jobs.title: Summer Activity Leader
jobs.content:
International Language Centres is seeking a highly motivated, professional Summer Activity Leaders to work in our Eastbourne school.  You will provide exceptional customer service for our students and assist with the day to day running of the student activity programme.  Reporting to the Activity Manager, you will work in accordance with EF policy, British Council and ISI criteria. 

 As a customer service oriented person, ensuring the highest levels of customer satisfaction will be your highest priority, achieved through excellent administration skills, inter-departmental communication and willingness to go the extra mile.  You will build strong relationships with the teams in school and ensure the Eastbourne school is well regarded amongst EF colleagues. 

 

Your key responsibilities include but will not be limited to:

  • Working in an international team to deliver the best course possible for our students

  • General group management and discipline

  • Student welfare and supervision

  • Organising and participating in all leisure activities and excursions ensuring that Activity Guidelines and Health and Safety Instructions are followed

  • Promote the well-being and satisfaction of all students at the centre

  • Assist with arrivals, intakes, departures and large events

  • Deal with administrative tasks where required.

  • Assist in care taking duties, including moving and unpacking stock 

  • Preparing student welcome packs

  • Attend all staff meetings called by Senior Staff.

  • Lunch time duties

 Please note this is a summer position we are looking to recruit staff from Mid June - Mid/ End August. We may be able to offer accommodation in exchange for residence duties in Eastbourne at our Summer Residence.

 

EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. 

All posts are subject to an enhanced DBS check and character referencing.

About Us

We are 40,500 staff, faculty and teachers, working in 500 offices and schools across 52 countries. While we continue to grow, we strive to stay small so as to ensure agility, smart thinking and a fun place to work. For the past 50 years, EF has grown to include a range of programs that give students of all ages the freedom and confidence to explore the world through language, travel and education.

 Located across the globe, our language centers for youth, adults and professionals combine the best of traditional, in-school teaching with innovative language-learning technology. We offer intensive language instruction abroad in English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Japanese and Chinese. Courses run from 2 to 52 weeks for students traveling independently or in escorted groups of all levels and abilities.  Classes take place in our international language centers in one of 16 countries and offer the very best locations and accommodation whether in local host family or in a student residence.

jobs.title: Community Consultant
jobs.content:
Community Consultant
Cultural Care Au Pair
Washington, DC - Palisades, Forest Hills, American University Park areas (Independent Contractor)

At Cultural Care Au Pair, we help families across the country secure childcare that provides flexibility, trust and cultural exchange. Your role as the on-the-ground face of our company is the most important aspect of a remarkable program experience for both host families and au pairs. 

Specifically, your role will be:
- Supporting host families and au pairs throughout the course of the program year
- Screening and interviewing host families
- Overseeing compliance with Department of State Regulations
- Promoting the program through connections in your local community

Local Childcare Consultants represent Cultural Care Au Pair in communities all across the country. Over the course of a program year, you'll build rapport and develop relationships with au pairs and host families, ensuring they have all the support and guidance needed for a successful experience.

Joining our team of Local Childcare Consultants is a fantastic and flexible role for someone who enjoys taking a proactive and collaborative approach to their work, connects quickly with others, can think on his/her feet, and has a true passion for cultural exchange. You'll join a team of charismatic and dedicated childcare professionals, and benefit from all the resources and support you need to make each match between a family and their au pair into a success story.

A successful Local Childcare Consultant . . .
- Inspires and motivates others toward achieving a common goal
- Makes decisions collaboratively
- Is extroverted, warm, enthusiastic and empathetic
- Thrives when handling a variety of tasks
- Leads and persuades others in a constructive way
- Has a strong commitment to results

Responsibilities include:
- Contact new au pairs within 48 hours of their arrival and conduct an in-home orientation within 2 weeks
- Host monthly au pair meetings
- Contact host families monthly
- Hold 2 Host Family Day Conferences each year
- Field questions and inquiries in your region
- Conduct mediations during the initial adjustment period and as needed
- Ensure that we recruit quality families with reasonable program expectations
- Conduct a host family interview
- Verify host family references
- Enforce U.S. Department of State regulations
- Provide monthly documentation of host family and au pair contact and support
- Initiate grassroots marketing efforts
- Generate "word of mouth" referrals
- Network through local events
- Follow up with leads and opportunities about the program

If this sounds like you, we want you on our team! To learn more and submit your qualifications, please visit us at http://consultant.culturalcare.com/local-childcare-consultant.html.

The Local Childcare Consultant role is a flexible W-9 independent contractor opportunity. You have the ability to earn monthly payment, commissions, and earn the opportunity to travel.

We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Sales Coordinator - Satelite
jobs.content:
Sales Consultant Ciudad Satelite

 

Job description

We are travelers, innovators, doers and thinkers. We are open and collaborative, we are dedicated and passionate – we really work hard, and then play hard. We believe that education can open up the world. You are driven to succeed and will always go the extra mile for your customers, friends, and family. Job satisfaction is very important for your happiness. You are focused on getting great results, but you don’t forget to have a good time whilst getting there. You are outgoing and positive. You are great at whatever you put your mind to, but that never makes you arrogant. You believe that nothing is impossible. You are passionate about travelling and meeting people from all over the world. 

Our Sales Team is looking for an enthusiastic sales person to join us in our Ciudad Satelite Office.

 

Job requirements

 

  • Sell our education programs through telesales and face-to-face interactions with potential customers (your #1 priority)

  • Excellent organization skills
  • Prepare and carry out regular school visits where you will present our services to students, teachers, and parents
  • Weekend shifts are occasionally required
  • Ability to operate and perform well in a truly international environment with young and energetic colleagues

 

Desired Skills and Experience

 

  • Minimum 1-2 years of experience in Sales
  • Degree from University, preferable a Bachelor`s degree in business, language or tourism
  • Strong business acumen with strong negotiation skills and a “nothing is impossible” attitude
  • Extremely sales-minded, energetic, and positive
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to prioritize, multitask, and meet deadlines
  • Overseas studying/working experience ideally/or at least exposure to an international environment for 3-6 months
  • IT literate
  • Work Permit and living in Mexico
  • Fluency in both written and spoken English, a third language is a plus

 

About Us 

 

We are 40,500 staff, faculty and teachers, working in 500 offices and schools across 52 countries. While we continue to grow, we strive to stay small so as to ensure agility, smart thinking and a fun place to work. For the past 50 years, EF has grown to include a range of programs that give students of all ages the freedom and confidence to explore the world through language, travel and education. 


 Additional Information EF is an equal opportunities employer. EF offers competitive salaries and a multicultural working environment.  If you are motivated by the prospect of an international career with a dynamic and forward-thinking company, we want to hear from you. Please send us your CV and cover letter in English.

jobs.title: Signal Integrity Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Description
The Amazon Devices team designs and engineers customer-obsessed consumer electronics, including the best-selling Kindle, Kindle Fire Tablets, Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Dash, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?

The Role:

 We are seeking an outstanding engineer who can thrive in a fast-paced, start-up-like environment with minimal supervision to deliver SI/PI solutions. The ideal candidate should be familiar with signal and power integrity issues of high speed interfaces in both frequency and time domains, worked on board/package design and analysis, lab correlation/validation of simulation results.

Basic Qualifications

  • MSEE with 3 years of experience or BSEE with at least 5 years of hands-on experience in simulations and lab validation for SI/PI.
  • Experience with high speed I/O interfaces, e.g., DDR, PCIe,MIPI,Sata,SAS, etc.
  • Electrical extraction and validation of package and PCB
  • Experience working with circuit design team and vendor to optimize circuit and system design
  • Experience developing and executing test plans to validate SI and PI
  • Experience working with product engineering and system engineering to debug and to improve product performance
  • Experience with EM, Transmission Line Theories, Via properties, and their effects on signal quality/timing
  • Experience uusing at least one time-domain and one frequency-domain tool such as Hspice, SiSoft, Sigrity, HFSS and Microwave Studio, as well as PI software such as Power SI
  • Experience using VNA, TDR, high speed scopes and probing techniques. Experience with Berts and Spectrum Analyzer is a plus.
  • Fluent in one programming language

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong analytical capabilities to interpret simulation and lab data to identify issues and provide solutions to fix those problems.
  • Good at making design tradeoffs to provide optimal solution to meet cost and time to market requirements
  • Fluent with Cadence Allegro and CMS for design reviews and constraint definition.
  • Strong communication and documentation skills

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

#LI-LS1

jobs.title: G&A Recruiting Coordinator
jobs.content:
As the G&A (General & Administrative) Recruiting Coordinator, you will have the awesome opportunity to play a crucial role on a vital team at Yelp! This team is responsible for finding top notch talent to join Yelp for every position globally, outside of sales and engineering: Think Human Resources, Finance & Accounting, Legal, Business Development, Community, Facilities, Biz & Revenue Operations, Marketing -- you name it, we do it! You will be the go-to person for all things G&A Recruiting.

Responsibilities:

  • Schedule phone, video and onsite interviews and manage schedule conflicts.
  • Greet and escort candidates during onsite and video interviews between offices.
  • Set up video/Skype interviews for local, interstate and international candidates.
  • Assemble and distribute interview materials.
  • Work with recruiters to post reqs to career site and any job boards.
  • Manage and track job board postings.
  • Update/maintain candidate records in Lever.
  • Book travel and accommodation when required.
  • Coordinate candidate reimbursement efforts with Accounts Payable.
  • Create offer letters and process new hire paperwork.
  • Initiate and monitor background check process using HireRight.
  • Create weekly and quarterly metrics reports.
  • Verify weekly new hires.
  • Manage and verify employee referral bonus program.
  • Ensure five-star candidate experience during interview process, onboarding and first day at Yelp!
  • Work with HR and IT teams to facilitate onboarding process for new employees across all our offices and remote locations.
  • Implementing and influencing recruitment processes and policies.
  • Take on ad-hoc projects on an as-needed basis.

Requirements:

  • 1+ years experience in a support role for a recruiting team.
  • Understanding Recruiting workflow.
  • Exceptional written, verbal and presentation skills.
  • Savvy tech skills -- can learn new programs, processes, and technology in a snap.
  • Detail-oriented (borderline OCD!), combined with a high level of organizational aptitude and desire to understand the bigger picture.
  • Must be flexible and able to adapt easily to change.
  • Must be a team player.
  • Able to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.
  • Proficiency in using Google applications (Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Hangouts, etc.) and MacBooks.
  • Experience with Lever (ATS) a plus.
  • Sense of humor a must!

Ready to apply? Submit the following:

  • Cover letter showcasing your skills and why you would be a good fit for this role.
  • Resume.
  • A link to your Yelp profile!

*LI-AP1

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

jobs.title: Director Digital Distribution

Manage partnership activities by collaborating with internal and external contributors.

jobs.title: Workforce Management Lead
jobs.content:
Overview

Utilize your exceptional analytical and communication skills while managing key aspects of Genesys workforce scheduling, workload forecasting, and process improvement of the Support Services workforce management solution.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze, monitor, and evaluate the Support Services workforce by monitoring activities on a real-time basis
  • Create schedules and provide regular reports to management on workload and workforce
  • Define both long-term strategies and ever-changing short-term and immediate workforce needs
  • Handle shift change requests and monitor new hire, holiday, and seasonal shift needs
  • Provide task management for workforce coordinators on scheduling and shift change request activities
  • Update and maintain scheduling database
  • Research, recommend, and implement call center technology and process improvements to reduce overall costs

Requirements

  • Three or more years of experience in workforce management analysis with minimum of one year of hands-on experience configuring and/or applying Genesys workforce management solution in a multi-channel call center environment
  • Experience in and demonstrated ability to train others on proper usage of a workforce management solution, including industry-recognized best practices
  • Demonstrated experience successfully handling workforce management responsibilities
  • Experience and familiarity with implementing continuous improvement concepts that will increase operational effectiveness at all levels
  • Ability to work collaboratively on projects and establish and maintain positive working relationships with colleagues and internal clients

The Company

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.

 

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.

 

Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobs.title: C#/.NET Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Overview

Are you a talented .NET/C# developer? Do you have a passion for solving development problems with distributed systems? Apply your skills to develop web services for Esri’s ArcGIS Online hosted services, which allow our users to expose a map or dataset on the web without having their own GIS server. As a member of our ArcGIS Online team, you’ll help build the next generation of these innovative services.

 

Responsibilities: 

  • Create web services components that follow industry-standard design patterns, development methodologies, and deployment models
  • Assist in bringing excellent software to the ArcGIS platform
  • Work closely with other developers to design and develop quality APIs that scale to millions of users
  • Write comprehensive technical design specifications and support documentation

Requirements

  • A minimum of three years of software development experience (it’s a plus if you have experience designing and developing large web software systems)
  • A deep understanding of the web and its protocols
  • Working knowledge of SQL with experience in ASP.NET and Entity Framework
  • Basic knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure, Amazon Web Services) and NoSQL databases
  • Hands-on experience with RESTful web services, distributed systems, and cloud computing
  • Experience with IIS
  • Knowledge of Agile software development methodologies (Scrum)
  • All the other important things that will help you be successful at Esri--good communication skills and the ability to thrive in an environment that encourages innovation
  • Bachelor’s in computer science, engineering, or mathematics, depending on position level 

Recommended Qualifications:

  • Microsoft Azure knowledge
  • Expertise with Microsoft technology (Visual Studio, TFS, SQL Server)
  • Familiarity with API development, performance tuning, system scalability

The Company

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. jobs.title: Software Engineer, Automation Coverage
jobs.content:
Why Pure

We’re here with the humble aspiration to accelerate the speed of human progress with our radically simple, all-flash enterprise storage technology. We’re inspired by our belief that storage isn’t just a place to put things, it’s a powerful strength to be unleashed - a strength that will remove the limitations on those building the world of today, so they can erase the word “impossible” from tomorrow. Our all-flash storage solutions offer radically simple technology to help companies unlock their future possibilities, today.

Our founders created the company with a passion to build storage technology customers love and deliver it with simplicity and service that fundamentally changes the enterprise storage experience. Founded in 2009, our record revenue growth has landed us among a very select group of companies. Today, customers and industries across the world are experiencing the benefits of going Pure - from Barclays to Linkedin.com and ConocoPhillips, Pure adopters cover a broad spectrum from global consumer brands, to healthcare, education and finance. 

Our Team

Puritans come from various backgrounds and we thrive off of challenging the norm. This cross pollination of backgrounds led to numerous ground breaking ideas and has helped us build one of the most reliable and easy to use storage systems in the industry. ​We aim to hire the best and brightest people, who excel in a cutting edge, fast paced, collective and open environment. We are seeking enthusiastic individuals to solve real world problems while having fun along the way.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Improve product quality through the development of test automation coverage.
  • Working with world-class storage engineers to define test automation requirements by participating in product design reviews.
  • Developing automated tests for software based all-flash storage arrays.
  • Collaborate with support, release, engineering and management teams to improve product quality by increasing test coverage.

What You Bring To The Team

  • A passion for improving software quality.
  • Demonstrated fluency in an advanced scripting language like Python.
  • Demonstrated experience with Unix/Linux automation.
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Experience with networking and storage protocols and management a plus.
  • Experience with software testing fundamentals.
  • Experience with Agile, Test-Driven Development and Continuous Integration
  • Ability to work independently in cross-functional teams.
  • 5+ years of relevant work experience.

Culture & Perks

Pure is a very special place. What makes and keeps us special is who we recruit to join us and how we work together. Our culture was shaped organically as our early team poured their heart and soul into Pure’s first generation product and supporting our early customers and partners. We expect each employee to approach their job at Pure with the same level of pride and care, and perpetuate the values that are making us the best storage company in history.

At the center of those values is the belief that the single most important thing we do is to continue to hire the best and create a workplace where they thrive and enjoy. To reward our employees for the great work they’re doing we offer a number of perks and benefits, including:

  • Flexible vacation - take time off when you need it
  • Extraordinary medical benefits with 100% employer paid premiums
  • Commuter benefits for public transit and bicycle commuters
  • Free lunches, dinners, and fully stocked snacks & beverages
  • Lounge areas with ping pong, foosball, pinball, and arcade games
  • Company ski trips, boat parties, BBQs, happy hours, game nights... just to name a few!

#LI-POST

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Cloud Platform
jobs.content:
Our Mission: make Box developers as effective as possible to develop, ship and manage their services. What used to take six months to launch a service is now less than a week
 
As a Sr. Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to build Box's Platform as a Service (PaaS) layer. Our team owns scheduling, service authentication and authorization, service discovery, load balancing, monitoring, and more. We are working with modern containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes to build the next generation of our infrastructure to support all services in our datacenters and other clouds (AWS & GCP). 
 
 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • You'll architect and implement new components of our service platform
  • You'll work with cutting-edge technologies that are defining the future of the cloud
  • You'll collaborate with other engineers on the team to foster solid engineering principles and represent our engineering values
  • As a senior member of the team, you'll use both technical and relational skills to lead large scale projects to completion
QUALIFICATIONS
  • You love building distributed, client/server systems, especially in the web application space
  • You are passionate about solving hard problems using data-driven solutions
  • You act like an owner and strive to do work you're proud of, both technically and in your team interactions
  • You are able to inspire other people to work with you, and you enjoy mentoring and coaching more junior engineers
  • 4+ years of experience
About Box: Founded in 2005, Box (NYSE:BOX) is transforming the way people and organizations work so they can achieve their greatest ambitions. As the world's leading enterprise software platform for secure content collaboration, Box helps business of all sizes in every industry securely access andmanage their critical information in the cloud. Box is headquartered in Redwood City, CA, with offices across the United States, Europe and Asia. To learn more about Box, visit www.box.com.

#LI-Eng

jobs.title: Account Executive, Large Enterprise Federal
jobs.content:
At Box we are changing the way companies work, share content, and collaborate. We have grown year over year and are adding dynamic and energetic salespeople to evangelize Box and uncover pivotal deals.
 
We have an opening for an experienced field sales executive to join our winning sales team. You will have extensive experience selling enterprise software to Federal accounts. 
 
As an Account Executive handling Federal accounts at Box, you are a hunter and sales leader experienced in selling SaaS to C-level buyers (IT and LOB) in the Federal space. We are looking for a creative and energetic self-starter that understands a consultative, complex sales process. You know how to sell innovation and disruption through customer vision expansion and can drive deals forward to compress decision cycles. You love understanding a product in depth and are passionate about communicating its value to end users, CIOs, and CTOs. Always hunting for new opportunities, you are adept at closing net new business while maintaining existing accounts. Our recent deals with General Electric, Eli Lilly, and Boston Scientific underscore our continued record of success and growth. Along with the chance to close an exciting deal, we also offer accelerators above 100% quota attainment.
 
You will...
  • Present a thorough territory plan within your first 90 days
  • Meet with CIOs, IT executives, LOB executives, and other key decision makers
  • Prospect and close new logos as well as new business within existing accounts 
  • Identify and close quick, small wins while handling a longer, complex sales cycles
  • Exceed activity, pipeline, and revenue targets
  • Track all customer details including use case, purchase time frames, next steps, and forecasting in Salesforce
  • Utilize a solution approach to selling that creates customer value
  • Evangelize Cloud Content Management, Enterprise 2.0, and the Box model
  • Ensure 100% satisfaction among all customers
  • Prioritize opportunities and applying appropriate resources
What you need
  • 4-year degree required
  • 7+ years of field sales experience in the Federal space
  • Prior success in selling ECM, Cloud, or SaaS sales to lines to IT leaders and lines of business
  • Extensive prior customer relationships with CIOs
  • Ability to simply articulate intricate cloud technologies
  • Successful track record of exceeding sales quotas
  • Existing CIO relationships and ability to develop C-level relationships within Fortune 500 accounts
  • A Box account - it's free!
  • Passion for cloud technologies
Internal Support Structure
  • Dedicated Outbound Prospecting Rep, and access to Inbound Qualifying Reps that will pass you leads
  • Inside Sales Rep to help close "smaller deals" within your accounts, while helping you to grow the larger opportunity within the organization
  • Dynamic Sales Operations team to process orders and take on contract challenges
  • In-house counsel to assist on legal matters
  • Access to Enterprise Collaboration Center where prospects are invited to HQ to meet with Box CEO and other Executives to help acquire new customers
  • Best in the business Sales Engineering support in your region
  • Visionary leadership with years of tactical expertise to mentor and guide you through the big wins
  • Post-sales Customer Success teams designed to ensure customer delight once the deal is won
Benefits 
  • Competitive salary with uncapped commission and lucrative accelerators
  • Top notch medical, dental, vision, life insurance & disability coverage
  • 401k Retirement Plan (Roth and Pre-Tax options available)
  • Local and National Corporate Discounts
  • Unlimited Paid Time Off
  • Awesome coworkers
  • Maternity and paternity plans

About Box: Founded in 2005, Box (NYSE:BOX) is transforming the way people and organizations work so they can achieve their greatest ambitions. As the world's leading enterprise software platform for secure content collaboration, Box helps business of all sizes in every industry securely access and manage their critical information in the cloud. Box is headquartered in Redwood City, CA, with offices across the United States, Europe and Asia. To learn more about Box, visit www.box.com.

jobs.title: Sales Manager, Nordics
jobs.content:
Taboola is looking for an experienced, dynamic and deal-oriented sales professional who can identify, source and structure partnerships independently. As Sales Manager, your role will be to secure new publishers, media clients and media agencies for the Taboola network in the Nordics

Recognized as the world’s leading content discovery platform, Taboola recommends editorial and sponsored content across many of the world’s most highly-trafficked sites. We help publisher’s monetize their content and drive higher engagement. We enable brands to surface their content to the right audience at scale and above all, we help people discover content they may like yet never knew existed.

Responsibilities:

  • Sell multiple products to clients by finding the right stakeholders for each product
  • Manage a robust pipeline and accurately forecast new business closure rate and revenue booked
  • Report directly to the Emerging Markets Lead, working closely with the European Account Management teams.
  • Independently build a large pipeline of leads, pursue them and close deals as well as developing those relationships in new markets
  • Manage presentations, build relationships and negotiate contracts
  • Interact with our project implementation team to effectively manage client expectations and ensure successful implementation of our widgets and technology
  • Work closely with the account management team to manage and develop long-term client relationships
  • Proactively seek market feedback on the Taboola platform and work with product team to help develop market-leading functionality

Requirements: 

  • Experience in structuring and negotiating deals with online publishers and/or media companies
  • Experience independently building, pursuing and closing a large pipeline of leads
  • Experience structuring, negotiating and closing deals in the UK market and elsewhere in Europe
  • Technologically savvy with the ability to learn what is needed to support a deal’s successful implementation and optimization
  • Fluency in one of the Nordic languages as well as exceptional English fluency.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, quickly changing environment and consistently learn, adapt, and develop

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.content:
Would you like your work to be used by millions of people worldwide? Do you want to work on mulitple products with distictive visual styles and brand identities? Do you want to join our highly supportive UX team and contribute to interface designs across web and mobile experiences?

As a Product Designer, you will collaborate with other designers, perform user research as a team and work directly with product managers to develop your creative vision into a wonderful user experience. You’ll also be able to watch the results of your designs and respond to them with changes in our fast, iterative environment.


A BIT ABOUT YOU

You love teamwork; you shared in kindergarten. You are always interested in learning the latest techniques and trends and sharing them with your team. You rely on self sufficiency, but are not afraid of asking questions. You care deeply about quality, but can work in a variety of styles.


MUST HAVE

  • A highly collaborative approach, both with other designers and with stakeholders
  • Ability to receive constructive design criticism
  • A strong online portfolio with an emphasis on UI design, icons, illustrations, and layout
  • Comprehension of and desire to simplify user flows on all Zoosk app platforms
  • Good time management skills
  • Good written and verbal communication
  • An understanding that design decisions are balanced with business goals and requirements
  • 3+ years experience designing responsively for web and mobile including iOS, Android, and Touch experience
  • Experience in contemporary and legacy design tools such as Sketch, Adobe CS, etc
  • Experience with cross-platform and responsive design
  • Experience and desire to create marketing graphics as companion to features


ROLE

  • Design usable, high performing, beautiful visual designs for web and mobile applications
  • Create flow diagrams, wireframes, and high-fidelity mockups to convey key interaction strategy
  • Articulate design decisions and collaborate to iterate on designs
  • Work with developers to solve techincal constraints
  • Contribute, through design a complete and wholistic user experience
  • Tackle complex product problems and solve them creatively while balancing business goals
  • Manage your project from inception to development hand-off
  • Document and share visual systems you build and expand
  • Follow UX best practices


IT’S COOL IF YOU

  • Brainstorm through sketching
  • Dabble in CSS
  • Enjoy design mentorship
  • Know something about animation
  • Tinker with new apps and tools
  • Participate in hack-a-thons
  • Respect and follow Design Thinking



Is this you? Show us your portfolio!

jobs.title: Space Planning Manager
jobs.content:
Space Planner

  • Oversee all facility space and personnel move requests to maximize space efficiency.
  • Attend weekly meetings to report occupancy related issues, requirements, challenges and opportunities.
  • Make ongoing recommendations for space maximization.
  • Develop blocking and stacking diagrams, and re-stack scenarios.
  • Participate in project reviews and coordinate meetings as needed.
  • Participate in business initiatives and team activities to enhance operational efficiency, service delivery, and asset utilization.
  • Attend kick-off meetings for new real estate acquisitions, major renovation projects and project moves to contribute insight, guidance, and smart, simple solutions in support of occupancy requirements.
  • Collaborate with Facilities, Real Estate & Environment Managers
  • Individual & Group Space Requests:
    • Review and assess business needs and develop program of requirements.
    • Meet and interface with department heads to develop options, finalize project concepts and prepare final documents for approval.
    • Oversee group moves and moves with special requirements. Coordinate with move managers, and present solutions to client.
    • Provide status updates and reports of relocation requests.
  • Building Audit Program & Spaceview System Updates:
    • Review that Spaceview system accurately reflects current occupancy for assigned territories and is updated to include new information obtained from site audits.
    • Maintain Spaceview data that supports development of space allocation plans.
  • Review and approve / or make alternate recommendation for reconfiguration requests.

 

REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor’s degree and five years’ work experience in 2 or more of the following: a) space planning, b) project management, and c) facilities planning
  • Minimum of five years of experience in a corporate environment.
  • Possess strong analytical skills and the ability to develop conclusions and recommendations.
  • Possess working knowledge of CAFM software, space management systems, and relational database functionality.
  • Proficiency in architectural and engineering drawings, concepts & design.
  • Experienced in managing projects of varied scope and complexity.

jobs.title: Embedded Software Developer
jobs.content:
The Validation Team!
Masabi are looking for an Embedded Engineer to join our JustRide Validation team and help support the rollout of hardware-based validation solutions to our customers around the world.

Masabi is the world’s leading provider of mobile ticketing solutions for the transport industry, allowing customers to buy and display tickets on their smartphone. Our JustRide mTicket applications mean that waiting in line for tickets is a thing of the past for customers whilst agencies are able to drastically reduce the cost of their operations. Our first major client was Boston in 2012. In 2014 we rolled out mobile ticketing to and Athens and this year we’re doing the same in New York as well as other major global cities.

As a member of our Validation team, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of products, all of which are highly visible to our customers. This spans from handheld mobile applications used by bus drivers and train conductors, to embedded hardware that is seen daily by end-users of our retail applications. You will play a big part in defining and shaping the solutions that we implement to ensure not only that our customers get a great experience, but also that we receive enough feedback about our implementation to iterate and improve upon it. 

The Role

We are looking for an embedded engineer to work within our validation team to help build hardware solutions that are changing the way that people travel. The role will require working closely and effectively with product management, development teams, in-field technical consultants and software testers. 

You will: 


  • Help the software team understand the intricacies and limitations of the underlying hardware.

  • Work closely with our hardware engineers, software engineers, and contractors to establish the best approach for exposing hardware functionality to our software team.

  • Use your best-practice experience of embedded hardware to complement the software team and help diagnose issues that arise during integration.

  • Own the embedded Linux platform and associated build processes.

  • Work closely with in-field delivery teams and technical consultants to troubleshoot integration approaches.

jobs.title: Software Developer In Test - An opportunity to work on a variety of products
jobs.content:
The Validation Team!

Masabi are looking for a QA / Automation Engineer to join our JustRide Validation team and help improve our test capabilities across a growing number of platforms. 

Masabi is the world’s leading provider of mobile ticketing solutions for the transport industry, allowing customers to buy and display tickets on their smartphone. Our JustRide mTicket applications mean that waiting in line for tickets is a thing of the past for customers whilst agencies are able to drastically reduce the cost of their operations. Our first major client was Boston in 2012. In 2014 we rolled out mobile ticketing to and Athens and this year we’re doing the same in New York as well as other major global cities.

As a member of our Validation team, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of products, all of which are highly visible to our customers. This spans from handheld mobile applications used by bus drivers and train conductors, to embedded hardware that is seen daily by end-users of our retail applications. You will play a big part in defining and shaping the solutions that we implement to ensure not only that our customers get a great experience, but also that we receive enough feedback about our implementation to iterate and improve upon it. 

The Role

As our QA Automation Engineer you will be the key component of ensuring that the quality of our products is the responsibility of the team.

You will have the opportunity to work across a variety of applications and services including mobile apps, back office services, APIs, databases, and even embedded software running on validators that we fit to buses or station gates. We follow agile principles, which means we regularly ship updates to our customers for user acceptance testing and production. 

You will therefore be responsible for feature and regression testing these updates. DevOps is something which we think is wonderful, and we do not forget about QA in this. As a QA you will have valuable input into how we can improve our products and environment configuration. Dev, QA and Ops work together when it comes to deploying to customer-facing and internal environments. Our ops team have worked very hard to ensure that you have the ability to play with environment config in your very own test environment, to ensure that we find and squash as many of those bugs as we can. Our test coverage consists of manual and automated testing but our aim is to fully automate the testing.

Some tools we use:
Appium/ Bamboo / MySQL / Charles Proxy / Tgestrail / HockeyApp / Postman / Puppet / Linux / Git

jobs.title: Marketing Services Technical Architect, Marketing Cloud, US - 00701 - 2017
jobs.content:
Bluewolf, an IBM company, is a global consulting agency that builds digital solutions designed to create results. Now. We’re the proven Salesforce strategic partner for a reason— our technology-driven method combines our team’s years of experience with cloud solutions that continually connect our clients with their customers. We specialize in leading cloud technologies like Salesforce, but our clients come to Bluewolf for so much more than our technical expertise. We serve a community of future-focused industry leaders dedicated to building the next generation of digital experiences. The way we see it, when business is done in real time on the cutting edge, it’s always now.

The Marketing Services Technical Architect is a technical subject matter expert around marketing automation systems, data, scripting, API, and integrations. He/she provides leadership to achieve specific technical objectives for implementations and managed services projects. The technical architect is responsible for leading technical requirements gathering and architecture sessions with clients and project teams. The technical architect collaborates with the solution architect on functional and technical design specifications and provides subject matter expertise to the project team and developers throughout the engagement.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Conduct technical process reviews, design sessions, and technical UAT
  • Design and develop customer solutions in scripting languages, SQL, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, web services (REST/SOAP), and others
  • Gather data migration requirements, define a data migration plan and perform complex data migrations
  • Analyze data quality requirements, define data quality plan, and execute
  • Work with clients to shape technical architecture and define and scope projects to address specific needs
  • Provide subject matter expertise to internal teams during sales and delivery processes

REQUIRED SKILLS

  • 4-6 years of experience in technical roles and/or consulting
  • At least 3 years of hands-on experience building technical solutions for and integrations with Marketing Cloud
  • Familiarity with additional marketing automation systems preferred
  • Understanding of agile and waterfall development practices
  • Understanding of Salesforce ecosystem, data models, and common integrations with marketing systems
  • Ability to lead and facilitate workshops, technical requirements gathering, and design sessions
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a project team
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Willingness to travel up to 50%
  • Obtain Certifications as required by role

jobs.title: Fullstack Javascript Node.js Engineer
jobs.content:
DIRECT APPLICANTS ONLY

NO RECRUITERS OR FIRMS



We are looking for Javascript/Node.js engineers who love challenges and solving big problems across many areas - finance, logistics, data mining, native processing and more. Want to be 100% remote, work on the most cutting edge technologies and get paid well? 



Requirements:




  • You have 4+ years production experience with JavaScript and Node.

  • You understand microservice architecture best practices.

  • You have worked with process managers and/or container orchestrators.

  • You're fluent in multiple SQL and NoSQL databases.

  • You know how to write thorough, articulate documentation.

  • You practice testing in all areas: unit, e2e, load, regression, etc.

  • You evaluate new technologies/patterns/frameworks on the regular.

  • You have intimate knowledge of the event loop



Added bonus if:




  • You've used Koa

  • You're familiar with Bluemix & CloudFoundry

  • You have recent experience working in a completely remote situation that we can reference if needed. We offer you complete 'physical' flexibility but your communication and ability to be completely engaged in daily standups and online presence in Slack is critical.

  • You've contributed to some great open source projects that we can see.



About Us:

Dealer Market Exchange (http://dmx.io) is releasing a virtual market for pre-owned vehicles. We are a global team with engineers, product owners and designers in 10 different timezones around the globe.

jobs.title: QA Analyst
jobs.content:
Life.io is looking for a passionate and articulate QA Analyst to join our team. We're looking for someone with attention to detail, a dedication to patterns and style, and an ability to move quickly through a changing landscape. You'll be working with our product and technology teams to understand new features, gather acceptance criteria, and manage the QA and UAT processes in our development workflow. You'll work with our team, our clients and our users to diagnose, document and manage open issues or requirements to their completion.

Things About You
  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events
  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of a remote team
  • Enjoy helping people: curious, empathetic and solving problems for others
  • Able to manage users or clients through a testing process
  • Ability to switch gears while keeping in mind the bigger vision
  • Able to manage multiple active projects

Required Skills/Qualifications
  • Knowledge and experience working with JIRA and Github
  • Experience conducting UAT with client stakeholders and end users
  • Experience in writing requirements, acceptance criteria and tickets
  • Strong writing and communications skills â able to explain an idea to the team, or tease out an answer from a user
  • Technical knowledge of web and mobile applications, terminology and functionality

Nice to Haves
  • Interest and/or background in health, healthcare, and wellness
  • 1 year+ experience in a relevant position
  • Bachelors Degree in a related field (Computer Science, Communications, English, etc).

Perks
  • Full time remote work
  • Generous company rewards and incentives
  • Possible stock options
  • Excellent work/life balance

About Life.io
Life.io is a venture-backed and healthy startup that's changing lives. Our platform, which is offered through insurers and employers, provides motivation and rewards people for making meaningful improvements in their lives.

âItâs more than a health and wellness platform,â says Jon Cooper, Founder and CEO, Life.io. âItâs exactly as its name suggests, a platform for Life, designed to encourage people to make daily decisions and form habits that help them live happily in the moment and healthier in the future.â

With expertise in epidemiology and behavioral sciences and an Advisory Board that includes leading faculty in the area of diagnostics and behavioral economics, our team utilizes an evidence-based approach that is flexible, accessible, rewarding and entirely HIPAA compliant.


To apply: Send us an email to jobs+qa@life.io with your resume and a bit about yourself.

jobs.title: User Researcher
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Philadelphia, PA
URL: http://life.io

Life.io is looking for a passionate and curious user researcher to join our team. We're looking for someone with attention to detail, a dedication to patterns and style, and an ability to move quickly through a changing landscape. You'll be working with our Product Designer, SVP of Product and Lead Front End Developer to understand new features, gather assumptions to test, and plan for feature research in our development process. You'll have access to analytics, data and engagement platforms, so you'll be able to blend quantitative and qualitative insights to help determine the direction our team should take.

We're looking for someone with a little experience, but open to growing and developing someone into the role. If you have a curiosity to learn, help and grow, this is a great role for you.

Things About You
  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events
  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of a remote team
  • Enjoy helping people: curious, empathetic and solving problems for others
  • Enjoy learning about people and finding ways to help them
  • Interest and/or background in health, healthcare, and wellness
  • Ability to switch gears while keeping in mind the bigger vision
  • Ability to manage multiple projects
  • 1 – 3 years experience in a related field

Required Skills/Qualifications
  • Background in developing usability research plans and reporting.
  • Expert knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design.
  • Strong understanding of the different research methods and when to use them during each product development phase.
  • Knowledge and experience working with analytics tools.
  • Strong writing and communications skills – able to explain an idea to the team, or tease out an answer from a user.
  • Experience conducting user interviews, studies and workshops.
  • Bachelors degree in a relevant field (HCI, IT management, Computer Science, Design, etc)

Perks
  • Generous company rewards and incentives.
  • Excellent work/life balance.
  • Fun and exciting team.
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance policies.
  • Possible stock options.
  • Time off when you need it and a flexible vacation policy.

About Life.io
Life.io is a venture-backed and healthy startup that's changing lives. Our platform, which is offered through insurers and employers, provides motivation and rewards people for making meaningful improvements in their lives.

“It’s more than a health and wellness platform,” says Jon Cooper, Founder and CEO, Life.io. “It’s exactly as its name suggests, a platform for Life, designed to encourage people to make daily decisions and form habits that help them live happily in the moment and healthier in the future.”

With expertise in epidemiology and behavioral sciences and an Advisory Board that includes leading faculty in the area of diagnostics and behavioral economics, our team utilizes an evidence-based approach that is flexible, accessible, rewarding and entirely HIPAA compliant.

To apply: Send us an email to jobs+user@life.io with your resume, a bit about yourself, and an interesting topic or challenge you think we should know about.

Vefstofan is looking to hire a full-time web and front-end developer to help our web agency meet new challenges and grow — we’ve got some big projects in the pipeline. jobs.content:
The Role


Roadtrippers is looking for creative problem solvers to help us write code that simplifies the complexities of travel planning and discovery at scale.  As an Android Developer, you will work with other developers as well as our business, content, and design teams to enhance the Roadtrippers mobile experience. jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
The Role


Roadtrippers' users are looking for new and exciting places to visit, and we are the wizards weaving the spells that open their eyes. We are the clockmakers and we are the machinists. We build the tools used to feed fuel to our data machine, and we keep the parts moving smoothly. As a Web Developer you will work with other developers as well as our business, content, and design teams to enhance the Roadtrippers experience.


Development at Roadtrippers is fast-paced. We balance the need to deploy a features quickly with keeping it running smoothly. Some days you will be building a hot, new feature that will blow minds, and others you will be refining an older feature to bring back that new-feature smell.


We are looking for problem solvers who can write code to simplify the complexities of travel planning and discovery at scale, for the world's travelers!

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.content:
About Us
We're ClickTime. We help businesses become more productive every day. Our time and expense tracking tools are used by thousands of companies worldwide.

Our office is in the heart of downtown San Francisco, with great food and coffee just steps away. As a bootstrapped, privately held, profitable entity, we provide big company benefits while maintaining the size and energy of a startup. Working with us means youâll be challenged, surrounded by high-quality teammates, and empowered to grow your career.

About the Role
At ClickTime, we never get a second chance to make a first impression â and our sales team makes sure it never needs one. We build great relationships with prospects and clients throughout every stage of the sales cycle, and keep those relationships strong after a sale is made. We do that by listening to our prospectsâ needs, educating them about how our product can help, and staying hungry for success. The end result? We exceed targets beyond anybodyâs wildest dreams.

As an Account Executive, you're pivotal to ensuring that success. Working closely with members of the sales team and with the support of the company at-large, you'll guide prospective clients through every stage of the sales cycle, from demo to close. If you love building a book of business and selling a product that customers love and need, we want to talk to you. 

Responsibilities:
Unearth new sales opportunities and pursue existing leads
Partner with prospects to understand and assess opportunities; become a trusted advisor to prospects
Manage contract negotiations
Collaborate effectively with internal partners in sales, customer success, and product management
Identify opportunities to streamline our sales process  
Exceed monthly, quarterly, and yearly sales targets

Requirements:
Excellent communication skills, especially via email and over the phone
Goal-oriented; record of overachievement in previous pursuits
High energy, enthusiasm, and commitment to the goals at hand
Strong organizational and planning skills
Technical acumen
QuickBooks and Salesforce knowledge is a big plus
Prior successful sales, lead qualification, and/or SaaS experience a plus
Bachelorâs Degree

Perks
Competitive salary, profit-sharing (did we mention weâre profitable?), medical/dental/vision, health savings account, subsidized transit, 401(k) with matching, very good coffee, a unicorn. Weâre a tight-knit group of about 30 with an energetic company culture.

How to Apply
Please submit your resume and cover letter, sharing a little bit about yourself and why you're interested in the role. Please no phone calls, drop-ins, or recruiters.

ClickTime provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

jobs.title: SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR II
jobs.content:
Texas A&M University Corpus Christi



SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR II



Position Description Summary:



This position is responsible for the design, installation, development, integration, testing, documentation, monitoring, and ongoing maintenance of assigned systems within departmental standards. Administration of Linux and Windows server based supporting University teaching & learning, research, and administrative activities.



Job Duties:



Responsible for the design, installation, development, integration, testing, documentation, monitoring, and ongoing maintenance of assigned systems within departmental standards. Administration of Linux and Windows server based supporting University teaching & learning, research, and administrative activities. Work with appropriate IT areas to maintain necessary security levels. Create system documentation and best practices. Lead analysis efforts and issue resolution with enterprise wide impact. Coordinate additional hardware, network, and/or software infrastructure components and their interdependencies. Responsible for planning, developing, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing the assigned application environments. Support and develop security for users. Collaborate with other teams to develop and implement hardware and software requirements. Schedule and implement major and minor software releases as well as emergency service and/or security packs. Provide access by assigning roles and maintaining security for auditing purposes.



Qualifications:



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Technology, Information Science, Engineering, or related fields.


Four (4) years of IT experience in system, application, and/or database administration to include two (2) years of system/server administration experience in a LAN networking/distributed computing environment.


Additional experience may be considered as a substitution for the minimum education requirement.


Experience in a multi-tier application lifecycle environment.


Experience developing or monitoring and maintaining enterprise applications on multiple platforms including Windows/UNIX /Linux, using object-oriented techniques or programming client/server applications.


Experience with virtualization platforms such as VMWare or Hyper-V. Experience deploying solutions in a heterogeneous Windows/UNIX computing environment.


Due do federal law on deemed export controls, it is not possible to petition for an H1B work authorization.


Applicants must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident, temporary resident, refugee or asylee.



Preferred Qualifications:



Project management and higher education experience. Demonstrated experience in all of the following: system, storage, back-up or network administration.


Experience with virtualization technologies such as SCVVM , HP Matrix, or Cisco UCS Director.


Experience with one or more of the following authentication technologies: Active Directory, CAS , Shibboleth, ADFS .


Experience with SCCM , SCOM , cfengine, or puppet or similar technologies.


MS Exchange or Office 365 experience.


Certified in MCSE or RHCE /RHCSA .



Monthly Pay Range: Commensurate with Experience

jobs.title: IT COMPLIANCE PROGRAM MANAGER
jobs.content:
Texas A&M University Corpus Christi



IT COMPLIANCE PROGRAM MANAGER



Position Description Summary:



Reporting to the Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi Information Security Officer, the IT Compliance Program Manager oversees the information technology compliance program and provides operational leadership for IT compliance. The program manager ensures that the University meets its IT compliance obligations, working within the Division of Information Technology and in partnership with all departments of the University. The IT Compliance Program Manager develops and maintains assessment and monitoring systems, providing current information on the state of IT compliance. Review federal, state and local pending legislation and regulation for issues that would affect information security at the University. The program manager serves as the University’s expert on IT compliance issues including Accessibility of Electronic Information Resources, PCI DSS , HIPAA , Export Data Control, DMCA , FERPA , GLBA , HEOA , DMCA , EU Privacy Directive and other regulations affecting IT. A foremost priority will be convening and establishing governance for accessibility of electronic information resources (EIR ) and serving as the University designated EIR coordinator. Responsibilities also include monitoring the legal and regulatory landscape for changes that may affect University IT operations domestically and internationally. Additional responsibilities include overseeing eDiscovery collection and services, scheduling and submitting PCI assessments and attestations, and managing the University data loss prevention program.



Job Duties:



Promote University information security policies, standards, guidelines, and procedures to ensure compliance with policy and federal, state and local regulations. Recommend and coordinate the development and maintenance of information security policy and practice that is applicable to Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi. Work with the pertinent stakeholders to develop University-wide IT policies and compliance processes. Perform compliance and assurance activities, including accessibility of electronic information resources (EIR ), information technology risk assessments (including FERPA , HIPAA , and PCI DSS compliance). Serve as EIR coordinator. Develop and implement a University Data Stewards program. Review federal, state and local pending legislation and regulation for issues that would affect information security at the University.



Qualifications:



Bachelor’s degree.


Three (3) years experience working in compliance or a compliance related field.


Additional education/experience may be considered as a substitution for the minimum requirements.


Experience in a combination of the following areas: information security, auditing, legal review and policy development, or policy administration.


Experience establishing policy, standards, and user guidelines for the security of data, networks, or systems.


Knowledge of major IT regulations affecting higher education such as accessibility of electronic information resources, PCI DSS , HIPAA , FERPA , GLBA , EU Privacy Directive, export controls, DMCA and HEOA .


Excellent written and verbal communication skills to be able to work with people at all levels of an organization. Proven ability to influence an organization.



Preferred Qualifications:



Masters or other Advance Degree.


Experience developing compliance programs pertaining to Accessibility, HIPAA , FERPA or PCI -DSS .


Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA ), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM ), Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP ) or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP ).


Familiarity with a college/university environment.



Monthly Pay Range: Commensurate with Experience



To be considered for this position please visit our web site and apply on line at the following link: http://apptrkr.com/941527



Texas A&M Corpus Christi is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Veterans/Disability Employer

jobs.title: APPLICATION SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR
jobs.content:
Texas A&M University Corpus Christi



APPLICATION SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR



Position Description Summary:



The application systems administrator works within and across teams to install, maintain and administer server-based applications supporting the diverse mission of TAMU -CC. Provide expertise and assist customers, developers and partners with design decisions. Provide ongoing maintenance and application of updates and patches. Recommends and implements standards, policies, and procedures to achieve agreed upon service levels by tuning, maintaining, and supporting a breadth of application infrastructure. Responsible for providing design recommendations and expertise regarding the integration and architecture of commercial application packages. Responsible for identifying and recording gaps between business requirements and product functionality and alternative work-arounds based on technical feasibility. Plan lifecycle replacement, coordinate outages and perform performance tuning for applications and hardware. Maintain monitoring and data gathering systems for reporting and performance purposes. Work with vendors to address and resolve problems. The individual will be part of a rotating on-call cycle.



Job Duties:



Provide design recommendations based on the architecture of commercial application packages, provide expertise regarding the integration of applications across the organization and work with application vendors to evaluate the impact of upgrades to existing architectures and environments. Responsible for the overall vendor application framework and integration of components with other legacy and enterprise applications. Act as resident expert working with application owners on the application package implementation. Identify and record gaps between business requirements and product functionality. Identify and recommend alternative work-arounds based on technical feasibility. Provide documentation of solutions to software problems and act as technical consultant for the application life cycle. Assist customers and partners with design decisions, discerning what is a configuration and what is a customization. Ensure system integrity by configuring and maintaining proper security safeguards. Install and configure hosted applications as requested by customers.



Qualifications:



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Technology, Information Science, Engineering, or related fields.


Three (3) years of IT experience in system, application, and/or database administration. Two (2) years of system or application administrator experience in a LAN networking/distributed computing environment.


Additional education and experience may be considered as a substitution for the minimum requirements.


Experience in a multi-tier application lifecycle environment. Experience developing or monitoring and maintaining enterprise applications on multiple platforms including Windows/UNIX /Linux, using object-oriented techniques or programming client/server applications.


Strong team player with ability to inspire a team to meet project plans and goals to be able to interact professionally with a variety of individuals using excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Demonstrated ability to work without supervision on daily tasks and projects. Self-motivated with a strong desire to learn new skills.


Demonstrate good problem-solving, collaboration, and planning skills. Resourceful and able to facilitate resolution of technical and business issues to develop appropriate solutions.


Ability to coordinate implementations with end-users from various areas and troubleshoot complex technical issues.


Knowledge of systems, networking, and system architectures and of UNIX and/or Windows operating system environments. Windows PowerShell and/or UNIX scripting skills.


Ability to work a rotating on-call cycle.



Preferred Qualifications:



Project management and higher education experience. Demonstrated experience in all of the following: system, application or database administration. Experience with version control systems and processes, database tuning, hardware platforms, infrastructure systems development and integration processes.


Basic knowledge of security principles. Knowledge of SQL scripting. Working knowledge and understanding of Oracle RDBMS , MS SQL server or MySQL architecture and administration.


Demonstrate strong requirements-gathering, analytical, and time management skills.



Monthly Pay Range: Commensurate with Experience



To be considered for this position please visit our web site and apply on line at the following link: http://apptrkr.com/941522

jobs.title: Mid-Level Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Bellingham, Washington
URL: http://benkinney.com/technology-software/

We’re looking for someone with a passion for programming and for writing beautiful code. You will join a team of exceptional developers building custom tools and web applications for the real estate industry. We are committed to simple, functional, and powerful user interfaces, API’s, and information storage systems.  

Our company is located in Bellingham, WA. Home to Western Washington University, Bellingham is a beautiful waterfront city nestled between Puget Sound and the Cascade mountains. Life here means access to the mountains and the sea providing an abundance of outdoor activities including skiing, mountain biking, hiking, sailing, kayaking, fishing, and wildlife viewing. A progressive city with lots to do, Bellingham is an ideal location to live and work.

Requirements:
  • 2+ years of direct experience in Ruby on Rails, along with other common libraries
  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3
  • Excellent understanding of the syntax of Ruby and its nuances
  • A knack for writing clean, readable Ruby code
  • Adept at implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests
  • GitHub expertise

Great to have:
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks
  • Background in continuous integration

We offer:
  • Open, collaborative workspaces
  • A fully stocked kitchen
  • Professional experience working on a team as well as experience using Git, Visual Studio Online, and other development tools

Ben Kinney Companies Tech Division is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

  • For this position we are open to remote work, telecommuting
  • This is a full-time, non-contract position
  • Salary DOE

Ben Kinney Companies Tech Division
2211 Rimland Dr., Suite 230, Bellingham, WA 98226

Some of our software products:
  • Brivity: https://www.brivity.com/
  • ActiveRain: http://activerain.com/
  • KWKLY: http://kwkly.com/
  • Blossor: https://www.blossor.com  

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

To apply: Submit your resume (and optionally cover letter) to us. We also encourage you to provide links to your GitHub or StackExchange profile, your LinkedIn page, sites or apps you've built, etc.

jobs.title: Robotics Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re well past proof-of-concept and on a clear path to production, preparing for a near-future where our robot will find its place in homes. We are looking for a Robotics Software Engineer to help bring our robot’s personality to life as it discovers and interacts with the world, all on its own. Working collaboratively with our Product Team, this role will be key to ensuring our robot acts as amazing as it looks and responds appropriately to real life, so it can delight, inspire, and connect people. Our goal is to build software that’s so good, people will forget it’s software; intelligent without feeling artificial.


An overabundance of fun and exciting challenges face the intrepid Engineer confronting the ever-changing, pet-inhabited, LEGO-strewn chaos that is our users’ homes. But never fear - you won’t be on your own - we have assembled an awesome software team (eight and growing!) to pull together to execute and ship our robot to its adoptive homes. If you’re looking to join a team that’s richly talented, charmingly diverse, sometimes goofy, and 100% passionate about all things robots, you’re looking in the right place.


Responsibilities:



  • Add new capabilities to our robots and make them more robust against the world of small children and hostile WiFi networks

  • Integration: make all of the robot capabilities work as part of a system that also behaves as a coherent character. You will touch many parts of the system, including image processing, state machines, embedded development, robot localization and mapping, and voice recognition

  • Collaborate daily with your fellow Robotics Engineers, QA, Product, and Hardware to get stuff done

  • Design, implement, and validate applications and capabilities in C++ and Python

  • Integrate and test software solutions in simulation and on the robot

  • Write clear and testable code

  • Participate in design discussions and code reviews

jobs.title: Senior Security Engineer
jobs.content:
Roblox has built an immersive 3D gaming platform used by tens of millions of people each week. Our mission is to provide an amazing, engaging experience for each one of those players. Unfortunately, exploiters work round the clock, attacking our executables and ruining the experience for others.


We’re looking for talented and passionate low level security experts to fight back against these exploiters -- not just tactically, but strategically taking us to a higher level of fundamental security.


Responsibilities:



  • Track and analyze attempts to hack or exploit our game

  • Develop effective tamper resistance strategies

  • Architect security strategies to increase theoretical protection

  • Evaluate and integrate potential third party solutions

jobs.title: Real-Time Graphics Rendering Engineer
jobs.content:
At ROBLOX, we are building a user-generated 3D content and gaming platform, which includes a rendering engine used by tens of millions of people worldwide. Join some of the best Graphics Engineers in the world supporting the largest immersive 3D streaming environment deployed across console, desktop, mobile, and VR.


As a Senior Rendering Engineer, you will solve difficult challenges while continuing to build a high-speed, completely dynamic environment connected on all devices. You will come up with ideas for graphics effects and features leveraged by our 400K strong developer community to create stunning content. Some projects we’re planning for the near future that you will have direct impact on:



  • Dynamic sky

  • Physically-based shading

  • Compute, shader-based lighting system


All of this is based on an in-house rendering engine built from the ground up, supporting DirectX 9/11, OpenGL, GNM, and Metal API’s, with Vulkan in the works. We have a powerful need for top-notch, low-level and high-level graphics work. The games on the ROBLOX platform are completely dynamic -- anything can change at any time -- and our rendering engine has to excel in this dynamic environment.


Responsibilities:



  • Investigate and implement new rendering techniques to make ROBLOX graphics more immersive and expressive

  • Work with technical artists to develop stunning visuals

  • Improve performance and stability of our game engine

jobs.title: Principal Software Security Architect
jobs.content:
Instructure was founded to define, develop, and deploy superior, easy-to-use software. (And that’s what we did / do / will keep on doing.) We are dedicated to the fight against iffy, mothbally, shoddy software. We make better, more usable tools for teaching and learning (you know, stuff people will actually use). A better connected and more open edtech ecosystem. And more effective ways for everyone everywhere to access education, make discoveries, share knowledge, be inspired, and do big things. We accomplish all this by giving smart, creative, passionate people opportunities to create awesome. So here’s your opportunity.

The Software Security Architect is a director-level principal developer.  You will be responsible for helping to secure a portfolio of large scale web applications developed using various modern technology stacks. You will also be instrumental in guiding our strategy and approach as we execute on a microservice platform vision.  

As a security expert, you will be working with other principal engineers and leaders to shape and influence our technology choices, building software and mentoring other engineers.




What we do:




    • We build innovative web applications that rely on modern tools to create engaging user experiences.

    • We are cloud native. For this role, that means collaborating with all teams and leaders to craft low-latency, high-availability web services that meet the security needs of our international customer base.

    • We grow great products by investing in the teams that create them: the hallmarks of our engineering culture are constructive code review, a bias to action, thoughtful mentorship, and regular communication.

    • We develop technical leaders through the practices of agile software development, leadership & management training and active mentoring from leaders and peers.  For this role, that means that you teach, train and mentor in secure software development practices.

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
Instructure is looking for a Senior iOS Engineer to work with our team of amazing iOS Engineers in building the best LMS on the market. This person will be enhancing our existing apps as well as building amazing new apps.
