Headquarters: Boston, MA
URL: https://www.thoughtindustries.com/

We’re looking for a JavaScript Application Engineer to help us build out our SaaS Learning Business Platform.

You would be a good fit if:

  • You are excited about new web technologies like ES2015 and RxJS.
  • You sweat the small stuff, but know when to ship it.
  • You are passionate about listening to users & building elegant web products.

We use Node.js with Koa and Ember.js, but are open to any framework experience you might have. This role is split evenly through the full stack. Bonus points for reporting, data viz, and any AWS experience you might have.

Throughout the day, we rely on Slack, GitHub pull requests, and Screenhero for remote collaboration. Our platform makes heavy use of Node.js, RethinkDB and Ember.js. The development team is completely distributed across the US. 

The company
Thought Industries is a funded startup in the Online Learning space. We enable companies to launch and sell their own online school and distribute learning material — think Shopify meets Udemy/Coursera. 
 
This is a full-time position. You can work from anywhere, but there should be some overlap with US East Coast hours. No Recruiters, please, and we are only able to consider US citizens at this time.
 
Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Thought Industries is one of the world’s fastest-growing online learning companies in the U.S. We are helping consumer brands and for-profit learning organizations change how they build, deploy and grow online learning businesses. Today, more than 100+ customers and brands are using the Thought Industries’ Learning Business Platform to transform the way they reach, teach, and engage audiences. 

We are a growing, well-funded technology company, with a talented team and a clear vision. This is a unique opportunity to take a lead role at an exciting SaaS software company with a robust cloud-based platform. We hire talented people who are self-motivated and team orientated.

To apply: Send a cover letter and resume to devjobs@thoughtindustries.com. We'd prefer something personal vs. a form letter.

jobs.title: Sr. Designer
jobs.content:
Schylling is a leading specialty toy and gift company located in the North Shore of Boston. We are looking to hire an exceptional in-house Senior Graphic Designer.

Our ideal candidate is a versatile artist that can mimic and recreate a wide variety of styles; a pop culture maven with a taste for vintage and retro artifacts and style. The Senior Designer will change-up style often as they execute authentic period illustration, lettering, and layout. NOT campy or kitsch…the real thing. We assume you are highly creative and imaginative, but we also prefer someone who speaks our toy and gift merchandise language. Additionally, we play in a space unique to us in our industry. Here are some keywords to help sort you into our design space beyond merely ‘toy & gift’ : VINTAGE, RETRO, PINBALL, TATTOO, MATCHBOOK, COMICS, TIN TOY, VINTAGE CEREAL and RADIO PREMIUMS.

From ideation to retail shelf, the Senior Designer is a contributing member of the Creative Department and participates in all aspects of product development including strategy, concept, plan, research, and execution. This role will take the lead on multiple creative projects and have experience creating consumer products in a high-volume, fast paced work group. Projects include product design, illustration, package design, retail displays, and marketing materials for the toy and gift market.

The Senior Designer is a successful collaborator who brings out the best in others, keeps partners and colleagues up to date, and takes full responsibility for forward movement of all projects. NOTE: Not every graphic designer is cut out for this position. It will take a creative individual with clear focus and mature abilities to be successful in our environment.

–––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––
QUALIFICATIONS
Important to note: Passion and dedication to the mastery of design, color, layout and typography is expected and should shine through on our first experience with you. Please have excellent grammatical and copywriting ability. Attention to detail is critical and being organized is a must. This position is for a senior level graphic designer with skills as a graphic illustrator.

We want to see your style. Your portfolio should include numerous examples of design work that has gone to production. However, concept projects, sketches, works-in-progress and hobby work are welcome as well (We like to see process). Examples would ideally include, but are not be limited to: illustration, graphic design, brand word marks, creative lettering and typography, product design, packaging (box, hang card, blister card) POPs, PDQs, catalogs.

Experience & Skill Set
• 6+ years professional design experience, much of which will have come from working in a high-volume art department. (Again, we prefer the experience comes from making toys, games, or other gift and novelty merchandise but, we will entertain candidates outside the industry. Show us your amazing work. You might just be a fit if you have the ability to create art and design consistent with our company mandate.)
• Have the ability to mimic and recreate a wide variety of unique graphic styles.
• Employ conceptualization (sketches) and creative strategy toward product ideation.
• Possess higher than average skills in illustration, rendering, and digital image editing.
• Present demonstrable experience with package design, layout, and production artwork, including proper file set-up and organization.
• Have prior experience communicating with overseas factories, in a manufacturing setting.
• Command an excellent working knowledge of Adobe Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat) as well as all Microsoft Office Software.
Personal Skills
• Open-minded collaborator with good interpersonal skills.
• Ability to accept constructive criticism and offer solutions.
• Proactive and self-motivated with the ability to schedule and prioritize work.
• Exceptional time management for meeting project timelines (deadlines rarely move).
• Meticulous attention to detail.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills.
• Ability to communicate project status, keep track of project details and follow through on projects to meet company standards.
• Ability to work independently to complete projects and problem solve, as well as work collaboratively on team projects.
• Willingness to learn and expand skill set as required for projects.
–––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––
MEET SCHYLLING, INC.
51-200 employees • Public Company

For over forty years, Schylling, Inc. has specialized in timeless toys. We started out making delightful playthings from a bygone era. Over time we’ve built a distinctive collection of innovative gifts and traditional toys with nostalgic appeal.

Located in North Andover, MA on the beautiful North Shore of Boston, our award-winning company is a mix of experienced veterans and fresh talent, all united in one energetic, fun, and hard working environment.

WHAT WE OFFER
A chance to grow in a progressive, highly-creative environment, plus:
• Competitive salary and consideration for annual bonus incentives.
• Medical, dental, vision, flexible spending plans, company paid life insurance.
• Matching 401K.
• Paid time off.
• Product discounts.

ARE YOU A FIT FOR THIS POSITION?
This is a full-time position in North Andover, MA. Please only apply if you are interested in living in the North Shore area, where we enjoy a rural blend of woods and historic villages and, are minutes from the beautiful seashore. Please note that only U.S. residents should apply.

If you are interested in helping us craft the future of Schylling, please send your resume and salary requirements to marketing-jobs@schylling.com

jobs.title: Senior Android Engineer
jobs.content:
Noom's scientifically proven behavior change programs take the uncertainty out of creating a healthier lifestyle, reliably delivering health outcomes, and we are tackling some of the biggest diseases out there (Type-II Diabetes, Obesity, and Hypertension to name a few). Our Engineering team is at the forefront of this challenge, solving complex technical and UX problems on our mobile apps that center around habits, behavior, and lifestyle.

We are looking for an experienced Android Engineer with a strong understanding of complex native mobile applications to help set the direction for Android as we scale. You will be making significant contributions to feature development on our existing applications, keeping up-to-date with latest trends in the Android ecosystem, use your best judgment about which ones fit well, and be thoughtful when rolling them out. You will also be a core contributor to the maintenance and improvement of our existing systems. As a senior member of the engineering team, you will also be a teacher and a leader, providing guidance, education, and support to the rest of the team on all things Android.

What We’re Looking For:

  • 3-4 years of large-scale android experience in a team environment
  • Ability to write code that is well structured, idiomatic, reusable, and easy to understand
  • Excellent communicator: comfort explaining technical problems in person and in writing
  • Team player: enjoys teaching new concepts to, and collaborating with, the team
  • User-oriented: thoughtfulness when considering both our growing and our legacy users when implementing new features and updates, placing them as the priority
  • Strong sense of responsibility and ownership; you will have come from an environment in which people are responsible for their own code

jobs.title: Full-stack Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Lisbon, Portugal
URL: http://twistag.com

Twistag is a Lisbon based digital agency. We design and develop amazing websites and digital products.
We’re looking for a talented and experienced Full-stack developer to join our team. At the moment we are working with top tier brands and agencies from Lisbon, NY, London and SF.
This will be a full-time remote position, you need to be really desciplined and passionate about what you do.

Main requirements
  • UI/Front-end — You should be able to write clean and pixel perfect markup, to convert designs from .SKETCH, .PSD into HTML + CSS + JavaScript. You need to be comfortable also working with CSS Frameworks (Twitter Bootstrap or Foundation) and JS Frameworks (jQuery, Angular)

  • Back-end — You should have experience working with WordPress (mandatory) (other PHP Frameworks or Woocommerce would be a plus). You need to have experience developing custom WordPress themes and plugins from scratch, using Custom Fields and Custom Post Types.

  • General — Write well-crafted, high-quality, self-documented, and easy to maintain code- Push your code to Github + deploying it and maintaining the repo- Providing technical support of applications (fixing bugs and supporting clients’ needs)- Support and maintenance of existing applications and website- Daily standup and update about the project’s status

Nice to have
  • You’ve helped build custom WordPress themes and plugins in the past and have some great examples you’re excited to share with us (you have code on GitHub, Launchpad, BitBucket, etc.)
  • You are self-disciplined and thrive in a remote environment working with a distributed team
  • You have an extensive knowledge of the HTML5 toolkit (HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, Jquery)
  • You are a strong communicator and can effectively communicate your ideas both internally and externally.

To apply: Send your portfolio and relevant links to hr at twistag dot com

jobs.title: Experienced Web Developer
jobs.content:
Full Job Description Available Here:


https://jobs.alongside.com/details/experienced-web-developer/14714?utm_source=stackoverflow



At HeyOrca, we are building a real time sandbox for marketing agencies to get their content reviewed and approved by their clients. We believe that the best agencies are the ones that involve their clients at critical junctures of the content creation process. HeyOrca exists to help these agencies, by providing the best agency-client collaboration experience.


HeyOrca is a growing software that integrates with social networks and numerous third party APIs. Some of the challenges we are facing include: gradually delivering complex features in short sprints and iterating over them, retiring or replacing features that cause code and business debt, making our codebase more maintainable, automating processes where applicable, and continuously increasing the overall quality of the HeyOrca application.


This is where you come in - be part of HeyOrca's growing family and create a great software for great users. We are looking to expand our technical team with two web developers who excel at either back-end or front-end development.



Responsibilities:


- As a HeyOrca team member, you will be adding and receiving value vs. just being another cog in the machine. Our goal is to build a great team, and with that, build great software.Developers should add value not just by coding, but by changing the way we work. Every day, we identify improvements, optimize part of the CI process, and teach each other something new. That's how we improve not just as individuals, but as a team. Developers receive different values from HeyOrca, for some it's the knowledge, for others the opportunity to contribute to the architecture of a young software, or perhaps the freedom to build your career rather than fitting into a role that's confined by its short list of responsibilities.A general day at HeyOrcaBegins with a team stretch or quick activityWorking on the story/task/bug you prefer to work onReviewing code and posting GIFs to express your feelings for someone's pull request http://gph.is/19z3HymHaving coffee/tea/lunch with the teamMeeting with non-technical team members to discuss design, bugs, roadmap, etc.Communicating with our awesome customers who might have discovered bugsRunning and reviewing results of automated testingCommunicating major code changes, architecture decisions, and challenges you are facing with the team.Most of our tasks are defined in a way to be finished by one developer, but expect lots of help from your peers. This reduces overhead and who likes merge conflicts anyways (this is how we merge code: http://gph.is/1Vp16TL). All members contribute in some way to most aspects of the software from ideation to maintenance and support; this helps us fully appreciate our role and gets us exploring about areas outside of our expertise.


At HeyOrca, we are building a real time sandbox for marketing agencies to get their content reviewed and approved by their clients. We believe that the best agencies are the ones that involve their clients at critical junctures of the content creation process. HeyOrca exists to help these agencies, by providing the best agency-client collaboration experience.


HeyOrca is a growing software that integrates with social networks and numerous third party APIs. Some of the challenges we are facing include: gradually delivering complex features in short sprints and iterating over them, retiring or replacing features that cause code and business debt, making our codebase more maintainable, automating processes where applicable, and continuously increasing the overall quality of the HeyOrca application.


This is where you come in - be part of HeyOrca's growing family and create a great software for great users. We are looking to expand our technical team with two web developers who excel at either back-end or front-end development.


At HeyOrca, we are building a real time sandbox for marketing agencies to get their content reviewed and approved by their clients. We believe that the best agencies are the ones that involve their clients at critical junctures of the content creation process. HeyOrca exists to help these agencies, by providing the best agency-client collaboration experience.


HeyOrca is a growing software that integrates with social networks and numerous third party APIs. Some of the challenges we are facing include: gradually delivering complex features in short sprints and iterating over them, retiring or replacing features that cause code and business debt, making our codebase more maintainable, automating processes where applicable, and continuously increasing the overall quality of the HeyOrca application.


This is where you come in - be part of HeyOrca's growing family and create a great software for great users. We are looking to expand our technical team with two web developers who excel at either back-end or front-end development.



Skills:


- Amazon Web Services (AWS)


- Other ORMs


- Other PHP Frameworks


- Other JS Frameworks


- Redux


- React.js


- Doctrine


- Laravel



Additional Information:


Here's some facts about HeyOrca that we think you might like:



  • We're a team of 17 from 7 different countries and are based in the oldest city in North America.

  • We just moved to a large office with open concept design, lots of fun, beer, video games, and music. More ideas are welcome!

  • We have a deep love for learning and personal improvement, so we help pay for your reading material, courses, or conference tickets.

  • If you like having fun, our team retreats, dinners, and parties are unforgettable to say the least.

  • Backed by some of the best VCs in Atlantic Canada, we keep improving as a team for a long and unforgettable future.


It's not going to be easy - but you will have more fun than you have ever had.


Some quotes that we live by:


"Make Something People Want"


"If you want to go far, bring others along the journey"


"Keep your eyes on the stars and your feet on the ground"



Apply now:


https://app.alongside.com/apply/14714?utm_source=stackoverflow

jobs.title: Android Developer - IOT
jobs.content:
Who we are


We believe that technology is not worth it, if it is not life changing and if it is not shared with as many people as possible, including your grandma. At Sen.se we work hard to make things that simply work, that make life easier and people happy. We design really smart objects that blend into people’s everyday lives and enhance it.


We're looking for talented Android developers to join our team and work on the companion apps for the new SensePeanut family of products.


We’re still a human-sized company, so you’ll get to be part of a tight-knit group of passionate people and have a direct impact of what we do and where we’re headed.


What you’ll do


Within our developer team and in direct contact with the CTO, you'll be working on two related projects: a BLE SDK (for both internal and external use), and the SensePeanut application. This means developing new features, but also supporting entirely new use cases.


You'll also help us streamline our processes by applying best practices (unit & functional tests, CI, etc.).


Your technical environment



  • Native development (Java)

  • Support for Android 4.3+

  • Google play services

  • GSON librairy

  • Bluetooth GATT APIs

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Engineer - North America - Remote
jobs.content:
We are hiring for our internal innovation team which is responsible for all our greenfield development. This means you get to create new things the right way from the beginning. You will have a unique opportunity to build new applications that will affect the future of our nation's healthcare system.

Cavulus is reshaping the landscape of the healthcare industry by building solutions which will drive the foundations of tomorrow's healthcare companies. Yes, it seems lofty but it is true.

Studies have shown over 30% of all healthcare costs are directly attributable to redundant and outdated processes. That is huge and we are tackling it using new technology, workflow automation and modern data science. Basically, bringing forward-leaning technology to an industry surviving on Cobol, old flat file systems and spreadsheets.

Responsibilities

  • Write application tier code ( Ruby, Scala, JAVA ( sometimes ) )
  • Integration with UI tier written in ember.js and vue.js
  • Partner in architecture and object design
  • Fully participate in our SCRUM process

Qualifications

  • Experience building enterprise business applications
  • Expert level knowledge of Ruby
  • Excellent Javascript skills ( vue.js a serious plus )
  • 3+ years of Ruby development experience
  • Strong understanding of Design Patterns and Software Paradigms

Nice To Haves

  • JAVA build systems experience ( think Maven )
  • GIT experience for managing source
  • Working knowledge of Scala

Be Intellectually Curious

The software world is constantly evolving which means we must grow and learn as a team. We actively look for new ideas and approaches to problems. Being intellectually curious helps you to bring the spark for the next great thing to the team.

Collaborate

We have a highly collaborative team environment. When creating new things, we believe collaborating, sharing ideas and solving problems together provides us the opportunity to arrive at unmatched solutions.

Have a Life

Late nights should be something you spend with your significant other not the development team. We believe your family needs you way more than the company does. This is why we work normal 8 hour days and encourage the use of PTO on your schedule not ours.

Not to mention we are 100% remote so you get to work in your space.

About Cavulus

Headquartered in beautiful Hilton Head, South Carolina, we are privately owned and debt free with a significant client roster. We have seen continuous positive growth since our inception over ten years ago. We are expanding and looking for people who want to be in a very collaborative and team oriented environment.

If this sounds like you and you want to be a part of this team, we would love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Engineer North America
jobs.content: Full Time: Senior Ruby Engineer - North America - Remote at Cavulus in Remote

jobs.title: DBA / Database Developer with DevOps Experience
jobs.content:
Full Time Telecommute Opportunity - Work from Home, but must live and be eligible to work in the US

Salary Range: $80,000- $110,000

Summary

Cavulus is seeking a database administrator with strong database scripting and automation skills. We are in the first phase of transitioning to a fully scripted (DevOps) database management process. The result of this project will be enabling employees to enter a single command to automatically stand up new application environments and new clients. This is a unique opportunity to build a DevOps process from the ground up. The successful candidate will be a integral part of this project, while also working closely with the development team for database related assistance.

Responsibilities

  • Write powershell (or python), and SQL scripts to fully automate configuration and maintenance of databases including creation of fully configured database environments, data migration, monitoring, and release management.
  • Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end
  • Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours
  • Understand how the company's application/product uses the databases and work with the application development team to optimize schema, queries, stored procedures, and functions to achieve optimum application performance with respect to the database.
  • Perform peer review of all changes to the production databases.
  • Available as 2nd tier on call support on a rotating basis for emergency issues after hours. You would only be contacted if a database issue occurred that the network operations center was unable to resolve.

Qualifications

  • Must be detail orientated and have excellent communication skills.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in CS or similar; with 5+ years of DBA / database development experience in SQL Server, MySQL, or Aurora.
  • Experience with DevOps environments using configuration management systems such as Chef, Puppet, or OpsWorks. Ruby or Python experience preferred.
  • SQL development experience to write and troubleshoot stored procedures, functions, and SSIS packages.
  • Experience in Amazon Web Services (AWS) preferred.
  • Extensive experience in performance tuning, query optimization, replication techniques, clustering, authentication, partitioning and security issues in a SaaS operations environment.
  • Experience with database security concepts, including access, auditing, and encryption.

About Our Company

Cavulus is helping to reshape the landscape of the healthcare industry. Our team is building solutions which are fast becoming an integral piece in the health care marketplace. The software world is constantly evolving which means we must grow and learn as a team. We are constantly looking for new ideas and approaches to problems.

We are privately owned and debt free with a significant client list. We have seen continuous positive growth since our inception over eight years ago. We are expanding and looking for people who want to be in a very collaborative and team oriented environment.

We offer a full benefits package to include:

  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401k/Roth plans
  • Paid Time Off

If this sounds like you and you want to be a part of this team, we would love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Senior AWS DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Full Time Telecommute Opportunity - Work from Home, but must live and be eligible to work in the US

Salary Range: $90,000- $125,000

Summary

Cavulus is seeking a senior devops engineer to design and build an automated SaaS infrastructure in AWS. The successful candidate will leverage their experience scripting infrastructure as code to enable environments to be rolled out in minutes and daily code updates through continuous integration. This is a rare opportunity to build a complete infrastructure from the ground up, the way you know it should be done without limitations or restrictions.

Responsibilities

  • Architect, implement, then maintain a completely scripted SaaS infrastructure with continuous integration for a linux environment running in AWS.
  • Design and implement solutions for monitoring, scaling, performance improvement, and configuration management of systems running SaaS applications.
  • Quickly troubleshoot and resolve network, hardware, software and performance issues, including rotating on call emergency response.
  • Mentor other systems adminstrators in devops and AWS best practices.

Qualifications

  • Must be detail orientated and have excellent communication skills.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in CS or similar.
  • 3+ years AWS architecture and automation with infrastructure management tools such as CloudFormation(required), Ansible, Chef, OpsWorks, and Jenkins.
  • Experience in at least one of the following languages: Python, Ruby, or Perl.
  • Experience with Ubutntu systems.
  • AWS architecture, developer, or devops certifications a plus.

About Our Company

Cavulus is helping to reshape the landscape of the healthcare industry. Our team is building solutions which are fast becoming an integral piece in the health care marketplace. The software world is constantly evolving which means we must grow and learn as a team. We are constantly looking for new ideas and approaches to problems.

We are privately owned and debt free with a significant client list. We have seen continuous positive growth since our inception over nine years ago. We are expanding and looking for people who want to be in a very collaborative and team oriented environment.

  • 401k/Roth plans
  • Paid Time Off

jobs.title: SQL Developer / Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Want to do something worthwhile? To improve the lives of millions of people in the UK? We do, and we’d like you to join us. DrDoctor is a fast growing healthcare start-up with big ambitions.


We are looking for a SQL Developer/Data Engineer to lead on our client integrations, help us grow our BI and keep our databases running smoothly.  Your mission will be to own all things data and help lead our platform on to new scale.


You will need great experience of integrating systems, transforming large amounts of data efficiently, and performance tuning databases. You should know ETL techniques, be able to understand and improve a SQL query plan, and be comfortable suggesting architecture changes where needed.  You should also have experience with at least two interesting technologies - things that get us excited include HL7, Redis, NoSQL, Azure SQL, machine learning and automated testing.  Our technology stack is primarily Microsoft C# .NET so although that won't be your core job you should be comfortable reading code and making tweaks to the data access layer.


We are looking for someone who loves technology and has the drive to push, challenge and grow the company. You’ll need to be as ambitious as we are and revel in the flexible nature and mix of skills required for startup work. We're primarily office based but supportive of flexible and remote working so days at home or nursery runs are not a problem.


No recruiters please

jobs.title: Senior .NET
jobs.content:
Want to do something worthwhile? To improve the lives of millions of people in the UK? We do, and we’d like you to join us. DrDoctor is a fast growing healthcare start-up with big ambitions.


We are looking for a Senior .NET (C#) Developer with extensive Azure experience to be a core member of our team. We have a proven stack which we now wish to move to Azure and take full advantage of the platform features. Your mission will be to drive this transformation of our core platform.


As well as this you will help build new features on the existing tech to help product develop   ent.  You will need great experience of C#, SQL and at least two interesting technologies.  Things that get us excited include distributed systems, CI & automated deployment, BDD, message busses, and API integrations.  Our technology stack is primarily Microsoft with a sprinkling of interesting C# open source components - read more about it here.  We’re always trying new frameworks and technologies so if you have ideas on how to improve things then that is what we want to know.

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs.content: We’re #1 on the app store and trusted by thousands of businesses in over 110 countries. Based in downtown Toronto, we offer all the benefits of being a startup with great work-life balance. The opportunities – for our product, and our people – are endless.

jobs.title: Senior Java Designer/Developer - Scala, Hadoop - Big Data focus
jobs.content:
You have a big passion for big data, and you aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves to get dirty – figuratively speaking, of course. You welcome the chance to wear multiple professional hats at once, providing strategic insight one day and technical support the next.


We’re looking for someone just like you to join our Information Management team, solving large scale data problems each day. The work you’ll be doing will establish new patterns of usage in our Cloudera CDH clusters, and will drive innovation within the organization as a whole.


For you, there’s no thinking outside the box. There’s only thinking about what comes next, box or no box.


If this sounds like you, drop us a line!

jobs.title: Data Integration Developer - Java, Scala
jobs.content:
The future of banking? Whatever you want it to be.


We’re looking for someone who really knows the ins and outs of Java and Scala to join our Information Management team. Your day to day will see you working closely with large quantities of data as you help build and implement a personal banking data strategy. Your work will make a direct impact on the lives of our 22 million customers worldwide.


(That’s a lot of data.)


Here’s what a typical day might look like for you:



  • Design and write code in Java, Scala or other functional programming languages. You’ll likely be working with data management solutions running in a Cloudera CDH.

  • Create code to automatically monitor, troubleshoot, and tune the work you create. Make your code work for you, not the other way around!

  • Write unit tests + integration tests and automate them using the Continuous Integration framework based on Jenkins, Bitbucket, Nexus, and other tools.

  • Nobody’s perfect. You’ll regularly participate in peer code reviews, and help us create and update coding standards.

  • Develop physical models based on the Personal Banking logical model aligned to the Teradata Financial Services Logical Data Model (FS-LDM).

  • Work with the Data Governance team on Semantic layer definition for data mapping and profiling.

  • Perform data profiling, discovery and quality assessment of the source system feeds.

  • Create and maintain technical metadata for source system feeds using Podium or custom Java or Scala code.

  • Perform data mapping, transformation and extraction from a Cloudera CDH cluster to another Cloudera CDH cluster development environment for analytics.

  • Create and update use stories and tasks in JIRA.

  • Create and maintain data architecture, data management conventions and standards, naming and metadata standards – and challenge them when you think we can improve upon them!

  • Use Confluence to collaborate with other team members and to publish technical artifacts. You’ll be working with a lot of talented team mates at every step of the way.

  • Last but not least, prioritize and manage own workload in order to deliver quality results and meet timelines. You know you best – let us know what you need to do your best work.

jobs.title: Full Stack .Net Developer
jobs.content:
At TD, we support over 22 million customers – along with 85 000 employees worldwide. The work we do internally to make our business better, faster, and stronger, is just as important as the services we offer externally. For us, "ground-breaking" is just another day.


The Treasury and Balance Sheet Management (TBSM) department of TD Bank is responsible for measurement and management of market risk (including interest rate and foreign exchange) for the Bank's retail portfolios. As part of the Treasury Analytics team, you'll help develop financial models and processes required for measuring, transfer pricing, hedging product profitability, and financial management reporting. (Whew!)

jobs.title: SENIOR DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
We are looking for someone to lead the creation of a comprehensive end-to-end detailed solution with overall accountability for the technical design and delivery of the system design specification. You’ll be exposed to stretch assignments as you take on large-scale, complex and/or enterprise-wide projects.
Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here’s some of what you may be asked to perform:



  • Develop new applications and performs unit / component test for new applications.

  • Create and maintains quality code, consistent with quality standards; provide code maintenance and support during testing cycles and post-production deployment

  • Conduct program/ system research, analysis, detailed design and problem resolution.

  • Develops program specifications, adapts, integrates, codes, tests, and debugs complex programs.

  • Works independently or collaboratively with other areas/ team members to meet deliverables and ensure team members adhere to guidelines/ procedures on medium to large scale projects

  • Inform the Solution Designer, Technology Project Manager or Development Manager of any issues that may affect other areas of the project

  • Support business enquiries and business activities through execution of small enhancements and break/fix implementations.

  • Deliver effective and efficient solutions by meeting key project milestones and overall project deliverables on time, within budget, and adhering to development and quality standards.

  • Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest.

  • Provide Level 3 Technical Support for Production Incidents.

  • Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units

jobs.title: Customer Success Engineer in Americas
jobs.content:
Note: we are seeking someone in North or South America. The position is remote insofar as work-from-home is expected, but you need to be in the right continents. Thanks!

Platform.sh the award-winning PaaS solution is looking for a talented customer success engineer who is passionate about site uptime and happy customers.


Our customers run thousands of web applications in over 100 countries consuming 10s of thousands of CPUs on multiple public clouds. We were shipping containers before Docker, our sales team can explain the CAP Theorem, and our marketing director programs Haskell. We can clone whole running systems, including the data, services, and networking in a matter seconds. The main API to operate and orchestrate our clusters of LXC containers is Git. We're hardcore technologists with equally hardcore customers. We're looking for strong technologists who are good at talking directly to customers.


Our customers need on-boarding and training before they can master the Platform.sh fu. Can you deliver breathtaking and exhilarating tech demos, and explain the intricacies of command line tools? We run OEM PaaS services for famous brands like Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition and Sensio Cloud - can you help us build and run these vibrant software products?


As a Customer Success Engineer, you help with onboarding, provisioning, and training of customers. You will also be essential for diagnostics and debugging of failing applications and systems, and you have a strong mandate to help us automate and streamline everything we do. You are periodically on call in case disaster strikes. You're our front line, and when our customers think of how great Platform.sh is, they think of you.

jobs.title: UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
The Product Design team at HotSchedules is growing, and we’re looking for a UI/UX Designer with the right chops and team fit. This role works closely with the Product Management and Engineering teams to flesh out features and improvements in our applications. As a designer, you should have excellent aesthetic, but also bring a deep love for problem solving – integrating user feedback and overall product direction to make our customers’ experience the best it can be.

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Portfolio showcasing strong UI/UX work (Please include a link)
  • Deep passion for design, product, and the customer experience.
  • Be humble and ready to learn
  • Must possess exceptional user interface and interaction design skills, as well as in-depth understanding of user-centered design principles
  • Must hold a good understanding of web and mobile design constraints
  • Experience implementing a design system and brand guidelines
  • Proficient with Adobe Creative Suite and Sketch (we use Sketch)
  • Some knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
  • Experience creating wireframes/prototypes and hi-fidelity mockups for web and mobile apps
  • Experience working in an agile development environment and working closely with development teams to deliver design assets
  • BS/BA or equivalent work experience
  • 1-3 years experience in a product company
  • Able to easily convey the reasons behind the design decisions you make, both one-on-one and in larger settings
  • Experience with Point of Sale, Business Intelligence applications or Labor Management and Scheduling solutions preferred

We Are:

Well-known across the globe for bringing the restaurant, retail and hospitality industries to the Cloud with our pioneering web & mobile products, superior customer service – and the people who make this happen.

Our Values: Because they are important to us!

Service – We come from the service industry, and like you, we know that great service is the only thing that keeps customers coming back.

Creativity – Not sure how to get that project done? We don’t let “the way we’ve always done it” get our way. We value out of the box thinkers who have fresh ways to address challenges!

Family – When you’re here, you’re family. When it’s time to go home, we respect your work-life balance so you can be with your real family.

Fun – In between (and even during) all the hard work, we like to have a lot of fun! From inter-office video contests to fitness challenges, happy hours and Friday lunches, we keep it awesome.

Humility – Humility starts at the top and flows throughout. It’s about responsibility, acknowledging mistakes and never forgetting our humble beginnings.

Learn more about us, our story and how we became a part of the HotSchedules family of products and services. Visit the About Us page on HotSchedules.com

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Speak the language like you’ve always wanted to.


Changing the way the language learning is done is a great challenge, so we are looking for Data Scientist to join our Berlin office.


Babbel is building up an advanced Data Science unit sharply focused on long-term projects, innovation and cutting edge methodology. Our goal is to use state of the art machine learning and statistical modeling to analyse and predict our customers, our markets and the mechanics of our business.


At Babbel you have the rare chance to join a company that’s building up its analytics and wants to do it right from the beginning, with data science and machine learning as an integral part.



We can’t wait to see what you make of your job, for starters these will be your responsibilities:



  • Design, implement and deploy predictive data services and machine learning models that create business value – providing insight, reducing cost or growing revenue.

  • Increase accuracy of direction setting and business planning with flexible, global predictive modeling.

  • Drive forward the use of machine learning, predictive intelligence and automated decision making with all stakeholders and departments across the company.

  • Drive innovation in Babbel’s way of working with data.

  • Collaborate with other analysts, data and research teams.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Product Manager - Platform
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Senior Technical Product Manager to start immediately in our office in Berlin-Mitte, Germany.


With millions of regular users and more than 7000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning.


You are an enthusiastic, high energy individual who is excited to drive technical projects in the challenging setting of a fast moving company.



As a TPO you will



  • drive technical product platform evolvement based on product strategy

  • drive technical projects across a wide range of initiatives

  • coordinate initiatives with other product managers (both technical and non-technical)

  • collaborate heavily with engineers in defining initiatives and solutions

  • be the product owner for two teams (core infrastructure, engineering tooling)

  • provide clear view of initiatives scope, progress and results incl. architectural changes for both operational as well as management

  • you will report directly to the head of software engineering

  • mentor junior colleagues and engineers in technical product management

jobs.content:
Changing the way the language learning is done is a great challenge, so we are looking for an Conversion Rate Optimisation Manager to join our Berlin office.



Responsibilities for the role:



  • Conceptualize original landing page design ideas that bring simplicity and  facilitates conversion

  • Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to communicate interaction and design ideas

  • Support developing test plans & campaign requirements to be implemented 

  • Validate design concepts with all relevant departments to ensure high quality and brand conformity

jobs.title: Director of Content, Artist Partner Group/Atlantic Records
jobs.content:
A little bit about us:
Artist Partner Group is a medium sized, new model label, in partnership with Atlantic Records. Lead by veteran music executive, Mike Caren, APG is a well funded, versatile label with the agility of an indie and the muscle of a major.
The company is fast paced, creative, and very close to the artists. It’s a place for fast moving but thoughtful and hardworking up-and-comers determined to make a significant mark on the industry.

Why this is the best move for your career:
Artist Partner Group is looking for a creative content director to commission and develop music content including but not limited to logos, social content, music videos, performance videos, visual branding, flash sites, and branding tools.

You’ll get to:
Meet with artists to learn their aesthetics and vision.
Meet with photographers, video directors, editors, graphic designers, and producers to develop content.
Create content calendars and strategy to meet content deadlines.
Negotiate deals with content creators for their work.
Provide notes & collect artist and marketing notes in order to direct content creators to improve their product.
Make quick edits, power point presentations, hype sheets, and social content when deadlines are short and need is urgent.

You’ll be the fit for this role if:
You live and breathe music and have knowledge of the Pop, Hip Hop, R&B, Dance, Alternative and Singer Songwriter genres.
You are determined to work in the music industry with the best and brightest people in the business.
You know how to source content on both small and large budgets.
You have basic skills in graphic design, photoshop, video editing, photography, powerpoint and basic site building.
You are hardworking, dedicated, proactive, detail oriented, have a high bar for quality, work well in teams, communicate well, think fast, and have strong ethics.
You have 2 years of experience creating artist content in-house, freelancing, or producing content.

Why join us?
We are at the heart of the music business and launch more successful music careers, for artists & executives a like, than most of the industry. We have a fast paced, exciting, and creative environment that is oriented for growth and career development.

Love this job and want to apply?
Send your resume, samples of your work, and salary requirements to careers@artistpg.com.
For more information on us, visit artistpg.com. We love it here, and think you will too.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
The EBI Metagenomics Portal and MG-RAST are the world-leading platforms offering free-to-use analysis services for the characterisation of metagenomics sequences. The Metagenomics Exchange is a new collaboration between these platforms, aiming to promote data exchange, discovery and cross talk between the resources and their analysis pipelines. Metagenomics analysis is challenging in terms of scale of data and diversity of data.

We are seeking an experienced software developer to work on this project, specifically working on the EBI metagenomics resource. The post-holder will be involved in implementing pipeline components, evaluating different storage solutions, investigating different cloud deployment approaches for running the pipeline and the application of workflow technologies (e.g. CWL). New technologies and approaches will be interweaved into the existing analysis framework largely written in Python and backed by MySQL and NoSQL data stores, to increase the pipeline throughput, robustness and scope of analysis. The candidate will also help establish data exchange procedures between EBI metagenomics and MG-RAST, to deliver a framework for broadcasting and exchange of metagenomics datasets and their associated analysis results, in collaboration with the European Nucleotide Resource. The EBI Metagenomics Portal project is maintained by a four-person sub-team within the larger Sequence Families team lead by Rob Finn (organised into biocurators, production software developers and web developers each with a sub-team lead). The post-holder will report to Simon Potter, participate in daily scrum meetings with the production software and web developers, attend EMG team meetings and gather requirements from key stakeholders for sprint planning meetings. The collaborative nature of EBI requires the post-holder to interact with other EBI teams, particularly the Technical Services teams and maintain and foster external collaborations, particularly with the MG-RAST team.

The ideal candidate will have a postgraduate degree in computer science, bioinformatics or a related discipline, although candidates with equivalent experience will also be considered.

jobs.title: Bioinformatician  GA4GH Meta Data, Ontologies & Biosamples
jobs.content:
The Samples, Phenotypes and Ontologies Team at EMBL-EBI seeks an enthusiastic, highly motivated bioinformatician to work with the Biosamples database team as part of the Global Alliance for Genomics and Health (GA4GH) initiative. This is a position specific to this project to ensure that human disease biological sample information can be integrated and made available worldwide.



The BioSamples database at EMBL-EBI integrates biological samples from a wide variety of sources, applying standards and ontologies to this data. In 2016 it has grown to contain over 5 million samples. The GA4GH initiative underlies the foundation of data sharing and processing for genomic medicine. The metadata task team of GA4GH is designing datamodels to ensure sample, individual and technical metadata is completely interoperable and can be used by research groups across the globe. A key component of this is the development of an API for data exchange using data from the BioSamples Database.



In this role, you’ll be working directly with the data to find, integrate and apply standards and ontologies to human disease sample records. You’ll be part of the Samples, Phenotypes and Ontologies Team – a multidisciplinary team of over 20 scientists, bioinformaticians and software developers – and working directly with members of the BioSamples Team and other members of the GA4GH group, both within the EBI and internationally. This post offers the challenges and excitement of working at the forefront of genomics and clinical data science, and as such you’ll need to be self-motivated, eager and have excellent communication skills.



This position offers exciting opportunities to work on a large, established bioinformatics database and to take initiative in the mapping and alignment of data to ontologies. You’ll also gain experience in API development, and you’ll have the opportunity to help build a RESTful API over data in the BioSamples database to make samples available to GA4GH.



This post would be perfect for a recent bioinformatics graduate who would like to improve their development skills, but with a background in Biology. You should be self-motivated and capable of working both independently and with a closely interacting team of scientists in an international academic environment. You’ll need to have experience of software development in at least one programming language, and if you have worked in a collaborative coding environment or an agile development team in the past you’ll be at the front of the queue. An interest in ontologies and semantic web technologies would be an advantage.

jobs.title: User Interface Designer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an ambitious and driven user interface designer who is passionate about creating engaging, consistent and memorable experiences. Hotjar is a rapidly growing startup that is giving thousands of website owners the tools needed to discover how their visitors are really using their website. In this role you will be iteratively improving the Hotjar user experience and helping us shape the product and company whilst growing with us.
 
This is an excellent remote career opportunity to join a fast growing startup in a key position and make a difference in the design community and industry.
 
__As a User Interface Designer, you will:__

* Create thoughtful and appropriate solutions to design challenges of all sizes as you design and build beautiful and engaging user interfaces according to user needs, business requirements and technical constraints.
* Work in one of our multiÂ­disciplinary product teams and collaborate with our Director of Design, stakeholders, engineers and other designers in an iterative, transparent and feedback driven process.
* Translate wireframes and experiences into highly-polished visual composites with a user-centered design methodology.
* Build browser-tested user interfaces using HTML, CSS and basic JavaScript whilst following best practices and Hotjarâs code, style and brand guidelines.

__Requirements__

* A minimum of 3 years experience designing and building interfaces and digital SaaS products.
* Experience designing interfaces for desktops, tablets and phones.
* Experience in front-end development (HTML, CSS, basic JavaScript).
* Demonstrated ability creating deliverables in the visual design and building stages.
* A passion for detail and a care for great usability and aesthetics.
* Excellent self-starter who always thinks MVP first with the ability to work in a small, startup-style, agile and fast-paced team.
* Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Confident in your work without becoming too attached to your designs when constructive team and user feedback is put forward.
* A strong portfolio featuring relevant work examples.
* Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party.
* Assets: Experience in UX research, wireframing and prototyping, experience working embedded in a team of developers, experience working remotely.

URL: https://www.hotjar.com/

Hotjar is a rapidly growing startup that is giving thousands of website owners the tools needed to discover how their visitors are really using their website. jobs.title: Hotjar Hero Engineer (US East Coast / Europe)
jobs.content:
The Hotjar Hero team supports thousands of users and customers in over 180 countries by providing world class service, documentation, and training. The Hero team also works closely with our product teams to help prioritize and define changes to Hotjar to continuously improve the overall user experience.

We are looking for extremely organized and self driven Hotjar Hero Engineer to work in a remote role with a fast growing startup.

All new Heroes receive extensive technical, product, and marketing training â as well as a yearly budget for additional training and self development. With this knowledge you will help our users set up and use Hotjar features to improve the experience and performance of their sites and apps. This is a great opportunity to develop your career by learning new skills and joining a fast-growing startup.

About You

Detail is key. Troubleshooting an issue isnât always straightforward. Since our tool can get pretty technical, obsessing over detail really helps. If you canât solve it, thatâs ok - just provide enough details to help the engineers as they investigate further.

Empathy for the win. Our users come from a wide range of backgrounds and have a wide range of technical ability. Hotjar Hero Engineers need to be able to put themselves in the usersâ shoes to help them resolve any questions while at the same time empowering users with knowledge.

Independent mindset. As a remote team, autonomy and self-motivation is necessary. One of our core values is Honesty. We donât use apps to measure whether or not you're working, we simply trust you. Are you up to the challenge?

Learning is growing. Hotjar is always adding new capabilities and improving the way our tool works. This means Hotjar Hero Engineers are always learning. Plus, it doesnât stop there - everyone at Hotjar aims to learn 1% each day (machine learning, anyone?).

Go Team! Though we are spread across the world, our team is always in contact. We hold daily scrums, weekly planning, and company wide demos. We need to be prepared to step up if a team member is out. Or share a new idea we have for how to make the team or the company better. Being a team player is vital to the role of Hero Engineer.

What Hotjar Hero Engineers do...

  • Creating 'WOW' moments by promptly replying and communicating with users on our support channels.
  • Investigate and solve technical issues users face on a daily basis by debugging complex issues in our codebase and on our users' sites â which use a myriad of different technologies.
  • Distill complex issues into underlying causes and work directly with our product teams to deploy solutions while consistently delivering world-class support.
  • Writing (and updating) documentation, FAQs and the Hotjar knowledgebase.
  • Representing Hotjar users within the company â to further their needs and help generate

Requirements

Must have:

  • Very strong English communication skills â both written and spoken. If you are fluent in other languages, tell us! German, French, Spanish and Japanese will be considered as assets.
  • Familiarity with the basics of HTML, CSS, Javascript, and using browser developer tools.
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex concepts that empowers our users without making them feel small.
  • Be able to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity
  • Experience working in technical support roles and teams, Agile experience a plus.
  • Desire and drive to always be learning.
  • Ability to work independently and within a team towards both personal and shared work goals
  • Passion for talking to users all day, every day.
  • Strong Javascript and angularJS knowledge.
  • Proficient in any one of the following: Python, PostgreSQL, Mercurial, Redis, Memcached, Lua, Nginx.
  • Previous experience in a troubleshooting environment and be a great problem solver.

Nice to have:

  • Experience working in technical support roles and teams.
  • Experience in codifying and maintaining customer support processes.
  • Experience working remotely.

To apply: PLease apply via our careers portal at http://careers.hotjar.com/

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Hotjar is looking for a driven and ambitious DevOps Engineer based in a US timezone to support and expand our cloud-based infrastructure used by thousands of sites around the world. The Hotjar infrastructure currently processes more than 8,300 API requests per second, delivers over a billionpieces of static content every week and hosts databases well into terabyte-size ranges, making this an interesting and challenging opportunity. 

This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast growing remote startup in a key position. 

In this position, you will:



  • Be part of the team building and maintaining our sites and web applications.

  • Choose, deploy and manage tools and technologies to build and support a robust infrastructure.

  • Be responsible for identifying bottlenecks and improving performance of all our systems.

  • Ensure all necessary monitoring, alerting and backup solutions are in place.

  • Do research and keep up to date on trends in big data processing and large scale analytics.

  • Implement proof of concept solutions in the form of prototype applications.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

About Veeqo

Veeqo is an award winning high growth tech startup company which has customers around the world and an ambition to become the best software platform for online retailers to manage their business. It helps online retailers sync their stock between their website, retail stores and marketplaces like eBay and Amazon.

Veeqo is growing at an astonishing 300% per year and is expanding globally. Joining Veeqo is a unique opportunity to get involved in a world class start up. Our company is based in London and Swansea and is expanding internationally rapidly ( US, Germany …)

Our position

Because our frontend was fragmented and carries some legacy, the team recently started to make things right: never write new code without tests, practice modularity, devote time to do technical debt, etc. We need someone smarter than us who will lead this movement in frontend.

Job location

We have offices in London, Swansea and shortly Cardiff but some of our team prefer to work remote, which we fully support.

Our team

Less than a dozen developers, five of which are frontend/fullstack. Our workflow and practices are based on shared culture rather than on red tape, which means that you will be also responsible for keeping, maintaining and conducting the culture. We are still a relatively small team, so your contribution will be significant.

Our frontend technology stack

  • Marionette.js, Backbone.js, CoffeeScript, JavaScript, SCSS, Rails assets pipeline
  • Some legacy plain Backbone javascript parts and even several legacy rendered Rails views
  • Jasmine, Sinon and Capybara are used for testing
  • RESTful RoR-based backend API (you can consider it a blackbox if you wish)

REQUIREMENTS

Required experience

  • Building and maintaining large frontend applications
  • Writing and maintaining unit, integration and functional tests for frontend behaviour
  • Keeping technical debt low
  • Leading [at least a small] team of frontenders
  • Working in a distributed team, being absolutely comfortable working with remote teammates

Technical skills required for this job

  • Perfect knowledge and experience in Marionette.js, CoffeeScript
  • Perfect SCSS skills
  • Profound knowledge of Backbone.js
  • Good TDD skills with Jasmine or Mocha, Sinon
  • Good skills in writing tests with Capybara or similar tool
  • Good OOD skills, knowledge of OOP patterns
  • Familiarity with BEM approach

We expect that you will:

  • Come up with a strategy of gradual improvement of our frontend codebase
  • Deliver new features as a part of our usual iteration workflow
  • Judge many trade-offs: advantages of a hot technology vs adoption cost, perfection of code vs speed of development, etc.
  • Support existing code and perform refactoring gradually making architectural improvements
  • Share your knowledge and experience with the rest of the team and significantly contribute into the developer's’ culture
  • Implement best frontend development practices
  • Give and receive a lot of code review

Who are you ?

  • You're a person who writes clean code that not only works, but is also maintainable and easy to change
  • You’re self-organized
  • You want to make the best UI for great experience of our customers
  • You have a patience and strong will to invigorate teammates
  • You want to build a career in a global company
  • You thrive in a fast-growing, always-changing environment
  • You want to be challenged every day

What do we (as a development team) practice:

  • TDD (obviously)
  • Continuous integration
  • Continuous delivery
  • Infrastructure as code
  • Well-defined planning process
  • Regular team retrospectives
  • Non-blocking code reviews

In short, we do our best to shorten feedback loops from any change of the system.

BENEFITS

  • Be part of a fast growth start-up and make a difference.
  • Our company highly supports personal and professional growth so it’s a great opportunity to became a team lead
  • We have an open business culture, so you’ll be able to see all aspects of the start-up growth
  • Work in a friendly, cross-functional team, with people who aim to be the best and love to tackle problems
  • Remote first - we believe in quality of work, not sitting in an office for 8 hours
  • Explicitly allocated time every week to learn new technologies and hacking
  • “The No Asshole” rule is applied
  • Annual budget for going to conferences or training in Europe
  • Spotify Premium, Private GP and Gym Membership
  • Share option

jobs.title: Ruby Backend Developer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

About Veeqo

Veeqo is an award winning high growth tech startup company which has customers around the world and an ambition to become the best software platform for online retailers to manage their business. It helps online retailers sync their stock between their website, retail stores and marketplaces like eBay and Amazon.

Veeqo is growing at an astonishing 300% per year and is expanding globally. Joining Veeqo is a unique opportunity to get involved in a world class start up. Our company is based in London and Swansea and is expanding internationally rapidly ( US, Germany …)

Our position

We need a mid-level Ruby backend developer. In our team, you will grow your skills faster than in any other team; you will learn from the best senior engineers. You will get your code right into production very quickly and see real impact — a task in our team is not complete until a problem of a user is solved in reality.

Job location

We have offices in London, Swansea and shortly Cardiff but some of our team prefer to work remote, which we fully support.

After working with us for some time you will:

  • Know Ruby better than the average Ruby programmer. You will know what implicit context is, the difference between ‘self’ and ‘default definee’ and when exactly these two don’t match. Soon you will know which race conditions are possible despite GIL and what "metaclass of eigenclass is eigenclass of metaclass" really means.
  • Contribute to open-source projects and develop your Github account.
  • Be able to work in a distributed team and become a geographically independent programmer.
  • Juggle git objects with ease and consider even interactive rebases as a daily routine.
  • Know how to monitor production servers and identify real-life problems.

In short, after 2-3 years of working with us you will be much more valuable on the labour market. We specialise in fast growth of junior and middle developers. But don’t forget that greater reward comes with greater risk:

REQUIREMENTS

Who are you ?

  • You're very enthusiastic about programming and have a passion to learn more
  • Ambition and eagerness to learn and improve
  • You want to build a career in a global company
  • You thrive in a fast-growing, always-changing environment
  • You want to be challenged every day

Technical prerequisites for this job

  • Be confident in the Ruby language, some metaprogramming is required
  • Know how to use RSpec, have a habit of test-driven development
  • Have enough knowledge of Ruby on Rails framework, be able to write a simple CRUD app without googling
  • Know basic git operations

Our backend technology stack

  • Ruby as an imperative language
  • Elixir as a functional language
  • Rails and Phoenix as web frameworks
  • Postgres as a relational database
  • Redis and Memcache as key-value storages
  • RabbitMQ and Redis as message queueing solutions

What do we (as a development team) practice:

  • TDD (obviously)
  • Continuous integration
  • Continuous delivery
  • Infrastructure as code
  • Well-defined planning process
  • Regular team retrospectives

BENEFITS

  • Annual budget for going to conferences or training in Europe
  • Spotify Premium, Private GP and Gym Membership
  • Share option
  • Be part of a fast growth start-up and make a difference
  • We are a relatively small team, your contribution will be significant
  • Our workflow and practices are based on shared culture rather than on red tape
  • Learn more in a few years at Veeqo than you will in any other job
  • Work in a friendly, cross-functional team, with people who aim to be the best and love to tackle problems
  • Relaxed and flexible work environment with free hot and cold drinks, Spotify Premium, private GP and gym membership
  • Remote first - we believe in quality of work, not sitting in an office for 8 hours
  • Explicitly allocated time every week to learn new technologies and hack
  • “The No Asshole” rule is applied

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Backend Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Swansea, UK
URL: https://veeqo.workable.com/jobs/405312

About Veeqo
Veeqo is an award winning high growth tech startup company which has customers around the world and an ambition to become the best software platform for online retailers to manage their business. It helps online retailers sync their stock between their website, retail stores and marketplaces like eBay and Amazon.
Veeqo is growing at an astonishing 300% per year and is expanding globally. Joining Veeqo is a unique opportunity to get involved in a world class start up. Our company is based in London and Swansea and is expanding internationally rapidly ( US, Germany …)
Our position
We need another smart brain to join our development team. You are expected to be already skilled and experienced in the main parts of our technology stack. We also need experience in mentoring juniors and middle devs, very good code review culture, business awareness and overall friendliness.

Job location
We have offices in London, Swansea and shortly Cardiff but some of our team prefer to work remote, which we fully support.

Our team
Less than a dozen developers, both frontend and backend, divided into sub-teams. Our workflow and practices are based on shared culture rather than on red tape, which means that you will be also responsible for keeping, maintaining and conducting the culture. We are still a relatively small team, so your contribution will be significant.

Our backend technology stack
Backend is separated from frontend and plays a role of RESTful JSON API. We communicate with dozens of 3rd party APIs and our own separate services. A lot of asynchronicity is involved, with the vast majority of work being done in background queue processors. We use:
  • Ruby as an imperative language
  • Elixir as a functional language
  • Rails and Phoenix as web frameworks
  • Postgres as a relational database
  • Redis and Memcache as key-value storages
  • RabbitMQ and Redis as message queueing solutions
  • Sidekiq and Sneakers as background job processing frameworks
  • ElasticSearch as a full-text search engine
REQUIREMENTS
Required experience
  • Developing and maintaining large mature Ruby applications
  • Writing and maintaining all kinds of tests
  • Mentoring junior and middle developers
  • Keeping technical debt low
  • Working in a distributed team, being absolutely comfortable working with remote teammates
  • Being able to maintain open-source project is preferred
Technical skills required for this job
  • Ruby at a very high level of knowledge. Metaprogramming skill is strictly required.
  • Backend parts of Ruby on Rails
  • SQL, particularly Postgres
Who are you ?

  • You're a person who writes clean code that not only works, but is also maintainable and easy to change
  • You’re self-organized
  • You want to make the best UI for great experience of our customers
  • You have a patience and strong will to invigorate teammates
  • You want to build a career in a global company
  • You thrive in a fast-growing, always-changing environment
  • You want to be challenged every day

What do we (as a development team) practice:

  • TDD (obviously)
  • Continuous integration
  • Continuous delivery
  • Infrastructure as a code
  • Well-defined planning process
  • Regular team retrospectives
  • Non-blocking code reviews
In short, we do our best to shorten feedback loops from any change of the system.

BENEFITS
  • Be part of a fast growth start-up and make a difference
  • Our company highly supports personal and professional growth so it’s a great opportunity to became a team lead
  • Annual budget for going to conferences or training in Europe
  • Spotify Premnuim, Private GP and Gym Membership
  • Share option
  • We have an open business culture, so you’ll be able to see all aspects of the start-up growth
  • Work in a friendly, cross-functional team, with people who aim to be the best and love to tackle problems
  • Remote first - we believe in quality of work, not sitting in an office for 8 hours
  • Explicitly allocated time every week to learn new technologies and hacking
  • “The No Asshole” rule is applied

To apply: Apply for this job via this link https://veeqo.workable.com/jobs/405312

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
What gets us out of bed each morning is the opportunity to use technology to make customers’ lives even easier.  Vital to developing best in class customer journeys is our expanding team of Software Development Engineers in Test (SDETs)


Is this you?


Acting as a trusted advisor and consultant to the technical community and individual product teams will need to be second nature for you to get the best out of this role. You’ll evangelise and promote new technologies and techniques –sharing your experience and expertise across the product teams. You’ll have no ego but you’ll challenge accepted standards and the way we work, ask questions to improve performance and quality of teams.

jobs.title: We just hit 1M members! Social Network seeking Software Engineer to help us grow
jobs.content:
About You


You love to write code, collaborate with a great team, and use technology to solve real problems for a meaningful community.  You enjoy working in a startup with its pace, culture, and expectations where you can have a voice and are allowed more flexibility and autonomy.  Being on the bleeding-edge isn’t a requirement for you, but an awareness of the ever-changing landscape we work in is.  Most importantly, you take pride in your work and feel responsible for its success.


About the Team


We are a small team tackling big problems. We’re an open source shop using Rails and Ember to continuously deliver our app to desktop and mobile devices from AWS. We use MySQL, S3, and Redis for our data and ElasticSearch for searching. The team works together on front and back-end features, collaboration and communication are important. Every piece of code is peer-reviewed and automated tests are encouraged. We move fast with several deployments a day.


About the Product


We are creating an application that improves the lives of military members and veterans by allowing them to build out their professional network, connect with other members of the military and veterans in a safe environment, and explore career opportunities both within the military (PCS opportunities) and in the private sector.

jobs.title: Projects & Applications Manager
jobs.content:
With immediate effect our Information, Communication and Technology (ICT) department is looking for a


Projects & Applications Manager


(40 hrs p/w = 100%)



Based in Amsterdam


Reports to the Head of the ICT department



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Under the leadership of the Head of ICT, the Projects and Applications Manager designs and oversees the IT projects and solutions that enable the organization to efficiently run the operations. He/she provides overall leadership in the choice, the implementation and the evolution of applications and drives the implementation of continuous improvement to business processes. Applications may be of various types (cloud-based, on-premises, mobile…) and in all the areas covered by MSF (medical, operation management, finance, HR, donor management, digital and communication, supply chain, IT…).

Main activities
Strategy and leadership



  • Assist the Head of IT for defining the IT strategic orientations, the strategic plan and the yearly plan of action.

  • Define the global IS vision and define the strategic technology initiatives.

  • Provide leadership in planning and managing applications through their entire lifecycle

  • Provide in-depth technical expertise to the Head of IT for both tactical and strategic initiatives.

  • Provide leadership to project management and competence centers (ERP, software development, integration…). Ensure staff professional development.

  • Pro-actively propose solutions, innovations, changes and projects related to IT governance, organizational aspects and technical challenges. Demonstrate the value of proposals through formal business cases.

  • Propose budgets and control costs.



Portfolio and project management



  • Maintain the portfolio of programs, projects and activities.

  • Overall coordinate projects/resources to ensure that the projects are carried out in an efficient manner. Ensure that all project deliverables, budgets, and timelines are met within scope and quality. Regularly report on the portfolio/project status to the PMO and to the management.

  • Pro-actively participate in the elaboration of the project management approach/methodology and ensure all the quality standards are met.



Applications delivery, maintenance and support



  • Provide leadership in building strong partnership with the lines of business in supporting them designing, building, improving and using their business processes and the associated applicative solutions.

  • Together with the enterprise architecture / business analysis team, and in very close collaboration with the lines of business, design and implement the best fitted solution in terms of technology and value for the business.

  • Ensure the commissioning of solutions through an efficient planning and coordination with the Infrastructure and Operations teams (under the Service Delivery Manager responsibility) on technology, resources and timeline.

  • Together with the lines of business and the service delivery manager, overall coordinate the preparation, the negotiation, the formalization and the fulfillment of  OLA’s/SLA’s.

  • Oversee the design and implementation of the application support to the satisfaction of the end-users.

  • Provide expertise on applicative architecture, integration and software related topic.

  • Ensure that the systems and processes are properly documented with up-to-date information.

  • Perform regular technological watch on IT trends, solutions and organizational aspects.



Sourcing and vendor management



  • Establish and maintain strong, strategic partnerships with vendors and service suppliers.

  • Develop RFPs/RFIs, oversee product evaluations, coordinate product and service selections. Ensure that the purchasing process, pricing, terms and conditions for supplier contracts meet IT and MSF purchasing standards while achieving optimal results for the organization.

  • Negotiate and establish contracts with vendors with the support of the supply unit.



Sourcing and vendor management



  • Closely collaborate with the counterparts of the other Operational Centers and with the IS management platform (ISM) to define opportunities of convergence at movement level, for example through the alignment on technological standards, global projects, implementation of a global shared service center…

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:

YOU will …
