jobs.title: Node.JS Betologist
jobs.content:
What you tell your friends you do?


Drink quality coffee in a tech team for a bookmakers!


What you really will be doing:


Reporting to the Lead Software Engineer, you will:



  • Turn concepts and requirements into highly available web applications and systems using industry standard languages and technologies such as Node.JS, Mongo, MySQL, Kafka, RabbitMQ, Chef and Docker.

  • Implement highly modular and maintainable components across a horizontally scalable application framework designed to maximise reuse across multiple channels.

  • Actively participate in application design, database design, data-flows and detailed technical design.  Ensure that analysis includes the wider view of technical and business impact. 

  • Deliver software solutions to specification and on-schedule that are fit for purpose.

  • Work with Product Owners to propose, analyse and negotiate business requirements, and translate them into technical requirements.

  • Participate in the definition of scope of projects and estimates of timescales for development and maintenance work.

  • Analyse functional and non-functional requirements to determine impact on technical systems.

  • Balance the commercial needs of the business against the ideal technical design, proposing sound phased or tactical implementations where appropriate.

  • Produce accurate and unambiguous functional and technical documentation of products, systems and services prior to and during development.

  • Proactively suggest ways to improve the quality of software releases. Work with the squad to ensure that development follows an agreed delivery model.  Ensure that updates are accurate and reflect known risks/issues to enable progress to be properly reported.

  • Actively support the implementation of continuous integration to enhance deployment processes in line with SB&G delivery/release evolution plans


Why not have a look at the Bet tribe: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tlxNSLqiko0

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer (Java/ Backend) - New Game
jobs.content:
As a Senior Software Developer (Java/ Backend) you will be part of our agile, cross-functional and international development team. You will drive the development of new features on backend side as well as maintain and improve the current code of our new mobile Games. You will be responsible for creating a game that will be played by millions of players. Your technical and architectural expertise will be crucial to our game’s success.

Your mission:

  • Responsibility for the realization of the backend architecture for one of our new games in Java 8 and latest frameworks like spring 4.x
  • Designing and implementing high availability systems and service-oriented architectures and game features
  • Developing, realizing and optimizing database designs
  • Education and technical guidance for other developers on Java specific topics
  • Working in close collaboration with Client Developers, Game Design, QA and System Administration
  • Maintaining and extending our development tools and environment

Your Profile:

  • A university degree in computer science or an equivalent training and experience as IT specialist
  • Several years of experience in object-oriented programming in Java
  • Experience with C# is a plus
  • Successful realization of online game projects, ideally in an agile environment
  • Experience with building services for mobile (e.g. REST) and proficiency in either IntelliJ, Eclipse IDE or Netbeans
  • Solid experience in Unit Testing, Design Patterns, Domain-driven Design, Code Reviews
  • Proactive and motivated to learn and work well within team
  • Good English language and overall communication skills

Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Senior Software Developer (Java/ Backend) with us? Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Cagla Lacinoglu.

InnoGames, based in Hamburg, is one of the leading developers and publishers of online games with more than 150 million registered players around the world. Currently, more than 400 people from 30 nations are working in the Hamburg-based headquarters. We have been characterized by dynamic growth ever since the company was founded in 2007. In order to further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.

jobs.title: Senior IT Administrator
jobs.content:
As Senior IT Administrator you have great organizational skills and are an expert in multitasking, together with your team members, on several levels. In our international environment, you will be the contact person for our employees in all office IT-related requests.


Your mission:



  • You are technically responsible for our whole Office IT system which is separated from our gaming infrastructure.

  • You are designing our future system architecture implementing new technologies.

  • Advise project teams with technical guidance in the initiation and planning phases which includes the definition of needs, benefits, and technical strategy; research & development within the project life-cycle, technical analysis and design

  • Closely collaborate with your team lead to define processes and support the whole team with your in depth technical knowledge.

  • Part of your job is the operation and administration of infrastructure and authorization services in the Windows environment (Hyper V, Microsoft Active Directory, Microsoft Office 365,…)

  • Taking care of VPN, WIFI, LAN

jobs.title: Linux System Administrator
jobs.content:
As Linux System Administrator you are the main contact for a game development team in all aspects of the daily operations and system environment improvements. You are responsible to keep a few hundred game servers in check and to automate your daily tasks.



Your mission:



  • Setup and operation of game projects and internal tools

  • Connecting your services to the supporting infrastructure (backup, monitoring, configuration and packet management)

  • Refining the server setup

  • Debugging the live systems

  • Advising the developers in regard to the server setup

  • Taking part in the stand-by duty every four weeks

jobs.title: Senior Hadoop DBA
jobs.content:
Working under minimal supervision, the Enterprise DBA 6 is responsible for providing operational database services to the organization. Primary responsibilities of this role would include owning, tracking and resolving database-related incidents and service requests, fulfilling Service Level Agreements(SLAs), reviewing service related reports (e.g: database backups, maintenance, monitoring) on a daily basis to ensure service-related issues are identified and resolved within established SLAs, responding to database-related alerts and escalations and working with application development to come up with strategic solutions to recurring problems.



This position requires a service-oriented mentality, a high sense of ownership of the problems and requests assigned, a focus on managing and resolving issues in alignment with the SLAs, establishing and maintaining communication with technology customers to keep them updated with status of their requests, initiating and performing changes on production systems and proactively escalating any issues that cannot be resolved within the established timeframes.



Major Responsibilities/Essential Functions:



  • Install and configure multiple RDBMS’s and components

  • Install and deploy databases

  • Create backup and disaster recover plans

  • Test disaster recovery scenarios

  • Manage security

  • Predictive Analytics for resource management 

  • Works on projects with developmentand engineering teams

  • Performance tuning

  • Provide on-call support

  • Perform patching and upgrades to all database platforms

jobs.title: Infrastructure Engineer/ Dev Ops
jobs.content:
POSITION SUMMARY



The Sr. Infrastructure/DevOps Engineer at Inmar is tasked with ensuring the delivery of technical services for new and existing clients.  The candidate will be a part of a team supporting the hosted environment for our client applications and provide preventative support, integration and infrastructure automation initiatives.  This role will require strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, experience in integrating multiple technology platforms and brands of products, solid communication skills and tackle the complex problems of automation and scale which are unique to our company.



This position requires a service-oriented mentality, a high sense of ownership of the problems and requests assigned, a focus on managing and resolving issues in alignment with the SLAs, establishing and maintaining communication with technology customers to keep them updated with status of their requests, initiating and performing changes on production systems and proactively escalating any issues that cannot be resolved within the established timeframes



Major Responsibilities/Essential Functions:




  • Management, maintenance and architecture of virtualized and non-virtualized infrastructure, not limited to servers, storage and productivity tools.

  • Proactively manage systems and identify performance issues.

  • Strong Expertise in developing , supporting and maintaining "infrastructure-as-a-service" and eventually infrastructure-as-code

  • String experience in collaborating with multiple teams such as Network Engineering, Security, Database Services, Devops and Application Development in their infrastructure and automation needs and arrive at solutions.

  • Active role in planning future infrastructure architecture and automation features

  • Documentation and communicating all infrastructure changes

  • Participation in 24X7 on call rotation as required.





Preferred Skills:



  • Strong expertise with automation platforms such as Jenkins, Ansible or Chef including development of automated pipelines, playbooks/cookbooks/recipes

  • Strong Experience with open source technologies

  • Experience with distributive computing systems

jobs.title: Database Administrator 6
jobs.content:
Position Summary:


Working under minimal supervision, the Enterprise DBA 6 is responsible for providing operational database services to the organization. Primary responsibilities of this role would include owning, tracking and resolving database-related incidents and service requests, fulfilling Service Level Agreements(SLAs), reviewing service related reports (e.g: database backups, maintenance, monitoring) on a daily basis to ensure service-related issues are identified and resolved within established SLAs, responding to database-related alerts and escalations and working with application development to come up with strategic solutions to recurring problems.



This position requires a service-oriented mentality, a high sense of ownership of the problems and requests assigned, a focus on managing and resolving issues in alignment with the SLAs, establishing and maintaining communication with technology customers to keep them updated with status of their requests, initiating and performing changes on production systems and proactively escalating any issues that cannot be resolved within the established timeframes.



Major Responsibilities/Essential Functions:



  • Install and configure multiple RDBMS’s and components

  • Install and deploy databases

  • Create backup and disaster recover plans

  • Test disaster recovery scenarios

  • Manage security

  • Predictive Analytics for resource management 

  • Works on projects with developmentand engineering teams

  • Performance tuning

  • Provide on-call support

  • Perform patching and upgrades to all database platforms

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ABOUT YOU


You’ve built sophisticated SPAs using one or more mainstream frameworks like Angular, Knockout, Backbone, Meteor, React, etc.; and you’re chomping at the bit to try another. You’ve built backends in one or more mainstream frameworks using Java, .NET, nodejs, etc. You think in REST and always notice when your CSS is off by a pixel. Modeling the databases and building the engines behind UIs gets your gears turning just as much as animating a button. You know the difference between call() and apply(), but you also know it usually doesn’t matter. Apps that react as fast as you can click have you opening up the source code. Working with more junior developers gets you excited for the coaching opportunities, and more senior developers for the learning. Groking the business requirements is second-nature. You own what you wrote and jump in to help your team support the product when there’s a fire, and when the smoke clears you’re one of the first to say “ok, how can we make sure that doesn’t happen again?”. You’re passionate and opinionated about great user experience; and most importantly, you love building real, working apps that surprise and delight your customers. 



WHAT YOU’D BE DOING


Under general supervision of the Engineering Manager, the Promotions B2B Engineer is a full-stack engineer with a bent for hard front-end problems, performing assignments in one or more of the following areas: providing technical guidance and direction to other staff members; participating in project planning and requirements definition; system/application design, system/application development, unit testing, support during QA and User Acceptance Testing, implementation and integration; customer support for and technical expertise in end-user decision support software tools and end-user computing technology; conducting all activities in accordance with standards and procedures. 




MAJOR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design, develop, test, deploy, and support new software solutions and changes to existing software solutions

  • Troubleshoot technical issues in a variety of application environments

  • Mentor team members and provide thoughtful discussion on tactics and strategies as they are selected

  • Translate business requirements and product specifications into components of complex, loosely-coupled, distributed systems

  • Maintain a focus on rapid delivery of new features to market while maintaining stability and uptime

  • Maintain familiarity with the evolving trends in software development

jobs.title: CTO
jobs.content:
We are looking for a highly proficient, independent, reliable and motivated Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to lead the IT infrastructure development and administrative processes at Tabletennis11.com.

Our headquarters and warehouse are located in Estonia - one of the most advanced digital societies in the world. Management and Marketing teams are working remotely from different locations in Europe. We also have a brick-and-mortar store in Paris downtown. You can work remotely anywhere in Europe or in our office in Narva, Estonia.

This is a leadership role and you will work closely with the Board members, CEO and CMO. As such, this is a huge opportunity to make your mark.

**Responsibilities**

* Help the company on the technical front. Be a strong leader of our IT processes.
* Continuously evolve the companyâs strategic technical direction.
* See the big picture of our IT infrastructure. Identify opportunities and risks for the business.
* Take over technical responsibility for code quality, system security and the entire development / technical administration being done on Tabletennis11âs IT infrastructure. Ensure its stability, speed and scalability.
* Manage external IT service providers or build up and lead internal IT team.

**Main Tasks**

* Make sure that all important technical things function smoothly.
* Suggest new technical improvements.
* Advise and inform the rest of the team about tech-related decisions and strategies.
* Set tasks for developers and control their progress.
* Hire new developers or development firms if needed.
* Maintain documentation of all key functions and modules with the developers.
* Provide trainings / presentations of new features to our team.
* Prepare the annual IT budget, control it and provide monthly reports.

jobs.title: Senior Design Research
jobs.content:
Do you love applying generative design research methodologies for the front-end of design development? Do you believe that everyone is inherently creative and that by bringing together stakeholders, users, and businesses we can discover and solve for unmet user needs? Do you like working with multidisciplinary teams to tackle big challenges (i.e. healthcare, financial services, retail, etc.)?

If so...

Stratos Innovation Group is looking for a mid-level Design Research Lead to join our team! The ideal candidate will have 2-4 years of professional experience in design research for services OR have a Master’s Degree in Design Research, or a similar field, with hands-on experience to share.

You may be a good fit for this position if...

1.) You’re a pro at:
-Creating and implementing custom-made research methods
-Facilitating one-on-one interviews and small group sessions
-Analyzing and synthesizing qualitative data
-Visually translating research insights for effective communication
-Connecting basic business challenges to design strategy outcomes

2.) You have experience with:

-Leading design research projects and executing the research plan with the given resources of time, people, and materials
-Interacting with clients
-Managing and collaborating with junior design researchers on project work
-Creating low-fidelity prototyping activities when a project requires giving shape to concepts

3.)You are:

-self-motivated
-a holistic thinker
-flexible, yet organized
-a good communicator
-a person with deep empathy for the end-user but also a passion to help organizations transform so they can better serve their customers and employees
-one who has high standards for qualitative research
-comfortable with ambiguity

Stratos Culture:
Adventurous, Quirky, Diverse, Authentic, Empathetic, Transparent, Involved

Stratos Core Values:
Impact, Integrity, Creativity and Service

Job Type: Full-time

We are looking for people who like to collaborate and want to be involved in shaping all aspects of the product as they grow as an iOS Developer.

jobs.content:
What you will do:



  • Gather and process raw data at scale (including writing scripts, web scraping, calling APIs, write SQL queries, etc.)

  • Retrieve, analyse and present critical data and help management to translate it into business strategy

  • Process unstructured data into a form suitable for analysis – and then do the analysis



  • Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis

  • Design and build healthy, scalable architectures for real time and batch data processing


What you will learn:

jobs.title: Customer Support Specialist
jobs.content:
We are a small team with a big business! Our customers come first, and our Customer Support team is at the forefront.

Are you passionate about people? Do you want to join a fast-growing business? 
Then we are looking for you!

Our Customer Support Specialists are spread across Finland, USA, Canada, UK, Spain and Thailand to provide exceptional service to our amazing customers!

Our highly-skilled team have the freedom to serve our customers the best way they know how (who wants to read from a script?). As a member of this team, you would be responsible for answering customer inquiries through email, chat and phone.

Successful applicants will begin with a two-week training period, following which the opportunity to work remotely is available. This is a 5 day per week position with shifts that may be from Mon-Sun and may include evening work.

We are looking for highly motivated people, who are capable of independent work and can meet set expectations within deadlines.

Your responsibilities include:
  • Answering customer inquiries via email, phone & chat

We're looking to fill this role immediately, so please apply ASAP!

jobs.title: Senior Product Engineer
jobs.content:
The First Years, (A division of TOMY International) is looking for an engineer who fits our company culture. Your mission is to work with the consumer team to create products that help families on their perfectly imperfect parenting journey. You should have the ability to develop a broad range of products, and work with concept phase to production ready. This person will refine designs for manufacturing that deliver on marketing strategies, safety requirements, cost limitations and schedules, while remaining true to the essence of the brand.

The First Years is a leading manufacturer of infant and toddler products. Our thing is problem solving and ingenuity. Simple, effective design is our passion. We are driven to create products that enhance children’s lives and help make the parenting experience easier and better. The ideal candidate is either an engineer with sensitivity and understanding of Industrial Design or an Industrial Designer who is very engineering focused.

MISSION
• Create, or drive the creation of files to communicate product details to manufacturing as tooling-ready CAD
• Multi task and multi manage projects in a team environment
• Collaborate with designers, marketing and project managers to deliver on team expectations
• Communicate on a regular basis with our international colleagues and manufacturing partners
• Think outside the box to find solutions that make better products that support business goals.
• Manage your process around time and cost restraints
• Design within intellectual property requirements and safety regulations

SKILLS
• BS in Mechanical Engineering
• 5-8 years of consumer product engineering experience
• Expert in SolidWorks – both solids and surface modeling – especially for injection molded plastics. Able to build complex parts, assemblies, and forms
• Extensive knowledge of materials, especially plastics and plastics manufacturing.
• Broad mechanical ability – can create mechanisms, linkages, and assemblies
• Ability to design and engineer while maintaining design intent and brand aesthetic within a given set of features and cost parameters
• Industrial Design, electronics, and/or soft goods experience is a plus

We offer a competitive salary and excellent benefit package in a fun and supportive environment. If interested and qualified, please send a resume, cover letter, with salary requirement, and portfolio to hr@tomy.com.

DISCLAIMER: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications of employees assigned to this classification.

jobs.title: Flight AI Developer
jobs.content:
A renewable energy development project harnessing wind power using kites: You will work on the high level automation software for a large scale wind power generator that uses kites to capture energy at high altitudes.


The main focus will be extending and enhancing our existing control software which provides the “autopilot” functions for our kites. This will involve working on our bespoke simulation environment to test and develop control systems offline, and interacting with the hardware team to have the system running on a real, 500kW capacity generator system.


You will join our software development team primarily working in Glasgow, but will need to be willing to travel to the test site in south-west Scotland to assist with deploying your code into the real testing environment on occasion.


The primary job responsibilities are



  • Developing and improving control algorithms that automate the system.

  • Evaluating feedback from real world tests of your code.


Secondary tasks you may be involved with (or may want to branch out to in future!)



  • Assisting the hardware and aerodynamics development teams by providing and analysing simulation data.

  • Scientific analysis of the energy production capabilities of the system.

  • Interacting with the test team to get software changes working in the field on prototype hardware, and debugging issues that may arise.

jobs.title: DevOps System Engineer
jobs.content:
A typical System Engineer workweek at Nmbrs


Monday morning you check in with your colleagues here in Amsterdam and via Slack with your colleagues in Lisbon. You tell all about your weekend and hear about theirs.

The next thing you do in the morning is to check the monitors and logs ( NewRelic ) and act on it. Then you check if the application is on optimal performance and you walk past the contact center and see if there are any outstanding requests. If everything is ok then you will go to the Jira board, prioritize your work based on business value and pick up your next task which could be one of the following:



  • Support for developers/testers;

  • 3rd line support for customers;

  • Automate processes (deployments, set-ups, configurations etc.) to create a consistent environment;

  • Troubleshoot issues across the entire stack - hardware, software, application and network;

  • On Thursdays you take care of weekly deployments (after the release you monitor if all lights stay green and take ownership over potential live issues);

  • Be in contact with the data centers;

  • Or you can be meeting up with some of the other colleagues to spar on designing a solution for our fast growing environment;



Twice a week you will attend your squad meets: the planning and the retrospectives. On your request and depending on the seniority of the team, this meetings can/will be attended by your agile coach to implement the agile workstyle even better and also to help you and your team grow and get better.

When you start with us you will probably have one or two catch-ups a week with your mentor, who helps you to become a senior Nmbrs employee. If you work at Nmbrs for a longer period, you will probably be a mentor yourself.

You can join one of the many initiatives to do a sport (bouldering, crossfit, pub-quiz) or fun and games, but that is only if you want. Each day we have lunch together in the office. On Friday we have a drink together to end the week.
 


Your multifunctional squad will have the following expertise



As a System Engineer you will be part of a multi-disciplinary self steering team which takes full ownership of their part of the product. You will collaborate with the team to improve the product, prioritize your product backlog and improve the teamwork. Some expertises your squad has:



  • Quality expertise

  • Customer focused expertise

  • Product Expertise

  • Technical expertise



Your specialist multidisciplinary squad consist from the following people
 


One DevOps Engineer, one QA in Amsterdam and two developers located in Lisbon.



What we offer  



  • International, young and bold company. We want to bring payrolling to another level.

  • Ambitious environment, constantly challenging ourselves.

  • Lots of ways to develop yourself and get lost in the newest techniques, work styles and software engineering best practices.

  • An agile working environment.

  • Working in Lisbon is possible on occasion. We have an apartment there, which you can use, when empty.

  • We have a boat which we use to cruise the canals together. In weekends or on days the boat is not reserved, you can take it with your friends.

  • Helpful, smart and fun colleagues.

jobs.title: Senior Designer
jobs.content:
Working at ESPN is unlike anything else. That’s because we’re always finding new ways to interact with fans – however and wherever they connect with sports. When you have the latest technology, game-changing ideas and world-class talent on your team, every day is extraordinary.

ESPN Technology is responsible for software development for consumer products, internal tools for broadcast distribution and media manipulation, building world class studios, transmission and distribution of content and all the cool visuals for live events like the 1st & 10 Line and PylonCam. In total, we have over 1,400 technologists working in 6 development centers around the world.

That said, we have a ton of work to do across our group. We would love to speak with you to see if there is a fit . Plus, share more about what could be a really cool opportunity working in a group that is the future of media and technology.

This is an opportunity to make a real impact on ESPN’s business and products through design and implementation of solutions which change how ESPN creates sports content, and through technology transfer!

The applicant will visually contribute to innovative industry-changing products for both broadcast and digital media, with the focus to deliver high quality leading-edge innovations, from concept to reality. We seek self-motivated, high-performing individuals with a passion for both the business and the technology.

The Office of the CTO reports directly to ESPN’s Chief Technology Officer. This group is responsible for a variety of critical functions in support of the CTO’s work and agenda. The group is a resource for the Chief Technology Officer and his executive team.

Responsibilities

  • The ideal candidate will lead and participate in designing and implementing interfaces and visualizations for internal and external applications on mobile and desktop platforms.
  • Contribute to definition and implementation of solutions, in support of ESPN Technology’s roadmap.
  • Develop and prototype solutions and proof of concepts, to demonstrate viability of innovations.
  • Partner with development leads on design of next generation of digital technologies created by ESPN.
  • Oversee consistency in UX, UI and visual design across all platforms and products, and develops and maintains design style and process guidelines across all implementations.
  • Executes design, with an advanced level of proficiency and artistry, including layouts, graphics, photos, icons, color schemes, interface features and transitions.
  • Lead the development of interface design concepts and determination of formats prior to execution and implementation
  • Provides feedback for concepts and designs
  • Has considerable influence on the look and feel of product design elements by means of design innovations
  • Build and maintain collaborative relationships with all development functions to ensure a best-in-breed production process and environment.
  • Ability to collaborate and interact across functional boundaries, to facilitate design and development of innovative solutions.
  • Interacts with development leads, executives and colleagues across ESPN’s Technology group regarding assigned design projects
Basic Qualifications
  • A minimum of 8 years of strong design experience
  • Ability to rapidly iterate through conceptual ideas or designs, and effectively communicate these using low to medium fidelity prototypes, such as sketches, prototypes, wireframes, storyboards and interactive click-through prototypes.
  • Understanding of how to create adaptive interfaces that work for multiple device form-factors. User interface development experience (ideally for both desktop and mobile devices).
  • Expertise in HTML5 and CSS3
  • Ability to lead change and evolve workflows to adapt to industry changes
  • Familiarity with common design, development and debugging tools, ideally for both mobile and desktop applications.
  • Strong analysis and problem solving skills, and the ability to design and develop projects aligned with ESPN’s Technology roadmap.
Required Education
  • High School diploma or equivalent
Preferred Education
  • B.S./M.S. in Computer Science, Design, Visualization, or a related discipline with strong design and development skills
Company Overview
At Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.


Additional Information
ESPN is an equal opportunity employer – Female/Minority/Veteran/Disability. Our goal is to create an inclusive workplace for all.

jobs.title: Full Stack .NET Developer - Join our new team based in Central London
jobs.content:
Why Raising IT?


Raising IT is transforming the way charities market themselves to increase their income and impact. We’re the largest provider of charity web tools, working with over 250 amazing clients such as Street League, Lepra and The Woodlands Trust.


We’re a rare breed of company that combines making a massive difference to important causes with being an exciting fast-growth tech company. We’ve grown 5X since closing our last investment round 18 months ago. We’re looking for people to join our caring and passionate team to come on our journey of building a world-changing, world-class company.



Your Role


We’ve recently relocated our tech team to our Shoreditch offices in London opposite Boxpark. We’re building out our .NET team here to accelerate features for our charity marketing platform and developing our platform which includes a CMS, fundraising, events and social media tools. You will have plenty of opportunities to improve and influence the direction of the product.


We have a DevOps culture (you support what you release) and thanks to the power of Azure we are moving towards CI. You will be helping us reach CD nirvana through automation, scripts and innovating on our deployment process. You will be working as part of an experienced close-knit team, iterating quickly on products that make a difference.


This is a key position in a talented new tech team to incubate and develop the team’s working practices.

jobs.title: Head of DevOps
jobs.content:
The Team


The platforms and production engineering team owns the systems infrastructure. We build and deliver platforms that support our production applications and internal services. With diverse backgrounds and philosophy of work, we are a closely knit team where we share the same enthusiasm for problem solving, passion for systems and networks, aptitude to research and implement open source solutions. We strive to ensure the best experience for our customers by adopting best practices of site reliability engineering. We embrace DevOps philosophies to ensure that our application delivery is faster and agile. The goal of the team is to constantly provide a renewed experience to our customers.


The Role


We are looking for a Manager to own and head systems infrastructure and platform engineering at Directi and review and influence new evolving design, architecture, standards and methods with operability in mind. S/He understands operational principles, such as capacity planning, monitoring and incident handling


In this role you will lead a team of System Administrators/Developers and manage our globally distributed infrastructure stack and platforms.


Responsibilities



  • Architect systems, infrastructure and platforms using Linux and Amazon Web Services to support applications in the communications space

  • Capacity planning and stress testing

  • Automate and implement permanent solutions to prevent outages / downtimes

  • Architect deployments for high availability, scalability and reliability

  • Design and implement continuous integration and continuous delivery platforms

  • Design and implement platforms for monitoring, log processing, metrics collection and data visualization

  • Script and code tools for automation and efficient management of infrastructure and platforms

  • System and infrastructure configuration management

  • Infrastructure and platform security

  • Project management using agile methodologies like Scrum or Kanban

  • Infrastructure and platform cost management

  • Lead and mentor a team of Operations Engineers

  • Liaise with geographically distributed application development teams to drive operational best practices

  • Liaise with external vendors like Amazon and work with Telecom providers

jobs.title: iOS Developer - Gurgaon
jobs.content:
You will be involved in all aspects of development playing a critical role in a design, planning, development and submission of Flock iOS app. You will help develop best practices for future development. You will be working closely with Tech, Design and Quality team to build and launch the product.



  • Developing, releasing and maintaining native iOS Applications

  • Deliver across the entire app life cycle, design, build, deploy, test, release to app stores and support

  • Working directly with developers and product managers to conceptualise, build, test and realise products/features.

  • Work on bug fixing and improving application performance.

  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximise development efficiency

  • Optimising performance for the app and keep it up to date with latest industry standards.

jobs.title: Android Developer - Gurgaon
jobs.content:
• Design, implement and launch highly-visible , user-facing features.

  • Develop new ways for Flock users to use third party apps

  • Design and develop SDK's in over 25 languages which will be used by 3rd party developers

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Engineers - building and shipping features from the ground up
jobs.content:
Bugatti Veyron, Concorde, Apollo, high velocity bullet, light - and you! Your whole life, you’ve learned fast and adapted to new challenges in double quick time. Now’s your chance to step on the gas and move your career forward at warp speed.


The internet is growing at a phenomenal pace and mobile app development is advancing even faster. So we’re looking for mobile engineers who are one jump ahead of that rapidly accelerating curve.

Like you, Skyscanner is also on a high-speed growth journey. Over 30 million people a month trust us to turn their travel nightmares into sweet dreams. Increasingly, they’re doing this on mobile devices, resulting in 35 million app downloads to date, and counting - which is where you come in. We’re currently expanding our app development capability and we’re looking for world-class mobile developers with mentoring or management experience to work within a small team of innovative engineers, in an ultra fast paced environment. We can offer you the flexibility and fast pace of a startup combined with the opportunity to develop products that are used by multiple millions of people every day. Products people actually want and find useful, built by a company that still has massive potential ahead of it.


To be clear, we aren’t just developing an app; we are building and shipping features from the ground up. Product teams working on mobile apps also do data analysis, design systems, and release services – which all builds up into a mobile experience. If you're flexible, eager to learn and can’t move forward fast enough - apply now.


You can offer us:


A hunger to learn, and learn fast. A desire to meet challenges. A passion for developing apps that work in a global and scalable environment. A commitment to applying engineering best practice to produce top quality solutions.


We can offer you:


An excellent career move. The chance to work with great developers, in fact, great people across the board. The space to be trusted to do what you do best. And to make decisions that matter. The potential to tackle big stuff, not small stuff.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineers - Polyglot problem solvers
jobs.content:
Are you a Polyglot Technologist? Software Engineers in Skyscanner solve problems - we don’t just write code. The problems you help to solve will improve the product we're able to offer our users (Currently 60 million+ travellers per month!)


Skyscanner is the world’s travel search engine with ambitions to be everybody’s personal travel assistant. As a full stack engineer, we want to employ your problem solving capabilities. Solving complex scalability challenges, proposing new design and systems solutions and all the while, instigating and promoting best engineering practices. To be really useful to us, you should have across the board experience – a bit of database, a bit of back end as well as some UX familiarity into the bargain – after all, if you don’t know what can go wrong, you won’t know how to fix it. We’re looking for exceptional engineers who can make difficult decisions and take ownership of a problem from end to end.


If you hate doing what you’ve always done but love finding new and better solutions, make our technical challenges part of your new engineering problems – apply today!


You can offer us:


A hunger to lead in a continuous learning culture, a desire to solve complex technical challenges, a passion for technology and tech leadership and ultimately a commitment to applying engineering best practices in order to produce top quality solutions.


We can offer you:


An excellent career move.


The chance to work with other great developers + other smart people across the rest of our business.


Autonomy, you are trusted to do what you do best and to make decisions that matter.


The potential to tackle big stuff, not small stuff.


Our tech stack includes (but is far from limited to): Python, Java, .Net, JavaScript, CoffeeScript, Couchbase, RabbitMQ, SQL, SQL Server, Elastic Search, Graphite, AWS

jobs.title: Software Development Leads - hands on impact & leading teams to excellence
jobs.content:
Internet Economy tech leaders, web development enthusiasts and product passionate engineers. If you enjoy a hybrid role of remaining technically hands on, making an impact and seeing quick results, while motivating and developing people, we’d love to hear from you!


“In this internet based economy every Software Engineer is a polyglot by necessity. We’re required to switch technologies efficiently, relying on our fundamental engineering skill-set to progress. That’s not to say we should all be generalists, specialists are also needed, but the core and fundamental skills of a specialist can be applied in many technologies.”


– Skyscanner Senior Architect & Tribe Lead


As a Technical Manager at Skyscanner, you’ll be technically leading while managing and developing your team of engineers as you join them in building world class products for our users. We’re looking for software and product enthusiasts who have proven expertise in leading, managing and developing engineers towards reaching both their personal career goals as well as the ever scaling objectives of Skyscanner.


We are the word’s travel search engine and we’re doing great new things as we engineer at scale. Our Technical Managers are responsible for leading their teams in the design and development of systems that keep our travel search solutions ahead of the pack. As well as engineers, you will work closely with architects, product and project managers, providing technical leadership to define the roadmap and deliver new features to the market. On top of all of that, you’ll have a hands on role in the planning, execution and successful delivery of state of the art solutions. You’ll mentor our technical staff and be actively involved in recruiting our future engineering talent.


You can offer us:


A background in software development, proven technical leadership, a track record of inspiring your teammates with your passion and vision, a self-motivated working style, a flexible approach and communication skills in spades.


Other than a fairly short hiring process... we can offer you:


An excellent career move, the chance to work with and lead a team of ultra smart developers and a great working culture of collaboration and technical excellence. The freedom and autonomy of your own technical choices and what’s more you’ll have the space to be trusted to do what you do best and the opportunity to make a real difference.

jobs.title: Senior Distributed Systems Engineers - Freedom, Impact, Scale
jobs.content:
Can you deliver World Class Engineering at Scale?


At Skyscanner we are committed to rapidly delivering continual improvement in the products we provide to over 60 million travellers monthly. World Class Execution at Scale is only made possible by our Engineers who quickly build and release new features and services; running experiments – gathering and reviewing data to identify, prioritize and action opportunities which can positively impact on travellers, our partners and our business.


What might I work on?



Distributed Systems Engineers at Skyscanner face a varied range of exciting challenges across areas including Machine Learning, Data Engineering, Cloud Services, Developer Enablement, Scalability, Optimization, Real Time Accuracy, building world class API’s, Automation (of anything which improves productivity and quality), and much more !

Our aim is to align you with the activities which truly interest you; will stretch you technically; help you grow and impact on millions of travellers globally.


Our Engineers Blog CodeVoyagers features examples of the projects we are working on including….


Building a Facebook Messenger Bot in 42 days
Journey to the centre of Memcached


We can offer you:


Ownership – the freedom and space to be trusted to do what you do best and to make decisions that matter


Master, Teach, Learn - The opportunity to work with, learn from and share knowledge with ultra-smart colleagues in a culture of collaboration and technical excellence


Impact - Huge potential to make a positive contribution across our business, people, partners and millions of users


Variety - A real opportunity to explore & experiment


Work – Life Balance – Flexible Working (including Home Country Working), no clocking in


An Excellent Career move – complexity, challenge and real opportunity for personal growth


Locations - London, Barcelona, Edinburgh, Glasgow, Budapest, Sofia

jobs.title: Fullstack Developer Call Center Interface
jobs.content:
:: ABOUT THE TEAM AND THE JOB


Our CCI team is responsible for the development and steadily optimization of our call center interface (CCI). They are service orientated, communicative and near to the customer. The team communicates with our external call center agents to analyse different customer operations hence they create a faster and more customer-friendly process of our customer service. You want to combine your ideas and knowledge with the feedback of our call center agents to develop a more and more customer-orientated platform? You have fun in explorative development of features? Then you are the perfect support for our CCI team who is searching for a Fullstack Developer Call Center Interface (m/f) at the moment.



:: ABOUT WHAT TO EXPECT



  • Conception, planning and development of new features in object-orientated PHP/Javascript

  • Development of UI Design and continuously improvement of the user experience

  • Lots of space for your own ideas and creations, especially at the implementation of new features

  • A highly motivated and experienced team

  • High technological networking with our different internal development teams

  • Flat hierarchies and very short decision making process

  • Actively internal knowledge sharing

jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Engineer - Berlin & Helsinki
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will be building the technologies that are utilized as a base for further products and aim to connect all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility - a software development methodology that allows engineers to get work done while management keeps their distance. Along with our guiding set of principles - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.


Your individual impact at Zalando is limitless. It is not only about growth and improvement, it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue.Along with you, we strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


You Are Setting Standards


Variety. As part of your onboarding, you will get to know some and join one of our teams that matches your interests and skills. As a team, you will build, scale and continuously improve a variety of web applications that redefine the user experience of our customers and partners.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code. You will decide together on the technologies and tools to utilize as well operate large-scale web applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Purpose. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset and drive the whole development cycle according to its purpose - from implementation to testing and maintenance.


Mastery. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the scalability, performance and user-centricity of our software. You will add value through innovation by leveraging current trends in software design, frameworks and RESTful web services.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend - Berlin
jobs.content:
YOU ARE READY TO MAKE AN IMPACT


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


YOU ARE SETTING STANDARDS


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Search & Browse
jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY

As a software engineer in the area of "Search & Browse" you will focus on developing Zalando's in-house search engine service providing highly relevant personalized search results helping millions of people find their favorite fashion items. You will be working with state-of-the-art technology to build a SAAS component which can be fully leveraged within our Zalando platform.
Your main challenges will include working with large amounts of data, deliver high-quality search results and also provide a high-performance, stable and auto-scaling production system. You will be part of a small, autonomous, and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced Scala developers and expert data scientists pushing "Fashion Search" one step further every day.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



  • You have 3+ years of experience, working as a Scala Developer (or any other functional programming language). A technical degree is a plus.

  • You are experienced with lucene-based technologies like Solr/ElasticSearch

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with data scientists & data analysts

  • A keen interest in applied machine learning, natural language processing and data mining is essential, work experience in these topics a plus

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to Enterprise level

  • You love to optimize processes & code and to use new technologies

  • You are experienced in building, evaluating, maintaining and improving large scale data-driven products

  • You have worked with current big data technology (e.g. Hadoop/MapReduce, Amazon EMR)

  • Knowing near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus

  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms like Amazon AWS is a plus




YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our search pipeline in short release cycles

  • You will implement highly scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You are ready to tweak and optimize our search for various markets all across Europe with more than a dozen different languages

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our search engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds

  • Design, develop, deploy, operate & improve software solutions that impact millions of Zalando customers




WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Our recipe to success: Think big and act fast. Your contribution today will influence millions of customers tomorrow. At Zalando you have the opportunity to work for a fast growing international company that wants to offer the world's best fashion experience. Obviously we offer you much more:



  • An exceptional opportunity to develop your skill set while learning from a team of top experts who will inspire and support you

  • Use of cutting-edge open source technologies and cloud services

  • Learning and growth opportunities: weekly tech talks, company-hosted tech meetups, rich team library (which you can expand with your book requests), possibility of visiting conferences

  • Complimentary fruit, beverages, table soccer, ping pong and band room

  • Employee discount for all Zalando shop products

  • Powerful hardware system environment

  • Through our mentoring program you will get up to speed and become productive very quickly

  • You will never be bored! Zalando offers a very exciting and fun working environment




ABOUT ZALANDO

Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast - with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams - and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.

WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!

If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Alicja Notowska at

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer Backend
jobs.content:
The opportunity



As a Zalando Back-end Software Engineer, you will build, scale and continuously improve the software of one of the world's largest e-commerce platforms. Whether junior- or senior-level, you will use cutting-edge technologies to create high-performance applications that scale. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others' projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand-while receiving meaningful support at every step.

What we are looking for



  • Deep knowledge of Scala or Java

  • Experience with relational (e.g. PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, Redis) databases

  • Expertise in functional programming

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Experience with building and/or running large-scale applications on a PaaS/SaaS cloud, preferably AWS

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • English language fluency




Your responsibilities



  • Help design and build our distributed microservices landscape and evangelize best practices

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Use agile methodologies

  • Think big-picture: Constantly evaluate our work and processes and challenge us




What you can expect from us



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical "People Leads" who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals




About Zalando



Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast - with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams - and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!



If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Rebecca Kurzbuch at rebecca.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Due to growth of our business, we seek a developer / IT professional graduate full time, which may be part of a team of 2 developers, which is based in Aarhus, Aarhus.



  • [40 %] Full-stack web-development

  • [20 %] Industrial automation 

  • [10 %] Continuous integration 

  • [30 %] Dev-ops


As a person you are serious, professional, reliable and well-considered. You are used to working at high speed and with a focus on quality and scalability. We appreciate an inquiring mind and expect you find better an effective solutions on your own. You will have great opportunities to influence how we build our solutions.


We offer an attractive salary / compensation package based on the skills and productivity of the candidate. If candidate is based in Denmark we provide smartphone including subscription.

jobs.title: Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
Primary function of position:
The Mid Level Industrial Designer will help drive and craft new product platforms, helping to shape the future of medical and consumer devices through the lens of a world-class experience. You will be working with teams of designers, engineers and scientists on product concepts that push the envelope and illustrate possibilities. You will employ your comprehensive understanding of design for manufacture, form, aesthetics, and creative functionalism to turn these concepts into beautiful, manufacturable devices that users love.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Work with engineering, manufacturing, management, electrical and software people while working in a team of designers and engineers to create solutions for a variety of medical and consumer type product clients. This will include:
-Employing design processes to help frame and define opportunities
-Actively participating in early stage design research and creating reports
-Using sketching and other rapid concept communication methods to illustrate multiple concept options to clients
-Building designed concepts in 3D CAD and creating photorealistic renderings
-Creating manufacturing CAD data in Solidworks for prototyping and manufacturing purposes
-Collaborate with systems engineers to develop and refine high quality, cost effective component integration and manufacturing methods
-Collaborate with all internal and external team members to successfully complete the deliverables for each project in the prescribed timeframe

Qualifications:
-Biased towards action with high attention to detail
-Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Design or related field of study
-Minimum of 4 years of post-degree experience in industrial design
-Passion for designing appealing, revolutionary products that make an impact on people’s lives
-Excited by working on difficult problems with a dedicated team of high energy, high caliber people, as well as working autonomously and multi-tasking in a fast paced environment
-Fluent with Solidworks, Adobe Creative Suite, and rendering software
-Ability to demonstrate a remarkably high level of aesthetic sense, supported by an equally high level of rapid visualization abilities
-Demonstrate a complete understanding of ergonomics, human factors, and user-centered design
-Ability to create high level prototypes, and manage prototype vendors and processes
-High level of understanding of materials, manufacturing processes, and highly regulated development requirements, such as medical device quality systems
-Medical device, electro-mechanical and

jobs.title: Software Solution Developer (m/w)
jobs.content:
Die censhare Digital Experience Platform vereint alle Marketing- und Kommunikations-Inhalte in einem System mit einheitlicher Oberfläche. Die nahtlos integrierten Best-of-Breed-Anwendungen für Kollaboration, DAM, PIM, Omnichannel CMS und MRM ermöglichen erstmals, aus Informationen in Echtzeit relevante digitale Erlebnisse zu gestalten. Weltweit setzen über 150 Unternehmen wie Dyson, GoPro, Hearst, Kohl's, Serviceplan, Migros, Rewe, Swiss Re und Vitra censhare täglich ein. Unser Kunden- und Projektportfolio umfasst nahezu alle Branchen und Unternehmensgrößen. Das alles tun wir mit 170 Mitarbeitern weltweit mit Niederlassungen in Deutschland, Schweiz, UK, Frankreich, USA und Indien.

Wenn Sie Spaß daran haben, den Wachstumskurs in einem dynamischen, international agierenden Unternehmen mit zu gestalten, wartet eine spannende Herausforderung auf Sie!

Für unser Headquarter in München suchen wir Sie, zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt, in der Funktion als:

Software Solution Developer (m/w)

Was erwartet Sie bei censhare?
Als Software Solution Developer sind Sie im Team Professional Services der zentrale Ansprechpartner für technisch komplexe Lösungen bei der Integration unserer Software. Sie sind Schnittstelle für Projektmanager, Partner und Kunden, die Sie durch Ihre Expertise unterstützen

Ihre Aufgaben und Verantwortlichkeiten

  • Technische Konzeption und Umsetzung projektspezifischer Customizings unseres Produktes censhare
  • Insbesondere Konzeption, Implementierung und Dokumentation von Interfaces und Datenmigrationen
  • Aufbau von komplexen Datenmodellen und deren Realisierung
  • Technischer Ansprechpartner für Projektleiter, Partner und Kunden sowie für unsere Support- und Dokumentationsabteilungen
  • Durchführung von Workshops und Trainings für unterschiedliche Zielgruppen
  • Präsentieren komplexer und technisch anspruchsvoller Konzepte und Lösungen vor unterschiedlichsten Zielgruppen

Ihr Profil

  • eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Fachinformatiker/In, ein Studium der Medieninformatik/OnlineMedien oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen oder als Quereinsteiger „on the job“ angeeignet – idealerweise in der Publishing-Branche
  • gute Kenntnisse in JAVA
  • sehr gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit XML, XSLT, XPath, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, UNIX-Systemen und haben keine Scheu vor der Kommandozeile
  • idealerweise Kenntnisse in DTP und Druckvorstufe
  • gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit in Deutsch und Englisch
  • Begeisterungsfähigkeit, Belastbarkeit, schnelle Auffassungsgabe für komplexe Aufgabenstellungen sowie eine analytische und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise

Unser Input

  • Sie finden bei uns ein modernes Arbeitsumfeld mit Freiraum für Individualität, flache Hierarchien und schnelle Entscheidungswege.
  • Bei uns können Sie schnell Verantwortung übernehmen und sich schnell entwickeln.
  • Sie arbeiten mit hochmotivierten und kompetenten Kollegen unter Einsatz neuester Technologien interkulturell zusammen.
  • Unsere Unternehmenskultur ist geprägt von kollegialem und wertschätzendem Umgang - wir sind ein tolles Team, das Erfolge gerne zusammen feiert.
  • Kaffee und Wasser sowie Obst stehen kostenlos zur Verfügung.
  • Eine eigene Köchin verwöhnt unsere Mitarbeiter mit Mittagessen in Bio-Qualität.

Über uns
Weltweit vertrauen führende Unternehmen und Marken auf censhare, um ihre Kommunikation zu integrieren und automatisieren und so begeisternde Kundenerlebnisse zu schaffen. Unser Kunden- und Projektportfolio umfasst nahezu alle Branchen und Unternehmensgrößen. Das alles tun wir mit 170 Mitarbeitern weltweit, mit Niederlassungen in Deutschland, Schweiz, UK, Frankreich, USA und Indien.

Interessiert?
Haben wir Ihr Interesse an dieser spannenden Herausforderung geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen in Deutsch oder Englisch und Angaben zu Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und dem frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin über den „Jetzt-Bewerben“ Button oder der Link. Wir freuen uns auf Sie!

Klicken Sie hier!

Fragen zur Position beantwortet Ihnen Frau Tatjana v. Hollen per E-Mail an recruiting@censhare.com.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - UI/UX
jobs.content:
Support us in bringing our website’s complex user interface to life through a compelling display, paramount quality, astonishing speed and compatibility with any device or browser out there! Are you constantly seeking new challenges and want to work within a cutting edge and creativity-enhancing setting? Then we’re the right company for you! Become part of our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new designs and effects.



Your responsibilities:



  • Create user interfaces for our high traffic web applications (e.g. price comparison, room5 blogs, and B2B applications).

  • As a mediator between our designers and back end developers, your knowledge and expertise in these two domains will be required.

  • With the implementation of modern designs, you make sure that our front end is always a step ahead.

  • Using pre-processors, you will code efficient, maintainable, scalable and cross-browser compatible CSS.

  • You support the design and development process through creation and improvement of style guides and pattern libraries.

  • You make sure trivago maintains its trendsetter status by familiarizing yourself with new technologies and keeping an eye out for upcoming trends and their applicability to our site.

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer - Spark
jobs.content:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries. We believe in personal development through flexible, self-directed work and cross-functional opportunities. Enjoy a work environment that encourages new ideas, having fun and challenging the status quo!

Our newly formed Data Engineering team is looking for a big data expert to supplement our cutting-edge analytics team and bring our data platform to the next level. You will achieve this by creating real-time streaming processes to ingest millions of messages every minute. You will design, implement and support data models and ETLs in Hadoop in order to process several terabytes of data each week. You will also set up monitor processes and be first in line to deal with and solve data-related problems or errors. Your role will involve consulting the Business Intelligence team on internal data best practices and training them on real time processing tools so it is essential that you stay up-to-date on the best practices used in the industry. We only work with state of the art technology so we want you to challenge the status quo at trivago and continually investigate new data processing technologies.

jobs.title: Junior Bug Detective - QA in a New Way
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Our Quality Assurance team ensures that our website can continue to evolve while maintaining reliability and quality and makes sure that new features are in the best possible shape before they go live. Now we are looking for a detail-focused individual who can assist us in speeding up our testing speed without compromising our high standards. Working as part of a multidisciplinary Scrum team, you will test new features to guarantee that they are functioning correctly and that they integrate problem free into our existing products. You will get the chance to learn how to properly create and develop automated tests as you collaborate with our Software Engineering team. You will identify bugs using automated, exploratory and regression testing, as well as by performing data analysis using business intelligence tools. You will be responsible for making sure that your area is great shape, allowing features to be smoothly and punctually released. In some cases, when unforeseen problems arise, delays will be inevitable, so it is essential that you inform all relevant stakeholders of potential roadblocks so that overly optimistic expectations don’t lead to disappointment.

jobs.title: Software Architect  JavaScript
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

JavaScript is a central technology of the trivago Hotel Search. Faced with high performance requirements, our JavaScript engineers work relentlessly on speeding up the application while keeping the code modular and maintainable.
We are currently looking for a JavaScript Architect who will support us in our efforts by maintaining and improving our existing tools and frameworks. Are you an innovative thinker? Do you create solid architectures that are well-structured and extensible? Would you like to create plugins for Babel and webpack? Then we should definitely talk!
You’ll become a vital part of our expanding JavaScript architecture team and will be given the chance to work and experiment with the newest technology. Your daily work will allow you to work on various parts of modern front end development, ranging from inventing ideal design patterns to hunting down performance bugs. As part of our JavaScript architecture team, you’ll be given the chance to hold workshops and spread your knowledge throughout our entire company.


Your responsibilities:



  • Maintain and refine our webpack-powered build setup by adding custom plugins and loaders.

  • Extend Babel with custom transpilation steps.

  • Dive into a modern JavaScript framework and become its new core developer.

  • Create documentation and spread best practices.

  • Create productivity-enhancing developer tools (Chrome addon, etc.) for our framework.

  • Develop and maintain a template compiler to take our client-side rendering process to the next level.

  • Work on our next generation virtual DOM library.

jobs.title: Senior System Administrator - Microsoft Exchange / Skype for Business
jobs.content:

We’re looking for an expert System Administrator who can take responsibility for our internal communication tools to make sure that our 1,000 plus employees stay connected.


What you'll do:



  • Plan, design, implement and maintain Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business solutions in our head office in Düsseldorf and our other branches all over the world to ensure that they’re working well 24/7.

  • Plan, design, implement and maintain our Asterisk servers which provide the connection between our internal Skype for Business systems and SIP providers.

  • Troubleshoot problems related to our Exchange and Skype for Business servers in our complex technical environment.

  • Stay up-to-date on industry updates to ensure that we stay ahead of the curve and suggest new projects we can develop to push our infrastructure forward.

  • Act as the in-house technical expert on all Exchange and Skype for Business issues, providing assistance to others in your team should they need it.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Core Hotel Data
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

trivago is looking for Software Engineers who are passionate about their craft, versatile and ambitious to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward!
We offer an international, results-driven, fun and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice!

Our engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users search for their ideal hotel at the best rate. Our ambitions reach far beyond just searching for hotels. Our product needs to handle information at the scale of the web. We’re looking for ideas from a lot of different areas of computer science, including information retrieval, data processing, data storage, distributed computing, large-scale system design and many more; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a Software Engineer, you work on a small team and on many different projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves.
You will be a leader in the design, implementation and ownership of major modules and sub-systems. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, maintain and enhance software solutions.

Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Our Software Engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users search for their ideal hotel at the best rate.
We are looking for a versatile individual who is passionate about their craft, and has the ambition to push technology forward. You will be a leader in the design, implementation and ownership of major modules and sub-systems. With your technical expertise, you will manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, maintain and enhance software solutions.
We offer an international, results-driven and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice.


Your responsibilities:



  • Build and maintain Java backend applications.

  • Play a leading role in the design and implementation of new functionality and platform enhancements.

  • Work closely and collaboratively with stakeholders and members from other teams (BI, Product, etc.).

  • Be creative, challenge yourself and spread the word: contribute to one of our lovely open source projects.

  • Initiate ideas from many different areas of computer science, including information retrieval, data processing, data storage, distributed computing, large-scale system design and many more.


Essential requirements:



  • A degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.

  • You have demonstrated the ability to master object oriented development in Core Java, especially Java Concurrency/ Multi-threading. (Please be aware that Pure JEE experience is not relevant for this position).

  • 3+ years' experience in designing and developing large scale web applications.

  • Extensive knowledge of software architecture, data structures and modern design patterns.

  • Extensive knowledge of building high performance, highly scalable and fault-tolerant web applications.

  • Experience in using NoSQL technologies (Redis, Cassandra, etc.).

  • Fluency in English (our company language).


Preferred requirements:



  • A master's degree or PhD in Computer Science.

  • Excellent communication skills.


Life at trivago is...



  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.

  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Living in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.


Start date:



  • As soon as possible.


Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.content:
trivago offers a highly dynamic, international, and result driven environment, where you’ll get the chance to make a meaningful impact on millions of users. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice!

We are looking for a Software Engineer with a solid background in data science who wants to join our Backend Services team and help us to optimize our revenue growth by building models and algorithms that improve our CPC bidding market. In your new role you’ll cooperate closely with individuals from Product Management and Business Intelligence, as well as engineers, and take full ownership of your work as a team – from the initial idea generation to the implementation in our search core. You should be passionate about your craft, versatile and ambitious to push our business forward.

Essential requirements:

  • You have experience implementing multi-core/distributed software, preferably in a Linux environment.

  • Exposure to SQL and relational databases.

Preferred requirements:
