jobs.title: Development Product Owner I
jobs.content:
Purpose of Job


This job represents business stakeholders to elicit, understand, analyze, document, refine and communicate business needs, so that business and/or technical delivery teams can build effective solutions. This requires a detailed understanding of customer needs, as well as business vision and strategy, to prioritize investment, business value and delivery. Must be able to collaboratively work within multiple evolving development methodologies including iterative Agile and sequential Waterfall programs and projects, and variations thereof. Serves as the business requirements expert, engaging and managing the work of subject matter specialists from the business. This position serves as the day to day decision maker and provides continual business guidance for the execution team. This position is responsible for prioritizing the execution team's work so that it aligns with the sponsor's/business executive's strategies. Leads, manages or orchestrates activities for completion and proper documentation of business requirements and validating metrics as appropriate for methodology and Enterprise controls. Works with the business and IT delivery teams to identify and mitigate risks to include business operational risks. Escalates issues and develops and recommends appropriate solutions.

jobs.content:
Purpose of Job



USAA BI-ETL Developers are not only experts in data analysis, but are also well versed in our business goals and members' needs. USAA is driven by personal service, but we are fueled by data. Understanding the trends and meaning behind our data helps us improve the member experience. And to us, that's priceless (which is saying something for a financial company).

jobs.title: Principal Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Overview:


“Enabling every process plant to achieve Operations Excellence” is the AspenTech vision. Founded more than 30 years ago by the best and brightest engineers at MIT, we continue to imagine and invent new ways to bring efficiency to the process industry. Today, AspenTech is thriving with our relentless focus on innovation, collaboration, and execution combined with world-class experts who speak more than 10 languages and work in 30 different offices worldwide. This is a place where people are fiercely passionate about technology, a balanced lifestyle, and a desire to make a difference in the process industries.


Our software tackles the most complex process manufacturing challenges, creating value and improving profitability for our customers. The industries that drive our economies and touch our lives are optimized by aspenONE software every day. The world’s leading oil & gas, chemical, engineering & construction, pharmaceutical, food, beverage, and consumer packaged goods companies—including Dow Chemical, ExxonMobil, BASF, Shell, and many others—all rely on AspenTech software to run their business. With integrated aspenONE software, process manufacturers can optimize their engineering, manufacturing, and supply chains. AspenTech customers are better able to achieve operational excellence: increasing capacity and improving margins, reducing costs, and becoming more energy efficient while ensuring safety and shrinking their carbon footprint.


AspenTech is looking for a Principal Software Engineer to join our growing Asset Performance Management team, building the next generation predictive analytics solution for IoT and asset optimization. As a Principal Software Engineer, you will help define architectures, standards, and best practices; mentor other engineers; and raise the bar for the engineering culture. AspenTech has always pushed the limits of technology and engineering. We are now embarking on the next evolution, from process optimization to asset optimization, with global implications for the IoT. This is your opportunity to play a critical role in this cutting edge transformation.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop new product concepts and implementation, deliver product prototypes.

  • Research and design new models by employing your mathematical knowledge, hacking skills, familiarity with machine learning libraries

  • Design, develop, integrate, test, and deploy company's software.

  • Build scalable, highly reliable, and super-fast globally distributed services.

  • Build a software stack that scales from on-premises software to deployments in secure environments to large multi-tenant systems. 

  • Execute product specification, system design, development and system integration.

  • Provide technical support to product management, product marketing, services, customer and business support on customer activities.

  • Some travel (up to 10%) may be required.

jobs.title: Web App Developer
jobs.content: numer.ai is a real-time web app for Numerai’s weekly tournament to solve the stock market.  Our users are thousands of anonymous data scientists around the world who compete to make the best predictions to control our hedge fund’s investments.  We’ve successfully begun a revolution in the finance industry, paying 7500 users by the second for 13 billion stock market predictions, and our work has just begun.  We’re looking for an amazing web developer to take the lead on our web app.

jobs.title: Lead Web Developer to Solve the Stock Market
jobs.content:
numer.ai is a real-time web app for Numerai’s weekly tournament to solve the stock market. Our users are thousands of anonymous data scientists around the world who compete to make the best predictions to control our hedge fund’s investments. We’ve successfully begun a revolution in the finance industry, paying 7500 users by the second for 13 billion stock market predictions. Our work has just begun, and we’re looking for an amazing web developer to take the lead developing our web app.

Responsibilities

  • Implement every aspect of the web app
  • Work with our filmmaker to create beautiful web design
  • Collect and calculate data on our tournament, including competitors’ winnings
  • Secure the web app. Our tournament participants are rewarded in cryptocurrencies. It’s important that they’re protected.

Technical Qualities

  • HTML, CSS, Javascript, database experience
  • Node.js, Elixir, or Elm experience is advantageous, but we’re interested in people who learn languages eagerly
  • Excited about good engineering practices: unit tests, documentation, beautiful code, GitHub
  • Keen interest in cryptocurrencies (Solidity advantageous)
  • Interest in machine learning is advantageous
  • Knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite is advantageous

Personal Qualities

  • Proactive
  • Optimistic
  • Seeks truth above what is easy or makes you look good
  • Passionate
  • Contrarian
  • Honest

The sky is the limit in this position at Numerai. You’ll be joining a small, elite team of mathematicians and machine learning experts. We want a ferocious entrepreneur who will relentlessly push the company forward in every direction.

jobs.title: Data Services Librarian
jobs.content:
POSITION ANNOUNCEMENT UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, BERKELEY

Data Services Librarian Hiring Range: Associate Librarian to Librarian $58,400- $84,930 per annum, based upon qualifications This is a full-time appointment available starting May 2017.

The University of California, Berkeley seeks a collaborative and service-oriented librarian to join a team of specialists supporting world-class research and teaching. The Data Services Librarian develops, leads, and assesses an innovative outreach and service program to increase data and statistical literacy within the Library and across the curriculum.

The Environment The UC Berkeley Library is an internationally renowned research and teaching facility at one of the nation's premier public universities. A highly diverse and intellectually rich environment, Berkeley serves a campus community of 25,500 undergraduate students, 10,300 graduate students, and 1,500 faculty. With a collection of more than 11 million volumes and a collections budget of over $15 million, the Library offers extensive collections in all formats and robust services to connect users with those collections and build their related research skills.

The Library’s Social Sciences Division consists of five library locations – the Anthropology Library, Business Library, Data Lab, Environmental Design Library, and Social Research Library – and collections and services located in Doe Library/Gardner MAIN Stacks. Collectively, the staff – 12 librarians, 12 library staff, and over 50 student library employees – support the research, teaching, and study needs of a diverse clientele. These libraries are primary service points and provide research-level print and digital collections in several languages to support the research and teaching programs of several academic programs and centers, professional schools, research units, and the general public. Visit http://www.lib.berkeley.edu/ for more information about the UC Berkeley Library.

Responsibilities Reporting to the Head of the Library’s Social Sciences Division, the incumbent provides leadership for campus and library initiatives supporting data and digital scholarship, and works with a variety of ad-hoc and standing groups to help achieve program objectives. The Data Services Librarian is the library liaison to the undergraduate Data Science Education Program (DSEP) and to the broader Data Science Initiative at Berkeley. The Data Science Initiative is University-wide, supporting the increased use of computational and inferential thinking in many academic disciplines and professional schools and developing information literacies for a data-rich world. The librarian establishes strong relationships with faculty and students, conducts analysis and assessment of user and program data needs, develops and implements peer consulting/drop-in services, provides virtual and in-person research consultations, creates instructional materials in a variety of formats, promotes library resources and services, and works collaboratively and programmatically to support data literacy across the curriculum.

The incumbent works closely with a network of campus partners including the Social Sciences Data Laboratory (D-Lab), the Social Science Matrix, the Berkeley Institute for Transparency in the Social Sciences (BITSS), the Berkeley Institute for Data Science (BIDS) and the Research Data Management Core Team, as well as colleagues within the Library, including those who support GIS, qualitative data, and the digital humanities. The librarian provides advice, guidance and instruction to build capacity amongst colleagues and to better use quantitative data to assess and improve Library services. The librarian is the service lead to the Library’s Data Acquisition and Access Program (DAAP), providing input and advice on data requested by students and faculty. The librarian represents the social sciences on the research data management core team, supporting best practices related to data creation, organization, preservation, and sharing. Regionally and nationally, the librarian collaborates with colleagues to develop and implement new models and best practices for Library support of data intensive research.

UC Berkeley librarians and academic staff are expected to participate in library-wide planning and governance, and work effectively in a shared decision-making environment. Advancement is partially based upon professional contributions beyond the primary assignment; the successful candidate will show evidence or promise of such contributions to the Library, campus, UC System, and profession.

Qualifications Minimum Basic Qualification at time of application:

  • Master’s degree from an American Library Association (ALA) accredited program or equivalent degree Additional Required Qualifications by start date of position:
  • Domain expertise in an area of research related to the position.
  • Demonstrated experience with quantitative academic research using statistical software such as SPSS, R, SAS or Stata and/or programming languages such as R or Python
  • Demonstrated ability to plan, coordinate, and implement effective programs, complex projects, and services
  • Demonstrated understanding of the information needs of social science researchers, including familiarity with new research methods and with research data management
  • Demonstrated ability to provide highly responsive public service and to work effectively with diverse staff and campus user communities
  • Experience teaching and/or advising researchers on resolving data-related questions
  • Experience creating documentation and educational materials
  • Demonstrated analytical, organizational, problem solving, interpersonal, and communication skills
  • Demonstrated initiative, flexibility, creativity and the ability to work effectively both independently and as a team member

Additional Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with data visualization principles and tools (such as Tableau or Gephi).
  • Experience providing reference and/or instructional services in an academic library.

The UC Berkeley Library is committed to supporting and encouraging a multicultural environment and seeks candidates who can make positive and imaginative contributions in a context of ethnic and cultural diversity.

UC professional librarians are academic appointees and are represented by an exclusive bargaining agent, University Council – American Federation of Teachers (UC-AFT). This position is in the bargaining unit.

Librarians are entitled to appropriate professional development leave, vacation leave, sick leave, and all other benefits granted non-faculty academic personnel. The University has an excellent retirement system and sponsors a variety of group health, dental, vision, and life insurance plans in addition to other benefits.

This recruitment will remain open until filled.

Submit applications online at http://apptrkr.com/940483

Applications must include a cover letter detailing a statement of qualifications, curriculum vitae noting degrees and relevant work experience, and the names and contact information of three references who are knowledgeable about the applicant's qualifications for this position. References will only be contacted for individuals under serious consideration.

The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status. For the complete University of California nondiscrimination and affirmative action policy see: http://policy.ucop.edu/doc/4000376/NondiscrimAffirmAct

jobs.title: Applications Programmer 3
jobs.content:
Job Title:


Applications Programmer 3 (7300U) #22595



Job ID:


22595



Location:


Main Campus-Berkeley



Full/Part Time:


Full-Time



Regular/Temporary:


Temporary



Department


The Social Science Matrix



About Berkeley



The University of California, Berkeley, is one of the world’s most iconic teaching and research institutions. Since 1868, Berkeley has fueled a perpetual renaissance, generating unparalleled intellectual, economic and social value in California, the United States and the world. Berkeley’s culture of openness, freedom and acceptance—academic and artistic, political and cultural—make it a very special place for students, faculty and staff.



Berkeley is committed to hiring and developing staff who want to work in a high performing culture that supports the outstanding work of our faculty and students. In deciding whether to apply for a staff position at Berkeley, candidates are strongly encouraged to consider the alignment of the Berkeley Workplace Culture with their potential for success at http://jobs.berkeley.edu/why-berkeley.html.



Application Review Date



The First Review Date for this job is: December 29, 2016.



Departmental Overview



The position is part of a DARPA-funded project to build next-generation methods for social science research. The project’s centerpiece is Dallinger, an open-source software platform that automates the full pipeline of crowd-sourced experimentation, from recruiting participants to managing the resultant data; think lab-on-a-chip or microfluidics but with people. The developer will join a team that includes scientists at UC Berkeley and Arizona State University; Accurat, a data design firm in NYC/Milan; and Jazkarta, a software development shop. The project expands on earlier work by the team on a platform called Wallace ( https://github.com/berkeley-cocosci/Wallace )



Responsibilities



The position involves writing web applications, designing databases, user interfaces, and content. Designs, develops, modifies, tests, evaluates, and maintains computer programs. Work includes test-to-production processes, quality assurance, maintenance, and documentation of applications. Includes web applications programming.



• Designs, develops, modifies, debugs and evaluates complex programs for functional areas.


• Analyzes existing programs or works to formulate logic for new systems, devises logic procedures, prepares flowcharting, performs coding, data analysis, and tests/debugs programs through the application of professional programming concepts.


• Provides analysis for the design and use complex relational databases.


• Develop and execute moderately complex test plans.


• Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for approval of system and programming documentation.


• Understands industry practices and department policies and procedures relating to work assignments.


• Interacts with senior level internal personnel.



Required Qualifications



• Bachelors degree in related area and/or equivalent experience/training


• Interest in building links between computer science, cognitive science, and the social sciences.


• Requires thorough knowledge of web application programming.


• Experience working with: Python, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SQL via SQLAlchemy, Redis, AWS, Heroku, and Crowdsourcing platforms such as Amazon Mechanical Turk.


• Must have knowledge relating to the design and development of applications programs across the organization.


• Requires knowledge of other related areas of IT.


• Knowledge of processes and procedures surrounding professional software development.


• Requires advanced skills associated with programming design, modification, and implementation.


• Requires interpersonal skills in order to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization.


• Must be able to communicate technical information in a clear and concise manner.


• Has ability to interface with management on a regular basis.


• Must be self-motivated, work independently or as part of a team, able to learn quickly, meet deadlines, and demonstrate problem solving skills.



Salary & Benefits



For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit:



http://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/compensation-and-benefits/index.html



How to Apply



Please submit your cover letter and resume as a single attachment when applying.



Other Information



This position is a full time, 2 years contract appointment.



Conviction History Background



This is a designated position requiring fingerprinting and a background check due to the nature of the job responsibilities.  Berkeley does hire people with conviction histories and reviews information received in the context of the job responsibilities.    The University reserves the right to make employment contingent upon successful completion of the background check.



Equal Employment Opportunity



The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. For more information about your rights as an applicant see: http://www.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf


For the complete University of California nondiscrimination and affirmative action policy see:


http://policy.ucop.edu/doc/4000376/NondiscrimAffirmAct

jobs.title: Product Software Engineer
jobs.content:
novi AMS is a SaaS product for managing trade associations. It is being built by the team behind iLS network, a popular series of online apartment guides in Florida.


We're a small but great team who are building a product that will make a big impact. We're headquartered in Orlando, Florida, but some of our team is distributed across Florida and Georgia, so we're used to working remotely. For this position, we're looking for candidates anywhere in the Southeast U.S. (We are not accepting international candidates or candidates in the Pacific or Mountain time zones)


You will be one of four developers on our software team working to build and support our product. Our team utilizes ASP.NET MVC C# and SQL running on Azure, so we are looking for candidates with expert-level experience in this stack.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Avionics Displays
jobs.content:
Summary:


We are seeking a motivated individual to support control and display design prototyping efforts for implementation and integration with simulated and live aircraft cockpits. Have you spent enough hours in Microsoft flight simulator (or another sim) to be a certified pilot? Do you know the ins and outs of developing user interfaces in either Unity/C# or Qt/C++? Are you interested in developing interfaces for advanced military aircraft? If so, this may be the position for you!


You will work closely with Charles River Scientists and Engineers to translate customer requirements and design concepts into implementation tasks. You will be responsible for supporting tasks across the systems engineering effort- from functional analysis, technical design requirements, design concept implementation, interface documentation and design, and verification and validation-with an emphasis on 2D and 3D display visualization.


Major Responsibilities/Activities:



  • Implement avionics display concepts in either a Unity/C# or C++ environment using Qt and OpenGL

  • Provide feedback on avionics display concepts from a technical feasibility standpoint

  • Translate customer requirements and display concepts into actionable technical tasks

  • Work against a defined backlog of tasks using an Agile software development workflow

  • Participate in technical discussions with a team of both internal and external software engineers

  • Present work, as necessary, in front of Government customers

jobs.title: Applications Developer
jobs.content:
We’re seeking a full-stack software developer who wants to work on apps that support independent journalism by streamlining workflow for content and audio production as well as improving content consumption.

Who we are

Southern California Public Radio (SCPR) is a public media network that operates across the region that covers Santa Barbara, Los Angeles, Orange County, the Coachella Valley, and everywhere in between. Our mission is to strengthen civic and cultural bonds that unite Southern California’s diverse communities by providing the highest quality news and information through our website, mobile apps, social media channels, and live events.

About the team

The digital product team at SCPR is a small and dedicated team of developers, designers, and product managers who create and maintain digital media platform tools. We like to ship quickly but also strive for code quality. In addition to working on our own products, we also work on products that contribute to NPR (National Public Radio) and are building a system that will be used by public radio stations around the country.

Who you are

  • Knowledgeable in backend languages (Ruby, Python, NodeJS) and frameworks (Rails, Django)
  • Knowledgeable in frontend technology (SASS, Javascript frameworks)
  • Enjoy taking a design composition and implementing it HTML and CSS
  • Enjoy working on a variety of projects
  • Can write scalable and maintainable code

What you’ll do

  • Come to work at the Mohn Broadcast Center in the heart of sunny Pasadena
  • Work on meaningful tasks iteratively in 2 week sprints under the Agile methodology
  • Use and contribute to open source software
  • Build and support tools that are used in our award-winning newsroom.
  • Continue to build and develop our custom CMS which provides news coverage for the region.
  • Build innovative podcast and public radio apps that will be used by NPR, KPCC, WNYC, and WHYY
  • Bring in new ideas that contribute to our mission of serving our community by providing relevant, unbiased information.

How to Apply

To apply online, please follow this link: https://americanpublicmedia.applicantpro.com/jobs/505636.html

jobs.title: L2 Customer Support Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us: 

mscripts™ is a fast growing mobile health start-up with offices in San Francisco, CA and Bangalore, India. We provide pharmacies and other health and wellness organizations with patient engagement, medication management, and medication adherence mobile solutions. We’re growing rapidly and have millions of active users of our service.  Our products consist of a mixture of large enterprise and transactional systems, data management systems, and mobile technology. We have a fun and casual office culture, with an emphasis on delivering great products to support patient health and wellness.

We’re looking for an L2 San Francisco based support team member to identify, trouble-shoot, and resolve software bugs, improve our products, and provide great customer service to our customers.  This position is a great place to learn about our business and products solutions and offers room for advancement commensurate with skills and performance. 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide engineering support to our customer service and implementation teams and users of the mscripts Mobile Pharmacy Platform and to the technical and business staff of large retail pharmacy chains;
  • Receive inbound support calls from customers, which will account for approximately 33 percent of the time;
  • Serve as the engineering liaison between our development and client services teams to identify, investigate, trouble-shoot, and resolve bugs;
  • Support system availability in mscripts’ and our client’s production environments;
  • Work with our clients on configuration and change requests for the mscripts Mobile Pharmacy Platform;
  • Propose solutions and designs to improve product, engineering, support, and adoption of our systems;
  • Support the implementation and integration of the mscripts service;
  • Depending on experience, possibly creating/developing tools/applications to assist the support function.

Requirements:

  • 1-3 years relevant work experience;
  • Knowledge in SQL, Java and basic coding;
  • Previous technical customer service a must. Our customers can get escalated quickly, and your ability to stay calm and solution focused is key to being successful;
  • Ability to trouble shoot complex problems in a systematic, solution-focused manner;
  • Strong engineering and technical support skills;
  • Solid analytical, critical and creative problem solving skills and the ability to convert technical concepts into easy to understand language for the lay person;
  • Knowledge of, and experience with, supporting mobile-based technologies;
  • Knowledge and experience with various mobile phone operating systems (e.g. iPhone, Android, mobile web etc.);
  • Excellent written and phone communication skills;
  • Empathy and patience;
  • Experience with pharmacy systems a plus, but not required;
  • Shift Hours: 5AM – 1PM.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can use your expertise and creativity to develop cutting-edge products? Do you want to work in a growing organization with opportunities for rapid advancement, all while delivering software that’s used—and loved—by more than 34,000 organizations around the world?


As a Laserfiche software engineer, you’ll have tremendous impact from day one. You’ll be part of a collaborative team that works in an iterative manner to deliver the next generation of Laserfiche software.


Laserfiche offers a fun and flexible work environment where you’ll get to wear many hats and tailor your job to your interests. Just a few of the areas of focus include:



  • Back-end development: You’ll be responsible for developing, implementing and refining the server applications that lie at the heart of the Laserfiche product line—all while optimizing security, scalability and performance under load.

  • Mobile application development: You’ll deliver mobile applications on a variety of platforms, including iOS, Android and Windows Phone.

  • Software test engineering: Through unit testing, load testing, user interface testing and localization testing, you’ll ensure that user needs are translated effectively into product features.

  • Infrastructure engineering: You’ll develop systems to satisfy departmental needs, and support the deployment, monitoring, maintenance, development, upgrade and administration of (mostly web-driven) infrastructure technologies.

  • Web development: You’ll deliver the next generation of Laserfiche web applications using AJAX and Web2.0 technology.

  • Software support engineering: You’ll research, troubleshoot, and analyze reported problems with Laserfiche software, working with your team to develop rapid fixes.


If you’re up for the challenge, we want to talk to you!

jobs.title: Customer Support Agent
jobs.content:
At some companies, customer support is a cost center.

A necessary evil that theyâre forced to pay for to keep their customers from leaving.

Where support agents are a commodity, evaluated on their ability to save the business money.

Groove isnât one of those companies.

Support is the lifeblood of our business. We exist to make our customers happy and successful. To deliver support thatâs so good that our customers canât help but tell their friends.

To do that, weâre adding to our team of the best damn customer support agents on the planet.

Does that sound like you?

If so, then we want you to join our team.

Hereâs what youâll accomplish at Groove:

  • Deliver awesome, personal support to our 6,000+ customers, helping them resolve issues and use Groove to deliver better support to their own customers.
  • Work with our team to make sure that our customersâ voices are being heard in every business decision we make
  • Give demos to prospects and customers to help them better understand and use Groove.
  • Troubleshoot and log bugs to help our developers prioritize fixes and product enhancements to keep our customers happy.
  • Create new knowledge base articles and canned replies to keep our documentation up to date.

Here are some things that describe you:

  • Youâre a kind, upbeat person with superhuman levels of empathy, who can make a customer smile, even from behind a computer. 
  • Our core values -- these arenât just words that we put on a wall, these are the cornerstone of how we run our business -- resonate with you and align with what makes you tick.
  • Youâre tech savvy and totally comfortable using different software, including:
               -Groove to manage support requests 
               -Slack, Trello and Zoom to work closely with our remote team.
               -Skype or Join.me to train our customers with screencasts and webinars.
  • You have experience working remotely and being super-productive with minimal supervision.
  • Youâre comfortable working on a small, agile startup team thatâs continuously evolving.
  • Youâre a problem solver and enjoy figuring things out on your own.
  • Youâre a strong, concise writer that can explain things clearly to customers.
  • Youâve read our Journey to 500K and Customer Support blogs, so you know what kind of company we are and how we think about growth and support.

Hereâs what we can offer:

In addition to competitive salary, youâll:

  • Work from literally anywhere you want, as long as it has an internet connection.
  • Enjoy a real 40-hour work week with plenty of paid vacation (we want you happy and healthy for the long haul, and we avoid burnout)
  • Work daily with a super close-knit team of smart, like-minded individuals who believe in making things simple for our customers, and having fun doing it (we end every team meeting with a random Urban Dictionary word; donât tell HR)
  • Be challenged to get better and grow every single day (and weâll hold you to it with quarterly goals). Weâre growing fast, and we want you to grow with us.

Does this sound like a job youâd love?

Email us and let us know:

  • Why youâre a great fit for the role
  • Why you want to work at Groove rather than another company
  • What would your reply be to a customer who emails about a bug that is only affecting their account, and we don't have the developer resources to fix it right now?

To apply: Email us at support@groovehq.com with the answers to the questions above.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Hiya! I'm Alex Turnbull, Founder & CEO of Groove. We're looking for a very senior full-stack developer to help us accelerate our pursuit of building the best damn customer support tools on the planet.

You may have heard of us from our Journey to $500K blog (in fact, weâd prefer if you have, or have at least read it before applying), or from seeing us in places like TheNextWeb, KISSmetrics, Buffer, Copyblogger, Hacker News or elsewhere around the web.

This gig is not for the unseasoned. We need someone whoâs been in the trenches and helped grow a B2B SaaS company. A coder and a leader, who can hack with the best of them, and has an appreciation for good design and usability. A craftsman with the fire to help us execute on our product roadmap and move us along on our journey to 10MM in ARR.

Weâve got a tight, scrappy team of former CTOs and founders working to make our app simpler, stronger and better. Weâve put the time into talking with our customers and hitting product/market fit,and and need your help to step on the gas.

From the technical side, hereâs what youâll need to know:

  • Ruby (with and without Rails)
  • Javascript (without jQuery)
  • Git (with a team)
  • Backbone (for legacy code)
  • React

Bonus points if you hacked on a PWA or GraphQL recently.

Experience working remotely is the only other requirement. Youâll be joining a completely remote team that knows how hackers work best. Meetings are kept to a minimum and everyone is left to get things done. Familiarity with Slack is a plus, and advanced-level Giphy skills will take you far.

If youâve helped a fast-moving team win before and are ready to do it again, we want you on board. Our work impacts thousands of businesses around the globe, and we have our sights (very publicly) set on massive growth goals. If you think you can help us get there and are ready to join the family, email me at alex@groovehq.com.

To apply: Please send samples of recent code along with your Github and LinkedIn profiles to alex@groovehq.com.Recruiters & Agencies: please DO NOT contact us about this job. All hires at Groove are made by our own team.

jobs.name: A leading programmatic native ad exchange

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer Glispa Global Group
jobs.company: A leading programmatic native ad exchange
jobs.content:
Avocarrot is the leading programmatic native ad exchange for mobile publishers and recently joined the Glispa Global Group. By combining real-time bidding technology and premium advertisers from around the world, Avocarrot is an all-in-one platform for optimizing and monitoring native ad revenue.

If you are a hardcore hacker who wants to work in a team of other hackers changing the face of mobile advertising once and for all keep reading!


We are looking for an outstanding DevOps Engineer to join our team. If you are passionate about software engineering and are always looking for novel ways to automate everything then this is for you.

(Possibility to work from our Athens office)

What You’ll Be Doing



  • Work on cutting-edge cloud technologies on an enormous scale

  • Automate infrastructure provisioning using industry leading tools like Ansible

  • Design and operate Big Data pipelines running on Hadoop, Spark and Druid

  • Develop a state-of-the-art monitoring and alerting solution designed to keep our systems highly available

  • Develop continuosly integrated development workflows

  • Work in a team of talented hackers learning as much as you can and having fun while doing it

jobs.title: Dot Net Developer
jobs.content:
Our current cohesive, highly interactive, accountable, flexible, fun and respected small team performs all in-house code development and report creation, including ad hoc requests. Developers also provide level 2 technical support for customized internal applications and generally responsible for database administration.


The development environment is comprised of .Net framework for internal applications, Team Foundation System for source code versioning and control, and SQL Server for Database. 


At this point, Regal has grown in the number of systems we need to support.  We are also looking to start code development on several new systems driven by growth of the company, and by requirements for new offerings. Therefore, Regal Securities development team is looking to bring one more Developer/DBA to share-in the development work effort. The areas of responsibility for this new position will include build of custom code using .Net, support for custom applications, and DBA. 


We are excited about the opportunity to welcome a new member to our development team.

The esthetic is clean and lively. You will have the support of several Design Directors and designers, Account and New Biz staff. Report into the Executive CD.

jobs.title: Presentation Specialist
jobs.content:
Are you a graphic designer who is also a great storyteller? Are you able to use your graphic design ability to make complex concepts clearer or easier to understand? If so, we are looking for someone like you to join our team of designers, writers, strategists and researchers as we use our talents to battle ambiguity and inspire clarity within the walls of some of the world’s most well-known companies and brands.
Check us out at www.seedstrategy.com.

Job Description
Presentation Specialists are integral to the strategic work we do at Seed. Without your help, our brilliant insights, data and strategic planning might be lost in a sea of poorly designed PowerPoint slides. That’s why we are looking for a designer to collaborate with our strategic teams to help us tell the dynamic, visual stories that will engage our clients and inspire them to act.

To become a part of the team you must:
• View PowerPoint not as a stodgy business tool, but more like a misunderstood cousin of design programs, able to be an effective resource for animation, typography and visual storytelling
• Be flexible and take direction from management as well as take ownership of projects
• Show the ability to multi-task and respond quickly and positively to changing demands
• Be willing to pitch-in on projects in any capacity when needed
• Be accountable for completing assigned work on time
• Be comfortable communicating opinions and ideas with team members

Your past experience should reveal:
• Related Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
• 1-3 years design experience
• Competent to superior knowledge of relevant digital programs, specifically: Microsoft PowerPoint, Word and Adobe Creative Suite
• A solid design sense and a knack for clarifying the unclear
• A love for page layout, infographics, charts and graphs
• The ability to work efficiently
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills

To apply, send your resume and a link or samples of your work to: creativejobs@seedstrategy.com or visit the contacts page of our website at: http://www.seedstrategy.com/contact/

Seed Strategy is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Jr Designer
jobs.content:
Are you a graphic designer whose abilities go way beyond your title? Are you able to apply the design process to solve complex business problems? Do you have ideas that CEOs and CMOs should hear? If so, then join us–as we use our talents to battle ambiguity and inspire clarity within the walls of some of the world’s most well-known companies and brands.

Check us out at www.seedstrategy.com.

Job Description
Graphic designers are integral members of our strategic team. Here at Seed, your visual design skills are as much a key to your success as your ability to think strategically. Due to Seed’s collaborative working style, the right candidate will revel in sharing ideas as well as responsibilities with team members and senior staff.

To become a part of the team you must:
• Be able to conceptualize and design multiple relevant solutions to a single problem
• Show interest in contributing to a diverse mix of projects such as: branding projects, new product innovations and strategic consulting projects
• Be flexible and take direction from management as well as take ownership of projects
• Inspire the team by staying on top of new technologies and technical advancements
• Be willing to pitch-in on projects in any capacity when needed
• Be accountable for completing assigned work on time
• Show the ability to multi-task and respond quickly and positively to changing demands

Your past experience should reveal:
• Related Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
• 1-3 years design experience
• Competent to superior knowledge of relevant digital programs, specifically: Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft PowerPoint and Word
• Ability to represent creative solutions through sketches or other means
• Ability to work quickly and solve problems
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills
• A love for every type of design, from PowerPoint presentations, to package design, to identity design

To apply, send your resume and a link or samples of your work to: creativejobs@seedstrategy.com or visit the contacts page of our website at: http://www.seedstrategy.com/contact/

Seed Strategy is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Ruby Architect
jobs.content:
We need heavy hitter, architect level performer with Ruby. Are you interested in working for a company that is constantly pushing boundaries and working with the latest iterations of the best technologies? Do you take a pragmatic approach to solving problems using technology? If so, you should check this out!


What’s the job?


We are a team of 5 Engineers that are really good at what we do. We communicate and collaborate. No one is more senior than another as far as years of experience matter. After all, just because you’ve been doing the same thing for the last 8 years doesn’t make you good at it. Our team calls upon the best you have to offer form a technology solution standpoint. Bring your 5 years or your 15+ to the table and we want to hear what you have to offer and how you solve problems.


Our back end, built on RoR brings all our APIs to life. Our platform integrates with our partner company’s custom API managing the communication between the different sites and our platform. We also have a secondary platform that integrates with Fortune 500 companies including insurance and credit card companies to engage customers in new products related to their move.


We run an online platform for updating records and handling logistical headaches during moving that is entirely referral based from mortgage brokers, real estate companies, attorneys, etc.


Our tech stack is:



  • Rails API 4.2.5 for Core API

  • Rails API 4.2.5 for our Integrations Platform

  • Angular 1.5 for client and consumer facing apps

  • Angular 2.0 for internal

  • MySQL 5.7

  • AWS

  • Elasticsearch for search & logs


Why work here?



  • Collaborative & Open Culture: From quarterly offsite strategy meetings to daily standups, we do everything as a team. Whether it’s architecting a solution or designing the best looking pinewood derby car, we do it in collaboration with team members

  • Cutting Edge Technologies: We are a team of engineers who are excited about working with cutting-edge technologies, but also care about solving practical, real-world problems

  • Fun work Environment: Our small team radically outperforms larger teams

  • Great Tech Leadership: Our CTO has led companies that have raised close to $100 million. He co-founded another company which raised close to $70 million--we’ve raised $28 million so far


About you:



  • You have proven Node or Rails as well as Front End Experience (React or Angular), but are always looking to use the latest version of software

  • Technology Agnostic - you’re comfortable using multiple technologies, and take a pragmatic approach to get the job done

  • Comfortable working in a B2B2C Environment

  • You know how check your ego at the door and believe in true team collaboration

  • You follow “I don’t know” with “I’ll find out”


Who are We?


We help users seamlessly transfer utilities, update accounts and records, forward mail, and manage all the other fun, logistical headaches involved with the moving process. Hundreds of the most prominent real estate companies in the US rely on our products to save clients hours on the overall moving experience. There are 17 million households that relocate every year in the US, and we’re looking to become a household name to each one of them. We launched the product in Sept '14 and have already sold to over 300 companies. We are extremely well funded by raising almost $30Million on the Australian Stock Market.


What to expect working here:



  • Rotating office DJ

  • Cross-functional collaboration

  • Group outings to NYC Meetup events

  • Team lunches & happy hours


What’s the bottom line?


We're looking for top-tier talent and offer compensation packages that include competitive base salary & stock options. Our comprehensive benefits programs include health care, dental, transportation subsidies, and unlimited paid time off. Our offices are brand new and located in the heart of Union Square on the top floor.


Something else to consider…


We have real money! There are no crazy Silicon Valley evaluations to live up to or promises to investors that need to be kept. No one that works here has useless equity options. Our options have real value, traded in actual currency, not Monopoly money or Bitcoin. Its true, just ask.


If this interest you, please contact Chris Allaire directly or apply here for immediate consideration.

jobs.title: Lead Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for our hands on Front-End Software Engineer to Lead our front-end architecture and development!


What will you be doing?


You will be joining a small and well-funded FinTech start up playing a pivotal role on the development of our unique real-time lending platform. As the FE lead you will be tasked with building our entire Front-End. This is a hands-on role that will grow into leadership as we progress and grow.


You will work heavily with JavaScript and need to have a sound understanding of modern frameworks. Ideally bring a very strong generalist background that has working knowledge of the React framework.


Who are we?


Located in New York City we are taking on a hugely ambitious stealth project that is backed by some of the best Fintech investors in the country, led by RRE and Greycroft.


We're in the consumer online lending space, doing something entirely new, and that can massively help bring down the price of everyday credit that consumers use to finance their purchases. The product also touches on payments and eCommerce to a significant degree, though we are not primarily a payments company.


We are in the process of growing our core team, and are currently looking for senior engineers - particularly those with experience with scalable real-time systems or exchanges, or with payments and ecommerce - as well as experienced web developers and front-end folks, to build best-in-class technology.


What skills do we look for?


• JavaScript: You know native JS in-and-out and have a solid understanding of modern frameworks. We are using React.JS.


• Leadership and Finance Experience


• A background in the FinTech space or other start-up environments


• An understanding of functional programming paradigms


• Any experience with Skala, Haskell, Elixir, or Golang are all plusses!


• A Computer Science Degree is a must and we LOVE advanced degrees


We are offering a great salary plus some serious equity for this role. We have nothing but upside here.


If you want to hear more about this, apply today or send your information along to patrick.koehl@averityteam.com!

jobs.title: Senior PHP Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you a full stack engineer who leans heavily towards the back-end? Do you have extensive experience building in PHP and Laravel? If so, read on!


Who Are We?:


Our team is currently working to develop two SaaS products both for use within our company as well as for outside sales. We’re a small internal team of developers and engineers backed by a major company that’s currently making waves across the globe. We operate with a startup mentality, where no task is too big or too small for any member of our team.


About You:


You’re a senior full-stack engineer with extensive PHP experience and a strong background in Laravel, specifically Laravel 5. You have a passion for cloud computing, systems engineering, APIs, and data management. You have experience shipping web apps and APIs that people love and use. You’re creative and quick on your feet, comfortable working with multiple platforms and thinking outside of the box. You barely break a sweat under pressure. You take responsibility and ownership for your work and are comfortable diving all in on a project at a quick pace.


What’s the Job?:




  • Contribute to an agile team that solves complex challenges and builds quality software




  • Design and maintain high performance data management and storage systems




  • Build high-performance, scalable APIs that power many clients as web dashboards and mobile apps




  • Create test cases, unit tests and automation scripts




  • Architect complex applications into independent microservices




General Skills and Experience:




  • A strong technical background with intuitive design sense and expert knowledge in PHP 7, Laravel 5, SQL, PostgreSQL, Redis, AWS, WebSockets, Git and other web/server technologies




  • An understanding of modern front-end web development technologies, specifically Javascript frameworks like React and Angular




  • Experience in designing clean, maintainable, and consumable RESTful APIs




  • Unit and acceptance testing experience




  • SQL knowledge (preferably in Postgres)




  • Comfortable in a client-facing role




Plusses:




  • Experience working with several Javascript frameworks, specifically React




  • Prior experience working in a startup environment




Other Details:


We offer competitive salary, a generous equity package, and comprehensive benefits-- not to mention a relaxed, fun work environment with endless perks including free beer and wine on tap, complimentary weekly dinners and lunches, free events, fitness discounts, and much more!

jobs.title: Support Engineer
jobs.content:
IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win.



Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?



Support Engineering at IMC:


IMC is currently looking for an experienced Support Engineer with outstanding technical, project management and communication skills with the opportunity grow into more responsibilities related to management and security.


You are responsible for the physical and virtual desktop trading environment, core infra components like email and DNS, phone/video communication systems, knowledge and ticketing systems and end user devices like tablets, mobile phones and laptops. This also includes inventory- and capacity management. Your success lies in delivering a high quality IT service optimized for user experience in a demanding environment.


On a day-to-day basis you work together with Traders, Quants, Engineers, Managers, Executive Board Members and Support staff. You’ll have a high level of autonomy and responsibility to provide an IT environment with the aim to exceed your user’s expectations. Here at IMC, we are covering support levels 1-3, so this is far from a traditional helpdesk role.


Your job is not just to serve several internal key accounts. Your job is also to solve problems, spot new opportunities and drive them. You’ll be hands-on involved where your technical and personal skills are an enabler, helping us deliver results, make a difference and ensure that IMC is future proof.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
The role

We are looking to hire a full-time senior level full stack developer to join our team. You’ll be tasked with developing complex, web-based tools for our backend systems and management.

Necessary skills and attributes

  • Write efficient, clean, readable, fast and testable code
  • Build efficient, highly available and high performing web applications that handle large quantities of mission critical information.
  • Exceptional PHP and MySQL knowledge
  • Experience developing to PHP MVC principles (Symfony preferred)
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
  • GIT version control and experience working in a remote team setting
  • As this is remote, it is critical to have exceptional time-management skills

Not so necessary (but nice to have) stuff

  • Working knowledge of AWS or other PaaS environments
  • Good awareness of user experience
  • Experience with digital marketing

About Quantified Media

We are a full service media agency based in NYC that exclusively manages our own brands and products in key international markets.

Salary

Salary: Competitive, based on experience
Basis: Full-time, Monday to Friday inclusive (preference to those who can work UTC+3 or UTC-5)

How to apply

To apply, please send your CV, examples of your work and a letter telling us about you and your experience, along with salary expectations (or current salary).

No agencies please.

jobs.title: Software Engineer  PHP  Leipzig
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 120 million users per month!

Join our dynamic Software Engineering department as a PHP Developer and help shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search. With around 3 billion requests per month, we are operating on a large scale in a complex and rapidly evolving IT landscape. We encourage all team members to question established processes and give them the freedom to experiment with new technologies in order to drive trivago to the next level.

jobs.title: Backend Developer
jobs.content:
The HRS Group is comprised of many well-known travel solutions in the end consumer and corporate travel space. Products include HRS.com, Hotel.de, Conichi, HRS Corporate, HRS Holidays, HRS Hotel Solutions, Surprice Hotels and Tiscover.


The Platform Team at the HRS Innovation Hub develops microservices powering our various products, portals and innovative prototypes of the HRS Group. E.g. the green-field reconstruction of Hotel.de and the HRS Corporate Portal on the platform's multi-tenant microservices architecture.


The platform bases 100% on cloud technologies so that its microservices are containerized with Docker in ECS and lately even server-less in AWS Lambda. Among the various AWS technologies and other programming languages in use, our standard technologies are Java 8 and Spring Framework on the backend as well as NodeJS and ReactJS on the frontend.


The team is cross-functional and organises by the Scrum methodology in a flat hierarchy within our Squads, Chapters & Guilds organization.


Responsibilities



  • Write code for complex web and mobile applications, related tools and services, and prototypes.

  • Build internal systems used throughout the HRS Group around the world.

  • Contribute your technical expertise during the requirements analysis, implementation phase and in-production improvements.

  • Evangelize about deep and sound monitoring, test coverage and proper documentation.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Greenhouse is hiring our first Front-End Engineer to join our growing tech team. We’re looking for someone ambitious who will take the lead in tackling new and challenging problems and help set the direction of front-end engineering at Greenhouse.


We want to bring consumer interaction and design to our product - your work will impact the workflows and day-to-day of 10,000+ users and you’ll significantly influence the redesign of our UI. As the first front-end engineer at Greenhouse, you’ll work on improving existing features and building a new platform and you’ll have the time and resources to write intentionally beautiful, scalable, and reusable code. We’re looking for someone who is comfortable diving into a project and working independently and who can also collaborate closely with other engineers and designers to contribute to our product and customer-driven culture.


In the past year, we’ve started to move from a monolithic application to distributed web services, switched our hosting from Heroku to AWS, and built a test suite with 12k+ tests covering our system; but we’re just getting started with scaling challenges.


What you will do:



  • Redesign and improve our existing UI, making our application more interactive, performant, and unified

  • Architect and build a UI platform of reusable and responsive components that other engineers will use for feature development

  • Work closely with developers, designers, and product managers to design and implement versatile and elegant solutions to complex problems

  • Mentor other engineers on front-end best practices and set standards for the team

jobs.title: Senior Designer
jobs.content:
Position: Senior Designer

Reports to: CTO

What we do:

Thuzio empowers brands and businesses to grow by leveraging influential people, content and experiences. Thuzio’s two unique products – Julius and Executive Club – provide the ideal talent solutions for the business community.

Julius provides brands and agencies with unparalleled influencer marketing software. Every day, brands and agencies use our technology to power their influencer marketing strategy and execution. Our strength is in search and discovery as we combine machine learning with human intelligence to offer the most robust profiles and search capabilities on the market, delivering fat, medium, and long tail matches. Experts in influencer marketing use Julius like a great recruiter would use LinkedIn Recruiter. Influencer marketing novices quickly become experts with our powerful tool.

Thuzio Executive Club (TEC) provides members and their guests with the most memorable business events of the year. Whether an intimate evening featuring all-star Q&A sessions, a charity event with the pros, networking with industry insiders, or coaching sessions for the whole family, TEC events are designed to be the most consistently interesting and distinctive platforms for client entertainment.

Position Mission:

Thuzio is looking for a Senior Designer to join the company and lead our design team in creating clean and impactful design across the business, from thoughtful UX wireframes and prototypes and beautiful minimalist user-centric designs for our SaaS platform Julius to branding, print, and on-premise assets for the Thuzio Executive Club.

What you'll do:

- You will work closely with the product management and marketing teams to create impactful designs that appeals to our diverse customer base
- You will be comfortable going from prototype to execution, taking customer and analytic feedback to help inform your designs
- Establish consistent visual creative direction for both our digital and print assets, maintaining consistent brand identity
- Work closely with product and engineering to refine user experience over time.
- Produce concepts and designs to help make our SaaS platform more engaging and useful to our customers

Your background:

- Strong portfolio showcasing a breadth of design experience and successful executions.
- 5+ years of UX/UI experience with particular focus on user interaction.
- Excellent communication skills
- Mastery of design tools, Sketch strongly preferred.
- Strong visual design skills with proven ability to create systemic guidelines
- Desire to grow and mentor a team of junior designers

jobs.title: Junior dev/ops working on web data extraction in Telecoms
jobs.content:
We have a number of platforms and techniques in play at any given time extracting data from the web and pumping it into our database for further downstream processing.


Reporting into our Service Delivery Manager and working closely with the Technical Director, the successful candidate will be responsible for a dev/ops style role involving keeping our extracted inbound data flowing, ensuring that the logic, scripts and platforms are suitable for the data being extracted providing 'hands-on' fixes as required, creating new projects, and recommending medium-to-long-term solutions to wider issues.


A typical week might include:



  • Using our existing tool-set to create a data extraction project for a customer, testing it and handing over to a colleague tasked with integration.

  • Pro-actively performing an audit of existing data being extracted to ensure it remains fit for purpose, making any necessary changes and raising issues as required.

  • Reacting to a report from a customer about missing or incomplete data, and resolving the issue (no direct customer contact is expected - we have an account manager who handles that).

  • Discovering that our existing toolset won't meet some new customer requirements, and so either recommending a new tool, or writing a solution from scratch or linking together open-source tools to create a solution.

  • Feeding into the offshore Development Team with technical requirements for any upcoming integrations or improvements you want recommend and meeting with the Technical Director to discuss new approaches.

  • Modifying our web presence to implement new pages/journeys and getting involved in bits of web development work where you have the bandwidth (expected to be less than 10% of your time).


If you live in or around Oxford that's ideal, but we'll consider remote working for the right candidate.


If you're into Mobile Phones, get a kick out of working with large data sets or just love putting together inventive solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Senior Relevance Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Relevance Engineer - Match


Overview:


Are you an experienced Search Relevance Engineer with personal drive and passion for building cutting edge personalized products with a social mission? Snagajob’s Match Team is growing, and we’re looking for a Sr. Engineer to join us. We’re working hard to help our 70 million registered workers find their right-fit position, and the Match Team is the team that makes the marketplace our users engage in.


Snagajob, America’s #1 spot for hourly work, is the only company solely committed to providing recruitment and hiring solutions to the hourly industry. With over 70 million registered job seekers and a leading hourly-focused talent management system, Snagajob has been serving hourly workers and those who employ them since 2000.


With offices in Richmond and Arlington, VA as well as Oakland, CA, Snagajob has been named to Fortune Magazine’s Great Place to Work® list for each of the past eight years.


What we Believe:



  • We believe that what we do is a craft and that making great software is a collaboration of art and science.

  • We believe that business goals are met most efficiently when they are aligned with top flight technical execution.

  • We believe in continually examining our practices in architecture, testing, development, deployment and support.

  • We believe in a strong culture where working hard and having fun go hand in hand.

  • We always keep our systems running no matter whether it’s on-hours or off-hours


If you agree, then we want to hear from you!

jobs.title: Angular JS Developer
jobs.content:
Do you love Angular2?  Have you worked on it?  Want to make a move to a company where you are a person with promise and talent, not just a number?  We are now looking for a Web User Interface developer to join our team to develop and maintain highly visible federal government web sites.


 We offer our employees competitive pay, benefits, retirement plans and training and advancement opportunities to enable you grow professionally with certifications and courses.


 As a web developer you will support multi-year federal government projects developing user-facing applications using front-end technologies based on wireframes, design documents and functional specifications.



  • Review and analyze functional requirements, use cases, and business rules to develop user interface designs and implementation

  • Write design documentation and user interface specifications for delivery to the government

  • Communicate user interface flows and user experience to non-technical end users

  • Work with back-end developers and database developers to integrate components of system

  • Support independent testers in resolving defects found in system and user acceptance testing


Support multiple projects in parallel.  Due to the government requirements for this role, candidates must be able to successfully pass a security background check, obtain a civil clearance, and have U.S. citizenship.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - C/C++ Guru Type
jobs.content:
Rogue Wave provides software development tools for mission-critical applications. Our tools simplify the growing complexity of building great software, accelerate the development process, and improve the quality of our customer’s solutions.  Klocwork is Rogue Wave’s industry-leading static code analysis tool. Thousands of customers rely on Klocwork to analyze their code and help them create more secure and reliable software.


Because we help customers discover difficult problems in their code, our team members need to be coding experts with a deep understanding of programming languages.  We hire exceptional people who can solve complex computer science problems.  Our Analysis Engine team builds the core technology we use to find problems in customer code.  We are looking for a Developer to join the Analysis Engine team.

jobs.title: Junior Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
BookingBug is the industry’s most advanced, powerful and versatile appointment and event booking platform, powering the real-time management of appointments made via online, mobile, in-store or call centre for thousands of enterprise clients. Using a combination of cutting-edge front end technologies, and a truly open and scalable cloud-based API architecture, we’re able to design solutions that can accommodate the wildest of client requirements.  

It’s an exciting time to join BookingBug. We’re scaling up our Technology teams, and looking for an ambitious, bright and development-hungry Junior Developer to join one of our Dev Squads (affectionately named after video games). The BookingBug platform is built on the AWS cloud platform, and is constantly in a state of expansion.  We employ various frameworks, from front-end AngularJS interfaces to MVC frameworks and design patterns for the construction of our back-end APIs.  

Based in our London HQ in this full-time position, you’ll be working across a range of internal and client projects - including a growing list of major UK and US brands.  As a Junior Developer, your main responsibility will be for the design, development and implementation of new features to improve the scalability and feature set of our platform, as well as production, modification and maintenance of the web application and user interfaces. As a junior member of the team, you’ll have the support of our experienced team members who will mentor & guide you, perform code reviews and help you along the path to becoming a Dev superstar.

This is a unique opportunity to join a company that has the stability and commercial success of a big business, but the heart & soul of a start-up. You’ll be working on truly interesting challenges – engineering issues, scalability, latency, distributed systems… so we need someone who is motivated by problem solving & seeing the wider impacts of their work.

jobs.title: Front-End Software Developer
jobs.content:
In a Nutshell:


At IDEO, our world-class multidisciplinary teams creates innovative solutions to address core human needs. In order to do this, we work with the latest tools and technologies to support and experiment within all aspects of our design process—from research to design; from concept to implementation. Software Designers at IDEO work closely with small teams that could include interaction designers, design researchers, industrial designers, graphic designers, electrical and mechanical engineers - inventing new solutions for some of the world’s biggest challenges. We collaborate with clients ranging from bold startups with emerging technologies to some of the most well-known brands of all time.

Why this role is important at IDEO?

Following a “build to think” approach, front-end software developers at IDEO shine at bringing designs to life - moving beyond static screens or strategic frameworks into tangible, visceral, living creations. Colleagues in this role will design software with a diverse range of fidelity; from quick and dirty user experience prototypes designed to facilitate research interviews, to limited-scale public software pilots that have a direct impact on end-users, to sample interface animations. You will often collaborate with external partners as well - firms with specialties in specific disciplines (from AI to VR to IOS) to help move the concept into a market-ready form. Software Design colleagues have the opportunity to explore projects that span mobile to virtual reality; wearables to interactive installations. You will have one foot firmly planted in the code world, but also consider yourself a designer as well - you are happy playing in the space of conceptual direction and visual language as much as ux flow, information architecture, and front-end code.

Once here you will:

  • Get the opportunity to go out in the field with your team and travel the world to build empathy for a user’s needs and discover new opportunities for design through first-hand through things like watching a surgical procedure, exploring the house of a hoarder, shadowing a single mom who works 3 jobs but still can’t make ends meet, or flying a flight simulator.
  • Work with people (like product designers, interaction designers, communication designers, electrical and mechanical engineers) who do things that seem like magic; together you’ll be able to prototype quickly and realistically. You will learn new approaches and discover how a wide range of skilled craft practitioners think about their work - while also sharing your own.
  • Debrief and discuss field research and user feedback with the design team, in order to synthesize research into meaningful design iterations.
  • Continually learn and apply user interface patterns, development tools and frameworks.
  • Work with a diverse set of stakeholders (coworkers, clients and mentors) to communicate complex concepts and complete projects.
  • Share techniques and approaches with other designers—from the software discipline to interaction design, and beyond.

What does IDEO offer you?

We believe software development is a creative discipline, not an execution task. Software discipline colleagues are creative problem solvers who often employ unorthodox yet ingenious ways to push a design and experience forward. You may modify an off-the-shelf PC driving game to integrate with an automotive simulator experience or collaborate with city organizations and data scientists to access, map and visualize raw energy usage data and expose human behaviors using open APIs. This isn’t a place where structure, rules, and instructions are given to you from above - it’s up to you to design how you want to collaborate with others to bring ideas to life in a way that lets your project team test concepts with sets of users, as well as give clients a compelling tease of what the full experience could be. Projects can range from co-designing and building a richly animated front-end experience of a two-sided healthcare portal, creating prototypes of financial services apps for the working poor, all the way to connecting live data into an immersive VR simulation by collaborating with a digital environments designer.

Some previous projects to check out:

  • Boston.gov: Tasked with helping the city of Boston redesign it’s website, we designed a website that takes into account what users need and offers simple, intuitive navigation.
  • LA Voting - Asked to Revamp the entire voting system for America’s largest jurisdiction, we created a modular voting system that addresses the system’s complexities and can adapt over time.

Relevant experience:

  • Passionate, self-motivated, and an inspiring champion of software as a craft.
  • Enjoy coding/implementing detailed front-end experiences - mobile, web, and beyond - from quick prototypes to full experience simulations.
  • Creative problem solver, often considering unorthodox yet feasible ways to push the design, and sharing these with others.
  • Comfort with ambiguity and selfless collaboration with a diverse set of colleagues (co-workers, clients and mentors.)
  • Deep knowledge of HTML5/CSS3 and Javascript. Quick with a modern stack - LESS/SASS, Browserify/webpack, Babelify, and node/gulp to tie it all together. Experience building apps with Vue.js, React, Angular, etc. Knowledge of Node.js and socket servers.
  • Able to make beautiful, nuanced browser animations via CSS keyframes and/or other JS libraries. WebGL shaders and SVG animation a plus.
  • Ability to be super speedy with Framer.js or Invision, Sketch, the Adobe suite (particularly After Effects).
  • 2+ years of experience developing software / digital products.

jobs.title: Manual QA Tester
jobs.content:
Fifteen million students are registered and using MobyMax. Our goal is to have all 55 million students in the U.S. learning twice as fast, and this is where you come in.  We need you to make sure MobyMax is stable and bug free.


We are looking for a Manual QA Tester with three or more years of industry experience writing and executing test plans, and performing manual testing.


This is a full-time, remote position. 


To apply, please email your resume, earliest start date, and salary expectations to hire2@mobymax.com. 


No recruiters, agencies or third-parties.
