jobs.title: Entry Level Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
As a leading worldwide provider of navigation, we are committed to making superior products for automotive, aviation, marine, outdoor and fitness markets that are an essential part of our customers’ lives. Our vertical integration business model keeps all design, manufacturing, marketing and warehouse processes in-house, giving us more control over timelines, quality and service. Our user-friendly products are not only sought after for their compelling design, superior quality and best value, but they also have innovative features that enhance the lives of our customers. We are focused on recruiting top performers in all areas of the company to drive innovation and success.

We are looking for entry level Industrial Designers to join our Consumer ID team. You must have the courage to explore new ideas and forms, combined with the ability to collaborate respectfully in a team.

Work directly with engineering and management to create compelling products for our worldwide customers. Join our growing team in our 35,000 square foot industrial design studio and prototype shop as we develop products for the Automotive, Outdoor, Fitness, Marine, and Wearable markets. Experience the variety and diversity of projects that would normally be reserved for a design consultancy but with the stability and benefits of a corporate environment. Our design team develops solutions for activity trackers, running watches, action cameras, cycling computers, marine radars, outdoor watches, and handhelds. Garmin’s process also provides designers the ability to work on a design from initial sketch through refinement, prototyping and into mass-production.

Visit our design directory page for a look at the studio, shop, and to see some of our work:
http://www.designdirectory.com/garmin


Essential functions
• Explore a wide variety of compelling design options through sketching and rendering for Garmin’s consumer product markets
• Understand and apply future trends in design, technology, and materials
• Create 3D models using Solidworks for product development and prototyping
• Communicate concepts and ideas through verbal, visual, and written means
• Understand the needs and desires of our customers
• Collaborate with Design, Engineering, Marketing, and Management teams to translate project goals into relevant design solutions
• Work with a team of prototype specialists to create in-house appearance models

Qualifications
Qualified candidates for this role will possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Design, Product Design, or another field relevant to the essential functions of this job description from a four-year college or university OR an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience with a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA.

Other requirements include:
• 0 -3 years experience
• Must demonstrate knowledge, education, experience and/or training necessary to use tools such as SolidWorks, Keyshot, CorelDRAW Graphics Suite, Adobe Creative Suite, and Sketchbook Pro
• Demonstrated strong and effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
• Excellent hand sketching skills (Wacom Tablet experience preferred)
• Ability to rapidly explore a wide variety of styling options (forms, colors, finishes, materials, etc.)
• Courage to explore new ideas

As part of our ongoing commitment to helping associates maintain a healthy balance between work and life, we sponsor company-wide and individual wellness initiatives, as well as world-class sporting events—and even some of the participating athletes. In each of the communities in which we do business, Garmin has a strong philanthropic and civic presence. Our associates benefit from these connections in many ways, including through discounts on products and services, opportunities to attend sponsored events, and even help with work-life initiatives, such as pilot certification and adoption assistance.

EEO/AA/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

jobs.title: Senior UX Designer
jobs.content:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played video game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and it’s for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience.

We’re looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; you’re passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, aren’t afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.

That’s where you come in.

Our focus on the player experience places designers in a unique position to influence product direction through bold design decisions. We apply design thinking and take a holistic approach to ensure experiential continuity across platforms and touch points.

That means we reach beyond core gameplay and design for things like social systems, a player's sense of identity, and even real-world events. Experience designers at Riot Games work on systems that millions of players interact with every day. We strive to connect players with others and ultimately want to turn strangers into friends, creating great shared experiences for years to come.

As a Senior UX Designer, you'll be responsible for the design work in a high-scope product area that is complex and ambiguous. You'll give it through end-to-end experience design. The spaces will generally encompass multiple features and sometimes span across teams. You'll work from concept through development and collaborate with other designers to achieve your goals.

YOU ARE:

+ Experienced with a great portfolio: you've racked up 7+ years in the field of UX, preferably on a range of large-scale, consumer-facing products
+ Constantly leveling up: although you've mastered the design tools in your kit (e.g. interaction design, journey mapping, information architecture, prototyping), you're always working to improve your skills
+ A dedicated shipper: great artists ship products, and you know how to get stuff done within teams; you can also thoughtfully break experiences down in order to ship value to our players
+ A clear communicator: you communicate in a clear and focused manner to inspire teams to follow-through on great design
+ A passionate gamer: you take play seriously, enjoying a lot of different types of games, but at the top are online games; you also empathize with players through data and your understanding of gaming culture

YOU WILL:

+ Work closely with product managers, game designers, artists, and engineers on high-scope design challenges and feature sets
+ Set clear experiential goals, follow-through on detailed design work, and ensure that your teams are set-up for success
+ Work with other discipline leads on establishing design standards and patterns

jobs.name: Tracker Marine Group-A White River Marine Group Company

jobs.title: Senior Industrial Designer for Tracker Boats
jobs.company: Tracker Marine Group-A White River Marine Group Company
jobs.content:
Position Summary:
Tracker Marine - a White River Marine Group company - is looking for a creative industrial designer to lead the aesthetic and ergonomic development of recreational marine products (fiberglass and aluminum fishing, sport, utility and pontoon boats) while collaborating with the industry’s top talent in Engineering, Manufacturing, Marketing, and Management to explore, develop, and execute highly innovative design solutions.

You will get to use your mechanical ability to visualize and design technically robust seating and composite, aluminum, and rotomolded thermoplastic marine products, and innovate within known high and low volume manufacturing techniques, specifying materials, construction, mechanisms, color and surface finish. As an individual you’ll bring creativity, passion, people skills, experience, and the ability to lead creative teams in an inspiring way. You are passionate about the details and have a proven track record of creating products that are authentic to a brand, and connect emotionally with consumers.

Position Responsibilities:
• Apply sound concepts of product design to define, develop and integrate state of the art marine product into high production manufacturing facilities company-wide.
• Generate and communicate ideas quickly without a lot of background information or parameters
• Work with manufacturers and suppliers’ teams to develop and deliver multiple simultaneous projects on time
• Develop 3D digital surface part and assembly models of high complexity and sophistication
• Support new product development and engineering for five brands of power boat products.
• All other duties as assigned.

Skills/Qualifications:
• Minimum Bachelor’s degree in industrial, transportation or product design
• A minimum of 5 years’ experience in the design, engineering, manufacturing and marketing of marine recreational, aerospace or consumer products with proven, quantifiable results
• Professionally developed design and presentation skills including concept generation, sketching, 3D CAD, and modeling
• Desire and experience in physical prototyping. Experience with digital prototyping and prototyping soft/sewn goods is a plus
• Proactive in identifying, owning and solving problems
• Experience and confidence leading on projects from start to finish
• Flexible in the face of shifting priorities
• Experience collaborating in the corporate environment for new product development, engineering and manufacturing

Application Details
• Interested candidates should email a cover letter, resume, and portfolio samples. Please limit submissions to 5MB. Submissions without a portfolio will not be considered. Portfolio samples must contain examples of your sketching and problem solving.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.content:
About Incase

Founded in 1997, Incase is brand driven by design.

We design solutions centered on protection and mobility to meet the evolving demands of today's creatives. Our heritage is deeply rooted in the lifestyles of those who create on the Apple platform, and through this dedication, we are able to focus on our consumers' evolving needs and continually expand our product offering while promoting creativity and the entrepreneurial spirit.
Informed by the principles of good design, the ecosystem of bags and accessories we curate transcend both age and demographics to provide the widest audience with the best possible experiences while in pursuit of their passions.

Our team employs exacting design protocols to ensure each Incase product meets the needs of our consumers, new emerging markets, and an ever-expanding world of Apple product experiences. The brand, our team, and the products we create thrive at the intersection of technology and lifestyle while innovation through collaboration lives at the core of our design process.

A better experience through good design.

Incase is a member of the Incipio, LLC portfolio of company owned and licensed brands. Incipio is an equal opportunities and affirmative action employer. Find out more at www.incipio-group.com

jobs.content:

Location: Greater LA Area
Status: Full Time

Description

Incase is a lifestyle brand on a global basis and the leader in carrying solutions and innovations. We are currently looking for an Entry-Level Industrial Designer to work in our award-winning design and development studio.

Your position involves a broad range of responsibilities that will support as well as drive the Incase brand and its evolving product offering. You will work within a group of designers to execute on brand and product-marketing goals, strategies and roadmaps. Projects and tasks may include, but are not limited to: soft goods products ranging from bags to sleeves and smaller cut and sew accessories. You will create mood boards, design sketches, renderings and specification/technical drawings for prototype production.  

With the guidance and supervision of our Design Director and the creative team as well as the support and direction of the development and the marketing team, you will walk each project from concept through to production and become familiar with the entire product development process. Future projects will include working on research and concept ideation as well as starting to manage your own projects.

–REQUIRED–

About Incipio

Customer focused, product centric.

Founded in Southern California in 1999, Incipio's strategy begins with a commitment to our customers and a passion for amazing product.The strategy behind the formula that has driven Incipio's success is based on operational excellence coupled with a commitment to product design, all backed by a robust manufacturing proficiency. Today, the mobile consumer seeks lifestyle brands and products that resonate with them. Incipio's strategy of delivering a mix of premium company owned brands, licensed blue chip brands, and retail have quickly cemented Incipio as the dominant global supplier to the industry.Incipio's global presence allows the company to deliver mobile device accessories and solutions to a diversified customer base quickly and efficiently.What was once a startup that grew out of a suburban garage has turned into an international powerhouse, with an incredibly diverse portfolio of company owned brands and licensed brands fused with a wide assortment of products that reach mobile consumers everywhere technology is purchased. With a far-reaching footprint and retail reach of over 50,000 storefronts spanning multiple categories; Incipio's range and presence is unparalleled. Incipio's business model flourishes with a commitment to our customers and a passion for amazing products.

Incipio is an equal opportunities and affirmative action employer. To Find out more go to www.Incipio-Group.com.

jobs.title: C# Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a C# Developer, who really knows how to code! Working on various greenfield projects and bespoke aps, there is a strong emphasis on delivering the highest quality code, and solving both technical and business challenges. 


The development team is fairly small, but extremely talented, and this an opportunity to work alongside some really high calibre developers and leaders. The environment is calm, relaxed, though fast paced, with innovation and creativity encouraged.

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.content:
We are looking for talent!


Are you an experienced data scientist and interested in joining a creative data analytics startup?


We are working on a range of analytics projects where we apply our statistical, mathematical, programming and visualizations skills in order to create tailored solutions for our customers. We pride ourselves on delivering effective and value adding results.


Our clients currently include companies in the finance, healthcare, online and marketing space.


Who are we looking for?



  • A proven track record in data analytics, visualization and/or productionalization, either in a commercial or research setting

  • A healthy balance of statistical knowledge, coding skills and business acumen, with an expertise in either of these fields

  • Willingness to learn, the ability to think skeptically about problems and results, curious to explore new techniques and domains

  • Good communication and data storytelling skills

  • Data wrangling prowess; you’re not afraid of working with high volume and/or untidy data

  • Expert knowledge of R and/or Python essential and the ability to learn new techniques is key

  • Know-how about the Hadoop ecosystem is a strong plus

  • Ability to work independently and in a quickly evolving environment

  • Interested in tutoring others about your area of expertise

  • Involvement in the open-source community is a plus

  • Located in Belgium, strong level of English and either Dutch or French

  • 2+ years of experience


What will you get in return?



  • A competitive salary package (including fringe benefits)

  • Flexible working hours (if the project allows it)

  • A personal training/development budget

  • Top notch hardware for analytics and home use

  • A startup environment and the ability to grow with the company


Did we tickle your interest? If so, send your resume together with a cover letter. If we see a fit, we will sent you an online test which will be followed up by an interview with one of dataroots’ partners.

jobs.title: Lead Javascript/Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Are you the type of engineer who punches juke boxes to make the music start? Do you consider riding your motorcycle off into the a sunset a personal hobby? Is architecting a system from the ground up no big deal to you? We're looking for full-time Javascript programmers to make this happen.


As a company we are at an exciting stage in our growth. We are getting traction with big customers, scaling out, and solving increasingly complex engineering problems. We want team members with attributes like:


- focus on delivering value to the customer
- strong belief in collaboration
- passion that drives you to execute and innovate
- ability to self-manage and take ownership of a feature
- good written communication
- not afraid of a steep learning curve
- experience in a start up
- avoid over-engineering
- simple designs and fast execution
- discipline in following process and documenting your work


These personality traits define the culture we are building and are more important to us than a particular set of technical skills, so there is some scope for training if you're a fast learner.


If you join LeadIQ, you will learn a lot: In terms of technical ability there are many cool tools, technologies, patterns and other great developers that will sharpen your skills. Personally you be given the chance to step up, lead and make your mark in a growing startup as we tackle the challenges in our next phase of growth.


So if you feel like you're a good fit for us, drop us a line! We love meeting developers who are excited by our product!

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
Want to join a fast-paced, rapidly growing startup thatâs disrupting a multi-billion-dollar industry? Thatâs what weâre doing here each day at Kontena. We are creating the leading open source container and microservices platform, delivering the most developer friendly solution to organizations all around the world. We thrive on providing products that help software developers, IT Operations, DevOps teams, and application owners to build, ship and run software on any cloud platform without hassle.

We are looking for an extraordinary Product Marketing Manager for Kontena. In this role you will own product & competitive positioning, sales enablement, market & competitive analysis, product launches, customer development, community engagement and more.

__Responsibilities__

* Develop positioning and messaging that resonates with Kontenaâs audience: developers, IT operations, and application owners.
* Enable the sales force by developing collateral and providing training.
* Develop marketing collateral: datasheets, whitepapers, presentations, webcasts, etc.
* Perform market and competitive research and analysis.
* Plan and manage product launch activities.
* Work with product management and engineering to influence product roadmap.
* Present at tradeshows and conferences.
* Engage with Kontena's community.

__Skills & Requirements__

* Experience working in product marketing, product management, sales engineering, and/or post sales services at software container and/or software development ecosystem.
* Experience in and understanding of open source business.
* Familiarity with the developer software landscape, including programming languages, app servers, databases, SaaS services and cloud solutions.
* Demonstrated ability to distill simple positioning from complex products.
* Technical depth and curiosity balanced with a strong business acumen.
* Experience working effectively across marketing and sales organizations.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Demonstrated ability to engage and grow online communities around software products.

__Perks at Kontena__

* Competitive salary
* Choose your own tech gear
* Amazing company, cool product and a world class team

__About Kontena__

Kontena, Inc. is the creator of Kontena open source container platform for orchestrating applications that are run on Docker containers. The product is designed to simplify deploying and running containerized applications on any infrastructure: on-premises, cloud or hybrid. By leveraging technologies such as Docker, CoreOS and Weave, it provides complete solution for organizations of any size. It is built to maximize developer happiness.

The company is backed by a great VC and was just recently awarded Black Duck Open Source Rookies award for creating one of the most interesting new open source projects in 2015.

We look forward to reviewing your application. Thank you for your interest in Kontena!

jobs.content:
Kontena, Inc. is looking for a skilled developer with a passion to container technologies and make-it-happen mindset. You will be part of Kontena’s core development team creating a platform that will be a foundation for organizations to run their containerized workloads around the world. You will participate in all phases of our product development: designing, prototyping, implementing, testing, and documenting. The ideal candidate has experience with container technologies, various cloud platforms, APIs and high availability solutions development.

  • Design, prototype, implement, test and document software components for Kontena container platform.

Skills & Requirements

  • Strong knowledge of Linux, Virtual Machines and Linux and Docker containers.
  • Excellent presentation, interaction and communication skills along with the ability to collaborate effectively across different parts of organization.

Perks at Kontena

  • Competitive salary
  • Choose your own tech gear
  • Amazing company, cool product and a world class team

About Kontena

Kontena, Inc. is the creator of Kontena open source container platform for orchestrating applications that are run on Docker containers. The product is designed to simplify deploying and running containerized applications on any infrastructure: on-premises, cloud or hybrid. By leveraging technologies such as Docker, CoreOS and Weave, it provides complete solution for organizations of any size. It is built to maximize developer happiness.

The company is backed by a great VC and was just recently awarded Black Duck Open Source Rookies award for creating one of the most interesting new open source projects in 2015.

We look forward to reviewing your application. Thank you for your interest in Kontena!

jobs.title: Master or Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Master Software Engineer


Department: Information Technology











General Description






Parametric provides engineered financial investment portfolio solutions to institutional and private clients with a sharp focus on implementation excellence and client-specific customization.. Our team is composed of software craftsmen dedicated to building the software our company runs on. We rely on TDD, Continuous Integration, and Automated Deployments to consistently deliver stable software to our internal customers. What we offer is a chance to work with a group of people with a dedication to finding better ways of doing things.



We are looking for a smart, curious, self-motivated software developer to join our development team.












About You






Most of the points below resonate with you.



–      You care about quality software development. For you, it's more than a job.


–      You understand that there is more to software engineering than just getting it to work--that keeping it working over time is a greater challenge.


–      You believe good software development is not just a technical exercise. Great software teams are composed of people working well together. This is something you strive for and help facilitate in many of the teams you have been on.


–      You enjoy scaling your productivity through mentoring and coaching others.


–      You are committed to TDD and Continuous Integration.


–      You want to share your experience, judgment, and wisdom with up-and-coming developers.


–      You care about clear communication with the business and your team to make sure you are building the right thing in a reasonable time frame.


–      You are interested in full-stack development. You want to feel your impact on the entire application stack from the databases, the services used, to the UI.


–      You follow the activities and opinions of other developers through books, blogs, podcasts, local communities or social media.


–      You want to work with people that you can learn from, and who will learn from you.


–      You have one or more side-projects in various stages of completion.


–      You enjoy the challenge of migrating a code base from its current state toward something better over time.











Maintenance






We use the software we write to run our organization. There is some new development, but most of our work is maintenance-oriented. The challenge we face is to add or change features in an existing application that you didn't write without breaking existing functionality. To accomplish this, we rely heavily on automated testing encompassing both unit and integration tests.



TDD


We are committed to Test Driven Development as an integral part of our development process. How much experience do you have with TDD? How did you discover TDD? How have you used TDD in a recent project? What problems have you faced? How did you solve them?



In this role you will be expected to cover as much of your production code as possible with tests. You'll be expected to work with developers and QA to make sure we have adequate automated test coverage of new work. You should have in depth of experience in TDD. You haven't just 'read about it', you've been there with your fellow developers learning what works / doesn't work and when. Other people will look to you for guidance on how we test our applications and how it should be done.



Continuous Integration


We believe that "it works on my machine" is not good enough. Many software problems for organizations are deployment-related. We minimize these issues by being sure that we can build and test our software using automated processes from Day One.



Are you familiar with the concepts behind Continuous Integration? Have you used a build server in a previous project before? If so, which ones?



What kinds of issues did you encounter?



Software Craftsmanship


We are committed to not only building software that works today, but that will remain stable in the face of change for years to come. For us, Software Craftsmanship is not about pretension, but about always doing the best job possible. We practice a "leave it better than you found it" attitude with legacy code, and ensure new code meets modern standards and practices.



We are committed to being a learning and teaching organization. We have an internship program in which we teach college students how to be professional developers. We share knowledge and ideas through pairing, weekly developer meetings, and one-on-one conversations. Your manager is your mentor, and will spend one-on-one time with you every week talking about your career and your aspirations.



Mentorship


We are committed to improving the development team we have through the sharing of knowledge and ideas. As a Senior Engineer, you are an example to your peers on how to do things. You model the behavior and attitudes you wish your peers to emulate. As a leader, you will ensure that your team is clear about what they're building and why. You communicate best practices, ensure clear communication, and adequate test coverage.



Leadership and Vision


As a Senior Engineer, you should have experience leading teams and projects. You will be the point person on a team, learning and understanding the business requirements. You will often be responsible for the design of solutions to problems. With this comes the requirement to effectively communicate your decisions, designs and work with your team, the business and everyone involved in the project.



The Role


Our average team consists of two developers, 1 QA representative, and a business contact. The business is in control of feature prioritization and scheduling. The technical team estimates work and decides how the features will be implemented. The whole team signs off on the software before it is released using our automated processes. You'll pair with developers and testers to write unit and integration tests and to implement features. You'll have your changes tested in a production-like environment with a complete set of services, databases, and applications. In addition, you'll be guiding the design of the software you work on and showcasing professional development practices to others in the group along the way. You will be looked at as a leader in the group.



We try to always do the correct thing, however we're aware that there are room for improvements, things change, technologies evolve. You'll spot opportunities for improvement and efficiency gains, evangelize your solutions to the team, and see them implemented. You can affect change at Parametric.



Your Professional Growth


Your professional growth is important to us. To that end we:


–      Give every developer a PluralSight License.


–      Maintain an internal lending library of technical books.


–      Meet weekly with all of our developers to discuss issues before they become problems and to share what we have learned.


–      Send every developer to the conference of their choice each year.


–      Give flex time when developers go to local conferences or meetups.


–      While most of our software is proprietary, some of our projects are open-source. We also encourage developers to submit pull requests to open source packages they are using



Technologies We Use


Most of our stack is MS SQL Server and C#. Our oldest applications are WinForms over SQL Server via NHibernate or WCF Web Services. Our newer applications are built using ASP .NET MVC and Web API. We do not require that you are proficient with the specific technologies we use (we can teach that), but we do require that you have command of at least one Object Oriented programming language (e.g., C#, Ruby, Java).



Here is a non-exclusive list of technologies we use:


–      C#, Javascript, Powershell


–      Git


–      ReSharper


–      TeamCity


–      NHibernate, Entity Framework


–      NUnit, NCrunch


–      RhinoMocks, Moq, NSubstitute


–      ASP .NET MVC, ASP .NET Web ApiKendo UI


–      node, grunt, karma, jasmine (for javascript unit testing)


–      Rabbit MQ












Contact Info:


Interested candidates should submit their resume online via the link below.


https://eatonvance.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Parametric/job/Seattle-Investment-Center/Senior-Software-Engineer_JR001359



Location:


1918 Eighth Avenue, Suite 3100


Seattle, WA 98101


www.parametricportfolio.com

jobs.title: Full Stack .NET Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a Full Stack Developer with experience to join our Development team in Dublin. You should have 'strong drive' and be able and willing to work in an agile, modern and fast moving environment.


What is the position


A successful candidate will be a team player who can take responsibility for building, delivering, testing and deploying new core projects through to production. You will take ownership of new products and features such as:



  • Deploying customer facing features into production

  • Refining our backoffice systems which service and manage hotel reservations


Our environment


We don’t hire based on experience with a handful of tools. Instead, we want smart, capable, and experienced people who can learn our tools quickly (and suggest new ones!). Prior experience with our stack or similar is however is a bonus. Here’s what we use:


Microsoft technology on server side frontend and middle tiers (.NET, C#, ASP.NET MVC, SQL Server).


JSON based public and internal services.


PubSub and Queue based processes for cache reloading and long running tasks.


Git source control.


SeleniumJS testing framework.


MVC, WebForms for Legacy System, Angular 1.5, Angular 2


Continuous Integration with integrated testing allowing us to deploy to live, with confidence, multiple times a day.


Although most of our core logic is written in C#, in Roomex we use the right tool for the job when it makes sense.


We have lots of exciting challenges which need to be solved.


We value our people...


Salaries are generous with good holidays.


Interested?


Roomex is growing fast and launching into new markets. We're looking for people who are interested in rolling up their sleeves and getting stuck in to building some amazing software which we believe will transform the corporate travel industry. If this sounds like the kind of challenge you are interested in then please get in touch.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer, Activations
jobs.content:
About the Role:


The Activations Team at AdRoll is seeking a Senior Backend Engineer to develop a product offering designed to set up our customers for success. You will work closely with a tight knit team of engineers and product managers on a higher level API which bridges multiple internal product APIs to create the proper AdRoll product portfolio tailored to their unique needs. The Activations Team is the stitching across AdRoll engineering’s service oriented architecture.


In this role, communication skills are key. You will collaborate with various AdRoll engineering teams as to coordinate callouts to their various APIs, and occasionally advocate for changes necessary for your own needs.


We need a backend engineer who has been around the block, and can help us take our system to the next level. You will help us to build out a fully horizontally scalable asynchronous updates framework, capable of flushing tens of thousands of bulk automation adjustments down to various internal APIs seamlessly.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with other engineers and product managers on building out our backend framework

  • Make well-founded decisions on new technology and processes to adopt

  • Mentor, teach, hire and share your knowledge to make our engineering team stronger

  • Code responsibly: minimize tech debt, advocate for change or investment as needed, test and monitor everything

jobs.content:

As a Real-time Systems Engineer you will need to straddle several of AdRoll’s core technologies: our stack includes Python, Erlang, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL, HBase, and our own open-sourced solutions.  


Responsibilities:



  • Improving the intelligence of the bidding systems, converting insights from AdRoll’s data science team into robust, scalable code

  • Make key improvements to our core distributed systems infrastructure, powering over 500 thousand individual bid requests per second

  • Be a part of a team working on a high volume, highly available system, critical to the success of the business. Balance performance and modularity in systems where every millisecond counts

jobs.title: Senior Data Science Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Role:


The Data Science Engineering team writes the math and software that sit at the heart of AdRoll’s real-time bidding technology, our core product.  Our software runs over hundreds of terabytes of data daily to produce its models, which are then subsequently queried billions of times by hundreds of servers.


Current members of Data Science Engineering have a passion for not only mathematics, but also technology. If you join our team, you will have the opportunity to stay on the cutting edge of research and then to put this research to practical use by building your own software and infrastructure systems. When you push out your code, you will be able to see the results of your efforts ripple throughout our systems in real-time.

Moreover, AdRoll Engineering is broken out into small teams that have significant autonomy. We like to think of Data Science Engineering as a "startup within AdRoll." You will design your systems as you see fit, own your code, and your work will have a very direct, measurable impact on AdRoll's core metrics.

Data Science Engineering is a small team with a variety of concurrent projects. Your interests dictate what projects you will tackle. The common thread among all projects is that they require a high level of mathematical sophistication and engineering prowess, due to the scale of our data.


Current projects include:



  • Enhancing our machine learning software with the latest in machine learning algorithms

  • Employing machine learning and statistical modeling over our petabytes of data to generate new features to feed into our bid-time predictions

  • Creating systems that monitor inputs and performance on a real-time basis to inform engineers when unexpected changes arise.

  • Performing automated market analyses to dynamically react to changing market conditions


Responsibilities:



  • Discover new predictive insights in our dataset

  • Design systems that regularly compute new predictive models

  • Read and conduct research to develop mathematical solutions to our most pressing problems

  • Engineer to put your research into practice

  • Ownership of a system that is the core of our intelligence products

Why work for Redback?


This start-up is great for anyone willing to collaborate on an application that truly helps people in their everyday lives.


The team is made up of super smart, talented, international and fun people to work with.


They are well funded (several $ million) and supported by some of the best investors in the world.


The office is located in the inner suburbs of Brisbane, so there is plenty of parking.


 Join in the early stages and make a huge impact on the renewable energy market.


 No dress code!

The Test Automation Lead will design and develop solution level test automation for cloud and on-premises healthcare services. This role will require working closely with product management and development team to deliver high quality products and customer satisfaction. You will have a chance to apply the cutting edge technology and latest development methodologies, such as microservices architecture, API spec driven development, and continuous deployment, in charting new ground in healthcare software and services.



Essential Job Responsibilities:
1. Owner of solution level test of healthcare services and required test automation framework
2. Research, evaluate and implement new tools to measure and or improve quality aspects of the product
3. Work with platform architect and service lead on technical issues, impact and risk analysis to determine the right approach for product testing (unit test, integration test of backend services and front-end components, and solution level regression test)
4. Work with infrastructure lead to integrate test automation into CI/CD pipeline
5. Provide technical leadership to service developers regarding test automation issues
6. Performs other duties as required


The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job, and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities.


PDS is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer.

jobs.title: Mid to Senior Level Software Engineers
jobs.content:
Fan Manager is looking for a mid to senior level software engineers who are passionate about coding to join our team. Our core product is a SaaS application providing clients in the sports and entertainment industries with the ability to analyze and manage fan data across a variety of data sources. Our portfolio of clients include a number of teams in the NFL, MLB, NBA and NHL such as the Boston Red Sox and Dallas Cowboys. 


As a member of our engineering team you will be working on projects spanning all aspects the Fan Manager platform. This includes our data integration and ETL processes, client facing analytics web portals and internal applications supporting client services.


As a software engineer for Fan Manager your responsibilities will include:



  • Building new features from scratch, enhance existing features, and optimize existing functionality within our data integration and analytic platforms using technologies like MongoDb, ASP.NET MVC and knockout.js to name a few.

  • Full stack design and development with a focus on scalability, usability, maintainability and performance.

  • Help maintain our continuous integration and deployment automation tools and processes with TeamCity and Octopus Deploy.

  • Perform code reviews and assist with peer review of designs.

  • Work closely with our QA team and product manager to ensure high quality releases.

  • Contribute ideas to evolve our development processes and tools.

  • Help in continually improving our release processes and tools to ensure successful deployments.


This is an excellent opportunity to work with a range of cutting edge technologies and expand your knowledge of data analytics and SaaS architectures.

jobs.title: Mobile Applications Developer
jobs.content:
Invincea Labs, the research arm of Invincea, is looking to hire a Senior Research Engineer with a focus on Mobile Applications Research. The successful candidate will have hands on software development experience in mobile operating systems (such as Google Android) in addition to security technologies and products.  We are seeking experienced candidates with both a passion for developing new technologies and a practical understanding of how to deliver real world solutions, and who have shown the ability to take a mobile application through the design process from conception to implementation.


About the Job



  • Working closely with end users, UX/UI engineers, and Field Engineers to deliver high performing quality customer experiences that are engaging, purposeful and powerful in their simplicity

  • Designing and developing native applications for Android from the ground up, as part of a larger system development effort

  • Integrating applications into back-end infrastructure using a variety of communication patterns, including REST and streaming protocols

  • Cooperatively designing and implementing efficient over-the-wire formats for system communication

  • Effectively communicating plans, interfaces, and blockers to the rest of the team to ensure tools and applications are delivered on time and are of the highest quality

  • Maintaining up-to-date knowledge and skills in the realm of Mobile application development

jobs.title: Full Stack ASP.NET MVC / C# / .NET Cloud Developer
jobs.content: Hello! We’re Fitabase and we’re in need of a passionate full stack developer who can help us enhance our cloud platform and join us as we expand our product features and market reach. We’re looking for someone who can quickly run with whatever framework / pattern / timelines are required, and who can add a voice and be an integral part of the way we plan and design our software’s expanding architecture. We’re looking for someone who learns quickly, knows how to push code on short release cycles, and can keep up with the pace of our small, nimble developer team.

jobs.title: Senior Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you a Rockstar in your field? If so, join the LoadSpring Solution team, rated "Top Small Company Workplace" by Inc. Magazine. LoadSpring is the market leader in creating and developing innovative Cloud-based Project Management solutions for top companies in all industries, particularly AEC (Architecture, Engineering, Construction).


Today we are hiring innovative and energetic Rockstars to join our growing LoadSpring team. We hire employees who are eager to learn, are goal-oriented self-starters and will take ownership of the position. You will be responsible for leading industry leading projects to ensure we remain ahead of the technology curve. You will be designing, testing, deploying and managing Server/Networking infrastructure for all of our data centers. As a cutting-edge application hosting provider, LoadSpring Solutions must remain up to date with new technologies and maintain the security uptime and performance of our cloud platform and mobile solutions.


Benefits


LoadSpring Solutions offers a competitive package of standard benefits such as health, dental, life, vision, 401k with a generous match, and a Health Savings Account with employer contributions. But more than that we also have our travel programs of CultureSpring and the SpringMan Excellence Club. The first encourages experiencing cultures outside the USA by offering extra vacation time and some expense reimbursement for qualified foreign travel. The second is an award open to all full-time employees who can win a company sponsored trip with other employees.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Business Operations
jobs.content:
We are seeking a talented Full Stack Software Engineer to join an experienced team supporting applications for both our Corporate and Store Operations.  Our team develops creative and innovative Web applications using Java, JavaScript and CSS among other technologies.  One of our projects has been Store Goal Setting, which allows managers to set monthly and yearly goals affecting 50,000 plus Team Members.  


What we look for in our developers:



  • Enjoy solving complex problems to streamline our day to day operations

  • Enjoy working in a team environment

  • Feel comfortable working with business users when necessary

  • Someone who takes initiative managing detailed tasks in a fast paced environment

  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

  • Senior-level experience with Java, JavaScript, CSS, and SQL technologies

  • Knowledge of technologies such as Hibernate, Spring, Dojo, and Bootstrap are a plus


About our team:



  • We create and customize the majority of our applications in house

  • We respect a healthy work-life balance

  • We are a “work family!” We have fun together and support each other

  • The team keeps open communication through different outlets – Email, IM, Conference Calls, on-line collaboration tools, etc.

  • Our manager really values comradery, communication, and a positive attitude

  • Growth with our team at O’Reilly Auto Parts:

  • We have several career paths, whether you want to be a manager, project manager, or simply stay technical

  • When it comes to advancement, those who are successful typically do well in:

    • Quality over quantity

    • Continue seeking technical knowledge

    • Goal oriented; seeks out new challenges



  • We want to develop our people – we help to make you better by providing a collaborative environment, mentoring, and allowing you to mentor others

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - eCommerce
jobs.content:
Our team works on Business-to-Consumer & Business-to-Business eCommerce projects adding directly to the O’Reilly Auto Parts bottom line and we are looking for exceptional developers to help us succeed! One of our projects has been the re-platform of oreillyauto.com. We are combining the latest in development technologies with an improved customer experience to produce a site that both increases eCommerce sales and gives the O’Reilly customer the world-class service they receive in our retail stores. Another project has been the refactoring of our existing Business-to-Business site to utilize responsive web design for better support of the changing mobile device needs of our professional installer customers. Some of the tools we use to implement our projects are Java, JavaScript & CSS, PostgreSQL, Eclipse, Intellij, SublimeText, Axure, & Balsamiq for development. We utilize Atlassian tools such as Jira, Confluence, Fisheye, & Crucible for developer productivity.


What we look for in our developers:



  • Love solving complex problems related to serving our customers better – both internal & external customers

  • Enjoy working with teams – our team has around 30 Developers & Business Systems Analysts, most projects consist of teams of five to ten people but larger projects could involve the whole team

  • Senior level experience with Java, HTML5, CSS/preprocessers, JavaScript/JS Frameworks, Grunt, Gulp, & GIT

  • Ability & desire to interface with business stakeholders and users to define and refine requirements when appropriate


About our team:



  • We create and customize 90% of our applications in house

  • We are a “work family”! We have fun together and support each other

  • We respect a healthy work-life balance

  • The team keeps open communication through different outlets – video conferencing, team messaging applications, and daily scrums/stand-up meetings

  • Our managers really value collaboration between team members and encourage developers to bring forth creative problem-solving ideas from both a technical and functional aspect


Growth with eCommerce at O’Reilly Auto Parts:



  • We have several career paths, whether you want to be a manager, project manager, or stay technical – there’s a documented growth plan to help you follow the path you choose

  • We want to grow our people – we help to make you better by providing training for both technical and professional development

  • We look to promote from within – O’Reilly is diligent to promote from within our organization with qualified team members

jobs.title: Full-Stack Developer for Industry Leading SaaS Applications
jobs.content:
In this role, you will be a critical component in the evolution of Navarik's technology and products. We are preparing for rapid growth into new markets. To support this we are developing a completely new set of SaaS applications and services, as well as new data products for commodity and market traders.


Our clients include global oil giants such as BP, Chevron, Exxon and Shell. Our applications track and monitor cargo movements and help the industry reduce loss and waste. In addition, our unique set of data provides insights into the worldwide commodity market that no other company is able to match.


We are a small group of developers handling big responsibilities; we live by the motto “Think big, act small, fail fast, learn and progress rapidly”. If you work this way, then we’re the right team for you…


Navarik is comprised of a team of highly motivated people working together in pursuit of product excellence and service to our customers. Every team member is empowered to learn, grow and share his or her knowledge and experience. Together, we are true, brilliant and we make things happen!


At Navarik, the overall well-being of our team is important. We believe in creating a culture that supports and provides opportunities for personal and professional development so that we can collectively provide the best experience for our clients and teams.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer Who Wants to Work With Satellites
jobs.content:
Do you love to solve problems & puzzles and be challenged? If yes, then read more.  


We are looking for software developers that can solve problems with difficult math and physics combined with scheduling algorithms on one/all of desktop, web, mobile, on-board satellite applications.


Candidates will work in small development teams on all aspects of the development life cycle. They will interact directly with customers and have the potential to attend domestic and international conferences. Self-motivation and the ability to work independently or as part of a team are required. They will interact internally with the VP of Software Development, Software Engineers and Systems Engineers. Our ideal candidate is highly motivated, eager to learn, and able to come up with innovative solutions to challenging problems. Orbit Logic offers a casual, friendly work environment and a competitive benefits.


Orbit Logic is  an software engineering company that creates applications related to satellites/space/aircraft for the full tech stack.  We are not keyed into a specific language, but are looking for developers who can design and build good code on a complex subject matter.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Rails Machine | Site Reliability Engineer | Full-Time | Remote | Hiring Junior to Senior Levels http://railsmachine.com

As a Site Reliability Engineer at Rails Machine, your primary goals will be to ensure our customer’s applications are available, fast, and secure. Our customers need the best service, support, and products, and we need you to help us deliver.

We offer two main products: managed infrastructure and managed operations. Through managed infrastructure, we provide automation, infrastructure, and scalability in our own data center on our own hardware. We provide both bare-metal and virtualized hosting options for our customers, and you’ll work directly with them to ensure their goals are met through automation, analysis, and hardware. And via managed operations, we provide custom, consulting-based solutions on top of any cloud vendor, as best meets the customer’s needs.

We give our customers the ability to reach out to us like they would an internal DevOps team!

You’ll work with virtualization and container technologies, and setup and automate high availability data clusters (MySQL Galera, PostgreSQL replication, Redis failover, ElasticSearch clustering, Memcached, MongoDB etc.). You'll manage application instances built with Ruby-on-Rails and Elixir/Phoenix (to name a few) and layer on top of those management, orchestration, monitoring, and alerting for fleets of instances. If you’ve ever wanted to work at a scale that few companies do, you’ll find the right challenge here at Rails Machine!

Responsibilities:

  • Manage availability and performance problems for customers; automate resolution to prevent reoccurrence
  • Pair with other SREs and Systems Administrators, mentor junior staff
  • Releases and maintain open-source software and projects
  • Author blog posts and participate in the community by going to meetups, conferences, etc. as a Rails Machine representative
  • Creates and maintain system architecture, design, and implementation

Minimum Qualifications :

  • Proficient in Ruby with additional experience in C/C++, Python, Elixir, Java, or JavaScript preferred
  • Experience with config management or automation framework, like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Capistrano
  • Experience maintaining production infrastructure on a Linux environment
  • Intermediate Ubuntu system administration skills
  • Strong DevOps experience and customer service skills
  • Self Motivated and Diligent.
  • Ability to participate in on-call/pager rotation
  • U.S. Residents Only

jobs.title: Computer Vision Developer
jobs.content: We are looking for an experienced Computer Vision Developer to lead the development of our data analysis tooling. You will build, evaluate, and deploy computer vision and machine learning algorithms including object classification, object tracking, object detection, background subtraction and event recognition. You will have the support and collaboration of the rest of the team, however we are looking for this role to lead and direct the future our data analysis tooling. We'd prefer someone on-site however we are open to the right hire provided that at least half of their workday overlaps with 9am to 5pm Mountain Time Zone.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Computer Vision Developer
jobs.content: We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning / Computer Vision Developer to lead the development of our data analysis tooling. You will build, evaluate, and deploy computer vision and machine learning algorithms including object classification, object tracking, object detection, background subtraction and event recognition. You will have the support and collaboration of the rest of the team, however we are looking for this role to lead and direct the future our data analysis tooling. We'd prefer someone on-site however we are open to the right hire provided that at least half of their workday overlaps with 9am to 5pm Mountain Time Zone.

jobs.title: iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
QuikOrder is the leading e-commerce platform for restaurant chains. We offer end-to-end omnichannel solutions that enable our clients to engage with their customers. Every week millions of users rely on our platform to order food for themselves and their families from branded e-commerce properties powered by QuikOrder.


We seek iOS Engineers to develop consumer facing mobile applications that interface with our e-commerce platform. iOS is strategic for QuikOrder and our customers since a third of our transactions originate from iOS users. We’re looking for solid engineers who bring fresh ideas from their own experience and are eager to tackle new problems across the stack. Expect to use the latest frameworks and contribute to them as needed.


Responsibilities



  • Build apps using Swift and objective C

  • Architect, design, and implement new features

  • Refactor and extend existing applications for our restaurant partners

  • Recommend and implement the latest libraries (e.g. location, payments, etc)

  • Design and develop new operational apps for restaurants

jobs.title: Node Engineer
jobs.content:
QuikOrder is a food commerce platform used by businesses of all sizes - from your local restaurant to large global chains.  We offer end-to-end omnichannel solutions that enable our clients to digitally engage with their customers. Well over 100,000 people order food via our platform each and every day.


Javascript Engineers at QuikOrder are creating our node-based next generation platform. We’re looking for solid engineers who bring fresh ideas from their own experience and are eager to tackle new problems across the stack. Expect to use the latest frameworks and contribute to them as needed.


Responsibilities



  • Develop Node.js based REST web services

  • Develop scalable interactive ecommerce application

  • Writing comprehensive unit tests

  • Design, architect, optimize, and refactor code to maximize performance

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
iContract is an exciting startup to revolutionise how contractors find and manage contracts, connect with recruiters and how recruiters find quality candidates. iContract creates a contractor community where you can search for jobs, build up your network among contractors, recruiters and employers, manage your contracts, share knowledge and obtain services under one roof.


Our platform will be ready to launch in Feb. 2017, starting in Financial Services, Legal and Technology sectors. However this is only our version 1 - a mobile app for instant connection is already on the way, a recommendation programme to assess the quality of the contractors is to be added, a social universe for contractors where knowledge can be shared and stories can be told is planned. The list goes on...


You will be joining our founding team where your voice and idea will be heard from day one. We are flexible, creative and agile. We build our platform based on our users' and our team's feedback, and yours will play a big part! 


You will be joining a team of 4 developers - 2 in the UK and 2 in Brazil. We are looking for a hands-on developer whom is passionate about startup, creating a product, with the potential to lead the development team in the future. 


Responsibilities



  • Develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve web platform

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables

  • Contribute and provide feedback on UI and UX design 

  • Work closely with the founders on product development, user feedback and business strategy

jobs.title: Visual Designer
jobs.content: Sentry is hiring a Visual Designer in San Francisco, CA

jobs.title: Senior Remote MySQL DBA
jobs.content:
Description


As a Senior Remote DBA, you will troubleshoot and resolve customer issues of any complexity.  You will develop relationships with customers, comprehend and fulfill their needs, and maintain their satisfaction through regular communication and engagement with their environments.  You will perform technical work that requires planning and scheduling to ensure the best possible solution is delivered on time.  You will serve as a subject matter expert in two of Managed Services’ key service areas (e.g. monitoring, backups, HA), as an escalation point for emergency/complex issues, and a coach and mentor for fellow team members.


You will work in a fast paced environment where we are responsible for companies’ most critical systems. Customers count on us to keep their MySQL database running and we are vital to the success of their business.


You will work remotely; there is no central office, and most people work from their homes. Some travel will be required for internal meetings. Access to a reliable high-speed internet connection is required.


**You can work remotely from anywhere in the US timezones, but you will need to be able to travel to company events, conferences, etc.**

jobs.title: IT Business Analyst - Standard
jobs.content:
1st BA opening-  Looking for a candidate that is a Senior or higher level user in Active Directory. Standard level user for Sharepoint.


2nd BA opening- Looking for a candidate that is a Senior or higher level user in Sharepoint,  Experience in building libraries, folder structures.  This is more of a standard BA position.


IT Business Analyst - Standard works as a liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems.


IT Business Analyst - Standard understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommends solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals and overall business strategies.


Level Expectations: Possess in-depth knowledge of the tools and processes required by the role. Function in complex environments with minimal direction. Solid individual performance while partnering with others. Work well through self-directed effort Share knowledge in area of expertise. May provide technical assistance to resolve operating issues.


 Essential Functions: Perform analysis of business issues, provide recommendations for possible solutions, work with Business users and IT project teams to drive decision making and define requirements for application development, ensuring that business needs are met. Complete documentation for business requirements that guide application development efforts, working closely with the Development team and Business teams to ensure successful implementation of business requirements. Assist with the development and maintenance of the business requirements process used to define requirements for systems projects, assist with the definition of project scope and create appropriate scope documentation. Work under the guidance of senior team members to implement solutions to enhance application reliability. Work under the guidance of senior team members to provide ongoing support to manage application SLAs, resolve problems and fulfill service requests that do not require application. Work under the guidance of senior team members to support regulatory compliance activities development. Communicate project status and escalates issues as needed.

jobs.title: IT Support Services - Senior / Technical Writer- Lake Mary, FL
jobs.content:
Senior Technical Writer Summary

The Technical Writer produces quality products supporting both CuraScriptSD’s Information Technology Department and our internal business partners. Products include process documentation, functional system documentation, system and data flows, user guides and training materials. Writers produce artifacts using multiple toolsets and displayed through online systems, currently MS SharePoint.

Candidates should be well-versed using topic-based writing and single-sourcing methodologies and tools for multi-channel delivery publishing. Current CuraScriptSD strategy is to create a content-based library aligning with enterprise capabilities.
Writers will collaborate with all IT functional disciplines (PMO/ Analysis / Dev / QA and other disciplines as needed) along with our internal business units.

Senior Technical Writer Responsibilities
• Analyze existing content for relevancy and re-use
• Assist in managing an content architecture
• Create topic-based content suitable for single-sourcing
• Focus on multi-channel publishing
• Manage content using content management systems and source controls
• Adhere to existing documentation standards and help streamline document workflows
• Identify and interview appropriate subject matter experts to understand the intended audience and create appropriate documents for that audience
• Participate in project kick-off meetings to appropriately identify needed documentation
• Provide time and resource estimates for project documentation
• Create User Guides, Functional Support Manuals, Online Training Guides, Help Systems, Configuration Manuals, assist with publishing Data Dictionaries and Support Documentation created by the BA/Development/QA teams, work with Project Management team in scrubbing project content for the Knowledge Base, and assist in archiving project documentation at project close
• Peer edit documentation created by other writers
• Create process, information and data flows for both insertion into technical documentation and as a stand-alone assisting with creating a system architecture
• Assist in promoting the IT department to our internal business customers
• Work with subject matter experts in identifying and comparing 3rd party systems geared toward information architecture

jobs.title: IT Application Engineer - Senior   St. Louis, MO
jobs.content: : IT Application Engineer- Senior is to design application solutions based on detailed application requirements, and define data structures and data sources to satisfy the application solution. IT Application Engineer- Senior also works closely with architects, developers, customer representatives, project managers, etc. to ensure that application solutions meet customer requirements.

jobs.title: IT Architect - Senior     St. Louis, MO
jobs.content:
Web Developer/ServiceNow Developer
Daylight and on call hours

Job Description:
• Ideally prefer someone with ServiceNow experience, but will consider very experienced Web Developers. Contractors will be considered the technology subject matter expert responsible for the analysis, design, engineering, development and implementation of software projects within the ServiceNow enterprise application suite.
• This role is responsible for the development of core functionality, existing ITSM applications, creation of new applications and understanding the various system integration needs.
• This is achieved by collaborating with key stakeholder teams to analyze and understand requirements, then transforming the requirements into a valid solution.
• The ideal candidate will provide technical leadership and training, perform peer code reviews and ensure the ServiceNow team follows development best-practices.
General:
• Analyze, design, write program code, test, document, and implement functionally appropriately, technically sound, and well-integrated application systems in accordance with Customer requirements, and organizational methodologies and standards.
• Respond to production problems and implement immediate resolution efforts across technology areas.
Systems Development Engineering:
• Responsible for overall Service Now code quality, administration, platform development, module development and execute using company AGILE practices
• Responsible for reviewing requirements to ensure that they are provided in sufficient detail to be accurately estimated
• Attends regularly scheduled meetings to identify any tasks or user stories that are at risk and provides support as needed
• Work with multiple levels of staff and leadership to understand the requirements and how they might impact cross-functional process teams
• Work with management and key stakeholders to design testing strategies for Development, QA and User Acceptance Testing
• Design and develop solutions within the Service Now environment to include modifications of applications, forms, workflow, interfaces and any other customization required to support ITIL processes
• Analyze and design programs for simple to medium complexity business problems according to user specifications and assist in developing detail program specifications.
• Comply with project management methodology requirements as appropriate.

jobs.title: Sr. Exhibit Designer
jobs.content:
Under the guidance of the Creative Director, this position will contribute to the successful creation of exhibit designs.

Essential Job Functions:
•Collaborate with a cross functional team to develop designs that are compelling solutions that meet and exceed the client’s expectations.
•Produce creative presentations of exhibit structures and components for trade shows and events using related presentation software.
•Work with the client and sales team to define the goals of each project.
•Communicate with external customer when supported by Sales, Senior Designer & Design Director.
•Manage multiple design projects in a fast paced work environment.
•Create, evaluate and analyze new design ideas.

Required/Preferred Education and Experience:
•Bachelor’s degree in design or related field required
•5+ years of experience
•Ability to learn Maya
•Ability to travel 10% of time

Language Skills:
•Excellent communication skills will be needed to develop and present creative concepts.

jobs.title: Sr. Applications Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Applications Developer


**This role can be located in Atlanta, GA or Louisville, KY**


Job Description:


The Senior Applications Developer provides input and support for, and performs full systems life cycle management activities (e.g., analyses, technical requirements, design, coding, testing, implementation of systems and applications software, etc.).  He/She participates in component and data architecture design, technology planning, and testing for Applications Development (AD) initiatives to meet business requirements. This position provides input to applications development project plans and integrations.  He/She collaborates with teams and supports emerging technologies to ensure effective communication and achievement of objectives. This position provides knowledge and support for applications development, integration, and maintenance. He/She provides input to department and project teams on decisions supporting projects.


Additional Role Information:


This position requires strong verbal and writing communication skills. The candidate should be comfortable delivering presentations and technical strategies in front of large groups of senior management. The candidate should be customer focused and have the ability to build strong business relationships with internal and external customers and providers.


Responsibilities:


Contributes to I.S. Projects

  • Reviews and compiles project issues to support effective resolutions.

Performs System Analysis and Design



  • Participates in defining and developing technical specifications to meet systems’ requirements.

  • Defines interfaces among systems components to ensure interoperability.

  • Creates and reviews interface agreements to ensure proper transfer of information between systems.

  • Evaluates vendor technologies to recommend potential products for use.

Designs and Develops Moderate to Highly Complex Applications



  • Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, corrects, and documents moderate to highly complex programs to ensure optimal performance and compliance.

  • Reviews and understands specifications to achieve coding tasks.

  • Reviews, analyzes, and refines requirements and specifications to ensure quality.

  • Records and updates defects log to ensure thorough and accurate documentation.


Develops Application Documentation



  • Develops and maintains system documentation to ensure accuracy and consistency.

  • Creates unit test plans and reviews documented results to ensure requirements are met.

  • Creates technical documentation in compliance with UPS Software Development Lifecycle to communicate and update project teams and stakeholders.


Produces Integration Builds



  • Defines and produces integration builds to create applications.

  • Performs build processes to produce software and to prepare application for delivery.

  • Produces integration test specifications to conduct tests, record failures, and conduct fault diagnoses.


Performs Maintenance and Support



  • Defines and administers procedures to monitor systems performance and integrity.

  • Documents maintenance and support activities to ensure quality control.

  • Performs business continuity and disaster recovery activities to ensure availability requirements are met.

  • Provides maintenance and support modifications to developers, users, and external groups to communicate updates.

  • Observes and evaluates the systems usage by users to improve applications quality and effectiveness.

  • Records and updates defect logs to monitor system reliability.

  • Designs, creates, develops, customizes, and maintains training content to enhance quality of support.


Supports Emerging Technologies and Products



  • Monitors the industry to gain knowledge and understanding of emerging technologies.

  • Identifies new and emerging hardware and software technologies and products to maintain industry competitiveness.

  • Determines relevance and potential value of new technologies to support business objectives and strategy.

The desired Senior Applications Developer will possess a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field or the equivalent in education and work experience.  A degree is preferred.
