jobs.title: Lead Applications Developer SQL Programming
jobs.content:
Lead Applications Developer


Job Description:


The Lead Applications Developer provides leadership in full systems life cycle management (e.g., analyses, technical requirements, design, coding, testing, implementation of systems and applications software, etc.) to ensure delivery is on time and within budget.  He/She directs component and data architecture design, technology planning, and testing for Applications Development (AD) initiatives to meet business requirements and ensure compliance.  This position develops and leads AD project activities and integrations. He/She guides teams to ensure effective communication and achievement of objectives.  This position researches and supports the integration of emerging technologies. He/She provides knowledge and support for applications’ development, integration, and maintenance.  This position will lead junior team members with project related activities and tasks. This position guides and influences department and project teams. He/She facilitates collaboration with stakeholders.


Additional Role Information:


The Lead Applications Developer will lead technical execution of innovation activities in the Contract Logistics Global Projects landscape. Within our Contract Logistics Global Projects landscape, multiple applications are impacted and a strong understanding of how these applications work together is required. These applications include GWS, GHOS, TTCS, and WEOS. There is also the need to have an understanding of emerging and disruptive distribution technologies and how to implement these emerging technologies into our existing landscape. Must have participated and/or completed related projects in pharmaceutical and freight & logistics industries. Must have worked on entire SDLC, Emphasis on Design, Requirements Gathering, Analysis & Coding. Perform variety of roles and have experience in working at various levels of team hierarchy and a proven ability to determine priorities, schedule work, and meet critical deadlines.


Responsibilities:


Leads I.S. Projects



  • Delegates work assignments to complete the deliverables for small projects or components of larger projects to meet project plan requirements.

  • Monitors team member activities to ensure tasks are completed within established deadlines and to rectify issues and roadblocks.

  • Identifies and assesses issues to communicate potential risks and impacts.

  • Analyzes project requirements and customers’ expectations to identify and implement required tasks.

  • Prepares and conducts project progress and quality reviews to provide project updates.

  • Monitors costs, timelines, and resources to address plan deviations.

  • Provides technological guidance to project teams to ensure the quality of project deliverables.

  • Assists junior staff to facilitate skills development.


Leads System Analysis and Design



  • Translates business and functional requirements into technical design to meet stated business needs.

  • Develops and designs internal component and adjacent system interfaces to ensure inter-operability.

  • Participates in technical architecture definitions to align solutions with business needs.

  • Writes specifications using business requirements and logical and physical designs to enable coding.

  • Identifies and participates in prototyping to assess value-to-need strategy and to clarify business needs.


Leads Design and Development of Applications



  • Identifies new areas for process improvements to enhance performance results.

  • Delivers application solutions to meet business and non-functional requirements.

  • Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, corrects, and documents large and complex programs to ensure optimal performance and compliance.

  • Leads team on analysis, design, and coding activities to ensure successful component and project delivery.

  • Leads review of project deliverables to ensure quality and standard process adherence.

  • Provides technical guidance to development teams to ensure quality deliverables.

  • Verifies and delivers software to ensure compliance with standards.


Develops and Ensures Creation of Application Documentation



  • Determines documentation needs to deliver applications.

  • Organizes the production and distribution of documentation to facilitate communications.

  • Responsible for system documentation to ensure accuracy and consistency when changes are made.

  • Leads technical documentation in compliance with UPS Software Development Lifecycle to communicate and update project teams and stakeholders.


Defines and Produces Integration Builds



  • Leads build processes for target environments to create software.

  • Verifies integration test specifications to ensure proper testing.

  • Creates integration plans to support systems interface testing.

  • Evaluates and implements vendor products to ensure successful integration with existing applications.

  • Designs and builds integration components and interfaces to ensure inter-operability.

  • Reviews work progress to ensure timeliness and integrity of builds.


Monitors Emerging Technology Trends



  • Monitors the industry to gain knowledge and understanding of emerging technologies.

  • Identifies new and emerging hardware and software technologies and products to maintain industry competitiveness.

  • Maintains awareness of emerging technology to ensure applicability for the assigned application area.

  • Influences and promotes the adoption of new technologies to improve capabilities and supportability.


Leads Maintenance and Support



  • Drives problem resolution to identify, recommend, and implement process improvements.

  • Leads junior team members' support activities to provide implementation and process improvements.

  • Monitors and records application defects to ensure systems integrity.

  • Coordinates efforts across interfacing systems and service providers to resolve system issues.

  • Drives business continuity and disaster recovery design and planning activities to establish agreed upon requirements.

  • Designs, creates, develops, customizes, and maintains training content and resources to deliver agreed upon outcomes.

  • Delivers training to a variety of audiences to increase knowledge sharing.


Leads Other Team Members



  • Provides input to people processes (e.g., Quality Performance Review [QPR], Career Development, Training, Staffing, etc.) to provide detailed performance level information to managers.

  • Contributes to performance evaluations, including performance improvement plans, to encourage continuous performance improvement.

  • Holds team members responsible for meeting established performance levels to achieve individual and group goals.

  • Coaches others and provides on-going feedback and support to improve performance.


Education:


The desired Lead Applications Developer will possess a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field or the equivalent in education and work experience.  A degree is preferred.

jobs.title: Lead Systems Programming Analyst
jobs.content:
Lead Systems Programming Analyst

Job Description:


The Lead Systems Programming Analyst leads the research, evaluation, design, testing, implementation, maintenance, performance / capacity tuning, and support of the UPS Big Data (Hadoop) Environment through the entire life cycle.  He/She performs strategic planning, diagnoses risk and system issues, and takes corrective actions to ensure continuity of operations.  This position leads disaster recovery tests. He/She identifies and implements technologies and processes to improve the reliability, efficiency, and availability of the systems environment.  This position is responsible for duties that are high risk, have severe impact, are high complexity, and have a large scope.


Responsibilities:       


Analyzes, implements & validates Hadoop and Hadoop related tools and software solutions including advanced analytical tools.



  • Leads the design, development, implementation and support of customized installations to meet business requirements.

  • Researches, evaluates, recommends, implements, and supports third-party solutions to fulfill business requirements.

  • Challenges requirements to ensure actual business value is met and proper solutions are implemented.

  • Leads the development, design, implementation and support of a security layer to mitigate UPS’s exposure to internal and external threats.

  • Leads efforts to meet and exceed infrastructure availability, maintainability, serviceability, supportability and performance targets.

  • Leads the development, design, implementation and support of customized data back-up and recovery solutions to prevent data loss and system integrity.

  • Leads business continuity plans to mitigate UPS’s exposure to large scale, internal and external events.


Education:                 


The desired Lead Systems Programming Analyst will possess a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field or the equivalent in education and work experience.

jobs.title: Java Application Developer
jobs.content:
Java Applications Developer


Job Description:


The Applications Developer performs duties and tasks to support full systems life cycle management (e.g., analyses, technical requirements, design, coding, testing, implementation of systems and applications software, etc.).  He/She performs tasks within planned durations and established deadlines.  This position collaborates with teams to ensure effective communication and to support the achievement of objectives.  He/She provides development, maintenance, and support for applications.


He/She should be a J2EE developer with a strong Java and J2EE skillset and also including skills in JMS messaging, web services, database, and SQL. Skillset should also include Spring Framework and Maven. FUSE and Apache Camel knowledge are a plus. Good communication skills are required. Frequent team participation in design and code reviews are expected. The team member will be working on a FUSE based development platform in Java involved heavily in enterprise integration of data. The application is an integration broker. It is a critical high volume application, responsible for distribution of data which enables UPS operations. General time management and good communication skills are requested.


Responsibilities:


Assists with I.S. Projects



  • Conducts systems and requirements analyses to identify project action items.

  • Contributes to task lists and cost and time estimates to support project plan development.

  • Performs assigned functions and tasks to meet project plan and quality review requirements.

  • Records, updates, and monitors assignment deviations to ensure effective resolutions.

  • Raises issues as appropriate to support effective resolutions.

  • Monitors assignments to ensure I.S. governance, standards, and policies compliance.


Assists in System Analysis and Design



  • Analyzes specifications and user requirements to perform assigned applications development work.

  • Assists with system components’ designs to meet requirements.

  • Participates in design reviews to improve quality.

  • Participates in product evaluations to assist in determining product usefulness and fit.

  • Participates in the creation and review of interface agreements to ensure proper transfer of information between systems.


Designs and Develops Low to Moderately Complex Applications



  • Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, and documents low to moderately complex programs to develop application software.

  • Develops unit test plans to deliver quality components.

  • Records and updates defects log to ensure thorough and accurate documentation.

  • Assists in software implementations to contribute to the software build process.

  • Performs testing and fixes of small components to ensure compliance with functional requirements.

  • Participates in applications peer reviews to improve code quality.


Generates Application Documentation



  • Creates technical documentation to communicate and update project teams and stakeholders.

  • Communicates and documents unit test results and code revisions to ensure consistency and accuracy.

  • Creates technical documentation in compliance with UPS Software Development Lifecycle to ensure proper and consistent application development.

  • Documents test plans to ensure expected outcomes.


Supports Integration Builds



  • Assists with software builds to meet application needs.

  • Conducts tests to diagnose and record failures and report results.

  • Escalates integration issues to resolve system discrepancies.


Assists in Maintenance and Support



  • Executes procedures to monitor systems performance and integrity.

  • Performs applications maintenance and support functions to support problem resolution.

  • Records and updates defect logs to monitor system reliability.


Education:


The desired Applications Developer will possess a degree a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field, or a current UPS employee with a minimum of three years of UPS experience.

jobs.title: Experienced Developers Needed
jobs.content: We’re looking for someone who’s excited to make a difference in the lives of users as we’ll be creating productivity and intelligence apps that will be used daily by thousands and sometimes millions of employees. We’re also looking for this individual to be a leader and provide guidance and mentorship for junior developers while working hand-in-hand with an extremely talented team of existing designers and developers.

jobs.title: What job title would you give yourself here?
jobs.content:
Highlights



  • Competitive salary range starting at £55k + benefits

  • We are 30 seconds from the tube station

  • We have a discounted canteen for breakfast & lunch onsite

  • Our engineers are constantly experimenting with new technologies

  • No gimmicks, just a great development environment


Role overview


We are an Agile and BDD/TDD driven team. You will work closely with our product owner and will have a major impact on our new products, deployed on blue-chip websites visited by millions to fast growth early stage businesses.


You will develop new greenfield services to enhance our growing architecture of web data processing, analysis, personalisation, and real time interventions with online users. You will work with high scale, low latency and resilience critical technology, to deliver solutions that work with big streams of data, while maintaining high security requirements.


We develop mainly in Java-8, but our team is multi-disciplinary, with additional platforms and technologies being used according to need, rather than familiarity. Being able and enthusiastic about picking up new technologies is key. Our team works in service oriented architecture, following a modern micro service approach. Engineers have a high level of independence choosing implementation whilst focusing on quality. We are full stack and take care of planning, testing, implementing, deploying and supporting our services. 


Due to our size, you can expect to be highly proficient in the following over a short period of time:



  • Leading by example; writing code alongside the team and owning the quality of the code produced by the team.

  • Jointly-owning and refining the development process, developing a scalable solution.

  • Assisting with architectural and high level design decisions.

  • Ownership of your code of all stages of development.

jobs.title: Full Stack React + PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Toronto, Canada
URL: https://agencyanalytics.com

AgencyAnalytics is seeking a full stack developer for a full time remote position. We are a self funded company that has experienced tremendous success and growth. We are a small team of developers committed to producing self directed quality work.

Our application is entirely written in ReactJS with a PHP REST API. We place immense focus on aesthetics in making sure every react component looks great and is easy to use. Attention to detail is must have.

Experience

  • 5+ years in developing modern front end applications using javascript, HTML5 and CSS
  • 5+ years with PHP
  • Experience with a modern PHP framework such as Phalcon
  • Experience in writing complete ReactJS applications
  • Great UI / UX experience
  • Experience using third party API’s such as Facebook or Google Analytics

Technology Used

  • ReactJS
  • CSS / Less
  • Phalcon PHP
  • MYSQL

Job Benefits

  • Self directed - We trust our developers and believe in giving them 100% freedom to do what they do best. Since we only have 4 developers, you will be expected to take a project from beginning to end.
  • Well paid - We only hire talented developers and believe you should get paid what you’re worth.
  • Innovative technology - We are always looking to implement the latest techniques in app design.
  • No deadlines - We prefer a project take longer if it means producing exception results rather than just getting it done.
  • Fun - Last year we rented a house in the Cayman islands and the entire company worked there for a month. We would love to include you on such trips.

To apply: https://agencyanalytics.com/company/jobs/

jobs.title: Account Executive (SaaS Sales)
jobs.content:
Weâre looking for an inside sales professional with a knack for closing deals wants to help our customers succeed. Your job will be to understand our product inside and out, demonstrate its benefits to a variety of marketing professionals and convert interested parties into satisfied clients. Weâre looking for somebody who can educate and close current leads and also build their own book of business through referrals and research.

This is our first full-time sales hire so you will be given an opportunity to grow the sales from the ground up for an already successful company.

Salary: $65-75k OTE with opportunity to exceed


To apply: Send a resume to christian.sculthorp@agencyanalytics.com with the title 'Account Executive Position'

jobs.title: Senior Software Quality Engineer
jobs.content:
What will you do? You will be responsible for software testing, working within a product team and with the individuals on that team to execute our technical testing strategies, including our test automation strategy. You will also provide technical advice and assistance on test tools, test planning, and test design – with an emphasis on test automation. You will provide recommendations in regards to technical approaches, deployments, tool uses, and integrations.  


Who are you?



  • You are an early adopter of tools and technology and understand that the automation of tests and other tasks is one component of a good quality engineer.

  • You bring your brain to work. You’re not a rookie and you know how to assess a situation or platform and recommend solutions.

  • Because you’re a professional, you know what needs to be done and you know how to work with stakeholders to make it happen.

  • You’re a Software Tester that has worked within different SDLC methodologies (Agile, waterfall, etc.).

  • You understand how to design a testing solution based on good testing practices and you use test automation concepts and tools to enhance that solution.

  • You’re able to research root causes around issues and identify, recommend and execute solutions.

  • You’ve contributed to automation strategies and you write tests using tools and other technology forums based on your deep testing knowledge.

  • You are a technical testing expert and you have created and/or contributed to one or more testing frameworks and you can speak to the differences between them.

  • You can provide informal knowledge transition and/or hands-on training with other team members.

  • You have the ability to adapt and learn from coworkers and share information and experiences in a variety of communication modes.

  • You are flexible and adaptable when needed, but you know when to deep dive and focus on the task at hand.

  • You both contribute to and consume from the Software Testing community in the form of writing or speaking and stay up on current trends and technologies in order to enhance your career and professional development.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
About Motive Interactive:

Motive Interactive was recently named #5 on the Top 25 Mobile Ad Networks in the world! Motive is seeking creative, driven, and out-of-the box thinkers to join our growing team in San Diego, CA.

Motive has been recognized by numerous publications including Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest growing companies in the United States. Motive is at the forefront of Mobile App Marketing and a proven leader in user acquisition. 

The Full Stack Developer will be responsible for the analysis, development, and deployment of online systems and Internet-facing promotional sites and applications.

The qualified Full Stack Web Developer candidate will possess a strong background in the full LAMP stack, with lead capabilities over other developers in a team environment. The developer will have experience with workflows with numerous hops/limited latency. A strong candidate will have excellent front-end and graphic design skills. AdTech is strongly preferred. 

Developer Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Maintenance and management (end-to-end) of current SaaS based Mobile Ad Solution that has multiple hops requiring limited latency
  • Maintenance and management of internal operational applications and processes
  • Application of systems development lifecycle, engineering best practices, and team development and leadership
  • Ability to integrate with multiple RESTful APIs
  • Strong design skills for web front-end UIs and marketing media kits

Web Developer Required Skills:

  • PHP
  • Javascript
  • Linux
  • MySQL/Postgresql
  • Strong design and UI/UX skills (Photoshop, Illustrator, HTML/CSS)
  • Agile software development processes

Web Developer Preferred Skills:

  • AdTech strongly preferred
  • RESTful APIs
  • Bootstrap & Responsive Design
  • AWS (Amazon Web Services) administration and understanding (EC2, RDS, S3)
  • MVC frameworks (CodeIgniter, Phalcon PHP)

PERKS

  • Company recognized for its amazing Culture! Ranked as one of San Diego's best places to work. 
  • Work in a fast-paced development environment where you will see the results of your work immediately 
  • Casual relaxed atmosphere with a results- driven mentality
  • Competitive base salary
  • Health benefits: Medical/dental/vision benefits
  • 401K
  • Profit from working with a team on the cutting edge of the mobile marketing and advertising industry. 
  • Quickly expand your skills as an online marketing professional and build a valuable network in one of the fastest growing segments of advertising
  • Complimentary massage therapy
  • Awesome company events!

jobs.title: UI / UX Designer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Travis CI is looking for a user interface and experience designer in US and EU timezones.

Travis CI is a continuous integration product that helps developers test and deploy their software with confidence. We are headquartered in Berlin, Germany with over half the company working remotely. As a company we are committed to openness, diversity, collaboration, and empathy.

As a designer at Travis CI, you will work closely with our Lead Designer and with our product team members, helping them create usable and engaging designs and user experiences. As part of our Platform Development team you’ll learn the challenges we face creating an environment for users to get their jobs done with our product. Using your experience as a designer, you’ll work with developers to make changes and add features to our product UI.

More about Travis CI:

Travis CI is a continuous integration platform: We run people's tests, deploy their code and help them be confident about their work.

We have strong roots in open source, both in our community and how Travis CI was built. We continue to support the open source community wherever we can.

Travis CI is run as a hosted service, free for open source, and a paid product for private code. It's also available as an on-premises version (Travis CI Enterprise).

We're a small, bootstrapped business headquartered in Berlin, Germany, with a team distributed across Europe and the Americas. Our goal is to help people build better software. Travis CI is profitable, and we're building a sustainable business for the long run.

Our team values working at a healthy pace and a normal working day over working extreme hours. We encourage self-care and personal time to be taken. Empathy is one of our core values as a team and company, towards each other, and our customers.

We foster a culture of continuous improvement and learning. If something's worth fixing or improving, it should be fixed or improved. Making mistakes is part of what we do, and we make sure we have each other's backs and learn from them. At Travis CI, we value diversity in all aspects of our team. We value everyone's questions, insights and feedback. We devote time to help our customers, the open source community, diversity in software development and to help our local communities. Most importantly, we thrive to help and support each other.

Travis CI seeks to increase the ratio of women in software engineering and development, and we encourage women and people from underrepresented groups to apply for this position.

Travis CI is striving to be a diverse team, made of and built by people with different backgrounds and lifestyles. We don't discriminate based on race, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, religion, color, or any other group.

REQUIREMENTS

At Travis CI we treat our users with empathy and care. We’re passionate about building and maintaining a tool that helps people work efficiently and would expect you to have these qualities as well. We encourage cross-team collaboration and this role will require someone who loves teamwork and is willing to work closely with different stakeholders.

We’re looking for someone who loves crafting purpose driven, clean designs. This individual would ideally have experience in and passion for user experience. The role of this designer position will need someone with the ability to solve problems creatively and effectively, with empathy of our diverse user base.

Qualifications:

You enjoy working in a team and brainstorming with others. You are able to see the big picture of the product and work towards finding creative solutions to improve it. You’ve had at least two years of professional experience in UX/UI design. Creating wireframes, user flows/stories, process flows, is already part of your personal toolkit. Ideally you are proficient in Adobe Illustrator and other Adobe Suite programs.

A BFA or MFA degree in art or design related fields such as: Ad Graph, Interactive, and New Media design would be a nice-to-have, but no must-have. We rely on tools like GitHub and InvisionApp to keep our work transparent and accessible to others in the company, and it would be great if you had experience using those programs. Since more than half of our company is working remotely, we’d like you to have experience working with distributed teams. Though our workdays can be flexible, this position requires overlapping hours with US/EU timezones (extra bonus points if you’re located somewhere in The Americas). You must be fluent in English for this position.

Most of all we’re looking for someone who understands that design isn’t about making things pretty on the surface. We want someone who knows design is about making products easier to use and functional for a broad range of users.

BENEFITS

Being a distributed team, you can work from wherever you want. You don’t have to go to Berlin, but we’re happy to fly you in to meet and work with the team.

You choose your working hours. We understand life comes with responsibilities and complications. We have families and personal lives and we encourage all our builders to spend time tending to them.

Minimum paid leave per year is 25 days.

Your health insurance is partially covered by Travis CI. We’ll generally split about 50/50 between employer and employee, no matter where you are. US based employees are offered a generous benefits package which includes healthcare, 401k, commuter, and other pre-tax benefits through the co-employment organization we partner with.

We’ll ship you a Kindle and give you a book allowance so you can take time off and read.

You’ll learn and grow at conferences, we’ll pay for travel and ticket costs.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
The American Physical Society, a leading publisher of scientific journals, based in Suffolk County, LI, seeks a senior software developer. If you have strong experience building applications for the web and have a passion for sharing new and better ways to build software, we'd like to hear from you.

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a small team using the latest technologies to build applications used by authors, reviewers, and staff to support editorial and peer review processes. The developer is expected to have a strong web development background, preferably with the ability to work full stack (backend, front-end, API and service layers).

We’re a group who happily share knowledge and value other ideas, while working in a bright, modern office with a friendly atmosphere and flat hierarchies.

We will challenge you with interesting work while providing you with a collaborative culture in a fast paced environment. Our staff is encouraged to attend industry conferences and we are constantly playing with new tools and use all the latest and greatest technologies, affording you the capability to impact all aspects of your projects.

You must have excellent English communication skills, be a problem solver and a team player, and be results oriented.

Other incentives for working at APS are great pay, great benefits, generous 403(b), fun company events, commuter benefits, and 3 weeks paid vacation.

Required:

● Advanced/senior level programming experience building full stack web applications. We currently utilize Clojure, Rails/Ruby, Clojurescript/re-frame, React

● A passion for writing well designed, maintainable code using test/behavior driven development.

● Experience with SQL and/or NoSQL databases (We currently utilize PostgreSQL, Redis, Kafka, etc.).

● Strong unix skills (Linux and/or Mac OS X preferred)

● Experience with Git or a similar version control system

● Experience with AWS or similar cloud service providers

Desirable:

● Knowledge/Experience/interest in building reactive applications over WebSockets/SSE

● Experience with JRuby and Java integration

● Java, Hibernate, Spring

● Dev-ops experience using provisioning/orchestration/deployments technologies like Docker, Ansible, Chef, Kubernetes, etc.

● Experience with search engines (Elasticsearch, Solr, Lucene, etc.)

● Knowledge/experience with distributed processes, event sourcing, CQRS, Kafka and/or similar

jobs.content:

Other skills: VMWare, SAN, PKI, scripting (bash, perl, python, etc).  This is a 100% REMOTE, work-from-home position.  Must be a US Citizen with Top Secret clearance or ability to obtain one.

jobs.title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
jobs.content:
The Senior Quality Assurance Engineeris responsible for leading software quality assurance activities related to the quality, automation, reliability and compliance of Mitratech products. This position is responsible for driving the QA strategy and ensuring quality is achieved across all areas of the department.  This will involve defining and implementing QA strategies and promoting continuous quality achievement and improvement.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Managing QA teams of 2-3 people and contributing to the testing effort in a hands-on role

  • Participate in a Quality Assurance team that is responsible for ensuring all quality standards for the product are met

  • Works closely with QA Engineers to ensure quality is implemented as part of their processes and that quality standards are adhered to

  • Work with the QA Manager to evaluate and enhance SQA standards, technologies and approaches.

  • Review product requirements documents and create test cases to ensure code generated by the engineering team conforms to the specified requirements

  • Execute against testing protocols to ensure that the product is fully tested

  • Execute system and integration testing on the product

  • Work with various teams in the organization to ensure appropriate project requirements are met

  • Ability to carry out all policies and procedures as established by the team, department or company at large

  • Assist in automating the testing process by using test harnesses and automated test tools

  • Leadership role on projects and test design efforts

  • Provide input and proposals/recommendations for process improvements, technologies, and tools

  • Track and report quality assurance metrics for performance improvement and implement ongoing quality improvement processes

  • Assist in developing and implementing practices to raise quality during software development such as continuous integration, code coverage analysis, code quality tools, automated code testing tools

  • Assist in developing and implementing standards, methods, or procedures to determine product quality or release readiness

  • Create testing programs that address areas such as API and database impacts, software scenarios, performance testing, regression testing, negative testing, error or bug retests, and usability testing.

jobs.content:
The Software Engineer III is responsible for coding, testing and implementing products. Responsibilities include reviewing functional and technical requirements, performing research, designing solutions, and developing code in a variety of programming languages for a web-based enterprise application.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Create code that meets design specifications, follows standards, is of high quality and is easy to maintain.

  • Work with various teams in the organization to ensure appropriate project requirements are met

  • Perform unit, automation, and peer testing to ensure that the product is fully tested

  • Ensure that all work is properly documented

  • Ability to carry out all policies and procedures as established by the team, department or company at large

  • Provide training, give project demos, and other presentations as needed

  • Voluntary mentoring of others

  • Writing and/or contributing to design documents

  • Perform code reviews

  • Leadership role on projects and design efforts

  • Provide input and proposals/recommendations for code refactoring, process improvements, technologies, and tools

jobs.title: Editorial Intern
jobs.content:
Core77 is looking for an editorial intern for the winter semester. The editorial intern will be responsible for providing support for the editorial team’s web and social media efforts through research, writing and social media production. The intern’s responsibilities will include but are not limited to creating and sharing content on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, the Core77 calendar and Core77 newsletter.

The Editorial Intern reports to the Community Manager and Editorial Assistant to deliver research and content on a consistent and timely manner. The editorial intern will assist in producing and identifying content for the various properties owned and operated by Core77 working with additional product management teams as necessary and supporting contesting, production of imagery and identifying new platforms to amplify the Core77 brand.

POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES & SPECIFIC DUTIES

Primary Objectives—Core77.com
- Production of copy and content for Core77 social media channels (Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest)
- Promotional copy for social media and editorial project campaigns as necessary
- Managing editorial assignments and posts
- Execute daily searches for relevant social media content (videos, images, news, etc.)
- Assist in maintaining the Core77 calendar with regular design events around the world
- Attending design events as needed

General
- Reports to the Community Manager and Editorial Assistant
- Innate understanding and passion for social media
- Ability to understand and adapt writing ability to a brand voice
- Strong writing skills, from 140-character Tweet text to entertaining blog posts
- Good sense of humor
- Display a passion for design in all of its manifestations
- Option of working between 4-6 hours each day, 2-3 days each week— in-office schedule flexible
- Must be able to report to our offices in Manhattan

To apply, please send a resume, cover letter and responses to the short writing exercise below to recruiting@core77.com.

———
SOCIAL MEDIA COPY WRITING CHALLENGE (REQUIRED):

Please choose two of the four articles attached below. After reading, for each article please write:

– An alternative title option
– Twitter copy to promote the article under 140 characters (for example: “The real reason the Rebels want to destroy the Death Star? Fiscal concerns: http://bit.ly/2hezow6”)
– Facebook copy to promote the article

Articles:
1. http://www.core77.com/posts/58516/Spamusement-Japans-Combination-Spa-and-Amusement-Park
2. http://www.core77.com/posts/58308/A-Cheese-Glue-Gun-Backed-by-Buzzfeed
3. http://www.core77.com/posts/58053/adidas-Unveils-Another-Sustainable-Sneaker%E2%80%94They-Are-Spidermans-Dream
4. http://www.core77.com/posts/57646/3D-Printed-Bone-That-Squishes-In-a-Good-Way

jobs.title: Web Development Specialist
jobs.content:
Web Development Specialist

The Treasury Board Secretariat, Central Agencies I&IT Cluster, is looking for an individual with exceptional knowledge in web technologies and technical Internet design, to fill the role of Web Development Specialist.

What can I expect to do in this role?

In this role, you will:

  • Lead and coordinate the provision of web application code, developer guidance and support for Government of Ontario websites.
  • Provide support to the redesign/redevelopment activities of government websites.
  • Identify, analyze, and evaluate project requirements, develop project activity plans and schedules, and coordinate resources.
  • Maintain and support existing web standards.
  • Prepare and present reports and briefings to senior officials on specific projects assigned.

Note: These positions can be located in either the Toronto or Oshawa location.

Location: Toronto

How do I qualify?

Technical Knowledge:

  • You have knowledge of website hosting and maintenance methods.
  • You have knowledge of emerging web technologies and tools, open source web technologies, and web site usability and accessibility requirements.
  • You have conceptual and operational knowledge of current and accepted technical Internet design, development and management methods, including experience with agile software development methodologies.
  • You have knowledge and experience with “LAMP” (Linux, Apache or nginx, MySQL, PhP) environments, open source web technologies (especially WordPress, Lucene/Solr), distributed code management and Cloud deployment methodologies.

Systems Analysis and Problem-Solving Skills:

  • You can identify and assess web technology, specific site planning and development requirements and resource needs as they relate to program and service delivery requirements.
  • You can recommend and implement practical alternatives and solutions.
  • You can prepare business cases.

Communication, Consultation, and Interpersonal Skills:

  • You can provide consultative assistance, technical expertise, advice and recommendations.
  • You can prepare and present reports, plans and briefings.
  • You can establish credibility and foster effective and collegial work relationships with committees, project teams, cluster staff and managers.

Salary Range: $1,261.01 - $1,611.66 per week

Additional information:

  • 2 Permanent, 222 Jarvis St, Toronto, Toronto Region

Please apply online, only, at www.ontario.ca/careers, quoting Job ID 102951, by Wednesday, January 18, 2017. Please follow the instructions to submit your application. Faxes are not being accepted at this time.

If you require accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us at www.gojobs.gov.on.ca/ContactUs.aspx to provide your contact information. Recruitment Services staff will contact you within 48 hours. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

The Ontario Public Service is an inclusive employer. Accommodation will be provided in accordance with Ontario’s Human Rights Code.

www.ontario.ca/careers

jobs.title: Image Processing Software Developer and Production Engineer (JAVA) Consultant
jobs.content:
About HHMI:

Howard Hughes Medical Institute (HHMI) is a science philanthropy whose
mission is to advance biomedical research and science education for the
benefit of humanity. We empower exceptional scientists and students to
pursue fundamental questions about living systems, and work to share
scientific discoveries with researchers, students, and science-curious
individuals around the world.

Founded in 1953 by aviator and industrialist Howard R. Hughes, HHMI is
headquartered in Chevy Chase, Maryland, and employs more than 2,500 people
across the U.S. Visit hhmi.org/careers to learn more about working at HHMI.

About Janelia:

Janelia Research Campus is a pioneering research center in Ashburn,
Virginia, where scientists pursue fundamental questions in neuroscience and
imaging. The Howard Hughes Medical Institute (HHMI) launched Janelia in
2006, establishing an intellectually distinctive environment for scientists
to do creative, collaborative, hands-on work. To learn more about working at
Janelia, visit janelia.org/careers.

Summary:

Within a time-limited (twelve to eighteen month) collaborative project
between the Allen Institute for Brain Science and Janelia Research Campus
(HHMI) we seek a software engineer/consultant to facilitate the processing
of high-throughput serial section transmission electron microscopy data into
distortion free volumes for reconstruction of neural connectivity. The
software engineer/consultant will be working with engineers at both the
Allen Institute for Brain Science and the Howard Hughes Medical Institute
(Janelia Research Campus) in Ashburn, VA. The position is based in Ashburn,
VA, and some travel is expected.

Role:

  • Design and production of end-to-end data flow pipeline for large scale image registration
  • Expand existing Java and Matlab libraries
  • Wrapping the pipeline as a service - Documenting and administering individual components
  • Training other production engineers and scientists to use and expand the pipeline

Principal Responsibilities:

  • Will work closely with scientists & software engineers to oversee infrastructure for manipulating peta-scale electron microscopy data
  • Will work on automation of existing image data registration, processing and curation
  • Diagnose and troubleshoot,both independently and collaboratively
  • Evaluate & learn new software tools, practices & algorithms

Preferred Qualifications:

  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent education and experience)
  • Strong familiarity with Linux
  • Proficient in Java
  • Preferred: Experience with utilizing SQL and/or NoSQL data stores (e.g. MongoDB, PostgreSQL)
  • Preferred: Experience with image processing (ImageJ, Fiji or other)
  • Preferred: Experience with Matlab - Familiar with RESTful web services
  • Experience using Spark on an HPC cluster
  • Comfortable working with new programming languages and tools when necessary

HHMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Astonishing React Developer
jobs.content:
About You


You love Electron.


You are using React and Redux, and have a great front-end perspective, keeping accessibility principals, client site performance, and responsive design in mind.


You can architect a solution to solve client needs including different React configurations and interactions with other libraries — like templating libraries.


You're always trying out new languages, frameworks, exciting libraries, and leveraging them off, whenever necessary—digital is in your DNA, you love what you do, and it shows!


You enjoy working with complex data and creating fulfilling interactions. You're comfortable discussing how the tech will create business value with managers.


You are ready for your next challenge, with the flexibility to create your best work, again and again!

You're interested in creating MVPs and helping clients build their ideas to profit / exit.


You have a bunch of interesting accomplishments to tell us about or you've rejected offers from companies like Google, Facebook, or Twitter.

If you're not a native English speaker, people don't believe you didn't live abroad most of your life.

jobs.title: Spectacular Javascript Desktop Engineer
jobs.content:
You are : 


Someone with 2+ years working with front end JavaScript, including React, Redux and Electron.


Someone with experience in creating native desktop applications and can discuss the challenges when using Electron for Mac and Windows.


A strong communicator who can handle complexity in the design phase and ensure the team is addressing concerns.


Someone who gets things done , and has accomplishments with desktop applications including Electron.


Someone who loves learning, participating in the cutting edge product design and building new applications that will be used at the highest standard.


You have participated in the release of production applications at a world class standard.


You organize around milestones and deadlines in a meaningful way. You are enthusiastic about clear communication and believe in collaborating with a strong team.



About Clevertech : 


We believe that freedom, mastery and purpose, fuel motivation. Freedom as remote work. Mastery as dedicated to one project and that project is a world class project that will stretch you and purpose in the form of changing the world through software.


We also believe that the best team are filled with people who are humble, hungry, and smart with people.


We are professional and we move quickly.


You might have seen us around - we are growing and have been growing for some time. And that is due to the team of world class developers that are creating client satisfaction. If this sounds like something you want to be a part of, come join our team of over 100 developers.


Who are they? They’ve rejected offers from top companies. They are travelers who enjoy skiing in the morning and coding in the afternoon, aspiring entrepreneurs who want a tour of duty to learn how the pros do it, they are parents of young kids that want to work from home so they don't waste their commute missing their kids growing up.


Here’s what they have in common :


They want to be the best they can. They’re all invested in becoming better together and we support their constant learning.


For more about us, check out why.clevertech.biz



About the Job : 


At Clevertech, we understand why it’s great to be part of the gig economy—we also understand some of the challenges it can present.


By offering ongoing, full-time roles, we eliminate the burnout and guesswork involved in being a contract worker. We’re also interested in making it possible for our team to focus on what they do best. Busy work that gets in the way of high-quality code is our worst enemy!


Here’s how it works : 


We work with quality clients who have brilliant ideas they want to scale, scale, scale.


* Schedules are flexible—you work when you're in flow, from wherever you wish


* You focus on one client at a time; when you're finished with one, we provide another


* We use the latest tools and streamline every workflow imaginable


* Everyone on our team shares your culture, irrespective of where they are physically

jobs.content:
About You


You have 5+ years of  Node.js and front-end development experience.

About the Job


At Clevertech, we understand why it’s great to be part of the gig economy—we also understand some of the challenges it can present.


By offering ongoing, full-time roles, we eliminate the burnout and guesswork involved in being a contract worker. We’re also interested in making it possible for our team to focus on what they do best. Busy work that gets in the way of high-quality code is our worst enemy!


Here’s how it works:



  • We work with quality clients who have brilliant ideas they want to scale, scale, scale :)

  • Schedules are flexible—you work when you're in flow, from wherever you wish

  • You focus on one client at a time; when you're finished with one, we provide another

  • We use the latest tools and streamline every workflow imaginable

  • Everyone on our team shares your culture, irrespective of where they are physically

We’re also interested in making it possible for our team to focus on what they do best. Busy work that gets in the way of high-quality code is our worst enemy! Here’s how it works:

Mastery as dedicated to one project and that project is a world class project that will stretch you and Purpose in the form of changing the world through software.  We also believe that the best team are filled of people who are humble, hungry and smart with people.  We are professional and we move quickly. jobs.title: Senior System Engineer / DevOps
jobs.content:
What the team lead says about the team:


We enjoy to work on DevOps because we are in the centre of IT. The skills and tools that we and you need or will learn are very broad. We are passionate about automation and infrastructure-as-code. Because of these skills we are highly respected, and other teams constantly seeking advise and even taking internships with us.



Job Description




  • You are part of an independent and cross-functional development team sharing and ensuring system engineer’s best practices.

  • Sharing knowledge, developing solutions, consulting on operating systems and building the best CI/CD and deployment system for the team, thus closing the gap between plain development and system engineering.

  • You are responsible for the smooth operation of the Bonial platform, which operates in several countries including Germany, France and USA.

  • For new projects, you will kickstart the infrastructure by using tools like AWS and Terraform.

  • You will use the AWS service portfolio in order to deal with scalability, high availability and monitoring strategies.

  • You always strive for automation, monitoring, logging and sharing your results with others following practices like Chatops

jobs.title: Systems Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for Systems Operations Engineer to join the Global Technical Operations team at Ticketmaster in London. The key focus our team is to support website domains such as LiveNation.co.uk & GetmeIn.com to ensure the sites stay online and transactional 24 -7.


As a Systems Operations Engineer you will use your skills in website support and system administration to carry out the operational infrastructure tasks to; improve performance, build scripts to aid with automation & alerting as well as deploying code that the in-house developers have written.  You will be the driving force of performance reliability that supports improvement and new features to the customer’s experience.

jobs.title: Linux Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for Linux Operations Engineer to join the Global Technical Operations team at Ticketmaster in London.The key focus of our team is to support all Linux product suite currently in uses in many countries.


As a Linux Operations Engineer you will use your skills in application support of both frontend and backend products and system administration to carry out the operational infrastructure tasks to; improve performance, build scripts to aid with automation & alerting as well as deploying code that the in-house developers have written. You will be the driving force of performance reliability that supports improvement and new features to the customer’s experience.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
A Front End Engineer to deliver the build of festival websites for the UK’s leading festival promoter, Festival Republic.


This role will work closely with the digital coordinator, web editor and the digital designer to transform ideas and designs into exciting interactive experiences across our growing portfolio of festivals


The Festival Republic sites are based on a large scale Drupal platform that has evolved considerably in the past few years to cater for a wide variety of events and content management needs. You’ll work predominantly with our existing Drupal themes but not exclusively as there will be opportunities to create standalone projects to support individual marketing campaigns which can be done in your choice of technologies and should push the boundaries of what’s possible on the web.


In addition, we are constantly striving to push the Drupal platform front end stack forward and take advantage of the latest technologies and you’ll be expected to take an active role in deciding the future direction of the platform.


The successful candidate will be required to work on site at all of the UK festivals and events which usually span weekends. European events have their own marketing teams on the ground but often require content ideas and suggestions.


Technologies, platforms and principles we use:



  • Git, hosted on Bitbucket and a Gitflow workflow.

  • Linux based web platforms.

  • Sites built with Drupal utilising Aegir platforms, install profiles, drush make, features and migrate.

  • We try to keep our front end stack as independent from Drupal as possible. Our latest theme uses node.js/Gulp/Bower/LibSass/Bourbon and we currently maintain an older Ruby based stack.

  • We currently employ a combination of North CSS syntax and Atom design principles to create a CSS framework that underpins all of our festival sites and promotes DRY coding principles.

  • We aim to follow an Agile framework however on occasion projects have to happen without discovery sessions and meetings


Festival Republic is part of Live Nation Entertainment which is the world’s leading live entertainment company comprised of global market leaders: Ticketmaster, Live Nation Concerts, LN Media and Artist Nation Management.

jobs.title: CTO for Online Store
jobs.content:
We are looking for a highly proficient, independent, reliable and motivated Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to lead the IT infrastructure development and administrative processes at Tabletennis11.com.

Our headquarters and warehouse are located in Estonia - one of the most advanced digital societies in the world. Management and Marketing teams are working remotely from different locations in Europe. We also have a brick-and-mortar store in Paris downtown. You can work remotely anywhere in Europe or in our office in Narva, Estonia.

This is a leadership role and you will work closely with the Board members, CEO and CMO. As such, this is a huge opportunity to make your mark.

**Responsibilities**

* Help the company on the technical front. Be a strong leader of our IT processes.
* Continuously evolve the companyâs strategic technical direction.
* See the big picture of our IT infrastructure. Identify opportunities and risks for the business.
* Take over technical responsibility for code quality, system security and the entire development / technical administration being done on Tabletennis11âs IT infrastructure. Ensure its stability, speed and scalability.
* Manage external IT service providers or build up and lead internal IT team.

**Main Tasks**

* Make sure that all important technical things function smoothly.
* Suggest new technical improvements.
* Advise and inform the rest of the team about tech-related decisions and strategies.
* Set tasks for developers and control their progress.
* Hire new developers or development firms if needed.
* Maintain documentation of all key functions and modules with the developers.
* Provide trainings / presentations of new features to our team.
* Prepare the annual IT budget, control it and provide monthly reports.

jobs.title: Quantitative Developer - Associate Director
jobs.content:
Job Purpose


The Global Quantitative Analytics group builds software that plays a central role in the capital markets trading business.  The analytical software we develop is widely used across the bank, helping sales to price trades, trading to manage their risk and structuring to identify new opportunities.  This role offers a wide range of work including applying advanced techniques from computer science to build the analytics library and using your software engineering skills to improve the library design and build tools.  The candidate is expected to be capable of independent work and identifying new opportunities for the application of computer science, including data analytics and machine learning, within the capital markets trading business.  They will work in a small highly skilled team of Mathematicians, Computer Scientists and Physicists split between London, Toronto and New York. 


Main Objectives


The successful candidate will be a member of the Global Quantitative Analytics group, and will be expected to:



  • Play a strong role in improving and extending the design of the analytics library;

  • Use their advanced computer science knowledge to solve problems faced by capital markets trading, for example through the development of the framework for driving the analytics, interfaces to make analysis easier and other tools;

  • Develop tools and practices to aid other team members (e.g. code generators, regression test frameworks etc).


Deadline for applications: 1 February 2017

jobs.title: Ingénieur développeur Java R&D
jobs.content:
Dans le cadre de notre développement, nous recherchons un ingénieur développeur Java R&D qui participera à l’amélioration des progiciels de la suite JUMP AMS et JUMP Insurance.


Les problématiques étant complexes et le niveau de l’équipe de développement élevé, nous recherchons un ingénieur particulièrement compétent en développement orienté objet et désireux de se confronter à des problématiques de haut niveau.


En tant qu’ingénieur développeur R&D à JUMP, vous serez amené, en fonction de vos centres d’intérêts, à développer votre expertise dans différents domaines :



  • Algorithmique : développement de nouveaux algorithmes en réponse à des problématiques clients complexes.

  • Persistance et traitement des données : connexion à un flux temps réel, bases de données.

  • Performance : optimisation logicielle, développement concurrent et développement temps réel.

  • Développement multimédia : effets graphiques, fonctionnalités multimédia et améliorations ergonomiques.

  • Informatique en Finance de Marché : analyses, études de risque, fonctionnalités de passage d’ordres, ajouts de contrôles temps réels.


Volontariste, dynamique et rigoureux, vous avez le désir de développer votre expertise au sein d’une équipe jeune et dynamique. Avec JUMP, vous avez l’opportunité de rejoindre une entreprise en forte croissance sur un marché international et de bénéficier d’une rémunération attrayante, basée sur vos compétences et motivations.

jobs.name: University of Georgia, Lamar Dodd School of Art

jobs.title: Assistant Professor of Studio Art Core
jobs.company: University of Georgia, Lamar Dodd School of Art
jobs.content:
Studio Art Core - Assistant Professor Position

The Lamar Dodd School of Art at the University of Georgia invites applications for the tenure-track position of Assistant Professor of Studio Art Core. Priority will be given to applications received by January 15, 2017. We will receive applications for this position through the University of Georgia, Faculty Jobs website (https://facultyjobs.uga.edu/) and SlideRoom.
• Letter of application
• Teaching Philosophy
• List of 3 references
• Curriculum vitae
• 10 Examples of current research/creative practice
• 10 Examples of student work
IMPORTANT:
Your research/creative practice and examples of student work must be uploaded to SlideRoom at http://artuga.slideroom.com. Applicants may upload images, video, music or PDF documents. For good image quality and fast upload, your image files should be sized no larger than 1220 px @ 72 dpi. The SlideRoom portal offers additional instruction for submitting work. For technical assistance, access the help desk at http://slideroom.zendesk.com

Successful candidates will have a proven record of active research/creative practice as an artist and/or designer, with an emerging or established reputation within his/her area of expertise. Working collaboratively with colleagues from across the School of Art, the successful candidate will bring an entrepreneurial spirit, along with management and organizational skills, to lead new innovations in a Studio Art Core curriculum. Thus, candidates must be able to demonstrate knowledge of current and emerging trends in first-year arts education, be knowledgeable and actively engaged with issues in contemporary art and design, and capable of creating a critical and inventive environment in the classroom inclusive of interdisciplinary and collaborative practices. Candidates whose expertise and research are one or more of the following areas are highly desirable:
• New Media or Algorithmic Art
• Social practice or Activism
• Entrepreneurial Art and Design
• Data Visualization
In addition, curricular development, mentorship of graduate student teachers and part-time faculty, and coordination with other studio areas are important components of this appointment. Candidates whose teaching and research can take advantage of opportunities for collaboration within the School of Art and the University at large will be viewed favorably.

This position requires an MFA degree with an active creative practice and research agenda. It includes a teaching load of 2 courses per semester, with a commitment to teaching Studio Art Core courses. Additional teaching opportunities in upper level courses and summer teaching may be available. Active engagement in the community of the School is expected including service on committees.

Minimum Qualifications
• An MFA in Studio Art or Design, or comparable terminal degree.

Preferred Qualifications
• Two years teaching experience beyond graduate school
• Expertise and research in one of these areas:
+ New Media or Algorithmic Art
+ Social practice or Activism
+ Interdisciplinary Design
+ Entrepreneurial Art and Design
+ Data Visualization
• Experience with programming and curriculum development
• Ability/Desire to mentor graduate student teachers and part time faculty
• Demonstrated leadership skills

Housed within a tier-one research university located approximately 60 miles east of Atlanta, the Lamar Dodd School of Art is an impressive, nationally-ranked art school with state of the art facilities and internationally renown faculty dedicated to cross-disciplinary and medium specific approaches. The School of Art has robust undergraduate and graduate programs and offers degrees in the fields of art, design, art education and art history. The School of Art is committed to maintaining diverse population and practices a wide range of methodologies within the fields of Art, Design, Art History and Art Education.

The University of Georgia is the first state-chartered university in America and celebrated the 225th anniversary of its charter in 2010-11. It is a comprehensive land and sea grant university located in Athens, Georgia, 70 miles northeast of Atlanta, the state capital (www.visitathensga.com; www.uga.edu). The University, with over 35,000 students and 2,900 faculty members, is one of the four major units of the Georgia System of Higher Education and offers programs of study at the doctoral level in most fields. In addition to its home campus, The University of Georgia maintains and is expanding its list of study-abroad programs around the world. Georgia is well known for its quality of life in regard to both outdoor and urban activities (www.exploregeorgia.org).

The Lamar Dodd School of Art at the University of Georgia has over 45 full-time faculty members in studio art, design, art education, and art history, administering undergraduate and graduate programs to 1,000 majors and graduate students. The Franklin College of Art & Sciences, its many units, and the University of Georgia are committed to increasing the diversity of its faculty and students, and sustaining a work and learning environment that is inclusive. Women, minorities and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply. The University of Georgia is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or protected veteran status. Faculty members are expected to support the college’s goals of creating and sustaining a diverse and inclusive learning environment.

jobs.title: Concepteur logiciel système de préparation et contrôle de Mission H/F
jobs.content:
Intégré(e) à la direction technique, au sein du département en charge du développement logiciel, vous concevez un logiciel opérationnel de préparation de mission. Le logiciel de préparation de mission intégré à une station sol permet à un opérateur de préparer (i.e. caractériser) les données nécessaires à un missile de croisière pour accomplir sa (ou ses) mission(s). Ces logiciels opérationnels mettent en œuvre des technologies complexes : IHM évoluées, architectures complexes et algorithmes multiples modélisant le comportement du missile. Vous interviendrez sur l'ensemble des phases de développement du logiciel (spécification, architecture, développement, intégration...).


Dans ce cadre, vous serez en charge de :



  • Analyser de façon critique des spécifications fonctionnelles et logicielles, participer à leur rédaction le cas échéant (SysML / UML...)

  • Concevoir le logiciel selon une architecture orientée services (REST/SOA) et en cohérence avec une stratégie ligne de produit induisant l'utilisation de frameworks dédiés,

  • Participer à l'implémentation en JAVA pour les parties graphiques (aide à la décision, affichages cartographiques, affichages 2D/3D, ...) ou participer à l'implémentation en C++ d'algorithmes dédiés au pilotage, guidage et à la navigation,

  • Intégrer et valider le logiciel dans le produit final avec le client interne

jobs.title: Intégrateur/Valideur des Logiciels Centre de Commande et de Contrôle H/F
jobs.content:
Au sein du département Logiciel Systèmes et rattaché(e) à un Responsable Projet Logiciel, vous assurez le développement et l'intégration de composants logiciels de type « Centre de Commande et de Contrôle » et Installation de Tirs. Vous êtes impliqué(e) sur l'ensemble du cycle de développement, depuis la phase amont de spécification des besoins jusqu‘à la phase de validation et d‘intégration ainsi que le support auprès des utilisateurs.


Dans le cadre des activités de validation, en fonction des phases du projet, vous êtes responsable de :



  • Participer aux revues des spécifications pour analyser la testabilité des exigences, et identifier les moyens de tests nécessaires,

  • Élaborer la stratégie de tests, en cohérence avec les essais systèmes,

  • Rédiger le plan de tests,

  • Participer à la définition des moyens de test,

  • Piloter ou assurer le déroulement des campagnes de test logiciels,

  • Assurer un support auprès des équipes Essais.


Dans le cadre des activités d'intégration, en fonction des phases du projet, vous êtes responsable de :



  • Assurer l‘intégration plateforme matérielle : intégration des logiciels sur les équipements hardware cibles,

  • Être garant de l‘intégration plateforme logicielle : gestion de configuration, maîtrise de la configuration,

  • Assurer le déroulement des campagnes de test d'intégration,

  • Effectuer une première analyse des défauts rencontrés en lien avec l'équipe de développement,

  • Assurer un support auprès des équipes Système et Essais.


Vous réalisez votre mission dans un environnement de haute technologie nécessitant des développements logiciel complexes. Vous êtes en interface permanente avec de nombreux domaines. Vous êtes amené(e) à travailler sur des projets d'envergure internationale.

jobs.title: Chef de projet logiciel H/F
jobs.content:
Au sein du département logiciel, vous êtes intégré(e) au service en charge de la réalisation et de la mise à disposition d'une suite logicielle pour simuler les environnements variés et stimuler les interfaces des produits et équipements MBDA.
Ce logiciel commun, multi-projets et multi-utilisateurs, est géré sous la forme d'une ligne produit, modulable en fonction des nombreux projets qui l'utilisent dans les 3 pays (France, UK et Italie). Dans un environnement temps réel contraint, il pilote du matériel (instruments de mesure, bus numériques à haut débit série, Ethernet, vidéo, ...) et offre des interfaces graphiques (IHM) évoluées et intuitives.


Dans ce cadre, vos principales missions seront d'organiser et piloter les activités de développement logiciel pour  répondre aux enjeux des différents projets de MBDA France et UK.


A ce titre, vous :



  • Pilotez, animez et coordonnez sur les plans techniques, financiers et calendaires les travaux de la suite logicielle en répondant aux exigences, dans les domaines des logiciels temps réel et non temps réel pour les moyens d'essais et de simulation des programmes phares de MBDA,

  • Respectez les coûts, délais et performances et effectuer un point d'avancement régulier avec les responsables projets,

  • Définissez les designs des composants logiciels de son périmètre en s'appuyant sur le comité produit,

  • Réalisez le plan de charge de son périmètre,

  • Participez à la définition et à la réalisation de la prochaine version majeure pour répondre aux nouveaux enjeux stratégiques de MBDA,

  • Planifiez et encadrer l'ensemble des travaux de préparation et de réalisation des formations à nos logiciels,

  • Promouvez notre suite logicielle en France et à l'international (au sein de MBDA, dans les 3 pays : France, Angleterre et Italie).

  • Encadrez techniquement 5 à 7 personnes (MBDA et sous-traitance).


Vous serez rattaché(e) hiérarchiquement au responsable du service et fonctionnellement aux différents responsables projet sous-système banc de test (RPSS). Des interfaces variées, en particulier avec les nombreux clients internes (chefs de projet, architectes, développeurs et utilisateurs), au sein de différentes entités (en France, en Angleterre et en Italie), demandent un bon relationnel pour mener à bien les travaux confiés.

jobs.title: Spécialiste Méthode Outils Logiciel H/F
jobs.content:
Au sein du département logiciel, dans l'équipe "Méthodes et outils", vous contribuez à l'amélioration et au développement des techniques logicielles, au niveau international, pour accroître la technicité et la productivité de nos équipes, auprès desquelles vous assurerez le support.
Vous aurez plus particulièrement la responsabilité du support de la gestion de configuration pour les équipes du Plessis Robinson et de Bourges.


Dans ce cadre, vos missions principales sont sur deux axes :



  • Support Ingénierie Logicielle:


    • Assurer le support des outils associés aux phases de codage (IDE, compilateur, debuggeur, ...)

    • Assurer la veille technologique sur les outils et méthodes de développement logiciel

    • Proposer régulièrement des améliorations et innovations de nos outils et méthodes

    • Recueillir auprès des équipes projets, les idées et besoins d'amélioration

    • Gérer la relation avec nos fournisseurs d'outils et administrer les licences associées





  • Support de la gestion de configuration :

    • Apporter un support méthodologique aux projets du département vis à vis de leur gestion de configuration

    • A l'international, travailler à l'harmonisation des pratiques de l'entité Software Product Line Capability

    • Participer avec le département informatique à la maintenance de l'outil




Des déplacements en France et à l'étranger sont possibles.

jobs.title: Ingénieur Développement Logiciel H/F
jobs.content:
Au sein du département Logiciel Systèmes et rattaché(e) à un Responsable Projet Logiciel, vous assurez le développement de composants logiciels de type « Centre de Commande et de Contrôle » et Installation de Tirs.


Vous êtes impliqué(e) sur l’ensemble du cycle de développement, depuis la phase amont de spécification des besoins jusqu’à la phase de validation et d’intégration ainsi que le support auprès des utilisateurs.
Dans ce cadre, vous êtes responsable de :



  • participer à l'élaboration des spécifications techniques et à la conception des composants logiciels,

  • assurer les phases de développement et de tests unitaires,

  • intervenir sur les phases d’intégration et de validation fonctionnelle,

  • assurer le suivi et le reporting de l’avancement des développements logiciels.

  • contribuer activement aux développements des process et des méthodologies inhérents à l’activité.


Vous réalisez votre mission dans un environnement de haute technologie et vous êtes en interface permanente avec de nombreux domaines. Vous êtes amené(e) à travailler sur des projets d’envergure, stratégiques et innovants nécessitant le développement de logiciels complexes.

jobs.title: Sales Assistant- Herman Miller Flagship Store
jobs.content:
Sales Assistant
The Sales Assistant will work with the Operations and Logistics Lead to ensure that all operational and logistics needs are met in the functioning of the store.

Responsibilities
• Assist with special and custom orders
• Maintain shop displays
• Maintain stock areas
• Cooperate with and help shop personnel as needed and promote a positive team spirit
• Assist with cycle counts and/or physical inventories
• Field customer phone inquiries, while providing top-notch customer service
• Tag and receive new merchandise into the shop
• Maintain inventory of fabric swatch program, all marketing collateral (catalogs, signage, tear sheets) and shop materials (bags, tissue paper, supplies)
• Assist with a variety of shop transformations, from complete shop turn-overs, to temporary exhibition spaces, to new window displays
• Facilitate in-shop events, from planning phase through execution
• Assist with regular shop maintenance, working with Facilities to ensure cleanliness and safety
• Perform data entry as needed (entering customer addresses, drop ship POs, etc.)
• Work from the shop location
• Follow company policies and procedures, including attendance, personal conduct, dress code, and employee discount
• Additional tasks as assigned by management

Required Skills
• 1-2 years experience in Interior Design, Architecture, or related fields
• Undergraduate degree preferred
• Demonstrates a passion for design and other creative pursuits
• Keen attention to detail
• Superior communication skills, both verbal and written
• Self-motivated
• Ability to routinely move objects up to 50 pounds
• Proficient in MS Office
• Ability to work evenings, weekends, and holidays
Design Within Reach is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer (minorities/women/veterans/disabilities).

Apply Here: http://www.Click2Apply.net/69fvc7477d

jobs.title: Designer and CSS Expert
jobs.content:
Do you take great pleasure in designing user interfaces that are both functionally elegant and visually beautiful? Do you obsess over bringing your impeccable sense of aesthetics to how you write code? Do you enjoy discovering how to do things in CSS that most developers thought were only possible using JavaScript? Are you tired of working for short-lived  start-ups that think "angel funding" is a business model and "VC Funding" is an exit? Then, my friend, we've got the job for you. Our growing, profitable company is seeking to add a talented, motivated expert designer to take our product the next level.

Specific Responsibilities:

  • You'll develop beautiful visual designs which will be at the center of our creative process. You're an expert user of Sketch, inVision, Photoshop and related tools.
  • You'll see problems in UX, UI or design processes and proactively work to fix them, contributing to both our digital assets and the overall success of the business. 
  • In addition to clear and frequent written communication, you'll video conference daily with team members to design and refine new features for the product, marketing websites, email campaigns and more.
  • You have strong opinions loosely held; you enjoy vigorously defending what you know to be right as much as you enjoy being wrong when the best answers wins.
  • You enjoy the challenge of accurately estimating your work and ensuring its on-time completion. You're loath to have your co-workers discover bugs you've missed.
  • As an expert craftsperson you enjoy writing beautiful and succinct CSS, SASS, and HTML, exerting complete control over modern browsers; your designs are fast and bug-free on mobile and desktop devices.
  • You'll tend to design mobile-first, working up through tablet and desktop to create responsive designs that work well on any device.
  • You thrive in a remove working environment where you define completely your own setup and interact with exclusively via computer; you go wherever you want.

About Us:

  • Pathable (http://pathable.com) is the leading provider of mobile event apps and online community platforms for conferences, tradeshows, events, and associations. From 10,000 doctors at a convention center to 200 community organizers meeting for a weekend, our software improves the entire experience of attending in-person conferences and events. 
  • Though we develop products delivered over the Internet, as a nearly 10 year-old profitable company, we're not quite a startup anymore. We're fortunate to have room to innovate and experiment as we develop new products and services.
  • Managed and majority owned by the original founders, we've got the freedom to chart our own course -- our only influence is what's best for our customers. 
  • From the beginning our culture has supported and embraced remote workers. We don't have an office and the Pathable family lives or is traveling in over 10 countries. Our members enjoy more time with their children, living in remote and unusual places, or exploring the world; all while growing professionally and building things about which they are proud.
  • We're building a new product, from the ground up, using the latest tools, integrated everything we've learned from nearly 10 years of product development to the same market. 

Benefits:

  • Accrued paid vacation
  • Paid holidays
  • Medical benefits

To apply: Please visit https://www.jsco.re/lwwr and be sure to enter your portofilo URL in the field marked XKCDTHX1138
