jobs.content:
Lead Software Engineer – C++ (Windows / Linux)


In our Lead Software Engineer position, you will be a key player at TCG and have many responsibilities, including substantially contributing to the advancement of technical development projects and the design and enhancement of TCG’s communication software systems while providing important supervision and mentoring for others.   You will also have the opportunity to work with our customers and prospects to identify the best technical solutions for their unique application needs. This is a career move, not a job move.


Essence of the Position 


You, as the successful Lead Software Engineer candidate, will have well developed C++ skills in a Windows and/or Linux environment, ideally for military systems.  You will also have experience with TCP/IP, UDP, and sockets.  Finally, you will have mentored or supervised one to several people in a professional environment

jobs.title: Technical Lead, Java / Scala Developer
jobs.content:
Position Description:




Candidate will be a Technical Lead, Java/Scala Developer responsible for the back end service layer for a new project for the banking book investments. The banking book investments (BBI) application will serve as a book of records for the firm’s investments on the banking book and is considered a crucial application in the finance regulatory and reporting space.




For this project, they will be responsible for the following areas




1.Technical analysis and design
2.Development of middleware and/or database and/or GUI components
3.Integration between various in-house sources of data




Candidate will be required to work across organizational boundaries and participate in discussions on technical and business issues. They will be an independent software developer of complex solutions using Java and/or Scala technology. The candidate should be able to mentor junior resources.

jobs.title: Java technical lead
jobs.content:
Position Description:



Product Reference Data (ProRD) is the authoritative source of externally verifiable Product and Corporate Action data for the Morgan Stanley business. This is achieved through the development and operation of a consolidated cross-asset processing platform that enables a high quality, multi-source, preference-based solution to cost effectively enable Morgan Stanley’s business objectives and regulatory reporting obligations.




Primary Responsibilities



Technical Lead for design and development of new functionality in the firm’s centralized Enterprise Announcements and Dividend Projections systems. It requires cross-department and cross-divisional collaboration with other technical teams and architects
Manage a team of near-shore and off-shore developers in the delivery of Product Reference Data strategic deliverables with a focus on Corporate Actions.
Oversight of small enhancement service and general BAU for Enterprise Announcements and Dividend Projections systems and Release planning, prioritization and coordination with Project Management and Primary Consumers of Product Reference Data Services.
Liaising with BA in documenting BRDs (Business Requirements Documents), and providing Functional Documentation and Platform Topology
Coordination with QA in Regression Testing, and On-Boarding of L1/L2 Support.



 


Key Projects:



Equity Corporate Actions workflow and automation
Introduce new architecture and data model to create golden copy of Corporate Actions sourced from numerous external and internal sources and to enable a transparent and automated application of Corporate Actions to Product Reference Data



Institutional Securities and Wealth Management consolidation of Fixed Income Principal and Interest events
Design and build out of Java based multi-threaded loaders for Corporate Actions processing and to port legacy single-threaded C++ loaders to new infrastructure

jobs.title: Juju Core Engineer
jobs.content:
Canonical, the company behind Ubuntu, is seeking a software engineer on the Juju Networking team. This role is critical to the success of the Juju product. In this position, you will not just write code; but will be defining and solving very complex cloud networking problems within a model driven environment. Example problems include handling of overlay networks, public and private networks on a single L2 device across OpenStack, bare metal, containers and public clouds. These exciting challenges make our customerâs experience modeling Big Software like OpenStack, Big Data and Kubernetes across bare metal and public/private clouds a breeze.

Juju is the leading operations modeling tool. We aspire to be at the center of a revolution in the datacenter, moving from âhardware definedâ static resource allocation, to a new dynamic software defined datacenter. By bringing your in-depth cloud networking skills, this will enable our customers to build dynamic and scalable solutions to their orchestration problems.

Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, in particular, software defined networking and modern networking topologies. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context.

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

  • Networking expertise, especially with modern network topologies and software defined networks.
  • Experience with production deployments and network configurations of OpenStack.
  • Experience with networking functionality of multiple major public cloud providers.
  • Understanding of container networks.
  • Experience with LInux networking fundamentals.
  • Knowledge of tun/tap devices, veth pairs, GRE tunnels, bridges, VLANS, network bonds, routing, iptables, L2/L3 topologies.
  • Experience with IPv6.
  • Experience with the Go programming language is a plus otherwise C or similar experience required.
  • Lead by example by being a respected and effective team lead on the juju-core networking project.
  • Must be able to travel at least two times a year for a week at a time.

To apply: https://ldd.tbe.taleo.net/ldd03/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=CANONICAL&cws=1&rid=1212

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Full Stack
jobs.content:
Olo’s software engineers develop the next-generation of digital ordering technologies for many of the country’s largest and fastest-growing restaurant brands. We are laser focused on continually improving ourselves and our products while prioritizing relationships at work and at home. We thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment, collaborating with some of the best engineers across the nation.


Our current technologies include modern versions of C#, F#, ASP.NET MVC, Ember, React, Javascript, HTML/CSS, Xamarin, and MSSQL. We also rely on tools such as AWS, GitHub, TeamCity, and Octopus.


As a part of Olo’s Engineering team, you will play a significant and visible role in helping us build one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the market. You will help us build new features and products, with responsibilities that span software design, test automation, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of our applications and services.


Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, nearly half of our engineering team is remote!

We are laser focused on continually improving ourselves and our products while prioritizing relationships at work and at home. We thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment, collaborating with some of the best engineers across the nation.


Our current technologies include modern versions of C#, F#, ASP.NET MVC, Ember, React, Javascript, HTML/CSS, Xamarin, and MSSQL. We also rely on tools such as AWS, GitHub, TeamCity, and Octopus.


As a part of Olo’s Engineering team, you will play a significant and visible role in helping us build one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the market. You will help us build new features and products, with responsibilities that span software design, test automation, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of our applications and services.


Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, nearly half of our engineering team is remote!

jobs.title: Cloud Solutions Developer
jobs.content:
What Will You Do?


You will be working on the development of web and mobile applications in the Cloud and in environments of the customer’s choice. We need an individual who takes a specific interest in building upon the latest of Google’s various Cloud Platform products, and other 3rd-party systems, to create robust and complete solutions for our customers.


Software development projects will range from Google App Scripts to full, web/mobile applications. Understanding and potentially being able to use different tools in the appropriate situation, such as AngularJS, React, Backbone, Mustache, jQuery, Python, Go and Node.js will be important – as is the ability to solve problems with a variety of tools. You have built applications on Google App Engine and/or Container Engine or other cloud platforms, and are comfortable modeling data with Google’s Datastore, specifically NDB.  If the following site excites you, that’s a big step in the right direction: http://javascript.crockford.com/


Who are You?


You spend hours learning web/mobile development frameworks, and are never satisfied with a solution being ‘good enough’.  Keeping up with the most cutting edge technology the world has to offer – you know that the Google Cloud Platform is poised to be the most advanced system in the world.


You’ve already built some apps that integrate with their REST APIs, and consider yourself skilled in Apps Script, App Engine, Compute Engine, Container Engine, DataStore, CloudSQL, Coud Storage, Big Query and are eager to expand your knowledge of the Maps APIs and Machine Learning.  You’ve got a few go to frameworks like Angular.js and jQuery, and have experience developing applications in Java, Python, PHP, Go, Angular.js and other JavaScript libraries. 


Responsibilities:



  • Develop professional, highly scalable and interactive web and mobile applications as custom solutions for clients

  • Full lifecycle application development

  • Designing, coding and debugging applications in various software languages.
    Software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software review, identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, software reliability analysis using the Agile Scrum development process

  • Performance unit-based software testing and quality assurance while building out the application

  • Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, automation

  • Support, maintain and document software functionality

  • Integrate software with existing systems

  • Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation

  • Work closely with Project Manager on client discovery, project estimating and project progression, testing, deployment, and iterations

  • Maintain standards compliance


NOTE: No sponsorship for US residency, No agencies, No Candidates outside the US or Canada

jobs.title: Software Developer (Functional Programming)
jobs.content:
Software Developer

Jane Street is a proprietary quantitative trading firm, focusing primarily on trading equities and equity derivatives. We use innovative technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of markets to stay successful in our highly competitive field. We operate around the clock and around the globe, employing over 400 people in offices in New York, London and Hong Kong.

The markets in which we trade change rapidly, but our intellectual approach changes faster still. Every day, we have new problems to solve and new theories to test. Our entrepreneurial culture is driven by our talented team of traders and programmers. At Jane Street, we don't come to work wanting to leave. We come to work excited to test new theories, have thought-provoking discussions, and maybe sneak in a game of ping-pong or two. Keeping our culture casual and our employees happy is of paramount importance to us.

We are looking to hire great software developers with an interest in functional programming. OCaml, a statically typed functional programming language with similarities to Haskell, Scheme, Erlang, F# and SML, is our language of choice. We've got the largest team of OCaml developers in any industrial setting, and probably the world's largest OCaml codebase. We use OCaml for running our entire business, supporting everything from research to systems administration to trading systems. If you're interested in seeing how functional programming plays out in the real world, there's no better place.

The atmosphere is informal and intellectual. There is a focus on education, and people learn about software and trading, both through formal classes and on the job. The work is challenging, and you get to see the practical impact of your efforts in quick and dramatic terms. Jane Street is also small enough that people have the freedom to get involved in many different areas of the business. Compensation is highly competitive, and there's a lot of room for growth.

You can learn more about Jane Street and our technology from our main site, janestreet.com. You can also look at a a talk given at CMU about why Jane Street uses functional programming (http://ocaml.janestreet.com/?q=node/61), and our programming blog (http://ocaml.janestreet.com).

We also have extensive benefits, including:

  • 90% book reimbursement for work-related books
  • 90% tuition reimbursement for continuing education
  • Excellent, zero-premium medical and dental insurance
  • Free lunch delivered daily from a selection of restaurants
  • Catered breakfasts and fresh brewed Peet's coffee
  • An on-site, private gym in New York with towel service
  • Kitchens fully stocked with a variety of snack choices
  • Full company 401(k) match up to 6% of salary, vests immediately
  • Three weeks of paid vacation for new hires in the US
  • 16 weeks fully paid maternity/paternity leave for primary caregivers, plus additional unpaid leave

More information at http://janestreet.com/culture/benefits/

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Analyst
jobs.content:
The Quality Analyst is responsible for the testing and validating of software and systems to ensure that internal and external customers’ requirements and needs are met. Creating test plans/cases, working with developers, and evaluating both the functional and subjective quality of projects for the software development team. Your willingness to listen and improve, problem solve, and take charge in quality improvement and control will help us succeed and innovate our products.  The QA Analyst will be also be responsible for finding problems with design and root causes for bugs before they can be discovered by our customer base.



  • Serve as key point of contact for all QA related aspects, providing services and coordinating resources.

  • Oversee aspects of quality assurance. Include metrics and if needed, find or develop new tools to ensure goals are met.

  • Engage and collaborate with development teams to effectively leverage test environments and processes.

  • Monitor and communicate with internal stakeholders regarding major issues impacting products and projects.

  • Develop and execute test cases, scripts, plans, and procedures

  • Produce and prioritize bug submissions

  • Manage QA workflows to be integrated across multiple projects

  • Working with product design and developers at all stages to promote quality

  • Ability to grasp new concepts and technologies

jobs.title: Senior Software Development Engineer (iOS)
jobs.content:
We’re proud to say that we’re up there amongst the UK's top 10 credit card providers. Since our beginning we’ve been a company built on bold, new ideas and entrepreneurial spirit. In an ever changing financial landscape we’re transforming to a technology company that happens to do credit, always on, and striving for the breakthroughs that will change banking for good.

Changing banking for good is not an idle statement, it’s our core vision and applies to everything we do. For us, it’s a no brainer. A happy customer is a loyal customer. By bringing innovation, simplicity, and, most importantly, humanity to the financial services industry we will succeed in delivering this mission.

We are transforming ourselves into a FinTech company. We have two development centres; Nottingham and London and in these we are delivering the next big things that will help our customers succeed.

We’d like you to be part of it.

  • An obsession for delivering quality products to our customers is at the heart of everything we do. We are a maturing agile organisation, our teams operate with a great deal of empowerment; collaborating with product owners, designers and stakeholders to deliver great software.

  • We are just beginning our journey into the cloud and have problems of scale, security, availability and performance for you to help solve. We try to solve these using internal and external open-source solutions wherever possible.

  • We love continuous learning and that’s why we give you 10% of your time to work on cutting edge innovative projects that shape the way we will work in the future.

  • Additionally, Capital One has been voted the Best Workplace for the last 3 years. We’re also recognised for our work in treating customer fairly.

  • You will excel in end to end software development and have breadth and technical depth in more than one area. Your strong design, analytical and problem solving skills will be crucial to our success.

  • As well as technical skill, you’ll need the people skills to collaborate across the business – not to mention creativity and drive to make things happen.

As a Senior Software Development Engineer, you’ll support the Dev Manager and work as part of a multidisciplinary team of engineers delivering best-of-class software for our customers to use on their mobile devices; changing the way they interact with their finances.

With excellent programming skills in a couple of languages and extensive commercial experience developing software for the iOS platform (Swift/Objective-C) - in an Agile environment - you’ll be collaborating with product owners and designers on feature development, as well as mentoring other engineers and advising managers.

Tools like Xcode, XCTest, OCMock/OCMockito, Jenkins and Git are second nature to you. A working knowledge of UI test automation frameworks is a big plus.

Your passion for software engineering and innovation means you’re always looking to gain experience with new platforms and languages and have a keen eye on what’s coming next. Hackathons are your thing and you’re likely to be actively engaged with the wider development community.

We offer a very competitive rewards package, a great pension scheme, bonus, generous holiday entitlement and private medical insurance. You can look forward to a host of other benefits including cycle to work and season ticket loans.

Capital One is committed to diversity in the workplace.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer (API & Integrations)
jobs.content:
Welcome to a world of innovation, problem solving and engineering excellence. Over the past 20 years we've been a company built on bold, new ideas and entrepreneurial spirit. Today we are amongst the UK's top 10 credit card providers, in no small part thanks to our technology teams.

Our next exciting journey is a transformation from a financial company with great tech into a technology company that just happens to offer financial products. Across our two engineering centres, in Nottingham and London, we have an obsession for delivering quality products within a maturing agile environment. You could be part of that mission to help customers succeed and change banking for good. The API & Integrations teams are at the forefront of modern banking; whether its working with a commercial partner, smaller startups or directly with our customers.

As a senior/lead engineer at our Nottingham office you will work within an agile feature team on a wide array of intriguing problems; such as API authentication, on-boarding external developers and auto-scaling infrastructure. Our teams have a high degree of empowerment to own their products from design to production. We are just beginning a journey into the cloud and want you to help take us there.

We are looking for a passionate and driven engineer who is not only a world-class Java developer but also comfortable working with stakeholders within and outside the team. You know how to build innovative solutions, engage the team to deliver at a higher quality and can break down technical designs into non-technical language. Each team has only one engineer like yourself; you are the keystone that brings together an array of amazing talent into a vehicle for high-cadence technical delivery.

This isn't a line management role; we call you an "individual contributor" who is at the top of their game and has a passion to focus on engineering over management. At Capital One we cherish engineers like you and have excellent career development opportunities that don't require you to become a people manager.

Your Responsibilities

  • Coach and mentor a highly skilled team of primarily back-end engineers
  • Collaborating and engaging with Product/Business stakeholders all the way up to VP level
  • A key technical influencer in company-wide software architecture decisions
  • Capability to find the right way to unlock business value, not just the "best" or "fastest"

Your Skills

  • World-class modern Java engineer, able to get under the hood and teach others
  • Well-exercised system and architecture design skill set
  • Embodies the engineering method, a great problem solver

Our Company

Capital One is not your traditional old-fashioned financial institution. We’ve adopted agile ways of working across the company, not just in tech, and so one of the first thing you'll notice about our office is all the post-it notes! We've been in the top-5 "Best Places to Work" for several years. Our Nottingham head office reflects the fun and relaxed corporate attitude; from the award-winning subsidised canteen and coffee bar through to the copious breakout/chill-out spaces and on-site gym.

As an engineer we know you need the right technology to get the job done. Which means a modern MacBook pro and great desk setup (everyone gets a standing desk too).

The Benefits

In addition to a great workplace and great kit, we offer the traditional, and very competitive, rewards package. Including a great pension scheme, bonus, generous holiday entitlement and private medical insurance. You can look forward to a host of other benefits including cycle to work and season ticket loans.

Capital One is committed to diversity in the workplace.

As a Software Developer in Quality Engineering you will have a passion for delivering high quality systems. You will play a critically important role in our software engineering teams. You'll be a part the feature delivery planning process and working directly with the developers in order to deliver innovative, best in class software for our customers. Your designs will include identifying user scenarios, establishing quality criteria and building test automation harnesses that will allow complex testing to be performed at a code, API and user interface level. You'll also conduct research on emerging technologies to analyse systems, decompose complicated software systems and design a strategies to test them, building advanced and automated test suites to exercise our ground breaking products. You will provide high quality reporting on product readiness and verify proper testing coverage and procedures both independently and collectively in a team environment.  Our current toolbox includes Gherkin, Cucumber, Ruby, Calabash, Java and Selenium.

jobs.title: Java Developer f/m
jobs.content:
Smaato is hiring a Java Developer due to growth and demand within our industry. This is an opportunity to work for a world-class company providing an innovative platform product that could change the way the next generation understands advertising!


The Java Developer we are seeking for is experienced and passionate about software development, and is willing to support the development of our overall application ecosystem. Currently our platform, built with  cutting edge technology, is processing around 10 billion inbound advertising queries per day. Each incoming request generates multiple outbound requests to our partners. The Senior Java Developer is a technologist and innovator who brings passionate inquisitiveness, primary research, and forward thinking to every assignment.


The key responsibilities include but are not limited to



  • Developing solutions to User Story based requirements.

  • Building software to pass automated acceptance tests and delivery of Sprint commitments

  • Mentoring Junior Developers.

  • Sharing responsibility for all team deliverable, and favoring informal communications with Product Owners and with other stakeholders within the company.

  • Engaging positively on the Scrum Team.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer

Dallas, TX (North Dallas)

What does it mean to be a BrinkerHead? We play like a team, take pride in our culture and seek every opportunity to make people feel special. Life is short. Work happy. At Brinker, we connect, serve and give to create the best life for our Team Members, Guests and community. Through our cultural beliefs, Brinker empowers its Team Members to positively impact our 4 Key Results: Engaging Team Members, Bringing Back Guests, Growing Sales and Increasing Profits.

Job Summary

Brinker is seeking an experienced Senior Software Engineer - Technical Lead to be part of the IT Digital Marketing team, supporting loyalty and personalization development. This role will work with business, IT and vendor partners on a multi-year roadmap within the Digital Guest Experience program. This program consists of projects across many channels and customer touch points, and will enable Brinker to deliver a robust and relevant Guest Experience within our corporate and franchise locations. Key areas include loyalty, social monitoring and engagement systems, guest engagement features delivered through tabletop devices, personalization system utilized to streamline inbound and outbound customer experiences through all guest engagement channels, guest relations, and integration with website and mobile applications.

Your Key Job Functions

•Actively contribute to the development of Brinker's personalization offerings, partnership development, and technical roadmaps for a market leading personalization experience.

•Support personalization capability development collaborating with other Brinker team members and our partner marketing agencies to transform and integrate their systems.

•Collaborate with architects, engineers and 3rd party partners to develop conceptual architecture and physical design for Marketing applications including loyalty, campaign and engagement management systems.

•Provide inputs to project plan (tasks and estimates) for technical design, development, testing, deploy and post-production warranty.

•Work with Delivery Lead and Project Manager to plan work for self and other engineers.

•Partner with business analysts, solution architects, SMEs, and other IT team members to establish the technical vision and examine tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.

•Collaborate with other application teams to define and implement any required interfaces for Marketing applications including various communication and engagement channels (e.g. web, mobile, table top device, social).

•Develop technical designs to meet business requirements, and review the technical designs of other engineers.

•Provide technical leadership through all phases of the projects, including design

The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate and bring to life the Brinker cultural beliefs to drive our 4 key results:

Feedback’s Priceless I see more through your feedback.

Own it I own, drive and achieve key results.

Win Together I work across boundaries to achieve key results.

Trust Matters I act in a manner that cultivates trust in others.

Thinking Forward I think and act in a manner to deliver desired future results.

What You Bring to the Team

•BS/BA degree or Information Systems, Computer Science or related field preferred, or equivalent formal training or work experience.

•Strong SDLC experience and application architecture/design background.

•At least 5 years experience as a Technical Lead role supporting projects, with at least 5-7 years in digital marketing or eCommerce systems.

•Detailed functional understanding of Digital Marketing applications, interfaces and business processes.

•5+ years of familiarity with advanced analytic techniques that drive personalized experiences (e.g. content/collaborative filtering).

•5+ years experience developing personalized marketing and experiences, digital and/or physical, leveraging sophisticated data and analytics.

•Strong knowledge of Java SE, Java EE, JMS, XML, XSL, Web Services and other application integration related technologies.

•Development experience with an understanding of REST, SOAP, UDDI, WS-Security, SOA Governance, Web Service Management tools.

•Knowledge of event processing platforms specifically the TIBCO Suite of technologies.

•Solid understanding of relational databases. . •Ability to troubleshoot pre- and post-production implementations of distributed systems.

•Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

•Be highly self-motivated to accomplish team goals in a fast paced environment sessions, unit testing, test support and deployment planning and execution.

Why Brinker

•Competitive salary

•Every team member working at the Restaurant Support Center (aka Brinker headquarters) eligible for annual bonus potential

•Generous dining discounts at Brinker owned brands

•A choice of healthcare plans, 401(k) Savings Plan with company match and generous holidays

•Onsite gym plus opportunities to increase your wellbeing with onsite Yoga and boot camp programs

•Work/Life/Fun balance in a casual and collaborative work environment

•Team members enjoy company-wide events and celebrations

•Regular volunteer opportunities with our community give back programs

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer - Product Platform
jobs.content: Our Product Platform team is responsible for developing and maintaining our core API services that are relied on to deliver our SaaS products. The API services that you will be responsible for will be consumed by our financial models, our web platform, and Chatham’s clients.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Miejsce pracy: Warszawa, Kraków, Pozna lub Toru


Dlaczego miaby z nami pracowa?



  • Korzystamy, zalenie od zespoów i potrzeb, z: Java 8, Scala, Kotlin, Groovy, Go, Spring, Reactive Programming, Hystrix, Spark, Hadoop, Mesos, TensorFlow

  • Code review, Continuous Integration, Scrum/Kanban (zalenie od zespou), Domain Driven Design, Test Driven Development, Pair Programming

  • Zespó 600 wietnych inynierów, którzy dotychczas dzielili si wiedz na setkach technologicznych konferencji takich jak, Devoxx PL, GeeCon PL i Prague, Confitura, Agile By Example, Agile India 2016 (Bangalore), Mesos Con (Denver), Atmosphere oraz wspótworz bloga allegro.tech

  • Rocznie ponad 100 naszych inynierów wyjeda na konferencje w Polsce i zagranic (Europa i USA), kady zespó ma budet na szkolenia i ksiki, jeli chcesz si rozwija, to zawsze Ci pomoemy

  • Laptop z i7, 16GB RAM, SSD - MacBook Pro 15’’ lub 13’’ albo analogiczny Dell z Ubuntu/Windows (jeli nie lubisz Maców), do tego dwa zewntrzne monitory, wszystkie gadety których potrzebujesz

  • Wewntrzny ekosystem oparty na self-service'ach i szeroko stosowanych narzdziach takich jak Marathon, Docker, Consul, Bitbucket czy Bamboo. Dziki temu ju w pierwszych dniach pracy bdziesz móg tworzy oprogramowanie w jzyku, architekturze oraz skali która bdzie ograniczona tylko Twoim pomysem i wyobrani

  • Aktywnie uczestniczymy w yciu najwikszych grup uytkowników zwizanych z technologiami w jakich pracujemy (Java, Python, Devops) w Polsce, organizujc szkolenia/warsztaty i prezentacje w Poznaniu, Warszawie, Toruniu i Krakowie

  • Autonomia technologiczna: wybierasz technologi która pasuje do problemu (nie trzeba zgody wszystkich witych). Ty za ni potem odpowiadasz

  • 10 tysicy serwerów w dwóch DC

  • 40 projektów open source, 3391 gwiazdek na github


Ze swojej strony oferujemy:



  • Startupow kultur pracy i stabilno dojrzaej organizacji

  • Nowoczesne biuro i narzdzia pracy

  • Nieformaln atmosfer pracy w profesjonalnym zespole

  • Bogaty pakiet wiadcze pozapacowych w systemie kafeteryjnym – Ty decydujesz z czego korzystasz

  • Zajcia angielskiego z programem nauczania stworzonym z myl o inynierach, opacane przez nas

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for self-starting full stack developers with strong experience developing sophisticated applications.  If you are interested in joining a team of passionate, extremely talented developers then you need to read on! We are building world-class applications that drive the technical design of Runzheimer’s solution and product offerings.  This team is very passionate about designing and deploying products that will shape the future for our customer’s business travel. Our innovative culture drives the use of innovative toolsets and approaches so we can help our clients achieve their growth and mobility goals.  To satisfy the rapidly expanding demand for Runzheimer services, we are growing our Product Development team with highly experienced, motivated, self-directed individuals who require minimal direction to produce web and mobile software solutions.  


WHAT YOU WILL DO: 


Work directly with the Manager of Product Development, talented Application Developers, and the leadership team to design and implement web/software applications. Participate in feature design, working with product, UX and business experts. Build out features that make the web experience something you want to show off to your friends and family. Test-driven development and real DevOps to get your code deployed to improve the business quickly.



  • Collaborate with product managers, business analysts, developers, and architects in conceptualizing and developing new software applications and enhancements.

  • Assist in defining software development project plans, including scoping, estimating, scheduling, and implementation.

  • Explore the use of emerging application development software products, languages, and standards in support of new product development efforts.

  • Recommend, schedule, and perform software improvements and upgrades.

  • Consistently write, translate, and code software programs and applications according to known specifications. 


HOW WE LIKE TO WORK:



  • Collaborative, super-productive teams

  • Self-motivated people with an entrepreneurial mindset

  • Desire both to learn and to teach.

  • We learn new things every day and are excited to share our knowledge with each other

jobs.title: Functional Developer
jobs.content:
Enoro is a Finnish company with more than 20 years of experience in the sustainable energy market. As a software supplier Enoro is market leader in the northern part of Europe for smart metering and smart grid solutions. Over 300 dedicated employees are working all over Europe to provide Enoro customers with software solutions. Enoro’s customers range from large energy users, utilities and multinational energy companies to system operators and energy exchanges. Enoro contributes to a smart society where private and industrial consumers can make sustainable energy choices. By supporting their clients in the utility industry, Enoro contributes to a more automated, digital and personalized energy service.. For Enoro we are building a new team with IT specialists to support Enoro’s customers in the Netherlands. We are looking for a Functional Developer.

Functional Developer

Client oriented Functional Developer with “sustainable” energy, who likes to take the initiative

The position: You will be joining a newly created team of professionals who are responsible for supporting Enoro’s customers in The Netherlands. You will be responsible for implementing new system features on configuration and functional programming levels and maintaining existing features on the configuration and functional programming levels of Generis. Creating new system functionality to meet customer expectations and maintaining a high level of customer support.

We are looking for: A functional developer with a background in the utility sector, who gets motivated by working closely with customers and wants to provide the highest level of support.

  • Extensive development experience with scripting and/or functional programming languages
  • Experienced in providing customer support of large scale IT systems
  • Expert in implementing new functionality from scratch
  • Knowledge of database technologies (Oracle is an advantage)
  • Fluently communication with the customer and internally in written and in spoken both English and Dutch

Enoro offers

  • Working for a company which is contributing in making sustainable energy choices
  • Working for a leading software solution provider
  • A varied job in a fast growing market
  • Working in a newly created team with a great perspective for the future
  • Favorable working conditions

Interested? For more information, please contact Paul Goedkoop, Consultant at Mercuri Urval via 010-288600. Or apply directly via the 'link':

Click here for the application form!

You can find the job on www.mercuriurval.nl with search criteria “Enoro”

Keywords: Vacancy, fulltime, Rotterdam, Customer Support, Developer

jobs.title: Installation Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an Installation Engineer.

Installation Engineer

Client oriented Installation Engineer with “sustainable” energy, who likes to take the initiative.

The position: You will be joining a new created team of professionals, responsible for supporting Enoro customers in the Netherlands. You will provide Generis installation support on internal and external environments. Carrying out periodic system upgrades, setting up new Generis installations from scratch and supporting customers with technical questions related to server and Generis service configuration.

jobs.title: Manager ICT
jobs.content:
Dairy Data Warehouse (DDW), a rapidly growing start up with approximately ten employees, is specialized in dairy farm data services for dairy farm consultants such as veterinarians, genetic consultants or feed advisers across the globe. DDW’s headquarters and customer services, including their multilingual helpdesk are located in Assen (Netherlands). DDW believes in the value of BIG dairy data and the fact that this data becomes most valuable when a broad range of continuously updated and different data sources are combined and enriched with BIG data driven algorithms. DDW has developed a unique solution that automatically collects dairy data from multiple sources and transforms it to make it useful for their customers. In order to stay beyond competition and to realize the ambition to ‘create the biggest dairy database of the dairy industry’, we are currently looking for a

Manager ICT
getting the best out of the people and projects

In this position you are responsible for managing a team of seven software developers and the further development and expansion of this team. You have the overall responsibility for managing and overseeing all projects (planning, forecasting, dividing tasks and setting priorities). You have a daily discussion with the project members to make sure that each project is delivered on time and within budget and scope. You are in close contact with sales about upcoming projects, translate this to appropriate feasibility studies and a forecast for the technical department. You are responsible for the infrastructure of DDW’s solution, in cooperation with external consultants and service providers and your goal is to prepare the organization for further technical growth. You will report directly to the Managing Director.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer/Architect
jobs.content:
Responsibility



  • Use agile engineering practices and modern development technologies to rapidly develop creative and efficient solutions that delivers against the product as outlined by the Product Owner

  • Collaborate with other agile team members to steer technology choices towards a leading edge setup that delivers against the longer term needs and vision from the Product Owner

  • Identify, suggest and conduct technology enabled product experiments in collaboration with the Product Owner

  • Provide technology expertise in discussions with stakeholders

jobs.title: Full Stack .NET Developers
jobs.content:
This job is open for 6 months from the date of publishing it, we will keep hiring during these six months.


Objectives



  • Analyze technical requirements and design new components, web pages and controls to meet client’s functional, performance and availability requirements.

  • Design ASP.NET and control layouts using XHTML/CSS/JavaScript/jQuery that work and perform well in target browsers as required by client’s product strategy.

  • Design and develop using Object Oriented design principles and software design patterns to attain high reusability and maintainability.

  • Develop an in-depth understanding of client’s product architecture and frameworks. 

  • Maintain and contribute to client’s product platform as necessary.

  • Develop database SQL scripts, stored procedures and SSIS packages that meet Soft Source database standards to implement product requirements.

  • Maintain and support client’s products that are released to internal partners and customers.

  • Build consensus among different teams working on software development projects.

  • Facilitate discussions among other .NET and database developers to exchange new ideas and improvements.

jobs.title: Java Entwickler Backend
jobs.content:
Agile Softwareentwicklung ist Ihre Leidenschaft? Kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung ist Ihnen genauso wichtig wie das Tüfteln an komplexen Problemstellungen?


Dann sind Sie der Entwickler, den wir suchen!


Für die kompetente Unterstützung unseres Entwicklerteams suchen wir ab sofort Java/ JEE-Entwickler (m/w) mit fachlichen Schwerpunkt im Backend.


Ihre Aufgaben:


Sie entwickeln, implementieren und testen Webanwendungen auf Basis offener Internet- Technologien in agilen Scrum-Teams. Sie evaluieren regelmäßig die zweckmäßigsten Technologien und legen deren Nutzung fest. Sie beschäftigen sich mit den Wünschen des Kunden und streben danach, diesem durch Ihre hohe Methodenkompetenz optimalen technologischen und betriebswirtschaftlichen Nutzen zu stiften.


Wir bieten an:



  • Die Mitarbeit in verschiedenen Projekten bei namhaften Kunden

  • Eine offene, moderne und mitarbeiterzentrierte Unternehmenskultur

  • Eine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance, z.B. durch flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung und die Homeoffice-Nutzung je nach Projekt

  • Modern eingerichtete Büros, individuelle Hardwareausstattung, Getränke und Obst zur freien Verfügung

  • Förderung fachlicher und persönlicher Weiterentwicklung durch regelmäßige Fort- und Weiterbildungsangebote

  • Wir verbringen gerne Zeit miteinander, z.B. auf unserem Sommerfest oder gemeinsamen Fahrten zu Trainings und Kongressen

jobs.title: Algorithm Engineer- CTOs Innovation Center
jobs.content:
ECI is looking for an ace Algorithm Engineer to join the CTO’s division in ECI, which is in charge of the research & development of the company’s next-generation state-of-the-art SDN/NFV/Cloud technologies.
Part of the responsibilities:



  • Analyze key technology in high performance networking and networked systems.

  • Design and verify efficient network related algorithms that boost the performance, lower the cost, or enable new services, to ensure competitive advantage.

  • Track and analyze related technology/device/component development road map.

  • Track and predict the industry trend and conduct proactive research for technology reserve to keep the technical leadership.

  • Model algorithms, simulate and profile the performance.

  • Implement/prototype algorithms, lab test and debug the reference design.

  • Document the design in forms of technical report, design document, or patent.

  • Collaborate with headquarter team on various design projects.

  • Engineering support for product lines, customers, and partners.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer- CTO's Innovation Center
jobs.content:
ECI is looking for a Senior Java Developer to join ECI’s CTO innovation center which is a strategic development elite group who is in charge of ECI’s next-generation state-of-the-art products. With the combination of software excellence and startup agility we create tomorrow’s network solutions.


Main responsibilities:



  • Build platform service and tools, create excellence in terms of quality, implementation and knowledge transfer.

  • Develop SW products using cutting edge technologies

  • Work in a diverse environment with different groups within ECI worldwide, handle multiple projects, methods, and approaches.

  • Implement algorithms to be part of ECI's portfolio product.

  • Execute PoC’s.

jobs.title: Sr Rails Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Our microservice architecture of 17 loosely coupled Rails services (http REST, async queuing etc) has been developed for the last 2 years. It's in production, supporting multiple brands and driving millions of dollars of revenue every month from US sales.


We are looking for one more smart developer to join a new team and help us deliver more features, faster for our long-term client. Are you an experienced engineer looking for a new challenge? Does working in a company that specialises in high performing distributed teams sound exciting?


What do we offer?



  • Work as part of a talented, globally distributed, successful team

  • A focussed adherance to our agile/scrum processes (we really believe it helps getting good work done)

  • Hard problems to solve (you won't find all the answers on Stack Overflow) - and the opportunity to own the solutions

  • A great working atmosphere where you can share and learn with other smart people

  • The best-in-class toolsets: Slack, CI/CD with Docker etc

  • Meetups in our Barcelona offices for our remote folks

  • Competitive rates

  • A long term working relationship: at least a year working on this project, then others.


You'll be:



  • Working within a fast moving team (working 11am - 8pm Central European time)

  • Solving hard business logic with elegant software design

  • Identifying bottlenecks, using tools to diagnose and refactor code for scale

  • Ensuring the robustness, performance and failure characteristics of the system.

  • Writing well tested (rspec), defect free code with CI/CD

  • Taking ownership of production applications - managing issues, releases and ensuring quality

  • Occasionally going full stack and also building functionality for the SPAs in javascript (experience in node/react/backbone is useful) 


Good english verbal and written communication skills are essential. 


This is a contract position with a long term outlook (12 months+ full time project) for the the right candidate. We are looking for remote workers (most of the company is remote) or have openings based in our Barcelona office.

jobs.title: C++ Developer
jobs.content:
Acunetix is a dynamic software company founded to develop a cutting-edge tool designed with security professionals in mind, to help them secure their websites and web applications from design flaws and hackers. Unlike network security solutions, Acunetix scans websites and web applications by replicating a hacker’s approach to detect vulnerabilities heuristically instead of based on fixed signatures.


We are looking for a senior C++ developer who will be developing functionality in the Acunetix engine. The post requires an experienced developer, who is able to develop platform independent applications, and coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the engine.


Senior C++ Developer will be responsible for:



  • Designing, building and maintaining components of our scanning engine using efficient, reusable and reliable code

  • Developing performant and quality modules

  • Identifying bottlenecks and bugs, and develop appropriate solutions

jobs.title: C# / .NET Azure Developer / Fashion E-commerce / Amsterdam
jobs.content: You will be implementing, integrating and developing innovative solutions for our cloud based product. This includes writing server-side C# .NET code on Azure. Our product serves the fashion B2B industry and is highly successful with the highest volumes of commercial traffic globally. Our clients are some of the best known brands in the world.

jobs.title: Software Developer C++
jobs.content:
At Rockfield, we are an approachable, experienced team of 30 colleagues, geared towards working to our customers’ goals and with an increasing, global portfolio, we are seeking a Software Developer with a passion for technology to join our us at our Swansea Head Office.


You will be part of a small, informal team supported in learning new skills and reporting to like-minded, dedicated and experienced senior developers. The role would suit developers who have a particular aptitude for C/C++ and Qt development.


As part of a small development team, tasks are varied and interesting. Example projects could include:



  • assisting in the development of GUIs for new products

  • designing algorithms for efficient result processing

  • development of geometry creation and manipulation tools;

  • adding capabilities to the FEM/DEM analysis code. 


You will be involved in full life cycle development of products with real-time 2D and 3D graphics, which leverage a highly advanced numerical analysis code.

jobs.title: Rails Pro Needed
jobs.content:
Headquarters: The World
URL: http://secretbenefits.com

Are you an amateur? Someone who enjoys talking code theory but rarely ships? Do you like to overcomplicate, and see pragmatic development principles as another theory to discuss, rather than work by? Do you need meetings and micromanagement to feel important and hide the fact you’re not producing anything valuable?

If you answered yes to any of the above, please stop reading now. Find yourself a nice startup in San Fran that has reached it’s series Z round of funding for a product no one wants and that is still in beta. I’m sure they'll be happy spending someone else’s money to pay you an exorbitant rate for producing little.

We're a small team building a big sugar dating site, we get shit done and don’t take ourselves too seriously. We’re looking for another Rails pro. Someone who relishes the fact we don’t have meetings, and everyone’s too busy shipping to look over your shoulder and make sure you're doing the same. You'll enjoy the freedom to express yourself and have a say in the design and functionality of the features you build. 

The day you join the team you will double our number of back end devs. You’ll love the fact there's nowhere to hide if you’re not producing, you’re a pro after all. We need you to have experience shipping code on user-facing sites. You will learn and teach in this position, just not the basics. 

Initially you'll join the team on a per-project basis - perhaps as a part-time reprieve from the bureaucracy of your day job. We’re bootstrapped and care about profit but have the means to reward you well if you’re creating value. Do the work and we’ll enjoy many years of creation together. We have no interest in becoming a giant team that’s hard to manage, so hopefully you're the last back end dev hire we ever need to make.

If you were mildly entertained, or want a job we would love to hear from you! Tell us about the user-facing work you've shipped, and why we’d be stupid not to hire you. Bonus points if you’ve developed for mobile or social apps before.

PS. If you’re quick with your application and proving you’re a Rails beast, we’ll fly you to join us for a week of hacking in Italy later this month. We hear the pizza is good, they make a decent tiramisu and a chianti or two never hurts our creativity.

To apply: Send your proof of being able to do the work - e.g. past experience shipping user-facing work to apply@secretbenefits.com

jobs.title: Customer Support & Profile Moderation
jobs.content:
There are no benefits and the pay wonât go far in New York or San Fran. The work may be tedious with dating profile reviews and often answering similar support questions. At times you will lose faith in humanity and wonder how the asker gets by each day. If you need your social life packaged in a meal-deal with your work, prepare to be underwhelmed. No one will look over your shoulder to ensure the work gets done.

If youâre still reading, this might be your dream job. Our sugar dating site users are in need of your TLC. You will send support emails that help them succeed in finding matches, and ensure they donât have a Kardashian as their profile pic. Repetitive clichÃ©s will amuse you. The photos that make you wish iPhones never had cameras will morbidly fascinate, rather than offend. 

If customer service is your passion, perfect! More likely itâs not but this job will free you to follow it. Your working hours will be flexible, although ideally aiming for full-time with most during 7am-9pm EST. Put in the work without someone having to prod you, and you can have a great time. Prove yourself and join the ranks of our core team that has been together for years.

Our small team is distributed globally. We get shit done but donât take ourselves too seriously. We are not a startup and measure success by the apparently-unsexy metric of making more money than we spend. We donât use words like âdisruptâ, and implemented our âexit strategyâ when we escaped the confines of the 9-5 tedium and commute.

If you were mildly entertained, or want a job we would love to hear from you! 

To apply: Send your best proof of being able to do this work to apply@secretbenefits.com

jobs.title: (Senior) Software Developer - Medical Media and Web Applications
jobs.content:
For our growing R&D division we are looking for a new software developer. You will be part of a young and dynamic team developing media and web applications for our Digital Operating Room product portfolio. Your contribution has an impact on daily work in hospitals around the world. 


As a software deveoper, you are responsible for designing, developing and maintaining components for streaming, audio and video conferencing, remote control, recording, and intelligent documentation workflows. You develop software mainly in javascript and C++, contribute to technical documentation and work together with a team of other software developers and quality engineers implementing the optimal solutions for our clinical customers. You will be involved in the development process from the very first idea until the final launch of the product.


We are looking for proactive people, eager to learn and grow who bring their own ideas and make a difference.

jobs.title: Ruby On Rails Senior Architect
jobs.content:
The Senior Ruby on Rails Architect role is the senior level of our technical positions and requires an expert-level understanding of Ruby on Rails and related technologies. This position is a hands-on leadership role. You will need a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect to senior software engineer on the most complex elements of the product. You will also be a technical team leader and solution evangelist.

Role Description

In the role, you will be creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs that scale to the customer's enterprise/global requirements. Its your responsibility to ensure that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.

Though we like to remove most of the management overhead for our Senior Architects to let you focus on the key technical solutions - you will be a peer-leader of a team of architects and developers to apply software engineering best practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery.


Company Description

Crossover is inventing the future of work. A future where high-skill jobs are available to anyone around the world - as long as they are the best-of-the-best in that skill. We assemble teams of these rockstars, apply best-known playbooks to run the teams and provide a platform to help each team and individual continuously improve. Crossover then connects these teams to companies with specific needs. And unlike freelancer marketplaces, Crossover only accepts customers looking for multi-year project or program needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
If you are an elite Software Engineering Manager with Universal Windows Platform expertise eager to gain unprecedented visibility to the top technology companies throughout the globe, employ your technical and managerial skills to oversee cutting-edge software in a high-intensity environment, and earn $120,000 USD per year while working from virtually anywhere on the planet, this job is for you.


The Company:


Crossover is a well-funded startup that has developed a unique way to find, curate and manage the top 1% of global talent and connect them to medium and large businesses. We are experiencing rapid growth within the companies we currently serve and are increasing our staff to expand our business.


Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will consist of teams collaborating from every corner of the world. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical contracting. But we dont just find the best; we also provide the software tools, training, and expert management to ensure success for long-term growth.


Job Description:

Crossover is looking for Software Engineering Managers with UWP experience who demonstrate outstanding managerial skills as well as the technical background to deeply understand the code their teams are developing. You will be expected to demonstrate both a mastery of the technical skills associated with the projects at hand, as well as the managerial ability to motivate, build, and monitor your team. Specifically, you will be responsible for overseeing from 4 to 6 teams of 3 to 4 individuals. You will own the process of breaking specifications created by the product management team into clear tasks and timelines, as well as assembling the results into high value, reusable components. Under your leadership, we expect to see consistent improvement in both static code quality metrics and weekly production.


A successful UWP Software Engineering Manager at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualities:

  • Ruthless commitment to impeccable code quality

  • Deep understanding of a wide range of the latest technologies and architectural approaches

  • Advanced proficiency in C# programming language, related frameworks and best practices

  • The ability to make appropriate technical decisions, review design and code, and ensure best technical practices

  • Commitment to hands-on engagement as an individual within the team, despite managerial status

  • Willingness to embrace iterative development as the means for building seamless products

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stop until its done correctly

  • Exceptional ability to effectively motivate and manage teams of individuals

  • Commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously automating parts of the software engineering process

  • Excellent remote management skills (you will be using Skype, GoToMeeting, Google Docs, etc.)


Required Skills and Experience:


A successful UWP Software Engineering Manager at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering

  • Proven managerial skills with at least 8 years of experience

  • 2 years of experience in hands-on UWP (Universal Windows Platform) application development

  • Experience with Cloud architecture and DevOps

  • At least 5 years of experience in managing .NET application development teams

  • Proficiency in Agile, SDLC, or SLA

  • Proficiency in AWS and TDD is desired but not mandatory

  • Outstanding English communication skills


Total compensation: $60/hr for 40 productive hours per week

Location: Global (remote)


Were one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

jobs.title: Docker Chief Architect
jobs.content:
Docker Chief Architect - $100K


Are you one of the top Software Architects in the world? Were you an early adopter of virtualization, containers and cloud infrastructure? Do you love to automate everything that needs to be done more than once? Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while being able to work from any location that is comfortable to you? Eager to join a development network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Through Crossover, youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for elite companies around the world.


The Company:


Aurea is partnering with Crossover to hire the best and brightest Docker Chief Architects. Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touch-points to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.

Job Description:

The Docker CA will be in charge of migrating products to Cloud using AWS, Docker and Aurora by taking any of our products from a legacy state, manual build/deploy processes, ancient dependencies, fragile architecture, weak security, lack of scalability or performance). Reverse engineer its legacy architecture and key flows (white box vs black box approach), understand its key weaknesses on the following pillars of cloud-readiness such as security, reliability, simplicity, performance, operational agility and automation. Design out the weaknesses, work hands-on and/or partner with and providing leadership to Product Development team. The final goal is to transform the product into a full dockerized CD pipeline with fully automated build/deploy/monitoring/resiliency processes in a fully consolidated Docker and Aurora environment with no unknown remaining legacy issues in terms of security, reliability, performance and operational agility.

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
At Kinesis we build software that enables sustainable and liveable cities. We’re looking for someone to join our team of 6 developers and help build software that makes a difference to the environment and to the lives of city dwellers.


We have several single page app products (EmberJS, Rails, Django and PostgreSQL), plus we are exploring more advanced mathematical modelling and algorithms in new products.


This opportunity will be focussed on contributing to our products at all layers of the stack, and if you are not already familiar, learn the latest in delivering beautiful, native-like experiences on the web with JavaScript. You'll be able to work all the way from product design to architecture and code, and as the team is small enough, you will be making a significant contribution.


The development team is agile and co-located, with daily stand-ups, kanban wall, retrospectives and pairing as appropriate. There is a strong automation culture, with automated testing and continuous integration for both our applications and infrastructure.


Some skills we’re looking for:



  • Ruby / Ruby on Rails or Python / Django (solid experience in both highly desirable)

  • Automated testing (unit, integration, end-to-end etc)

  • Good communication skills


Bonus points for:



  • Worked in a team with an agile process or would like to

  • Comfortable with pair programming as needed

  • EmberJS or similar SPA JavaScript frameworks (AngularJS, React)

  • Advanced SQL with PostgreSQL

  • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent


We are based in Sydney, in a newly renovated office close to Wynyard. We believe in a good work/life balance, and encourage and subsidise environment friendly travel (we pay for your train ticket or bike after probation).

jobs.title: Senior PHP Engineer
jobs.content:
At Modus Create you will collaborate with a cross-functional Scrum team to deliver high quality innovative products in short sprint cycles. You thrive in an independent, distributed environment. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet.

Your duties in this role:

This senior PHP engineer will build features for a secure mid tier platform for several financial web apps due to hit the market in 2017. You will need to be able to collaborate effectively on an Agile distributed team.

Required Experience

  • 3-5 yrs PHP development on the backend
  • Experience developing w/ PHP framework Symfony
  • Proficient working in a Linux environment
  • Experience with MySQL
  • Experience w/ Docker
  • Experience using IntelliJ IDE
  • Experience using JIRA

Why Modus Create?

  • Ability to work with the best and learn from the best
  • Ability to telecommute or work remote if not on client site
  • Assisted continuous self-development

At Modus Create, we envision what is possible with emerging technologies.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - C++ - Algos/Smart Routing
jobs.content:
ITG is looking for an experienced, detail-oriented senior software engineer to join our smart order routing team, a critical product to ITG’s global business.


Here at ITG, technology is our middle name. Literally. With nearly half of our staff working in technology roles, our technologists empower our business to provide best-in-class service to our clients around the world. From conceptualizing ideas to bringing them to market, ITG engineers work alongside our business units to build technology for institutional traders that enables them to improve returns for investors. 


WE’LL TRUST YOU TO:



  • Enhance ITG’s existing smart order router and migrate our technology from Windows to Linux

  • Build and support low-latency order routing algorithms alongside management

  • Analyze feature specifications and work with product management in refining specs

  • Evaluate trading strategies and recommend enhancements

  • Analyze the latency of trading systems and implement changes to improve performance

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Back End
jobs.content:
Are you highly motivated and interested in shaping the next generation of financial applications while working on ITG's Flagship product, POSIT Alert? If you're up for the challenge then we need you! 


 We are seeking a Software Engineer who is able to work independently in researching and solving problems as part of a small team (3 to 5) of knowledgeable developers. You will be working on the next generation of POSIT Alert, an innovative indication crossing system and one of ITG’s star products.


 More specifically you will be responsible to:



  • Design and develop a Java application responsible for the real-time gathering and interpreting  of large amount of data in order to organize that data into an SQL database

  • Design and develop an automated regression testing framework used for the systematic testing of the aforementioned application

  • Help with the data mining of the gathered data to be used for real-time monitoring, reporting, usage pattern detection, behavior analysis and possibly modeling and prediction.

  • Second-level support

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer  Insight C#  FinTech
jobs.content:
Description/ Responsibilities:



  • Developing and maintaining ITG’s enterprise real-time trade execution monitoring system: sophisticated GUI front-end and high-performance data-analytic back-end.

  • Provide technical / design / process on the product.

  • Developing in WPF, C# (.Net 4.0+) on windows.

  • Developing Backend C++ Low Latency/High throughput applications

  • Work in a fast moving and rapidly changing environment using agile methodology

  • Solve highly technical and complex problems on multiple projects

  • End to end involvement in the product development cycle – from requirements to deployment.

  • Working in an integrated environment – interfacing with local and overseas based products & dev teams.

  • Working both independently and in collaboration with other team members.

  • Close interaction with the client services (Product management and Production Services – located remotely) 


Technical Knowledge/Skills:



  • Development experience with C#, primarily WPF + MVVM experience (preference for WPF experts).

  • Unit-testing and functional testing while doing development

  • Microsoft Visual Studio and Windows experience

  • Experience in developing rich client side applications and good GUI sensibilities

  • Object Oriented programming

  • Ability to work independently and also in a stressful, high pressure support environment

  • Demonstrates excellent communication skills (verbal and written), good interpersonal skills, excellent ability to gather and understand requirements in the financial sector

  • Self-starting quick learner of complex systems.

  • Detail oriented. Ability to think through corner cases while development and testing

  • Demonstrated ability to handle concurrent projects while adapting quickly to rapidly

  • changing priorities

  • Multi tiered & integrated systems experience

  • Familiarity with / enthusiasm for securities markets and trading.


Preferred Technical Knowledge/Skills:



  • Past experience with C++ 11/14/17 is a strong plus

  • UNIX/Linux is a strong plus

  • Multi-threading

  • Experience with Real-time trading applications. Experience with Algorithmic Trading,

  • High Frequency Trading, Low Latency Trading and Order Management Systems is a plus

  • SQL

  • XML

  • SVN/CVS/GIT

  • LUA, SQLite experience

  • TDD, unit testing, StyleCop, FxCop, Unity, Moq, MEF experience

  • Infragistics experience

  • Developing with and leading Agile methodologies

  • Project team leadership

  • Good UI & user perspective orientation and understanding

  • Knowledge of any US or Global exchanges


Education/Experience Requirements:



  • 7+ years of experience with a B.S. degree or 5+ years of experience with a M.S. degree in Computer Science, MIS or equivalent technical discipline


To Apply: Interested candidates should send a resume to Careers@itg.com and include Senior Software Engineer – Insight C# in the subject line.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Market Data - Java and/or C++
jobs.content:
ITG is looking for a high-caliber Software Engineer (C++ OR Java) to join our Market Data organization, responsible for managing ITG’s global data.


Here at ITG, technology is our middle name. Literally. With nearly half of our staff working in technology roles, our technologists empower our business to provide best-in-class service to our clients around the world. From conceptualizing ideas to bringing them to market, ITG engineers work alongside our business units to build technology for institutional traders that enables them to improve returns for investors. 


Description/ Responsibilities: We are replacing our existing historical trade/quote ticks solution with next-generation applications written in C++ or Java (Two Teams!).  You would be working on designing, developing, and supporting those financial applications, both on equities and new asset classes.  Must be a self-starter, able to research and solve problems individually while working in a small, geographically-distributed team. Looking for someone who has strong communication skills (both written and oral), able to multi-task, and eager to learn new technologies.


WE’LL TRUST YOU TO:



  • Design and develop new features to work with our OneTick historical ticks servers for multiple asset classes. Includes querying data from multiple sources, processing/transforming data, and generating analytics for use by internal applications via API.

  • Work with Product Management to refine and analyze business requirements, then translate that into software design.

  • Provide second-line support of developed applications.

jobs.title: Senior Software Architect
jobs.content:
Help us build the future of custom furniture


Want to join the rare startup that intakes bits and outputs a physical product? A company that has both an office with a whiteboard and a 55,000 square foot factory near downtown Los Angeles? A startup early enough that you can get in on the ground floor and be responsible for building new products, but late enough that we’re not eating instant ramen?


We are revolutionizing an industry which has been around for thousands of years and have built a little product that, in less than a year, has more customers queued up than we can handle.


At its core our app lets licensed interior designers upload a photo of a piece of furniture they want and have it manufactured and shipped to their clients. But that's really the tip of the iceberg. Our many products range from traditional web and mobile apps to an RFID system which tracks furniture movement. At Showroom we have the opportunity to work on a wealth of different products.


We believe in customer focus, hard work, engineering discipline, moving fast, and checking egos at the door. And we offer:



  • Generous salary and equity

  • Fantastic health insurance

  • Remote work days

  • Valet parking


We're looking to hire a talented and passionate software architect who loves the idea of doing some fast paced development with modern technologies, mentoring and steering our engineering team, and adding software engineering best practices to our team little by little.


See our full stack at: http://stackshare.io/showroom/showroom.

jobs.title: Senior UI/JavaScript Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
URL: https://close.io

ABOUT US
At Close.io we’re building the sales communication platform of the future. We’ve built a next-generation CRM that eliminates manual data entry and helps sales teams close more deals. We are hiring engineers to help us unify the world's sales calls and emails into one beautiful workflow.

Our app’s front-end is a single-page HTML5/JavaScript web app written with Backbone.js (now starting to dabble in React), jQuery, RequireJS, Handlebars, QUnit, Grunt, etc. It’s built entirely on top of our public REST API and targets only modern browsers. Our UI updates in near real-time and is written in LESS/CSS atop Bootstrap.

We ❤ open source – using 40+ frontend libraries/plugins with contributions to many of them.

ABOUT YOU
We're looking for experienced full-time developers to join our core team who have a strong understanding of web technologies and want to help design, implement, and launch major user-facing features.

YOU SHOULD...
  • have 8+ years experience building modern front-end applications in JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS
  • have great product sense and be able to think through user experience issues before diving into the code
  • write maintainable, testable, and performant JavaScript
  • have a love for great UI
  • enjoy debugging all aspects of the front-end app including memory leaks and quirky CSS across browsers
  • have experience implementing real-time (e.g. websockets, polling, etc.) web apps
  • have significant experience with REST APIs and thoroughly understand HTTP requests

BONUS POINT IF YOU...
  • have an eye for design and experience with Photoshop, Sketch, or similar
  • have contributed open source code (core or plugins) for a popular frontend framework such as React, Backbone, or Angular

WHY WORK WITH US...
  • Work remotely from anywhere in the world! Just be willing to do a bit of traveling twice a year for some face-to-face time with the whole team :)  
  • Help build a truly successful SaaS company with a stellar team where you can have a huge impact. 
  • Above market salary and benefits
  • Join a company that embraces a healthy work/life balance 
  • A culture that values: trust, ridiculousness, entrepreneurship and autonomy 

To apply: APPLY HERE: https://jobs.lever.co/close.io/10a1e32b-1a59-48dc-b8f4-e6f0dfae4e20/apply?lever-source=WWR

jobs.title: Open Source Software Engineers
jobs.content:
Work in Canberra with the latest open-source technology and cutting edge customers from around the world?


At Instaclustr, you'll be working in a small, fast paced team using the latest open source technologies, supporting our Cassandra-as-a-Service solution and under the leadership of our senior software engineers in our product development and technical operations teams.


Duties


Here's some of the things you can expect to be doing:
