  • Developing code in Java, Python, AngularJS, PostgreSQL

  • Assisting with the resolution of customer issues with their use of Cassandra and associated technologies.

  • Contributing to the development of internal tools, applications and processes as well as the open source products we support.

  • Following defined QA and other development processes.

jobs.title: Chief Technology Officer
jobs.content:
Vi söker nu en CTO på heltid för att ta en strategisk såväl som operativ roll i företaget och arbeta i nära samarbete med vår CEO. Du kommer att ansvara för vidareutveckling av vår MVP i en CMS-miljö samt själv få rekrytera dina medarbetare med stöd av HR-specialister. Positionen kräver att du är en naturlig ledare då du kommer att planera och driva all teknisk utveckling med fokus på kundupplevelsen. Detta ger dig stor frihet att själv utforma ditt arbete.


Som CTO kommer du att:



  • Driva och utvärdera beslut om webb- och applösningars funktionalitet samt design

  • Löpande själv kunna programmera när det behövs

  • Genomföra integration av front- och back-end med externa samarbetspartners

  • Representera och driva utvecklingen av Liveable på en global marknad


Vi tror att du har:



  • Har teknisk universitetsutbildning och/eller gedigen erfarenhet från liknande arbete

  • Minst tre års erfarenhet av utvecklingsarbete inom webb- och applösningar

  • Utmärkta kunskaper i PHP

  • Erfarenhet av och stort intresse för hantering samt utveckling av CMS


Vi letar efter dig som:



  • Är nyfiken och har ett entreprenöriellt och kreativt mindset

  • Teknisk talang och inspirerande ledarstil

  • Tror på att de bästa resultaten uppnås genom att testa, experimentera och ha roligt

  • Blir inspirerad av att förbättra livet för andra genom att lösa riktiga problem


Som del av vårt team får du:



  • Konkurrenskraftig lön med goda möjligheter till delägarskap

  • Nyckelroll i ett mycket starkt och framgångsrikt team

  • Unik möjlighet att leda utvecklingen av en revolutionerande fintech-produkt på en internationell arena

  • Heltidstjänst på vårt dynamiska kontor på Skeppsbron 44 i centrala Stockholm


Intervjuer görs löpande och tjänsten ska vara tillsatt senast 15 mars.


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer  C#/.Net
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance.  You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment via website architecture built on a cloud infrastructure. 


Come be a part of our exciting fast paced team, proud of building the solutions that drive our websites seen by millions of Crate and Barrel customers.


Job Description:



  • Design, develop, and implement solutions using C#, ASP.NET (MVC and WebForms), and Javascript Frameworks as your tools and Visual Studio 2015 as your environment.

  • Conceive and build unit testable solutions for our website applications.

  • Participate in technical design meetings with other developers and assist in defining the system architecture and choosing technologies.

  • Work on a cross-disciplinary Agile team to develop, estimate, test, and maintain our websites, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective.

  • Work directly with business stakeholders to understand requirements and communicate progress.

  • Be an active contributor to back-end development practices and code reviews.

  • Update and maintain site documentation.

  • Communicate effectively and efficiently with all associates and business contacts and promote a strong sense of teamwork.


Requirements:



  • You have been building websites for 3+ years with C#, ASP.NET, MVC with a preferred focus on e-commerce solutions.

  • Possess 3+ years experience with relational databases like SQLServer, NoSQL experience a plus.

  • You have strong communication skills and experience working with business stakeholders and web designers.

  • You can work with jQuery right away. You have some experience and knowledge of another script framework (e.g. AngularJS, node.js).

  • Real world problem solving and technology excites you.

  • Experience working in a web environment such as IIS administration.

  • You have worked in an Agile environment.

  • You can write unit tests and testable code.

  • Ability to work efficiently and meet project deadlines with minimal supervision.

  • Ability to analyze business problems and provide accurate development estimates.

  • Experience in domain-driven development and cloud technologies is a plus.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or comparable work experience.

  • You have good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).

  • Work location can flex to our Chicago location occasionally subject to the needs of the business.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Senior Front End Developer to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture. This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Senior Front End Developer, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance. You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.



  • Design, develop, and implement solutions using HTML, CSS, and Javascript as your tools and ASP.NET (MVC) as your environment.

  • Conceive and build responsive and adaptive solutions for website applications.

  • Work on an Agile team to develop, test, deploy, and maintain, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective.

  • Participate in technical design meetings with other developers and assist in definition of front end web architecture.

  • Work with product team and stakeholders to understand and communicate progress.

  • Update, maintain and adhere to pattern-libraries, styleguides, and site documentation.

  • Be an active contributor to front-end development best practices.


Requirements:



  • You have been building websites using HTML/CSS/Javascript for 3+ years, and you can show it.

  • You can communicate to people in product management, design, user experience, and QA, and they will understand you.

  • You have excellent knowledge of CSS and Javascript coding best practices.

  • You can build responsive, cross-browser, highly-performant, and accessible applications.

  • You can work with jQuery right away. You have some experience and knowledge of another script framework (e.g. ReactJS, AngularJS, node.js).

  • You have worked with Twitter Bootstrap or Foundation or the like. You know about CSS preprocessors (LESS or SASS).

  • Maybe you’ve worked with C#, ASP.NET MVC, the .NET Framework, and VisualStudio.

  • You have basic knowledge of SQL language.

  • Bachelor’s degreein Computer Science, Graphic Design, or Visual Communication desired but not required.

  • You have good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).

  • Work location can flex to our Chicago location occasionally subject to the needs of the business.

jobs.title: Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team as a technical leader responsible for delivering innovative eCommerce solutions built for sustainability and performance. Your passion for architecture optimization will enable you to become a key contributor in the development and enhancement of our core eCommerce architecture. You will be a go-to-person in designing and guiding teams in the delivery of high quality software that scales and performs at a best-in-class level. Collaborating closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers, you will design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.


Our teams are composed of talented software engineers working in a very dynamic, challenging, fast-paced, sustainable and fun Agile (Scrum) environment.


Job Description:



  • Translate business requirements into architecture designs:

    • Understand the existing software core architecture, interactions and dependencies between its main components.

    • Support product managers to gather and filter key information from stakeholders.

    • Evaluate risk by identifying development complexity, limitations and impacts.

    • Determine development feasibility within identified constraints.



  • Support product managers with drafting functional specifications.

  • Write minimum technical specifications and documents.

  • Participate in detailed development reviews and demos.

  • Write unit tests.

  • Troubleshoot and guide the team to resolve complex problems.

  • Suggest core infrastructure enhancements based on current and future technology trends.

  • Brainstorm and solve very interesting problems that will considerably increase product user experience.

  • Coach and mentor junior team members:

    • Contribute and promote software best practices and processes across the team.

    • Participate actively in code reviews.

    • Provide teammates continuous technical support.

    • Provide guidance for new feature integration and key architectural decisions.



  • Share knowledge through collaboration, training, peer review, presentations, and articles.


Requirements:



  • 7 + years of C# and ASP.NET experience.

  • 4+ years of hands-on technical leadership experience around system engineering.

  • 2 + years of MVC experience.

  • 2 + years experience working under Agile scrum framework.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field; Master’s degree preferred.

  • Strong knowledge of SQL Server.

  • Strong experience with web development (HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, relational databases and SQL).

  • Experience with MongoDB preferred.

  • Experience implementing REST architecture preferred.

  • Demonstrated ability to be accountable and be a leader in their areas of expertise by staying on top of the latest developments.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the proven ability to effectively translate complex ideas and tailor key messages to multiple audiences.

  • Good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).

  • Work location can flex to our Chicago location occasionally subject to the needs of the business.

jobs.title: Remote Sales Manager
jobs.content:
No phone calls or emails, please. We only accept applications via this form.

ABOUT US

Museum Hack is a creative company that offers irreverent, renegade museum tours and cultural offsites to corporate and private clients. Founded in 2013 and having grown to $2 million in sales in 2016, Museum Hack has uplifted the lives of tens of thousands of new museum guests. We work at renowned cultural institutions and quirky locations in New York City and other major cities to bring these innovative experiences to companies and groups.

Museum Hack has been featured by The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, PBS, TimeOut New York, Huffington Post, TEDx, and more. Beloved clients include private citizens, schools, industry groups, and large companies like Google, Lego, LinkedIn, and CitiBank.

THE OPPORTUNITY

Museum Hack is looking for an ambitious seller with 3-5 years selling and sales team management experience to be our Sales Manager. Youâll be a major part of helping Museum Hack grow, grow, grow! We are excited for this new hire. The right candidate has massive growth potential with our company on a Sales Director track.

The Sales Manager will coach the remote team that oversees our inbound sales as well as lead our budding new biz team. The Sales Manager has lots to do upon getting started by shoring up our processes and improving our healthy inbound flow. Then thereâs lots of room to grow by helping us think about new markets, developing ways to make our happiest customers even happier, and reaching out to identify and cultivate new customers.

If youâve been managing a few salespeople at a company you donât love or for a product you donât use, and are looking to shine again... then this is for you. Step into a leadership role at Museum Hack to help us share our beloved, 5-star rated experiences with the world!

ABOUT YOU

Youâre a creative and ambitious person with experience in sales, management, and doing what it takes to build a company up. You have B2B or enterprise sales experience.

You live in the United States or Canada, and you're readily available during East Coast working hours. You have a home office and have some prior experience working remotely. This is not a position for digital nomads.

Important: You must have prior management experience in sales, with direct reports whom you had hire / fire responsibility and gave coaching and reviews to.

THINGS YOU SHOULD BE / HAVE...

  • Experience managing at least 2-3 salespeople in a positive sales culture
  • Focus on B2B or enterprise sales. Retail sales managers need not apply.
  • 3-5 years in a sales role with a passion for becoming an energetic sales leader
  • A sales track record that shows your ability to grow revenue and relationships
  • A strong reputation with your clients for driving high satisfaction
  • Experience proposing new sales processes, markets, or ideas to your leadership
  • Experience managing/overseeing CRM software to track activity (we use Base)
  • Proficiency with the usual office suites (Excel, Word, Google Docs, contract programs)
  • Ability to work remotely and communicate in a variety of channels (we love Slack)
  • Youâre inspired by arts, culture, and institutions that let us experience them (we love museums!)
  • You want to help Museum Hack become the most successful cultural experience company in the world!

THE RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Train and coach the inside sales team and new business exec to improve performance
  • Manage a remote team with success, empathy, and strong communication
  • Set benchmarks and tone for sales calls, emails, and communication
  • Set sales goals and help our sellers to meet and exceed them
  • Get us organized by managing lead assignments, creating new sales processes, and logging activity
  • Create a strong and positive sales culture with a strong emphasis on our customer
  • Measure sales KPIs and take creative and difficult steps to improve them
  • Develop one off sales into quality, lasting relationships through customer development
  • Research, manage, and reach out to new customer prospects to grow revenue
  • Navigate larger organizations to get to the right decision-maker
  • Be obsessed with our corporate customers and how to make them even happier
  • Set a great example for how to lead creatively and effectively at Museum Hack
  • Work alongside the Museum Hack management team to help grow the company
  • Love Museum Hack and how it transforms people into healthier, happier humans obsessed with these great cultural institutions! (Theyâre not always boring, we promise.)

OUR SALES TEAM

This team and department is being led by an overall sales manager and an inside sales team lead. The existing sales manager's role is evolving into focusing on partnership development with our high performance clients.

To apply: Apply here: http://museumhack.com/sales-manager-wwr/

jobs.title: Web Application Engineer
jobs.content: We are looking for a passionate engineer to be the next member of our growing developer-owned company. We care far less about what particular technologies you're working with than we do about your experience and passion for building useful software. jobs.title: Senior Database Developer – Oracle PL/SQL
jobs.content:
The Database Development Team at Paf is responsible for the development of data management (including data warehousing) and the BI tools, providing stakeholders and other teams like Compliance, Analytics, CRM and Customer Communications with the data required for daily operations as well as long term business development.

We are now looking for Senior Database Developer to strengthen the team. In this role you will be involved in the whole development life cycle from analysis and design to development and testing of our Internet business. You will also work with our experienced DB/DW professionals with various tasks and work related activities around database development, Big Data and Middleware products.

Requirements:

  • Degree in Computer Science or in information Processing Science development.
  • 5+ years of proven experience in Oracle PL/SQL.
  • Experience in SQL tuning and optimization.
  • Experience in OLTP Database design.
  • Experience with DW design.
  • 5+ years of troubleshooting experience of database queries, reports.

To your advantage:

  • Basic knowledge of software development and data access layer design.
  • Knowledge of DW principles and/or working with large data sets.
  • Experience of Analytics and Big Data technologies.
  • Experience with data warehouse or large data sets

Your personal qualities:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • A good communicator with customer oriented approach
  • Proven collaborative skills and ability to work well within a team
  • Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting

Good knowledge in English (written and spoken) is a requirement since our corporate language is English.

Are you interested?

Please submit your application online at http://bit.ly/2iZLxGd by 23rd January 2017 the latest. All communication and applications will be treated confidentially. For more information about the position, please contact our recruitment partner Arja Martikainen, +358 407621564 or arja.martikainen(at)barona.fi.

jobs.title: Marketing
jobs.content:
Hey, I'm the CEO of my company and I am looking to hire an extremely motivated go-getter to master the art of media buying (buying ads online).

You will work side-by -side with me and I will personally train you. 

I will also pay top consultants in my industry, some who cost $500-1,000 per hour, to train you to be a highly skilled and indispensable employee and gain a skill you can use for life.

The goal is to eventually have you manage millions of dollars in annual ad spend, planning our ad strategies and overseeing all our ad campaigns, making sure ROI is maximized, no unnecessary money is lost and no costly mistakes are made.

I prefer someone with no prior experience whom I can train from scratch. You must, however, have a serious work ethic, a great attitude and a strong desire to achieve big things in the world.

You're getting in on the ground floor of this company, which means there will be tons of opportunity for salary growth and new responsibilities to take on, including hiring and overseeing additional employees.

ABOUT THE POSITION:

Here's what you'll be doing (and will be trained to do)...

- Using existing ad networks to put our advertisements online (Facebook, native networks and more)

- Setting ad budgets and closely measure the performance and profitability of every ad

- Canceling low-performing ads and investing in high-performing ones

- Split testing different ads against each other to improve ad performance

- Keeping STRICT track of ad performance daily to make sure no unnecessary money is lost and ROI is maximized

- Setting up and testing different landing pages to increase conversion rates and returns

- Using ad spy software to spy on competitors and other advertisers to find new places to advertise and come up with new ideas for creatives

- Working with sites and adnetwork compliance teams to create compliant ads and landing pages that meet their approval

- Negotiating discounts on adspace and credit from networks

- Keep tabs on new ad networks

- Doing grunt work to find solo sites and negotiate ads on those sites

(NOTE: If you're not totally sure what all this means at this point, that's totally fine.)

ABOUT YOU:

You are highly detail-oriented, you never make mistakes twice, you are comfortable taking on new responsibilities, are a fast learner, ambitious, a go getter, you want to achieve success in your career and be the best you can be.

ABOUT THE COMPANY:

We are an edgy company that sells dating and sex advice courses as well as a new foray into health supplements. Our revenue hit $3M in 2015 and we expect will double in 2016. We are a small team of "work hard, play hard" individual's building something great and it seems to be taking off with great speed -- we hope you'll join us!

Work is a fast-paced environment, you'll be expected to wear many different hats and learn quickly on the fly, but you will become good at what you do.

Must be 100% OK with adult-content, as some of our ads appear on adult sites.

DETAILS ABOUT THIS POSITION:

Compensation: $40k -- 50k+

Hours: 10am -- 6pm EST, Monday-Friday (semi-flexible)

Location: Currently work from home. Monthly in-person work weeks. 

Our Team: We're located in NYC and 16 strong, plus part-time employees.

==========
DEADLINE:
==========
Deadline for this application is Monday, 2/6/2017

=======
To Apply:
=======
This is a THREE ROUND application process. 

A written application, a 3-minute video interview and finally, if you make it, an in-person or skype interview.

jobs.title: Key member to cross-functional team >> Skilled Java Developer
jobs.content:
In the Digital Trading & Advisory team we take pride in giving our customers a state of the art FX trading platform and now we are looking for a highly skilled Java back end developer to help us do this.

Digital Markets is the e-business area of Nordea’s fixed income, currency and commodities Capital Markets business. We are both a business area deeply integrated in our business and an IT development organisation


You will be an integral part of the team building the back-end to support a state of the art user-centric e-Markets web application. Our aim is to create a one stop shop for our customers collating all of our services in a modern web based platform, and continuously add new areas to our service offering. We want a high quality scalable solution that turns complex workflows into suitable straight forward user journeys for our customers.

You will be a key member of our agile cross-functional team of talented and very technically skilled people, currently consisting of 2 backend developers, 2 frontend developers, and 2 specialists/Product Owners. This team is one of three co-operating closely on the e-Markets web application. It goes without saying that we work with modern technologies and tools – but we also prioritise a learning culture and having fun in our daily work. You will be working at our Nordea office at Christiansbro in Copenhagen

You will help plan, design, develop, test, troubleshoot and support the RESTful micro-services that act as intermediary between the customer portal (a single page web application) and internal systems components and programs. You will also be responsible for the low-latency live streaming components that handle the trade execution.

You will act as a technical sparring partner and contact point towards system analysts and architects.

More information and send application


If you have any questions, please contact Head of Digital Trading and Advisory, Britt Rifbjerg Hertsdahl, britt.rifbjerg@nordea.com or +45 24986566.

Over the past 10 years, Digital Markets has been instrumental in changing the Markets business. We are now focusing on the next steps for our e-business area, and we have very high ambitions of creating a unique user experience. We have equally high ambitions for an outstanding UI design and implementation, and we use the latest in web development tools and agile processes to achieve our goals.

About the position

Reporting directly to the CTO, you will be in charge to maintain, design, challenge and take the lead on subjects related to the backend aspect of the various Saas solutions owned by the company. Wiremind currently operates two main applications:

The stack we use is the following:

We follow a strict continuous deployment with unit testing pattern and do code review on every changes before merging it.

  • Work on improving Wiremind’s development & deployment workflow (both in term of processes and tools)


Conditions



Full-time job, based in Paris (11th district). Starting date as soon as possible.


CV and cover letter.


Salary according to experience.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer  - Data Science Platform
jobs.content:
At B23, we build data products that push the limits of modern hardware and software to power decisions for data business, from startups, to unicorn, to multi-national enterprises. For example, we developed a custom data pipeline that produced to Apache Kafka at a rate of 1PB of data every 66 minutes. We are constantly thinking of new ways to automate technology to relieve humans from mundane infrastructure and software configuration tasks. We embrace the notion that "if you are going to do something twice or more, you might as well automate it."


B23 currently has an open position for a Senior Software Developer for Data Science Platform. We are seeking a senior developer, leader, and mentor who can take ownership of aspects of the data delivery platform. This is a remarkable opportunity to shape the direction of our small but growing company, work with the brightest developers, and impact the world related to cloud, big data, and data science. We’ve done it before, and we are doing it again. The candidate should have experience with much of the following:



  • Strong understanding of concurrency and parallelism software development techniques

  • Working with data at the terabyte scale

  • Writing clean and concise code using functional and object oriented programming models, preferably using Python or Scala

  • Familiarity developing with distributed processing systems such as Spark, Kafka, Hadoop, Storm, Nifi, StreamSets, etc.

  • Familiarity with developing on AWS and using its SDK’s

  • Applying sound engineering processes, including gitflow, code reviews, automated testing


The most important attributes for a qualified candidate are: curiosity, creativity, and flexibility. You need the curiosity to ask big questions, the creativity to explore innovative answers to those questions, and the flexibility to build a system to implement those answers. You take an entrepreneurial approach to designing systems, aren’t afraid to ask questions, and have a keen eye for detail. You love building applications based on data products, enjoy performing thoughtful investigations of datasets, see the opportunity of cloud computing, and enjoy working with fellow engineers on hard problems.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer (PHP)
jobs.content:
Popsa is an e-Commerce startup that uses data to automatically design personalised products such as photobooks, posters, canvases, and postcards.

We are disrupting the print industry by automating in seconds what has traditionally been done manually by customers over many hours.

Our vision is to completely automate the traditionally laborious process of designing and ordering these unique products so that eventually we can generate them entirely in the background - programmatically selecting a user's content - and then prompt a purchase at strategic moments (such as before birthdays and after holidays). The core of the business will be data analysis to make customer decisions.

Currently we automatically generate beautiful photobook layouts in a matter of seconds (our conversion rate is already 5x industry average), but we want to go further by selecting the best photos and predicting purchase events too. This means from 2017 we will be developing machine learning algorithms to categorise photo content and predict what each customer wants in terms of style, all without them having to lift a finger. This is a challenge the entire team will be involved with.

We are seeking a highly motivated, ambitious and capable engineer to join us and become the team lead for all things on the backend, with career progression opportunities as we grow.

Responsibilities

  • API Development: Architecture, programming, testing, documentation, and deployment

  • Internal Application Design: e.g. Popsa’s bespoke PDF generator and our customer support CMS.

  • DevOps: Management of AWS infrastructure and automations such as backups and Lambda functions

  • Platform Stability and Security: Ensuring Popsa stays up and running whilst protecting our customer’s data.

Our iOS app is currently supported by a scalable platform architecture hosted fully on AWS. In 2017, we are launching an Android and Web applications to go with it. You will be responsible for developing the APIs which serve these applications, for ensuring the stability of the platform, and for working with the engineering team to optimise/automate internal engineering processes.

You will be involved in setting out the Platform and DevOps strategies for the business and will work alongside with the company's senior management.

Internally, we operate a policy of transparency - the deal is that we give all employees oversight of company data and in return expect everyone to be jointly responsible for growth. In short - it’s very much a team effort, and we operate an employee share options scheme to ensure everyone has a stake in the company’s success.

Requirements

  • 4+ years professional experience with PHP and SQL
  • Experienced with object-oriented programming with ability to optimise code for memory management and performance
  • Solid experience building RESTful APIs
  • Solid experience with Amazon Web Services (EC2, AutoScaling, RDS, DynamoDB, S3, Lambda, CodeDeploy, VPC, CloudFront, Route53, CloudWatch, SQS, SNS, SES)
  • A good understanding of Linux
  • Familiar with Agile Development processes (quick iterations, deploying regularly, working in sprints, tracking issues)
  • Attention to detail, writing neat, maintainable, well-documented code and following coding conventions
  • Ability to structure code for scalability and speed
  • Familiar with version control systems like Git, branching workflows, pull requests and code-reviews
  • Code deployment using Jenkins (or Bamboo, Capistrano)
  • A working knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript

From January 2017 we will be part of 500 Startup’s accelerator programme and we will be based in an office in central London.

If you’re interested, drop me an email and we can arrange to meet for a coffee. :-)

I look forward to hearing from you.

Tom Cohen, CTO, Popsa

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Do you crave volumes of data and the tools and resources to analyze it? Do you delight at the prospect of discovering patterns and transforming data into actionable information? Do you love working collaboratively with intelligent, energetic, no-nonsense colleagues? Are you as nice as you are brilliant? If you’ve answered “yes” to all four questions, we’d like to introduce ourselves. 


What You'll Do


At the core of LiveRamp’s products is a massive graph that connects the different identifiers for each person, their online devices, and the identifiers that 100s of different marketing platforms use to recognize them. As a LiveRamp Data Scientist you’ll analyze the complex connections in this half a trillion node graph that contains PBs of data from over a 1000 different sources. To work with this massive dataset, you’ll learn cutting edge big data analysis tools (e.g., Redshift and Pregel). Using the results of your investigations, you’ll further develop our conceptual framework for understanding LiveRamp’s identity graph, including new terminology, metrics, mathematical models, visualizations, and reports. Further, you’ll apply this conceptual framework to create new data refinement strategies that filter out suspect connections to further enhance the quality of LiveRamp’s identity graph.


Types of projects you’ll work on:



  • Further develop our conceptual framework for understanding and making quantitative decisions about our complex and massive identity graph.


    • Including the development of new terminology, metrics, mathematical models, visualizations, and reports.

    • Of paramount importance is understanding identity accuracy (i.e., correctness) and reach (i.e., completeness, how many people can we match?).


  • Apply this conceptual framework in the development of data refinement strategies that enhance the accuracy of our identity graph.

  • Explore and quantify the reach and accuracy implications for incorporating new sources of identity data into the graph.

  • Quantify the “holes” in our identity graph. I.e., what types of consumers are we missing identity data for?

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
LiveRamp is looking for senior DevOps engineers to help us maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Here at LiveRamp, we’re changing the world of data connectivity. Our technology unites the marketing technology ecosystem, enabling brands to measure the impact of digital marketing on sales and deliver highly relevant messages to consumers on virtually any channel or device.


As a Senior Engineer, DevOps, you’ll be responsible for helping bring the LiveRamp vision to life and doing whatever it takes to get the job done.We run a hybrid colo/EC2 environment with over 1,000 physical servers and at least as many virtual servers. We are responsible for ensuring high availability of an infrastructure that processes many billions of customer records on a daily basis. 


On the engineering team at LiveRamp, we value ownership and individual contribution within a collaborative environment. Be ready to leave your ego at the door, roll up your sleeves and start solving huge challenges as soon as you begin.


A Day in the Life of a LiveRamp Senior Engineer, DevOps:



  • Maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Create tools for managing our massive hardware resources; fight to make our server:sysadmin ratio ridiculously high.

  • Configure as code, leveraging Chef and VMware.

  • Monitor and detect what may break and when, using tools like Datadog and ELK

  • Work closely with developers to solve systems problems. Blur the line between ops and development.

  • Automate everything!

  • Push your teammates to be stronger engineers. They will do the same to you.

  • Take our engineering, business development and culture in a whole new direction during one of our four Hackweeks every year.

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs.content:
LiveRamp is looking for Senior Data Engineers to help us scale and grow a 1200+ node Hadoop cluster which processes 35 petabytes of data and 100 billion requests a month. Here at LiveRamp, we’re changing the world of data connectivity. Our technology unites the marketing technology ecosystem, enabling brands to measure the impact of digital marketing on sales and deliver highly relevant messages to consumers on virtually any channel or device.


As a Senior Data Engineer you will help bring this vision to life by building systems that collect, process, and distribute enormous quantities of data. You’ll collaborate with other engineers to execute on a diverse range of projects. This might include building out our large distributed systems, implementing algorithms, or discovering new ways to leverage 35 petabytes of data and 100 billion requests per month at lightning speeds.


On the engineering team at LiveRamp, we value ownership and individual contribution within a collaborative environment. Be ready to leave your ego at the door, roll up your sleeves and start solving huge challenges as soon as you begin.


Day in the Life of a LiveRamp Engineer:



  • Design and implement algorithms to efficiently process, analyze, and serve massive datasets on a 1200+ node Hadoop cluster.

  • Build, operate, and optimize large distributed systems.

  • Embrace and introduce technology innovations to keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become stronger engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Take our engineering, business development and culture in a whole new direction during one of our four Hackweeks every year.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Company Information:

Paktor is the leading SE Asian provider of various social networking platforms that are dedicated to helping Asian singles meet other singles in the region. Paktor emphasizes anonymity, locality, and usability for our users. We find out who you’d like to meet nearby and connect you with them if they’re also interested. Or to put it simply, we bring people together: without the pressure. After all, that’s what Paktor means.

Paktor was founded with the mission of connecting singles in Asia through technology-enabled platforms. To date, Paktor has grown into a leading multi-social entertainment network Company in Asia, with assets in dating, social networking, video live streaming and media sharing. Headquartered in Singapore with presence in Taiwan, Korea, Japan, Indonesia, Vietnam, Malaysia and Thailand, Paktor has over 7 million users and successfully made over 20 million matches. Paktor is backed by institutional investors including Vertex Ventures (subsidiary of Temasek), Majuven, Convergence Ventures, Infinity Venture Partners and Yahoo Japan.

The projects on our plate are amazing, and we're looking for talented people to meet the exciting technical challenges we face. We're looking for an experienced Java Engineer to contribute to the continual improvement of the Paktor experience for our users. We're open to your ideas for cool interactions and interesting ways to bring people together. The best ideas - from any source - are acted on quickly here. If you're an intelligent and highly ambitious entrepreneur, we want to talk to you!

Requirements:

  • Experience with Java Spring MVC
  • Deep knowledge of RDBMS (MySQL preferred)
  • Experience with AWS S3, EC2, RDS
  • Experience with Agile programming with scrum, code reviews, rapid iteration
  • Experience with Git

Bonus points if you have:

  • A BS/MS in Computer Science or Engineering from a top school, but a wonderful project list trumps all
  • Prior start-up experience is awesome (not necessary); being scrappy will help you hit the ground running.

Location can be remote. Need not be in Singapore

jobs.title: UX Designer
jobs.content:
SmartBug Media, a leading digital and content marketing agency, is seeking a remote freelance UX Designer to join its 28-person strong team of talented and passionate marketers. You will lead research, strategy and wire design for strategic web redesigns. Based on your work, the position will have the opportunity of full-time when the initial redesign is completed.

In this role, you will report to the Creative Director and work closely with her, the project manager and developers. This is a client-facing role where you will be leading research in the form of client and customer interviews, persona development, buyer’s journey creation and usability testing.

We’re looking for a passionate, detail-oriented UX Designer who will be a team player deliver high-quality work. If you are looking for a challenge where you can do great work with a collaborative team, this opportunity is for you.

We’re building a different kind of agency—one that lets you do great work without the sweatshop grind many agencies are known for. We believe people can deliver great results, have a great time with people you respect, and still embrace the things that matter in life. And we do it all remotely.

Responsibilities

  • Lead research and strategy for web redesign
  • Attend client and internal meetings
  • Work collaboratively with the CD and project manager
  • Conduct client and customer interviews
  • Create personas and buyer’s journey
  • Perform content audit with subsequent sitemap recommendation
  • Deliver clear design strategy
  • Design clean, strong wireframes or prototypes
  • Validate designs through usability testing

Requirements

  • 2-4 years of UX design experience with documented examples of working on large projects
  • Ability to simplify and distill complex ideas into intuitive experiences
  • Ability to present cohesive design approaches to internal and external teams
  • Ability to prioritize and manage workload to adhere to project timelines
  • Strong design chops with the portfolio to prove it
  • Proficient in Axure, Sketch, Invision, Adobe Suite or comparable tools.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Bachelor’s degree in design, human-centered interaction, related field or relevant work experience

Key Attributes

  • Excellent teamwork skills and the ability to deliver high-quality work, on deadline
  • Not afraid to speak up and contribute to make a project better
  • Values, ethics and integrity
  • Exacting attention to detail
  • Fun to work with

jobs.title: UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a creative designer with strong UI/UX skills, an eye for form and an ear for the user.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Designing new desktop and mobile interfaces for our existing products
  • Improving current workflows and layouts
  • Collaborating with our development team to craft new features that users love
  • Establishing design guidelines

(This is a remote and contracted position.)

jobs.title: React Native Engineer - Mid to Senior
jobs.content:
The role:

High Horse is a London based development agency building startup technology in the ecommerce and SaaS space. We are looking for a dedicated React Native developer to produce world class apps for our clients.

What you’ll be doing:

Building React Native apps for iOS and Android in ecommerce and Saas. At times you may be responsible for multiple projects, building new products or adding features to existing apps.

About you:

  • Self directed / self managed, you clean up a mess when you see it
  • Self learner and an early adopter - you loved react before it was cool
  • You care about writing thoughtful, maintainable code
  • Adequate communication - fluent english required, native / bilingual ideal

Remote work by remote workers:

  • Remote work makes us happier and more productive but it comes with more personal responsibility
  • You must work a fixed schedule on an EU timezone
  • We do daily standups and communicate constantly through chat and video
  • You should always have access to a strong internet connection that can handle video calls

The benefits:

  • Compensation: £25k to £40k
  • The latest hardware delivered to you inc. your choice of an iMac 5k / MBP
  • The latest peripherals and software with a product first mindset
  • A travel budget to meet the London team and relevant events
  • A generous education and training budget inc. books, courses, events etc.

Skills and requirements

  • You have built React Native Apps
  • You are comfortable with Redux, Nodejs and unit testing
  • You are a javascript enthusiast and expert, you counted down the days for ES6 features to be released
  • You implement designs and animations with great care and attention to detail

About High Horse

High Horse is a small, fast growing development agency in central London. We build technology for startups in the ecommerce and SaaS space working with full stack javascript. We are a remote first company and incredibly passionate about building lasting products with thoughtful coding and fantastic ux. We are looking for engineers who care about what they build and want to be impactful in a small team. Our growth and ambition means we are looking for people who can rapidly adapt and grow in their roles.

Why we hire remote https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sxEE8Ch2Cmk

jobs.title: Product Engineer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

We are seeking software developers who are looking to work with a team of well-seasoned product developers. Our team successfully and pragmatically delivers product for a core set of interesting clients.

We have many years of experience successfully working remotely.

REQUIREMENTS

We are not tied to any particular language or framework. We are looking for well rounded people who care about their craft and understand product development. That being said, here are some of the most common languages, frameworks and tools we are currently using.

Languages

Javascript, Ruby, Python, Go

Frameworks

Rails, React, Ember, Angular

Tools

Git

We don't look at years of experience and formal education as much as we look for tenacity, drive, attitude, humility and competency.

BENEFITS

One of our core values is taking care of people. This is not just something we say, but something we hold very dearly.

We are a no-nonsense happy team that enjoys working together and what we deliver.

jobs.title: Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Whiplash is empowering next-generation eCommerce entrepreneurs with simple and powerful warehousing and fulfillment solutions. Our software translates complex retail requirements into simple, failsafe instructions for warehouse employees across the globe.

Our goal is to make life easier for our customers and partners, and to leave them with the “wow” feeling of having solved logistics and fulfillment issues with ease, style and class.

jobs.title: Front End Web Designer
jobs.content:
Objective

To add a designer to our growing team who can make our beautiful code look beautiful to the end users.

Contract Description

Bonk Studios seeks a front end web designer to join the team. Before we bore you with the requirements of this position, why Bonk Studios?

  • We are a small team that throws out the politics, and focuses on developing great technology.
  • Adapting the SCRUM Methodology, your voice will always be heard, and your strengths will be utilized.
  • Each year, you will be flown out for a business vacation, and getting to meet the team. This year, we went to Hilton Head, SC.
  • Being able to work with the freedom of a contractor, but the stability of an employee gives you the best of both worlds. Never hustle finding gigs as a freelancer, yet being able to program in your underoos. At Bonk Studios, you will always have 40 hours of work each week. This always has been and always will be the case. No more hustling to find gigs!
  • Sick of writing emails back and forth? We utilize slack, and a bug tracking system to communicate. This leaves more time to focus on developing great applications, and posting funny pictures!

Now that you know a little bit about our team and how we operate, what skills are essential to join Bonk Studios?

  • Great design must be second nature to you. Ideally, someone with a wide range of taste. For example, our website is quite unique to the typical website. Business professional, edgy, retro, etc. should all be styles that you are comfortable with.
  • Expert with CSS and SASS.
  • An expert with Bootstrap.
  • Must be a team player, great communicator, and able to work on multiple projects at the same time.
  • Master of time management.
  • Strong desire to always increase your skill set and adapt to new technologies.

Other skills that are a big plus:

  • Knowledgeable with SCRUM Methodology. If you have never practiced this, we can help you.
  • Knowledge of jQuery and Angular
  • Knowledge of Typescript.

Contract Details

From time to time, Bonk Studios and the team will be flown out to visit clients to go over projects. The contractor should be available for this.

Note: This is a contracting position. No benefits will be given, nor will any taxes be with held.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
About the position

This is a full stack position with an expected duration of 3 months. You will work remotely and can choose the hours that you work, as long as we have a couple hours of overlap during the day (Toronto is UTC -5:00).

We are seeking someone with intermediate Python/Django experience and novice/intermediate experience with React.js (with Redux a big plus). The position is heavily weighted towards front-end development yet will require interfacing with our back-end. The position will entail several small tasks rather than undertaking a large project and really is a great opportunity to learn/strengthen React.js skills quickly.

About the company

ClinicSense offers clinic management software to small wellness clinics. We help automate several of the tedious day-to-day administrative tasks, so that our customers can spend less time on paperwork and more time with their clients.

jobs.title: Sr Python Engineer, Backend/Pipeline
jobs.content:
ExecVision is building software to help companies extract insights from call recordings. We integrate with over two dozen different sources for calls, using APIs or scrapers to retrieve users' content, which is then matched to CRM records to provide metadata. The recordings then flow through a content pipeline which transcodes, transcribes, and performs analytics, and the results are then indexed in elastic search for usage in the website.

We're looking for a Sr Python Engineer to work in the content pipeline team. You'll be focusing on scalability, task distribution, efficiency, and quality. If you're an engineer who likes to optimize algorithms and prove correctness, this is a perfect job for you.

Our team is distributed, and no travel is required.

A home office stipend is available. US or Canadian citizenship is required.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years commercial Python experience, expert level Python skills
  • BSc Computer Science or equivalent
  • "Big data" and distributed systems experience
  • Expert level SQL skills
  • Clear communicator, good time management, and experience working from home

Nice to have:

  • Audio transcoding / processing (sox, ffmpeg, pyaudioanalysis, scipy)
  • Fast Fourier Transform
  • Elastic Search or Solr
  • REST, SOAP, OAuth, etc
  • Machine Learning, NLP

If you think you're a good fit, we'd love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer With React.js Experience
jobs.content:
FoxCommerce is a Seattle, Washington based company looking to add to our remote engineering team located in Russia and Ukraine.  We are seeking both Front and Back End engineers with the hunger to be more than just a cog in a giant machine.  This is the perfect role for a technical leader that cares deeply about their craft.  You’ll be a good fit if you want to contribute to a platform by writing excellent code, planning the architecture, mentoring junior engineers, and working to continually improve our approach to software development.  


We’re a polyglot organization and we believe in using the right tool for the job.  Our stack today includes Scala, GoLang, Elixir, and React.js.  


What we're looking for:


You're the right person for us if you strike a balance between pragmatism and pushing the envelope.  You want to be part of a small, high-performance organization in a rapidly growing company and market.  You want to build something people will use.  You care as much about going fast as you do about doing it right.  You want friendly teammates who aren't dogmatic.

jobs.content: FoxCommerce is hiring an UX/UI Designer anywhere

jobs.title: UX UI Designer
jobs.content: FoxCommerce is hiring an UX/UI Designer anywhere

jobs.title: UI/UX Designer - Russia and Ukraine
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Seattle, WA
URL: www.foxcommerce.com

FoxCommerce is looking for a talented UX/UI designer to work directly with our Product and Engineering teams to craft and deliver elegant user experiences for our clients. You will be joining our remote team in Eastern Europe. 

FoxCommerce is building a modern SaaS eCommerce platform, optimized for mobile and global commerce. Our founders know eCommerce and have done this before. They’ve built real companies with $200M+ in revenue and more than 400 employees.

Who we're looking for:

  • You strike a balance between using industry-standard design patterns and pushing the envelope.
  • You are comfortable working on a variety of projects, from web and mobile apps to branding and marketing assets.
  • You are able to gracefully balance multiple projects at a time.
  • You have an impeccable aesthetic and attention to detail.
  • You value communication and organization.
  • You enjoy and value direct communication with clients and external stakeholders.
  • You’re a self-starter who can always be relied on to get things done.
  • You have a challenge-seeking attitude and the follow-through to thrive in a rapidly growing company and market.
  • You care as much about going fast as you do about doing it right.
  • You actively seek out feedback, handling it with humility and an open-mind.
  • You have the skill and experience to design a product end-to-end: developing and collaborating on concepts, researching, crafting user-centric wireframes and intuitive UI, collaborating with engineers, and delivering a pixel-perfect product.

Responsibilities:

  • Crafting designs up and down the fidelity spectrum - from user flows and sitemaps, to wireframes, to detailed mockups with specs.
  • Creating interactive prototypes of designs in some way, shape or form.
  • Working directly with existing and prospective clients to understand their customer base and business needs, in order to inform the design process and project scope.
  • Working with existing and prospective clients to identify opportunities for UX/UI improvement to create business value.
  • Working with our product and engineering teams to create and ship designs.
  • Driving research, user tests and A/B tests to inform product and design patterns;  proposing and crafting improvements based on findings.  
  • Maintaining design patterns and style guide to help drive clarity and velocity.
  • Nurturing the inner-designer in all of your teammates, whether they be engineers or account executives.
  • Providing ongoing feedback to engineers and product leaders about current implementation.
  • Training and mentoring new design teammates.

Requirements:

  • Experience designing production web and/or mobile applications at a high-performing organization.
  • Experience in a client-facing role and long-term projects.
  • Excellent verbal and visual communication skills, with experience presenting to both clients and coworkers.
  • Exposure to B2C eCommerce/digital retail design, with an understanding how to design for both small and enterprise businesses. Exposure to B2B design is a plus.
  • Expert ability with design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator and Sketch.
  • Experience creating rapid, interactive prototypes with tools such as InVision.
  • Experience with, or desire to learn, After Effects/motion graphics for prototyping is a plus.
  • Exposure to reading or writing UI code (HTML/CSS/JS) is a plus.

To apply: Please send a resume and cover letter with your location to jessica@foxcommerce.com

jobs.title: React.js Engineer - Russia and Ukraine Remote Team

We're a fast-growing business that sold our product before we built it.  We bootstrapped for more than a year, and were cashflow-positive before we raised any outside capital.  Almost everyone in the company writes code.  Our founders have done this before.  They've built real companies with $200M+ in revenue and more than 400 employees.

Responsibilities:

  • Contributing to key architectural decisions
  • Actively pair-programming with teammates when they need help
  • Drive formal and informal code reviews
  • Adopting best-practices in code structure and tool chain within the company
  • Diving into R&D when necessary to help the organization explore which new technologies are the best fit

Ideal Characteristics:

  • Experience building production UI applications using a modern toolkit such as:
  • React.js
  • Angular.js
  • Node.js
  • Ember.js
  • Backbone.js
You have an active interest in building great user experiences

You're addicted to building performant UI applications

Youâre not afraid of CSS and HTML5

You believe that UI engineering is first-class software development

Exposure to functional programming and modern concurrency primitives is a plus

jobs.title: Wordpress Developer Technical Director
jobs.content:
Alchemy+Aim is a strategy and website development company, specializing in helping thought leaders, entrepreneurs and creative businesses. 

The Basics of the Technical Director Job:

+ You would be lead developer on the team. We're looking for someone who is really knowledgeable about Wordpress development, PHP, CSS, and Javascript, who can lead the team in learning and developing websites. You'll also be helping team members troubleshoot problems on projects as they arise, and onboarding new developers to the team, showing them the systems we use and performing regular code reviews.


+ You would be developing custom Wordpress sites. You would be developing custom Wordpress themes and websites from designs provided via Photoshop, Illustrator, and Sketch. Your syntax style should be consistent, understandable, and commented where needed. You must ensure content population is intuitive and easy for the client by using appropriate fields and comments.


+ You would be responsible for technical support requests and our technical support system. We want a team member who can handle/organize incoming tech support requests and communicate with clients. For sites we've developed, you would be responsible for making changes where necessary to site and keeping repos up-to-date with changes.


+ You would be regularly researching new plugins, codes, or other trends in website development. We want to truly serve our clients and make sure we're well-informed and constantly learning about the best features, plugins, and ways of doing things that are out there.


+ You would be responsible for overseeing some general company systems, such as backing up site data and running regular security checks.


+ You would be communicating with the team regularly. We use Slack for regular communication and Basecamp for project management. There are also some team meetings and individual meetings.

Job benefits:
 + You can work from anywhere. No moving for a job involved. If you’re happy where you are, stay there. If you’re unhappy, move somewhere new. This job will go with you. (If you want to spend a month working from the Italian countryside or in a Scottish pub -- we do that sometimes, more power to you.)

+ You decide what you want your hours to be. You just need to communicate with the team regularly, with your hours overlapping EST business hours for at least 4-5 hours per day.

+ You start out as a contractor, with the option to move to a full-time position. We want to make sure you're the right fit for us and we're the right fit for you. After 3 months, we'll discuss the move to full-time. We have a solid benefits package and lots of flexibility for our team members.

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer Extraordinaire
jobs.content:
Griddy is preparing for a huge disruption in the energy sector. Using the latest in distributed service architecture, we have found a new way to deliver green energy, and we need more brilliant Software Engineers to make it happen.


We are building a gorgeous iOS app — and an Android app and a web app, too! — to provide customers with unprecedented visibility and control of their energy consumption and cost.


Want lower prices? There are times when the price of energy is $0! No joke. And we pass along 100% of the savings. 'cause that's just how we roll. Want to use more green energy? We'll show you when renewables are at their peak so you can take advantage of wind, solar, hydroelectric and other renewable energy sources.


As part of our Core Engineering Team you'll take charge of the mobile app, working closely with other engineers to design, build, and manage our flagship product. You'll be collaborating with the backend engineers to ensure that the platform supports highly-interactive front-ends that scale seamlessly across our stateless infrastructure.


Most importantly, you will be working with fellow experts to solve real life problems in how our society currently consumes, pays for, and thinks about energy. Go planet!

jobs.title: Data Engineer - Python or Scala
jobs.content:
At Toptal, we measure everything and always rely on data to guide all of our initiatives, including both our long-term strategy and our day-to-day operations.


As a Data Engineer, your main goal is to be one step ahead of data scientists and analysts, and support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. This is more than building and maintaining ETL pipelines. We need innovation, creativity, and solutions that will have significant impact on our velocity. We, in turn, will give you autonomy and freedom to turn your ideas into reality.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. However, we do things like rent out hotels in Africa or mansions in Thailand, and you will certainly be invited to come work with us.

jobs.title: Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content:
Building a great platform is not possible without having a great infrastructure in place. All of our services are always up and running and this is ensured by the great infrastructure that backs all of them.


As an Infrastructure Engineer, you’ll be responsible for the continued maintenance, improvement, and evolution of Toptal’s infrastructure and the health of all of our applications. Some of your main activities will be deploying and scaling various services, building fault-tolerant application setups, monitoring server and application performance, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring the security and the robustness of our server infrastructure.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. However, we do things like rent out hotels in Africa or mansions in Thailand, and you will certainly be invited to come work with us.


Responsibilities:



  • Deploy and scale Toptal products

  • Maintain and improve our server infrastructure

  • Ensure the security of our server infrastructure

  • Monitor servers and applications

  • Make strategic technical decisions related to the infrastructure (e.g. deployment and monitoring strategies, replication strategies, etc)

  • Onboard and mentor new team members

jobs.title: BPM Engineer
jobs.content:
Toptal is a fast growing business. We accomplished that by implementing a large number of business processes that our systems facilitates, tracks and optimizes. As a business-driven company, we’re constantly looking for ways to streamline business processes, improve their scalability and growth potential.


By joining our team, you’ll get the opportunity to influence the way we implement BPM into our systems. You will be helping the rest of the development team to gain an understanding of the best way to implement our business processes.


We never compromise on quality - we will dedicate whatever resources are needed to create the best possible solution.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere; however, we do things like rent out hotels in Africa or mansions in Thailand, and you will certainly be invited to come work with us.


Responsibilities:



  • Creating a brand new BPM engine based on a solid mathematical modeling language.

  • Modeling business processes using the BPM engine.

  • Proactively bringing BPM expertise to continuously improve the engine and business processes.

  • Ensuring robustness and ease of understanding of Toptal’s business processes.

  • Educating internal developers on business process modelling techniques and on common patterns and pitfall avoidance.

jobs.title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content:
The Space Telescope Science Institute (STScI) is looking for a Senior Infrastructure Engineer to help design and develop a new generation of tools and services for the STScI data archives.


As the operations center for NASA's flagship science observatories such as the Hubble Space Telescope and the James Webb Space Telescope (set to launch in 2018) we serve data products to the astronomy community for these and a further ~20 community efforts such as the Kepler Space Telescope, PanSTARRS, SWIFT, FUSE and GALEX. With upwards of 4 PB of multi-mission, multi-wavelength data we hold many of the highest-value datasets in astronomy.



The role:



With a heavy R&D focus, the Senior Infrastructure Engineer will be working directly with the Head of the Data Science Mission Office, our IT technology teams, and existing engineering staff to evaluate cloud-based services for data storage and large-scale compute/analysis to support the work of our data science mission. The work is a combination of technology evaluation, infrastructure design and benchmarking prototype solutions together with our astronomers, data scientists and engineers. The ability to communicate effectively your ideas with an audience of mixed technical skills and backgrounds is critical.



About you:



You're an experienced software engineer with significant experience of building cloud-based infrastructure to support complex data and compute intensive tasks. You've developed scalable, reliable, highly-available secure and supportable production systems and take pride in shipping high-quality, secure-by-design code using a modern development toolchain.


You thrive in an environment that offers you significant freedom to develop novel solutions but you also have a demonstrated commitment to shipping. You enjoy solving hard technical problems and explaining your solutions to your peers as well as management. You enjoy getting stuck into large, legacy codebases and developing roadmaps for their migration to new environments. You understand the challenges of scaling large projects and understand the critical role that automation plays in building reliable systems. You embrace the 'DevOps' mentality and believe that engineers should share operations ownership of the systems they build.



Responsibilities:


- Designing and developing prototype solutions for STScI's next generation data archive services


- Evaluate potential new technologies for STScI data management


- Provide technical guidance to other engineers and data scientists at STScI


- Work with research groups to gather technical requirements for enabling data-science workflows for their domains


- Contribute to technical roadmaps for migrating existing technologies and workflows to new solutions



Requirements


- Significant experience (4+ years) of designing, developing and shipping cloud-based solutions for data intensive analysis tasks


- Experience leading the development of complex technical projects with multiple peers


- Strong proficiency in Web Services (RESTful APIs, SOAP etc)


- Extensive experience of developing solutions in virtualized/containerized environments such as VMware, OpenStack, Docker, etc.


- Strong written and verbal communication skills


- Good working knowledge of configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet or Ansible



Good to have:


- Experience of contributing to open source


- Experience of working in a security-compliant (ITAR) environment


- Experience of developing computing infrastructure to support academic users


- Experience developing automated monitoring and reporting tools (e.g. Nagios)


- Experience of working with (and migrating) legacy codebases



Interested candidates are requested to complete an on-line application through our website at http://www.stsci.edu/jobs. Please provide a CV/resume and a cover letter stating your interest in the position and qualifications you bring to the position in the "Resume Upload Section." Please include job # 16-0368 in the filename. Applications received by 1/27/17 will receive full consideration.


AURA, as a leader in the astronomical community, is committed to diversity and inclusion.  AURA develops and supports programs that advance our organizational commitment to diversity, broaden participation, and encourage the advancement of diversity throughout the astronomical scientific workforce.  Learn more at http://www.aura-astronomy.org/diversity.asp. 


As a recipient of U.S. Government funding, AURA is considered a government contractor and is subject to Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action regulations. As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, AURA and all of the centers, do not discriminate based on race, sex, color, age, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender identity expression, lawful political affiliations, veteran status, disability, and/or any other legally protected status under applicable federal, state, and local equal opportunity laws. The statements below as well as the requests for self-identification are required pursuant to these regulations.  We encourage your participation in meeting these federal reporting requirements which are included for protection and to assist us in our recordkeeping and reporting.  Your responses are kept strictly confidential.


STScI sees the diversity of our staff as a strategic priority in our desire to create a first-rate scientific community. We reflect that deep commitment in strongly encouraging women, minorities, veterans and disabled individuals to apply for these opportunities.


Veterans, disabled individuals or wounded warriors needing assistance with the employment process can contact us at careers@stsci.edu. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V  


 Voted to the Baltimore Magazine Hall of Fame in 2015 – Top 25 Places to Work in Baltimore.

jobs.title: Sr Python Engineer, Backend/Pipeline
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Arlington, VA
URL: http://execvision.io

ExecVision is building software to help companies extract insights from call recordings. We integrate with over two dozen different sources for calls, using APIs or scrapers to retrieve users' content, which is then matched to CRM records to provide metadata. The recordings then flow through a content pipeline which transcodes, transcribes, and performs analytics, and the results are then indexed in elastic search for usage in the website.

We're looking for a Sr Python Engineer to work in the content pipeline team. You'll be focusing on scalability, task distribution, efficiency, and quality. If you're an engineer who likes to optimize algorithms and prove correctness, this is a perfect job for you.

Our team is distributed, and no travel is required. 

A home office stipend is available. US or Canadian citizenship is required.

Requirements:
5+ years commercial Python experience, expert level Python skills
BSc Computer Science or equivalent
"Big data" and distributed systems experience
Expert level SQL skills
Clear communicator, good time management, and experience working from home

Nice to have:
Audio transcoding / processing (sox, ffmpeg, pyaudioanalysis, scipy)
Fast Fourier Transform
Elastic Search or Solr
REST, SOAP, OAuth, etc
Machine Learning, NLP

If you think you're a good fit, we'd love to hear from you.

To apply: Send a resume to rfirmin@execvision.io

jobs.title: Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
We succeed as a company because of our people.  That's why we're looking for only the most talented and motivated people to join us.  Our software is revolutionizing the way “things get made” by allowing mechanical engineering diagrams describing parts to automatically be priced and ordered, all at the click of a button.  This incredibly easy and quick service is how we consistently create moments of delight for our customers.  And our customers make amazing things like spacecraft, satellites, planes, and cars.  


We set high standards and demand a lot from our people, but think that's fair because we know the best people love a challenge.  We take responsibility for our work and thrive on getting things done.  We love solving problems, have boundless curiosity, and question everything.

  • Working closely with the software development team to manage infrastructure, monitoring, security, and deployment across testing, staging, and production environments

  • Ensure smooth scalability for a rapidly growing software business

  • Manage the continuous integration and testing procedure to ensure successful, rapid deployments

  • Develop best practices for maintaining modern web applications


Our Benefits:

  • Stock options

  • 401K

  • 15 PTO days/year

  • Casual work environment

  • Standing desks

  • Regular happy hours, lunch and learns, and more

jobs.title: Sr. Java Developer
jobs.content:
Vertex Inc is currently looking for a Senior Java Developer to manage and deliver the interface design,development, testing and implementation process between Vertex and Third Party financial applications. To research, manage and plan the growth of the on-going technical relationships with these solutions. Ensure Vertex customers achieve successful implementation projects by delivering standard interfaces and facilitating custom configurations and enhancements to satisfy their requirements.



Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities: 




  • Manage, deliver and develop integrations to Vertex’s commercial tax products  - Follow methodologies to design, develop and test interfaces.

  • Document interface capabilities and limitations for Vertex knowledge base. Maintain ownership of interface knowledge transfer to internal and external audiences. Define support methodologies between Vertex and partners.

  • Maintain and advance existing relationships - Coordinate planning to understand and forecast functional and technical requirements over the life of an interface. Coordinate enhancements and new product requirements with appropriate Vertex entities.

jobs.title: Jr. iOS Developer
jobs.content:
About the Role


We’re looking for a talented Jr. iOS Developer to join our growing Brooklyn-based mobile development agency. You’ll work with our Clients, Designers, Project Managers, and other Developers to create cutting-edge codebases for our clients’ diverse native mobile applications.


The people who thrive in this position can switch modes easily between solo efforts and team projects, and can overcome a wide array of coding challenges. They enjoy the rigor of producing high quality code that’s at the forefront of industry innovation. They’re thorough, detail-oriented, and take pride in their work. We are these things, too.


Working at App Partner


Fact is, the kind of people who work at App Partner could work just about anywhere. They’re smart. They’re creative. They’re fun. They’re engaged. And they take a ridiculous amount of pride in doing what needs to be done to make sure our clients get what they need, when they need it. So why do they choose to work at App Partner? Simple. Because we get it.


We get that most people want to work in a great office in a vibrant neighborhood like Brooklyn – not some office park in suburbia. We get that work needs to be fun, vibrant and exciting – but never distracting. We get that transparency, communication and opportunities for growth matter. A lot. And that free snacks don’t hurt, either. We get that work is a big part of your life, but it’s not your whole life. And we get that smart, creative people want to be around other smart, creative people. Think you have what it takes? Apply and let’s talk.


Responsibilities:



  • Create, modify, and test high-quality code

  • Work from specifications drawn up by our Sr. Developers or Head of Development

  • Collaborate closely with project managers, designers, developers, and strategists

  • Take ownership of the projects you’re assigned
