jobs.content:
Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, Business Intelligence (BI)


Location: Portland, OR


Reports To: Senior Manager, Software Engineering



JOB FUNCTION:



The Software Engineer will join our BI Tech team to create and support business intelligence applications for internal and external customers. If you are a successful fit for this position, you enjoy working independently with minimal supervision; you are good at collaborating with designers and end users; you have good analytical skills, strong communication skills and a positive attitude.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Develop BI data models.

  • Work with other software engineers to manage and deliver data sets.

  • Design and maintain existing Qlik applications

  • Tune existing Qlik applications for efficient performance.

  • Maintain and ensure SDLC process and proper tools and standards for company BI development.

  • Work closely with the Product team to design external BI applications.

  • Work closely with stakeholders to design and maintain internal BI applications.

  • Train stakeholders on basic BI use and best practices.

  • Maintain BI source and source history.



QUALIFICATIONS:



  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Business or equivalent.

  • Minimum of 1 year experience with Qlik application design, charting, set analysis, scripting, testing and debugging.

  • Experience with basic SQL scripting

  • Experience with data modeling and Business Intelligence applications, concepts and patterns.

  • Experience providing training for users, internal and external customers.

  • Strong knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle

  • Familiarity with multiple 3rd party BI offerings to assist in evaluations as needs arise.

  • Familiarity with software and data security needs.

  • JavaScript, CSS experience preferred.


About comScore: comScore, Inc. (NASDAQ: SCOR) is the cross-platform measurement company that precisely measures audiences, brands and consumer behavior everywhere.


comScore completed its merger with Rentrak Corporation in January 2016, to create the new model for a dynamic, cross-platform world. Built on precision and innovation, our unmatched data footprint combines proprietary digital, TV and movie intelligence with vast demographic details to quantify consumers' multiscreen behavior at massive scale. This approach helps media companies monetize their complete audiences and allows marketers to reach these audiences more effectively. With more than 3,200 clients and global footprint in more than 75 countries, comScore is delivering the future of measurement. For more information on comScore, please visit comscore.com.

jobs.title: User Interface Developer
jobs.content:
At MacroFab, we're creating the tools that hundreds of hardware teams around the world use every day to build and deliver their products to customers.  Our mission has always been to transform the traditionally manual practice of managing manufacturing and logistics across dozens of vendors, while giving teams of any size the automation capabilities and operational effectiveness of the world's largest companies.  Today, our customers range from solo engineers to the world's largest technology companies.


The MacroFab platform makes quoting, manufacturing, and delivering electronics products a completely real-time and self-service activity.  Whether it's a single prototype, or a multi-thousand unit production run, there has never been a product manufacturing platform like MacroFab's before.  Beyond manufacturing, our platform also enables teams to manage inventory, fulfillment, and even automate and integrate systems via our RESTful APIs and e-commerce plugins.  


In this role, you'll create amazing, intuitive interfaces that teams will rely on as a core function of their business.  Our platform is not a "nice-to-have," for our customers, it's an essential part of their day-to-day activities and they will love everything you do that makes their life easier.  The team is focused on quickly delivering new solutions and enhancements, and our users give quick and thorough feedback on every new capability or enhancement.


Unlike other development jobs where there are walls between the development team and the end-users, you'll have direct access to customers, manufacturing experts, and every single team member to ensure that you get the information and feedback you need direct from the source.  As a team, we rapidly iterate around feedback, with the goal on getting the right features done in the best possible way.

jobs.title: Tech Lead Mobile
jobs.content:
Buscamos um Líder Técnico Mobile experiente, hands-on para liderar o desenvolvimento de um produto novo cuja peça central é um app, escrito do zero.


O EBANX trabalha com Squads, isto é, equipes pequenas (8-14 pessoas) horizontais multi-discliplinares em que devs, designers, pessoas de produto, negócio e marketing trabalham juntos para criar produtos incríveis.


O líder técnico trabalhará como o mentor em todo o processo de desenvolvimento mobile e também como um desenvolvedor sênior, colocando a mão na massa e fazendo acontecer.


Além de tentar conquistar o mundo, as suas atividades serão:


Trabalhar em um ambiente diversificado e dinâmico que desenvolve aplicativos em iOS e Android.



  • iOS: utilizamos Swift (Alamofire, Unbox, SwiftyJSON, etc...)

  • Android: utilizamos Kotlin (Retrofit 2, RxKotlin, etc...)


Ser dono do backlog de atividades e do processo de desenvolvimento priorizando com o gerente de produto e com a equipe nas sprints.
Tomar posse de projetos e fazer as coisas acontecerem. Queremos um ciclo de releases rápido, dinâmicos e sempre cheio de novidades.
Escrever e testar códigos de modo eficiente, ágil e bem-documentado.


O que é indispensável para a vaga?



  • Conhecimento em uma ou mais linguagens de programação como Swift, Java, ObjectiveC, etc;

  • Habilidade para escolher a ferramenta correta para o projeto e fazer o mesmo acontecer;

  • Integrar com APIs RESTful de olhos fechados;

  • Conhecimento em bancos de dados relacionais e não relacionais;

  • Saber utilizar bem conceitos do Git(Hub) como branching, pull-requests, etc;


Precisa ser formado?



  • Sim e não! Se você for formado em Sistemas de Informação, Ciência/Engenharia da Computação, Análise e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas ou cursos similares seria legal, mas se você tem uma puta experiência e sabe muito, se inscreve também!


O que mais a gente adoraria ver?



  • Experiência em desenvolvimento web full stack e APIs além de mobile.

  • Inglês avançado (conversação). Ele é o idioma oficial do EBANX.

  • Um bom espanhol. Estamos expandindo rápido por toda América Latina e iremos levar o aplicativo para esses mercados também.


O que oferecemos:



  • Aulas de Inglês e Espanhol dentro do EBANX

  • Bolsa para cursos e atualização de até R$300/mês.

  • Horário Semi-Flexível (8 horas de segunda à sexta)

  • Ambiente informal e descontraído - Frutas e snack saudáveis, chuveiros no escritório, uma Pug que adora carinho, patinete, nerf, drones, Nespressos e festas.

  • Programa de Remuneração Variável.

  • Contrato CLT, Vale Refeição, Plano de Saúde e Odontológico


Para saber um pouco mais veja a nossa Career Page e procure as fotos tiradas pelos ebankers no nosso instagram.

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
ClubReady is hiring a senior web developer in our St. Louis office. We are looking for a self-starter with strong front-end development skills who has experience developing and maintaining hybrid mobile apps. You will be responsible for translating wireframes created by our UX team to functional screens in our cross-platform mobile solution (based-on Apache Cordova and the Ionic 2 framework). Additionally, you’ll need to be able to help field bug reports from our support team and help resolve issues in our legacy mobile apps (built with Xamarin and Ionic Framework). Experience with C#/.NET web services using ServiceStack is a plus!


Responsibilities:



  • Translate Photoshop and Sketch files to functional mobile screens.

  • Participate in architectural/design reviews for new features.

  • Help diagnose issues in existing apps and apply fixes

  • Build custom themes to existing mobile apps

  • Compile and deploy apps to app stores on Android and iOS

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ClubReady is hiring an Software Engineer in our St. Louis office. The Senior Software Engineer is responsible for ensuring the systems of the software operate correctly while developing new systems and automation within the program across all platforms and environments.


Responsibilities:



  • Web and Database Application Development

  • Mobile Application Development

  • Windows Client and Hardware integration development

  • Systems integration and automation

  • Involvement with sales team/customer discussions/customer product related support issues as required

  • Responding to assigned customer helpdesk tickets, bug resolution, troubleshooting

  • Discuss and architect system issues and customer requests

  • Develop new system functionality areas

jobs.title: Database Administrator
jobs.content:
POSITION:


ClubReady is hiring a Database Administrator in our St. Louis office. The database administrator is responsible for maintaining the integrity of the data systems. The DBA is expected to keep the data systems operating consistently efficient offering a high degree of availability at all times. As the database administrator, he/she is expected to proactively and constantly be improving the data systems that support the ClubReady application environments.


Responsibilities:



  • Database Application Development

  • Data warehousing configuration and management

  • Creating complex analytic queries on large data sets

  • Creating stored procedures, triggers, and functions

  • Generating code to extract, transform and load data

  • Performance tuning of queries

  • Develop and maintain SQL maintenance plans in accordance with best practices

  • Analyze query execution plans and optimize database code

  • Research and develop new ways to improve existing functionality

  • Pro-actively analyze and bring forth ideas for continuous improvement

  • Data warehousing configuration and management

  • Other tasks and projects as directed by supervisor

jobs.title: Web-developer UX
jobs.content:
Alpiq Ltd. is a Swiss energy company operating throughout the European energy markets.


In order to continue the growth and handle the rapidly increasing pipeline for integrated real-time IoT, optimisation solutions and smart data driven applications we are strengthening our development team with user experience and front-end competences.


Web-developer UX


Job assignment


In your function as the Web-developer UX Specialist you will prototype, test and implement solutions for all types of front-end applications as an integral part of our optimisation solutions in the smart-data-to-decision framework. Together with the Senior UX Specialist you will further setup and integrate UX development activities within the unit, as well as shape the UX vision of the team. You will support the development strategy for front-end solutions following an optimum trade-off between agility/time-to-market, cost and scalability. 

Specific tasks will include: 



  • Implement and test UX solutions around user optimisation cockpits, asset and device monitoring interfaces, smart-data visualisation and more.

  • Collaborate closely with the senior UX specialist, development, business, optimisation and other technical teams.

  • Set up and integrate UX solutions in a consistent way within Energy Solutions’ and the general IT-landscape in collaboration with development teams.

  • Support make or buy decisions to deliver productive and professional solutions and design.

  • The preferred front-end solutions are web-based user interaction tools for integrated solutions around real-time flexibility optimisation and trading, decentral energy resources pooling and monitoring, smart grid solutions, energy Internet-of-Things and other related applications. Mobile Apps on different platforms will complement the portfolio.


Job profile



  • Prototyping: Ability to create low fidelity prototypes of applications and features (ranging from paper-and-pencil concepts to wireframes and interactive prototypes), for internal review and brain storming

  • Up-to-date knowledge of current trends and practices in web development like responsive web-design and responsive mobile-design

  • In-depth knowledge for creating prototypes with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Bootstrap, AngularJS/React

  • Additional knowledge of languages/methods are an asset: JSON, SASS/Compass, AJAX, Graphical design languages (material design), Node.js, Linux, RDBMS (e.g. SQL), Apache

  • Experience with data visualization and graphs (Reporting frameworks)

  • Knowledge Android/iOS app development beneficial

  • Knowledge of design tools beneficial: Creative Cloud suites, Adobe CS (Photoshop, Illustrator) or equivalent

  • Beneficial: UX Design methods, patterns and practices

  • Java software development, knowledge of Java EE or Spring technologies (back and front-end), SQL, Python, Linux, Docker/LXC, Hardware accelerated graphics API (OpenGL, WebGL)


Job benefits


We offer attractive employment conditions in a diverse, international environment, leading the digital transformation in the energy trading sector. As part of Energy Solutions you will have a unique chance to shape the future of Alpiq and tomorrow’s energy markets while working with top-level quantitative analysts, IT-scientists, developers and a lean management team.


About Alpiq


Alpiq is a leading Swiss electricity and energy services provider with a European focus. The company is active in power production, as well as energy trading and sales. Alpiq offers its clients extensive, efficient energy services for buildings and plants, transport technology, as well as power and industrial plant engineering.


Contact: Reto Röllin, Human Resources, Alpiq AG, Bahnhofquai 12, CH-4601 Olten, Tel. +41 62 286 71 11

jobs.title: Senior User Experience Specialist
jobs.content:
Alpiq Ltd. is a Swiss energy company operating throughout the European energy markets.


In order to continue the growth and handle the rapidly increasing pipeline for integrated real-time IoT, optimisation solutions and smart data driven applications we are strengthening our development team with user experience and front-end competences. 


Senior User Experience Specialist (f/m)


The new position is key to success on the way to implement Alpiq’s future technology framework.



Job assignment


In your function as the Senior User Experience (UX) Specialist you will provide technical solutions and concepts as well as development leadership for all types of front-end applications as an integral part of our optimisation solutions in the smart-data-to-decision framework. As the first UX expert in Energy Solutions you will take responsibility for the further setup and integration of all UX development activities within the unit, as well as shape the UX vision of the team. You will furthermore define a development strategy for front-end solutions following an optimum trade-off between agility/time-to-market, cost and scalability.


Specific tasks will include:



  • Design and implement UX solutions around user optimisation cockpits, asset and device monitoring interfaces, smart-data visualisation and more. The concepts and functionality will be derived along the user stories from the involved stakeholders.

  • Prototype the proposed UX solutions or supervise prototype development.

  • Work closely in an agile manner with different stakeholders across the business for the solutions and product design, understand the business needs and come up with creative UX solutions and improvements to contribute to innovative energy solutions.

  • Collaborate closely with the development, optimisation and other technical teams.

  • Present ideas, concepts and designs to management, front units, partners or customers.

  • Carry out, supervise and coordinate solution testing.

  • Set up and integrate UX solutions within Energy Solutions’ platform and optimisation framework as well as track and maintain development consistency across different platforms in the existing IT landscape.

  • Make or buy decisions to deliver productive and professional solutions and design.

  • Scan the market for available UX solutions.

  • Shape the vision of the Energy Solutions platform from the user perspective.


The preferred front-end solutions are web-based user interaction tools for integrated solutions around real-time flexibility optimisation and trading, decentral energy resources pooling and monitoring, smart grid solutions, energy Internet-of-Things and other related applications. Mobile Apps on different platforms will complement the portfolio.



Job profile


The candidate holds a degree in Information Technology, Software Development, or similar and has a minimum of 5 years of experience in UX development with a proven track record of successfully implemented projects. Ideally, the development experience is complemented with senior development responsibility.


Technical skills:



  • Up-to-date knowledge of current trends and practices in web development like responsive web-design and responsive mobile-design

  • UX Design methods, patterns and practices

  • Requirements engineering

  • Prototyping: Ability to create low fidelity prototypes of applications and features (ranging from paper-and-pencil concepts to wireframes and interactive prototypes), for internal review and brain storming

  • Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, JSON, JavaScript, Bootstrap, AngularJS, Node.js

  • Knowledge of graphical design languages (material design),

  • Design skills: Adobe CS (Photoshop, Illustrator), Axure or equivalent tools

  • Experience with data visualization and graphs (Reporting frameworks)

  • Sense for IT-Security (make the application as secure as possible)

  • Beneficial: Knowledge of Linux, RDBMS (e.g. SQL), Apache


From your personality and working mentality we expect:



  • A strong team-player, able to communicate and work with colleagues and managers of all functions and levels.

  • Creative, innovative, curious mind and pro-active contribution to solutions.

  • Fast understanding of concepts, in particular from user and business perspective.

  • Multi-tasking and independent specialist, able to cope with a dynamically growing intercultural environment.

  • Inspiring, visionary and motivating mindset.

  • You are fluent in English (written and spoken), knowledge of German or French is beneficial.


Job benefits


We offer attractive employment conditions in a diverse, international environment, leading the digital transformation in the energy trading sector. As part of Energy Solutions you will have a unique chance to shape the future of Alpiq and tomorrow’s energy markets while working with top-level quantitative analysts, IT-scientists, developers and a lean management team.


About Alpiq


Alpiq is a leading Swiss electricity and energy services provider with a European focus. The company is active in power production, as well as energy trading and sales. Alpiq offers its clients extensive, efficient energy services for buildings and plants, transport technology, as well as power and industrial plant engineering.


Contact: Reto Röllin, Human Resources, Alpiq AG, Bahnhofquai 12, CH-4601 Olten, Tel. +41 62 286 71 11

jobs.title: Rails or Angular Web Developer
jobs.content:
Your job will be developing the leading visitor management software for museums.


We want to build the most technologically advanced web-based software for museums. With GraphQL, Angular, Ruby on Rails and Docker.


You decide whether you would like to work on the backend using Rails, orchestrating controller actions and backend services or if you would like to focus on the frontend, working with Angular 2.0, components and web workers.


Together with your team, consisting of young, highly motivated software engineers, we want to push the world of museums forward. Allowing better and easier access to culture. Taking advantage of digital media in order to reach younger generations.


We offer you an attractive working place in Berlin Mitte, next to Rosenthaler Platz. In an office full of natural light, situated in a traditional old-style building, with a view out to Weinbergspark and a fair salary. You will work with exciting colleagues on cutting edge development.


You will take on the following duties:



  • Programming either backend or frontend

  • Writing tests and documentation

  • Designing and architecting new features

  • Running necessary infrastructure

  • Working together with colleagues and management as a team.


You will be the 8th full time member of our team so expect to take on responsibility.

jobs.title: Sr PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Sr. PHPDeveloper

Thisposition will participate in new product development as well as support and improveexisting PHP application base.

This is a very agile environment and collaborative team.Communication and a desire to succeed are of very high importance in thisposition

Compensation:
Compensation willbe commensurate with experience.

To apply: Please send resumes to: shurst@drndata.com

jobs.title: PHP/Drupal Developer - Digital Publisher of the Year!
jobs.content:
Dennis Publishing is one of the world's fastest-growing independently owned media companies and is currently one of the most innovative, successful and respected publishers in the world. We publish over 70 magazines, digital magazines, websites, apps and mobile sites in the UK (including The Week, Auto Express, Alphr, Buyacar, evo and Men’s Fitness) and The Week and Mental Floss in the US.


At Dennis, our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our mission is to ensure that our staff express themselves in an environment where change and growth are celebrated and we believe every person here contributes to the future success of Dennis! 


Our Award Winning development team are looking for a PHP/Drupal developer, with experience building and implementing websites and APIs in a commercial environment to join our team.


The Role:



  • The role involves working on both greenfield projects and on our Drupal Distribution which powers our growing portfolio of brands including Alphr.com, BuyaCar.co.uk, AutoExpress.co.uk, Evo.co.uk, TheWeek.co.uk, mental_floss.co.uk, Carbuyer.co.uk, CloudPro.co.uk, ExpertReviews.co.uk, DenOfGeek.com, to develop and integrate front and back-end functionality using open source technologies.

  • The opportunity to work together with the engineering team at Dennis will provide you with the skills needed to develop enterprise level cloud hosted applications, work on migrations from Drupal 7 to Drupal 8 and give back to the Drupal ecosystem.


So why work for us?


We’re a hard-working bunch, but we definitely know how to let our hair down (and plant a few trees along the way!) We believe in rewarding employees both financially and through recognition and support every day!



  • We have great employee benefits: 28 days paid holiday, interest-free season ticket loan, cycle to work scheme, discounted gym membership and more.

  • We know how to have fun. We host parties, birthday extravaganzas, summer BBQ’s, fancy dress parties, quizzes, charity trips, battle of the band nights and more.

  • Our office is slap bang in the heart of London’s West End – situated parallel to Charlotte Street with its many bars and restaurants and five minutes from Soho and London’s media hub.

  • As our charity (The Heart of England Forest) is literally at the heart of our business, we host monthly trips to the forest to help plant trees and take a break from the city!


You’ll be working with passionate leaders. Game changers. Award-winners. Industry extraordinaires. But we’re a social crowd who definitely like to take regular office trips to the local bars to wind down after a busy and of course rewarding week.


Dennis Publishing is an equal opportunities employer and encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

jobs.title: FULL-STACK .NET DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
We are now looking for passionate Full-Stack .NET developers who wants to be part of our agile development teams and contribute in their work on developing world leading Software Asset Management products/technologies.  


As a developer at Snow Software you will implement your own ideas to create great services for our customers. You will work closely with fellow teammates as well as our product management and design team to deliver quality products and solutions on time. In this position you are actively involved in the whole design and development process of our products, making them perform better and become even more user friendly. You will support our teams to integrate and develop our web solutions, backend support and JavaScript frontend features, as well as implementing new features and products.  


We offer an environment with exiting and developing assignment as well as the chance to join tech conferences and meet-ups in the Stockholm area.

jobs.title: .NET WEB DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
Snow develops software products that are used by thousands of corporate and enterprise customers throughout the world. In this, we are smart about our technology choices, looking at the latest trends but always choosing the right technology to handle the complexity of targeting multiple platforms and many different client environment. Yet always focusing on the customer needs.


We are now looking for web developers who appreciate the complexity of building large scale web applications in a structured way. If you consider yourself a systems developer who happens to appreciate web development. You are the one were looking for.


You have at least three years of experience in the field and a passion for the web and agile development. You explore and stay on top of the latest web development tools and technologies. You are proactive and pay attention to scalability, usability and maintainability of the systems you develop.

jobs.title: QUALITY ENGINEER
jobs.content:
Several experienced QA engineers to our product development teams to improve our agile testing,  nurture top quality and work hands on with system testing.


All our teams are cross-functional meaning developers and testers work closely together with quality assurance to prevent misunderstandings from becoming defects as well as finding bugs as soon as possible.


In this role you will together with your colleagues perform exploratory testing, identify test cases, define and implement the overall strategy for manual and automated testing of the products. You will also participate in identifying and implementing QA best practices into our development and release processes to support our high quality ambitions.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.content:
Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form-building application, is looking for a UX Designer to add to its already awesome Product Design Team!

Formstack is a 10 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform. 

Who You Are:

You're passionate about web apps, user-centered web design and have a passion for learning new skills. You also enjoy working in a collaborative environment that values critical & constructive discussions about design.

What You'll Do:


  • Work with the Product Design, Product Management and Development team to design and iterate user interface designs for the Formstack app.

  • Collaborate with our Product Manager, Fellow Designers, UX Researchers and Development team to create wireframes, prototypes, user flows, mockups and polished final designs.

  • Produce final user interface designs, while adhering to, and improving our UI library and Design Guidelines.

  • Work with your cross functional team to implement your designs in an agile workflow environment.



How You Qualify:


  • 3+ years of experience.

  • BA degree or higher.

  • Experience working closely with product development teams.

  • Practicing UX design as a major role in your job.

  • Knowledge of how to best design to solve business and user problems. Ability to understand the needs of customers.

  • Design fundamentals including information design, visual design, industry UI standards for desktop and web-based applications, and ease of use best practices.

  • Experience with relevant design tools (Adobe CS, Sketch, Invision...)

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.



Extra Credit Qualifications:


  • Experience working on a UX team.

  • Strong understanding and/or experience using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

  • Experience with designing, running and analyzing A/B tests or any other quantitative data analysis.

  • Experience designing for mobile apps (iOS, Android, Windows, etc.) and the mobile web.



Why You Want to Work at Formstack:


  • Remote environment

  • Medical, Dental, Vision as well as company-paid Disability and Life Insurance Benefits.

  • 401k with matching company contribution

  • Friday Lunch (Indianapolis Office)

  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job

  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning

  • Yearly company gatherings

  • Generous PTO



Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Check out our about page and apply if you want to jump into the next great chapter of your life!

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Formstack, Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form building application, is looking for a Front-End Developer

to add to its already awesome Product Design team.



Formstack is a 10 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform.



Job Description:



In this position you will work on a cross-functional team around a specific part of the app. Your team will work together in a scrum methodology to deliver new features and improvements to the Formstack platform. You will be responsible for implementing new front end code, improving and maintaining existing functionality. You will also work with the product design team to improve and maintain our custom built UI Library. You will also have a lot of fun collaborating, playing games, solving really difficult problems and building relationships with some really awesome, talented people.



What You Will Do: 




  • You will collaborate with a cross functional team around a specific part of the app. You'll work with Product Designers, Product Managers, Developers, QA Testers and UX Researchers.

  • Work with your team in a agile process to deliver each projects goals.

  • Develop and test across multiple browsers, platforms and devices - including smartphones and tablets.

  • Help improve and maintain our custom frontend UI library, optimizing it and making our whole front end codebase as efficient as possible. The next great Formstacker will also work with the Development department to assure a smooth hand-off of assets for implementation, work with both the Product Design and Development teams to implement their designs in an agile workflow environment and effectively manage their time across multiple projects and tasks in a deadline-driven, team environment.



Who You Are:



You enjoy working in a collaborative environment that values critical & constructive discussions about design and development. You're passionate about web apps and modern, user-centered web design and development. If that's you, you might be just what we need!



How You Qualify:



You must have a minimum of 1-3 years experience working in a fast-paced environment AND: 




  • Experience using CSS preprocessors such as SASS or LESS.

  • Experience writing awesome HTML5 and CSS3.

  • Solid experience with JS, particularly AngularJS.

  • Experience with version control systems (Git).

  • Comfortable using command line tools.

  • Experience with responsive design concepts.

  • Experience or a high level of interest in usability and user experience.

  • Knowledge of how to best design to solve business and user problems. Ability to understand the needs of customers.

  • Experience with relevant design tools.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.



Extra Credit Qualifications: 




  • Experience with frontend UI libraries (Foundation, Bootstrap, custom).

  • Experience with frontend unit testing (Mocha, Jasmine, Karma, Protractor etc.).

  • Experience with task runners such as Grunt/Gulp (or Makefile).

  • Experience with javascript frameworks (AngularJS, React, Ember.js, Polymer etc.).

  • Experience with Node.js.

  • Experience with Lean/Agile methodologies.

  • Experience working on a SaaS product



Learn More About How Our Team Works:



Everyone on our team blogs about working at Formstack. We dive into the details on our process, tools and anything else we feel like sharing. http://designstack.io/



What Formstack Offers:




  • Remote environment

  • Medical, Dental, Vision as well as company-paid Disability and Life Insurance Benefits.

  • 401k with matching company contribution

  • Friday Lunch (Indianapolis Office)

  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job

  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning

  • Yearly company gatherings

  • Generous PTO



Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Check out this Video and apply if you want to jump into the next great chapter of your life!

jobs.title: Security Specialist
jobs.content:
CAMP Systems International, is the clear industry leader in business aviation software and services for more then 4 decades, this position offers a chance to work in a deep and complex domain, suitable for curious, intellectually driven problem solvers.


CAMP provides information management services to the business aviation industry. The nature of aviation maintenance information lends itself to exciting challenges in terms of finding products and data technologies that deliver all possible business value.


 Our services are delivered through a “SaaS plus” model and we serve over 16,000 aircraft worldwide. CAMP has grown from a single location company with $12MM in revenue in 2001, to over $120MM in revenue, with more than 750 employees in 10+ locations around the world.  Most of this growth has come from strategic acquisitions, which have been fully integrated into the core operations of the business. 


This position is responsible for ensuring that CAMP’s applications and infrastructure is secure. Conducting security tests internally and with external partners. Working with customers to handle security related concerns. Working with software engineering and DevOps to ensure applications are engineered to be secure and deployed to production in a secure manner.

jobs.title: EDI Specialist
jobs.content:
We are currently looking for an:

EDI Specialist

Job purpose
The EDI Specialist’s role is to develop, coordinate, implement, and communicate Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) trading partnerships between Data2Logistics, its Clients and their Carriers’ systems. This individual is responsible for ensuring that EDI-related production and procedures are maintained and properly executed, including development, change requests, and EDI integration projects. The EDI Specialist will also act as liaison between Clients, their Carriers  and the IT staff implementing EDI-based applications.


Principal Duties and responsibilities (of the job):



  • Work with cross-functional D2L teams to implement data trading partnerships between D2L, its Clients and their Carriers.

  • Work within the Information Technology group to accurately map EDI transactions into D2L’s systems and business processes.

  • Lead, coordinate, and administer key process improvements to EDI implementations.

  • Participate in design and review of new applications and integration strategies of EDI systems.

  • Coordinate with IT’s Technical Operations team to ensure availability, reliability, and scalability of EDI software and systems to meet business demands.

  • Perform system configuration, mapping, and management for EDI-based transactions and processes.

  • Install, coordinate, and support EDI-related products.

  • Recommend and execute modifications to EDI systems in order to improve efficiency, reliability, and performance.

  • Assist in research of EDI-related software in support of procurement and system development efforts.

  • Develop and maintain EDI training materials and systems and process documentation.

  • Manage and/or provide guidance to junior members of the team.

  • All other duties as assigned

jobs.title: Fullstack .NET till Datscha
jobs.content:
Datscha växer! Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och skapa framtidens arbetssätt. Vi är i en expansiv fas och gör stora satsningar för att möta nya krav från omvärlden. Datscha AB är Sveriges ledande leverantör av tjänster för information och analys av kommersiella fastigheter. Vi har över 700 företagskunder, de flesta verksamma inom finans- eller fastighetsmarknaden. Användarna av tjänsten har olika roller som till exempel banktjänstemän, fastighetsägare, värderare, revisorer, konsulter, mäklare, jurister och etableringschefer.


Vi söker nu en .NET utvecklare, gärna fullstack, till vårt utvecklingsteam. Teamet består av 12 dedikerade personer med en passion för att leverera den bästa tjänsten på marknaden. Vi jobbar i ett DevOps perspektiv som säkerställer såväl kontinuerlig nyutveckling som att tjänsten alltid är tillgänglig för kunderna. Utvecklingsteamet och produktteamet jobbar nära varandra efter agila värderingar och processer med ett ständigt fokus på att teknik och affär ska gå hand i hand.

jobs.content:

As our first dedicated software engineer you will have the opportunity to guide and direct our development processes, and technology stack that we use. You will become a key member of our team, working directly with both founders, and helping to guide our company.


Your primary responsibility will be building a real-time video analytics platform, running state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms on real video data. This platform will start small and over time will scale to analyse thousands of simultaneous streams using dozens of different algorithms.

Silexica is a fast-growing software company that helps manufacturers of embedded systems, such as smartphones, to increase their device performance by effective utilization of the underlying multicore architecture. We are incredibly passionate about revolutionizing embedded parallel programming. We strive to constantly improve our software development tools, bringing together innovation, creativity and advanced software development principles.


Silexica is currently seeking a Field Application Engineer (m/f) to engage in joint development and research projects with our customers and provide technical support. We offer you the exciting opportunity to become a true specialist to solve real-life problems of multicore SoC software development from key players in the embedded market.


Job Profile:



  • Engagement in research and development projects with our customers

jobs.title: PHP Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Company:


Yume is a start-up, a disruptor in the world of food waste. They have built a platform that addresses the issue head on and offers clever technology that works towards a solution. They are a group of passionate individuals driven by a common goal and belief in the values they live by. This is a business that encourages creativity, to materialise their ideas, making a difference in what they do. It starts locally but in the next twelve months they will expand up the eastern seaboard of Australia, then nationally and internationally. This is an amazing opportunity to join an intelligent and driven team. An opportunity for a likeminded individual to make their own difference on the path of this exciting cause.


Culture:


People love to work at Yume because they feel a part of something that is making a positive impact on our society. The culture at Yume is quite relaxed and flat. They are not regimented. They work hard but have a good balance. But in this, they each have the internal drive and determination to face challenges and move forward. They work as equals and give everyone the freedom to create and be innovative. They have strong ethical values and this is critical for them to maintain. They thrive in seeing the impact of their actions and use it to push boundaries as individuals and as a team.


About the Role:


The PHP Engineer will report to the Head of Product and Process and will play an important role not only the development of the product but the transition from the current software vendors back in-house to the Yume team.


Key responsibilities for the role include:



  • Work onsite with current software vendors to familiarize yourself with the code base, under their current development team and workflows.

  • Work to shift the responsibility of code and technical infrastructure from the current vendors, to the Yume in-house engineering team.

  • Be a conduit between the business and the current vendors, clearly reporting technical progress and plans.

  • Work with the CTO to build out our product roadmap and manage release timeframes.

  • Develop Yume's capability to become an agile organisation. 

  • Become the voice of technology within Yume; guide our technical decisions with your wealth of experience.

  • Build out our automated testing processes and drive continuous integration and delivery.

  • Manage version releases and software documentation, following industry standards.

  • Collaborate amongst our broad team which includes non-technical stakeholders.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
Core Engine Java Developer
jobs.content:
Ecolane: Core Engine Java Developer

Type: Fulltime, permanent

Working hours : 37,5 h/week

Suitable background: Graduated

Location: Espoo

Starting date: As soon as possible

Deadline: ASAP

Now we are looking for a talented and proactive Java developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for the development work on one of the main functionalities in our core product, trip optimization. This also involves improving the existing algorithms and creating technical specifications. As part of this work, you will be simulating operations in the system and analyzing the results of the optimization.

You will be joining a team of talented and enthusiastic people, where each person takes both pride in and responsibility for making our product even better. You should be willing to solve tricky problems on your own but have no fear of communicating with others or questioning the existing solutions. Our management and processes will make sure that you have the specifications you need for your work, and a working environment that supports a healthy work-life balance.

What we are looking for:

-Excellent system analysis and problem solving skills
-A capability of understanding and evaluating the use of different algorithms
-An understanding of the fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
-A solid understanding of object-oriented programming
-An understanding of Java performance optimization and concurrency patterns, and a good knowledge of  Java ecosystems
-A basic understanding of JVM and its limitations, weaknesses, and workarounds
-An excellent knowledge of relational databases, SQL, and ORM technologies (JPA 2, Hibernate)
Fluent English

What we can offer:

-An independent role where you have both the support of your team and the possibility to make your own decisions about the way you work and solve problems
-A great opportunity to develop your skills as a software professional: you can learn new things every day
-Flexible working hours
-A relaxed working atmosphere and super nice colleagues: Ecolane’s people look after each other

If you are the Core Engine Java Developer we are looking for, send your CV and application as soon as possible to https://apply.atalent.fi/ecolane-core-engine-java-developer-12-2016 Tell us what you have done with the required technologies and what kind of projects you have worked on. Please mention your possible starting date and salary request.

You can read more about Ecolane at www.ecolane.com. For more information about the application process, contact Mia Paatsalo (050 4680 610, mia.paatsalo[at]atalent.fi).

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Camera team - Transmission electron microscopy
jobs.content:
Introduction, the World needs answers
If you want to help accelerate discoveries that change our world for the better, look no further than FEI. We are looking for motivated and inspired professionals with experience to strengthen our R&D software organization. We are devoted to bringing leading technologies to different markets with high quality products and services. The markets we service are Science (Life Sciences & Materials Science) and Industry (Oil & Gas and Semiconductor)

Check out these video’s



  • FEI’s corporate organization https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ABSxT6Y099I

  • FEI’s life sciences business https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KxfPTJt1NEA

  • Inside the FEI Titan Transmission Electron Microscope https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2wEmsDh_l_A

  • Blog SW Technical lead Eindhoven http://www.talentbox.nl/blogs/3/gl6zc7-achieve-breakthroughs-by-electron-microscopes-

  • Blog SW engineer Eindhoven http://www.brainporttalentbox.com/blogs/3/iwdy98-building-software-related-applications-for-electron-microscopes-



The Corporate Technology Software Group
A part of the R&D organization is the Corporate Technology Software Group.
This group is responsible for the development of the platform and microscope control software for Transmission Electron Microscopes (TEM), like cameras and imaging software
This group is committed to bring value-adding and game changing software solutions to our customers that help them with their success. The application software group is a multi-site development organization divided over the R&D sites in Eindhoven (the Netherlands), Brno (Czech), and Russia. The organization in Eindhoven consists of around 50 software engineers.

Position
The software engineer will be part of an enthusiastic team. You will be responsible for the full software development cycle of new features, product enhancement and new applications. Your assignment will be a mixture of the following activities:



  • Software specification based on system performance and requirements

  • Develop designs based on a full comprehension of the function, purpose and application of the product.

  • Align on architectural guidelines and re-use of components with other engineers

  • Contribute to the architectural software roadmap using the sw product roadmaps and vision. Implement and integrate while making practical development choices given limited design information and defined delivery schedules.

  • Troubleshooting and debugging of software programs in a simulation as well as on the microscope systems available for development.

  • Conduct bug fixing on existing issues through software implementation, development of test methodologies and performing unit tests.

  • Act as the authoritative owner of multiple functional characteristics and/or modules of the specified software application.

  • Mentoring and coaching less experienced Software Engineers within the team.

jobs.title: Ruby Developer - one of the world's largest Ruby apps!
jobs.content:
• Huge scale: Envato has one of the world's largest Ruby apps by traffic! 

  • Be part of the team responsible for our most valuable asset - our community!

  • Work from anywhere in Australia or from our Global HQ in the Melbourne CBD



What you'll be doing


Envato is split into four major groups, Customer, Content, Small Business and Platform. This exciting new role is within our Content Group. This group is responsible for looking after one of our most important assets, our community of creative sellers who earn a living through our sites, and also for making content available for customers on Envato Market and Envato Elements. Without content, there can be no customers, so the group work hand in hand with the Customer Group to build on Envato's continuing success.


Along with working at Australia's premier Ruby development company, you'll get to work with a fun and modern tech stack. Whether you're a passionate Ruby newbie (with experience as a developer) or you've worked at our scale before, we'd love to hear from you. 


On a day to day basis you will:



  • Write clean, well thought out and reliable code

  • Participate as a member of a small cross functional team containing members with different skills and experience

  • You'll work on big projects, small maintenance tasks, server management tasks and anything else that makes software our customers love

  • Take lots of responsibility for your work as most teams don't have analysts, testers or system administrators

  • Take part in our 24/7 on-call rotation supporting one of the biggest websites in the world



Essential Requirements



  • Be a nice person who cares about their work

  • Communicate well in person and in writing

  • Be a curious person committed to continual learning

  • Be capable of writing clean, well thought out, and reliable code

  • Be comfortable working on a project from the original fuzzy brief through development and deployment and beyond with minimal oversight required

  • Be comfortable in a Linux software development and deployment environment



Preferred Requirements



  • Have commercial Ruby on Rails experience

  • Have solid TDD/BDD experience

  • Have experience of other high volume/scale web apps

  • Contribute to Open Source projects

  • Past experience in other agile environments

  • Excellent Linux knowledge



What We've Got


A Great Team and Culture



  • Developers are responsible for features from inception through to them being in the hands of customers. The devs talk directly to our community and customers about what they're working on

  • We do continuous delivery properly: any team member can deploy, and we regularly do several deploys a day

  • We publish portions of our code as open source, and contribute back to open source projects we use

  • A fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success

  • Flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato

  • We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination

  • In addition to hiring for our Melbourne CBD office, we will also consider applications from experienced Ruby Developers who would like to work remotely (Australia wide)

  • Future career progression will be available across the entire business - we're big on internal opportunities and professional growth!



Can you Meet the Expectations of Envato's Engineering Team?


At Envato, our Engineers expect certain things of each other. Not all of these are easy to uphold. Are you ready to join the team and meet the expectations of your peers at Envato? Read about the expectations and how they were developed by our team on our technical blog. 



Who should apply?


We care deeply about diversity at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd like to hear from you.


What next?


Submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to the below questions. Good luck!



We care about your privacy. By submitting your application you are agreeing to our Privacy Policy. If you're into reading legal documents or you're keen to know more about how we handle your personal information read our Privacy Policy before you submit your application.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer, Baseball Systems
jobs.content:
This position is primarily responsible for the development and operation of an online unified player management and scouting system. Works closely with the Baseball Operations staff to define, develop, and implement a system that will support the Orioles’ player evaluation, selection and development efforts. The system will integrate multiple sources of information and video, both internal and external to the organization, into a single, centralized view of ballplayers.The incumbent is responsible for the full life-cycle of the player management and scouting system.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Works with Director of Analytics and other senior Baseball Operations staff to develop project plans for developing and implementing a player management system. With limited supervision, follows plan and monitors and reports progress.

  • Gathers, verifies, and documents user requirements for web-based player management system. Understands and analyzes the business process and required outcomes of the system and creates documents defining the business use cases.

  • Develops and modifies player management website. Makes use of industry best practices and recommended coding standards to write clear, readable, and efficient code.

  • Identifies and recommends potential features to be incorporated into the player management system.

  • Designs and develops procedures to calculate advanced player statistics and manage player evaluations, rankings, and other information contained in the system. Designs and develops graphical and tabular layouts of the information according to the needs of the Baseball Operations staff.

  • Oversees day-to-day maintenance of internal SQL Server database.

  • Designs processes to import new Statcast player tracking data and works to efficiently integrate it with existing datasets and analytical models. Works with IT department to verify that server infrastructure can handle the new influx of data.

  • Builds out interactive tools and visualizations to aid our evaluation of players’ defensive abilities and better inform our Major League defensive positioning.

  • Coordinates with video and data providers to integrate systems and information into the unified player management system. Designs and develops routines to integrate external data into the underlying data architecture.

  • Employs an iterative software development approach to ensure quick roll-out along with incremental improvements to developed player management system over time.

  • Develops and oversees system acceptance testing for all newly developed components of the player management system. Designs and sets up test scenarios. Reviews test results and validates that software capabilities meet business needs.

  • Provides ongoing support of player management system, including training all player management system users. Troubleshoots and corrects defects found in the system. Upgrades system as necessary to take advantage of new technology and meet dynamic business goals.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description




Are you passionate about software?  Are you constantly pushing yourself to learn new technologies to develop better, faster and more efficient applications?  Then CoStar is the place for you.  Everyone at CoStar is deeply committed to delivering high-performing applications that change the way our users consume and use commercial real estate data.  We are THE leading data provider to the $11 trillion commercial real estate industry.  Every day customers use our data and products to make multi-million dollar investment decisions.   Our team in Orange County, CA is growing rapidly and searching for a Senior.NET Developer who can take us to the next level.  Are you up for the challenge?



Mission


The Senior .NET Developer is responsible for designing, developing and troubleshooting high performance and high availability web applications using .NET 4.5+, ASP.NET MVC, C#, XHTML/CSS, JavaScript ES5 and jQuery technologies to meet the company’s strategic objectives. He/she is also responsible for adhering to CoStar’s .NET and JavaScript development frameworks & best practices. In addition, supporting and contributing to CoStar’s Agile/Scrum development process is an essential component of the Senior .NET developer role.




Objectives


-Analyze technical requirements and design new components, web pages and controls to meet CoStar’s functional, performance and availability requirements.


-Design ASP.NET and control layouts using CSS/JavaScript/Less that work and perform well in target browsers as required by CoStar’s product strategy.


-Design and develop using Object Oriented design principles and software design patterns to attain high reusability and maintainability.


-Develop an in-depth understanding of CoStar’s product architecture and frameworks. Maintain and contribute to CoStar’s product platform as necessary.


-Develop database stored procedures and SQL scripts/ETL jobs that meet CoStar database standards to implement product requirements.


-Maintain and support CoStar’s products that are released to stakeholders and customers.


-Participate and drive continuous improvement within CoStar’s Agile/Scrum teams. 


-Build consensus among different teams working on software development projects.


-Facilitate discussions among other .NET and database developers to exchange new ideas and improvements.


-Continually evaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends and best practices that can be used to strengthen CoStar’s technology platform and development practices.




Competencies, Knowledge & Skills



-Ability to work with minimal supervision or assistance to complete tasks.


-Possesses strong analytical and problem solving abilities.


-Possesses Enterprise development experience.


-Core technologies required



  • Current .Net technologies with a focus in .Net 4.5+, Asp.net MVC

  • C#, Nuget

  • Javascript (ES5, Knockout, Jquery, Bootstrap, RequireJS)

  • HTML5, DOM, CSS, LESS, Chrome debugger, Modernizer

  • MVC and MVVM patterns

  • SOA principles and Design patterns


-Experience with Unity or IOC design patterns


-Demonstrates good working knowledge of SOA - Web services, WebAPI and WCF technologies


-Demonstrates knowledge of ADO.NET, TSQL and stored procedure development.


-Requirements analysis and management


-Strong knowledge of SDLC and Agile/Scrum methodologies.


-Software testing (Unit, System, Integration, Functional, Performance).


-Adaptability/Stress tolerance.


-Ability to clearly communicate thoughts and ideas within and across teams.


-Ability to work well with other developers and management.


-Ability to juggle priorities


-Awareness of emerging technologies.



Nice to Have


-Experience with Javascript ES6, Typescript, Angular


-Experience with .net core, Async/Await, TPL, Node, Containers


-Domain driven and Event driven design patterns


-Experience developing microservice-based architectures


-Experience with cloud technologies such as Azure and AWS

jobs.title: Senior Network Engineer
jobs.content:
CoStar provides industry professionals and consumers of commercial real estate and apartments with critical knowledge to explore and complete transactions by offering the most comprehensive, timely and standardized information on commercial real estate and apartments and the right innovative tools to be able to effectively utilize that information. 



We are looking for a firewall engineer to join our team of network and security engineers to manage the network infrastructure that spans 6 global data centers, 80+ offices worldwide, over 4500 servers and public clouds to support web applications (apartments.com, etc), which serve over 25M customers each month.



You have a background in network engineering with a specialty in next generation unified threat management firewalls.  You use leading edge technology to automate and secure public and private clouds, while optimizing performance for corporate and public customers. You are motivated to help yourself and the team grow. 



Required Skills and Qualifications: 



  • CheckPoint or Palo Alto firewall expertise

  • Bachelors in Computer Science or related Field

  • Firewall certifications: CCSA, CCSE, CCMSE, CCSM, PCNSE

  • Experience in network security including: Device Hardening and patching, IDS/IPS, SIEM, Firewalls, and IPSec, vulnerability assessment and intrusion detection

  • Experience with Next Generation and web application firewalls (CheckPoint, Palo Alto, Cisco ASA Firepower, WatchGuard, Juniper SRX, Akamai Kona WAF, AWS WAF)

  • Knowledge of networking routing and traffic: OSPF, EIGRP, BGP, HSRP, NAT, QoS, SNMP

  • Experience network infrastructure systems such as InfoBlox (IPAM), Solarwinds, CACTI, DynaTrace Keynote, AppDynamics

  • Experience in load balancing with local and global traffic management solutions such as F5 BIGIP LTM and GTM, Akamai, Amazon ELB

  • Experience in network protocol analyzers/sniffers.

  • Experience integrating LDAP object authentication with firewalls

  • Site to site based and user based SSL VPNs (Junos, CheckPoint, Microsoft Direct Access)

  • Cisco Nexus switches – 9Ks, 7Ks, 5Ks, 3Ks, FEXs

  • Other relevant certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, JNCIE, VCP-NV, F5-CA, F5-CTS, F5-CSE, ACMA, ACMP, ACMX, ACDX, etc

  • Public and private cloud software defined networking – Amazon Direct Connect, AWS VPC, Azure ExpressRoute, VMware NSX, Cisco ACI




Operational Responsibilities:



  • Architect scalable, secure firewalling solutions to support the unique needs of a global company with 80 offices as well as dense web application data centers serving >25 million customers.

  • Secure and manage 85 world-wide office locations supporting both onsite and mobile users

  • Respond to automated monitors and alerts to troubleshoot issues networks

  • Triage log incidents and events to secure operations while maximizing throughput performance

  • Deploy and support-routing, switching, firewall, and traffic management environments for 40 market leading Internet sites that serve millions of visitors

  • Position requires participation in a 24x7 on-call rotation and off hour's maintenance windows



Sample Network Team Projects:



  • Architect horizontal scale out firewall solution for 5000 VMs

  • Architect global traffic management across redundant CDNs and multi-active data centers

  • Lead the implementation of the entire network stack (switches, routers, firewalls, wireless) to support global offices

  • Deploy Site to site and Corporate VPN solutions with multi-factor authentication

jobs.title: Director of Sales
jobs.content:
This is an opportunity to lead the sales team at a self-funded, fast growing startup. You will report directly to the CEO and be responsible for executing on ConvertKitâs sales goals.
ConvertKit is an email marketing company for professional bloggers. We have 10,000 paying customers, send 150 million emails per month, and are growing revenue quickly.

Think of ConvertKit as the power of Infusionsoft, but easier to use than MailChimp. We're a remote team of 22+ people in 7 states and 4 countries. We're bootstrapped, profitable, and growing quickly.

Because we are self-funded and profitable we focus on serving our customers, not doing whatever is necessary to close our next funding round. As Director of Sales youâre responsible for recruiting the right high-value customers to ConvertKit.

The right person for this position will have:

  • Experience leading a sales team with the goal of consistent revenue growth, with an inside sales focus.
  • The ability to create, maintain and document a process for an organized sales pipeline.
  • A self-motivated attitude, focused on meeting and exceeding sales quotas and leading the sales team to do the same.
  • A strong understanding of the blogging industry with many personal relationships to turn into customers.
  • The ability to understand the needs of ConvertKitâs largest customers, when it pertains to email marketing, in order to accurately position ConvertKit to potential clients.
  • Great empathy, communication, and listening skills to understand the needs of their team.
  • A desire to lead a small, highly effective team rather than just increasing headcount to meet goals.
  • The ability to set and implement sales plans & forecasts for both long-term and short-term goals.
  • The ability to run a data driven sales team, with real-time metrics and dashboards for each team member.
  • Ability to work well with others and initiate consistent communication across teams.
Key metrics:

  • New customer accounts retained for 90 days or longer (focus on obtaining the right customers who are a good fit for ConvertKit).
  • New customers from affiliates and growth of affiliate referrals over time.
  • ROI from signups from conferences/sponsorships.
  • Measuring results from each step of the sales funnel.
Areas of responsibility:

  • Direct Sales for accounts over 10,000 subscribers.
  • Booking and hosting webinars and other affiliate promotions.
  • Attending and sponsoring conferences for new customers and partner relationships.
  • Affiliates.
  • Real-time tracking and analytics on all areas of responsibilities.
  • Sales forecasting
  • Sales funnel
  • Understanding potential customer characteristics and how it affects their progression through the sales funnel
Weekly, quarterly, yearly sales planningManaging and coaching sales team
  • Hiring/Firing as needed
  • Performance reviews
  • Weekly 1-on-1s
  • Regular team meetings
  • Sales training
Developing sales budgetsRegular communication and partnership with marketing director for across team projects/promotions
Perks and benefits

  • Competitive salaries
  • Commissions on new accounts
  • Generous equipment budget
  • Work from anywhere
  • 3 weeks paid vacation
  • 9 paid holidays
  • 3 sick days
  • $1,000 yearly vacation bonus

To apply: Apply here: https://convertkit.workable.com/jobs/398706/candidates/new

jobs.title: Head of Engineering - Tech company changing the game for film and TV production
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced software developer to become a key part of our friendly and competent engineering team here at We Got POP in East London.


The ideal candidate would contribute as a technical leader, as well as a manager of people.  Depending on your profile, experience and inclinations however, the team is flexible and experienced enough to be able to accommodate someone only interested in pursuing one of those aspects.


The team has grown rapidly over the last few months as we’ve taken on funding and have been expanding our product offering.


It’s a strong team which values well-engineered solutions, and is part of a dynamic startup where you will have the opportunity to impact our users and the productions using our platform, both via the direct impact you’ll have on our engineering efforts, but also by being included in management meetings and so impacting company strategy.


POP is a great place to work, and we care about our team and about creating high quality software that we can be proud of.



Some of the things we'll be working on over the next months include expanding our payroll product, which we aim to develop as a de-coupled web service, rather than being tightly integrated into the rest of the codebase.  We also want to expand on our scheduling and messaging platform, and our secure document management functionality.

jobs.title: Senior PHP Developer
jobs.content:
The Westwing mission is to inspire and make every home a beautiful home. We are on a quest to bring the wonders of eCommerce for home & living to our more than 26 million members in 14 countries on three continents. In less than 5 years on the market, we have grown to more than 219 million Euros in annual sales, and the opportunity ahead of us is massive.


The Westwing team is the secret to our success. Our more than 1,500 team members balance creativity and style with innovative technology and strong business fundamentals. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious, and looking for the challenge to transform an industry and take it into the future.


Do you think this could be you? To pursue our ambitious expansion strategy, we are looking for a Senior PHP Developer (m/f). As a senior developer, you will design and develop complex web applications and modules for our eCommerce platform. Furthermore you will optimize our platform for scalability during peak traffic hours. Adhering to agile SW-development methodologies you will also ensure code quality and enforce best practices by communicating and sharing them to team members.


Keywords:



  • PHP 5.6/7 OOP, Zend Framework, Yii framework, Symfony

  • HTML5, CSS, javascript, jQuery, Ember, Ajax

  • PHPUnit, Behat, PHPCodeSniffer, Jenkins, Phing

  • RabbitMQ, REST, JSON, SOAP

  • AWS, Debian, Docker, Nginx, MySQL, Memcache, ElasticSearch

  • git


You come with:



  • Knowledge of most of the keywords described above

  • Several years of experience in development with PHP5 OOP (Zend Framework experience is a plus, Yii, symfony and CakePHP are also valued)

  • Experience with MySQL

  • A proactive, goal-oriented, reliable and self-structured way of working

  • Fluency in English


We offer:



  • A truly shaping tech position with high degrees of responsibility and autonomy

  • Plenty of room for personal growth and professional development (e.g. hackathons, certifications, budget for conferences)

  • A position in a high-caliber Tech team with like-minded developers

  • Entrepreneurial experience in a well-financed, high-growth eCommerce company

  • Work equipment of your choice

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About YETI Custom Shop


YETI Custom Shop is the official customization service for YETI's Rambler line of stainless steel drinkware. We leverage a unique laser marking process to create an attractive and highly durable custom mark on the cup. YETI Custom Shop is growing extremely fast and we have big plans for across the board technology development and integration from e-commerce to our manufacturing floor.


Position:


The Senior Software Engineer will be part of an engineering team that will be responsible for all of the development and implementation of YETI Custom Shop’s manufacturing and production control systems. This position requires a strong background in Service Oriented Architecture. The Senior Software Engineer will be asked to work on multiple mission critical control applications that will be used every day on the production line to run our custom built lasers. This position offers an extremely rare and unique opportunity to join a highly profitable, fast growing business with a fun and agile startup culture.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer / Senior Developer
jobs.content:
The Full Stack Developer / Senior Developer will work on a variety of projects to support our Story Tools, Metered Paywall and Identity Arc Suite of applications including building out new features, making improvements to existing features and functionality and maintaining and improving our AWS infrastructure.



The ideal candidate has a demonstrated history, and passion for, solving complex technical challenges with a particular focus on efficiency and performance. Our development team is an energetic and forward-thinking team which uses rapid agile development in an open-source, devops cloud-based environment.



Responsibilities include:



  • Developing new, and contributing to existing, platforms that have a critical role in the digital landscape that supports washingtonpost.com.

  • Leading and participating in major architectural decisions, helping to review code and implementations, and bring in new and emerging technologies into the organization.

  • Promoting an agile - prototype first - culture that prizes continuous learning and growth, while maintaining a high regard for quality.

  • Owning the end to end technical requirements and roadmap for major engineering products.

  • Working in tandem with editorial and business partners to build leading edge media products that have a material impact on The Washington Post and the industry.



Requirements include:



  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or related technical field

  • 5+ years of relevant technical professional experience required (including 2+ years in a software development role) - familiar with both front end and back end technologies

  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum. Experience with JIRA desired.

  • Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate methodologies and their applications to non-technical individuals

  • Openness to working with new frameworks \ languages, a passion to learn emerging technologies & paradigms, and ability to handle occasional ambiguity.

  • Excellent judgment, both in technical and organizational problem solving.

jobs.title: Support Programmer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a support programmer to work with us as we build a safer, faster, better Basecamp. As well as working on Basecamp and our other apps, you'll be an important part of our work on Basecamp, the company. You'll be joining our existing support programmer Jim and working as part of our Security, Infrastructure and Performance team in a fun and varied role that will allow you to develop personally and professionally.

We recognize the strength that comes from having diverse teams built from different backgrounds, experiences and identities, and the ongoing work that goes into building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best work of your career. That starts with regularly working no more than 40 hours a week, and hopefully getting 8+ hours sleep a night. Our benefits are designed to support a sustainable, healthy relationship with your work.

Currently our team works from 32 different cities, spread across 6 countries. You can work from anywhere in the world, but your normal working day should have 4 hours or more overlap with Central Time (CST).

About you

Do you have questions?
Do you like finding answers?
Does helping people make your heart sing?
Can you approach problems calmly and compassionately?
Do you think clearly, and can you express yourself in English and in code?

About the job
Here are some examples of the kind of work you'll be doing. Every single day, you'll get to work across teams to support three major areas:

Making our customers happy. 

  • Youâll be helping our customers to perform tasks they canât do easily in Basecamp itself. We refer to these as concierge-style requests. They often involve writing small snippets of Ruby and working in a console
  • Youâll make it easier for companies to trust us by answering security and compliance questions
  • Every day youâll be supporting our wonderful support team, to help them to ask better questions and find better answers for our customers
  • Developers who are working with our APIs sometimes need some help too, and youâll be on hand to offer the right documentation, and suggestions on the best way to approach things

Working on our legacy
In the pursuit of answers, you'll go delving into the codebase for all of our apps (including the very first Rails app!) to discover how things work. You'll be comfortable looking at code, exceptions and logs, identifying problems and suggesting fixes. 

Experience with Ruby, Rails and JavaScript would be very helpful, but if you have been using different languages and stacks, that's fine too. Be sure to tell us all about it in your application.

As well as spelunking through our apps, you'll work with people across Basecamp every day:
  • Delving into the codebase for all of our apps (including the first Rails app!) to discover how things work
  • Working with our ops team to track down mail delivery issues, or networking problems or SSL certificate fun
  • Working with programmers to triage bugs, suggest fixes, and write code
  • Exploring issues with our Android or iOS apps, and working with our mobile teams
  • Support our QA team as they lead our feature retrospectives

Helping us find ways to be better
  • Triaging security reports & identifying fixes
  • Looking at reports of slowness in our apps and searching for the cause
  • Researching & planning improvements across teams, like ending support for RC4, or taking part in PrivacyShield certification
  • Looking at exceptions in our apps, and identifying fixes
  • Providing thoughtful commentary on product pitches, ideas and suggested fixes based on what you have seen
  • Investigating common cases, and coming up with ideas on how to reduce them

Youâll get support and trust every step of the way, and the freedom to make decisions to make things simpler, clearer, easier and more honest.

To apply: If this sounds like the kind of work youâd love to do, you can apply here: https://basecamp.workable.com/jobs/395476. Weâre accepting applications until February 3rd, 2017.

jobs.title: MySQL DBA : King of the servers, master of the infrastructure!
jobs.content:
As a MySQL DBA at Catawiki, you are the master of hundreds of servers and dozens of services. All Catawiki users will appreciate you for placing great importance on high-availability and fault-tolerance in each and every piece of infrastructure. Your colleagues will praise you for the awesome runtime you are building to provide them with the highest level of service and security.


With your broad knowledge of the infrastructure and X-Ray vision you can see everything what will happen in the next second. Any cloud provider is envious of your magical provisioning script when setting up a new cluster. You know that the heaven is a place where each packet, connection and log line matters. You'll achieve all of this and more by working closely together with the team of system engineers and back-end developers who really appreciate the pragmatic approach you are taking. Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:



  • Automating database systems management;

  • Actively monitoring and troubleshooting of all database infrastructure;

  • Providing knowledge and support for software developers.


The list of the tools you'll be faced with includes but is not limited to: Linux, KVM, Ansible, Git, Nginx, MySQL, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, InfluxDB, Solr, Apache Kafka, Hadoop, Cassandra, Redis, Zabbix, ELK, AWS.
