jobs.title: (JUNIOR) WEB-DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
Challenge accepted! You want to program your own application and bring it onto the market? Working with BigData, complex algorithms and new technologies motivates you? Then catch the chance to enter a startup that will revolutionize the market for automotive spare parts.


ABOUT THE ROLE


The Velocity Automotive N.V. has been selling spare parts for US cars for over 10 years. Due to the high demand for an intuitive product information management tool (PIM), a new business segment emerged for the Velocity Group.


For the development of this tool we are looking for a (Junior) Web-Developer (m/f), who has the drive and the motivation to bring his own application onto the market.


In this position you are employed directly by our customer company. The application process for Velocity Data Consulting is handled by Academic Work, so please contact Nathalie Zetzmann of Academic Work for questions about the process.


JOB DUTIES


In this position you can choose whether you want to code in the frontend or backend, or both! You develop the PIM system in close coordination with the whole developer team:



  • You design, develop and implement the PIM system

  • You code in JavaScript with AngularJS or React in the frontend OR in Ruby (Rails, Padrino) and SQL in the backend – or both

  • You develop RESTful APIs and connections to the database

  • You create your own ideas and develop innovative functions

  • You face the challenges of extremely large amounts of data, the complexity of the data and the high requirements of the usability

We’re looking for talented, passionate, and pragmatic Senior Go Developers. You’ll join our team in Barcelona — we pride ourself on having a fun, challenging and diverse environment with 44 different nationalities represented.


Our current challenge is that we're moving from a monolith to a microservices architecture, and along the way rebuilding parts of the platform in React and Redux on the frontend, and Go and Node on the backend.

jobs.content:
• Design, implement and extend our backend solutions in an agile team

  • Create concepts to handle the ever-growing pile of data

  • Work with technologies in the Big Data- and Realtime Analytics topic, like HBase, Kafka, Flink, Phoenix

  • Maintain and secure our standards for system reliability and performance

jobs.title: Agile Software Engineer - Java/ Big Data/ Realtime
jobs.content:
UNSERE PROJEKTE UND TECHNOLOGIEN:

Außerdem wollen wir mit unseren Kunden in Echtzeit interagieren, sowohl über die Self-Service-Terminals, als auch über die PAYBACK App.

UNSERE PROJEKTE UND TECHNOLOGIEN:

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
Our Company
GASTROFIX has developed a revolutionary, cloud-based point-of-sale (POS) system for Apple iPad and iPod. The cash register covers the whole hospitality industry from restaurants, cafés, bars, bakeries, canteens, hotels up to franchise chains.


GASTROFIX already sold more than 10,000 POS systems in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Netherlands, Norway and USA and we are growing fast!


Who we are looking for
We are expanding our team at our headquarters in Berlin and are looking for an experienced iOS Developer (m/f) for our cloud backend.



Your job
• Develop new features in Objective-C and maintain existing POS App
• Agile software development in cross-functional Scrum teams
• Develop interfaces to Java based Cloud Backend

jobs.title: React.js Frontend developer who also understands some Swift or Java (android) code
jobs.content:
A fast growing startup with a brilliant remote team is looking for a great experienced React.js Frontend developer. 

The startup already got a native mobile app in both Swift and Java (ios and android) - and we need someone who can build the web client using React.JS.

This is a cool messaging apps with many special features. 

Must have:

-Great React.js experience

Who are we?
Qualicode.co helps some of the fastest growing most technologically advanced Israeli and US startups find great developers and build remote teams all around the world. 

Working with us means you'll have a lot of flexibility with your time and that you will be working on world level products with a super smart team.

jobs.title: Lead Web Developer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about developing great customer focused websites and applications? Do you have the skills to help shape a web development team that can deliver great products using Agile methods?


We are seeking an experienced full stack web developer with excellent Java and node.js skills to work in the Information Services Department to develop and maintain our new TfGM website which is currently in beta.


TfGM oversees transport in Greater Manchester, delivering and improving transport services, facilities and information to make travel easier for everyone. We deliver high-profile, large-scale transport projects, and it’s our experts who provide the information and analysis to shape transport strategy. This is a busy and exciting time for us: under the devolution agreement and with Greater Manchester at the heart of the Northern Powerhouse, transport will play a vital role in supporting growth and prosperity in the UK’s largest regional economy outside London.


In this role you will lead the development of new and evolving web based systems and services utilising cloud infrastructure. You will be working in a fast paced organisation using Agile methods to deliver excellent solutions to meet demanding customer requirements. You will be a critical member of a cross functional delivery team working with business analysts, testers, DevOps and other digital specialists where you will need to share your own knowledge and experience. To succeed in this role you will also be expected to provide technical and professional leadership to less experienced team members.


If you believe you have the skills we need in this exciting and challenging role we would really like to hear from you! For more information and to apply, please visit http://www.tfgm.com/workingforus/Pages/vacancies.aspx

jobs.title: Email Developer
jobs.content:
Delivery Hero is building the next generation global online food ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in 40 countries worldwide. We feature an environment with feedback exchange throughout the company from people who are genuine, ambitious and fun. We are looking for passionate and smart people to join us on our mission. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative, and good at “getting things done“. Play an active role in our future. An exciting job opportunity in the heart of Berlin is waiting for you.


Your mission:



  • You’ll be part of the customer management team.

  • Design and development of responsive HTML emails.

  • Leverage third party email tools and scripting language to deliver highly dynamic and personalized content.

  • Work with CRM managers to understand key campaign parameters and inputs, such as email audience, program frequency, degree of personalization and overall creative approach.

  • Work within the design team to create email templates and modules, and find innovative solutions to keep improving the designs that are already defined.

  • Test email rendering for consistency across all email clients (Gmail, Outlook, Mobile, etc.).

  • Code dynamic content and map variables within the campaign, to drive versioning and customization of the emails.

  • Stay up to date with latest email best practices, including design and responsive development.



Your heroic skills:



  • At least 2-5 years of email development experience (experience working with Experian UMS is a plus)

  • Expertise in HTML, CSS

  • Experience in coding responsive design and mobile optimization techniques,

  • Solid knowledge of cross-browser/email client limitations, code fixes/hacks and (Google) markups

  • Good design skills and a creative mind

  • Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment

  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage workload and work independently

  • Experience in HTML5 and markups for web applications are a plus

  • Proficient in English, other languages are a plus



We offer you:



  • Well-funded startup with entrepreneurial culture

  • Collaborative environment with experienced colleagues

  • Company supported pension scheme

  • Dynamic international office environment with English as working language

  • An exponential learning curve of a fast-growing e-commerce startup

  • Flexible and agile company with flat hierarchy

  • Ability for rapid career advancement

jobs.title: Back-End PHP Skills Required to Create a Monopoly!
jobs.content:
Our research has shown that the periodic collection of payments (recurring payments) has grown exponentially over recent years. However, we have found that it is often a challenge for companies to build this e-finance process in-house without incurring long development cycles and high costs.


eCurring is powered by Mollie, one of the largest and most reliable Dutch payment service providers. Our subscription payments SaaS solution enables clients to efficiently manage their customers and subscriptions, collect funds periodically and automate follow-ups.


Join our project team as a PHP Back-End Developer and be given the autonomy to use your coding skills to create, build and maintain custom built SaaS solutions.


You will work as part of a close-knit team, comprising of business developers, product owners and a front-end developer. Together with your team, you’ll be responsible for the end-to-end development process. You'll start from scratch, so from concept to design and from development to implementation. And last but not least, testing and aftercare. 


To be successful in our start-up, you will be able to demonstrate expertise in PHP + (Laravel OR Symfony OR Zend) + MVC. Laravel is our chosen framework. 


We would love to see your GitHub and Stack Overflow contributions!

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you an ambitious and technically strong DevOps engineer? If the answer is a solid yes the you may just be the chosen one for our new DevOps Engineer position!


Siteimprove is looking for an ambitious and technically strong DevOps engineer to help us build Siteimprove cloud infrastructure, supporting the company in its mission to make the web better for all. You will be joining our Operations team and help us build the common operating infrastructure for services including monitoring, high availability, performance, security while collaborating with cross functional stakeholders.


Tech keywords: AWS, ELB, AutoScaling, Spot Requests, Security Groups, Subnets, Gateways, IAM, EC2, S3, VPC, Route53, RDS, CloudWatch,CloudTrail, CloudFront, Containers, Micro services, Serverless, HTML, REST APIs, SQL, Go, Linux, Windows, C#, HaProxy, Squid, Mesos, Ansible



Responsibilities



  • Design, implement and deploy cloud solutions to meet operational goals for high availability, performance, stability, security and cost-efficiency.

  • Promote, implement and integrate cloud based services as alternative to traditional on-premises solutions.

  • Optimize the environment to maximize auto-recovery and geographically distributed redundancy in support of business continuity plan and disaster recovery goals.

  • Continuously optimize our applications and create an efficient infrastructure that allows us to grow dynamically with our growing base of customers.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Are you an ambitious, creative and driven user-centric frontend developer? If the answer is a resounding yes then you may just be perfect for our new Senior Frontend Developer position!


You’ll have built plenty of user interfaces that people actually like to use, and you’ll know and have opinions based on your practical experience as to what actually constitutes a great user experience. Through your proven records of building web applications you’ll be an expert at knowing how to support several brands and browser generations from IE9 and onwards. A passion for building accessible interfaces that everyone, regardless of ability or disability can use, is a huge plus.   


Tech keywords: HTML, CSS, JavaScript/jQuery, C#.



Responsibilities



  • Develop and maintain frontend application code in one of our product teams.

  • Work together with the product owner, user experience people and graphical designers to implement nothing less than great user interfaces.

  • Perform code reviews.



Each of our product teams take ownership of a unique aspect of our product suite: Fancy ridding the web from misspellings and malformed HTML? Relieve the visually impaired of frustrations when they are browsing? Could you build the bots that protect the online brand of a customer? Want to play a part in the next generation of web analytics? Or do you like rolling up your sleeves to migrate large amounts of data without downtime? How about battle-testing web pages in headless browsers to reveal their weaknesses? Building a crawler for the future web? We have a team for you.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Developer
jobs.content:
Are you an experienced and ambitious backend software developer who’s ready to think outside the box and influence our future directions? If the answer is yes, yes and YES then keep reading.

Joining one our several product teams you’ll take ownership of challenges worth accepting. Whether it’s ridding the web from misspellings and malformed HTML,  relieving the visually impaired of browsing frustrations, building bots that protect the online brand of a customer or leading the way in the next generation of web analytics.

This position requires someone who’s happy to roll up their sleeves and migrate large amounts of data without downtime, someone who can battle-test web pages in headless browsers to reveal their weaknesses and build a crawler for the future web.

Joining our diverse and talented group of over 40 developers you’ll have a proven track record of building stable and scalable server software and know what it takes to stream, store and query large amounts of data, SQL or NoSQL. You’ll understand cloud-based solutions and know how to provide software-as-a-service.

Our primary tech stacks include AWS, C# and SQL but we are pragmatic (see below!) and expect you to be the same. We value general skills and experience higher than any specific technology.


Responsibilities



  • Develop and maintain backend application code in one of our product teams.

  • Work together with the product owner, UX designers, operations specialists and fellow developers to shape the best solutions for our customers.

  • Take part in and improve on the way we develop software.

  • Understand what other teams are doing, help them, take action when you see problems on the horizon.

jobs.title: C# MVC Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for 2 middle-weight .net developers to help us deliver the next version of our internal tools and the website behind drinkstuff.com – a fully featured ERP system, a warehouse management system and a fully featured eCommerce system. Built on a combination of Azure cloud services and traditional co-located hosted services using the latest dev tools and services, we’re keen to improve the platform and support the growth of the business. The developer we are looking for will have a real passion for what they do, a desire to work on interesting and challenging problems, and with a ‘do what it takes’ attitude and talent. Experience is desirable, but is less important than an ability and talent to develop, learn and get things done.


As a developer here you can expect to be challenged, to grow, to work to your strengths, learn heaps in a web focused role and have a positive impact on real people, both our customers in the outside world and the teams inside our offices and warehouses. You’ll be joining an exciting company of 60 staff who are constantly growing and looking for individuals with new, creative ideas to join our team. We have consistently grown the business year on year and the systems you will be working with will be projected to consistently handle around £10M a year of transactions and beyond as we continue our projected growth.


Direct applicants only please. No agencies. You will need to be able to work in the UK


We operate from our 33,000sq/ft warehouse and Head Office in Melbourn, Hertfordshire with an open plan office space and welcoming, friendly team. If you're up for a challenging and rewarding career, we look forward to hearing from you.

jobs.title: App DesignerIn / GrafikerIn, 60–100%
jobs.content: Ubique – Apps & Technology is hiring an App DesignerIn / GrafikerIn, 60–100% in Zürich, Switzerland

jobs.title: Dev iOS confirmé, SWIFT, open-source
jobs.content:
Nous sommes en train d'architecturer et développer la nouvelle génération du SDK Readium (readium.org) sur lequel sont basées plus de 20 apps de lecture numérique à travers le monde (http://readium.org/about/applications-based-on-readium).

jobs.title: Inventory Associate
jobs.content:
Would you enjoy a job that has you working outside more than in? Do you want a professional opportunity that doesn’t have you dressing in a suit every day? As an Inventory Associate, you can enjoy a casual work environment in a team oriented, fast paced environment!

Inventory Associate responsibilities include computerized tracking of inventory, receiving, staging and prepping inventory, quality control checks and facility and ground maintenance.

Experience in a fast paced environment as well as previous inventory tracking responsibilities are a plus. Applicants must be open to work some nights and weekends as well as in all types of weather.

If you are a motivated self starter who likes to stay busy and would enjoy a team atmosphere, you may be right for this position.

jobs.title: ASE Automotive Technician
jobs.content:
Technicians at CarMax don’t have to worry about crammed work spaces, hot shops and other annoyances that don’t let them enjoy their work! Quite the contrary at CarMax! You can enjoy great perks like…….a consistent workload, a clean modern facility, free training, high volume, a large variety of vehicles…..and much more!

Technician responsibilities include diagnosing and repairing domestic and foreign vehicles, maintaining high customer satisfaction and meeting productivity and efficiency numbers.

Automotive repair experience required with the following ASE Certifications:

Engine Repair, Steering & Suspension, Heating & Air Conditioning (including refrigerant and recycling license) and Brakes.

Applicants must also be team oriented, flexible and focused on maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction. If you are team oriented, have the above qualifications and enjoy a high-volume, fast paced work environment, this position may be for you!

mechanic

jobs.title: Business Office Associate (part-time)
jobs.content:
The CarMax Business Office has exciting opportunities for part-time Business Office Associates (BOA). The flexible work schedule offers rotating shifts and hours to fit in with your other daily activities. Potential advancement opportunities for this position include full-time BOA, Lead BOA, Assistant Business Office Manager and Business Office Manager.

Do you enjoy a fast-paced, high volume retail environment? Do you thrive on doing lots of different administrative tasks and at the same time having lots of interaction with customers as well as other departments? Maybe you should consider a Business Office Associate position!

Responsibilities include opening and closing the business office, reviewing and processing documents associated with customer’s vehicle purchases, assisting customers with questions on tag and title information, preparing DMV documents, interacting with sales staff, obtaining payoff information, assisting our purchasing team with appraisal purchases and in-store auctions, handling accounts payable functions, tendering cash transactions, preparing bank deposits, and answering multi-line phone system.

A strong commitment to customer service, good communications skills and attention to detail are required for this position. Ideal candidates come from various backgrounds including retail, banking, and food service. Applicants must also be available to work nights and weekends.

jobs.title: Sales Consultant
jobs.content:
If you’ve got a passion for people and the desire to succeed, a position as a CarMax Sales Consultant may be for you! CarMax is a growing company that is built on the fundamental principles of integrity and treating people with respect. Here are more reasons why our Associates love working for America’s #1 used car retailer:

A Great Place to Work

CarMax has been named one of the FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® since 2005. Our Associates work in a supportive, diverse, and fun environment that fosters a work/life balance. This positive work environment leads to a positive customer experience, and is a big part of why 95% of our customers would refer us to their friends.

Top-Notch Training

Don’t have automotive sales experience? CarMax is ranked as one of the best training companies in America. You’ll enjoy world-class, training with your own personal sales mentor who is dedicated to your success. We provide ongoing training, support self-development, and we learn as a team.

Career Growth and Recognition

With more than 130 stores nationwide and growing, CarMax Associates have fantastic career opportunities. Our incentive programs provide the potential for additional earnings, recognition, and perks!

CarMax Sales Consultant responsibilities include:

  • Providing exceptional service throughout the customer’s experience.
  • Communicating effectively both in-person and over the phone to discover the customer’s wants and needs.
  • Serving as an advocate for CarMax by sharing what makes us the smart choice.
  • Navigating and using various provided computer programs as selling tools.
  • Consulting and guiding your customers to the appropriate next step based on their situation.
  • Facilitating steps of the sale, such as the vehicle appraisal process, taking test drives, and submitting finance applications.
  • Maintaining a working knowledge of CarMax products and appropriately recommending them to customers.
  • Reading, collecting, and transcribing data in order to complete accurate paperwork.
  • Seeking out opportunities for self-development, participating in training, and welcoming performance feedback.
  • Building and maintaining strong relationships and demonstrating excellent teamwork.
  • Maintaining the sales area so our vehicles and products are neatly and accurately displayed.

This position may require other duties as assigned. For store positions, the responsibilities may vary by store.

jobs.title: Retail Manager - Buyer
jobs.content:
Position Description

Voted a FORTUNE “100 Best Companies to Work For” several years in a row, CarMax is a unique automotive retailing company that has revolutionized the way consumers buy cars. We offer a relaxed, no-haggle car buying experience, exceptional customer service, and a vast amount of inventory available at each location and online at carmax.com. We are a Fortune 500 retailer with stores across the U.S. CarMax is publicly traded on the NYSE (ticker: KMX).

As part of our CarMax store Purchasing Team, a Buyer in Training (BIT) is responsible for conducting vehicle appraisals, coordinating on-site auctions, and attending various regional auctions. Our unique retail environment allows BITs to train on a rotating weekly 40 hour schedule. BITs will spend 8 to12 months learning the dynamics of the used car wholesale industry using various resources to determine the price that CarMax should pay for a used vehicle. BITs track their purchases through the quality inspection and reconditioning process and set pricing based on sales data and competitive analysis. This position provides a unique mix of analytical and physical challenges due to the fast-paced nature of the business, and approximately 50% of a buyer’s time is spent outdoors in a “hands-on” environment. The average CarMax Buyer will be responsible for purchasing approximately $8-$10 Million worth of vehicles annually!

What we offer:

  • Product & Industry knowledge. (Skill based, classroom, and workbook technical training)
  • Hands on training with a mentor. No previous automotive experience required.
  • Exceptional career path. All Purchasing associates begin in the BIT position, therefore we promote from within exclusively for each level of the career path.
  • Fast paced environment with limited time behind a desk. Our Purchasing team spends more than 50% of their time outdoors managing our inventory

Career Path for this position is as follows:

Buyer in Training—-Buyer ——Senior Buyer—-Purchasing Manager——Regional Vice President

Position Requirements

The ideal background includes 3+ years of retail management, hotel/restaurant management, or outside/territory sales experience. An ownership mentality, competitive spirit, high energy and attention to detail are a must to be successful in this position. The position also requires strong leadership, analytical and customer service skills. Bachelors Degree and the ability to relocate is strongly preferred; Ability to work a rotating retail schedule, including nights and weekends, is required. Additionally, some overnight travel may be required.

jobs.title: Parts/Supply Associate
jobs.content:
“A place for everything, and everything in its place.” Is that phrase one of your philosophies? If so, you may want to know more about the Parts Associate opportunity at CarMax.

Parts Associate responsibilities include allocating parts to a vehicle, keeping parts inventory well stocked, controlling shrinkage and maintaining a working relationship with suppliers.

Applicants must provide quality customer service, and be highly organized. Previous experience in a parts environment is preferred.

Flexible work hours with shifts that may include nights, weekends, holidays and 12-hour days.

jobs.title: System Developer
jobs.content:
DIAKRIT is looking for a System Developer for our Development Team in Bangkok


Having recently joined the News Corp Australia family, Swedish-founded DIAKRIT needs to strengthen our Development Team in Bangkok. We are now looking for a System Developer to be part of our team to further develop our international internal and external web system.


The work tasks include further development of existing systems as well as managing your own development projects. Although the focus will be on back-end, some work will include front-end development as well. You will report to our IT & System Development Manager and will be part of a team of 5 employees as well as part of the entire IT/R&D department of approximately 30 people.


Could this be you?


Are you looking to gain international experience & grow your career within an international company? Do you want to be part of a company who is being known for state-of-the-art technology & innovative software? Then this might be the right role for you!


To fit into this role, you need to have a genuine interest and experience in working with back-end PHP-development. You enjoy working with team work in an international environment and get challenged by developing the impossible. You are used to work against tight deadlines, can manage several projects in different phases simultaneously.


You have a logical mindset and you see possibilities and solutions where other see problems. You are used to take own initiatives and work to improve things all the time.

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Experience: 5-12 years

Job Location: Bangalore

Requirements:


MMT is looking for strong and passionate hard-core Data Scientists. The incumbent would:



  • Build required statistical models and heuristics to predict, optimize, and guide various aspects of our business based on available data

  • Design, implement, and iterate through statistical experiments to incrementally maximize site margin while minimizing risk.

  • Handle 1.8 TB of data volume every day on Makemytrip Data platform

  • Extract and consume data from our live systems to analyze and produce robust 99.99% SLA Big-data environment

  • The incumbent will be in the driving seat for innovation and delivery in various exciting tech. opportunities. Specifically, we are significantly increasing our tech-investments in Big-data Analytics as the base for Data-Science

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
The backend team develops the infrastructure to import, process, and store the phonebook- and advertisement data for Switzerland’s official directory. We are providing a highly optimized and reliable layer of delivery services to make this data accessible to our search engine and the web/mobile platforms. Our main challenge is toconstantly push our technology stack forward and to be ready for next-gen features.. Therefore we are looking for a



Backend Engineer



As a member of the backend team, you will be part of a small but highly committed group of developers that is collaborating very closely with web- and mobile engineering teams to provide the best solutions possible to our users and customers.


Since we are running one of the biggest web sites in Switzerland, you get a chance to have a positive impact on millions of users within your first day.




Roles and Responsibilities





  • You translate business requirements into technical solutions

  • You develop and improve our application architecture

  • You are responsible for all phases of the application life cycle

  • You work in a team, but are also able to execute tasks autonomously

  • You do code reviews and improve our code quality

jobs.title: Trainee Supply Chain
jobs.content:
Job TitleTrainee Supply Chain

Job Description

Job Description

Trainee Supply Chain

Your challenge

As a trainee you will join a 2-year program, in which you will be fulfilling 2 or 3 challenging assignments in different departments and sectors within Philips. For some of our Trainees it is even an option to work abroad. The Traineeship focusses on ‘learning on the job’, mentoring and training. Benefit from ample opportunities to learn and share with other Philips trainees and employees, while expanding your business network. After two years of accelerated learning and gaining valuable experience you are in the driver seat of your career. You will get the chance to use the network you have built to find the perfect next step in your Philips career.

Your responsibilities

We have several assignments (location Best or Amsterdam) available at Philips Health Systems and Personal Care. Within the Supply Chain trainee positions, each assignment has a specific focus.

  • Program Management Office in Global Operations; deliver predictable, fast and efficient execution of breakthrough improvements in the global supply chain. Improvement initiatives can be in various steps of the supply chain; order intake, source, plan, build.
  • Business Group Health and Wellness; the key area where the trainee will be responsible for is being the go to person in case of SCM questions and proactively get involved in the projects to high light where we need to be involved and guide the project teams to the right stakeholders in the chain.
  • Commercial Supply Chain in Personal Health; you will have regular calls with key countries to support and drive improvements. Identify and implement process improvements. You will also support the Customer Service Level Program.

We are looking for

To be successful in this program you are a self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit, eager and ambitious. Are you the one we are looking for? You can apply for the traineeship if you:

  • have recently graduated or will graduate latest August 2017 with a Master’s Degree in the directions of Supply Chain, Logistics, Business Administration or Industrial Engineering and Management Sciences. You have max 1 years of work experience straight after your graduation;
  • have excellent inter-personal and communication skills, so you can persuade colleagues at all ranks in the organization;
  • have international experience or an international mindset and the ability to use internal and external resources to maximize the value for the company and its customers;
  • have project and change management skills;
  • speak and write fluent English.

Our offer

We offer you a unique and challenging trainee program and the opportunity to:

  • work for an employer whose activities have a major impact on people all over the world;
  • discover how you can actively contribute to innovations that matter;
  • launch and steer your career in an environment with an astonishing diversity of nationalities, skills and backgrounds;
  • learn about different parts of the organization;
  • strengthen your capabilities and knowledge;
  • build a great international network.

As a trainee you will receive a contract for the period of 3 years, with excellent labor conditions.

Recruitment Process

When you are interested to join the Philips’ traineeship, please apply online latest 31st January 2017.

  • upload your CV, motivation and grade list;
  • if you pass the pre-selection round you will be asked to make an online ability test beginning of February;
  • if you achieve the required score on this test, you will be invited for the Selection Days in the Netherlands, Eindhoven (7th or 9th of March 2017);
  • the most suitable candidates will be invited to the Traineeship Business Challenge Event in the Netherlands, to be scheduled 30&31st of March and 3rd&4th of April 2017 (you will attend one of these Business Challenges, depending on the functional area). During the event you will spend 1.5 day with similar minded graduates, working on a range of highly challenging exercises in a number of business-related scenarios. This is the final step in the traineeship selection process.

When you successfully complete the selection process you are able to start between the 1st of May and September 2017 in your first assignment which are especially created for this program.

Contact

When you have any questions regarding this vacancy, please contact Stefanie Ronde (Talent Acquisition Consultant) via +31(0)6-21142022.

Contact

In case of difficulties with your job application please send an email to support.careercenter@philips.com

jobs.title: Observatory Software Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Summary


The TMT Observatory Software (OSW) effort provides a wide range of critical configuration-controlled software for observatory operations, including science operations support software and the software infrastructure that integrates and controls all telescope and instrument systems. Science operations software includes proposal and observation planning tools, observation execution and visualization software, data handling and management, telescope-control and instrument-observing user interfaces.


The Observatory Software (OSW) Senior Software Developer will be a key member of the project team; it is an opportunity to bring high-standard software design and extensive development experience to an exciting science project. The position reports to the Observatory Software Project Manager. The OSW Senior Software Developer will be a part of an international software development organization as the development of observatory software is shared between the TMT Project Office and the India partner institutions. The majority of the software design effort is performed at the TMT PO; the software implementation effort is performed by qualified software development companies based in India – a major TMT partner. This position will play a key role in the software design effort as well as leading and supporting software implementation activities in India.


The planned location for this position is the TMT Project Office in Pasadena, CA. Some travel to partner locations is expected as part of this position to support the software development process during construction. Some travel to the observatory site is also expected during the integration and commissioning phases of the project.


Job Duties




  • Work closely with the TMT Software System Architect to develop detailed designs for all OSW subsystems




  • Become a technical expert in the OSW architecture, design, tools and languages in order to support development teams in India and elsewhere in the project




  • Support the development and maintenance of software requirements and interfaces between OSW and other TMT subsystems




  • Develop TMT Systems Engineering deliverables required for preliminary and final design phases, including interface control documents (ICDs), detailed design description documents, preliminary hazard analysis (PHA), FMEA and reliability analysis, user story list and definitions, requirements traceability, verification plans and compliance matrices, etc.




  • Lead and support software implementation activities in India, including sprint planning, review of implementation approach and delivered source code, testing and acceptance of delivered software, review of delivered software documentation, sprint conclusion review and lessons learned, daily technical support, review of software quality metrics, issue prioritization, tracking and resolution, etc. Travel to India to kick-off and support implementation activities as necessary




  • Perform integration, verification and acceptance testing of delivered software working closely the with test team at the India partner institutions, using the TMT Software Test and Integration Lab (STIL). Support tracking, prioritizing and resolving of OSW software bugs using the JIRA issue management tool




  • Develop prototype code as needed during the preliminary and final design phases and provide coding as needed to resolve bugs working with the India partner institutions and vendors




  • Support development, implementation and improvement of TMT software systems engineering and software quality assurance processes. Help develop software quality metrics and work with the STIL staff to implement them




  • Apply TMT software systems engineering and software quality processes and tools throughout the software development life cycle. Provide leadership and support to the TMT partners on TMT software processes and best practices in software development and testing




  • Participate in cross-functional software working groups and provide support to resolution of issues and lessons learned




  • Participate in TMT software formal systems engineering reviews and attend review panels for other TMT software subsystem reviews




  • Support the Assembly, Integration and Verification (AIV) effort at the TMT Observatory site




  • Provide input into planning for early operations with respect to OSW

jobs.title: Front End Web Designer
jobs.content:
__Objective__

To add a designer to our growing team who can make our beautiful code look beautiful to the end users.

----

__Contract Description__

Bonk Studios seeks a front end web designer to join the team. Before we bore you with the requirements of this position, why Bonk Studios?

* We are a small team that throws out the politics, and focuses on developing great technology.
* Adapting the SCRUM Methodology, your voice will always be heard, and your strengths will be utilized.
* Each year, you will be flown out for a business vacation, and getting to meet the team. This year, we went to Hilton Head, SC.
* Being able to work with the freedom of a contractor, but the stability of an employee gives you the best of both worlds. Never hustle finding gigs as a freelancer, yet being able to program in your underoos. At Bonk Studios, you will always have 40 hours of work each week. This always has been and always will be the case. No more hustling to find gigs!
* Sick of writing emails back and forth? We utilize slack, and a bug tracking system to communicate. This leaves more time to focus on developing great applications, and posting funny pictures!

Now that you know a little bit about our team and how we operate, what skills are essential to join Bonk Studios?

* Great design must be second nature to you. Ideally, someone with a wide range of taste. For example, our website is quite unique to the typical website. Business professional, edgy, retro, etc. should all be styles that you are comfortable with.
* Expert with CSS and SASS.
* An expert with Bootstrap.
* Must be a team player, great communicator, and able to work on multiple projects at the same time.
* Master of time management.
* Strong desire to always increase your skill set and adapt to new technologies.

Other skills that are a big plus:

* Knowledgeable with SCRUM Methodology. If you have never practiced this, we can help you.
* Knowledge of jQuery and Angular
* Knowledge of Typescript.

----

__Contract Details__

From time to time, Bonk Studios and the team will be flown out to visit clients to go over projects. The contractor should be available for this.

___Note: This is a contracting position. No benefits will be given, nor will any taxes be with held.___

jobs.title: Customer Support Manager
jobs.content:
Goshipages is looking for a part-time remote Customer Support Hero to join our team.

We are a small start-up that has been helping thousands of people find housing in South Korea each year with our super simple accommodation management and search product.

We are currently investing heavily into our technology and finalizing a complete re-imagination of our entire business and will launch a shiny new product in the coming months.

Our goal is to build the business tool of choice for accommodation providers around the world. We are starting in South Korea and plan to quickly grow to the rest of Asia before taking over the entire world - We have a lot of work to do and we need you to help us get there.

----

As our customer support manager you will be the voice of the company.

* You will be communicating with our existing and trial customers via phone and chat for customer support and lead generation
* You will grow our leads database of potential customers and contacting leads via phone to convert them to paying customers
* You will be maintaining our blog and social media channels in Korean and English for both our housing-managers and housing-seeker users.
* This is a __remote and part-time role__, which means we are accepting applications from anywhere in the world - so long as you can be available to work Monday to Thursday 9am to 5pm __South Korean time__.

__We offer__

* A lot of room to learn and work on your own ideas
* The freedom to work from anywhere in the world that you want
* A competitive salary + commission

__About you:__

Must haves:

* Exceptional phone manners
* You are a sales genius and can prove it
* Native Korean fluency
* You're fluent in English, verbally and written
* You are able to work during Korean working hours
* You are able to work independently and to structure your work day on your own

For bonus points:

* You have good knowledge of the housing/accommodation industry in Korea
* You have experience working remotely and can tell us about it
* You also speak other languages - Mandarin or Japanese would be a plus!

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer - PHP & Javascript
jobs.content:
Goshipages is looking for a remote Senior Full-Stack Developer for a 3 month contract with option to stay on for the right candidate.

We are a small start-up that has been helping thousands of people find housing in South Korea each year with our super simple accommodation management and search product.

We are currently investing heavily into our technology and finalizing a complete re-imagination of our entire business and will launch a shiny new product in the coming months.

Our goal is to build the business tool of choice for accommodation providers around the world. We are starting in South Korea and plan to quickly grow to the rest of Asia before taking over the entire world - We have a lot of work to do and we need you to help us get there.

We are looking for a remote Senior Full Stack developer with Laravel and VueJS experience for a 3 month contract to help our dev-team finish building our new web application.

  • You enjoy having complete ownership of your work and time as you will be working remotely with little supervision going through our backlog in Asana
  • You will be working primarily on helping us finalize our messaging feature and CMS but will be comfortable picking up a variety of tasks in front and backend
  • You will be familiar implementing mobile first mockups helping in testing across a range devices and browsers
  • Our stack includes PHP7 (Laravel 5 framework), VueJS, Pusher, Mailgun, Nginx, MySQL, S3, Sentry.

Must haves

  • Able to provide invoices as contractor for the 3 month contract
  • Experienced working with GIT workflow
  • Experience with TDD
  • Expert knowledge of PHP (5.6+ / 7+) and Laravel 5.3+
  • Expert knowledge of Javascript and love working with ES6
  • Strong knowledge of VueJS (1.0+)
  • Experience in implementing pixel-perfect mobile-first mockups
  • Experienced with modern frontend tooling and workflow (Gulp/Babel/Sass/etc)

Nice to haves

  • Experience with sockets / push notifications and tools like Pusher
  • Experienced working with remote team
  • Experience with Payment gateways
  • Knowledge of Korean language / culture

What we offer

  • Opportunity to work with an awesome, dedicated team
  • Competitive compensation
  • Freedom to choose your hours and work wherever you want

jobs.title: Junior Full Stack Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
Hiring: Junior Full Stack Javascript Developer with React experience

Howdy! I'm Dave Stevens, Co-founder & CEO of Chartlytics. We're looking for a very passionate full-stack javascript developer to help us build the most powerful behavior measurement platform for accelerating learning outcomes across all of human learning the world has ever seen! Phew...

Accelerating learning outcomes

Our mission is to help each learner reach their latent potential. With my business partner, Dr. Rick Kubina (Professor of Special Education at Penn State) we are transforming how teachers, analysts, coaches, and trainers understand the effects of their instruction on individuals so they can make more timely decisions to produce accelerated outcomes.

Remote FTW!

We all work remotely, and so can you! We use slack, github, zoom, to communicate with each other regularly. We're fun, candid and focused on building good software and good solutions. We're bootstrapping the company so there are no VC's or angels to change our business model and force us down paths we'd rather not go. This has it's pros and cons but we're at least in control of our own destiny. If you're looking for free lunches, a built in spa and gym, and a bus to pick you up because you have no where to park your car - we're not for you. :)

Got Skills?

Ideally you should have:

  • Strong skills in modern Javascript (ES6/ES7) techniques.
  • A solid understanding of React, and unidirectional dataflow architectures i.e. flux/redux.
  • An appreciation of working with open source code.
  • Interest in implementing functional programming techniques.
  • The ability to create a straightforward user interface
  • Knowledge of designing schemas (currently using MongoDB, long term looking to switch to PostgreSQL).
  • Familiarity with node.js for creating restful API’s.
  • A strong attention to detail
  • An appreciation for maintainability over cleverness

Node all the things!

Our stack:

  • All on AWS
  • Node.js & Koa
  • React & Redux
  • React-Native
  • Mongo
  • Terraform

We are looking for passionate javascript developers. If you think this - http://demo.chartlytics-stage.com/ - is cool, checkout our blog and facebook to get an idea of who we are and what we exist for. If you like the mission, love the stack, and would like to be involved on the ground floor and meet the qualificaions above we'd love to have you on board.

jobs.title: Senior SEO Manager
jobs.content:
We are looking for an SEO pro that's passionate about using organic search, content marketing, and social media to elevate the exposure of websites within search engines. If that's you, keep reading!

As a member of the TakeLessons marketing team, the Senior SEO Manager will report directly to the VP of Marketing and own the development and execution of the companyâs SEO and content marketing strategy to reach target audiences and grow the business.

With hands-on experience and a proven track record for driving qualified traffic, this individual brings expert-level knowledge and experience within SEO, content marketing, and social media. This role is responsible for team management, including the recruitment, coaching, and development of staff. 

Remote workers are also welcome to apply!

__This person will ...__

* Define, execute, and evolve the SEO strategy and goals for TakeLessons
* Be directly responsible for qualified traffic growth through organic search
* Develop annual and quarterly operating plans and forecasts in-line with business objectives
* Maintain monthly, quarterly, and yearly reporting to support team objectives and goals
* Manage the SEO budget to maximize performance and meet or exceed budget goals
* Identify opportunities, develop proposals, and forecasts results for SEO initiatives
* Manage link building efforts and develop targeted campaigns for growing domain authority
* Oversee our content marketing program including research, promotion, and measurement
* Build our social media presence and drives engagement as part of cohesive SEO strategy
* Monitor keyword rankings and analytics to measure performance and identify opportunities
* Iterate and tests to continuously learn and maximize the impact of our SEO efforts
* Work collaboratively with the marketing team and across departments for driving conversion and growth
* Recruit, manage, and motivate a highly skilled team necessary to deliver outstanding business results
* Monitor and appraise staff performance and identifies training and development opportunities that will ensure consistently high performance and retention of key employees
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technical knowledge, and tactics by reviewing professional publications, establishing professional networks, and participating in professional groups
* Other duties as assigned or required

__In order to succeed you need..__

* Bachelorâs degree highly preferred or equivalent education and experience
* Minimum 6 years of B2C digital marketing experience
* Minimum 4 years hands-on experience managing SEO and content marketing
* A proven track record of developing, executing and scaling high impact, profitable, SEO programs that drive business results
* Proven ability to define and execute on assigned goals and objectives
* Exceptional data and analytics skills with the capacity to be both analytical and creative
* Organized and detail oriented with the ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
* Excellent communicator at all levels to drive alignment and action towards goals
* Significant knowledge of the consumer internet marketplace industry and the ability to continuously evaluate trends and adjust strategy to compensate and take advantage of shifts
* Strong familiarity across a broad range of digital marketing activities including but not limited to SEM, paid media, email marketing, and conversion preferred
* People management/supervisory experience
* A 'Rollâupâyourâsleeves' entrepreneurial, startup attitude

We offer a great benefits plan, PTO and 401k plan. We are a startup where you can make a high-impact because of the amount of ownership you have!

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
Looking to put your HTML/CSS/JS, Wordpress and marketing expertise to use with some of the largest brands in the country? GoFanbase is looking for a front-end developer who will help build web and landing pages designed to generate warm leads along with the opportunity to improve the UI/UX of our mobile and web applications.

Want to work remote, yet with a team of like-minded individuals? Looking for a place to learn additional skills and test out new technologies that might get shot down by other employers? This job is for you!

Our Perfect Hire:

  • Loves working and building new things
  • Has strong communication skills
  • Works well flying solo or running in a pack
  • Enjoys working smarter and avoids the “I build everything custom” mentality
  • Can stay focused and achieve goals

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Daily interfacing with designers and internal marketing teams
  • Building and managing internal websites and landing pages
  • Coming up with ideas on how to improve conversion rates and finding new ways to track how visitors are using our solutions

Desired Experience:

  • Comfortable with Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Yelp and Google
  • Familiarity with the Automotive Industry a big plus
  • Understanding of search and social advertising platforms
  • Wordpress and theme management, HTML, CSS, JS, JQuery
  • Understanding of SEO
  • Sales/Marketing experience a plus

Our team is fun and tight-knit. We believe in learning on the job - as long as you’re willing to learn and can teach yourself, you’ll succeed and grow with us!

Starting range is $50,000 - $65,000, depending on experience. Increases and bonuses are based on reviews and performance.

Contract position available immediately.

jobs.title: Sr. Front-End Web Developer
jobs.content:
RubensteinTech team members share a passion for technology and design; it’s at the core of everything we do. We blend this passion with solid engineering methodologies to build truly empowering user experiences for our clients and design partners. We are looking for a motivated and experienced front-end engineer who shares our passion and can execute sophisticated interactive designs to the pixel. The ideal candidate will be able to ask the right questions and see beyond a given assignment, understanding how the task at hand relates to the implementation of an empowering user experience for the users/visitors of the website or web application. You will have years of experience implementation front-end websites, and looking for a challenging position in a supportive team environment to take your skills to the next level.



Employment includes full benefits and many of the perks and privileges of working for a small, profitable tech firm, including daily company-provided lunch, health/dental/vision insurance, gym membership reimbursement, a retirement plan with company match, top notch hardware, and many variations and quantities of caffeine. We have been in business for over a decade, have a solid track record of delivering professional software solutions for the web and mobile devices, and aren't dependent on our "next round of funding" to ensure you get paid next week. We're a highly focused team and you will have a major role in daily decision-making and our future success.

jobs.title: Senior Rails Developers
jobs.content:
We're Panda Strike, a developer-owned and run, 100% remote shop, located (for what it's worth) in Santa Monica, CA. We're looking for a few experienced Rails developers to join our team. Please be up-to-speed on Rails 5. Full-stack capability preferred.

You can learn more about our company via our Web site:

https://www.pandastrike.com/

and our blog:

https://www.pandastrike.com/blog/

Please be seeking full-time employment and be located in the United States.

If you are another dev shop, independent contractor, or located outside the United States, please do not inquire about this opening. We treat all such emails as spam. Sorry, but otherwise we get flooded with emails that make it harder to find the candidates we're actually advertising to find. Thank you.

To apply: Please send a link to your resume, Web site, and Github account, whichever is applicable, to:jobs@pandastrike.comPlease use the subject line: âSenior Developer / Full-Stack / Rails.âPlease also include links to any projects or code that demonstrates your capabilities. Given the volume of replies we usually get, this will help us differentiate you from other candidates.If you don't hear back from us, please accept our apologies in advance. We're a small shop and we don't have dedicated HR staff or a recruiter, so we reply only to the most promising candidates.

jobs.title: Salesforce Commerce Cloud (Demandware) / Web Developer
jobs.content:
The Red Van Workshop specializes in top-tier eCommerce web development on the Salesforce Commerce Cloud (formerly known as Demandware) platform for some of the world's best companies, and we shine in customized development, complex scenarios, and international expansion. We perform system design, architecture, integration, development direction, implementation, testing, customization, support, and delivery.

We try to be the best consulting company anyone has ever worked for, and the best help any client can ever get. We will challenge you, our clients will challenge you, and we respect you.

You should apply if you're a talented front-end or full-stack web developer who has the capacity to use server-side templating and is very comfortable working in JavaScript, CSS, and markup to build, enhance, and troubleshoot high performance and high-traffic eCommerce sites. If you prefer integration, server-side functionality, and architecture in context of the platform, we do that too. 

Web development experience is required, and experience with a large eCommerce or CMS platform is preferred (Demandware, Magento, Sitecore, etc.). We do expect that you can show at least a few examples of sites or code that you've worked on and are proud of - they don't have to be intrinsically exciting, just tell us a bit about what, why, and how you did it. 

To be considered, applicants must be located in the United States of America, legally authorized to work in the United States of America, and fluent in written and verbal English. Recruiting and staffing firms will not be considered.

The Red Van Workshop is a distributed company, so your geographic location within the USA is not critical: your office is your choice. Occasional travel availability to client locations is necessary, however, so reasonable proximity to an airport with good commercial service is necessary. Most of our crew travels rarely, at most a few days per quarter. 

To apply: Send a portfolio and/or resume to work@redvanworkshop.com

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
Masonite is looking for experienced JAVA developers responsible for building JAVA applications, including anything from back-end services to their client-end counterparts. Your primary responsibilities will be to design and develop these applications, and to coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure.  Provide expertise in the use of the Spring Framework, including best practices and design patterns. Significantly contribute to software design and architecture, develop both new applications and improve our existing ones in performance, capability, and reliability.  Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is essential.



  • Participate in paired programming environment where the development deliverable is an ecommerce solution. 

  • Requirements gathering sessions that defines what we are going to build and develop more detailed story as we follow Agile/Scrum framework

  • Development assigned by the Application Development Manager by priority of stories. 

  • Contribute to the team by employing best practices in utilizing a broad platform of technologies within a cloud native development environment 

  • Leverage development expertise to achieve business objectives for the development of the project

  • Embrace change in a dynamic environment that is tool agnostic. Be flexible enough to use the tool that will best fit the requirement.

  • Translate application storyboards and use cases into functional applications

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable JAVA code

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatic testing

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Have you built sizeable applications for thousands of users? Do you value simplicity over over-engineered solutions? Do you want to work on an elegant solution to infrastructure monitoring that just works for our enterprise and startup clients? If so, read on.


We’re on a mission to bring sanity to cloud operations and we need you to build the data pipelines to ingest, store, analyze and query hundreds of billions of events a day. 


Join us to build powerful and resilient data systems.


What you will do



  • Build distributed, high-throughput, real-time applications

  • Do it in Go and Python, with bits of C or other languages on the back-end and Reactjs (with flux and redux) and d3.js on the front-end

  • Use Kafka, Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch and other open-source components

  • Join a tightly knit team solving hard problems the right way

  • Own meaningful parts of our service, have an impact, grow with the company

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer: Services & Applications
jobs.content:
Have you ever wondered what happens inside the Cloud?

DigitalOcean is on a mission to simplify cloud infrastructure for the millions of software developers around the world. We are a small, distributed, and cohesive team. At DigitalOcean, every single engineer has a massive impact on the organization and product, and we wan to keep it that way. We believe in autonomy for teams and individuals, and that's why we like to work with people who have an area of expertise but either already have or are willing to learn skills needed by their teams to deliver the best product in small, frequent increments.

Ultimately, we want you to be passionate about creating products that you and your peers would love.

Our systems make our users' lives simple by letting them deploy, scale, and manage their operations with a simple call to our API. As a software engineer focused on the back-end, you will build and own the services that power this cloud.

You will join a team of engineers experienced in the construction of distributed architectures using microservices. The bulk of your work will be in Go and Ruby, but you will use other technologies and platforms relevant to your team's work.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Join an end-to-end team, responsible for all aspects of a given product or platform
  • Design, build and own various services and APIs, from their conception to production and maintenance
  • Work in a business domain you already know and are passionate about
  • Own the operations, performance, and reliability of the services developed by your team
  • Solve unique problems as you cross the border between product and infrastructure

What We'll Expect From You:

  • 8+ years experience as a software engineer, developer, or programmer
  • Excellent skills in at least two programming languages, preferably (but not restricted to) Go, Ruby, JavaScript, Python, Java, or Scala
  • You have some experience in distributed application architecture technologies
  • You have extensively used some form of RPC (e.g. grpc, REST, SOAP, ProtocolBuffers, Thrift)
  • Strong opinions, weakly held

Why You'll Like Working at DigitalOcean:

  • Because we have amazing people. We can promise you will work with some of the smartest and coolest people in the industry. We work hard but we always have fun doing it. Archery classes, DJ lessons, and office pie fights are a thing. We care deeply about each other and take our “no jerks” rule very seriously.
  • Because we value development. We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development. You’ll need to be great to get hired here and we promise you’ll get even better.
  • Because we care about you. We offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents, a monthly gym reimbursement to keep you fit, and a monthly commute allowance to make your trips to and from work easier.
  • Because we invest in your future. We offer competitive compensation and a 401k plan with up to a 4% employer match. We also provide all employees with Kindles and reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.
  • Because we want you to love where you work. We have a great office space located in the heart of SoHo NYC and offer daily catered lunches to keep your hunger at bay. We’re also very remote-friendly—we use Slack to communicate across the company—and all remote employees have the opportunity to take an all-expense-paid trip to our HQ to get quality in-person time with the team at least once a year. We also allow employees to customize their workstations to meet their needs—whether remote or in HQ.
  • Because we value diversity and inclusivity. We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We believe in autonomy for teams and individuals, and that's why we like to work with people who have an area of expertise but either already have or are willing to learn skills needed by their teams to deliver the best product in small, frequent increments. 

___Ultimately, we want you to be passionate about creating products that you and your peers would love.___

Our systems make our users' lives simple by letting them deploy, scale, and manage their operations with a simple call to our API. As a software engineer focused on the back-end, you will build and own the services that power this cloud.

You will join a team of engineers experienced in the construction of distributed architectures using microservices. The bulk of your work will be in Go and Ruby, but you will use other technologies and platforms relevant to your team's work.

__What You'll Be Doing:__

* Join an end-to-end team, responsible for all aspects of a given product or platform
* Design, build and own various services and APIs, from their conception to production and maintenance
* Work in a business domain you already know and are passionate about
* Own the operations, performance, and reliability of the services developed by your team
* Solve unique problems as you cross the border between product and infrastructure

__What We'll Expect From You:__

* 8+ years experience as a software engineer, developer, or programmer
* Excellent skills in at least two programming languages, preferably (but not restricted to) Go, Ruby, JavaScript, Python, Java, or Scala
* You have some experience in distributed application architecture technologies
* You have extensively used some form of RPC (e.g. grpc, REST, SOAP, ProtocolBuffers, Thrift)
* [Strong opinions, weakly held](http://bobsutton.typepad.com/my_weblog/2006/07/strong_opinions.html)

__Why You'll Like Working at DigitalOcean:__

* ___Because we have amazing people.___ We can promise you will work with some of the smartest and coolest people in the industry. We work hard but we always have fun doing it. Archery classes, DJ lessons, and office pie fights are a thing. We care deeply about each other and take our âno jerksâ rule very seriously.
* ___Because we value development.___ We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.  Youâll need to be great to get hired here and we promise youâll get even better.
* ___Because we care about you.___ We offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents, a monthly gym reimbursement to keep you fit, and a monthly commute allowance to make your trips to and from work easier.
* ___Because we invest in your future.___ We offer competitive compensation and a 401k plan with up to a 4% employer match. We also provide all employees with Kindles and reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.
* ___Because we want you to love where you work.___ We have a great office space located in the heart of SoHo NYC and offer daily catered lunches to keep your hunger at bay. Weâre also very remote-friendlyâwe use Slack to communicate across the companyâand all remote employees have the opportunity to take an all-expense-paid trip to our HQ to get quality in-person time with the team at least once a year. We also allow employees to customize their workstations to meet their needsâwhether remote or in HQ.
* ___Because we value diversity and inclusivity.___ We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Director of Frontend Engineering
jobs.content:
About the Engineering Organization
We are a growing, hands-on, flat organization. Because we are still small, it means everyone is a generalist and allows for our engineers to take on multiple roles and challenges not defined by titles.  Regardless of who you are on the engineering team, you will contribute to and have a big impact on the final product from day one. The opportunity for growth and development here is incredible. We have a strong culture of mentoring and promoting from within! We place a lot of emphasis on good engineering practices while retaining the flexibility of allowing each engineering team to have independent agile processes. Diversity is important to us, and we treat each other with respect and empathy.


About the Role
Minted is embarking on a major overhaul of our front-end that will showcase, through its consumer- and community- facing technology assets, the company’s deep love for and credibility in design.  This includes the development of front-end infrastructure and development process that the rest of the company’s engineering organization will leverage.


Minted is consolidating its excellent but distributed front-end talent under a single organization that will be chartered with delivering Minted’s design brand through technology and ensure that our user’s digital experience reflects our brand values of quality and creative independence.


This role will lead that team, and will partner with our Director of UX, the UX team, the brand team, and the CEO to re-envision, redesign, and build Minted's web presence on all devices.  This role has ultimate authority over front-end engineering decisions at the company, and is expected to be part of discussions about creative UI design.

The individual leading this organization will have a major opportunity to contribute creatively to Minted’s brand, working in a technology capacity that is partners closely with our creative UI design team.  We seek someone who wants to make beautiful, groundbreaking UI and has a vision as to how to make that possible.  We specifically want someone who will bring an additional point of view on how we can move our front end design forward so that it becomes a point of differentiation for the company that is as strong as our reputation for design of physical products.


We are looking for an experienced hands-on leader in front-end engineering with a passion for design, a tendency toward perfectionism, and the desire to establish durable and effective front-end infrastructure and development process.

jobs.title: Software Crafts(wo)man Angular / C#
jobs.content:
Fan d'AngularJS et bien au fait des technos web et tu n'as rien contre travailler avec un back-end C# ?


Ou au contraire, tu es un(e) expert(e) en C# et tu aimerais consolider tes connaissances front-end ?


 Dans tous les cas, un code clean est, pour toi, obligatoire et software craftsmanship n'est pas imprononçable ;-).


Tu sais, également, découper tes user stories dans le bon sens (slicing business et non layering technique) et enfin ton code respire le vocabulaire métier.


Alors, j'ai une proposition qui va t'intéresser :)


Un de nos clients recherche activement des personnes comme toi pour rejoindre son équipe de craftsmen.


Le projet consiste à développer une application web dont le front utilise AngularJS 1 (tests avec Jasmine, Karma, phantomJS, dev et intégration avec node).


Le back est en C# et le but est de faire communiquer tout le monde via des événements grâce à des technos comme RxJS.


Chaque fonctionnalité est explicitée en BDD puis écrite en TDD. Le produit est livré de façon continue via une usine de build éprouvée.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Why weâre hiring a developer

Simple: Weâre growing.

Weâre growing, and weâre growing fast. Weâre searching for the best and the brightest developers cities across the country have to offer! Weâre searching for ambitious, driven, and creative game changers with a passion for revolutionizing digital marketing technologies, and creating amazing Wordpress sites. We want talented innovators, who never settle for the adequate, and always strive for greatness.

Why? Because thatâs who we are.

 

Weâre not just searching for developers â weâre searching for great developers.

To us, a developer is a scientist as much as an artist; a dynamic individual who can think logically and creatively. A great developer is someone who can write custom, compact, and efficient PHP from scratch and transform WordPress from its default settings into a secure, scalable, and beautifully organized paragon of blazingly fast custom functionality. Weâre searching for developers with a strong commitment to delivering exceptional work, without compromises. We want the rock stars who face challenges with tenacity, an exceptional work ethic, and a positive attitude.

 

Who are we?

http://uptrending.com/

 

Location

This position is 100% remote. Hired candidates may work out of the U.S.-based location of their choosing. 

 

What we offer

As a part of our team, youâll have the opportunity to work on a variety of startup, entrepreneurial, and enterprise-grade projects â projects youâll be excited about. Youâll have the chance to work alongside industry leaders, and learn from their experience and expertise. Youâll have the opportunity to master new technologies, as well as sharpen your current skills. We want our developers to do more than just grow -- we want our team to thrive. We offer a competitive compensation plan, robust benefits, and paid vacation.

 

Required Skills:

PHP --Custom PHP app experience

Additional Requirements:

Client Communicationâ Exceptional verbal and written communication skills -- The proven ability and willingness to engage clients directly, brainstorm solutions, and anticipate problems before they arise.
Collaboration â Self-motivated individuals who work well independently and alongside a team. Qualified candidates are comfortable with participating in peer code reviews, learning from constructive feedback, and educating others on best practices and new technologies.

Agility -- We want individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly, and regularly master diverse web technologies, techniques, and best practices.

Growth and Learning â We want curious and motivated individuals who enjoy learning in a company that values personal growth and knowledge

Digital agency experience strongly preferred.


To apply: Send us your cover letter, rÃ©sumÃ©, and a portfolio of your best work to the link below. We look forward to hearing from A+ candidates!https://uptrending.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0m66c/
