jobs.title: Senior SEO Manager
jobs.content:
We are looking for an SEO pro that's passionate about using organic search, content marketing, and social media to elevate the exposure of websites within search engines. If that's you, keep reading!

As a member of the TakeLessons marketing team, the Senior SEO Manager will report directly to the VP of Marketing and own the development and execution of the companyâs SEO and content marketing strategy to reach target audiences and grow the business.

With hands-on experience and a proven track record for driving qualified traffic, this individual brings expert-level knowledge and experience within SEO, content marketing, and social media. This role is responsible for team management, including the recruitment, coaching, and development of staff. 

Remote workers are also welcome to apply!

This person will ...

  • Define, execute, and evolve the SEO strategy and goals for TakeLessons
  • Be directly responsible for qualified traffic growth through organic search
  • Develop annual and quarterly operating plans and forecasts in-line with business objectives
  • Maintain monthly, quarterly, and yearly reporting to support team objectives and goals
  • Manage the SEO budget to maximize performance and meet or exceed budget goals
  • Identify opportunities, develop proposals, and forecasts results for SEO initiatives
  • Manage link building efforts and develop targeted campaigns for growing domain authority
  • Oversee our content marketing program including research, promotion, and measurement
  • Build our social media presence and drives engagement as part of cohesive SEO strategy
  • Monitor keyword rankings and analytics to measure performance and identify opportunities
  • Iterate and tests to continuously learn and maximize the impact of our SEO efforts
  • Work collaboratively with the marketing team and across departments for driving conversion and growth
  • Recruit, manage, and motivate a highly skilled team necessary to deliver outstanding business results
  • Monitor and appraise staff performance and identifies training and development opportunities that will ensure consistently high performance and retention of key employees
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technical knowledge, and tactics by reviewing professional publications, establishing professional networks, and participating in professional groups
  • Other duties as assigned or required

In order to succeed you need.. 

  • Bachelorâs degree highly preferred or equivalent education and experience
  • Minimum 6 years of B2C digital marketing experience
  • Minimum 4 years hands-on experience managing SEO and content marketing
  • A proven track record of developing, executing and scaling high impact, profitable, SEO programs that drive business results
  • Proven ability to define and execute on assigned goals and objectives
  • Exceptional data and analytics skills with the capacity to be both analytical and creative
  • Organized and detail oriented with the ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
  • Excellent communicator at all levels to drive alignment and action towards goals
  • Significant knowledge of the consumer internet marketplace industry and the ability to continuously evaluate trends and adjust strategy to compensate and take advantage of shifts
  • Strong familiarity across a broad range of digital marketing activities including but not limited to SEM, paid media, email marketing, and conversion preferred
  • People management/supervisory experience
  • A "Rollâupâyourâsleeves" entrepreneurial, startup attitude

We offer a great benefits plan, PTO and 401k plan. We are a startup where you can make a high-impact because of the amount of ownership you have! 

To apply: https://takelessons.com/about/careers

jobs.title: Ruby / React Dev. - Help us build a kickass camera app for contractors!
jobs.content:
Are you ready to become the 9th (and most crucial!) member of our team?  I think you are. You've put in your time building boring stuff for other people. You needed the money, we get it. But that time has passed. Now you're ready to bring your skills to bear on a fun, interesting project with other people that are super pumped to be working with you!

Still not convinced to apply? Keep reading (it get's interesting...)

You're probably wondering what will your day look like at CompanyCam?
Well you'll likely roll in at 8:30 even though you don't have to be here til 9:00.  You'll be new and you'll want to make a good impression and prove to everyone that you're all class.  You'll spend the first 30-45 minutes standing at your incredibly amazing (autonomous.ai) standing desk. Then your feet will start to hurt and you'll sit until after lunch.


At some point on your first day, or first week, you'll find yourself in bathroom with the Russian guy that works at another office in the building. How will you know? THE GRUNTING. Soon enough you'll recognize his shoes and thus be able to avoid the uncomfortable experience of trying to pee while he's loudly birthing a hoofed creature in the stall nearby. But not at first. At first you won't know any better and you'll be forced to courageously suffer through the intense discomfort of listening to a man shit loudly.


He's actually a really nice guy though...


------------


Now on to serious things that our CTO will want you to be doing:


You will be responsible for assisting with the implementation of new features and bugfixes. You will also be integrating with a variety of partner software using a variety of protocols and standards.

jobs.title: Chief Technology Officer For Established Ecommerce Company
jobs.content:
We are seeking an extremely talented programmer for the CTO of our company.  This is a hands on role, as you will be the sole programmer to start.  Once you have settled within the company, you will be able to build a team with hires you will recruit, manage and build alongside.  

Our company is an established and profitable top 1000 eCommerce website launched in 2008.  We occupy a niche product category with broad appeal.  As our CTO, you will have a significant impact on the trajectory of the company over the next decade.

You should have great experience/passion about building websites that load quickly.  You should have experience optimizing websites for mobile use.  Our current ecommerce website is a highly customized version of magento enterprise.  As our new CTO, you will work on the existing magento website.  Eventually, we anticipate a complete re-platform to either another ecommerce system or custom/in house.

Below is a list of skills/experiences for this position, divided between required and nice to have:

Required:



  1. Exceptional technical skills, specifically with PHP, MYSQL, javascript, ajax and relevant web technologies.  Cream of the crop, top 1%

  2. Full front end and back end developer

  3. Server management/optimization

  4. Performance optimization

  5. Mobile optimization

  6. Email Management

  7. Good communication skills with non-technical stakeholders in the company

  8. Ability to integrate systems via APIs or any method necessary.

  9. A/b split testing

  10. Able to admit when unable to accomplish a technical task on your own, but able to identify the resources to get the task done.

  11. Understands security best practices and implementation.



Nice to have:



  1. Ecommerce

  2. Magento

  3. SEO

  4. Operation side experience such as warehouse management systems and order fulfillment systems.

  5. Google analytics

  6. Paypal integration



Benefits of working for our company include:



  1. Small/close knit team.

  2. Casual work environment.

  3. Results oriented, not process oriented.  Don't care how you get it done or during what hours you get it done, as long as you get it done!

  4. You will be working directly with the managing partners, so no bureaucracy.

  5. Opportunity to scale up an existing business has lots of room for growth, yet isn't starting from the ground floor.  We have hundreds of thousands of customers and have done millions in revenue.

  6. Opportunity to build a technical team from the ground up according to your vision within a stable company.

  7. You will not be on a time clock.  This is an on site position and you will be asked to be in the office 4-5 days per week.  However, you can set your own specific hours and put time in at home.

  8. Our office is in southern Westchester, easily accessible from New York City or Northern Jersey.  It is a 22 minutes express train from Grand Central



Compensation: Base Salary of 6 figures plus, negotiable based on fit/experience.  Performance based bonuses based on measurable metrics.

jobs.title: Growth Marketer
jobs.content:
Bonfire is transforming the way people buy and sell high-quality custom shirts. As a leading custom apparel platform, weâve helped thousands of people and organizations raise millions of dollars by selling their own custom shirts â and weâre just getting started.

We have an amazing opportunity for an experienced, creative, and analytical marketing professional to join our team and help our fast-growing platform grow even faster.

What youâll be doing:

Most importantly, youâll be doing what you love. Discovering new channels, converting traffic, optimizing funnels, testing âcrazyâ ideas, and digging into the data to see what works (and what doesnât).

At Bonfire, growth is company-wide. Youâll get to work directly with our product, marketing, engineering, sales, and support teams to drive user and revenue growth across all channels of our platform.

Youâll also have access to implementation teams and internal resources at your disposal to execute high impact growth. Plus, youâll have a sizable marketing budget and subscriptions to modern tools such as Intercom, Heap Analytics, Optimizely, Unbounce, Ahrefs and Hotjar (among others) to help you get the job done.  

This is not an entry level role, and some of the low hanging fruit has already been picked. However, for the right person, this is an incredible opportunity to shape the future growth curve of our company.

What youâre all about:
  • Youâve marketed SaaS platforms, marketplace platforms, e-commerce sites, web/mobile apps, or your own product
  • Youâve scaled other companies/products, and you can prove it
  • Youâre an excellent problem solver
  • Youâve got grit
  • You like getting under the hood and asking âwhy?â and âwhat ifâ¦â
  • Youâre an analytics junkie who checks stats more often than youâd like to admit
  • You are forever curious
  • You donât mind bending the rules
  • You take ownership in your work, even if everything doesnât go as planned
  • You arenât afraid to take risks to make things happen
  • You love learning new things and trying new tools/tactics, even when it falls well outside of your comfort zone

What we are looking for:
  • 5+ years experience in digital marketing and/or product management
  • Deep understanding of paid advertising, SEO, content strategy, email marketing, and other user acquisition channels
  • Strong technical background with working knowledge of HTML/CSS and Javascript
  • Basic design skills with proficiency in Photoshop/Sketch/Illustrator
  • Experience running A/B + MVT and CRO tests with tools like Optimizely/VWO and Unbounce
  • Expertise with modern analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Heap, etc.

Youâre in good company (with a good company). We offer:
  • Competitive compensation with excellent insurance benefits
  • Unlimited paid vacation
  • Remote position - work from anywhere
  • An amazing workplace culture
  • An environment to grow your skills, learn new technologies and tools, and to challenge yourself (and have a lot of fun)
  • The chance to make a real impact in the companyâs growth and history
  • An opportunity to help make a difference in thousands of peopleâs lives

To apply: Does this sound like you? If so, weâd love to hear from you. Apply directly from our careers page https://careers.bonfire.com/growth-marketer/

jobs.title: MEAN Engineer
jobs.content:
Email on Acid is dedicated to building an industry leading SaaS application using the most up-to-date and current technologies available. We have a team of world-class engineers who are constantly pushing the envelope. The team is in the midst of a number of site-wide initiatives and we need your help to shape the future of our platform!


We are a looking for a talented software engineer to assist in developing and upgrading our web platform from a LAMP stack to a MEAN stack. In this role, expect to be involved in migrating current features to Node.js while also expanding our product. The right candidate understands modern software design and can break down complex tasks in clear and concise ways. They should have a strict attention to detail and be comfortable learning and applying the newest development methodologies. Candidates should be able to quickly jump into our tech stack (Node.js / MongoDB / Dynamo / Redis / PHP / MySQL) and make a difference. We work with many different programming languages and thrive on the cutting edge of technology. There are no manuals or blogs written to build our product and the right engineer will help define the path of innovation.

jobs.title: Senior UI Developer Contract and Permanent

The candidate will be a natural leader and mentor with a driven yet pragmatic, delivery focussed mindset and a desire to deliver constant business value through the effective and innovative use of technology with a proven background in delivering high quality business critical software. The candidate will be expected to take ownership, responsibility and accountability for critical deliveries. In addition the successful candidate will have come from a mature and demonstrable Agile and DevOps background and be comfortable dealing with the resistance that comes with change.

jobs.title: Job Opening for "Lead Business Analyst"

jobs.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Summary:  


iRobot Engineering is expanding, and is looking for an exceptional senior embedded software engineer to join our team. Key personality attributes should include passion, energy, and the desire to build! 


What you will do:


As part of Product Development, you will be designing and implementing new technologies and features into next generation iRobot products.  Working in an Agile development process, you will design, implement, and document software to run on embedded platforms.


As a team, you will create cutting-edge sensors, processor mainboards, navigation software and motion control systems.  Job functions will include: system level design, board bring up, low level driver implementation, and advanced analog/digital signal processing.


Qualifications:



  • Experience with real-time embedded microprocessor and microcontroller systems

  • Solid understanding of design patterns, data structures and advanced programming techniques

  • Knowledge of embedded software such as: interrupts, ADCs, DMA, SPI and clock management

  • Expert in embedded C/C++

  • Strong analytical skills and a desire to learn

  • Ability to understand electrical schematics and the fundamentals of analog circuits

  • Strong understanding of operating system fundamentals, and experience bringing up embedded OS’s on new platforms

  • Ability to work independently, without direct supervision

  • B.S. in Computer Science / Computer Engineering or other technical or scientific field

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Summary:


As a pioneer in the robot industry, iRobot’s goal is to drive innovation, serve as an industry catalyst and change the world by fueling the era of robots. To support and encourage the development of robot technology, iRobot offers comprehensive resources for third-party developers, providing information and products that facilitate the creation and easy integration of new payloads, behaviors and capabilities on iRobot platforms. 



  • Our SW Engineering Team is expanding, and is looking for an exceptional Principal Software Engineer to join our team. Key personality attributes should include: great interpersonal skills, passion, energy, and the desire to build. 


Essential Functions/ Job Duties:


As part of SW Product Development Team, you will:



  • Work on the next generation Roomba, focused on the Robot Application

  • Develop robotic software packages for mission state machines, path planning, and robot behaviors

  • Integrate software on multiple robotic platforms

  • Design, implement, and document software to run on linux and embedded platforms

  • Lead and mentor other software engineers

  • Work in an Agile environment

  • Be passionate about Robotics

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer - iOS Applications
jobs.content:
Summary:


As a Principal Software Engineer – iOS Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control iRobot’s Consumer Home Products.


In this role, you will collaborate with robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development lifecycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will also have experience building mobile applications (iOS) that control real time systems.


Essential Functions/ Job Duties:



  • As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new products that are used by millions of people.

  • This position will help to mentor and grow other engineers.

  • Design, implement, and test a new, iOS based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

  • Participate in and drive code reviews.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer

You will work closely with other members of the development team to solve challenging big data and social graph problems. You will be an expert in one of .NET MVC, MongoDB or Javascript. We’ll expect you to take ownership and help test, release and maintain the code you write.

jobs.title: Senior iOS-Developer
jobs.content:
Your challenge



  • Design and implement complex, appealing and high quality iOS applications

  • Write clear and maintanable code that every developer is happy to work with

  • Unit-test code for robustness including edge cases, usability and general reliability

  • Optimize architecture for various iOS devices

  • Evaluate projects/tasks and provide estimates

  • Explore feasibility of technical realization

  • Collaborate with team members within agile process to deliver according to user requirements and technical feasibility

  • Maintain quality standards through a structured approach and application of modern development methods

  • Conduct code reviews on a pull request base

  • Create and maintain source code and project documentation



Your profile



  • You are a skilled iOS developer with proven proficiency in the iOS SDK, more than five years of working experience and actively supporting Open-Source development (see also: https://github.com/WeltN24 - PiedPiper, GraphQLicious, Carlos, LazyPages)

  • You possess excellent knowledge of Xcode as well as the iTunes Connect submission process

  • You have excellent knowledge of software patterns as MVVM, MVP, VIPER, Reactive, Futures and Promises, and more.

  • You have experience with Fastlane, Carthage, Alamofire and the most used third-party libraries

  • You are using TDD and BDD, e.g. with Quick & NimbleGit, GitFlow, Jenkins, Jira and Confluence are familiar to you

  • For you, it is self-evident to be take initiatives for the search of solutions and the removal of impediments proactively

  • You are able to inspire and excite a team and are open to share your knowledge and have a discussion about the best approaches

  • You possess the ability to think analytical, you are able to visualize, articulate and solve problems and make decisions based on available information

  • You are a true professional, who feels comfortable in a dynamic environment and is ready to become a part of a young organization

  • Neither written nor spoken English hamper you

  • You impress as a result-oriented planner and executor, who is ready to deliver individually and as a team member



What we offer


You will be given the opportunity to deploy your current strengths and gain additional ones. In an agile and highly qualified team, you will work on the newest media technologies in a modern office in the heart of Berlin. A variety of seminars and workshops give you the opportunity to develop your specialized skill-set and your knowledge of comprehensive issues. Besides that, various conferences and Tech Talks as well as our regular exchange with subsidiaries of Axel Springer (e.g. Zanox, idealo, KaufDa and Immonet) provide an opportunity to build a valuable network.


Moreover: You will have flexible working hours and above average number of vacation days, free beverages as well as fruits and a generous subsidy in our four on-site restaurants every day. Furthermore, a MacBook Pro with Apple Cinema Display, which can also be used privately, will be placed at your disposal.


Contact

Questions regarding this position (reference number 015700060) will be answered gladly by: claudia.model@axelspringer.de


This position is initially limited for 2 years.

jobs.title: Senior Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
At Bright Pattern we design and develop cloud-based communication-enabled customer service and sales applications. A few words about the software we’ve developed, and are now running:



  • Fault tolerant

  • Scalable

  • Runs on bare metal as well as in virtualized environments

  • Runs in 24 x 7 environment and is upgradable without downtime

  • 3 (4) levels of data protection

  • Carries mission-critical voice traffic

  • Works with mobile apps

  • Integrates with major SaaS providers (Salesforce, Zendesk etc)

  • Highest hardware/user density in the industry

  • Disaster recovery support (currently primary/backup, active-active is being developed)

  • Whole system can run on a laptop, if needed (surely you’ll need 2 for redundancy)

  • We are at the phase when we have the product and it is competitive and it works and we are beginning to scale. Interested? Sign up.



You will be responsible for operations infrastructure in datacenter (production, staging clusters), track available capacity, propose and materialize expansion plans. As a part of it you will have to:



  • Ensure proper monitoring of the solution deployed in the datacenter (servers, network, VoIP). The primary focus is on productization and improvements of monitoring system to ensure consistent, repeatable coverage:

  • Establish, document and maintain operational procedures on failure management, monitoring, preventative maintenance, expansions and upgrades. We expect you to try them manually as first step, document them as next step and automate (think Ansible) as the final step.

  • Maintain and improve automation for  installations, multi-computer cluster upgrades

  • Perform expansion, provisioning of additional servers, perform pilot deployments in new environments (AWS, Azure, across geographic regions)


We offer plenty of challenges and opportunities to explore and try and use new technologies – from new and coming charting, trending, monitoring solutions to advanced usage of AWS services.

jobs.title: NHS Digital Graduate Developer

These will ensure you have the best opportunities to gain the varied skills, knowledge and experience necessary to secure a permanent post within NHS Digital.


You will be working in an Agile delivery environment following DevOps principles and will be central to the ongoing development and improvement of key healthcare systems. These could include developing and enhancing critical messaging, identity and/or data infrastructure operating at significant scale to support critical healthcare services for the NHS and beyond.

Benefits

jobs.title: Tester
jobs.content:
About the Opportunities

• The chance to help shape, develop, support and maintain essential live National & Local NHS services.
• Help innovate and deliver the next phase of digital services for healthcare, utilising or creating tools and methodologies to deliver test driven development of robust and safe National and Local NHS services.
• Receive in-house training on NHS systems and technologies.
• To support a service which supplies 21,000+ organisations and links 27,000 ICT services within these organisations.
• To support a service which handles over 20 million messages a day.
• Building a strong reputation in an expanding team across NHS Digital and growing your Test and Assurance career in a challenging and rewarding environment.
This is an inspiring time to join the national, dynamic and well established NHS Digital Test and Assurance Profession.

The NHS Digital Test and Assurance Profession has a dual role, providing both testing of in house developed systems and services and assurance governance to both NHS Digital and the wider NHS. From a governance perspective the Test and Assurance Profession ensures applications and services meet contractual and user centric needs and driving out value for money from the Department of Health’s significant investment in these existing systems and services but also the progress towards paperless integration across the NHS. In the operational role the Test and Assurance Profession work closely with DevOps and Service Management teams on our in-house delivered services across the whole lifecycle from inception to operational running, to maximise value to our users.

This is an exciting time for the Test and Assurance Profession, as we are undertaking the scoping and discovery phases of the drive to deliver a paperless NHS as well as enhancing and delivering the existing services that form an integral part of day to day NHS operations. To facilitate this we will operate in an agile and operationally focussed way, using tools and automation as necessary to achieve a lean but technically and clinically robust and safe service. We are therefore looking to recruit a number of Test and Assurance professionals to a range of roles across our expanding professional group, from Senior Test & Assurance Managers, Lead and Senior Test Practitioners to Junior or Graduate Test Practitioners who are at the start of their Testing Careers.


About The Rewards

In addition to a competitive salary you can look forward to a full range of public sector benefits, including an excellent contributory pension scheme, generous holiday entitlement and various flexible working options. Perhaps the most compelling reasons for joining us, however, are the scale, scope and high profile nature of the projects you’ll be working on, and the unprecedented opportunity for personal and professional development.

jobs.title: Build cool s%#t and save the world
jobs.content:
We are looking for a front-end web developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Bit of an all-rounder, an experimenter, likes getting stuck in and understands the intricacies, joys and pitfalls of the web. Someone who understands the difference between MVVM, MVC and Flux – we need someone who is more focused on front end development but understands what’s happening on the back end and can help out and develop on it if needed (or if they want).


We want to go big and need a platform that can scale on the front end as well as the back end. We want to be able to rapidly build features and make maintenance a walk in the park using best practice UI development techniques and technology. We’ll be manning the front lines and need your help in the fast-growing and changing world of front end web.


Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.


We're a tech company at heart. We've recently begun the process of building a full-service internal team and have our team lead senior .Net dev in place. He needs a front end developer friend!


To start in January / February 2017 (latest). So we have some time to get to know you and for you to work out any notice periods you may have.


Your dream (we hope)? To work in a fast, free, creative "startup" environment. Solve big problems. We have a great culture — obsessed with delivery and getting shit done, empowering our staff, failing fast, experimenting and generally just being rad…


You'll be building and iterating the biggest tech platform the South African social sector has seen. We're trying to do social involvement, employee volunteering and other good things at SERIOUS SCALE. We've got a white label product that allows huge corporates to plug into our ecosystem and tailor-make their employee volunteering experiences. All these operate off real-time central databases, allowing to keep our fingers on the pulse of social activity in the country.


You know what's cool about this? Every time we get a conversion, it's something awesome happening out there in the world. A connection between a person and a Cause and some meaning being generated, some lives being changed. That's a lot more fulfilling than selling razors or clothes or random daily deals!

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer


Our Customer Engagement team is looking to grow to take on some really interesting, and technical, customer focused work. To do this we need a developer with a desire to cover front-to-back work: we do front end work seen by the customer; we build microservices in Clojure & Go; we deploy & monitor all of this using Docker and AWS ECS.  You really will get exposure across our technology stack.


The team is focused on improving the customer accounts experience: we care about the customer and we support the other uSwitch products; we balance delivering customer value against the technology used and we empower you to own those problems. 


We try to keep a startup feel to how we work: anyone can get involved in any aspect of the product and, sometimes, you might have to.  Expect to not only bring your knowledge and understanding but also to be pushed to grow and expand your experiences.


Technologies, we use: 



  • Languages: Clojure, Go, Ruby, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

  • Services: SQS, Kinesis

  • Analytics: BigQuery, R, Google Analytics

  • Infrastructure: AWS, Docker, Terraform


GitHub: https://github.com/uswitch


Our culture


We empower people to make intelligent decisions. We give them the autonomy to experiment and develop innovative ways to deliver a better product.


uSwitch uses a micro-service architecture to help the company and the systems we build be as scalable as possible; teams operate and deploy independently, making as many updates and changes they want to throughout the day.


A World Class Team 


We work in small autonomous product teams with everyone needed across disciplines to help solve problems and deliver. The organisation helps set direction but how you get there is up to you and your team. We share our ideas internally and externally through hosting meet-ups, working on open-source and presenting at conferences.


Ownership 


We expect you to own your problem. If that is delivering a web product then you must understand traffic acquisition, user experience, monitoring, technology, user journey and, importantly, the problem we are trying to solve for the customer. Although the majority of our APIs are written in Clojure and our front end apps tend to be Ruby our philosophy is to use the right tool for the job. We employ polyglot engineers with an interest in experimenting with new technology; if you feel a different language or tool is more appropriate for the problem at hand (and you can bring your team with you) you will have the space to incorporate it - even it if means rewriting existing systems.


Conferences / Public Speaking / Hack days / Community events 


We support many conferences around the globe particularly in the Clojure world and help with both your attendance and speaking engagements (within limits).  You can also see us at Clojure Dojos, we hosted the first couple of clojurebridge events in the UK, have hosted codebar and DataKind.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
Are you a web developer with stunning Javascript knowledge and experience in building complex single page applications? Are you looking for freedom, responsibility and opportunities to learn on the job? Then come join us to work on Lime CRM, our flexible application framework for helping companies make a lasting impression on their customers!


What you will do



  • Discuss, write and review code and tests for improvements to the Lime CRM Web Client, a single page app currently based on AngularJS.

  • Build re-usable components for others to use (application framework, remember?)

  • If you're into it -- lead and coordinate work with the Web Client frontend architecture.

  • Guide and mentor less experienced colleagues.


What we offer



  • The chance to influence the way you work, the technology stack and of course the product itself (which ultimately means improving the daily life of a large number of users).

  • Employment in a product company where we own the entire lifecycle from development to end-user support. In other words – we have an understanding all the way up in the executive management team that Doing Things Right pays off in the end.

  • An invitation to our famous Hack Tuesdays, Cottage Code Camps and mandatory "fredagsfika" (everybody eats cake). You will probably also want to hang with the people in the frontend guild.


We work in an agile environment with focus on quality. We use Gitlab for version control/peer reviews, TeamCity for CI/CD and Python for general tooling. Lime CRM is available in both on-premise and SaaS environments where AWS is our infrastructure provider of choice.

jobs.title: Ruby/Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
What you'll do

You'll collaborate to build, maintain and streamline our large application, working with Ruby, Rails, Postgres and more. Some examples of the work you'll be doing include the following:

continually improving our fetching code, which grabs information about millions of properties throughout each day
integrating against a new REST api to give our customers even more info about a house
making our mobile website a more pleasant experience
rewriting a SQL query to be 100x faster
You'll have both the opportunity and the independence to tackle all kinds of challenges: some days you'll work on refactoring a legacy part of the app to make it do something new, and on others, you'll build a brand new, greenfield feature.
You

You care about both building and maintaining a clean, readable, well tested codebase. We're looking for someone with Ruby experience. We do Ruby, Rails, Postgres, plus JavaScript, CSS and HTML on the front end. We don't require you to know all of those, but you should be comfortable in Ruby, and familiar with Rails. You communicate and collaborate with the whole team, be it to work through tough code problems or clarify product specifications.

About Us
We're a small team focused on opening up the old school real estate world.
Our goal is to build the best place for people to browse, shop for, and buy homes.
We employ an iterative approach to building products and deploy multiple times a day.
We have a big vision.
We believe in hiring smart people and giving them the support and flexibility to succeed.
If you work locally, you'll be in a relaxed and fun office in the Belltown neighborhood.
We're looking to hire the best people wherever they are in the world. If you don't want to relocate to beautiful Seattle, you should be awesome at working from home and available to join our daily standup at 10am Pacific. Some developers live in Seattle and come into the Estately office, but the majority live and work remotely, including several who live outside of the United States. We've had remote developers since 2011, and are seasoned veterans of working with a distributed team, across multiple timezones.

Our Hiring Process

We don't believe in algorithmic interviews under hostile conditions. We'll never ask you to invert a binary tree on a whiteboard or interview you with five interviewers at the same time. We like our recruiting process to be transparent to you. It roughly consists of the following steps:

An initial call between you and a member of our team
We'll tell you more about the work that you'd be doing, and why we think Estately is a great place to work. You'll have the opportunity to ask us lots of questions, too. We'll ask you about your experience and some technical questions, mostly to get a feel for where you're at as we move forward with the process.

Individual Exercise
We have a few practical challenges to assess technical knowledge. Over the course of a few hours, you'll be fixing a bug in our app (that we've previously fixed), so we can see how you approach solving a realistic problem.

Pairing on a Few Potential Features
Finally, during the pairing exercises you'll pair with one of our developers to implement an (existing) feature in the app. This will take a couple hours or so, and will mostly consist of discussion about approach, with some coding in the midst of it.

Diversity

Estately seeks to increase the ratio of women and underrepresented minorities in software engineering and development, we encourage women and people from underrepresented groups to apply for this position.

Estately is striving to be a diverse team, made of and built by people with different backgrounds and lifestyles. We don't discriminate based on race, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, religion, color, or any other group.

jobs.title: Senior Pipeline Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking an experienced Software Engineer to join the R&D team developing key tools and processes that implement our production pipeline. At least 5 years prior experience in the visual effects industry is expected.
 
The Pipeline team is part of the larger Research & Development department developing software for all parts of the company.  As a member of this team, you will be creating software used by artists in craft departments such as Modelling, Rigging, Animation and Lighting, to assemble, manage and deliver complex graphics scenes.  You will be working with proprietary software as well as tools such as Maya, Houdini and Nuke, extending them through their APIs in C++ and Python
 
As the pipeline evolves to meet the needs of the story, the tools evolve as well, so you will be in regular contact with artists and leads, identifying issues and adapting the pipeline to address them. Throughout these interactions, as someone who is passionate about automation you will always be on the lookout for opportunities to off-load manual work onto automated processes.

jobs.title: Senior WordPress Developer
jobs.content:
JOB PURPOSE:


Stanford Law School (SLS) is looking for a full-stack WordPress developer to join the Web Team in the Office of Communications and Public Relations, reporting to the Associate Director of Online Communications & Identity. The SLS WebTeam updates and maintains the law school website, and also creates multimedia and interactive Web projects. We are looking for someone who likes a creative challenge and thinks anything is possible – it’s just a matter of figuring things out.


Duties include working with the Web Team to architect, build, and implement new, high quality, high performance web-based applications and tools that maximally leverage available technology infrastructure – as well as maintain and enhance the law school website with dynamic content, and implement SLS Web initiatives.


Technically, the individual must be able to quickly synthesize complex design and functionality requirements and execute solutions that account for usability, accessibility, security, and maintainability.


With your application please include links to WordPress projects you have worked on with descriptions of your role and contributions.


CORE DUTIES*:



  • Architect, implement, and manage web-based applications, databases, and interfaces from initial architecture through development, test, and deployment.

  • Implement and maintain content management systems (primarily WordPress, some Drupal), including installation, configuration, troubleshooting, and creation of custom SLS plugins and content types. Develop and deploy upgrade/migration plans for content management systems.

  • Develop and deploy web applications and client-side web interface components that interact with relational database management systems that integrate with Stanford's web, authentication, and authorization infrastructure.

  • Evaluate and implement new programming languages and technologies. Provide life-cycle management for software and code.

  • Design and document data structures, architecture, and process flows for websites, web-based applications, and databases.

  • Assist and collaborate with other staff on technical matters. Conduct security reviews of applications written by other developers.

  • Design, coordinate, and troubleshoot integrations, components, and infrastructures to run enterprise class website.

  • Research, evaluate, and enforce web standards for usability and accessibility. Develop and enforce Stanford programming and application design standards.

  • Work with outside vendors as appropriate on development-related projects.


* - Other duties may also be assigned

jobs.title: Agile Technical Lead
jobs.content:
Do you want to work with cutting edge technologies?


HI Digital Solutions, LLC. is looking for an Agile Technical Lead to design, test, build and deploy systems that support world-wide scalability. If you want to work for a company that is making a difference, apply today!


As a purely virtual company, Digital Solutions' highly motivated, accountable, and talented people work from their home office, backyard, or wherever they are happiest.


As a member of our team you will join a fast-paced company with a social conscience. We focus on delivering information and digital systems to aid the word's largest home care company. Together we are tackling the growing problem of aging by delivering highly personalized care to seniors in their homes. 


As a Agile Technical Lead, you will be working with…



  • Cloud Development utilizing IaaS and PaaS

  • Programming languages like Ruby, Python, Java, JavaScript, and C#

  • Continuous Integration technologies and environments

  • Web Service development with REST based services

  • Oauth2 Security

  • Data Analytics on Azure

  • Front End development leveraging JavaScript


Team responsibilities include…



  • Delivering high-quality, test driven, and clearly-written software systems.

  • Consulting with other teams and individuals to identify strategic direction or architectural constraints to ensure proper investments are made in the current implementation to support future direction while minimizing waste.

  • Working with other teams and individuals to assess performance characteristics, identifying sources of constraints or slowdowns, and implementing remediation or improvement.

  • Pairing with remote team members to improve quality and team capability.


Leadership Responsibilities include ...



  • Providing technical vision for the team(s) and fellow engineers.

  • Visualizing architecture in a way that can be consumed consistently across the team(s).

  • Understanding business needs and translating those to elegant technical solutions.

  • Mentoring and growing members of the team(s).

  • Champions quality from an agile engineers perspective for the team(s). (TDD, SOLID, Continuous Delivery, etc.).

  • Quantify and prioritize technical debt against business value to be delivered with the rest of the team leadership.


Qualifications:



  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field preferred.

  • Experience with at least three of the following languages: Ruby, Python, Java, JavaScript, and/or C#.

  • Understanding of multi-tier web-based system architecture.

  • Deep knowledge and experience with Agile Engineering Practices (Test Driven Development, Continuous Delivery, etc.).

  • Significant experience with Scrum or Kanban approaches to work management preferred. 

  • 8+ years of experience developing software.

  • 2+ years of leading agile development teams.

  • 3+ years of experience with Test Driven Development

jobs.title: Outbound/Cold Email Marketer (Contract or Full-Time)
jobs.content:
About us:
Betterteam is a recruiting platform for small businesses. We are a remote-first company with most of the team having worked remote for a decade or more. We have had an amazingly successful launch and have seen some rock solid growth. Weâre an incredibly talented team of founders, product and marketers and weâre ready to take our growth to the next level.

About you:

jobs.title: Software Quality Engineer - Online Pizza Ordering
jobs.content:
In the great Northwest they call it an SDET.  Other places they call it a Software Quality Engineer.  Whatever they call it, it's you.  You've somehow found yourself writing code that tests other people's code.


At Granbury we respect the mighty SQE and we'll need your help making sure drunk college kids can order pizza on their phones.  And no, that isn't a joke.  You'll use a new front end test automation tool we've built on top of Selenium WebDriver to make sure our online ordering systems work reliably and accurately.


Like Wes Mantooth, the other developers may hate you for it, but they will respect you.


And they'll work with you.  When you need DOM elements to have id's, they will give you id's.  You won't have to slog your way through with unwieldy xpath expressions.  You won't be a second class citizen and you'll get the respect and support you need.  No code ships without a green bar from you.


And you'll do all this from the comfort of your own home.  This is a remote position, but you'll keep in touch with your team with daily virtual standups.  We'll pick a spot on the map every so often and get together for a technical conference (including PNSQC in October) or an in person design confab. But most importantly, you'll help level the technology playing field for mom and pop pizza shops in their struggle against corporate pizza.  If you have a grudge against the major pizza chains, this is your chance to get even.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer - Pizza and Wine
jobs.content:
Granbury Solutions is building a next generation technology stack for our restaurant and winery management platforms and we need your help.  We need a DevOps Engineer to work alongside our core product engineers to make sure they have the information, tools, and reliable systems they need to help our customers sell pizza - because we make software for pizza.  And yes, we know that's awesome.


You'll enable greater levels of pizza success using Elastic Search, Logstash, and Kibana to organize log data and metrics from thousands of cloud and in store systems.  You'll combine log data with browser crash reporting tools and server resource metrics to assemble a total picture of how our systems are behaving in the field complete with pretty charts and graphs.  You'll help modernize our continuous integration pipeline with Jenkins.  And you'll help keep our AWS services up and running using tools like CloudFormation and Ansible.


You'll work with people who are as nice as they are smart.  You'll get the guidance you need and you won't be shamed when you stumble across a problem you don't know how to solve on your own.  You'll deal with a minimum of corporate nonsense and get the freedom to do things right.  


And you'll do all this from the comfort of your own home.  This is a remote position, but you'll keep in touch with your team with daily virtual standups.  We'll pick a spot on the map every so often and get together for a technical conference or in person design confab.  But most importantly, you'll give hard working locally owned pizza joints a real chance in their struggle against the empire.  Seriously.

jobs.title: Database Developer

What we’d like you to do:


This opportunity is ideal for an experienced MySQL Developer responsible for architecture planning, development, configuration and performance tuning of our MySQL database clusters. You will be required to:

jobs.title: Senior Engineer - Java, Go
jobs.content:
We want to add a senior engineer to our team at Signal’s Brooklyn office. If you want to join a high-performing engineering team full of awesome people (who doesn’t?), you should keep reading.



A few reasons we’re excited to come to work every day


“We’re making Cassandra scale to the needs of our business (more than 2 billion queries per day and growing)” -Aki (engineering manager)



“Building a distributed Jenkins system, running multiple workers on multiple platforms, to not only run front-end and back-end unit tests, but to also create a pooled set of services to run per developer for long duration, integration and behavior tests.” –John (engineer)



“Our Cassandra Cluster is 60 nodes by five regions. We’re one of the biggest Cassandra deployments that I know of for a company our size. I love that we’re small but mighty, solving the types of problems tackled by much larger teams at Apple or Facebook”. – Jenny (engineer)



“We're switching from using Mongo for storing pending messages to Kafka.  The cool part about this is we're going from mongo's do-anything architecture to a stream-based architecture. This means we can scale a lot easier. Once we roll this out is we go from ~5k messages/sec to 200k+ messages/sec on a quarter the hardware cost.” – Cliff (engineering manager)



“I’m working on the Kafka project. The exciting part is that we can, with a little more work, replace our whole message broker stack with Kafka. We'll be able to show up-to-the-minute stats on how much data we've consumed from the Kafka topic and that will be how we tell if our system is working. It will enable us to react more quickly to problems and sets us up to do some neat machine learning and analytics on our traffic to gain some insights into what's happening in our system.”- Bobby (engineer)





So, what else would you be doing?



  • Design practical solutions to solve problems. Write great code. Stay ahead technically.  Participate in code reviews, testing.

  • Provide the technology for a platform that facilitates billions of requests monthly.

  • Working with big data and predictive analytics on a distributed system.

  • Collaborate. You'll be working with everyone—dev team, product owners, client services, to innovate and get stuff done.

  • Provide back-end connectivity solutions.

  • Work to help us be the best team we can be by promoting great architectural practices, improving process and always wanting to learn more.

  • Mentor junior developers

  • Participate in Hack Week, Shark Week, demo days. Have fun and experience life at a growing tech company.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.company: Kixer a division of LAKANA LLC
jobs.content:
What we need from you:



  • Get it done.

  • Know a modern statically-typed language.

  • Understand statistics and design of experiments.

  • Focus on business value.  Iteration now beats academically perfect later.


What we offer:



  • Mutual respect. If you listen, you will be listened to. If you pull your weight, it'll be ok for you to make mistakes and have priorities outside of work.

  • Startup culture with stability. We were successfully acquired over a year ago by a publicly traded company (NASDAQ: NXST), but are still a small team in control of our own destiny.

  • Open source opportunity. We've contributed significant improvements to Spark (e.g. the Kafka integration), and encourage engineers to give back when it makes sense.

  • Honest work. Optimizing advertising isn't curing cancer, but we strive to provide real value to partners, without cheating.


Tools we use:



  • Scala, Spark, Kafka, PHP, Javascript, Linux on AWS, key-value stores, relational databases

  • Most engineers choose to use a MacBook Pro and one or two large monitors.

  • Access to VM resources is typically not an issue. 


This is a full-time role with benefits.
We are in downtown Austin, TX; relocation assistance is available.


LAKANA provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital/ familial status, ancestry, or public assistance in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
Join the Cyft team to build a groundbreaking machine learning platform that has the potential to revolutionize the healthcare industry. We are seeking a senior frontend engineer to help our customers create, understand, and act on machine learning predictions. You will work with a great team and a state of the art technology stack that is fully hosted on AWS. Most importantly, you will be solving healthcare problems for paying customers starting on day one.


Core responsibilities:



  • You implement new user interface features, including the design and implementation of the API and data models that support these features.

  • You test your changes, using a combination of unit, integration, and browser tests as appropriate.

  • You like talking to users, and will directly connect with them to get feedback on how to make our application better

  • You'll work with our CEO and data science team to understand product requirements

  • You source and collaborate with usability and design contractors to create wireframes and mockups based on product requirements

  • You're comfortable in a continuous delivery environment, where your changes get deployed to production when all test layers pass.

  • You improve our automation tools as necessary to support the deployment of our container-based infrastructure

  • You research UI technology and recommend how to continually improve our frontend tech stack


Benefits


We are a small team that values hard work, good coffee, and diversity in people and viewpoints. We care about our mission to make healthcare better. We maintain sane work hours and a flexible daily schedule. We have a well behaved, hypoallergenic office dog that you are free to take for walks.



  • Salary + Equity

  • Health + dental

  • Make an impact at a company dedicated to improving healthcare

  • Gain exposure to Cyft’s advisors, customers, investors, and broader network

jobs.title: Technical Director of Business Technology
jobs.content:
POSITION SUMMARY


The Business Technology Services team within the Media Technology & Information Services (MTIS) group at HBO is responsible for the build and support of vital technology solutions supporting the scheduling, acquisition, processing, and distribution of HBO content, the team is a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and successful Technology team in New York City, Santa Monica and Seattle.


The team partners with various business units to enable the services required to deliver HBO’s premium content to domestic and global platforms as well as third party partners by bringing together platform, software, data and business intelligence services. The team’s mission is to provide rock solid operations while defining and executing on the future business technology landscape leveraging Cloud and DevOpsSec.


The Technical Director of Business Technology is responsible for evolving the existing design and the successful implementation of a service centric organization to provide rock solid technical services for a portfolio of 80+ assets including Business systems, Media systems, databases, integration and Corporate systems. The position collaborates with the Technology leadership and stakeholders to bring parity across the various Technology operations teams within HBO to meet the growing demand of a 24*7 service across business and direct customers.


We are looking for an experienced leader who has his/her eye on the future with a passion to drive organic change through innovation, operational efficiency, automation, integration and decommission. The individual will be responsible for managing a current team of 25+ employees and consultants across the globe. (S)He is expected to demonstrate significant depth and breadth while being open minded in building valuable partnerships across vendors, customers and peers to build a lean and an agile organization for the future.


This position will be based in New York City and report to the VP Business Technology Solutions.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Effective management of people, services, budgets and vendors associated to Business Technology team.

  • Define and execute against a roadmap to drive a predictable and a stable support organization responsible for on-prem and/or cloud hosted applications/systems.

  • Defining, measuring, managing and reporting performance against KPI’s/SLA’s.

  • Drive standardization, automation, integration across the group.

  • Drive the maturity of the portfolio by effectively defining incident and problem management.

  • Establish a 24*7 on call and operations center for an integrated Business systems and Media systems portfolio of on-prem and/or cloud hosted applications/systems.

  • Act as an escalation point for all departmental issues and leading the effort to resolve and reconcile those events.

  • Maintain vendors/consultants relationship management and associated health metrics reporting and analysis.

  • Enhance, maintain and improve departmental daily/weekly operating reports.

  • Responsible for meeting the various compliances and security demands of the portfolio including SOX.

  • Collaboration with peers and the leadership team to create and maintain a strategic plan.

  • Influence ongoing portfolio management, rationalization and prioritization.

  • You will help transform the organization into a DevopsSec model supporting cloud technologies.

jobs.title: Director of Business Technology and Operations
jobs.content:
The Business Technology Services team within the Media Technology & Information Services (MTIS) group at HBO is responsible for the build and support of vital technology solutions supporting the scheduling, acquisition, processing, and distribution of HBO content, the team is a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and successful Technology team in New York City, Santa Monica and Seattle.


The team partners with various business units to enable the services required to deliver HBO’s premium content to domestic and global platforms as well as third party partners by bringing together platform, software, data and business intelligence services. The team’s mission is to provide rock solid operations while defining and executing on the future business technology landscape leveraging Cloud and DevOpsSec.


The Director of Technology Planning and Operations is responsible for providing  the inception, execution and general management leverage to design, execute and operate the Business Technology team. The individual will be a part of the Business Technology leadership team driving operational maturity while helping create the future state of HBO’s content supply chain through collaboration, organizational maturity and technical leadership.


We are looking for a rising star with a track record of organizational leadership who is creative, forward leaning, technologically savvy and is business centric who takes pride in evolving the organization to meet the future needs of business and technology.


This position will be based in New York City and report to the VP Business Technology Solutions.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Plan, design, socialize, implement and evolve the operating model for the department to meet business goals.

  • Collaborate with your peers and leadership to create and maintain a 3 year strategic plan.

  • Portfolio management, rationalization and prioritization for a portfolio of 80+ assets and services.

  • Maintaining the 5+ vendors/consultants relationship management and associated health metrics reporting and analysis.

  • Assist VP and at times lead development of the departmental and management of budgets and processes by streamlining approvals, reconciliations and tracking against decommissions.

  • Act as an escalation point for all departmental issues and leading the effort to resolve and reconcile those events.

  • Enhance, maintain and improve departmental daily/weekly operating reports.

  • Establish and drive maturity of various steering and operating committee include program reviews, customer engagement and strategic planning.

  • Assist VP and at times lead critical initiatives including transformation, cloud adaptation and support of new programming that are of business importance as required.

  • Engage with senior leadership to interpret and integrate cross functional processes and programs.

jobs.title: Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a passionate, self-driven, and experienced mobile app developer to join our small, high-powered team to produce iOS and Android mobile applications that are both good looking and easy to use. You will be creating mobile applications that communicate with REST API functions. An in-house design team will assist you with screen layouts, images and flow. You should be familiar with tools and techniques that allow you to create a single code-base that can run on both IOS and Android without any major rework.


Thorough knowledge of how to package and publish mobile apps is required. You should be comfortable using a distributed source code control system such as Git. You will be joining our small development team in Newark, NJ, and expected to work independently and contribute to overall architectural and design discussions. 


We believe in a strong foundation of problem-solving, creative dialogue, and transparent software development in a fun workspace. Each day will be challenging, requiring you to learn something new...and you will have a blast doing it.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer - Emerging Technologies
jobs.content:
IDT Corp. (NYSE: IDT), a Fortune 1000, technology corporation, is building an Emerging Technologies Team comprised of Full Stack Developers.


The Emerging Technologies team is focused on transforming the business through new innovative processes, agile methodologies, and developing next-generation mobile products. Our work will create new ways for IDT to gain efficiencies in monitoring, deployment and development using Docker, Cloud, Serverless applications and AWS. Some frameworks we are using, and communities we contribute to include Node.js, React Native, and AngularJS. We use the Agile methodology process developed at Pivotal Labs.


We believe in a strong foundation of problem-solving, creative dialogue, and transparent software development in a fun workspace. 


Each day will be challenging, requiring you to learn something new... and you will have a blast doing it.


This is a chance to fully immerse yourself in emerging technologies. You will be given a great deal of autonomy and responsibility.

jobs.title: Senior Project Manager
jobs.content: JetSmarter is looking for a Technical Project Manager to execute company-wide initiatives and continuously improve processes in order to increase the effectiveness of our world-wide organization. Our technical PM will develop processes from the big picture to the smallest detail so the team can deliver complex and strategic cross-functional projects.  This person will be a link between our vision and the tangible tools to execute it. They will work collaboratively to create an efficient, streamline, and smarter environment for our engineering department - synthesizing cross-team communications and developing relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

jobs.title: Jr. Web Applications Developer
jobs.content:
We have a custom storefront/back-office web app built on the LAMP Stack.  You would participate in all of the standard responsibilities associated with a system like this:



  • Collaborate with users to analyze opportunities for new features

  • Drive projects through design and development towards forward thinking solutions

  • Analyze the existing codebase for opportunities to optimize and improve it

  • Adhere to our internal coding standards

  • Produce clear and concise documentation of application functionality

  • Ongoing support, solving break/fix issues as they arise with an eye toward permanently solving temporary problems


We are passionate about leveraging technology to both gain efficiencies and capture new business opportunities. Consequently, Development is at the core of who we are and what we do. In this role you will have the opportunity to influence our business direction. We apply holistic system thinking to our development and expect developers to bring a business mindset to problem-solving. Good is not good enough at CK, because we seek to prevail (not just survive) in the business segments where we choose to play. We are on a journey to build lean enterprise principles (including the concepts of agile development) into our culture. We enjoy each other and have fun while bringing a ferocious tenacity to our work.


We're currently employing all of the standard LAMP Stack tools. You will need to bring a strong understanding of the latest features in these technologies and how to use them with tools like the Zend Framework and patterns like MVC. These are the skills needed to work effectively with our current code base, as we continue to build and grow our technology base you'll have a voice on how and where that growth happens.


No visa sponsorship. US candidates only.


Don't think this job description fits you, but want to be a part of the team? Reach out to us anyway. We love to meet exceptional people. It wouldn't be the first time we've made an opportunistic hire!

jobs.title: Data Science Engineer
jobs.content:
Our growing data science team is looking for an experienced Software Engineer with a focus in Data Science.   We're looking for a candidate that's curious, creative and can effectively use data to tell a story. We develop and work with recommendation engines (collaborative, content-based filtering, and hybrid systems) and as well as a variety of both supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms and the data pipelines that support them.  We spend most of our time in Python, NumPy and sklearn.


The ideal candidate isn't afraid to get their hands dirty aggregating data, feature engineering and prototyping.  You will move quickly from problem identification all the way through productionizing algorithms via REST APIs. 


About the job:



  • You'll identify problems, gather and analyze supporting data and implement solutions

  • You'll write production code

  • You'll use a wide range of tools ranging from basic decision rules to sophisticated machine learning algorithms that drive user experience

  • You'll work with a small, close-knit team tackling some of the biggest challenges facing the business

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Front-end Developers at Catalant are highly skilled in making the website properties feel natural (not overdesigned or forced).  This means writing clean maintainable code that takes into account browser compatibility so that every interaction "just works" no matter if it is IE (10+) on Windows or Chrome on OS X.  The right person will be working with a small team of highly skilled individuals to build the platform that will be changing the future of work.


About the job:



  • Partner with other developers and product management to build new features 

  • Build reusable components 

  • Leverage cutting edge web technologies to build a best in class experience 

  • Learn and use new technologies 

  • Develop and maintain automated tests

jobs.title: Back End Developer
jobs.content:
Back-end Developers are expected to be highly skilled in making APIs fast and intuitive.  The team owns not only the externalization of the API, but the engines used to drive the APIs and their performance (i.e MySQL, ElasticSearch, etc.).  The right individual will be working closely with a small team of highly skilled individuals from varied backgrounds to build an API that supports all the Catalant web properties.


About the job:



  • Partner with front-end developers and product management to build new APIs

  • Continually improve performance of existing APIs 

  • Help define best practices for writing scalable APIs 

  • Learn and use new technologies 

  • Devlop and maintain automated tests

jobs.title: Content Marketing Analyst
jobs.content:
We're looking for extremely talented writers to help write the best content on the internet. You should have experience writing and editing for the web, and be able to think up, outline, research and write pitch-perfect pieces in about half the time it takes most people.

Youâll be writing about startups and the tech world. If youâre not already an expert in these areas, you should have a desire to become one.

Expect fun, ambitious, and eclectic colleagues. Do not expect to be told what to do. We're young and growing rapidly, which means each of us (including you) is responsible for shaping this company.

Our office is located on the Lower East Side of Manhattan.

Please send an email to workwithus@animalz.co with [content marketing analyst] in the subject. In your email, please include:
  • your rÃ©sumÃ©/CV

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

To apply: See: job description

jobs.content:

This includes optimal use of the latest choice of technologies in e.g. microservices, containers, databases and new programming languages and best practices (e.g. TDD, Code reviews, continuous delivery)

jobs.title: Medior Java Developer to fight terrorism and find people jobs
jobs.content:
De uitdaging


Bij WCC Smart Search & Match zijn we ambitieus en willen we het verschil maken. Mede daardoor lopen we nu al jaren voorop als het gaat om search & match oplossingen. Onze unieke software wordt wereldwijd door grote organisaties en overheden gebruikt om mensen aan een goede baan te helpen of te zorgen voor een veiligere wereld door middel van identificatie-oplossingen. Dit vraagt om softwareontwikkeling op topniveau en een Java Developer die ervoor gaat om de beste te worden op Java-gebied.


Jouw baan als Medior Java Developer


Je bouwt oplossingen die er echt toe doen en lost uitdagende problemen op met de ontwikkeling  van complexe software. Het mooie is ook dat je je vak uitoefent terwijl je tegelijkertijd de wereld een beetje beter maakt. Je zult meedraaien in een scrum team waar je de modernste methoden en technieken toepast. En door samen te werken met slimme collega-developers haal je alles uit je vakgebied. Je komt terecht in een snelgroeiende organisatie waar kansen net zo belangrijk worden gevonden als het resultaat en de kwaliteit. Bovendien bieden wij je alle ruimte om je vakgebied verder te ontdekken.


Bij WCC Smart Search & Match kun je waarde toevoegen bij:



  • De ontwikkeling van onze unieke software, zoals het ontwikkelen van de generieke Business Logic van ons Employment platform en ID oplossingen;

  • Het vertalen van user stories naar technische ontwerpen en deze samen met je team en de Product Owner uitwerken;

  • Het realiseren van deze user stories door het schrijven van code, die voldoet aan de hoge kwaliteitsstandaarden die continu gemonitord wordt;

  • Het bedenken en ontwikelen van unit tests.


Concreet betekent dit dat je als Medior Java Developer werkt met technologieën, tools en frameworks als:



  • Java Ecosysteem;

  • SOAP en REST;

  • Spring, JAXB, Apache CXF, Maven, Jenkins, Angular JS;

  • Scrum;

  • SaaS.


Jij kunt het verschil maken!


Net als wij ben je ambitieus en wil je verder(door) groeien. Leergierigheid en nieuwsgierigheid staan daarom bij jou voorop. Je neemt je verantwoordelijkheid om de allerbeste kwaliteit te leveren. Jij bent sterk in het proces, maar hebt altijd oog voor detail en resultaat. Net zo gemakkelijk als jij je hulp aanbiedt aan anderen, durf je er zelf ook om te vragen als je er even niet uitkomt. Zoals het hoort in scrum, neem je samen met het hele team initiatieven voor het bereiken van de sprint doelen. En je bent een echte medior omdat je:



  • In ieder geval een hbo-diploma hebt. Het liefst in de richting IT, denk aan Software Engineering;

  • Minimaal 4 jaar werkervaring hebt als Java Developer;

  • Enige ervaring hebt opgedaan met complexe software architecturen, applicatieontwikkeling en -integratie, Algorithmic Programming, Web Services, SOA en/of de technologieën, tools en frameworks waarmee wij werken;

  • Je uitstekend kunt redden in technisch Engels;

jobs.title: Technical Consultant who makes an impact on society
jobs.content:
As Technical Consultant, you are a customer-focused specialist with a background in software development. You will participate in customer projects where WCC consultants rely on you to perform the technical tasks required for project success. WCC’s Software Platform ELISE is often integrated in large and complex enterprise architecture environments. End user applications and ELISE communicate through Enterprise Service Buses, for which connectors need to be developed. Among other tasks, you will be designing, developing and testing these connectors. 


Responsibilities



  • Analyze and define customer requirements and record these in functional and technical design documents.

  • Plan and estimate implementation efforts.

  • Install, integrate, customize and tune ELISE according to the specifications set by customers and partners.

  • Write user guides and train (technical) users.

  • Identify business opportunities and relay these to the sales team.

  • Execute pre-sales and proof-of-concept assignments.



WCC Smart Search & Match: your place to be!
You'll find our modern, open and attractive office on business park Lage Weide next to highway A2, off exit 6 to Maarssen. It has its own parking area and is easily accessible by car via the A2, the A27 or the N320.


Do you have what it takes?


Convince us by uploading your motivation and resume, in Dutch or English, by using the "Apply now!" button. As soon as we have received your motivation and resume, you'll be informed within two weeks about the procedure. We will not take your application lightly. To get to know you please take into account that there will be several interviews, an assessment as wel as a reference check.


Want to know more?


Call our HR Department via + 31 (0) 30 750 32 000 for answers to your questions or more information about WCC Smart Search & Match, the selection process, the assessment of your role as Technical Consultant.

As Technical Implementation Consultant, you are a customer-focused specialist with a background in software development. You will participate in customer projects where WCC consultants rely on you to perform the technical tasks required for project success. WCC’s software platform ELISE is often integrated in large and complex enterprise architecture environments. End user applications and ELISE communicate through Enterprise Service Buses, for which connectors need to be developed. Among other tasks, you will be designing, developing and testing these connectors. 


Responsibilities

  • Analyzing, estimating, designing, developing and testing customer change requests.

WCC Smart Search & Match: your place to be!
You'll find our modern, open and attractive office on business park Lage Weide next to highway A2, off exit 6 to Maarssen. It has its own parking area and is easily accessible by car via the A2, the A27 or the N320. Only 20 minutes away from Amsterdam!


Do you have what it takes?

Want to know more?


Call our HR Department via + 31 (0) 30 750 32 000 for answers to your questions or more information about WCC Smart Search & Match, the selection process, the assessment of your role as Technical Implementation Consultant.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer to fight terrorism and find people jobs
jobs.content:
Make your mark by building the world’s leading search & match software at a fast-growing organization whose success rests on software development. Combining quality, a clear vision, and doing what you do best to develop groundbreaking software. Handling technical challenges that go hand in hand with the dynamics of the day. In short, just the right setting for an ambitious Senior Java Developer. Sounds like your kind of work environment, right?


As our Senior Java Developer, you will:



  • Use your undisputed technical knowledge and vision to help build our software with your team;

  • Cooperate effectively with the Product Owner to achieve the best results and guarantee optimal quality;

  • Take the lead in coaching your team in the software process, or involve yourself more closely in the architecture;

  • Intelligently translate specific customer requirements into a generic solution.


As Senior Java Developer, you work within a team of experienced Java developers and testers who put quality and joy in technology first. The team collaborates in an open atmosphere where all input is valued.


What’s in it for you?


We offer a challenge-packed position with plenty of room for further development of your talents. You will work with smart and passionate colleagues in an international, innovative, and growing organization. 


WCC Smart Search & Match: your place to be!


You'll find our modern, open, and stylish office at business park Lage Weide next to highway A2, just off exit 6 to Maarssen. It has its own parking area and is easily accessible by car via the A2, the A27, and the N320. And Amsterdam only 20 minutes away.


Do you have what it takes?


Convince us by uploading your motivation and CV in Dutch or English. You will hear back from us within two weeks. We don’t rush into things: we prefer to get to know you properly. We do this through several interviews, an assessment, and a reference check.


Want to know more?


Call our HR department at +31 (0)30 750 32 00 for answers to your questions or more information about WCC Smart Search & Match, the selection process, the assessment, or your role as Senior Java Developer.
