jobs.title: Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Dans le cadre de son programme d’amélioration continue et sa recherche de qualité, Capsule a développé une méthodologie unique basée sur les bonnes pratiques de développement logiciel (SCRUM, XP, TSP / PSP) et l'approche Agile telle que définie par l'industrie médicale.


Pour soutenir notre croissance forte et rapide, nous sommes aujourd'hui à la recherche d'un Senior Software Development Engineer. Rattaché(e) au responsable du développement, vous interviendrez sur le développement de nos logiciels. Dans le respect des normes appliquées au médical, vous étudiez les demandes clients, vous proposez un design technique, vous écrivez le code et sa documentation. Vous travaillez sur les nouvelles fonctionnalités du produit ainsi que sur la maintenance des versions existantes.


Vous développez dans un environnement moderne et flexible qui bénéficie du partenariat Microsoft Gold.


Situé au centre de Paris, vous travaillerez dans un environnement international et multiculturel, avec une atmosphère agréable et conviviale.


Fonctions essentielles


Rôles



  • Construction de solutions techniques à partir de spécifications fonctionnelles

  • Participation aux choix technologiques

  • Développement des solutions logicielles avec leurs tests unitaires

  • Suivi et amélioration des standards et des procédures de développement

  • Intégration et mise au point

  • Rédaction de vos designs logiciels


Equipe et organisation



  • Equipe globale de 25 développeurs

  • Travail en équipe réduite et multidisciplinaire d’environ 8 (« Feature team » composée de 3-4 développeurs, 2-3 testeurs, chef de projet, rédacteur technique)

  • Estimation du temps nécessaire aux différentes phases du développement

  • Suivi hebdomadaire du temps passé vs. temps prévu en utilisant les outils en vigueur


Technologie



  • Environnement Microsoft

    • C#, .Net 4.5, 4.6.2, WPF, WCF

    • C++ 11, C++ COM/DCOM (legacy)

    • TFS2013, Visual Studio 2013, 2015

    • Windows Embedded 7, 10, Windows Server 2016



  • Web / Cloud

    • JQuery, Jasmin, Knockout, Gulp

    • Azure



  • Formations

    • Licences MSDN Enterprise

    • Accès à pluralsight, Lynda, Safaribook online

    • Workshop, Training, Dojo, Hackaton en interne



  • Intégration continue, nightly builds, gestion de branches, tests unitaires

  • Infrastructure virtuelle de test sous HyperV et VirtualBox

  • Méthodologie et outils PSP/TSP (Personal/Team Software Process) et Agile

  • Normes médicales ISO 13485 et IEC62304

Pour soutenir notre croissance forte et rapide, nous sommes aujourd'hui à la recherche d'un Ingénieur Analyste Logiciel Confirmé. Vous allez tester dans un environnement moderne et flexible qui bénéficie du partenariat Microsoft Gold.


Situé au centre de Paris, vous travaillerez dans un environnement international et multiculturel, avec une atmosphère agréable et conviviale.


Fonctions essentielles



  • Concevoir et mettre en place des procédures de test détaillées sur la base des spécifications fonctionnelles et techniques

  • Concevoir et développer des outils de test

  • Exécuter des procédures de test en respectant les standards et procédures internes et vérifier la conformité des résultats obtenus vis-à-vis des résultats attendus

jobs.title: Senior SQL Developer/DBA SQL Server
jobs.content:
Dans le cadre de son programme d’amélioration continue et sa recherche de qualité, Capsule a développé une méthodologie unique basée sur les bonnes pratiques de développement logiciel (SCRUM, XP, TSP / PSP) et l'approche Agile telle que définie par l'industrie médicale.


Pour soutenir notre croissance forte et rapide, nous sommes aujourd'hui à la recherche d'un Senior SQL Developer/DBA SQL Server. Au sein du département Software et rattaché au responsable de l’équipe Operational Services (OpS), vous serez le référent sur les problématiques SQL.


Vous serez en charge de l’exploitation et de l’évolution des bases de données sur nos outils de développement (TFS et SharePoint). En tant qu’interface privilégiée au sein de l’entreprise et afin de gérer au mieux la maintenance des outils de production, vous travaillerez avec les experts et managers des différentes équipes produits (IT, Device Connectivity et Software). La communication et l’esprit d’équipe sont des éléments clés de vos compétences.


En tant que référent, votre expertise sera aussi nécessaire sur les évolutions des bases de données de nos produits (on-premises et dans le cloud Azure) et vous serez donc amené à travailler avec les leads techniques et les développeurs.


Votre position dans l’équipe OpS vous permettra d’être au plus près des activités Cloud. Aussi, vous travaillerez avec notre expert Azure afin d’étendre vos compétences dans cet environnement, afin de pouvoir le seconder et d’assurer la continuité de production.


Fonctions essentielles


Rôles



  • Gestion de l’exploitation des bases de données de production (maintenance, évolution, optimisation, continuité de service)

  • Activité transverse au sein de l’entreprise (Référent SQL)

  • Conseiller les équipes de développement

  • Développer ses compétences Azure

  • Formation sur les bonnes pratiques de base données et SQL en particulier

jobs.title: Senior Database Developer noSQL
jobs.content:
Work in Berlin for one of the world`s largest games websites and excite more than 125 million users.


GameDuell`s IT architecture is based on the SOA paradigm and consists of several loosely linked services that communicate by sending messages to each other. On one hand, the architecture allows a horizontal scaling of databases and services. On the other hand, it offers the highest possible availability and robustness for the user.


As a Senior Database Developer at GameDuell, you will be responsible for our Hadoop/Big Data infrastructure and you will serve as an interface between different teams.


Your Tasks



  • Consolidation and optimization of the current Hadoop/Big Data infrastructure

  • MapReduce Data Aggregation

  • Design and extension of data models

  • Database performance analysis, tuning and monitoring

  • Effectively drive cross-team solutions

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.content:
We are looking for an amazing data scientist to join our team at Red Guava. This doesnât mean you need to have 5+ years experience in the industry, we care much more about skill and passion than credentials.

WHO WE ARE

Red Guava is a small, bootstrapped and profitable software company based in Melbourne, Australia. We love building software and working with talented people.

We build a product called Cliniko (http://www.cliniko.com/). Cliniko makes life easy for Allied Health professionals by handling appointment scheduling, storing treatment notes and a bunch of other things too. It is already used globally by tens of thousands of people every day.

HOW WE WORK

We work smarter, not harder. We think work/life balance is important and we work a 30 hour week as standard (you still get a full-time pay; itâs a full-time position).

Some of us work in our office in Melbourne, but not all (we have team members in the UK, USA, Canada, Poland, Brazil, Portugal, France, Malaysia and New Zealand). We want to hire the best person available, not just the best person within a 10km radius.

If you want to know more about how we work, Joel gave a talk (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o_2jXqzxBNU) recently about it.

WHO YOU ARE

You are a data scientist extraordinaire!

You love data, you love numbers and you're very interested in business. People get annoyed at you because you ask too many questions. You just consider it delightfully inquisitive.

You have strong maths and statistics skills. Even more importantly, common sense and logic are some of your best tools.

Getting answers is one thing, but answers that you can act upon, that's when you get excited.

Here's the tricky bit though, we'd love you to have some engineering skills too! If you can implement your own systems for getting the data, it's going to be better for you and us.

Youâre excited by the opportunity to make a real difference in peoples lives with your work. You want to have fun too!

WHAT YOU'LL WORK ON

Let's be honest, you'll know what you should work on better than we do. Of course we have some ideas on things that might be useful, or we wouldn't be hiring, but ultimately we expect you to know how your time is best spent.

A few things you'll likely be doing are: 

- Using the data in Cliniko help improve the experience for new customers
- Helping existing customers get the most out of Cliniko
- Knowing when things aren't going well for our customers so we can lend a helping hand

A lot of this will probably require building models which can predict outcomes so that we can be more proactive with our support for customers.

You'll also need to be setting up tools that make it easy to get the data. We do not have this currently, so this will be part of your role. We'll help of course!

Ultimately, you'll be helping us make better business decisions, and helping our Cliniko customers do the same.

IN SUMMARY

Letâs be clear, you need to be seriously amazing. We are a small team and we want to keep it that way. We will offer you the best job you have ever had with plenty of perks (we don't list them here, but I promise they are good), however we do expect you to be super-talented.

You should be absolutely passionate about making a difference to our business and to our customers. You should take pride in your work and be excited to measure the benefits from it.

Here's your chance to work on challenging and interesting problems with a bunch of talented people. If this sounds like you, we hope to hear from you soon!

To apply: Details for how to apply can be found here http://www.redguava.com.au/jobs/data_scientist/.

jobs.title: Bilingual Customer Care Representative
jobs.content:
Located in Burlington, Ontario, HostPapa Inc. is one of Canadaâs fastest growing technology companies. Our goal is to provide our customers with the web hosting solutions they need to achieve success, while maintaining our reputation for reliability, security and award-winning customer service.

An innovative, dynamic, and fast-paced environment awaits you as you will handle a large volume of customer support calls and emails regarding related account and technical support issues.

We are seeking Bilingual Customer Care Representatives, English/French and English/German.

__Responsibilities:__

* Provide prompt, effective and courteous first level technical support to existing and potential clients via email, phone, and live chat services
* Input support/customer-related information into tracking software in a timely and accurate manner
* Provide sales information including pricing, plan, and upgrade options
* Use troubleshooting skills to assist clients with technical issues

__Requirements:__

* 1-3 years of web hosting experience
* Demonstrated experience creating websites using various content management systems (WordPress, Joomla, Drupal, etc.)
* Must be fluent in English, French and/or German (written and verbal)
* Excellent email and phone etiquette, with the ability to service clients with issues and/or questions relating to web hosting services
* Reliable, motivated, ability to multi-task, enthusiastic, and able to work independently as well as in a team environment
* A willingness to work shifts outside of regular business hours (weekend, day, evening, and midnight shifts may be required)

__What we offer:__

* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Paid training and continuous learning opportunities
* Excellent team environment
* Possibility to work from home

___PLEASE NO PHONE CALLS OR AGENCIES___

jobs.title: Full Stack .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description:


Join forces with our creative team and help shape the future of the technology stack for our platforms, including web services, task schedules, authentication mechanism, core utility frameworks, security, scalability, auditing, database profiling, block storage management, and performance tracking and monitoring. Collaborate with our CEO, CTO, product engineers, UX designers, and developer team members to define the product roadmap. Oversee agile processes, establish schedules, assign tasks, and enforce coding standards. Do what you do best: develop, test, and debug applications, all with an excellent cup of coffee in hand.


Responsibilities



  • Design and enhance software applications and components by converting project requirements into code through the use of algorithm design, performance tuning, software documentation, debugging, and testing. (20%)

  • Work with various businesses to gather requirements, using flow charts and schematic diagrams to create application development specifications and estimate timelines. Analyze detailed functional specifications and build applications based on standards. (20%)

  • Perform application flow analysis and test data management software and related applications for performance and data integrity on a constant basis, ensuring efficiency and quality assurance. Document design specifications, maintain application configuration standards, and document troubleshooting. (15%)

  • Test applications for unit performance, regression, and user acceptance. Modify existing applications to eliminate errors, simplify interfaces, enhance performance, improve overall reliability, and accommodate dynamic business needs. (15%)

  • Design additional components or more efficient processes to enhance the data flow control system within client’s relation applications. Create rescue data functionality to enable users in offline mode to save data on the server. Implement cross browser functionality for saving client side generated files. (15%)

  • Work closely with other team members, such as project managers and QA engineers to develop applications that add value to our product suite. (15%)

jobs.title: Project Manager, Ads Help and Education
jobs.content:
(Menlo Park, CA)

Facebook’s mission is to give people the power to share, and make the world more open and connected. Through our growing family of apps and services, we’re building a different kind of company that helps billions of people around the world connect and share what matters most to them. Whether we’re creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to make the world more open and accessible. Connecting the world takes every one of us—and we’re just getting started.

The Ads Help and Education team is looking for an experienced project manager with a strong background in web and mobile content to transform the support experience for Facebook advertisers around the world. You will manage projects for a team responsible for creating and managing high quality educational and support content at massive scale for mobile and web users of our Help Center and Facebook for Business website. This role requires strong analytical skills, experience working in a cross-functional team, and an obsession with creating an amazing customer experience through scalable and efficient processes. This role is based in our headquarters in Menlo Park, California.

Responsibilities

  • Engage and build relationships with cross-functional teams and stakeholders (Product, Engineering, Marketing, etc.) to ensure content requirements are implemented and help and education impact is well understood
  • Establish shared goals, clear responsibilities, metrics and feedback loops, and other operating rhythms to foster collaboration and communication within our team and with cross-functional partners
  • Manage end-to-end delivery of projects from requirements, solution design and development, robust testing, identifying and managing risks, monitoring and triaging issues, and ensuring documentation and training
  • Work with product teams across Facebook to ensure content best practices are followed
  • Analyze content workflow issues and provide optimal solutions
  • Review, prioritize, and track progress of issues that affect content relevancy, quality, and functionality
  • Map, monitor, and analyze daily and periodic workflows to scope and drive alignment on solutions to streamline workflows, opportunities for automation, and areas requiring tools enhancement to increase efficiency
  • Manage high profile projects and identify the need for freelance resources when necessary

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years of relevant project management experience
  • Ability to establish shared goals and drive alignment across multiple stakeholders
  • Communication and leadership skills
  • Experience managing budgets and vendors
  • Track record of operating independently, demonstrating creativity, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in an organized manner
  • Experience in project managing the end-to-end delivery of large-scale process redesign, systems implementation, or streamlining processes through automation
  • Ability to stay focused under pressure, prioritizing and managing multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
  • Knowledgeable in Microsoft Office tools and related project/program management applications, such as Asana or Basecamp
  • Knowledgeable of tools and techniques for process improvement (i.e., process mapping, analysis, and redesign)

Preferred Qualifications

  • 2+ years spent working in the internet technology or digital marketing space
  • Experience or knowledge in the production of websites, videos, and other help and educational content
  • Experience with content management systems
  • Experience working with engineering teams
  • Familiarity with data analysis and data mining (e.g., BI tools, SQL)
  • General knowledge of advertising and/or UX
  • Experience using Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and other design packages

jobs.title: (Associate) Account Manager (m/f) for AppLift
jobs.content:
À propos d’AppLift:

Nous sommes ici pour résoudre un problème qui concerne tous les professionnels du marketing mobile: comment acquérir les meilleurs utilisateurs possibles pour leur app, au meilleur prix. En les connectant avec plus d’un milliard d’utilisateurs du monde entier au travers de notre technologie, nous leur permettons d’atteindre leurs objectifs commerciaux.

Vos responsabilités:

  • Vous initiez et développez de fortes et durables relations avec nos partenaires annonceurs
  • Vous surveillez et analysez les résultats des différentes sources de trafic, gèrez nos partenaires annonceurs en conséquence et vous efforcez de constamment débloquer de nouveaux budgets et de nouvelles opportunités
  • Vous créez des rapports de synthèse, des analyses de performance et effectuez des prédictions
  • Vous faites partie intégrale de l’équipe de relations clients et contribuez significativement à son succès ainsi qu’à celui de l’entreprise toute entière
  • Tu organisez des évènements, fournissez des ressources éducationnelles ainsi que du soutien aux partenaires annonceurs en cas de besoin
  • Vous vous tenez au courant des nouvelles du secteur
  • Vous travaillez indépendamment et gèrez vos propres projets dans de divers domaines

Les critères requis:

  • De six à douze mois d’expérience dans l’industrie du mobile ou du digital
  • Une expérience antérieure impliquant un rôle au contact du client
  • De fortes compétences sociales et relationnelles, tu es un bon négociateur
  • Niveau de français, d’anglais et d’allemand courant
  • Personnalité proactive, un team player
  • Compétence en créativité et en résolution de problèmes
  • Une volonté de voyager
  • Ce que nous vous offrons:
  • Rejoignez une entreprise de marketing mobile parmi les plus établies du marché
  • Travaillez avec des professionnels expérimentés et développez votre carrière avec nous
  • Profitez des avantages d’une startup (espace de détente, jeux vidéos, événements, et plus encore) dans une entreprise stable et profitable
  • Faites partie d’une équipe internationale (35+ nationalités) qui crée le marketing mobile de demain
  • Bénéficiez d’un salaire compétitif et d’une évolution professionelle personnalisée

Ce que nous vous offrons:

  • Rejoignez une entreprise de marketing mobile parmi les plus établies du marché
  • Travaillez avec des professionnels expérimentés et développez votre carrière avec nous
  • Profitez des avantages d’une startup (espace de détente, jeux vidéos, événements, et plus encore) dans une entreprise stable et profitable
  • Faites partie d’une équipe internationale (35+ nationalités) qui crée le marketing mobile de demain
  • Bénéficiez d’un salaire compétitif et d’une évolution professionelle personnalisée

Intéressé? Envoyez-nous votre CV (merci de le limiter à 1 page).

jobs.title: Technical lead / Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Our E-commerce tech team is growing and we are currently looking for a senior software engineer who ready for the next step in his career as technical lead for our backend systems. Are you obsessed with quality code, test coverage, green builds, and do you also dream about getting your system towards continuous delivery? Do you want to work in a dynamic and fast-growing E-commerce team? Then we want to hear from you!


As a Senior Backend Engineer / Technical Lead you will be part of our E-commerce department in the center of Amsterdam, where you will be working together with more than 45 dedicated engineers from all over the world. You will play a key role within our Amsterdam office, leading the way to help BESTSELLER e-commerce push quality of the systems to the next level.


In the technology team you will be hands-on coding on your system, defining the technical roadmap with the scrum team and push for the technical initiatives that improve the reliability and agility of our systems. Your opinion will matter and you’ll be part of a strong team of engineers. Together you will make a real impact.


Moreover, your tasks will include:



  • Take system responsibility within your team for quality of the systems, by improving the CI, the quality of the deployment and the agility of the development process

  • Be responsible for create, manage and coordinate technical tickets

  • Building new features into different micro services within our AWS architecture 

  • Conducting code reviews and writing automated tests 

  • Implement Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices 

  • Sharing knowledge with your team members 

  • Fixing bugs and analyze errors using all available information and tools

jobs.title: C/C++ Robot Brain Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Responsibilities


Work with experts developing, iterating and testing robot algorithms, in one or more of these areas:



  • Robot motion planning and control

  • Visual modeling and perception

  • Language understanding

  • Grasp planning

  • Firmware programming for HW/SW systems

  • Other amazing robotics-based challenges!



About you


You are looking for the place to stretch yourself, able to work within a senior, highly performant product team, and aren’t afraid of a challenge.  You are a self-starter with the motivation and skills needed to effectively operate on your own time in your own way while being responsive to the needs of your teammates and the team as a whole.


You love working on the metal and/or deep in low-level or scaled algorithmic code.  You are effective at quickly understanding and operating on algorithms taken from research in AI, Robotics, and Vision, or you have have experience with sensors, motors, and other devices.  You are comfortable working alongside experts in these areas, or are an expert yourself. You have a proven track record of delivering ideas into working prototypes at high velocity.  You have commercial/agile development teaming experience.  You've architected some serious systems and may have even been a team lead.



Flexible Hours & 100% Remote Work


These roles permit flexible working hours and are 100% remote.  You will work in a scrum-based agile development cycle. Whether you prefer contract work or a permanent position, we can accommodate you. You will be working alongside founders, researchers, and engineers to design and build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.

jobs.title: "We're gonna have to JavaScript the shit out of it..."
jobs.content:
Hiring: Junior Front End Javascript Developer with React experience

Howdy! I'm Dave Stevens, Co-founder & CEO of Chartlytics. We're looking for a very passionate full-stack javascript developer to help us build the most powerful behavior measurement platform for accelerating learning outcomes across all of human learning the world has ever seen! Phew... 

Accelerating learning outcomes

Our mission is to help each learner reach their latent potential. With my business partner, Dr. Rick Kubina (Professor of Special Education at Penn State) we are transforming how teachers, analysts, coaches, and trainers understand the effects of their instruction on individuals so they can make more timely decisions to produce accelerated outcomes. 

Remote FTW!

We all work remotely, and so can you! We use slack, github, zoom, to communicate with each other regularly. We're fun, candid and focused on building good software and good solutions. We're bootstrapping the company so there are no VC's or angels to change our business model and force us down paths we'd rather not go. This has it's pros and cons but we're at least in control of our own destiny. If you're looking for free lunches, a built in spa and gym, and a bus to pick you up because you have no where to park your car - we're not for you. :) 

Got Skills?

Ideally you should have: 

  • Strong skills in modern Javascript (ES6/ES7) techniques. 
  • A deep understanding of React, and unidirectional dataflow architectures i.e. flux/redux. 
  • An appreciation of working with open source code.
  • Interest in implementing functional programming techniques. 
  • The ability to create a straightforward user interface 
  • Knowledge of designing schemas (currently using MongoDB, long term looking to switch to PostgreSQL). 
  • Familiarity with node.js for creating restful APIâs. 
  • A strong attention to detailâ¢ An appreciation for maintainability over cleverness 

Node all the things!

 Our stack: 

  • All on AWS 
  • Node.js & Koa 
  • React & Redux 
  • React-Native 
  • Mongo
  • Terraform

We are looking for passionate javascript developers. If you think this - http://demo.chartlytics-stage.com/ - is cool, checkout our blog and facebook to get an idea of who we are and what we exist for. If you like the mission, love the stack, and would like to be involved on the ground floor and meet the qualificaions above we'd love to have you on board. Email me at dave@chartlytics.com.

To apply: Please send samples of recent code along with your Github and LinkedIn profiles to dave@chartlytics.com. Recruiters & Agencies: please DO NOT contact us about this job. All hires at Chartlytics are made by our own team.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Next Jump, we're committed to a culture of growth, challenges, and collaboration - and our engineers are no exception. We hire the best and brightest, then empower them to tackle big problems, own products, and take risks. Together, we're building a data-driven shopping and rewards program for millions of members in PHP, MsSQL, Java, Solr, Go, and more. Next Jump engineers also play a critical role in shaping our corporate culture; we lead initiatives such as an annual Hackathon, Code for a Cause, and NxJ University technical growth. If you have the drive to make a real impact and the technical chops to handle our fast-paced environment, come join us!


Next Jump is looking for full-stack web developers to work in a number of different technical roles. We screen for a wide array of skills from back-end to front-end, as requirements for specific roles vary and you will move from project to project. Being adaptable is a must, and business and problem-solving skills are a big plus. We're looking to get the smartest people on the bus - if we like you, we'll find you a seat!

jobs.title: Visual Sketch Note Taker / Graphic Artist / Sketchnoting
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Raleigh

This is a remote position, however candidates MUST have exceptional oral and written English skills.

This position is NOT full-time, but is a FREELANCE / Project based position.

Project Brief

We week a visual note taker who is highly skilled in taking complex stories around complex services and products and communicating them in visual sketch form.  This style of communication will be used to build a series of story boards that will be used to communicate complex ideas and services into a more powerful, visual picture.

Ideal Candidate

As a visual sketch / note designer you must posses the following: 
  
  • 5+ years working as a sketch artist across a number of complex business concepts.
  • An online portfolio that shows the style and breadth of your work.
  • A proven methodology for working with clients who seek to communicate complex products and services in a visually interesting, compelling, and simple way.
  • A HUGE Plus would be if you can also work in other mediums besides sketch.  For example using Adobe photoshop or Indesign to render more formal sketch designs.
  • Another HUGE Plus would be experience helping craft White Board Explainer Videos.

To apply: brad.murphy@gearstream.com

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
* Support visas but only for the developers who are already in U.S. legally.


* Must have at least 3 years professional experience.


We are looking for a Back-End Java Developer (Java) responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the application. A deep understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.


Responsibilities



  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by a front-end developers with server side logic

  • Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Design and Implementation of security and data protection

  • Design and implementation of data storage solutions and multithreaded Web Application (Java) utilizing web application frameworks

  • Develops applications using dependency injection and configuration driven behaviors

jobs.title: Jboss Middleware Engineer
jobs.content: As a Jboss Middleware Engineer, you will be responsible for installing and configuring middleware software’s like JBOSS, Tomcat, web sphere application server, Apache, Web sphere MQ, and other J2EE software products and fixes on Linux/Windows. You will support the application through its entire development life cycle – involved with Application design, deploying code, resolving any infrastructure problems, production implementation and post production support.  You will work with other teams in the infrastructure department to set up the necessary artifacts for the applications like URL’s (load balancing VIP’s), Firewall rules, requesting necessary file system and storage requirements, for setting up other third party tools like splunk, perceiver, wily and BEM (for monitoring and alerting).  You will maneuver Z/OS to perform basic MQ administrative functionalities like defining queues, channels, setting up batch jobs, read and analyze logs files on the mainframe as well as on the distributed side (in both windows and Linux).  You will support production implementations and be able to troubleshoot and resolve production issues minimizing the customer impact, support application releases, monitor production environment, participate in production problem calls, resolve any problems related to Middleware.

Our applications are undergoing rapid modernization efforts to new technologies, moving to new Cloud infrastructure, and rolling out DevOps processes.  There is no better opportunity to drive impactful changes in a company culture that rewards hard work and results. 


GEICO offers excellent benefits, career advancement in a promote-from-within culture, continual IT training, professional development opportunities, and more. You will be responsible for  performing advanced-level application analysis, design, development, unit testing and implementation activities for production critical .NET applications. You will be working in dynamic project teams with project managers, analysts and other developers to deliver first-class software that solves real business problems. You will be providing input and feedback to others on topics of architecture design, code quality, and business solutions. Also, you will be supporting other .Net developers with advice and coaching.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
There is this magical recent invention called the "video game." It's really fun. Kids spend hours playing these things. Really!

There's this terribly boring historical artifact called "the textbook" which hasn't been updated since Prussia was still a thing. It's still the way teachers cram knowledge into little kids. Barbaric.

We're combining the two to get those kiddos learning better. We ran a real academic study with the good folks at Vanderbilt to see if our prototype would work. It did. Awesomely.

We've assembled the equivalent of the A-Team to turn this into a billion dollar company. We're tired of building $50 and $60 million dollar companies (that's what our last two companies we started turned into*).

Company is funded. Software development with React, Relay, GraphQL, Postgres, and AWS is underway and rolling.

One problem: Too many awesome features to build, not quite enough developers. We need another
A-Team developer help us get to launch and beyond!

Help us solve this problem and you get a competitive salary (90-120K) and a bunch of equity. Also, we get to revolutionize education together.


*Seriously

jobs.title: Software Architect Team Lead
jobs.content:
The Mission: Safe Food for Everyone!



Sample6 is making food safer by delivering two powerful tools to the food industry, Sample6 DETECTÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ and Sample6 CONTROLÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢. Sample6 DETECTÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ is an enrichment-free, on-site, in-shift pathogen diagnostic. This transformative detection technology is paired with a powerful software suite called CONTROLÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢. Together the two enable our customers to evolve their food safety practices from reactive to preventive!



After a recent $12.5m round of funding, Sample6 is well positioned to provide this necessary next-generation of products and services to food processors regardless of segment. Meat, seafood, dairy, produce, and dry goods processors have already partnered with Sample6 in order to integrate these revolutionary products into their plants. Join us in the drive to protect the public by making food safer!



Position:  Software Architect/Team Lead



We are looking for a talented, highly motivated person to lead the development of our CONTROL software application. You will report to our CEO and work in concert with our VP of Software & Customer Success to deliver a transformative product that owns the market. You will be a part of Sample6's management team, working closely with the company's senior executives..



Position details:



The Software Architect will be a champion for the introduction of health and safety data management into food production. He/she will take a hands-on approach and will be responsible for:




  • Leading an agile SW development environment that facilitates innovative software delivery while actively participating in sprint planning, backlog prioritization, daily stand-ups

  • Driving the SW architecture to deliver a solution that is robust and scalable, and agile enough to handle a growing list of feature/functionality requests

  • Guiding the design of user interfaces that are intuitive, easy to use and mindful of the target end-user's expectation

  • Managing the current CONTROL development team which today is an off-shore team of developers/QA

  • Building a team in-house that is well balanced to meet both SW creation and support requirements

  • Working with Sales/Customer Success to map market requirements/competitive considerations to solution designs that strike the right balance between cutting-edge technical excellence, robustness and time-to-market requirements

  • Demonstrating proficiency in tracking projects, keeping them on schedule and meeting all product release requirements/deadlines



SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS:




  • B.S degree in a technical discipline (preferably computer science) or equivalent experience

  • 5-10 yrs. years' software development experience, with technical development management experience

  • Ability to code 50%+ of the time.  (Groovy, Grails, Java, Javascript/Coffeescript frameworks a plus)

  • Expertise in agile software development

  • ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂªProven ability in delivering on-time SW products of high quality

  • Take ownership of the codebase/product technologies and make it yours

  • Experience working with mobile devices and other hardware devices a plus.

  • Excellent Communication and customer-facing skills



Benefits



The people we hire form the company we become and determine the goals we can accomplish. We hire GREAT PEOPLE who are smart, ambitious, hardworking and dedicated.



In addition to providing a comfortable work environment, we offer an array of benefits which include but are not limited to the following: competitive salaries, a 401K plan, generous vacation time, equity for qualified hires, parking and commuter benefits and, most of all, an outstanding opportunity to develop your career.

jobs.title: Software Engineer- E-Commerce
jobs.content:
POSITION OVERVIEW: 


Bloomberg BNA, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Bloomberg provides legal, tax and compliance professionals with critical information, practical guidance and workflow solutions.  We leverage leading technology and a global network of experts to deliver a unique combination of news and authoritative analysis, comprehensive research solutions, innovative practice tools, and proprietary business data and analytics.  Bloomberg BNA is wholly owned by Bloomberg L.P., the global business, financial information and news leader. 


Bloomberg BNA seeks a Software Engineer – E-Commerce to design, develop, and support object-oriented programming geared towards re-use of pre-existing and vendor-supplied code in a multi-vendor environment. Simplify the overall use of the system for both end-users and developers while ensuring functionality on all Bloomberg BNA platforms.
RESPONSIBILITIES:  Design, develop, and support object-oriented software in a multi-vendor environment; analyze software requirements in order to integrate and simplify highly complex computer software programs and scripts while ensuring functionality on all BBNA platforms; perform software integration activities to support applications and classes from multiple vendors; create, maintain, support, and enhance end-user tools and interfaces to improve workflows and productivity; provide user-support and troubleshoot problems; help systems analysts and software engineers to develop software designs and specifications; develop estimates and schedules for assignments; follow, and enhance when necessary, BBNA’s software engineering standards and procedures; maintain knowledge of programming languages, principles, and procedures; participate in special projects; and perform other duties as assigned.

jobs.content:

The Web Application Architect is responsible for business analysis, application design, development, integration and delivery and application maintenance and support.   • Participate in recruiting, hiring, onboarding and performance management of new team members.

  • Participate in special projects and perform other duties as assigned.

jobs.title: Back-end Industrial IoT Developer
jobs.content:
Founded in 2015 at MIT, our goal is to change the way people interface with the equipment they work with every day. Our platform keeps our customers’ equipment data secure, allows them to seamlessly exchange information with their partners, and provides end-to-end visibility across the equipment they manage.


In this position, you will lead the team’s back-end development efforts: designing and implementing new capabilities into the platform at the helm of a small and very talented MIT-trained engineering team. The solutions you build will collect, store, and analyze billions of streaming sensor readings from high value industrial equipment—everything from large power transformers to reverse osmosis systems.

jobs.title: iOS Developer Intern
jobs.content:
About the Role


We’re looking for a talented iOS Developer Intern to join our growing Brooklyn-based mobile development agency. You’ll work with our Clients, Designers, Project Managers, and other Developers to create cutting-edge codebases for our clients’ diverse native mobile applications. You’ll also provide support for our clients’ live applications by coding minor updates and troubleshooting bugs.


It's an opportunity to get real experience working in a professional production environment alongside link-minded peers. The schedule is flexible and can be either part-time or full-time based on the candidate's needs. The position is also eligible for promotion to our entry-level Jr. iOS Developer upon successful completion of a three-month performance review and graduation in the case of college students.


Working at AppPartner


Fact is, the kind of people who work at AppPartner could work just about anywhere. They’re smart. They’re creative. They’re fun. They’re engaged. And they take a ridiculous amount of pride in doing what needs to be done to make sure our clients get what they need, when they need it. So why do they choose to work at AppPartner? Simple. Because we get it.


We get that most people want to work in a great office in a vibrant neighborhood like Brooklyn – not some office park in suburbia. We get that work needs to be fun, vibrant and exciting – but never distracting. We get that transparency, communication and opportunities for growth matter. A lot. And that free snacks don’t hurt, either. We get that work is a big part of your life, but it’s not your whole life. And we get that smart, creative people want to be around other smart, creative people. Think you have what it takes? Apply and let’s talk.


Responsibilities:



  • Create, modify, and test high-quality code

  • Work from specifications drawn up by our Support Director or Head of Development

  • Collaborate closely with project managers, designers, developers, and strategists

  • Take ownership of the projects you’re assigned


Key Qualifications:



  • Knowledge of Objective-C, XCode, iOS SDK, & iOS Tools.

  • Familiarity with standard tools such as SVN or Git.

  • Ability to effectively communicate challenges and issues both verbally and written.

  • Ability to pro-actively manage your time to ensure you’re maximizing your productivity for our clients


Bonus Qualifications:



  • Familiarity with SQL databases

  • Familiarity or experience with Swift

  • Familiarity with integrating 3rd party libraries such as the Facebook SDK

  • Experience as a developer in an agile environment

  • Experience as a developer on a shipped mobile application

  • Experience with other platforms such as Android

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer(C++/Android) Mobile SDK´s
jobs.content:
We are searching for a Senior Software Engineer (C++/Android) to join our “HERE Mobile SDKs for Business”-Team in Berlin



What we do


 The HERE Mobile SDKs provide a set of programming interfaces that enable developers to build immersive native applications while leveraging a powerful and flexible mapping platform. Features such as routing to a destination, searching a global places database and manipulating an interactive map are just some of the many available for integration into mobile applications. While leveraging a sophisticated engine for rendering map data and route calculation, the HERE Mobile SDKs also support offline mapping through the use of previously cached map data or previously downloaded map packages.


The HERE Mobile SDKs come with various features and functionalities meant to help customers build an enhanced and personalized experience to end-users. For those applications meant to support core business processes such as field management, telematics and field force optimization, our Mobile SDKs provide a unique set of enterprise features (e.g. truck routing, fleet map, historical traffic patterns, congestion zone map) tailored for specific business environments. When a more personalized consumer location experience is desired, our Mobile SDKs offer a multitude of functionalities (e.g. pedestrian routing, venue maps), which enable an easy transformation of daily routine tasks into everyday adventures.


You can get more information about our mobile SDK offerings on our developer portal at: https://developer.here.com/develop/mobile-sdks


To make all of that happen, and deliver the best quality in the market, we are growing our engineering team in Berlin and are searching for an excellent C++ developer with Android background!


What you’ll be doing



  • You will be a key member of our growing Mobile SDK engineering team in Berlin. This is an experienced position that requires fluency in the latest C++ and Android standards. 



  • You are motivated to explore and deliver the best possible solutions to our customers with very high quality. You should have a strong passion for technology and a strong customer-centric product sense. You should enjoy working outside the comfort zone and love to learn new technologies.



  • You will work on our C++ core and Android APIs of the SDK, that enables all features of the HERE location platform for the mobile platforms. 



  • You will help to put new features into the HERE location platform together with the corresponding development teams and will drive the MobileSDK requirements end to end.



  • Work will be done in a team with other engineers, designers and usability experts and in close collaboration with engineers of the location platform.



The position will be based in Berlin and will report to the Technical Lead of the Mobile SKDs for Business, HERE Platform for Business

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
This is your chance to join the team in Berlin that builds & delivers the HERE WeGo App for Android. We invested in creating a highly automated App delivery pipeline and are pushing further to automate all the testing and release steps. We ship the App every 2 weeks and want to do that even more often. You can help us out taking automation to the next level while working directly with the development team.


The HERE Wego App is one of the top mapping and mobility apps with millions of active users and 4+ star rating. Have a look at the details on our site and in the Play Store: https://here.com/app


For a detailed look at how we deliver the CI/CD for Mobile, have a look at this talk we recently held at the Berlin DevOps meetup:


http://www.slideshare.net/stefanverhoeff/cicd-for-mobile-at-here  


 Key Responsibilities



  • Develop and improve the automated build, testing and release system

  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex software integration issues with the development team

  • Work directly with the development teams on designing and building the next steps in automation

  • Learn and share knowledge in the Consumer DevOps team that works on Android, iOS and Web platforms

jobs.title: Early Morning News Producer (7300)
jobs.content:
Make your mark in Broadcasting and Digital Media. Sinclair Broadcast Group and Sinclair Digital Solutions are dedicated to making Sinclair a communications powerhouse! We are the largest and most diversified television broadcasting company in the country. Sinclair owns and operates, programs or provides services to more television stations than anyone and has affiliations with all major networks. Sinclair Digital group is focused on bringing the most engaging content to web, mobile and over-the-top broadcasting to audiences all over the country! Our success is the result of extraordinary employees and an exemplary management team who believe in a vision and are dedicated to ensuring a great future for our employees. Whether you are an industry veteran or just starting out, you can find it at Sinclair! We are advancing the world of Broadcasting and we want YOU to join our winning team!

KUTV the CBS affiliate in Salt Lake City has an excellent full-time opportunity for an Early Morning News Producer to join our winning news team!

The ideal candidate will have solid news judgment, be a compelling and accurate writer and be able to multitask and manage their time in order to put together an exciting and informative newscast.

Required Skills

The candidate must have news producing experience at a commercial TV station. The candidate must also have strong leadership skills, excellent communication skills, and the ability to execute news strategies and goals in daily newscasts. Flexibility and on-the-spot problems solving abilities are a must. Journalism degree preferred as well as experience:

  • Determining the content and flow of newscasts
  • Writing stories with relentless attention to detail
  • Use of graphics creatively and effectively
  • Producing content for multiple platforms, including TV, internet, mobile, etc.
  • Working with management and reporters to generate stories
  • Staying informed of current events
  • Meeting daily deadlines in a high energy working environment
  • Other responsibilities as assigned

Qualifications:

  • Experience in producing and boothing live newscasts
  • BA in Journalism or a related field
  • Knowledge in INews and Avid NewsCutter XP technology is not required, but is a definite plus!!

When applying online, please include a recent web link of your work. If you do not have a link to your work, please apply online and then send a non-returnable DVD of a recent newscast to:

KUTV

Attn: News Director

299 S. Main St. Suite 150Salt Lake City, Utah 84111Please, no phone calls.

Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free Workplace!

Required Experience

jobs.content:
We're a small team, building big things! We're focused on building two web apps, serving two unique needs with a common goal - make advertising not suck.


Our tech stack:

As the VP of Engineering at AdMass, you will:

  • Spend at least 70% of your time coding and 30% managing, hiring, and planning

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you desire to work in a fast pace, team-oriented, results driven environment who continues to implement the latest technologies?  Are you looking for a company that wants to hear your opinions on how to solve tough technological problems and will give you the latitude to try new things?  Does the idea of working for a high growth organization that values their employees appeal to you?  Have you worked in a heavy open source environment?   If so you will want to look at this new opportunity with Stansberry Research that is a result of their growth and dedication to the latest technologies.


Stansberry Research is a high-growth, independent, subscription-based publisher of financial information that is dedicated to helping millions of people around the world become better investors and we are seeking a DevOps Engineer with strong experience with AWS.  The DevOps Engineer will be an integral part of our technology team working alongside some of the most talented group of people in the industry.  In this role you will help define, implement and maintain the standards for deployment, processes, and standard protocols in a cloud environment. 





Responsibilities






  • Stay current with Amazon Web Services, Common Cloud Operations and Development Operation practices and how these systems can be efficiently used at Stansberry Research

  • Full product lifecycle in AWS including architecting the IaaS landscape, monitoring, securing and supporting environments

  • Partner with various business stakeholders and technology leaders to translate program requirements into scalable technical solutions and system designs

  • Collaborate with other members of the development operations team, to evaluate solutions and gain consensus on technical solutions

  • Research, design, test, and evaluate new technologies, platforms and third party products

  • Facilitate planning for production implementation of solutions

  • Ensure alignment of solutions with Enterprise Architecture principles and guidelines

  • Socialize information on technology trends and products

  • Develop documentation and standards for the architecture and security landscape

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content: Join one of biotech's most successful companies to create world-class software with the best and brightest in the industry. Illumina is looking for talented, motivated software engineers to join the instrument control software team.  You’ll be writing software that powers the pumps, lasers, motors, imaging systems, analysis engines, and user interface on Illumina’s instruments.  This role will collaborate with cross-functional teams that are ultimately responsible to expand and enhance our genome sequencing platforms.

jobs.title: Technical Architect
jobs.content:
An exciting new position has come up within the MMG – Product Development Team. We’re looking for a Technical Architect, based in Central London and offered on a permanent basis. The successful candidate will be responsible for working closely with our chief architect our tech leads, delivery teams and business stakeholders to produce high quality solutions to our business demands. You will identify and translate business requirements into a viable solution. Defining the architecture and making trade-off considerations to also ensure technical solutions are selected according to a clear view of the business requirements and constraints.


This role has a hands-on technical aspect and although you’re not required to write code you’ll benefit from having strong technical development background. We are open to high performing Senior Developers looking to make the move into architecture although experience working as an architect will count on your favour.


Specific tasks include (but are not limited to!):



  • Designing scalable, robust, secure, maintainable and cost-effective solutions.

  • Identifying and managing risks (technical or otherwise).

  • Selecting 3rd party providers (databases, message brokers, other SaaS, infrastructure).

  • Maintaining our technical documentation and highlighting architectural debt.

  • Defining standards, policies and design principles.



Skills & Requirements




  • Experience in designing and implementing SOA.

  • Experience developing and designing services using REST / RPC / MoM (ZeroMQ, AMQP, JMS).

  • Experience with Internet architectures including DNS, load balancers, proxies, caches, browser behaviour, HTTP, TLS.

  • Previous experience designing and developing CMS and content delivery systems.

  • Experience working in Agile Kanban/Scrum/TDD environments where architecture and design is part of the team’s daily jobs.

  • Capable of working out solutions while enumerating approaches and doing trade-off analysis to select a suitable one.

  • Capable of presenting a solution in different level of detail to different audiences: High-level architecture, Service/Component diagrams, Sequence diagrams, State diagrams.

  • Capable of selecting SaaS/off-the-shelf/open source services, tools, languages, frameworks to avoid re-implementing too much in-house

  • Experience with public cloud providers such as AWS.

  • Understanding of networks and operating systems that allows for designing distributed service oriented solutions.

  • Experience working with Relational and NoSQL/Document-based data stores.

  • Experience implementing solutions with open source or commercial search engines.

  • Experience implementing micro-service oriented solutions.



People skills



  • Excellent leadership and management skills.

  • Good written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Communicate directly and effectively with developers and other stakeholders.

jobs.title: Big Data Technical Lead
jobs.content:
Cars.com is seeking an experienced Hadoop/Big Data Technical Lead to join our organization in providing leadership for the overall, design, development and deployment of a Hadoop based platform. Developing conceptual, logical and physical target-state architecture, engineering and operational specs for Big Data solutions across all lines of businesses by effectively applying software engineering principles, patterns and best practices.   The candidate will collaborate with business users and application teams across the Cars.com organization to build consensus and to promote adoption of Big Data solutions effectively. Additionally, provides technology insight and expertise on industry trends


The ideal candidate will be able to:




    • Utilize and mentor developers in Big Data Technologies such as Hadoop and Spark, Kafka and In-memory applications using Java, SQL, Pig, Hive, Impala, Scala, based on the concepts of Lamda architecture





    • Function as a hands-on team Technical Leader that provides day to day direction and solutions to achieving set goals. Analyze multiple sources of structured and unstructured data to propose and design data architecture solutions for scalability, high availability, fault tolerance, and elasticity.





    • Understand business taxonomy and provide data analysis, design, modeling, and implementation leadership to project teams, database development group(s), IT, and the enterprise and ensure that analytical solutions are aligned with our architectural direction.





    • Develop conceptual, logical and physical design for various data types and large volumes.





    • Architect, design and implement high performance, large volume data integration processes, database, storage, and other back-end services





    • Implement security, encryption best practices for big data environments.





    • Create and maintain data flow diagrams, entity relationship diagrams, system diagrams, business and logical systems integration as it pertains to Analytics/Business Intelligence and big data systems.





    • Find and implement solutions to integrate event-based, semi-structured and 3rd party data sources (e.g. E-commerce transaction data) with enterprise relational models and strategies for transactional and analytical systems to effectively share data.

    • Partner with our Enterprise Architecture team to ensure that the defined architectures align with other architecture domains (e.g. infrastructure, EDW, security, etc).

jobs.title: Digital Business & Ecosystems Developer | ZEISS Unit Digital Innovation Partners
jobs.content:
The Digital Innovation Partners unit is being set up at ZEISS to realize cutting-edge digital solutions. Jointly with the ZEISS business groups, we develop and implement digital solutions @speed and @scale. Based in Munich we are driven by creativity and a strong desire to shape the digital future of ZEISS.





Your role at ZEISS Digital Innovation Partners:


You will play a crucial role in setting up our new Digital Innovation Partners unit and actively contribute to the success of the digital transformation at ZEISS. In this challenging function, you will hunt for new business ideas to transform ZEISS. By quickly assessing these opportunities we focus investments on the most promising big ideas. You build an internal and external network to actively fill our project funnel for business innovations. While working closely together with our Design & Analytics as well as Architecture & Engineering functions at the Digital Innovation Partners and the ZEISS Business Groups, you shape these ideas from inception to launch. You lead projects to confirm strategic and economic viability and define the cornerstones of scalable digital systems to provide a distinctively more efficient and better customer experience. With your fellow digital business developers, you build our capability to stay on top of digital innovation and make sure that portfolio decisions are made in the interest of ZEISS and are measured by its business impact in critical metrics.

Take responsibility and shape the future of ZEISS!

jobs.title: Content Writer and Community Champion
jobs.content:
The Organic Academy helps people learn to grow organic food. Growers join our friendly online community and build their skills with courses that take them by the hand through the gardening year.

Is this you?

  • Experienced organic grower
  • Love writing
  • Divide your time between being in the garden and online where you contribute to gardening blogs and forums

We'd like help with:

  • Writing courses about organic growing
  • Writing blog posts about organic growing
  • Helping growers on our community forum
  • Being active on social media

Things you should probably have:

  • A garden or allotment where you grow some organic fruit and veg
  • A quiet place with good internet access and a computer where you can work for several hours a day
  • An active blog or website about gardening or an active presence on a forum, online community or social media
  • Confidence at communicating with people online using forums, email and chat (e.g. Slack)
  • Excellent written English skills
  • Ability to type reasonably quickly (at least 30wpm in a test like this: http://www.ratatype.com/typing-test/)
  • Experience taking photos and uploading to the web
  • Definitely not necessary, but bonus points if you have experience making videos

Initially we will contract you for three months from the beginning of January 2017. We're looking for a commitment of about 20-30 hours per week spread over four or five days. Salary dependent on experience.

If we work well together, we'd love to make this a long-term position. You will be a core member of the team at an early stage of the company. The ideal person will be excited about what we're creating. You'll be able to contribute ideas and be involved in decision making about the future of the business.

Location

You can be located anywhere in the Northern Hemisphere. We would prefer someone living in a region with climatic conditions similar to the UK, or US climate zones 5 to 7.

To apply: Send an email to jobs@theorganicacademy.com and include:(1) A summary of your organic growing experience (2) Links to your writing online (can be a blog, website, forum posts etc) (3) In no more than 150 words tell us about a gardening experience that inspired you

jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Type: Permanent
Suitable background: End of studies - graduated
Working hours: 37.5 h / week
Beginning day: As soon as possible (negotiable)
Location: Helsinki
Application DL: 10.1.2017


Headquartered in Helsinki, Frosmo employs more than 100 people from almost 40 countries. We currently have offices in Helsinki, Stockholm, London, Warsaw, Barcelona, Singapore, Istanbul and are opening several new locations within the next year.
We build success stories through the fast and flexible Frosmo single tag based UI development method. Our customers are large companies in eCommerce, travel, banking & finance, media, etc, wanting to create winning User Experiences online. Every day, the Frosmo tags are called upon 1,5 billion times.


Living up to the Best Exponential Startup title, Frosmo is growing fast and seeking talented people to join our international team!


We are looking for you, who know how modern browsers work, how the JavaScript environment works, what common libraries do, and what you can do with them. You have solid experience combined with a theoretical background and you are aware what is happening with JavaScript and browser technology at the current moment.

You know how to put all this together with your own elegant but understandable software design.
You also are aware that JavaScript itself is evolving, and are ready to take that next step in your personal development to master all that is available. Lucky for you, this is possible at Frosmo.


Welcome to join our pack of Frosmonauts, we assure you it will be fun and challenging! Find out more about us here: http://frosmo.com/en/infographics

Required:
• 4-5 years professional experience developing web applications with JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Git
• 2 years of experience with PHP
• Strong DOM (Document Object Model) and browser behavior knowledge
• SQL database
• VanillaJS, Jasmine, PhantomJS, MustacheJS and JQuery
• Promises, functional programming, object-oriented programming, closures
• Fluent in English

Preferred skills:
• Python
• Bash scripting
• CI environment experience
• API documentation
• Test-driven development

We offer:
• Diverse and challenging projects: you’ll never be bored again!
• Brilliant cohesive team spirit, likely the best place to learn you will find
• Location in the heart of Helsinki (we can see the main train station from our window)
• Competitive salary with excellent benefits
If this sounds like you, please send your CV and application letter preferably in PDF-format by latest 10th of January here: https://apply.atalent.fi/frosmo-senior-javascript-developer-12-2016.


For further information about the role or the application process, please contact Anna Oikarinen (anna.oikarinen@atalent.fi, 050 4155345).

jobs.title: TYPO3 / PHP Developer
jobs.content:
audibene is an award winning health tech start-up which has grown massively over the last years and is now present in 10 countries and employs over 500 people. Our team is working towards building cutting edge technology that will reshape the hearing care industry and improve the quality of life of many people across the globe. audibene has its headquarters in Berlin, Germany with offices in Miami, Toronto, Kuala Lumpur, Bern, Seoul etc. Join us as we are working towards revolutionizing the hearing aid industry!


We are looking for a TYPO3 / PHP Developer (m/f) to join our experienced cross functional team based in Berlin


About the role:


We have an experienced and international engineering team and we are building web applications to server the global market using TYPO3 inside a micro-service landscape. We are working with industry best practices and test driven development and looking towards continuous integration. As a TYPO3-Engineer you will maintain and create new features for our global websites and micro-services. As we are currently building up our teams for new ambitious projects, you will be able to support in shaping and designing the service landscape and contribute to develop our platforms.


Your core tasks:



  • Programming, development and improvement of all global websites

  • Implementation of custom designs and extensions

  • Administration and Optimization of existing projects and extensions

  • Application Development in PHP7 (micro-services)


Your Profile:



  • You successfully completed your degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related field, or having shown an equivalent qualification through previous work experience

  • You have strong experiences in programming with TYPO3, PHP and current frontend technologies. CSS3 and HTML5 is a common language for you

  • You have a deep understanding of OOP and how to implement SOLID conform software

  • You know how to write good and meaningful unit-tests

  • You know what POST and PUT means and know how to create APIs with this knowledge

  • Working with git, vagrant and shell is fun for you

  • You feel comfortable in very international environment

  • You have great communication skills and working team oriented is one of your best skills


Our Perks:



  • Attractive remuneration and well-equipped working place in a modern loft office in the heart of Berlin

  • A friendly open-minded team fostering a culture of continuous exchange that will support you in your professional development

  • Flexible working hours

  • Drinks & coffee, snacks, fruits and games for free

  • Parties and regular team events

  • Opportunity to attend and speak at conferences 


This is a full-time position based in Berlin. We are seeking enthusiastic and motivated team-members who are looking to fast-track their career. If you want to be part of a young, dynamic and fast growing company, a new challenge awaits you. We’re looking forward to receiving your application including your soonest start date and salary expectation.


Why Audibene:


We innovate and shape the technologies of hearing aid devices and improve the quality of life of millions across the globe. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way a traditional industry works.


We are tech geeks and we celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation.


We are doers!

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer (Remote)
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Our company is growing! We're looking for an awesome full-stack senior developer to work on PayrollPanda - Malaysia's fastest growing cloud Payroll app. It's an exciting time to join a proven group of entrepreneurs and developers. Get a share in a start-up and awesome benefits.

REQUIREMENTS

  1. At least 5 years of commercial development experience or you're some kind of genius coder straight out of university.
  2. Extensive experience with web development technologies including Javascript frameworks (preferably Backbone), NodeJS, MongoDB,
  3. Agile (Kanban) software development

BENEFITS

  1. REMOTE working - literally work anywhere in the world but our only requirement is that you work at least 6 daily hours within Malaysia working times, 9am to 6pm and have fast Internet access. If you live further west of Eastern Europe or West of Australia it probably won't be suitable for you.
  2. Work only 35 working hours. Many of us have burnt out before and we want to prevent it happening again to any of our team.

jobs.title: C# .NET Utvecklare
jobs.content:
Toyota Material Handling har som mål att utveckla världsledande produkter för lagerhantering.  
Marknadens bästa kvalitet och kostnadsoptimerade produkter är en förutsättning för Toyotas fortsatta framgång på en hårt konkurrensutsatt marknad. Vi gör därför en kraftfull satsning inom Produktutveckling och söker nu C# .NET Utvecklare  för trucknära applikationer


 DIN UTMANING


Som C# .NET-utvecklare på Toyota kommer du att arbeta med utveckling av trucknära applikationsmjukvara som exempelvis Sevice- och underhållsverktyg för våra produkter.  Utvecklingen sker i huvudsak i C# .NET.


Tillsammans med övriga funktioner på utvecklingsavdelningen och med företagets övriga funktioner inom provning, produktion och servicemarknad kommer Du  att ta fram de mest innovativa och kostnadsoptimerade systemlösningarna på marknaden.


VÅRT ERBJUDANDE


Toyota Material Handling erbjuder dig en nyckelroll i vårt utvecklingsteam med möjlighet att jobba med innovation och optimering på marknadens ledande produkter.  Är du intresserad av ett arbete där du får jobba i en kreativ miljö, riktigt nära slutprodukten och ha en stort inflytande på dess funktion, prestanda och deras framtida utveckling? Då är detta nästa steg för dig i din karriär som ingenjör.  


Sista ansökningsdag är 15 januari 2017. Ansök redan idag då vi tillämpar löpande urval. 


För ytterligare information om tjänsterna, kontakta gärna:



  • Patrick Blomqvist, Gruppchef Elektronik, tel 0142-86575

  • Jonathan Strömgren, HR Business Partner, tel 0142-86617

jobs.title: Project Leader
jobs.content:
The Digital Innovation Partners unit is being set up at ZEISS to realize cutting-edge digital solutions. Jointly with the ZEISS business groups, we develop and implement digital solutions @speed and @scale. Based in Munich we are driven by creativity and a strong desire to shape the digital future of ZEISS. 


Your role at ZEISS Digital Innovation Partners:


You will play a crucial role in setting up our new Digital Innovation Partners unit and actively contribute to the success of the digital transformation at ZEISS. In this challenging function, you are responsible for the development of our digital systems (MVP, preto- and prototype) providing a distinctly more efficient and better customer experience. You will drive implementation planning, cost assessment and the definition of the development process. Your core responsibility is to ensure cost and agility targets are met. You will deal with large complex projects and act as a project leader for key components of innovative big impact projects. In this context you work closely and in an agile manner with the Digital Business function as well as the Design & Analytics function of the Digital Innovation Partners and also the ZEISS business groups. The business groups will finally be responsible for implementing the digital solutions at scale.

Take responsibility for relevant and sizeable projects and shape the future of ZEISS!

The Digital Innovation Partners unit is being set up at ZEISS to realize cutting-edge digital solutions. Jointly with the ZEISS business groups we develop and implement digital solutions @speed and @scale. Based in Munich we are driven by creativity and a strong desire to shape the digital future of ZEISS.

jobs.title: Experience Designer
jobs.content:
The Digital Innovation Partners unit is being set up at ZEISS to realize cutting-edge digital solutions. Jointly with the ZEISS business groups we develop and implement digital solutions @speed and @scale. Based in Munich we are driven by creativity and a strong desire to shape the digital future of ZEISS. 


Your role at ZEISS Digital Innovation Partners:


You will play a crucial role in setting up our new Digital Innovation Partners unit and actively contribute to the success of the digital transformation at ZEISS. In this challenging function, you will be responsible for the user-centered experience design and interaction design for new digital solutions based on our customer's job-to-be-done. Your initial focus will be the experience design for unique digital products, services and systems. Leveraging intensive customer interactions, you surface our customers' needs and current pain points. Additionally, you are responsible for analyzing ongoing customer journeys, indicating crucial interaction moments and touchpoints. You will also outline the needs and challenges of the stakeholder ecosystem, design target user journeys and details of the user touchpoints. As an Experience Designer, you craft artifacts or images to create tangible opportunities for multiple audiences. The moderation of Design Thinking workshops and the encouragement of new ideas are essential to be successful in this role.

Take over responsibility for important projects and shape the future of ZEISS!

jobs.title: Data Scientist - Business Analytics
jobs.content:
Your role at ZEISS Digital Innovation Partners:


You will be responsible for supporting new business model design activities and business process re-engineering initiatives by identifying business value and/or emerging issues through mining, analyzing and monitoring relevant internal and external data. You act as an expert in translating complex data into key business insights and actionable findings. You create and run diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive data models. Being part of our Design & Analytics team, you identify and develop business narratives told by the data and present them to other scientists, business partners and functional managers at various levels to address specific business opportunities. You will build dashboards, visualizations and/or other advanced analytics reports to comprehensively tell the business narrative and offer recommendations that are actionable and impactful. You run the exploration of use cases for innovative new data-driven business services, including pulling data and research until the final handover to subsequent business stakeholders. Furthermore, you are responsible to develop and test heuristics pertaining to business process challenges such as demand planning, inventory optimization, contractor utilization, spend analysis and transactional automation.

Take responsibility for important projects and shape the future of ZEISS!

jobs.title: Utvecklare
jobs.content:
Vi söker fler utvecklare. 


Har du ett genuint intresse av internet? Drivs du av att hela tiden lära dig nytt, gräva ner dig i nya tekniker, testa och utvärdera? Utvecklar du egna tjänster utifrån dina intressen, plugins du tycker saknas eller andra bra att ha grejer hemifrån vardagsrummet? Då låter du perfekt.


Vill du dessutom jobba med banbrytande digitala tjänster och mobil spetsutveckling? Då kanske du är personen vi söker. 


Jobbet


Som utvecklare på Adeprimo jobbar du med utveckling av Sveriges bästa digitala tjänster, mobilapplikationer och webbplatser inom framförallt media, turism och handel.


Du ingår i ett kreativt team med andra utvecklare, creative director, art director, copywriter, interaktionsdesigner och projektledare. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med ditt team och kund vid kravställning, konceptutveckling, utveckling och kreativ förvaltning.


Vi förväntar oss att du drivs av att skapa användarvänliga tjänster, som verkligen skapar nytta. Att du älskar det du gör och ser utveckling som mer än ett jobb. Och att du har ett personligt intresse av internet och utveckling inom webb, mobil och sociala medier.


Vi gillar helt enkelt att lära oss nya saker och räknar med att du är likadan. Vår labbverksamhet är därför en del av vardagen och ger oss utrymme att leka och att växa.


Kreerar, dricker du kaffe och spelar pingis gör du på vårt fantastiska huvudkontor i Östersund med 30-talet kollegor. Vill du hellre jobba från kontoret i Vasa i Finland så går det givetvis utmärkt.

jobs.title: .NET developer
jobs.content:
As a system developer focusing on .NET and the web, you will develop, design and implement functionality in close cooperation with the product owner, with a strong focus on usability, reliability and quality. We work in an agile manner and believe strongly that small cross-functional teams empowered to make decisions and move fast are the best way to achieve our goals. This is a stunning opportunity for a passionate developer who hopes to work on and deliver game-changing solutions with other passionate people in a fun and inspired environment.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop, maintain, and document web systems using current technologies and best practices.

  • Understand and pursue the product vision and roadmap, as determined by the Product Owner.
