jobs.title: Back-End Developer
jobs.content:
What makes being a Back-End Developer at Tele2 so much fun



As a back-end developer your job is to make our products come to life and provide customers with an optimal online user experience. Not only for desktop but also for mobile devices, guaranteeing a seamless user experience. The back-end developer is a part of a multi-functional team consisting of front-end/full-stack/back-end developers, testers, UI/UX designers and product owners, that spend not only their working time but also their free time together. We value your experience and opinion so we expect you to speak up and challenge whenever there is room for an improvement.



This is what you’ll be doing



  • Be responsible for maintaining existing and developing new functionalities on www.tele2.nl

  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices

  • Create and maintain software documentation

  • Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities

  • Cooperate with web designers to create optimal online user experience

  • Coach other developers and development interns




The team that awaits you


Every time that you, as a consumer, buy something from Tele2, hear from us or call us, it is our Consumer Market department that’s behind that. Divided over six sub departments, there are 150 people working in small teams with big goals. Marketing, communications, sales, operations and customer service. Fixed, 4G. Online and Offline – It’s all here. The heart of the department is our living room. This is where ideas take form and come to life, where we talk about customer questions, test our propositions and close the deal on campaigns. And on Fridays? You will find the best social drinks here (at least of our C-wing).

jobs.title: Are you Zound Industries' next Hardware or Software Engineer?
jobs.content:
What we´re looking for
We’re now on the lookout for two experienced, driven and tech savvy System Engineers to join our Product Development and Production Team at the Zound Industries HQ in central Stockholm. Zound is operating in rapidly changing industry where development and knowledge about the future are crucial - and this is where you come in. These roles will help us to continue to be great at what we do. At Zound Industries we are extremely passionate and dedicated about what we do - and expect the same from you.


About the position
The team of System Engineers is a new function at Zound. With that said, it’s important that you feel comfortable in defining the role and building the organization along the way. You will work closely with our Project Managers and Acoustics Team to support introduction of new technology. The day-to-day work will entail responsibility of the technology roadmap and follow-ups of our development work, requirement discussions and requirement definitions together with internal and external partners, taking lead in technology investigations, strategy work and implementation and maintenance of platforms.


 About you
In order to succeed as a System Engineer you must act as a great team player with attention to details. You are confident in your skills and love to share you knowledge. Zound is a fast-paced organization where one day is not like the other and it’s important that you are a result-focused self-starter who likes to get things done. You have great analyzing skills and are a strategic thinker. You also have a great ability to communicate and work with all different kinds of people, and are fluent in both English and Swedish.


Does this sound like you?


So, if you are up to the task of working for Sweden’s most dynamic company and this job is a perfect match for you, please send us you resumé and cover letter no later than December 31.


We´re looking forward to your application!

jobs.title: Ingénieur Développement Logiciel C++
jobs.content:
AGUERIS assure la conception, le développement, la réalisation et la maintenance de simulateurs d’entraînement dans le domaine militaire terrestre. Ces simulateurs mettent en œuvre de nombreuses technologies logicielles : Visualisation 3D temps réel, Simulation physique de véhicules, Génération d’environnement tactique, Intelligence Artificielle, Protocoles de communication, Modèles de terrains synthétiques, Interfaces graphiques / IHM.


En phase de croissance, AGUERIS renforce son équipe et recherche un Ingénieur Développement Logiciel C++ (h/f).


 Rattaché au directeur technique, intégré au sein d’une petite équipe de développement, vous participez activement à l’ensemble des phases du développement des projets /  applications logicielles 3D Temps réel et leur intégration dans le cadre des activités R&D de la société.


 Vous menez à bien l’ensemble des phases de développement des modules logiciels : élaboration des spécifications techniques, proposition de solutions techniques, conception, développement, tests et documentation


 Vous participez activement aux différentes phases des projets et travaux de R&D dans lesquels sont intégrés les modules logiciels développés : analyse du besoin, spécification fonctionnelle, intégration, tests fonctionnels, recette, documentation, maintenance évolutive et corrective


 Vous menez une veille permanente dans les domaines techniques et technologiques afin d’anticiper et de préparer les produits et solutions futurs.


 Vous remontez les actions  et tout fait marquant rencontré sur le terrain (clients, partenaires, fonctionnement interne…). Vous  participez ponctuellement aux actions de promotion, marketing et avant-vente sur site client : installation, mise en service, recette et support, proposez des idées et/ou actions visant à améliorer la satisfaction client et la qualité du service.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Bizboard is looking for an intellectual innovator who can help us push boundaries to create new and exciting users experiences for all of our products and customers. Ideal candidates not only have extensive knowledge of JavaScript, but are sociable and think ahead as well.


We believe we're changing the way apps are built, using our own JavaScript-based open source black magic to build 60fps highly animated applications for any platform, focused on providing the best user interaction we can possibly create.


At Bizboard you'll work with the latest and greatest of the web tech world (ES6/7, Stage0+ proposals, firebase, jspm, web+service workers, webGL+VR, etc), in an environment where pushing tech to their absolute limit is daily business.


Developers work on one project at a time, in teams of 4, following no-nonsense agile scrum. We like to think our dev workflow is kind of nice. We use WebStorm + Chrome or node for development, write unit tests, and have sweet time-saving templates and (build)scripts.

jobs.title: Community and content development manager
jobs.content:
Inside.com is a network of email newsletters. We publish high quality roundups that curate, summarize, and analyze all of the most important news in many different verticals and industries. Some examples are cybersecurity, electric vehicles, virtual and augmented reality, artificial intelligence, drones, and more.

Over the past 10 months, we doubled our entire subscriber-base. Then we doubled it again. Then we doubled it a third time. And weâre just getting started. We also track net promoter scores and all of our newsletters score between 66 and 89 â which is right on par with world-renowned products like the iPhone and the Tesla Model S.

Our editorial team is masterful when it comes to creating a âpresidential briefingâ style update in any of these areas, but we also want to bring in voices of industry leaders to level up the content of the newsletters. This program is loosely modeled off the LinkedIn Influencer program, which you can read more about here.

Weâre looking for someone to help create and grow this influencer program. The role consists of a few things:

  • Developing lists of the most influential people in all of our current and upcoming verticals
  • Identifying the best ways to contact and build relationships with these people
  • Applying a Lean Startup methodology to your outreach efforts
  • Building and maintaining relationships with our network of influencers
  • Identifying key topics, events, and issues for influencers to offer input on
  • Communicating actively with our editorial team to get this influencer content into our newsletters

Here are some key requirements:

  • Hustle. You need to be able to track down busy, influential people and get them to talk to you. This requires creative communication, research, persistence, and hustle.
  • Persistence. We mentioned this above, but it bears reiteration. You might need to email someone 6 times before you catch their attention. We need someone willing to push hard.
  • Communication. This is a growth position, not an editorial position, but we are an editorial-driven company and everybody needs to be able to write and communicate well.
  • Curiosity. To excel in this role, you need to be able to build a deep understanding of each of the verticals we publish in. That means knowing the events, companies, products, and most importantly, people, in each of these verticals and having your finger to the pulse of any changes or developments.

This is a contract position for 30-40 hours per week, and pay is $20/hr.

To apply: Fill out this form to apply: https://insidedailybrief.typeform.com/to/F8sxNP

jobs.title: Buying and selling land (hourly+comm) project management, sales
jobs.content:
You will be buying and selling parcels of land on our behalf. Extensive training will be given. Excellent opportunity with potentially high commissions, including residuals.

We are looking for people who believe they can be very successful and are ready to make it happen. We are only hiring a few people and then this opportunity will be closed.
  
Duties include:

  • Creating & implementing systems for discovering, doing due diligence, and marketing parcels of land.
  • Maintaining and improving those systems
  • Responding to buyer and seller inquiries
  • Talking to prospective buyers on phone and closing the sale 
  • Completing due diligence procedures on prospective parcels 
  • Managing the advertising efforts to promote the buying and selling of parcels
  • Friendly and confident telephone skills
  • Entrepreneurial mindset
  • Responsive and communicative - we place a great value on your ability to communicate with us.

This is a telecommuting job. We are looking for a hard worker who possesses exceptional organizational skills as well as the ability to communicate well with buyers. You will need project management skills and the ability to use time wisely in order to get a lot done each day.

You will be given training and procedures to follow in order to successfully do the job.

Hourly pay plus commission.

References will be asked for.

To be considered for this position please complete the following assessments on Wonscore. Thank you for completing this assessment as it helps us to make sure we are both a good fit. We are putting a lot of effort into hiring an exceptional candidate as we are offering extensive training and you can expect to make great money.

Applicants will only be considered upon completion of this quick test.

The link for completing Wonscore is (copy and paste into browser) https://hiring.wonderlic.com/openings/570822d60c1edc0100cc5f85/apply

To apply: Send a resume to helpingyousucceedllc@gmail.com and complete the Wonscore assessment as detailed in the job listing.

jobs.title: WordPress Support & Customer Success Manager
jobs.content:
This position can be in-office in NYC orremote work-from-home. Remote U.S. candidates are encouraged to apply.
AdThrive.com helps bloggers make more moneywith the ads on their site. This means helping them figure out which networksto use, how to set them, and then actually doing that for them. People who havea passion for something (cooking, decorating, parenting) get to write abouttheir passion and be paid to live their dream. We help moms leave theirfull-time jobs and stay home with their kids. We help struggling families paytheir bills and find hope. We support the people who are creating the internet!
 

As a Support & Customer Success Manager,youâre passionate about helping people. It shapes your worldview. Perhapsyouâre already active in helping people online through the WordPress.com orWordPress.org forums, or another venue like StackOverflow. The thought ofhelping families earn enough money for one parent to stay home or to covertheir mortgage gives you goosebumps.

Day in the Life
  • Crafting thoughtful, personal responses to client questions in our support system (Zendesk)
  • Troubleshooting and fixing problems on client websites (mostly WordPress)
  • Analyzing ad layouts and earnings
  • Making recommendations for improvements in ad layouts
  • Onboarding new clients by installing ads on their sites
  • Being an active member of a distributed team via tools like Slack and Google Hangouts

Youâll do well if you have:
  • Patience,grace, and a sense of humor
  • Excellentwriting and communication skills
  • Workingknowledge of WordPress, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
  • Aknack for taking technical language and making it understandable
  • Apassion for solving tough problems and proposing elegant solutions
  • Adesire to make everything you touch better

Qualifications
  • 2+years of backend WordPress experience using the following languages: PHP, HTML,CSS, and JavaScript
  • Experienceediting custom WordPress themes and plugins
  • Experiencewith common plugins such as W3 Total Cache and WooCommerce
  • Strongunderstanding of Google Analytics
  • StrongWritten Communication (web-based copy, preferred)
  • Mustsuccessfully complete appropriate FireSeeds Selection Process
  • Commitmentto clientâs Mission Statement
 
There is limitless opportunity here for theperson who makes themselves valuable. We're new and growing fast, so strongleaders and strong performers will have teams placed under them and increasingresponsibility.
 

A competitive base salary will be offered. Inaddition, we offer health/dental/vision benefits, 401k, life insurance,paid/vacation/sick/personal time, and many perks.
 

To apply: Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter with salary requirements to hr@cafemedia.com. The subject line of your email should read âWordPress Support & Customer Success Managerâ.We regret that we are unable to respond to each resume. Only those individuals selected for interviews will be contacted. CafeMedia is an equal opportunity employer.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
about imgur:

Imgur was founded in 2009 as a simple image hosting platform and over the past seven years has evolved into the world’s largest image sharing community. We have grown from having 46,000 page views per month in February 2009 to over seven billion page views per month in February 2016 (with 900 billion images viewed in 2015 alone). We are now a top-15 visited site in the United States and our opportunity for future growth is massive. As we continue to expand internally and externally, we are looking to add a talented backend engineer to our smart, fun, and quirky culture to help us achieve our goals for growth and scalability.

imgur is positivity at scale.

Our vision is to lift the world’s spirits for a few moments every day. We accomplish this by surfacing the world’s most entertaining content. With every submission having the potential to go viral, our highly-engaged community is integrally important to our product and we want to ensure we continually delight and surprise our users.

about you:

You are a senior+-level software engineer who thrives on building highly-scalable backend solutions. You enjoy working with a small and Agile team that is tasked with developing core features and functions while also focusing on stability and performance issues. You are comfortable building things from scratch and working in the core engineering team. You will be responsible from prototyping to owning the whole product lifecycle. Most importantly - you’re excited about working on a product that our highly-engaged community loves and deploying code to our 175M monthly active users.

responsibilities:

  • Help us evolve our platform to its next incarnation
  • Write systems in PHP5, Golang, and/or node.js (previous knowledge not necessary, but willingness to learn is)
  • Work with and become an expert in datastores such as MySQL, DynamoDB, HBase, etc.
  • Be part of a team that wants to work on all aspects of the mobile web technology.
  • Own the Tests, CI tools, Chef recipes, StatsD monitoring, logging, and alerting for your software.

what you bring to the table:

  • BS (or higher) in Computer Science, or equivalent experience
  • 6+ years of professional experience with backend technologies
  • Critical thinkers who present logical arguments to defend their solutions
  • Experience in PHP, Go, and/or Node.js is helpful but experience in Java or C/C++ is of course welcome
  • The ability to comfortably program in a Unix environment and knowledge of Unix commands
  • A passion for beautiful, pragmatic code paired with a strong sense of product design
  • Experience with distributed systems a huge plus!

benefits:

  • Competitive salary, fully covered medical/dental/vision
  • 401k matching
  • 25 days of PTO per year
  • Gym stipend
  • Passion fund - $500 a year towards your favorite passion or something you’ve always wanted to try
  • Commuter/parking benefits
  • Opportunity to work on the world’s largest image sharing community!

Above all: As we grow, so will you. Interested? Click apply and let’s begin the journey together. Note: if you don't meet these requirements we are still open to hearing from you.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
BackOffice Associates, LLC is a worldwide leader in information governance and data migration solutions, focusing on helping customers manage one of their most critical assets – data. Our company’s range of products, built on a revolutionary platform, address the needs of business users seeking to unlock the value of their data assets. BackOffice Associates’ products and services enable organizations to accelerate growth, gain actionable visibility and reduce risks. Founded in 1996, BackOffice Associates has an unparalleled record of success in the most complex data environments across a variety of industries. Customers include many Fortune 1000 companies including Eli Lilly, Kraft and Dow Chemical. BackOffice Associates is a global corporation headquartered in Massachusetts with additional offices in the U.S., Australia, Europe and Asia. We are looking for energetic, self-directed, committed and goal- oriented individuals with the desire to join a world-class organization.

Position Summary

The Software Developer is responsible for helping, design, develop, and maintain BackOffice’s products. We use a myriad of technologies and have both on-prem Enterprise and cloud native software.

As a Software Developer on our team, you will be joining a group of developers working to grow the information governance product space, building out applications on Amazon Web Services platform. Our base development stack consists of backend API’s implemented via Lambda, running against DynamoDB. In front of that exists our AngularJS application that employs Foundation for Apps as a responsive front-end framework. This is our stack today, and we are continuously evaluating options for improvement.

A successful candidate will be joining the team with members across North America, and as such, the ability to work remotely and with remote colleagues is of the utmost importance. The candidate will work closely with developers, product owners, DevOps staff, and many other colleagues. This role’s responsibility will be developing software products not just through slinging code, but developing prototypes, reaching consensus, and keeping the user flow in mind.

This position is looking for someone close to full stack development, a DevOps + Quality driven mindset, and itching to grow, learn, and expand while developing cutting-edge, market-leading applications. You will have opportunities to explore the broader scope of cloud based application development, database design and deployment in the Amazon Web Services environment. We are expanding our AWS and cloud footprint every day, and are always on the lookout for improving not just what we do, but how we do it.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Experience in software engineering, DevOps, and cloud environments
  • Believes in continuous delivery and full integration of the lifecycle: Dev, Ops, Quality
  • Embraces a “remote-first” model even if you are at an office
  • Is agile not Agile™, no ties to a prescribed process here, we keep it lean and adapt continuously
  • Help us innovate and continue our mission of building a great team building great products

Qualifications:

  • BS/MS in Comp Sci/Math/EE or related discipline or equivalent experience
  • .NET with SQL Server or Java with some RDBMS
  • Functional and Object Oriented experience, a plus
  • Understanding of development principles for intuitive, useful user interfaces
  • Jenkins and git/GitHub experience, a plus; some VCS experience required
  • Ability to work as part of a highly distributed team
  • Great communication skills via Slack and Google Hangouts is a must

Technology That We Currently Use

  • AWS, Lambda,, Dynamo, Git, GitHub, Gulp, NodeJS, Python, JVM (Java, Scala), CloudFormation, ElasticSearch, Linux, Jenkins, AngularJS, CSS (SCSS), .NET (C#), Foundation for Apps, SQL Server, Artifactory, Windows Server

jobs.title: Cloud Operations Production Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
BackOffice Associates, LLC is a worldwide leader in information governance and data migration solutions, focusing on helping customers manage one of their most critical assets â data. Our companyâs range of products, built on a revolutionary platform, address the needs of business users seeking to unlock the value of their data assets. BackOffice Associatesâ products and services enable organizations to accelerate growth, gain actionable visibility and reduce risks. Founded in 1996, BackOffice Associates has an unparalleled record of success in the most complex data environments across a variety of industries. Customers include many Fortune 1000 companies including Eli Lilly, Kraft and Dow Chemical. BackOffice Associates is a global corporation headquartered in Massachusetts with additional offices in the U.S., Australia, Europe and Asia. We are looking for energetic, self-directed, committed and goal- oriented individuals with the desire to join a world-class organization.

__Position Summary__

The Cloud Operations â Production Operations Engineer will be responsible for supporting highly reliable, high performing and secure operations for n-tier SaaS applications, comprising both UI and data integration components and for provisioning and administering the R&D AWS environment. The person in this position will work closely with the Cloud Development team maintaining a âDevOpsâ culture. This position reports through R&D IT leadership, but will be a key contributor to Cloud Development and Product Support teams.

__Primary Responsibilities:__

* Uphold established SaaS security and performance standards to ensure compliance with Service Level Agreements as specified in customer contracts
* Assist in implementation and maintenance of a highly secure and high performing cloud based infrastructure, including the following:
 * Create and manage cloud tenants
 * Apply new builds to cloud environments
 * Monitor system health and establish appropriate alerting thresholds and response procedures
* Provision, administer and maintain cloud hosted (currently AWS) systems for the R&D group
* Build Subject Matter Expertise in cloud security, privacy and information management
* Provide hands on testing, tuning and technical support
* On a rotating basis, provide after hours, on-call incident support
* Continuously improve operations processes, including incident, problem, change management and disaster recovery processes

__Qualifications:__

* Bachelorâs Degree in relevant field
* At least 1 year of experience working with a high volume customer facing SaaS application or in a DevOps environment
* Understanding of / experience with at least 4 of the following disciplines:
 * SaaS Application architecture
 * Serverless (Lambda, API Gateway) AWS technologies
 * Build/deployment/delivery processes
 * System provisioning, automation and configuration management tools
 * AWS EC2 or similar instance provision and administration
 * Familiarity with cloud monitoring principles and tools
 * Security, performance and data privacy for a multitier cloud based application
* Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate verbally and in writing
* Strong team player capable of providing support across the organization
* Willing/able to provide after hours, on-call and escalation, including system outages and incident response

jobs.title: Experienced Full Stack Developer (Rails/React)
jobs.content:
We're looking for a full-time full stack developer to help build and maintain our social media management tool, Edgar. Edgar launched in mid-2014 and has thousands of happy, beautiful, paying customers that will use the features you build every day. Weâre growing ~20% month on month. (No pressure, right?)
Youâll be working on big, exciting projects like optimizing our queuing system, building out React components, adding support for social media platform-specific features like native video, and getting our onboarding juuuust right so that every user has a mind-blowing experience from their very first login.

Youâll be joining a small team of talented full-stack developers, and working alongside dedicated UX designers, QA and Customer Experience pros.

Our stack is Rails 4, Ruby 2.2, Heroku, Postgres, S3, Sidekiq + Redis with Webpack, React and Redux on the front-end. Itâs great stack to work with everyday, and we take our time to write solid code and proper tests to make sure it stays that way.

Our Dev Process

We do a fair amount of pair programming and a lot of code reviews, we love solid tests and CI, and we deploy several times a week. Basically? Weâre constantly improving our process so we can create an ideal developer environment - low overheads, high transparency. Estimates were inaccurate and irrelevant, so we dropped âem. Artificial deadlines werenât doing it for us, so we switched from scrum to pure kanban and never looked back. When something isnât working, weâre not afraid to throw it out and try something new - so if you have exciting ideas about the dev process and how to make your own job even better, youâll fit right in. (Weâre open-minded like that.)
Youâll have final responsibility for features you build, from inception all the way through to deployment, so your teammates know exactly who to shower with praise.

Requirements

  • You have experience creating software products that solve real user challenges
  • Youâve got real professional history with React, and Redux â Webpack & ES6 are big plusses
  • Live anywhere in the USA or Canada (need to be able to provide documentation of eligibility to work in the USA)
  • You love Rails and React
  • You know how to communicate effectively and work as part of a team with lots of different backgrounds and roles
  • Passionate about improving the development process and recognize the value of an awesome company culture
  • Not a jerk

About Us

Weâre a small team of about 25 people, all working remotely across the US & Canada. We do a lot of collaborating and meme-swapping on Slack, along with virtual team meetings and super-futuristic video calls. We also do a twice-annual meetup week where we work together on cool projects all day and generally make fools of ourselves all night. Weâre proudly bootstrapped and profitable, which means we get to turn down VC money a lot and keep doing things the way we like. Weâre pretty serious about building and maintaining an awesome, positive company culture, so, you know, no jerks.

We'll probably get along if youâre someone who wants to be creative, have a pretty-serious-but-not-inhuman amount of responsibility, and work with people who make going to work not suck. (And be one of those people yourself. We like those people.)

You can find out more at http://meetedgar.com/careers/ and by watching this video (we paid a lot for this thing): https://youtu.be/XvU3P43b0rQ

Perks & Benefits

  • Work from home (or wherever thereâs strong wifi)
  • 4 weeks paid vacation (Shazam! And yes, everyone actually uses all 4 weeks)
  • Monthly cleaning service for your home - not that we don't have total faith in you
  • Paid home Internet service
  • Coworking space/coffee shop working expenses
  • Health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your fam
  • 401(k) plan with employer match
  • Up to two months family leave for new parents (including adoption)
  • An extra paid day off per quarter so you can volunteer in your community (awww)
  • New Mac laptop (#blessed)
  • Books, conferences, and other educational resources to help you be even more amazing at what you do!
  • TSA pre-check to make getting to retreats and conferences a breeze

Check âem out in even more detail here (you know youâre curious):
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1txOs5h-ZjbOqMW-GxmJcKnCClKK3yVqOWO0hhHBAbT0/edit

Want to know more about our company culture? We've got a video for that, too: https://youtu.be/nFMEp6D7M74

To apply: https://docs.google.com/a/meetedgar.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf7MiLnszPFWFBEfeYRnachhnB0zM9XnWBb_6vekx8_r-EyCQ/viewform

jobs.title: Software Engineer III
jobs.content:
Casey Family Programs, an Equal Opportunity Employer, is the nation’s largest operating foundation focused on safely reducing the need for foster care and building Communities of Hope for children and families across America.  Founded in 1966, we work in 50 states, the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico to influence long-lasting improvements to the safety and success of children, families and the communities where they live. We value diversity and respect for individuals in the workplace.



Job Summary:


The Software Engineer III is responsible for creating software designs and directly implementing software solutions based on those designs. At times the position is a lead in all aspects of the solution lifecycle including proposals, analysis, design, requirements, customization, development, quality assurance, release management, and support. Project platforms include web applications, back-end databases, data warehouses, SharePoint sites, and data manipulation tools.


Essential Responsibilities:      



  • Implement fully functional software based on designs that adhere to Agile development software best practices including designing for test and modularity for growth using SOLID principles. 40%

  • Independently create application designs both through written documentation and working prototypes based on provided requirements. 20%

  • Create automated deployment and test processes for solutions through dev, test, stage and prod environments 10%

  • At times, leads in all phases of enterprise software development, including requirements gathering, specifications, development, unit testing, documentation, deployment, and maintenance. 10%

  • Authors technical analyses and technical designs, issue feasibility and effort studies for development projects, and creates and maintains system architecture documents. 5%

  • Works with Infrastructure Group to deploy applications to test, stage, and production environments. <5%

  • Performs other duties as assigned. <5%

- You take pride in the quality and craftsmanship of your work rather than just doing it to get it done.

## WHAT WE OFFER:
Working for a fast-growing bootstrapped company is a rare opportunity, one we consider a lifestyle choice rather than a job choice. Our positions are challenging, but also come with amazing advantages and fulfillment to those who earn them. Hereâs what we offer.

- Competitive Salary.

jobs.title: Lead Mobile Engineer
jobs.content:
Top Hat is looking for iOS or Android developers to be part of a growing team building out our native mobile apps, used in class by students and professors all over the world. We're looking for someone highly technical who also understands the nuances of beautiful user experiences on mobile.


About the Gig:



  • Work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment

  • Maintain and improve the iOS or Android application used by over a million students

  • Implement new features in the Top Hat phone and tablet apps

  • Improve application performance and reliability

  • Provide solutions to exciting new problems

  • Work closely with our design and backend teams to help bring beautiful, usable, and fast mobile designs to life (Our backend is a REST API built with Django, with Node.js for realtime. Everything runs in a high-availability setup on AWS, with MySQL, memcached, autoscaling.)

  • Contribute ideas and participate in design and planning discussions with your team


About You:



  • You are very smart and able to learn quickly

  • You probably have a technical undergraduate degree (ie. computer science/engineering)

  • You have a few years of development experience on at least one of the iOS or Android platforms

  • You are able to architect robust, maintainable systems, not just hack together code for one-off projects

  • You want to work on an app that is positively influencing the education space


You should be comfortable with most of the following:



  • Current knowledge of iOS or Android development technologies and tools

  • Mobile network programming (client-server)

  • REST APIs

  • Git

  • Automated unit and integration testing


We think the best sign of a good developer is interesting projects they’ve done. Tell us your about the cool stuff you’ve built!

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a hardcore engineer to help build our cutting edge education platform that students all over the world use in class. Does doin’ your thing in Django take you to your happy place? Does coding in JavaScript feel better than Christmas morning? Read on, you Maniac Hack. Read on.


About You:




  • At least a few years of web development experience under your belt.




  • Be able to put together robust, maintainable systems. Hacking together code for one-off projects isn't going to cut it in this shop.




  • Degree in a technical field is preferred, but not essential.




  • Be super smart and get things done.




  • You understand the difference between smart shortcuts to take and a ugly hacks.




Our client side app is built on a fairly sophisticated JavaScript framework and makes use of jQuery, React, Flux and all the usual suspects. The server-side is written in Python on Django, with a MySQL database. We use Node.js and SockJS for our real-time components. Our systems all run on Amazon Web Services.


You will be will be working a variety of projects relating to our flagship web application. These will include front-end MVC application design and development, DOM optimization, and modular and extensible HTML/CSS . In terms of back-end development, you will be working on our Django application and creating lightning-fast REST APIs.


We like to hire developers who have solid full stack experience but definitely value, and accommodate, developers who choose to be more focused on either front-end and back-end development.


It’s a good sign if you’re comfortable with:




  • Semantic HTML5 concepts




  • CSS 3.0




  • JavaScript




  • Git




  • Automated unit and integration testing




  • HTTP




  • REST APIs




  • Databases (Hopefully including query performance and optimization)




We think a good developer should have interesting projects they've done on their own time. So please showcase any cool side projects, open source contributions, community involvement, and show us your GitHub profile if you have one.

jobs.title: Mjukvaruutvecklare till projekt inom arkitektur och konstruktion
jobs.content:
Arkitektur- och byggbranschen befinner sig i en informationsrevolution. Byggnadsdata kan modelleras och visualiseras som aldrig förr - men det vi har sett är bara början. Nu finns chansen att ta utvecklingen till nästa nivå och skapa framtidens system för byggnadsmodellering!


newCAD är en konsultfirma bestående av drivna specialister inom Building Information Modelling (BIM). Vi använder lasermätning och moderna CAD-verktyg för att skapa kompletta 3D- och datamodeller av fastigheter. Nu siktar vi på att utöka möjligheterna för att presentera och behandla denna data.


Den vi söker har bred erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, med särskilt intresse för webbutveckling. Arbetet kommer att ske i projektform och kandidaten har stora möjligheter att påverka såväl tekniska slutresultat som företagets långsiktiga utveckling.


Följande egenskaper efterfrågas:
- Goda kunskaper inom Javascript (ES6), HTML5 och CSS.
- Erfarenhet av modern frontend-utveckling, gärna i React eller Angular.
- Starkt teknikintresse.
- Intresse för design och UI/UX.
- Kunskaper inom databaser.


Erfarenhet inom följande områden är meriterande:
- Full stack-webbutveckling.
- Datavisualisering i webbmiljö (i exempelvis D3.js).
- Grafikvisualisering i webbmiljö (WebGL, three.js).
- CAD, GIS eller 3D-modellering.
- Spelutveckling eller utveckling av datorgrafik.


Vi ser det som mycket meriterande om kandidaten kan visa upp exempel på tidigare arbeten eller egna projekt inom dessa områden!

- We cover all costs of company travel (including our annual all-company retreat and mini-team meetups).
- Ability to work with some of the best people in the business through frequent, if not daily, interactions.
- And in case you were wondering: no politics, no b.s., and no jerks.

jobs.title: Technical Consultant
jobs.content:
Technical Consultant
Philadelphia, United States

Introduction
Quintiq, part of Dassault Systèmes, is looking for a candidate ready to become an expert in all deployment and integration aspects of the Quintiq software.

This technical consultant will work closely with customers and to architect and maintain mission-critical systems. The technical consultant is responsible for architecting a system that satisfies the customer’s availability requirements, designing interfaces with the rest of the customer’s IT landscape, deploying software into the production environments, and ensuring the performance of that system is up to par.

You will get to understand how complex modern enterprises work, and how they provide the goods and services we take for granted every day. You will be working in relatively small teams with a motivated team of colleagues who use the Quintiq software to solve some of the world’s most complex supply chain puzzles. You will play an essential role of becoming the absolute expert on the Quintiq software platform.

Department & supervisor
You will work as part of a team of Quintiq experts and will report directly to the Business Unit Director.

Location
This role is based in Quintiq’s office at Radnor, Pennsylvania, U.S.A.

Type of employment
This is a full-time role. Quintiq does not sponsor visa applications for this position.

Salary range & benefits
We provide excellent working conditions and a salary commensurate with experience and education. We provide an environment where self-reliant people are well rewarded. Visit Careers & Benefits to find out more.

Responsibilities



  • Architect mission-critical systems that support thousands of concurrent users, terabytes of data, and our industry-leading optimization technology;

  • Design integration between Quintiq systems and other systems within the customer’s existing IT landscape (HR, ERP, MES, etc);

  • Design and develop communication with mobile apps;

  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance problems in all aspects of the software;

  • Train customers to install, configure, and maintain their own solutions;

  • Collaborate with R&D to diagnose, troubleshoot, and document technical issues with the software;

  • Opportunities to lead and manage technical teams for the right candidate.

jobs.title: Senior Back-end Developers - Highly Concurrent Systems
jobs.content:
About Jet’s Internal Engine

We’re building a new kind of company, and we’re building it from the inside out, which means that investing in hiring, developing, and retaining the brightest minds in the world is a top priority. Everything we do is grounded in three simple values: trust, transparency, and fairness. From our business model to our culture, we live our values to the extreme, whether we’re dealing with employees, retail partners, or consumers. We believe that happiness is the highest level of success and we want every person that crosses paths with Jet to achieve it. If you’re an ambitious, smart, natural collaborator who likes taking risks, influencing, and innovating in a challenging hyper-growth environment, we’d love to talk to you about joining our team. 

About the Job

We are looking for exceptional back-end developers to help us build a world class ecommerce platform. The role is wide ranging in its scope and will include working on all back end technology for our platform and supporting apps. The platform is an event driven (event sourced) system built largely in .NET and designed to run on the cloud (Azure). This is an extension of our US team that is responsible for the back-end of all of Jet.com.

jobs.title: Lead App Developer
jobs.content:
We are hiring 2 developers. 1 iOS  and 1 Android engineer to lead the development of the official city guide app for London, the Visit London app. Supported by Mastercard, our new app is designed to make London accessible for the 30m annual visitors as they arrive in the greatest City on earth! With a soft-launch on iOS already under our belt, you will take ownership of this new channel, leading on future iterations and releases and working alongside a highly focused and agile team of content and development specialists to bring app development in house to the visitlondon.com team for the first time



  • iOS Lead: Responsibility for the delivery and success of the iOS App and full product lifecycle

  • Android Lead: Define the architecture and standards for the new Android App. Full responsibility for the delivery and success of the Android App and its full product lifecycle

  • Continuously iterate and improve in response to user feedback and analytics

  • Champion best practice development methodologies and processes including testing

  • Work with product team and wider stakeholders to help define new features and functionality and prioritise the delivery of these

  • Be an integral member of the product team (Android lead, iOS lead, product manager, editor) and the wider digital development team

  • Be the go to person for all things iOS or Android

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
The Role


Zattoo is searching for a highly motivated Android Developer with a proven track record in Android development to add to our world class development team. You’ll play a key role in creating and developing Zattoo’s mobile experience and can also contribute in areas such as tablet optimization or video streaming.  


Zattoo’s mobile apps for iOS, Android and Windows Phone are installed on millions of devices. We were among the first to bring Live and Catchup TV to these platforms without requiring additional hardware.  In addition to mobile, we put a strong focus on new Android based big screen platforms such as Android TV and Amazon Fire TV. Zattoo is also amongst the first to provide Linear TV on those platforms and we see big potential in building and improving great applications in this new field.


We’re looking for someone who wants to push the borders of what’s possible on these platforms. You’ll help us make the Zattoo mobile apps even better, whether it’s implementing new features, improving performance or making sure the user interface is top notch.


You will find Zattoo to be a comfortable place to work at with our flat hierarchies, pragmatic decision making, fast approval paths and willingness to take risks. Most importantly, you’ll be surrounded by colleagues who’ll share your commitment to building world class products and work directly with partners like Google and Amazon to build the next generation TV experience.




Responsibilities



  • Develop and maintain our Android applications that have more than a million active installations

  • Work directly with other developers, designers, QA and product managers to conceptualize, build, test and release applications

  • Gather requirements around functionality and translate those requirements into elegant functional solutions

  • Implement compelling device specific user interfaces and experiences and optimize performance for the applications

  • Contribute to developing the concept for the next generation TV experience by providing input to product owners and designers about Android features and patterns

jobs.title: Front-end Developer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

You're an experienced Front-End Developer and have a strong desire to push boundaries via development. You will help in the creation of innovative products that heavily use latest JavaScript trends and software development best practices. As a Javascript Guru at Sanbrex Digital, you’ll be joining a versatile team of people who are passionate about development and its ability to shape one’s viewpoint of the world. You will get the opportunity to create unique experiences for disruptive projects in financial and entertainment industries.

REQUIREMENTS

The Bare Necessities:

  • Comfortable with building responsive web applications and coding compelling interactions
  • Ability to create marvellous web experiences using UI design
  • At least 3-4 years working in a front-end development or in an in-house software development position
  • Experienced in MEANSTACK Development (Mongo DB, Express, Angular JS, Node JS)
  • Experienced in Javascript Libraries such as Ionic/Cordova, Electron, React Native, Meteor
  • Proven experience in Web and Hybrid Mobile Applications Development
  • Familiarity Front-End languages like (CSS, ActionScript, CoffeeScript, DHTML, XML-Based Languages, XSL, VB Script, Silverlight)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English) - better listening skills!
  • Self-Motivator and past experience in working with remote distributive teams

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Shopify (.Liquid), BigCommerce and Woo-Commerce Platforms
  • Experience with Go, Sass, WebSockets, Casper JS or GitHub

BENEFITS

  • Flexible Hours
  • Tech Allowance
  • Corporate Retreats
  • Work from anywhere in the world
  • Small and focused team that gives a ton of technical freedom
  • Working on a product that no one else has built before, we're waiting for you to leave your mark!

ABOUT SANBREX DIGITAL

Sanbrex Digital is disrupting the way software is built, designed, developed and delivered. We are always two steps ahead of the mobile and web applications revolution; with every new transformation, we have a developer ready to tackle it. The Sanbrex team takes the client’s business and creates a 180 degree flip through ideating, designing, developing and marketing. We design using modern JavaScript frameworks (including Angular 2, React and Node), a development process that is not only driven for User-Experience, but also conveys an intriguing user experience, with less effort than its out-dated counterpart. Our UX/UI experts focus on creating a memorable experience for your customers/clients, compelling each to give your business a double-take. And to perfectly tie the whole project together, our creative geniuses visually entice your audience by making them say WOW. Our goal is to create product platforms that not only puts our client at the forefront in their domain, but keeps them ahead of the game, allowing them to grasp each opportunity that comes their way with confidence!

jobs.title: QA Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an enthusiastic Quality Assurance Automation Engineer to join one of our teams. You will work within a team which is responsible for a specific part of the application. You will build on our existing achievements to further improve the quality of our solution, and increase our customer satisfaction as a result.


As a Quality Assurance Automation Engineer at Bynder you are the quality expert when it comes to your team’s mission, and you will help your team to achieve the quality you want to see in our application.


You will be actively working with the product team, development and business stakeholders to clarify requirements in terms of testability, consistency, and completeness. You know that it is crucial to have all information complete before development, and if any detail is missing lacking during the process, then you will make it your mission to ensure completeness, and communicate these changes to the team.


With an eye for detail, you will create, review and automate test cases. You will be working closely with the devops team, making sure that the correct scenarios are automatically run over the latest build prior to release. You will be actively studying the results of each automated test run, when finding a defect or possible issue you will investigate and report them clearly in detail with all information attached and will work with the team to resolve them. On your company-provided Apple equipment you will work with Jira, Github, Browserstack, Jmeter; write BDD (Behaviour Driven Development) scenarios and automate them with Selenium, behave and Python.


Participating proactively in daily standup meetings, team retrospectives, suggesting and implementing improvements, you know you can make a difference. The best argument wins!

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
In 2017 Bynder will keep growing steadily with a focus on stability and new features that will certainly bring a lot of new challenges. In order to successfully comply with our product vision we need you: a self-motivated problem solver, capable of taking responsibility and provide solutions. As a DevOps Engineer and a member of the DevOps squad at Bynder, you will be responsible to improve and maintain our Cloud infrastructure while participating in architecture decisions for current and future projects. You will work in an agile environment closely cooperating with our Chief Technology Officer and product owners.


Your typical day will be action packed: Be ready for a dynamic environment that requires the flexibility to work independently, take initiative to lead projects while collaborating with the team to expedite the creation and deployment of our game-changing SaaS platform. But of course there is always a cold beer waiting for you at the end of each day. Work hard, play hard! That's how we roll!

What you will do:



  • Build and maintain our production infrastructure to ensure scalability and high-availability while maximizing development team efficiency

  • Troubleshoot and debug complex issues related to the product and the infrastructure

  • Implement solutions for automated provisioning of clusters and systems and centralised configuration management using orchestration and configuration management tools

  • Ensure proactive and sufficient monitoring is in place for all our vital microservices, while an advanced alarming system is notifying us for unusual behavior

  • Perform automated deployments to create new or update existing production/staging environments

  • Be responsible for packaging and distribution of our custom software libraries

  • Continuous Integration and Delivery for all our microservices

  • Provide insights into scalability and maintenance to developers

jobs.title: Python Developer
jobs.content:
Bynder is looking to hire you, a Back-End Developer, who wants to help build the most advanced and easiest to use branding automation software in the industry. Our Development team is building a cloud-based SaaS product for marketeers to automate and streamline their workflow in today’s globalized business environment.


Our clients are some of the world’s largest brands, including Spotify, KLM, Nest, & Logitech to name but a few. We’re looking for someone who understands the challenges involved in creating a globally available, distributed system with four nines of reliability. We don’t take “no” for an answer and we stress the boundaries of what’s available.


We work with a microservice architecture, using multiple asynchronous systems and pushing the limits of both the technology and AWS to the limits to adapt our product to use state of the art technologies.


How we roll


We are hiring for this role in Barcelona, where our rapidly growing team of developers is situated. The office is situated in the heart of the city.


Our development team is split into autonomous squads, each with responsibility for their own area of the product.


We have perks: each developer gets their own mac. We supply daily lunch at the office. We relax every day with beers, and we have ping-pong tables on hand for when you need a break.


You will join an international team: we have 20 nationalities between our 60 developers - and many more when you include our other offices in London, Boston, Dubai, and Barcelona.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Operations
jobs.content:
The Berlin Institute of Health (BIH) is a joint venture of the Charite University Medicine and the Max Delbrueck Center for Molecular Medicine for interdisciplinary translational system medicine.


The bioinformatics core unit is looking for a highly-motivated, detail-oriented individual to join us.


As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for deploying and maintaining bioinformatics data


management, processing, analysis and delivery systems. In this position, you will drive the course


of change and improvement while retaining the stability of our systems.


Working in the BIH bioinformatics core unit gives the opportunity to support world-class scientific


facilities in their interesting projects with the aim of translational biomedical research and bringing


research results closer to the patient for diagnostics or treatment.


Job duties include:



  • Deployment, configuration, and integration of software systems including analysis pipelines

  • and large-scale data repositories

  • Implementation and maintenance of a container management system

  • Evaluation and testing of new systems and technologies

  • Deployment and maintenance of software systems to various environments ranging from

  • Desktop to HPC systems

  • Support data management and processing with scripting, data motion, automation, and testing


Position Requirements:



  • MS degree in Computer Science or similar demonstrable skills required

  • 3+ years post degree work experience in deployment, maintenance, and evolution of complex system landscapes based on Unix/Linux

  • In-depth understanding of the requirements in scientific computing and large scale data management; experience in biomedical environment is a plus

  • Excellent programming skills in Bash and a high-level programming language such as Python or Java; experience with Docker, SGE, Puppet, OpenBIS, iRODS is a plus

  • Team-oriented with excellent communication skills in English and German

  • Willingness to learn


Salaries are set according to TVöD up to level 13, according to qualification and experience.


Appointments are made for an initial period of 24 months with possibility of extension. Please send


your applications by 15th January 2016 to cubi@bihealth.de.


The Charité – Universitätsmedizin Berlin meets the personnel decisions on the suitability,


competence and professional performance. When equally qualified, we prefer people with severe


disabilities. In addition, we aim to increase the proportion of women among academic staff and


encourage women to apply. When equally qualified women will be given priority in the context of


legal options. Applications from people with immigrant backgrounds who meet the recruitment


requirements are welcome. Should any difficulties in the interpretation occur, the German version


of this job offer shall be binding.


Any applicable travel expenses are not reimbursed.

jobs.title: Prototyping PHP MySQL Javascript
jobs.content: Development and maintenance of PHP/MySQL/Javascript based web applications for large companies. We work closely with customers, meaning rapid development, and quick turnaround time to build usabale prototypes.

jobs.title: Customer Support Manager
jobs.content:
We're looking for a smart, customer service focused person to help our customers with daily issues: answering questions about features, integrations, creating newsletters and managing subscribers. Moreover, you will be reviewing customer accounts to make sure they comply with our anti-spam policy.

Communication with customers is by email and chat. Delivering WOW through customer support is our main value, check all our company values here. We're using bunch of tools, like Slack, Trello and 15five, to be connected and feel like a team.

  • Working hours: 8AM-4PM (GMT +08:00)
  • Working days: 4 workweek days and at least one weekend day. So for example you could work on Tuesday - Saturday or Sunday - Thursday.

Requirements
  • Fluent English
  • Experience in Customer Support (at least 1 year)
  • Fast learning skills
  • Multi-tasking
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Interest in the Internet and marketing
  • Keen interest in providing great customer service
  • Self-motivated attitude

Bonus points
  • Languages: French, Portuguese, Russian
  • HTML/CSS skills
  • Design skills (Photoshop)

Salary
  • 1300 - 2000 EUR/month (before taxes)

To apply: Don't send us a CV. It's boring... Instead we offer a better way to apply: signup for a free MailerLite account and create a newsletter about yourself. Send it to jobs@mailerlite.comThings we would love to see in the newsletter: links to your Linkedin, Twitter, Facebook or personal homepage; companies where you worked; 3 websites or blogs which inspire you; why you want to join MailerLite and why we should hire you.

jobs.title: Digital Developer
jobs.content:
Department for Transport


Digital Developer


Ref. 1520047


£41,587 - £45,746


London


There has never been a more exciting moment to join the Department for Transport. Right now, we’re investing in transport to make journeys simpler, faster and more reliable. Our plan will support jobs, enable business growth and bring our country closer together. There is a huge amount to say. You will help us to be heard through a range of digital platforms.


You will take the lead on web and application development and specialist digital projects. As well as managing existing systems, web operations and cloud hosting, you will drive the management, maintenance and development of digital content and products hosted off the GOV.UK platform - from online forms and forums, to campaign websites and extranets. Your responsibilities will span everything from bespoke solutions to architecture and security. Crucially, you will manage and develop our online consultation and crowd sourcing platform, for more open policy making.


To be equal to this exciting challenge, you will need working knowledge of digital and web technologies including PHP, MySQL, HTML5, CSS, Javascript, WordPress administration, API design and development, and third party API development. You will bring to the role proven experience of server administration and cloud hosting - from Linux/Ubuntu operating systems, through to Apache, Varnish and DNS administration. Most importantly, you have a track record of developing successful digital products to support communications campaigns, and managing technical projects. From influencing decision makers and managing non-expert stakeholders, to working with contractors, your communication skills and way with people really set you apart.


In addition to the breadth of opportunity and scope for rewarding achievement in this role, you will benefit from our ongoing support for your professional development through investment in skills. You will also enjoy an excellent package of Civil Service benefits.


Closing date: 28th December 2016.


To apply, please click on the apply now button.


https://www.civilservicejobs.service.gov.uk/csr/jobs.cgi?jcode=1520047

jobs.title: Développeur(se) Android
jobs.content:
L’équipe Android (4 dévs dont 1 lead) recherche aujourd’hui un(e) nouveau(lle) développeur(se) Android pour la rejoindre sur les projets suivants :


Au sein de l’équipe mobile vous travaillerez sur le développement de l’application android. Ainsi, vous aurez à :



  • Assurer la maintenance évolutive et corrective de l’application existante et développer de nouvelles fonctionnalités.

  • Respecter les processus de développement et proposer des best practices.

  • Garantir la stabilité et la performance de l’application.


Leboncoin étant dans un groupe international, vous serez amené à collaborer avec des équipes situées dans différents pays (Suède, Espagne...).

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer & Product Lead - Exciting New Website
jobs.content:
We are looking for someone to help build out the proof of concept for an exciting new website.

This is a directory listing type website so the first stage will be to create the website and basic admin features - create/edit listings individually and upload in bulk as well as other admin section features.  This stage will also include creation of a basic mobile app to view the information. 

The second stage will involve doing some intelligent scraping of information from the web.

The third stage will involve intelligently surfacing results to users.

So this role will suit someone who likes to work individually without granular specifications.  You must also be able to work across the full stack and any UI flair would be a huge advantage. 

You will be the only technical team member on this project and be able to apply a wide range of your technical expertise to this project.

The choice of technologies will be yours but I am partial to Node, React, Python, Go etc.

Initially this is a 3 month project.  I am open for between 20-40 hours per week work.

Skills & Experience:
* At least 3 years in a full stack role
* Excellent English communication skills
* Advance working knowledge of at least two programming languages
* Experience using with one database eg Mysql
* Experience working across the full stack
* Experience creating responsive sites
* Experience creating APIs
* Strong product sense
* UI sensibility
* Experience with AWS

I don't mind where in the world you work from as long as you make yourself available for the occasional Skype meeting at a Sydney friendly time.

You will mainly be working with the founder of 89n - an entrepreneur with a strong technical bent and deep online product experience.

To apply: jobs@89n.com

jobs.title: App Developer, die slimme creatieve apps bedenkt en ontwikkelt
jobs.content:
Goed is niet goed genoeg. Als App Developer werk je niet voor, maar mét klanten als de Efteling, Kia, Holland Festival, United Nations, Moeders voor Moeders en Landal GreenParks om het beste neer te zetten. Wat je er ook voor moet doen. Je ontwikkelt niet zomaar apps, maar slimme gebruiksvriendelijke software die bepalend is voor de business van je klant.


Geen managers
Dit doe je in een zelfsturend multidisciplinair scrumteam, in een organisatie waar geen managers werken. Omdat wij vinden dat je alleen dan kunt excelleren. Geen baas dus die zegt wat je moet doen, maar eigen beslissingen maken en met je team de planning bepalen. Dat betekent: durven doen en verantwoordelijkheid pakken op wat misgaat of juist beter kan. En dat alles in nauwe samenwerking met de klant; deze zit in je team en heeft een werkplek bij ons op kantoor.


Denk je nu: ‘Ja, logisch. Dat wil ik!’? Lees dan verder. Frons je hierbij je wenkbrauwen? Bel ons gerust om de vragen te stellen die je hebt.

jobs.title: .NET Software Engineer, die alleen het beste wil
jobs.content:
Goed is niet goed genoeg. Als .NET Software Engineer zet je niet voor, maar mét klanten als de Efteling, Kia, Landal GreenParks, Van Gansewinkel en Van der Valk Exclusief het beste neer. Wat je er ook voor moet doen. Je ontwikkelt niet zomaar websites of apps in Sitecore, maar mooie professionele software die voor 80% de business van je klant bepaalt.


Geen managers
Dit doe je in een zelfsturend multidisciplinair scrumteam, in een organisatie waar geen managers werken. Omdat wij vinden dat je alleen dan kunt excelleren. Geen baas dus die zegt wat je moet doen, maar eigen beslissingen maken en met je team de planning bepalen. Dat betekent: durven doen en verantwoordelijkheid pakken op wat misgaat of juist beter kan. En dat alles in nauwe samenwerking met de klant; deze zit in je team en heeft een werkplek bij ons op kantoor.


Denk je nu: ‘Ja, logisch. Dat wil ik!’? Lees dan verder. Frons je hierbij je wenkbrauwen? Bel ons gerust om de vragen te stellen die je hebt.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Company Description


Digital First Media, a business name of MediaNews Group, offers news reporting and third party advertising and directory opportunities through its more than 800 multi-platform products which include: web, mobile, tablet and print.


Job Description


Digital First Media is looking for a Data Engineer to come build something great with us. As part of the engineering team, you will work with both Engineering and Product Development to build and own stable and scalable data-driven products. We're looking for a self-motivated engineer who has a passion for working with technologies including Redshift and many other AWS services, Python, Docker, Spark and, well, whatever else catches your fancy really. Every engineer has input into our technology selection and product process and will have a real impact as part of a small, nimble team.

jobs.title: Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
Your tasks


You will have a key part in developing and improving our software applications, involving our mobile apps and websites. You will help our Product team to scale our product to millions of users globally while remaining fast, reliable and secure. One of the key aspects for scaling is remaining secure, reliable and well-tested. You will be responsible in developing and maintaining the code for automated testing.


The position is called “Automation engineer”, which means that we don’t expect you to do a lot of manual testing, but instead automate things as much as possible. But in the beginning, before everything is automated, you may need to some testing manually, to understand how things work, what is more important, what is less important to automate, etc.


Our products that need to have automated test coverage include:



  • “Natural Cycles” mobile app, that we package for iOS and Android

  • “Natural Cycles” web app, that runs in the browser (and shares the same code base, because it’s a hybrid app)


Our technical plans and challenges include



  • Maintain and develop new functionality for our core product, presented in the form of mobile apps for iOS and Android, as well as browser-based client

  • Ensure highest quality, performance and security of the product

  • Ensure continuous delivery of new software releases while working in Agile way

  • Maintain a healthy and consistent codebase with minimized technical debt and flexibility to expand

  • Have a good coverage of automated end-to-end and unit tests

  • Have routine operations automated (continuous integration, reproducible builds, gulp, livereload, etc)

  • Have a great product team

  • Make working together fun & efficient

  • Allow everyone to take initiative and contribute to the success of the company and product

  • Allow everyone to participate in technical decisions

  • Encourage learning

  • Move towards emerging new industry standards when they become mature and stable (Angular 2, Ionic 2, ES6, TypeScript, ...)

  • Contribute to the open-source community by publishing reusable parts of the code

jobs.title: Online Advertising Team Lead (Part-Time)
jobs.content:
Make a Dent in the Universe by Solving the Number One Problem Faced by Medical Researchers

Helloâweâre Trialfacts, a remote company, and without us, a lot of medical research would not be possible. Weâre searching for an experienced, part-time online advertising team lead to manage and ensure the performance of our online advertising campaigns, while innovating and improving our advertising processes. If youâre looking for a position where you can set your own hours, take holidays as you see fit, work remotely from home or while traveling, and help medical research succeed, then please read on. 

Our clientsâmedical research organizations, are working hard to continue to develop treatments, increase our understanding, eradicate sickness and improve quality of life.

Our companyâTrialfacts, removes the biggest hurdle and frustration to conducting their research, by recruiting the patients they require for their clinical trials, and often times saving the day when they come to us to find the patients they need, or else have their research invalidated. 

Weâre looking for someone who can:

AdvertiseâYouâll need to create, manage and optimize our Facebook advertising campaigns and funnels. This includes complete ownership of the landing pages and multi-page forms we use to collect patient data.

OptimizeâYouâll be managing our campaigns from end to end, and expected to continuously run experiments and evaluate new strategies, processes and technologies to continuously improve performance and CPA. Youâll be expected to contribute to ongoing process and systems improvement, to support efficient campaign setup, efficient client onboarding and CPA improvement.

LearnâIn addition to developing an in-depth understanding of clinical trials generally, youâll also on an ongoing basis need to be able to rapidly develop a thorough understanding of each of our clientâs clinical trials, their concerns, and then use that knowledge to create advertising collateral. If youâre intimidated by medical jargon then you need not apply.

LeadâWeâre looking for someone who will provide leadership in the operations team, and is open to playing a growing leadership role within our small but fast-growing business.

CollaborateâWeâre looking for someone who is not afraid of picking up the phone, calling a client, brainstorming and working towards a solution. Part of this role is to help onboard our new clients, provide updates, as well as solve any client campaign issues that come up.

Whatâs in it for you:

AutonomyâWe donât have set working hours. We donât have a holiday policy (you can take your holidays whenever you want). We donât micromanage or babysit.

Youâll be accountable to the rest of the team purely on your results, and not on the number of hours spent working. Our team is remote (we communicate via Slack and Google Hangouts). We set our own hours based on what works for us and our clients. As long as you have a decent internet connection and can overlap with our clientsâ working hours in the United States and Australia for a phone call, you can work from wherever you choose.

InnovationâWeâre the first and only company in our industry to guarantee our results. Weâve launched innovative patient recruitment strategies (e.g., our phone screening appointment system, researcher interviews) that provide predictability and certainty in a volatile industry, and weâre constantly improving our service.

We apply the same innovative approach to our patient advertising and recruitment process, and our client communication. Weâre currently focused on streamlining and automating client onboarding, education and gathering feedback from our clients, and we're always interested in the latest and greatest software tools and improvements that technology provides.

ImpactâTrialfacts plays an extremely important role in contributing to medical research and driving humanity forward. Our clientsâresearchers working at universities, pharmaceutical companies, biotech companies, natural medicine companies, hospitals and medical practicesâwork hard to develop treatments that cure diseases and improve quality of life.

We are the only company that solves clinical trial recruitment problems in a predictable and reliable wayâour consistent, results-driven process makes us the only recruitment company that provides a money-back guarantee.

OpportunityâWeâre a rapidly growing company, 100% year on year via organic growth through repeat business and referrals. We offer an attractive part-time salary, and the possibility to move into a full-time position and/or leadership role in the business. The future looks optimistic as we continue to improve and expand on our core service.

View the full position description at http://signup.trialfacts.com/advertising-team-lead.

To apply: Complete the job application at https://trialfacts.wufoo.com/forms/m1nk6usf19rh6d2/.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We're on a mission to accelerate science, and our platform is transforming how technology gets to market. Resolute is the leading marketplace for patents, inventions, and technology, offering powerful AI-driven tools to aid in discovery. Our software annotates hundreds of millions of scientific documents from around the world, then cuts through them in milliseconds to deliver actionable insights to our users.  
  
We're looking to bring on experienced engineers who have fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, and UI design. There is a lot to do, no red tape, and no limit to the impact you can have.

jobs.title: Data Engineering Manager- SF/MN
jobs.content:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve health and wellness of its users and advance the state of health care using modern technologies and end-user engagement.  Rally Health is a privately owned company of 400 employees with major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group.  We have partnered with several insurance companies including UHG and other large corporations for user acquisition, clinical data feeds, and monetization.


In this role you will be enabling business intelligence, analytics, and data science by building data pipeline infrastructure and services.  This position combines technical lead and management roles.  You will serve as an architect and mentor for a small growing data engineering team. You will be responsible for temperature and performance of your team, communicating across Engineering and Product organizations, and representing your team technically and strategically.  At the same time you will provide code reviews, help improve code, troubleshoot systems, participate in an on-call rotation, as well as write code as your bandwidth permits.


Our technologies include:



  • Kafka, Hadoop (CDH), Avro, Spark and Spark Streaming, Airflow

  • Scala, Play, Akka

  • AWS, Docker, Mesos

  • MongoDB, Postgres


Here is what you need:



  • Previous technical lead or management experience within a scrum/agile development framework

  • Previous history of successful project delivery

  • Command of Scala (or Java and a desire to learn Scala)

  • Command of SQL

  • Command of data structures and algorithms

  • Experience in maintaining production Hadoop infrastructure

  • Experience in designing and developing ETL and streaming data pipelines on Hadoop

  • Experience with distributed systems and application design in a SOA environment  

  • Ability to track down root causes and fix them in systematic ways

  • Strong computer science fundamentals

  • Analytical strategic thinking with strong problem solving skills and attention to detail

  • Self-starter and result-oriented attitude with a strong sense of ownership and team motivational skills

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related engineering field


Rally Health is committed to ensuring that its workforce reflects America’s diverse population.  Rally Health knows that such diversity will enrich us with the talent, energy, perspective and inspiration it needs to achieve its mission.  Rally Health believes in a policy of equal employment and opportunity for all people based on merit and commitment to the principles of diversity.  It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote individuals in all job titles, and administer all programs, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, sex, age, marital status, pregnancy, child birth or related medical conditions, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, genetic information, disability, matriculation, political affiliation, veteran status, union affiliation, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.


Individuals with disabilities and veterans are encouraged to apply.  Applicants who require an accommodation related to the application and/or review process should notify Jin Yoo, Sr. Manager - Talent Acquisition (recruiting@rallyhealth.com). 


Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
