jobs.title: Account Executive (Sales)
jobs.content:
JOIN TESERA AND SELL WITH US

We require a uniquely talented and self motivated Account Executive to join our team at Tesera!  Each day you will connect with leads, prospects and clients to create and convert opportunities to sales, as we strive to become the  preferred consulting team for creating data driven applications and integrations in the cloud.

You will support a dynamic team of developers, designers and data scientists while having more time to pursue your passions.  We think we can help make your job easy by running an Agile product management process that our clients love, by working on a modern application stack based on Amazon Web Services (which just opened a Canadian Region), by providing  clients with differentiating User Experiences built on modern web-technology, and by adding value to application investments through expert integration and middleware.  

You will work remotely, have flexible work hours and help us create meaningful and profitable projects. We pride ourselves in learning new technologies and applying that learning to improve the products we create for ourselves and our clients.

Does this sound like the job for you?

WHERE WE NEED YOUR HELP

Our professional services business has largely been made up of recurring clients and referrals.  Weâve never been excellent at managing our sales pipeline, directing our marketing resources, and developing new prospects.  We are motivated to change this and we require your expertise to build and take our professional services to a larger scale.    

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Business to business account development, generating revenue and meeting sales quotas.
  • Managing sales cycles including developing and optimizing a sales pipeline, maintaining pursuit strategies focused on key decision makers, negotiating key deal terms and closing contractual agreements.
  • Developing and qualifying leads to drive additional sales opportunities through cold-calling, networking, and other contact methods (priority).
  • Guide prospects through demos of our approach and products over video call and in person.
  • Direct the team to provide the support materials you require to be successful.

Who are we looking for

  • 2+ years of experience in full-cycle solutions sales.
  • An understanding of selling approaches and methodologies, including value selling, target account selling, solutions selling and strategic selling.
  • Proven track record of exceeding high-volume sales targets for software solutions and services.
  • Experience selling multiple product/service lines.
  • Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles.
  • Skilled and eloquent in writing.
  • Fanatical  about video conference / phone selling.
  • Knowledge of internet applications, data applications, and consulting services.
  • Prior experience at Internet, Consulting or SaaS companies (preferred).
  • Working knowledge of CRM and email automation tools (preferred).

WHAT WE DO:

Tesera is an emerging technology company focusing on three business lines.  Our primary business lines are as follows:

Professional Services has always been a focus for Tesera.  We help our clients implement projects in areas such as open data, data management through visualization and analysis, data science, commercial product development and geospatial solutions.  In the past year our Professional Services teams have completed a variety of projects including building the SaaS platform for an award winning energy services asset management startup, building a set of citizen science mobile monitoring apps, building a new way to share environmental monitoring data, building a sophisticated automated data quality control pipeline for the forest sector, creating a portal for biodiversity monitoring data, and delivering a series of applications to support the Fort McMurray wildfire recovery.  Helping us build and expand this core service area will be your primary responsibility.  

Our second business line is in the adaption to climate change space.  Tesera has worked with a key industry associations to build a risk assessment tool that will support and assist municipalities in discovering asset vulnerabilities.  Tesera is commercializing this product which employs a spatial machine learning approach.  We break the landscape down into thousands of spatial indicators which can then be modeled to determine their influence on event outcomes such as infrastructure failures.  We have a lot of work to do here to bring this to a commercial product offering and we are very excited about doing it.  

High Resolution Inventory Service  (HRIS) is our third business area.  HRIS enables our clients who manage landscapes to have a higher level of resolution and accuracy that theyâve ever had before.  HRIS combines LiDAR, colour infrared imagery, climate indices, terrain indices and ground plot data via machine learning processes to predict attributes about the landscape.  The types of information that can be generated from HRIS are far-ranging from types and quality of timber resources to locations of streams, potential wildlife habitat and amount of carbon sequestration.  The HRIS solution, creates attributes across an  entire landscape creating an inventory that has more useful attributes and is at a more detailed resolution than other approaches available today.  

OUR PURPOSE & VALUES:

âWe disrupt conventional thinking to expand what is possible.

We ignite change in the future we share.â

Accountability:  We hold ourselves, and each other accountable for all we do.
Communication:  We communicate openly and honestly. We listen.  Each is heard and considered.  We share feedback and express gratitude.
Community:  We contribute and lead within communities that empower and inspire us.
Design and Innovation:  We craft elegant solutions using beautiful ideas and innovation.
Fiscal:  We are responsible for our fiscal health and vitality.     
Fun:  We are the spark that triggers awesome.
Health, Fitness and Balance:   Space-Time is ours to define.  We bend work to balance our lives.
Personal Development:   We are driven to learn.  We push each other to expand our horizons.
Relationships:   We build trusting relationships.
Sustainability:  We act in relentless pursuit of a sustainable future.

To apply: We want to hear about how you can help us. Please describe what about Tesera interests you and how you think you can help pursue our purpose and support our values. Please send along the following to Bruce MacArthur, President and CEO at bruce.macarthur@tesera.comA RÃ©sumÃ© - what have you done?A Cover Letter - how can you help Tesera? How does Teseraâs purpose align with you?

jobs.title: Senior Development Manager
jobs.content:
Giles-Parscale, an award-winning digital agency located in downtown San Antonio, is looking for a Senior Development Manager to join our growing team. As a senior development manager, you will be responsible managing a team of back-end and front-end web developers that create custom web development projects and offer technical support solutions for other PHP/CMS related issues. Knowledge of HTML/CSS is required for project work. Must have hands-on experience working in Content Management Systems - ExpressionEngine experience required.


This is a full-time, salaried position in the range of $50-90,000/year, depending on experience. Past experience in web development is a requirement, and you must be willing to work in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment and do whatever it takes to help our clients achieve — and exceed — their goals and objectives. Our mantra is collaboration, creativity and freedom — we are a highly-motivated team of individuals who enjoy working together, but respect each other’s unique vision and talents, encouraging the freedom to creatively decide how to create the best solutions.


Responsibilities:



  • Effectively lead, support and develop the Web Development team

  • Coordinate with the Head of Account Management and Head of Sales for resource assignment of development personnel to ensure optimized workflow between teams and project completion meets deadlines

  • Create weekly reports of any problems and status of progress of all projects for managers

  • Work with clients for end-user training and ongoing support

  • Continually follow the industry trends and regulations to increase effectiveness and ensure compliance

  • Oversee the training, motivation, discipline and performance evaluation of assigned employees

jobs.title: UI Engineer
jobs.content:
What We Need


 An experienced JavaScript UI Engineer who will work as part of a team to develop front-end client and consumer applications for Passport®, which includes our flagship eCommerce product, client access control and a host of best-in-class web applications. You’ll be expected to participate in daily stand-ups and sprint planning sessions as part of our Agile development process. We move fast and as priorities shift, you’ll need to keep up with your peers. We need someone who can code, collaborate and contribute.


Who We Are


accesso Technology Group, plc® is a world-wide software company delivering industry leading virtual queuing, eCommerce and ticketing solutions for the attractions, cultural and leisure industries. Passport® is one of four product lines of the accesso brand, joining the accesso Technology Group in 2012, and is the attractions industry’s leading eCommerce provider with 28+ million tickets sold online per year and over $1 billion processed transactions annually.


Our Passport® OnSite, OnLine and OnTheGo modules are leveraged by clients worldwide. With deployments in North America, Europe, Asia and Australia, we help our clients achieve their goals through our unsurpassed service, rapid release software deployment, commitment to innovation, and focus on security. 


If you are interested in joining a team who values Passion, Commitment, Teamwork, Innovation and Integrity and what we’ve described above is YOU, then apply today and let’s talk!

jobs.title: Web Developer - CMS Developer
jobs.content:
Summary: Antimicrobial Therapy, Inc., a family-owned and operated medical information company, seeks a Web Developer to work on-site and assist with Plone CMS development to provide clinical decision support information and tools to over a million prescribers and pharmacists worldwide.


Responsibilities: Antimicrobial Therapy, Inc. is expanding our software engineering team to meet the demands of our company’s expansion into the Healthcare Information Technology (HIT) sector. We are looking for a Web Developer who can quickly jump in and assist with the development, administration, and maintenance of our Plone 5 site, in addition to working with other HIT vendors to develop platform interoperability. The Web Developer will join our software engineering team to help further cultivate our expanding product line. This is a full-time position based in our office in Sperryville, Virginia.


Primary duties will include:



  • Web development, administration, and maintenance of our Plone 5 site, to include:


    • Managing and developing Plone Add-Ons

    • Building content types in the Dexterity content type system

    • Zope Object Database (ZODB) configuration and management

    • Managing content and user permissions

    • Develop and maintain site APIs

    • Assist with the design, development, and maintenance of a ZEO cluster implementation


  • Integration of our data into external clinical decision support (CDS) and electronic health record (EHR) platforms, and integration externally-generated data into our software platforms.

  • Optimizing site performance via an Amazon Web Services implementation

  • Create and maintain software design specifications

  • Working as part of an interdisciplinary team


The position may also assist with (depending upon the candidate’s interests and abilities):



  • Mobile application development (iOS, Android, Windows 10)

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
You are already a full stack engineer, or looking to become one on your next gig. You have worked at scale, shipped, done some side projects, and are now looking for a real challenge and a great team to join.


Come join us as an integral member of a small but highly motivated and ambitious team to build and manage scalable and performance oriented software for an innovative spatial analytics company.


Our first product is a SaaS web mapping and analytics solution for businesses across the US. A few of the components that we use include Go, React, Javascript, Mesos, Node, Spark, Leaflet, Docker, Crate, Git and, of course, AWS.


JOB ROLE



  • Comfortable developing across the entire stack, or learning to. Quickly.

  • Take part in establishing and driving best practices and engineering practices geared towards shipping products.

  • Design, implement, and maintain software systems & infrastructure.

  • Refactor and improve maintainability of the codebase.

  • Solve complex scalability, platform, and integration problems.

  • Learn new paradigms, languages, and libraries as you work.

  • Build, manage & maintain multiple application environments, including production.

  • Manage systems and work in all aspects of the kanban driven software development lifecycle.

  • Work closely with Product and Data Science teams.

jobs.title: Senior QA Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
Conduce is building a data visualization platform for real-time operational monitoring and collaborative data discovery.  Our Systems Engineering team provides stable, scalable and secure infrastructure to make this happen.  Using tooling and development best practices, we define systems as code which can be run anywhere, on anything.


We are currently looking for a Senior QA Automation Engineer to join our QA team to help maintain and evolve our automated test efforts. 


The Senior QA Automation Engineer performs software quality assurance tasks to ensure that developed products and services meet design specifications, are scalable and reliable and meet total quality management criteria and standards. Communicates with product & operations organization regarding test results and works with engineering team as well as with cross-functional teams to interpret feedback into product changes. Documents and reports on software performance issues. Communicates with developers, project managers and other development staff regarding software performance issues and testing processes. Develops test automation scripts and executes both manual and automated testing protocols.


Responsibilities:



  • Review, maintain and evolve current automated tests and test framework.

  • Develop and maintain automation test framework and test cases for functional, performance and regression test execution.

  • Lead development of automation test scripts.

  • Validate and sign off on complex test plans.

  • Execute automated test cases and perform manual test confirmation to validate test results.

  • Contribute to the creation of QA documentation, documents system and framework architectures.

  • Participate in the development of broad technical solutions that meet specifications and that impact future developments.

  • Assist engineering team with the isolation of difficult bugs and root cause analysis.

  • Participate in release activities with DevOps, validate and approve release requirements to confirm successful delivery into production.

jobs.title: Senior QA Engineer
jobs.content:
Conduce is building a data visualization platform for real-time operational monitoring and collaborative data discovery.  Our Systems Engineering team provides stable, scalable and secure infrastructure to make this happen.  Using tooling and development best practices, we define systems as code which can be run anywhere, on anything.


We are currently looking for a Software QA Engineer to join our QA team to assist with manual and automated web application testing. 


The Senior QA Engineer performs test planning, test development, manual and automated test execution in support of project release goals and requirements, as well as collaborating with other QA/Development team members to ensure comprehensive test coverage and improve overall product quality.  


Responsibilities: 



  • Define and maintain test plans and test specifications for functional, regression, and performance testing; manual execution of test cases, manual validation of automation failures; reporting product failures.

  • Conduct review and sign-off for test plans and use cases.

  • Take ownership of certain product module QA efforts.

  • Work closely with engineering teams to analyze and resolve product defects.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content: The candidate will be an individual software contributor in a team working on Sonus Networks products. This involves understanding the applications for the device; write architectural, functional and design specifications, unit test plans, develop and test software, provide peer-review and feedback where applicable and support the qualification/marketing/sales/support/documentation/project management teams.

jobs.title: Full-Time C# or PHP Backend Developer
jobs.content:
Do you thrive on high-quality code?
Hi! We are TidTilForsikring (TimeForInsurance); a Danish startup looking to change the way, people look at insurances. Most people think it's quite a boring (and complex) subject, and a lot of people actually end up having the wrong insurance coverage.

Our goal is to change this. We have developed our first prototype, but now we're looking for more ressources to finish up the product for release.

We want to achieve this goal, by building a tool which uses 'questions' to analyse the situation, that our users are in, and using their answers to generate an insurance package that'll fit perfectly into their lives.

The first prototype has already been built, and is working really well. But to take the prototype to the next level and getting ready for release, we need an extra pair of hands.

TTF was founded in november 2015, and we've spent the past year analyzing the Danish insurance market, to ensure we have the data needed, to build our tool.

About us
We are a currently a small team all located in Denmark.

Jens Christian is the CEO of the company. He's been working for a number of large Danish insurance companies for the past many years and he's the main driving force behind TTF. He's the one analyzing the insurance policies and terms to make sure we have the correct data grounds, while he's also getting our contracts with the insurance companies.

Lasse is our online marketing specialist, and he's previously worked as an OM consultant at one of the largest Danish web bureaus. He's also been an integral part of the business development part, and is in charge of both marketing and on-site optimization.

Lars is the technical lead. He manages the development team consisting of two freelancers, while also participating in the actual development and architecture of the platform.

Other than the three people mentioned above, we have another investor who also has extensive knowledge of the insurance market in Denmark, and acts as an advisor as well as an investor.

What are we looking for?
We are looking for a full-time remote backend developer who takes pride in high-quality, maintainable and pretty code.

Your main tasks will be to further develop the algorithms used to generate the insurance and coverage suggestions. 

You will be a part of the team consisting of Lars and two freelance programmers (a frontender and a backender).

The skill-set of the ideal candidate
The requirements for this position are:

  • PHP (or C#), ninja-level
  • Experience working SOLID
  • REST-experience
  • Git-experience

As a bonus, but not a requirement, it would be a plus if you to have some experience with:

  • Gitflow
  • Microservices

To apply: To apply for the job, you will need to complete a simple assignment and attach it along with your application. The assignment can be found here: http://tidtilforsikring.dk/jobs/assignment.pdf , and should be doable within a reasonable timeframe. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Lars, on lars@tidtilforsikring.dk. The assignment (or link to GitHub/BitBucket) and your application should be sent to lars@tidtilforsikring.dk. Please note that any applications that does not contain a finished assignment, will not be taken into consideration.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
Our sophisticated web crawler helps some of the world's top companies improve their web sites by giving them deep, comprehensive insights into their problems -- and solutions. Companies that make their business on the web depend on DeepCrawl to improve user experience, manage change, and improve indexability.


Your role is to bring your passion for Ruby and other open-source technologies to build better tools for improving web sites. In the end, it’s all about making the web a nicer place for users -- with fewer annoying gimmicks and more genuinely useful, well designed, easily found resources.


We’ve built our stack on AWS and leading open source technologies: Ruby, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, AngularJS.  As a Ruby developer, you’ll be writing backend code with our core team, and will have ample opportunity to learn new skills and evaluate leading-edge technologies as we seek the most powerful ways to reach our users.



Responsibilities will include:



  • Work with a small but growing team of developers who are passionate about improving design, usability, reliability, scalability, and clarity of code, all with the end goal of satisfying our many users and making the web a better place

  • Help improve the scalability and performance of our crawler’s data processing pipeline, and improve your understanding of performant and scalable design

  • Run benchmarks for performance- and resource-sensitive features

  • Help improve test coverage and testability of code

  • Work with product owners to write technical specifications for new features

  • Help improve internal tools for monitoring, testing, bug fixing, and administration

  • Provide mentoring and architectural guidance for other devs (architectural planning, code reviews)

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
TST is an online travel shopping and booking software company. We build and grow an innovative private label solution, specifically tailored to online customers, travel agencies, and home-based travel agents. Our goal is to deliver the foremost experience for consumers and travel agents to shop for and book flights, hotels, cruises, car rentals, and trip activities. Our unsurpassed travel agent product gives agents the tools they need to help their customers find the best available deals for their travel needs.


What you are going to do


You'll be an integral part of one of our agile and autonomous teams.  Your team will include  a product owner, three to five developers, a QA automation engineer, a manual tester, and a customer support representative.


Your team’s mission is to expand and improve one of our many travel products (Agent, Air, Car, Cruise, Hotel, Trip and Vacation). With the support of designers, operations engineers, and experienced travel agents, your team will be self-sufficient and given the autonomy to make your own decisions on how best to solve problems and innovate.


How you will be doing this


Our back-end is written in Scala and we use the Play! Framework and SBT to build reactive applications. We integrate with a variety of travel providers using SOAP and REST. Our current front-end is built on Backbone.js and Twirl templates, but we have already started a migration to AngularJS and are in the process of fully separating our front-end from the back-end.


We embrace continuous delivery and prefer feature toggles to long lived branches. This allows us to deploy new releases daily. And by adding Docker to our development pipeline, we are going to simplify our local development setup, ensure that our applications run identically in all our environments and ship new features even faster.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
** This is a Remote Only position **


In this role, you will take ownership of web development and build Auction Mobility’s web platforms to drive the success of our platform. You will participate and help drive architecture decisions of the web platform including brandings and customizations for clients.

jobs.title: Senior Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
Since 2008, Teldio has been developing voice & data apps in the digital two-way radio industry. In 2013, we started working on a web app that allows manufacturers and dealers to design, document, deliver and manage these networks (hence the name D3M). We help sales reps and technicians collaborate in real-time and design complex networks while automating their workflow (autogenerated quotes, system proposals, etc.).


Our team has continued to grow and D3M is now its very own division within Teldio. It’s a very exciting time for us and we’re looking for the ideal candidate that has both the skills and the energy to succeed within our team.  We’re seeking a Senior Web Application Developer to help improve our architecture, plan out new product enhancements and assist our team in scaling our user base. You’ll be part of a small team that aims to build a powerful and reliable tool for our ever-growing base of users. We’re passionate about the code we write and the tools we use and are looking for someone who shares that passion. We always work with quality in mind and take pride in our creations.


If you love web development, have strong coding skills and enjoy working as part of a team, come join us! Here's a short video on what it's like here at Teldio: http://goo.gl/trmM7U.


Oh, and here’s the web app you’d be working on www.d3mradios.com. It’s a pretty awesome tool, but don’t just take our word for it, check out what our customers have to say: http://goo.gl/y9hzom


What you’ll be doing



  • Scoping out features with the team to prepare for development

  • Architecting and improving the framework that powers D3M

  • Choosing from a backlog of features to work on the things that interest you most

  • Hacking on projects outside the scope of our backlog to build your skills, try new things, and make our jobs easier



What you need



  • Passion for learning and sharing knowledge

  • Positive attitude for collaborating

  • Ability to adapt to the situation at hand

  • Creativity for solving tough problems or simplifying existing solutions

  • Experience with some of the following: Scaling web applications, API design, Server performance tuning, Ruby, Elasticsearch, Redis, AWS



How you can make an impression



  • Experience leading development teams

  • Ability to analyze problems and choose the right solution for the job

  • Creativity. We read a lot of resumes...

  • Code samples that you‘re proud of



Perks & Benefits



  • Competitive compensation packages & employee stock option plans.

  • Full coverage for medical, dental, and vision. You even get free massages!

  • Flexible work schedule. Yes, some of us enjoy starting our days earlier than others…

  • 2 weeks of personal vacation (3 after your 1st year) and 1 week off during the Holidays!

  • The opportunity to mingle, network & learn from other dynamic companies as part of the Wesley Clover Tech incubator.

  • Free coffee to keep you sharp and access to our Office Keg, Dartboard, Foosball & Ping pong tables.



Interested?


Please submit your resume as well as a cover letter describing why you’d be a good fit for this role.

jobs.title: iOS Software Developer
jobs.content:
Matter and Form Inc., a brilliant startup looking for brilliant people to join our team, is seeking an experienced iOS Software Developer with expertise in Objective-C and C++. Join our small team of 15 people as we create new and truly disruptive technologies. Here's one of the amazing projects you will be working on, bevel 3D (http://bevel3d.net).  Our first award-winning product delivered the world’s most easy-to-use and affordable 3D scanner to the consumer and prosumer market.  We are looking for experienced, creative, dedicated people that can think problems through and design considered solutions.


The ideal candidate will have 5-10 years of experience developing iOS apps for distribution on the App Store and be knowledgable of 3D math and C++ integration. Matter and Form’s technology interprets complex spatial input data and the successful candidate will preferably have experience with or schooling in computer vision, programming 3D environments, and/or higher mathematics.  Most importantly, we’re looking for someone who takes pride and ownership of their work, and who brings an approach that reflects the values of our company: innovative thinking, energy, excellence and enthusiasm.


Matter and Form is willing to offer up to $1000 of financial aid toward the costs of relocation for candidates outside the Greater Toronto Area. 


Responsibilities: 



  • iOS application and OS X app development;

  • Build easy-to-use client technologies;

  • Be involved in all phases of product development from concepts through requirements, use cases, implementation and test-to-live deployment;

  • Participate in the analysis, design and development of the product.

jobs.title: Academic Enterprise Programmer-Analyst
jobs.content:
Academic Enterprise Programmer-Analyst


University of California, Santa Cruz



Applications and Project Management



JOB #: 1606878



FULL TIME; CAREER


Starting Salary Range: $90,000 - $105,000/annually. Salary commensurate with qualifications and experience.



UCSC strives to embrace diversity in all its forms; it strives to be an inclusive community that fosters an open, enlightened & productive environment.



Involves writing programs in a computer language, designing related databases, web interfaces and content, or multimedia processes. Designs, develops, modifies, tests and evaluates and maintains computer programs. Work includes test-to-production processes, quality assurance, maintenance and documentation of applications. Includes web applications programming. Implements and maintains selected modules of a comprehensive campus-wide academic information system. Analyzes requirements for selected modules, providing related technical specifications, application testing and assistance with data migrations and application interfaces.



Experienced professional who knows how to apply theory and put it into practice with in-depth understanding of the professional field; independently performs the full range of responsibilities within the function; possesses broad job knowledge; analyzes problems/issues of diverse scope and determines solutions.



Uses skills as a seasoned, experienced applications programming professional with a full understanding of industry practices and campus policies and procedures; resolves a wide range of issues. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Supports Oracle's PeopleSoft Enterprise Campus Solutions suite of software and other applications within the Academic Applications portfolio. Strategizes, architects, and deploys the conversion of enterprise legacy systems to contemporary standards, using in-house skill sets or SaaS as necessary. Troubleshoots bugs and participates in scheduled development releases to extend and enhance the vendor-delivered application with a strong focus on supportability and sustainability. Scopes work and manages development cycles in a team-based environment to meet project deliverables and deadlines.



Qualifications include:



• Bachelors degree in related area and/or equivalent experience/training.



• Experience with the full systems development lifecycle.



• Advanced knowledge of Oracle PeopleTools 8.5x development environment and PeopleSoft-related technologies such as Application Package PeopleCode, Application Engine, Application Messaging, and Integration Broker.



• Functional knowledge of Oracle's PeopleSoft Campus Solutions 9.0 suite of software.



• Experience with RESTful web service construction and usage.



Position is open until filled; Initial Review Date: 12-19-2016



APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO USE THE UCSC ON-LINE PROCESS


View full job description and access on-line application: http://apptrkr.com/931872



To ensure review of application materials by the hiring unit they must be submitted electronically via the Staff Employment Opportunities web site (http://jobs.ucsc.edu ) on or before the initial review date. Computers are available at the UCSC Staff Human Resources office located at 1201 Shaffer Road, Santa Cruz. For further information or to request disability accommodation call 831-459-2009. Hearing impaired are encouraged to use the California Relay Service 800-735-2922. The University of California, Santa Cruz is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: International Business Development for Shipping Service
jobs.content:
Fishisfast provides people and business around the world with a virtual US address, and allows them the easily buy from US ecommerce.

What separates us from our competitors is our focus on creating a uniquely powerful customer experience. Our service is so powerful and simple that a single use will usually convince a competitor's user to switch permanently. 

Our service has been a long time in the making, and we can serve customer needs like no other in the industry. Now we're ready to expand our service to new markets around the world. So, we are looking for partners to help with international business development.

Because of the nature of our industry, every market has a potentially different set of challenges, opportunities and use cases for a service like ours. Our business development leads will work closely with us to identify these challenges and opportunities and help discover where the things we can do intersect with the needs of a local market.

We will offer an initial 3-month contract during which we lay the groundwork and assess the potential of the region in question, with the option of extending to 6 months where we see promise, and finally becoming a permanent position when the region shows itself to be a viable addition to our supported markets.

We are currently most interested in candidates with a strong research background and deep knowledge of the following areas of the world:

* Russia / Eastern Europe
* South Korea
* Brazil
* India
* Australia and New Zealand
* Spanish-speaking Latin America
* China / Chinese-speaking world
* Japan
* Middle East
* Others (will consider candidates from anywhere)

Our ideal candidates:
* Are able to independently make decisions and implement ideas
* Think strategically
* Take the time to have an informed opinion on key issues
* Are willing to fight to see the right direction taken
* Have experience with an international focus
* Are great written communicators
* Can lead and inspire a diverse team

The successful candidate for this position will:
* Live or have lived in target markets for an extended time (cannot stress this enough)
* Speak the language of the target markets at an advanced business level (native is great, too!)
* Understand the long term opportunities and challenges of our industry
* Have a good understanding of online marketing tools and concepts
* Be highly organized, focused and able to condense large amounts of information down to the most relevant points

At Fishisfast, our team works remotely. The successful candidate will join our remote team and will need to become very familiar with the software we use to plan work and collaborate over long distances (mainly Slack, Basecamp, Asana, Skype, and Google Apps).

To apply: Send a resume and some information about yourself to resume@fishisfast.com

jobs.title: WordPress Plugin Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking to hire an experienced, versatile WordPress developer to lead development of a popular WordPress mobile theme plugin. This is a mature product used by many thousands of sites. Nevertheless, like any product, it requires continuing development to address security issues, bugs, and continue releasing features that address the shifting needs of the WordPress community.


If you're an experienced WordPress developer, this position may seem a little different. You won't be answering to clients, and you won't be guessing at the wishes of non-technical managers.


Instead, you'll work alongside a remote team of experienced startup founders to create and execute a long-term product development strategy. We have the first 6 months scoped out already, but after that, you will be leading product development and acting as the technical lead and, indeed, the product ambassador!


This is a flexible part-time position; that is, we expect that the person who fills it is ambitious enough to be working on another projects alongside it.

jobs.title: Front-End Developer with an interest in UX/UI (mid-Level/senior)
jobs.content:
Real Audience is a Swedish tech company within the Artificial Intelligence / Big Data field, focusing on collecting and storing specific site data, do calculations on the data and help our customers to take actions based on the computed predictions.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a front end developer. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that lives in Central or Eastern European countries.

Your main responsibility will be to contribute to the front end systems that our customers are using.

You should have a sense for:
  • Clear and concise JavaScript code
  • HTML and CSS with extensions such as Sass and Less
  • Test Driven Development (TDD)
  • Identifying and optimizing front-end related performance issues
  • Working with agile methodology, such as Scrum
  • Common tools, such as Git
  • Working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should:
  • Have a good sense for graphics and UX
  • Have experience with modern JS frameworks (e.g. Angular, React)
  • Have experience with HTML&CSS frameworks like Twitter Bootstrap
  • Have at least three years of programming background
  • Have an interest in high software quality

Additionally, you:
  • Seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • Inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • Are a passionate developer, proud of the quality of your work
  • Are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • Are able to communicate well in spoken and written English
  • Are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland or Norway for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • Live within the CEE-area (for example Poland, Ukraine, western Russia etc.) - time zones between UTC and UTC+4

Bonus points for:
  • An interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions
  • A university degree in technology, science or other relevant areas

We offer:
  • An opportunity for you to work with, and create, cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence
  • Work in the Amazon AWS environment with a modern technology stack, such as Cassandra, Spark, and ElasticSearch
  • No technical debt
  • Stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • A great and experienced remote team
  • A permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice - range â¬2000 - â¬3000)

To apply: Please send your application together with CV and relevant links (open source contributions, Github/Stack Overflow accounts, public projects, code samples etc.) to Real Audience AB. Please also state clearly in which country you reside and will work from.Email address for applications: aXJlYWxseXdhbnR0b3dvcmt3aXRoeW91@realaudience.se

We're looking for a team player to work with other Profium's skilled developers who love to help each other one and have the passion to develop and maintain high quality software products. We develope and maintain software products for Finnish and  international customers. We would like to have you work with us either at our Espoo or Mikkeli office in Finland. Profium is continuously welcoming applications from top talents to keep the company on the growth path. We would like to have you work with us either at our Espoo or Mikkeli office in Finland.


Please address your application by email to:
careers@profium.com with a title 'Java Software engineer'.
