jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a Senior Front End Developer to join our Which? Digital team.


About us


Which? launched almost 70 years ago in a Bethnal Green garage.  It’s not our love of toasters that has kept us going all these years, it’s our ability to evolve.


From our high–traffic websites to our emerging apps, we want customers to access information in the way that suits them.  As our Senior Front End Developer, you’ll make sure our sites look and feel great to offer a brilliant online experience.


What you can expect


We love everything digital and get excited by new technologies. We hold hack days to get teams thinking differently and challenge our existing approach. As a technical expert and role model within the team, we’ll want you to think like this every day.


This isn’t a run-of-the-mill role. We don’t just want you to build beautiful sites (although that is important), we want you to shape our future.


What we’ll need from you


It goes without saying that you’re an excellent developer. It’s important to us that you enjoy working with people too. This role is as much about collaborating both within and outside of your team as it is about your technical ability.


Technologies


So you can make an impact on the team and help junior Developers, you need to be already working with the following:



  • Hand-coded OOP JavaScript

  • JavaScript testing frameworks (Jasmine or Mocha)

  • Front-end libraries - ideally React or AngularJS

  • jQuery

  • CSS and Sass (or similar)

  • HTML5

  • Progressive enhancement

  • Agile practices (Scrum or Kanban)


We’d get really excited if you any experience or knowledge of the below:



  • Isomorphic JavaScript applications

  • Node.js

  • Ruby on Rails

  • Package and module managers, e.g. Webpack

  • EcmaScript2015

  • Automated cross-browser testing tools


What we’ll give you in return


Let’s not be modest, our rewards package is one of the best out there. You’ll get 28 days’ annual leave, an interest-free season ticket loan, life assurance, and a pension scheme that increases to 11% after you’ve been here for a year.


The legal stuff


We don’t mean to sound bureaucratic, but there are certain boxes we have to tick.  Eligibility to live and work in the UK is one of them. We need you to confirm in your application that you are able to accept a role without the need for sponsorship.  We really don’t want to waste your time, so please only apply if you are an EU citizen or hold a valid Visa. We will ask to see your passport (or equivalent) at interview stage.

jobs.title: Senior Developer in Test
jobs.content:
Senior Developer in Test, London


Which? launched almost 70 years ago in a Bethnal Green garage.  It’s not our love of toasters that has kept us going all these years, it’s our ability to evolve. From our magazines to our high–traffic website and apps, our members and supporters access our information in the way that suits them.  As our Senior Developer in Test, you’ll make sure our digital audience has the best experience possible.


About Which?


Our 1.4 million members and supporters make us the largest consumer organisation in the UK.  That’s a huge number of people looking for our expert advice online, either at home or on the move.  We need you to make sure our two most popular sites, reviews and magazines, look and work as our customers expect.


A little about the team


We are passionate about technology and engineering practices. We choose the latest tools and technology to bring requirements to life following Agile methodologies. Test and Behaviour Driven Development are baked into everything we do, and if it can be automated it will be automated.


Everyone has a voice and sharing and collaboration are core team values. We pair program on user stories to ensure no one is left behind. We work as cross-functional Product teams - sitting alongside design, UX, BA and POs - which guarantees that our approach is user centred and joined up.


What you’ll be doing


We are currently delivering several business critical projects with others in the pipeline. Your eye for detail and passion for automation will guarantee that we deliver quality, production ready code to our high availability AWS environments like clockwork.


What we’ll need from you


We know that you can spot a pesky bug from a mile away, but we also need to see the following experience:



  • Testing Ruby on Rails applications

  • Automated BDD and TDD experience (preferably Cucumber, Capybara & RSpec)

  • Selenium/WebDriver

  • Testing responsive websites

  • CI and CD

  • JIRA/Confluence

  • Git/GitHub

  • Agile working practices (SCRUM/Kanban)


We’d get really excited if you had experience with:



  • Jenkins/Circle CI

  • Karma, Mocha and Chai, and JavaScript/UI testing

  • Cloud based testing services

  • Performance testing


This is a collaborative team, so you need to be comfortable contributing ideas for technical and process improvements.  You’ll lead technical and process initiatives within the team, and will always be open to share knowledge as you mentor and train team members


What we’ll give you in return


Let’s not be modest, our rewards package is one of the best out there. You’ll get 28 days’ annual leave, an interest-free season ticket loan, life assurance, and a pension scheme that increases to 11% after you’ve been here for a year.


The legal stuff


We don’t mean to sound bureaucratic, but there are certain boxes we have to tick.  Eligibility to live and work in the UK is one of them. We need you to confirm in your application that you are able to accept a role without the need for sponsorship.  We really don’t want to waste your time, so please only apply if you are an EU citizen or hold a valid Visa. We will ask to see your passport (or equivalent) at interview stage.

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer - Live Streaming
jobs.content:
Brightcove is looking for a talented software engineer for our live streaming platform. Our live streaming platform is based on latest cloud technologies and platform enables Brightcove customers to quickly create reliable ABR live streams from any place in the world and monetize them using server side Ad insertion or regular player Ad insertion. We also provide really fast live to VOD capacities among other features.



Fluency up and down the stack and good operational knowledge of scalable platforms in the cloud will serve you well in this role. We are looking for smart, creative, collaborative and fun people who have a desire to work in a fast paced environment building scalable cloud based services for video processing and streaming.


The Team



  • Develop and deploy scalable backend services for live video transcoding, processing, and delivery.

  • Provide operational support for the platforms.

  • Work in an agile environment with a team of engineers to create new products and streamline/enhance existing solutions and workflows.



You



  • 3+ years of software development experience.

  • You need to be a polyglot programmer, comfortable in both object oriented and functional programming paradigms.

  • Experience in NodeJS will be highly appreciated, C and C++ is a plus.

  • All our products run in AWS. So experience using any of the following AWS cloud services is required: EC2, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB

  • Comfortable working with both relational and NoSQL data stores.  

  • Experience with video codecs and container formats, DRM technologies and CDN delivery is a plus.

  • Develop clean, high quality code even when working on extremely hard problems.

  • Need to be comfortable working with Linux and have a good understanding of OS internals.

  • Self motivated, proactive and take ownership of issues.

  • Thrive and excel in our diverse agile team environment.



THE WORK ENVIRONMENT


We are located adjacent to ASU's beautiful campus in the heart of Tempe, just outside of Phoenix. We strive to maintain a fun, casual and friendly environment at work.

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer, Tier 2 Developer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about working directly with customers and immediately impacting their success? We are looking for an exceptional person to join our Customer Support team in providing efficient and accurate technical assistance to ensure complete customer satisfaction for our growing customer base of online video publishers. The ideal candidate is a dedicated problem solver, passionate about rich media technologies, and a proven customer advocate. We are looking for someone who is highly motivated with strong technical experience, excellent written and verbal communication skills and high enthusiasm for customer success.


Responsibilities will include working directly with customers via phone and email to respond to technical issues, providing escalated technical and triage support for other team members, and actively contribute to our online community and knowledge database for up-to-date customer information and solutions. This individual will also work closely with our Engineering, Product Management and QA teams to increase customer satisfaction by providing critical feedback and assistance for product enhancements. As a member of Customer Support, the candidate will be part of a Global team interacting closely with Support offices in the US, Europe, Australia, Korea, and Japan, as well as with customers around the world.


Working for Brightcove will give you a unique opportunity to join a fast growing company and play an integral role building products and online services that promise to transform the media industry and change the way people all over the world watch video.



Qualifications and Required Experience



  • College degree (CS degree preferred)

  • Excellent communication skills and strong customer focus

  • Proven analytical / problem solving ability

  • Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively, both written and oral

  • Demonstrated ability to lead and manage initiatives to completion.

  • Proven ability to work with the team to quickly and calmly resolve technical issues.

  • Solid understanding of internet technologies including browsers, networking, firewalls & proxy servers

  • Demonstrated ability to learn new skills quickly.

  • Ability to work independently and as a part of a team.

  • Required to be flexible, detail oriented and organized with the ability to multitask.

  • On-call availability



Technical Experience 



  • Strong technology background with a comprehensive knowledge of Internet, Mobile and Digital Online Media technologies such as networking, servers, etc

  • Strong familiarity and working knowledge in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS is essential

  • Familiarity and working knowledge of Java; experience in Android development is a plus

  • Familiarity and working knowledge with rich media applications and mobile SDK development or testing

  • Familiarity and working knowledge of RESTful API use, data collection tools, developer support experience

  • Meaningful experience with online video and of video encoding applications

  • Exposure and working knowledge in at least one other programming language including Objective C/Swift, PHP, BASH, etc


Location


This position is based in Boston, Massachusetts, USA.



Why you want to work for Brightcove


Brightcove is the leading online video platform. Media companies, businesses, and organizations worldwide use Brightcove to publish and distribute video that reaches more than 135 million unique viewers every month. We've worked hard to create a company where talented, passionate people can thrive in a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence, and collaboration. Working at Brightcove gives you the chance to reshape how media is published and consumed worldwide while you develop your skills, grow your career, and have fun.

jobs.title: Sr. Node.js Developer
jobs.content:
About Us:


Brightcove is the global leader in providing online video to Media and Digital Marketing organizations. Our global services team, BGS, builds highly scalable and complex solutions on our platform for some of the best known media companies in the world and we're expanding. If you have great technical skill, a passion for online video, a keen sense of creativity and a willingness to work with our clients to build awesome experiences, we'd love to talk.


What we are looking for:


We're looking for a great Node.js developer with experience building microservices and delivering at huge scale (think video delivery to hundreds of thousands of concurrent viewers). We take for granted that you know JS inside and out and are familiar with the most common Node frameworks. We're also expecting you to be creative in designing services, proficient enough in one or more mobile platforms and front-end frameworks to hold your own with our app teams, and humble enough to both take feedback and mentor others.


What you will do here:



  • Develop real-time communication applications using microservices and containers integrating with Brightcove products and 3rd party service providers

  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server side logic

  • Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code

  • Design and implementation of low-latency, high-availability, and performant 

  • Mentor more junior staff members and be a role model for best practices in technical development


What you will bring here:



  • 5+ years of experience in Node.js development

  • Strong proficiency with vanilla JavaScript

  • Strong Object Oriented Programming and Development skills

  • Strong knowledge of Node.js and frameworks available for it

  • Understanding the nature of asynchronous programming and its quirks and workarounds

  • Good understanding of server-side templating languages

  • Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as HTML5, and CSS3

  • Understanding data security compliance and security best practices

  • Experience in profiling, debugging & troubleshooting Node.js processes

  • Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application

  • Understanding differences between multiple delivery platforms, such as mobile vs. desktop, and optimizing output to match the specific platform

  • Familiar with Linux-based systems, comfortable in the terminal and SSH

  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

  • Experience with nginx, AWS and cloud-based architecture a strong plus


Why you want to work here:


What we offer is the chance to work with a small, passionate team inside Brightcove to build some amazing media platforms, competitive compensation, options, benefits, unlimited vacation and an amazing office.


This role is based out of our Boston office located downtown by South Station.

jobs.title: Senior Deployed Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Deployed Engineer

Job description
Based on our world leading research and development of deep learning and machine learning technologies we are tackling currently unsolved problems in insurance, industrial inspection and healthcare. Tractable’s Deployed engineers are leaders and first responders in developing solutions for our customers. Supported by our core Engineering and AI Research teams, Deployed Engineers work directly with customers to provide a complete solution from high-level design and prototyping to application development.

As a Senior Deployed Engineer you will be responsible for mentoring and assisting other deployed engineers and contributing to the overall system design and architecture of customer facing technology at Tractable. You will also work with our most important customers to deliver solutions in key areas of their business. You’ll need to own major projects and be prepared to travel regularly and work at our customers' sites. You will get to see cutting edge Artificial Intelligence software in action solving real problems and changing the world. The customers you will be working with include international insurance companies, world leading software businesses and national infrastructure providers. This role will require some international travel.

Requirements
For this role we are interested in candidates with a great track record including at least 4 years of commercial experience rather than with specific technologies or programming languages. You should have the following skills:



  • Coding: Regardless of which language you use or how you learned it, we’re looking for people who can write clean, effective code and review the code of others

  • Pragmatism and Creativity

  • Leadership and Collaboration

  • Prioritizing: You are comfortable in a high-paced environment, and can adapt quickly to respond to urgent requests

  • Making an impact: You are driven, entrepreneurial and goal focussed

  • Our customers generally work with Microsoft technologies so familiarity in this area is a bonus



Interested?
We look forward to receiving your application. Please use the online application form. For further information, please visit our website: www.tractable.io.


Acquisition by third parties is not appreciated.

jobs.title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer / SRE
jobs.content:
Senior Infrastructure Engineer / SRE

Job description
The unprecedented rate of advancement in computer vision brought about by deep learning in the past 3 years means that today, computers can surpass human performance on a range of tasks. Tractable is pioneering 'AI for Computer Vision', based in London and backed by Silicon Valley venture capital. We are taking these breakthroughs from the research lab to the real world. We work with international insurance companies providing AI to lower insurance premiums and ensure that people get the right help when things go wrong and in the UK we are working with national infrastructure providers to make water and electricity distribution networks safer and more reliable. 

We are looking for a passionate engineer with experience of high availability, large scale, distributed systems to work with our Head of Engineering to design, build and run the software and systems of our real-time, distributed Artificial Intelligence services and our petabyte-scale Deep Learning infrastructure.

You’ll be building flexible services and tooling which allows Tractable to rapidly scale whilst delivering a seamless experience to our customers and helping our researchers to make breakthroughs in Artificial Intelligence. You'll ensure that we are ready for anything by designing highly available, fault tolerant systems that are regularly tested.
 
You will contribute to the architecture and technical design of our software and of the ecosystem as a whole. You will be hands-on automating anything which isn't already automated to perform deployment, maintenance and monitoring of our applications and services. You will also mentor junior Infrastructure Engineers and work with our team of AI Researchers.
 
A passion for performance, scalability and fault tolerance is key. We 10x the capacity of our systems every 1-2 months.

Requirements
We use Big Data technologies (Spark, Kafka, Cassandra) and state-of-the-art infrastructure and tools (Docker, Mesos, Nvidia GPUs, CoreOS) running on a mix of public cloud services (AWS, Azure) and bare metal (CentOS). Our principal languages are currently Python, Java/Scala and Typescript/Coffeescript. A presentation of our engineering stack, given by our Head of Engineering, can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EwaI-HGsGM0
 
We are looking for candidates with an outstanding record who are passionate about software and systems engineering.



  • Desirable Skills and Experience

  • High-availability, large scale distributed applications

  • Cloud Infrastructure (e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)

  • Containers (e.g. Docker, rkt, CoreOS)

  • Orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes/Swarm/Mesos/Fleet)

  • Monitoring and alerting systems (e.g. Splunk, Prometheus)

  • Distributed data storage (HDFS, Cassandra, ElasticSearch)

  • Queues/messaging systems (Kafka, Rabbitmq, ZMQ)

  • Distributed programming (e.g. Spark, EMR, AKKA, Dask)

  • In-depth knowledge of Linux/Unix

  • A good understanding of internet and networking protocols



Interested?
We look forward to receiving your application. Please use the online application form. For further information, please visit our website.

Acquisition by third parties is not appreciated.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
TradePMR is building the future of financial advice platforms. We are looking for creative, senior-level software engineer to continue our role as a technology leader for both financial advisors and investors. As a senior member of our team, you'll craft solutions using everything from front-end HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and React, to server-side C#, open-source frameworks, proprietary APIs and different data stores including MS SQL Server.


We want the right person for our challenging, fast-paced environment. You'll enjoy a competitive salary, leading-edge equipment, and access to the most up-to-date training resources available.

DEVSISTERS . . UX UI . DEVSISTER . . 


[]


* Cocos2d-x


* IP


* , ,


*


*  


* C++

jobs.title: Full Stack .NET Developer
jobs.content:
You will work for an international company which is leading the market in their niche. The media industry is booming and everyone in this niche wants to know how they’re doing? You are building software that measures the reach and success of online and offline entertainment (Radio, TV, etc.). Companies throughout the world use this software and the future is exciting! GfK is active in more than one hundred countries and the number of countries is growing.


Our multidisciplinary team of software engineers is looking for two new colleagues to help building two new and exciting projects with a strong .NET focus. We are talking here about survey systems which handle the complex job of data collection, data analyses and reporting to the market on a daily basis. These systems ensure continuous data production which actually gives our customers a real time indication about how are they doing on the market.


What can we offer?



  • You will be working closely with experienced backend developers who have experience of multiple programming languages (C#, Perl, Universe).

  • You will work with young enthusiastic front end oriented developers that know how to create various client facades and mobile apps.

  • You will help the team implementing a modern, professional, development environment with .NET technology stack at its core where the AGILE/SCRUM practice is valued.

  • A working environment based on a build server, continuous integration with TFS/GIT is something you can expect and contribute to.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
VDL ETG Technology & Development in Eindhoven has a vacancy:




Senior Software Engineer




Job information
As a Software Engineer at VDL ETG you are responsible for the design, implementation, test and integration and maintenance of software for complex modules and machines. You work with a code base of C, C++, Python or C#. This code base is under strict configuration management in order to deliver in a reliable way for multiple systems and multiple users.. You cooperate closely with colleagues from other disciplines and strategic customers (mechanics, mechatronics, electronics, equipment engineering) in a multidisciplinary team. The software team works in an agile fashion in scrum teams.

You see it as a challenge to take up new things and explore new tools and techniques.

jobs.title: Senior PHP/Node.js/C++ developer - Full Time - 100% Remote EU Time Zone
jobs.content:
We're looking for an all round seasoned developer with critical performance experience with multithreading, parallel programming and mass data processing. We create amazing AI, Machine learning products with no countries or language barriers. Cvedia is a free, cloud-based service simplifying image dataset classifications. We give our clients direct access to various public data sources such as ImageNet, COCO, etc, and directly export their filters and augmentations to their local server in the format of their favourite machine learning framework, including Torch, Caffe, TensorFlow, Theano and Deeplearning4J.

Please notice:

  • Only applicants from European time zone will be processed.
  • We will not reply to 3rd party software and HR agencies
  • Please state on the mail subject the job position you are applying for!
Required Qualifications:

PHP 7

Node.js 6+ parallel, multithreaded

C++, node 7 nan library is a plus

Postgres 9.6

Elasticsearch 5, Lucene and/or SOLR

Linux knowledge is a must

Ability to work using existing code and upgrading it

Teamwork

Excellent knowledge of English, speaking & writing

Experience in high-traffic, production environment

Preferred, but not mandatory:

Scripting with perl/shell scripts

RMQ

Memcache, Redis

libVips, libJpeg

OpenCV

Data mining

Neural networks functionality understanding

How should you apply for this job?

Only applications written in English are going to be processed!

Only applicants from European time zone will be processed.

WE will not reply to 3rd party software agencies

Please state on the mail subject the job position you are applying for!

Please understand that this job capacity is for a full position.

Application process:

Application usually will be screened the same day we receive it.

We will reply to you no later than two business days to set-up a short interview.

1-3 weeks after the interview you could be hired!

What we offer:

Job location is in Cyberspace.

Communication with the all team members is done through Skype

Employee will be receiving all of his social rights as stated in the law of his country.

Salary will be paid once a month with a wire transfer

Job capacity: Monday - Friday (8 hours daily)  

If you are interested in working with us, please send your complete CV incl. your last jobs and a list of visible references of web projects (link to github account or zip with non-minified code samples) .

Please send to jobs@cvedia.com

To apply: Send a resume to jobs@cvedia.com

jobs.title: Skilled Java Developer
jobs.content:
As a developer at Cinnober, you are part of a cross functional agile team that includes testers and business analysts. Together, you develop our products and tailor them to our customer’s needs. Our customers are demanding — they want solutions that processes huge amount of data at lightening speeds where robustness is a key factor. We solve these kinds of challenges, often within a fixed time scope. You eagerly take responsibility for making it happen, and you never disappoint. But even when our customers are satisfied, you are not. You’re a driven sort of person who gets a real kick out of constantly looking for ways to make improvements that add value for the customer.


The results of your work will be used by Tier 1 exchanges and clearing houses around the world and customers with high standards for quality and performance. This is your dream — you are absolutely passionate about developing systems fulfilling customers’ business requirements. In your world, quality is not an accident. You strive for it. You achieve it.


Our evolving tech stack contains both open-source and proprietary components. For example, we have our own databases, message layers and fail-over mechanisms all tailor made for a demanding environment where we have 100% control. You have an interest and the technical skills to tackle complex problems with the appropriate techniques.


But your interests are broader than just pure technology. You are fascinated by our customers’ business area, and are curious about how you can use your skills and insight to transform the latest technology into solutions that help our customers succeed. Your curiosity drives you to continuously look for better solutions, and to strive to develop your knowledge every day. You are at the top of your game when you are part of a high-performance team that applies test-driven development and pair programming to produce the very best solutions.

jobs.title: Java/API Software developer
jobs.content:
Chez  Axway, nous sommes  des « APIstes ». Si quelque chose n’a pas d’API nous allons lui en donner une. Nous automatisons tous les aspects de notre prestation de logiciels.


Notre plate-forme API sophistiquée  permet l’activation de l’économie numérique. Nous ouvrons des systèmes d’organisation back-end pour les appareils mobiles. 


Nous aidons à créer, gérer, exposer et faire des rapports sur les API internes et externes pour les communautés de développeurs. Nous gérons des API pour l'internet des objets (IoT).  Curieux sur les technologies REST, Docker


Rejoignez-nous et devenez Axway !


Nous recherchons actuellement un développeur JAVA  qui voudrait passer la tête dans les nuages, prendre de la hauteur sur nos problématiques complexes de scalabilité et performance.


Le produit en question : API Gateway : (https://www.axway.com/fr/enterprise-solutions/api-gateway#tablist1-tab1) capable de convertir de veilles API en API dernier cri.

jobs.title: Ingénieur Test Java
jobs.content:
Chez Axway nous adorons partager l’information. 


Nous partageons des dossiers, des fichiers mais surtout nous les partageons efficacement et en toute sécurité.


“Sharing is caring » disent les Anglophones. Prendre soin de nos clients c’est donc aussi leur transmettre notre expertise du transfert de fichiers.


Alors oui bien sûr nous sommes experts dans ce domaine …mais nous adorons aussi les API, l’IoT et plein d’autres choses qui touchent aux flux de données, mais revenons à nos moutons.


Le service CFT (Cross File Transfert) est composé 25 personnes formant une équipe techniquement très affutée qui n’attend que vous.


Si il devait y avoir un mot pour décrire cette dream team : hétérogène (que ce soit en termes d’environnements techniques, de machines, de personnalités, de nationalités ...)


 Concernant CFT, c’est un moniteur de transfert de fichiers amélioré par une couche de monitoring pour la sécurité, la connexion, l’Access management…Une sorte de FTP très évolué et mondialement connu qui génère plus de 25% du CA annuel d’Axway.


“Un test, c’est quand on vous fait faire des petits dessins pour voir si vous n’êtes pas fous.”…Visiblement Emile Ajar n’avait pas venu venir l’air du digital. Nous lui pardonnons.


Chez nous un test c’est le challenge, c’est le défi, c’est l’épreuve ultime de nos développeurs !


Au sein d’une équipe de 7 personnes consacrée à la qualité et au testing vous nous rejoignez pour développer des tests en Java (nous avons 2 frameworks, un en Python et l’autre en Java, mais nous avons assez de Pythonistes dans l’équipe)


 Nul besoin de vous décrire les missions en long et en large vous savez de quoi il retourne, vous devez challenger nos développeurs en développant à votre tour de quoi mettre en évidence la moindre de leur petite erreur.

jobs.title: Technical Manager - Application Security
jobs.content:
TripAdvisor is seeking an experienced security focused technical manager to join our Technology and Infrastructure group.  In this role your charter will be to build and lead a team tasked with ensuring that TripAdvisor’s website is secure from external abuse and appropriately protects our users’ data.  You will identify and lead efforts to develop and maintain the processes and monitoring necessary to identify security vulnerabilities within the TripAdvisor site.  Additionally, you will provide security guidance to our engineering and product teams in support of their products.


 Responsibilities



  • Build and lead the Application Security Engineering team for TripAdvisor.

  • Identify software security vulnerabilities within TripAdvisor and articulate their importance and relevance to our business.

  • Propose and build new tools/infrastructure to make application security easy for TripAdvisor engineers.

  • Define software development policy and govern implementation to assure adherence to standards.

  • Work with TripAdvisor IT, Operations Staff, Product Managers, and Software Engineers to prevent and resolve issues.

  • Active interest in promoting security awareness and mentor members of the development teams on company security standards, including secure coding guidelines.

  • Analyze industry trends and incorporate into roadmaps for security strategy.

  • Ensure security strategy is aligned with business strategy and overall company direction.


 Qualifications



  • B.S. or M.S. Computer Science, or equivalent experience.

  • 7+ years of relevant work experience applying security practices to software development, with at least 2 years managing a team.

  • You can manage a team towards long-term goals while delivering new capability daily.

  • You have the ability to work with everyone from engineers to product owners to C-level executives to help communicate, prioritize, influence and inform key product decisions.

  • You have successfully hired and built teams including interviewing, on-boarding, and mentoring.

  • In-depth knowledge of common Internet vulnerabilities and techniques to identify and fix them.

  • Java or C++ development experience in a UNIX or Linux environment.

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

  • Contributions to the security community are a plus.

jobs.title: VP - Engineering
jobs.content:
VP, Engineering - Hybrid Cloud & DevOps Startup


We are looking for a team leader who is passionate about building products from scratch that will help simplify the lives of IT engineering teams worldwide. We are a new NYC-based venture-backed software company that is focused on optimizing and simplifying hybrid cloud design and procurement.


As the VP, Engineering your charter will be to:


Lead the engineering team - Initially, the VP, Engineering will be the lead developer for the platform with 95% of time spent coding and will ultimately be accountable for managing the entire code base as well as the velocity of feature deployment and the quality of the architecture.


Work closely with the Founding Team - assist in the formation of the strategic product vision - building simple solutions to very complex problems for IT infrastructure professionals.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
If you want to consider an adventure of a lifetime, then look no further. Experticity/ReadyPulse is building THE social network for helping people decide what to buy. We are connecting category experts with brands and their products because we believe experts help people make better buying decisions. Our Engineering Teams are located in Salt Lake City and the Seattle area.  (The position will be based in Kirkland, WA).




  • Architect, design and implement software components that process semi-structured data coming from disparate channels.

  • Develop and build systems that manage big data stores, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.

  • Design and participate in code reviews.

  • Implement and maintain tests, and operational service issues.

  • Document design and architecture proposals properly and include aids like flowcharts, diagrams, flows, tasks, code snippets to illustrate key concepts.

  • Obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces.

  • Modify existing software as needed.

  • Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints.

  • Manage and coordinate software system installation on cloud infrastructure.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
If you like to engage in a single project for more than a year, this gig is for you. This position is for those who like to dig deep, see results in the form of revenue and speed, and want other high grade developers to bounce ideas off of. 


Anatta Design works with clients on a dedicated basis providing a team of resources (designers, developers, managers) to engage in a common goal. The goals change quarterly and we work together to produce our deliverables. 


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will oversee the backend development tasks apart of the given project. And report directly to a team lead who oversees our current team of backend developers (currently 5 members). 


Your daily work assignments would take place in our beautiful office in Santa Monica.

jobs.title: Web Software Developer
jobs.content: Our Patient Platform was designed to leverage the excellent penetration of Accuro®EMR, our Electronic Medical Record (EMR) software with the largest adoption in Canada, serving thousands of practitioners and millions of patients, but it doesn’t stop there.  As a public-facing interface to be integrated with all EMRs including our own, it is uniquely positioned to deliver an excellent customer experience regardless of vendor.  We are looking for talented individuals to be part of our team and to help shape our next generation of products.  They would be responsible for the delivery of that cohesive experience for all partner EMRs including our own.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content: Our Electronic Medical Record (EMR) software Accuro®EMR has the largest adoption in Canada and serves thousands of practitioners and millions of patients. Our patient platform Medeo leverages that market penetration and connects patients to their healthcare providers. Today, we offer virtual visits, secure messaging and online booking of appointments. Tomorrow, we will offer deeper interactions with providers and pharmacies. We are looking for talented front-end or full-stack developers to be part of our team and to help shape our next generation of products.

jobs.title: UI Designer
jobs.content:
QHR’s software team is developing the next generation of desktop, web and mobile technologies to improve the quality of human health. We are a dedicated team of passionate software developers who love to build products that delight our customers.  Join a growing team working on products used by thousands of health care practitioners and patients across Canada.


QHR is looking for an UI Designer to create beautiful and compelling interfaces and work with the team to transform these interfaces into robust interactive experiences.  Responsible for collaboratively designing the look and feel of our products, the UI designer uses visual and interactive prototypes, UI guidelines, and motion to describe scalable product interfaces. The UI Designer is able to translate wireframes, flow maps, personas, gathered research and user feedback into vibrant and highly functional design work. 


Working closely with UX and UI designers, programmers and others, the Designer will create well-crafted, usable interfaces that meet user needs and leverage the capability of existing technologies.  Experience with Sketch (or the willingness to learn) and Invision are sought for this role. You will create both low and high fidelity wireframes, mockups, and prototypes and validate UI concepts with user feedback.  An understanding of HTML & CSS, and experience prototyping in code (Framer.js, codepen.io, others) are also desired. 


Help shape our next generation of products and change how health care is experienced!

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
OPIsystems Inc. has an immediate opening for a Senior Full Stack Developer. This position will be located in our Calgary, Alberta office and will report to our Chief Technology Officer.


Working with members of a cross-functional agile development team, the Senior Full Stack Developer is responsible for building features, functionality, and enhancements for OPI Blue, our cloud based grain management system. The Senior Full Stack Developer participates in all aspects of development including design, architecture, implementation, and testing, and is capable of working across our technology stack (including web development, firmware, messaging protocols, and infrastructure). The Senior Full Stack Developer also provides mentoring and technical leadership to the team, and is as excited about growing the capabilities of other developers as they are about building great products.


Job Duties:


Software Development

Software Technology & Team Mentoring

 Web Development Subject Matter Expert

jobs.title: Software Quality Engineer IV
jobs.company: Newport News Shipbuilding-A Division of Huntington Ingalls Industries
jobs.content:
Have you always had the knack to break software while the rest of the team was more concerned with building software? Are you a testing expert with proven experience developing testing strategies and leading QA teams or initiatives? We are looking for a leader who can take ownership and responsibility of the entire software quality practice for the IT Solutions Development organization. If you have experience with techniques such as TDD/ATDD, BDD, Black-box, white-box, top-down, bottom-up, then this job is likely for you.


The Software Quality Engineer performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal. Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications.


Core Responsibilities:



  • Deliver a strategy for testing in the organization. Strategy must leverage industry best-practices and extensive experiences to drive a significantly higher testing competency.

  • Be the company’s representative to suppliers and industry regarding testing. Evaluate the need for and lead the sourcing and review of any testing related services.

  • Lead the various initiatives required to achieve testing maturity according to the strategy. Continuously assess the organization's current state of maturity and track progress to the goal.

  • Maintain a constant heartbeat on industry best-practices for testing and work to align our maturity with those best-practices.

  • Act as a liaison to other organizations with a vested interest in software quality, such as QP&E and the Business Partners.

  • Shall apply knowledge of IT principles, business processes, procedures, and standards to research, design, configure, develop, test and debug to all development.

  • Creates specialized reports for SAP modules using ABAP programming languages.

  • Designs forms and screens for SAP modules using tools such as SAPscript and SmartForms.

  • Interfaces with functional teams to ensure the proper integration of business processes and procedures with information technology and to identify customer solutions.

jobs.title: Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Tired of writing batch data interfaces?  Bored with integrating another 3rd party package into a complex organization it really doesn’t fit into?  Looking for an opportunity to actually use your knowledge and problem solving creativity you spent years acquiring?  Take a look at Catalina. We are looking for an experienced Lead/Sr. Engineer that will actually spend the majority of their time designing and writing software!  Have experience with Agile methodologies but frustrated that they aren’t really followed?  Take a second look at Catalina. We are in the middle of an agile transformation that is changing not only how we engineer software, but also the culture that we do it in.  Self-managing teams, open workspaces, collaboration – you’ll get it all in this fast-paced environment where technology is not an afterthought, but has been a key part of our strategic direction for 30+ years… and we are just getting started.  All that is missing is you!


What You’ll Do:


There are certainly some benefits to working on a system that has a handful of users in the same building as the engineering team.  However, if you really want your skills as a software engineer to be challenged, consider working on products that are touching real consumers in the real world.  You’ll get that on Catalina’s Platform engineering team, where you’ll be working on distributed, high availability cloud applications that interact with millions of consumers every day around the world to deliver personalized marketing content.

jobs.title: WebUI Senior Developer
jobs.content:
WebUI Senior Developer Description at Citizens Bank


We are looking for a senior web developer to help maintain the existing web applications, and to guide development of the next generation of Online Banking at Citizens Bank. The right individual for this role must be capable of building applications in HTML5 (Javascript, CSS, and HTML), using modern front-end architectures and frameworks. You should be comfortable with application coding and UI creation based on design and UX team specifications, and also be comfortable working with network protocols such as HTTP, ReST, and SSH. The candidate must be a top-notch web developer committed to becoming an integral part of, and fostering growth within our development team. The Senior Application Developer is responsible for leading the development, implementation and support of individual applications, including analysis, detailed design, development/coding, testing and implementation of the components Primary responsibilities include: ·Demonstrates deep expertise in coding concepts and patterns, specifically with regards to web ui development (HTML, CSS, and Javascript) ·Partner with business line and architects during initial project stages to ensure the accuracy of requirements and provide critical input and direction from a technology perspective ·Work with architects and other technology leads to define and document guidelines and standards for development and deployment of applications following industry best practices ·Lead scrum team in development and implementation of changes to the Online Banking platform and foster growth within the team ·Continually monitor the web ui ecosystem for opportunities in advancing the Citizens Bank technology approach and infrastructure ·Interfacing with back-end APIs using ReSTful services and JSON data payloads

jobs.title: Sr. iOS Mobile Developer

This position reports directly to our Chief Software Architect. We want a perfect cultural and technical fit but don't worry we are not expecting a perfect person. Let us know if this excites you in your next job:  



  • Cutting Edge Technology Exposure: we have a track record from 16 years of being in business, but we stay on the forefront of technology from developing one of the first 500 apps on the iTunes App store on Day 1 to completing a launched iOS project in Swift and active Apple Watch projects 

  • Work/Life Balance: we honor great work and producing great deliverables- not sitting in the office all night 

  • Management Team That Cares: report directly to our Chief Software Architect, who has a Masters in Computer Science, and work with our President/Founder with over 15 years software development experience and also trained with a Computer Science Degree, and work with a CEO who enjoys providing clear goals, treats & trivia each month, and does push-ups every time we start a new project-what's not to love?

jobs.title: Microsoft Surface Developer
jobs.content:
Were an industrial research lab working on computing tools to augment human intellect, and we want you to join us for our next project in a series of experiments.

This project is a collaborative whiteboarding app for Microsoft Surface. As the primary Windows engineer, youll work with our small team of industry veterans to develop an innovative prototype over two months.

Our team is all remote. Its a low-ego, casual environment and where we try to learn from one another and have fun along the way.


Benefits


  • 8 week contract, kickoff in January
  • weekly rate of USD $1000 $2000 / 900 1800 depending on your skills & experience
  • work remotely via Slack, Github, Trello, and video chat
  • flexible hours centered on US eastern timezone

We welcome qualified candidates regardless of background. We look forward to hearing from you.

jobs.title: Tools Engineer : C++ Profiling Tools
jobs.content:
Codeplay is looking for an engineer to work on development tools, such as performance profilers. This is a C++ development role working on tools to help software developers deliver high-performance graphics or machine vision software on smartphones, virtual reality and (in the near future) self-driving cars.At Codeplay, we produce the software development tools to lower power consumption and increase performance via open standards. To help developers further, we need to be able to improve the ability to analyse how the software is running across a whole System-on-Chip. The successful candidate will be part of a team working on performance analysis tools across several areas, including open-source projects, customer projects, academic collaborations and research.


This role will involve a lot of new platforms, techniques and technologies as part of a team. The relevant candidate will show enthusiasm for working with others to produce tools that help developers work better.


The position will be based at our Head Office in central Edinburgh.


What We Offer



  • Work on exciting brand-new technologies and standards with well-recognized customers

  • A friendly and relaxed working environment where colleagues support each other

  • Knowledge sharing : our staff frequently give company-wide presentations on new software and technology trends, personal projects and other relevant subjects

  • Great career prospects within a growing company

  • Positions are available at various levels, from entry-level Software Engineer to Senior Principal Software Engineer, depending on your skills and experience

  • We develop our employees and provide training in skills such as project and people management, networking and delivering effective presentations

  • Frequent opportunities to attend conferences and developer meetings, represent the company, and become a recognized expert

  • We encourage engineers to progress quickly in their roles, for example to become team leads (for which training in people management and project management is provided)

  • Codeplay has been recognized as an excellent employer and awarded the Silver Level of the Investors in People accreditation

  • Opportunities to get involved with industrial standardisation initiatives such as The Khronos Group and HSA Foundation, and various European research programmes

  • Working on early-stage technology offers opportunities to contribute/shape new hardware/software and standards

  • Flexible working hours, stock options and pension scheme


Salary range (depending on experience) £27,000 to £53,000


See more at: https://www.codeplay.com/company/careers/view.html?id=39#sthash.erV5foYv.dpuf

jobs.title: Principal DevOps Engineer - Data Platform Team
jobs.content:
Twilio's Data Platform captures, stores, and processes global event data reliably at scale, and makes this data available to Twilio and the market for a large set of products and services.


About the job:


As Principal DevOps Engineer, you will be a core contributor in the Data Platform team and help us deliver the world-class Data Platform Twilio needs in order to succeed. You will face some of the most complex challenges in distributed data systems at scale.


Responsibilities:



  • Create a resilient and highly operable production environment for Twilio’s Data Platform with 24x7 availability, high performance, scalable and zero downtime releases in AWS environment.

  • Manage large MySQL database clusters and noSQL systems such as DynamoDB and Cassandra.

  • Manage regional deployments and set up disaster recovery of Kafka data pipelines, systems and stores in AWS environment.

  • Collaborate with Engineers to create a continuous delivery environment and processes.

  • Instrument and monitor the health and availability of services, with fault detection, alerting, triage and recovery (automated and manual).

  • Work closely with Twilio’s cloud infrastructure, orchestration, and security teams to help implement company-wide security and operability initiatives and to provide tooling requirements.

  • Performance manage (with benchmarking and monitoring of vital metrics), capacity plan, and resolve performance problems affecting service levels.

  • Write scripts and runbooks to automate procedures.

  • Lead and mentor a DevOps Engineer.

  • Enable auto-scaling.

jobs.title: Holacracy-Powered BrickFTP Seeks Full-Time Designer For Our Web Applications (React.js), Marketing Websites and Corporate Identity
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Las Vegas, NV, USA
URL: https://brickftp.com/

Hi there.  We're Action Verb and we build Infrastructure-as-a-Service products.  We've been around for almost 10 years, operate profitably, and will probably make the Inc 5000 list this year.

We offer two main products:  BrickFTP,  a hosted file sharing service for business, and Vae Platform, a unique web hosting platform with an integrated CMS system.  Our IaaS services have over 1,900 paying business customers.

We're small, happy, and we avoid the Silicon Valley startup culture that encourages growth over sustainability.  We treat each team member like family.  We have 9 full time staff now (plus 3 part time) and we're looking to grow our family by adding a full time designer to our team.

As a company, we are one of the early adopters of Holacracy, a new style of running an organization in a self-organizing manner that draws inspiration from agile software development and lean manufacturing processes.  

Rather than hiring people for exactly one job description, we instead look to find well rounded team members with skills in design, coding, marketing, sales, and our other needs who are interested in filling multiple roles within the organization.

As a self-organizing team, our people have multiple roles and our role descriptions are regularly updated via small iterations.  The roles you take on are intended to change over time as your interests change and our needs change.

“Most startups believe in iteration of their products. Now they need to apply the same thinking to their organizations.”  
— Adam Pisoni, Yammer co-founder & CTO

At Action Verb, you don't have a boss.  Your work is executed autonomously, without micromanagement.

But Holacracy is not unstructured: you'll have a clear understanding of your current roles and responsibilities, as well as a set of rules and processes for changing those roles and responsibilities in real time.

Our team members work from home and choose their own hours, allowing them to make time for family, recreation, vacations, or anything that is important to them.

Our team members also work hard, are constantly learning, and accomplish a ton for the company in the time that they are working. That's why we consistently pay above-market rates for talent and are generous with raises and bonuses.

Even though Holacracy is a lot to learn, we have a great onboarding process and the rest of our team will guide you through your first few months.  We will take responsibility for ensuring that you quickly learn how to be productive at Action Verb.  We expect that you'll be more productive here than you've been anywhere else.

We believe that building great products requires great infrastructure.  We have Continuous Integration, a full staging environment, and great READMEs across our system.  We built our own application deployment system.  We self-manage our server stack on Amazon EC2 and custom hardware.

We believe in using the right tool for the job.  Our application frontends are built in React.js and Ruby on Rails.  Our eventual goal is to move everything to React.js on the frontend for our large applications, so we are really looking for folks with React experience.

However, as new frameworks come out, we are looking for someone who will stay on top of the latest trends in Javascript development and push us in the right direction.

We believe that the best designers know how to code.  We’re looking for someone who can bring the following things to the table:

  • Experience with web application design, marketing website design, and offline (print) design
  • Comprehensive understanding of UI/UX principles
  • Solid web front-end development skills in HTML, CSS, and Javascript.  Even though we have a great team to help you integrate your designs with our applications, in order to be a great application designer, we expect that you can implement enough Javascript to make your designs come to life (even in a basic way).
  • Ability to prioritize and make decisions without needing to be micromanaged
  • History designing actual SaaS or desktop applications that have seen production usage with real customers.
  • Truly interested in giving our customers a great experience and able to communicate directly with customers and prospects

We believe that open-source only works if companies give back.  If you work on any open-source projects during the course of your work at Action Verb, you are encouraged to submit your improvements as a pull request back to the upstream project.  And if you build something from scratch while working here that’s generic and not related to our core products, we want you to release that on GitHub too.  We’ll also pay your travel costs to any conference where you can get a speaking gig.

We believe that our products will never be finished.  We are committed to continuously improving our customer experience.  We constantly reach out to our customers to learn about new ways that we can help them get their job done.

Tell us about what you believe.  Please use the link below to send in your application now.  We only read cover letters in our first screening round, so make sure yours counts.  Specifically, we'd like you to address the following topics:

  • What is your level of experience with Holacracy?  Had you heard about it prior to this posting?  Do you have any questions about it?
  • What is your level of experience with a remote team?
  • What would be your ideal focus areas and roles within the company?  (Please understand that our current needs are mostly on the design side, but we always prefer folks with broad areas of interest.)

Important Notes:

  • Since this is a design-focused posting, please also provide portfolio links to things you designed.  Ideally this portfolio will include web applications, marketing websites, and physical print design.
  • Compensation requirements for designers also tend to be all over the map.  Please include your requested salary in the application so we can better understand your application from the start.
  • While we are accepting applications from non-USA applicants, USA-based applicants are strongly preferred for this position.
  • We hope to hear from you (and SEE what you've done)!

To apply: Apply here: http://actionverb.jazz.co/apply/S0OYVR/HolacracyPowered-BrickFTP-Seeks-FullTime-Designer-For-Our-Web-Applications-Reactjs-Marketing-Websites-And-Corporate-Identity Don't use the LinkedIn or Indeed buttons to apply. Make sure you include a great cover letter and a link to a design portfolio that ideally includes both web application and marketing website work. Print work in the portfolio is a bonus too!

jobs.title: Holacracy-Powered BrickFTP Seeks Full-Time Japanese Speaking (Japan/Asia timezone) Inside Sales & Customer Support Representative
jobs.content:
Do you absolutely love sales and get excited about the idea of scoring your next commission?

Enjoy learning about and working with software-as-a-service?

Do you speak Japanese (and ideally live in Japan)?

 
If so, we have an awesome, full-time career opportunity at a fun, laid-back American tech company.

Hi there.  We're Action Verb and we build Infrastructure-as-a-Service products.  We've been around for almost 10 years, operate profitably, and will probably make the Inc 5000 list this year.

We offer two main products:  BrickFTP,  a hosted file sharing service for business, and Vae Platform, a unique web hosting platform with an integrated CMS system.  Our IaaS services have over 1,900 paying business customers.

We're small, happy, and we avoid the Silicon Valley startup culture that encourages growth over sustainability.  We treat each team member like family.  We have 9 full time staff now (plus 3 part time) and we're looking to grow our family by adding a full time Japanese-speaking Inside Sales and Customer Service/Support professional to our team.

As a company, we are one of the early adopters of Holacracy, a new style of running an organization in a self-organizing manner that draws inspiration from agile software development and lean manufacturing processes.  

Rather than hiring people for exactly one job description, we instead look to find well rounded team members with skills in design, coding, marketing, sales, and our other needs who are interested in filling multiple roles within the organization.

As a self-organizing team, our people have multiple roles and our role descriptions are regularly updated via small iterations.  The roles you take on are intended to change over time as your interests change and our needs change.

âMost startups believe in iteration of their products. Now they need to apply the same thinking to their organizations.â  
â Adam Pisoni, Yammer co-founder & CTO

At Action Verb, you don't have a boss.  Your work is executed autonomously, without micromanagement.

But Holacracy is not unstructured: you'll have a clear understanding of your current roles and responsibilities, as well as a set of rules and processes for changing those roles and responsibilities in real time.

Our team members work from home and choose their own hours, allowing them to make time for family, recreation, vacations, or anything that is important to them.

Our team members also work hard, are constantly learning, and accomplish a ton for the company in the time that they are working.

Even though Holacracy is a lot to learn, we have a great onboarding process and the rest of our team will guide you through your first few months.  We will take responsibility for ensuring that you quickly learn how to be productive at Action Verb.  We expect that you'll be more productive here than you've been anywhere else.

 

About The Position

Your job will be to handle all Japanese-language sales and customer support requests, as well as any English-language sales or support requests that occur during Japan's normal business hours (aka during our night time in the USA.)

Although this is a sales position, it is not one of those hard-selling, cold-calling types of stressful sales jobs.

You'll be calling and emailing warm leads who have responded to online advertising and would like to be walked through our software products before deciding to buy. Your job is simply to help them understand our software, how it can benefit them, and why they should use our software instead of our competitors.

Basically, you'll be the "face" of our business to all our prospects.

You'll patiently deal with users who don't fully understand our products.  However, most of our customers are highly technical CTOs or IT director-types, so we hope that your time will be spent mostly with high-level customers who understand our products.

You'll have the support of our 6 staff engineers and 5 other sales staff in case the sales calls get too technical.

BrickFTP is an easy product to sell.  Our customers are businesses and the price point is just $49 per month, so this is not a high-pressure sales situation.  Also remember that these are warm leads who opted-in asking for a phone call.

You will also be responsible for front-line customer support in your language/market.  Any issue you can resolve yourself, you'll resolve, and anything else you'll work with our English-speaking support engineers to resolve.  You may have to get on conference calls to translate for our customers if necessary.
 

Here are the details of the Pay.

The base pay is $600-800 per week full time depending on experience, but the exciting part of our compensation structure is a commission of 10% of the annual value of any package that you sell.  The average commission is about $100 and you should be selling several packages per week.  Our salespeople do considerable commissions in addition to their base earnings.

What skills are we looking for?

We are looking for you to have:

  • Perfect phone demeanor and ability to communicate effectively via the phone.
  • Perfect grammar and professional tone via email.
  • Basic understanding of the technical aspects of hosting.
  • Fluency in English and Japanese.
  • Located in Japan ideally or in a similar time zone.
  • Previous experience doing telephone-based inside sales, ideally in a software or technology related business.
  • Ability to wake up early or stay up late to have some overlap with USA hours 2 days a week.  Ability to work weekends is a huge plus.

What makes this opportunity unique?

A really awesome team.  The team includes a strong technical founder and 5 other top technical engineers and operations folks.  We also have a USA-based salesperson and 4 other regional salespeople to help with your sales/support efforts.  We'll have your back and do everything in our power to make your job as easy as possible.

Work from home.  Thereâs nothing we hate more than commuting.  So, we donât have an office and would definitely like to avoid having one for as long as possible.  If you have a family at home, move between locations, or even live abroad, this is a great opportunity to do all your work from home and stop wasting all that time on commuting.   Itâs like getting 2 free hours added back to your day.

Choose your own hours. As long as youâre available to take calls and return calls during the business hours of your market, we're flexible with exactly when you work during the day.  Work 2 hours, then run and take the kids to lunch, come back and work another 3 hours.  We work highly variable hours so weâll be able to sync up no matter when you work.  We do have full team meetings on Tuesdays and Wednesdays at 4pm Eastern Time, and you should ideally be able to make those.

Stability.  Action Verb is bootstrapped, profitable, adequately capitalized, and debt-free.  We are committed to continuously improving our customer experience and believe that our products will never be âfinished.â

To apply: Apply here: http://actionverb.jazz.co/apply/omoTV3/HolacracyPowered-BrickFTP-Seeks-FullTime-Japanese-Speaking-JapanAsia-Location-Required-Inside-Sales-Customer-Support-Representative(Do not use the LinkedIn or Indeed buttons on that page to apply. We want a non-copy-and-paste submission.)

jobs.title: Experienced Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for an experienced Ruby on Rails Developer to join our scrum team of multiple developers, QA and DevOps Engineers. This is a remote position for US/Canadian candidates. Our platform features a responsive front-end built with Ember.js, and a well-designed Rails API that combines semantic databases, natural language processing, machine learning and search. 


You will be doing some or all of the following:



  • Developing scalable, highly-performant, customer-facing we applications with Ruby on Rails.

  • Building RESTful APIs. 

  • Improving system performance and reliability.  

  • Writing clean, efficient and maintainable code.

  • Helping us scale our rapidly growing web application. 


Ideally, you'd be local to our beautiful Upper Valley located on the border between Vermont and New Hampshire where we'd welcome you to our fancy new offices. We have a ping pong table, and are really excited about the craft brewery that just opened up the street. If you're not within a daily commute (we're about 100 miles northwest of Boston), we'll entertain applicants who wish to work remotely. We'd ask you to travel to our offices (at our expense) once a quarter so we can get everyone face-to-face for some bonding and planning.

jobs.title: VR 3D Game Developer Unreal 4 / Unity 5  Long Island, NY
jobs.content:
VR & 3D Game Developer Unreal 4 / Unity 5 – Jericho Long Island, NY


We are searching for another Lead Unreal 4 / Unity 5 developer / programmer for our Long Island location to work on an existing VR Shooter prototype.  In this position you will be working with a new and well-funded Virtual Reality / Software Entertainment firm looking to develop VR and traditional entertainment titles. This will include in-house projects along with corporate work for clients looking to demo products and services with the VR or traditional 2D and 3D mediums.  This is a full-time salaried position with benefits.


This is an onsite only position.  Please do not apply if you cannot work onsite.  If you are willing to relocate, please let us know.


We are looking for someone who has overall experience developing a title in Unreal & Unity with excellent C++ / C# skills, blueprints and has worked with the VIVE, Oculus and Steam VR.  If you have a passion for 3D gaming or Virtual Reality and have built & released your own basic titles, we would like to speak with you.


Please email your resume to resumes@labrodex.com in pdf format with salary requirements.


****Please include a link to your current portfolio of VR or gaming work****


POSITION REQUIREMENTS



  • Hands-on software development with Unreal 4 or Unity 5 with excellent C++ and C# skills.

  • Extensive experience developing AI and complex shooter game mechanics.

  • 5+ years 3D game design or related corporate work with Unity or Unreal a must.

  • Excellent documenting and code optimization skills with C++ and C#.

  • 1+ Years of VR game experience with Unity or Unreal.

  • 5+ years object oriented programming, 3D math & complex math computations required.

  • Code, size and memory optimization skills a must.

  • First-hand knowledge of designing and optimizing scripts, custom coding and algorithms

  • Familiarity with Maya, 3D Modeling, rigging and animating skills a plus.

  • Experience working with particle systems in Unreal and Unity.

  • Thorough understanding and use of Direct X 11 /12.

  • Basic HTC Vive, Oculus and VR Gear knowledge required.

  • Basic understanding of graphics, audio/video, networking, memory handling, script compilers, I/O, physics engines, managing resources and assets.


Please email your resume to resumes@labrodex.com in pdf format with salary requirements.


This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is looking for a ground-floor opportunity at a new VR/3D entertainment software firm.  If you are looking for entry into this space, please send us your resume!

Lead Unity 4 Developer, Unity 5 Software Engineer, Unity 5 Game Designer, Unity 5 Software Developer, UE4, UE3, Gaming / Unreal 4 / Virtual Reality / VR / Entertainment / 3D Gaming / New York / Long Island / Video Game Design

jobs.title: Training Manager
jobs.content:
About us
Sticker Mule is the Internet's fastest growing printing company. We invest heavily in training to make our people successful and want an outstanding training manager to continually improve the effectiveness of our training programs. Our team is 100% remote and we use Lessonly to manage our training content. 

Job description
Develops & maintains training programs primarily to support our customer service, manufacturing & proofing teams. 

Work performed
1. Works with management & employees to identify training needs.
2. Collaborates with subject matter experts to develop training courses.
3. Updates training courses as needed when processes change. 
4. Evaluates training and works to continually enhance effectiveness. 
5. Creates training simulations using Adobe Captivate. 
6. Discusses training effectiveness with employees to identify improvements. 
7. Maintains company knowledge base.

The ideal candidate will be...
1. Willing to travel to work on-site in the factory. 
2. Interested in developing technical training for manufacturing & proofing. 
3. Able to quickly learn & synthesize new topics. 
4. Highly experienced developing corporate training. 

Compensation
1. Salary: $60k - $90k
2. Signing bonus: $10k
3. Health & dental insurance
4. 4 weeks paid vacation
5. Flexible work hours

To apply: Apply online: http://bit.ly/2hp6itX
