jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Can be located in DC, Indianapolis, San Francisco or Austin.


This is an opportunity in the Product Development team, responsible for the backbone of our flagship product. If you are an experienced engineer, care about education, and want to shape the future of online learning, we want to speak with you.  We are looking for an engineer with the following experience:



  • Lead the development of high performing, scalable software solutions from concept to code.



  • Become an active technology leader that can work with multiple teams and stakeholders to enhance our platforms. Participate in daily stand-ups, design sessions, code reviews, sprint demos.

  • Embrace test development as an integral part of what you deliver as a software developer.

  • Be willing to respond to the unique challenges of delivering and maintaining large scale, SaaS based solutions. This includes troubleshooting live production environments, minimizing downtime, and responding to client-reported issues.

  • Develop innovative technical solutions to the challenging of building a cloud scale application.

  • Support and develop software engineers by providing advice and mentoring.

  • Present detailed tradeoffs and recommendations to senior staff.

jobs.title: QA Automation Engineer required to help us keep 4 billion phones connected!
jobs.content:
The successful candidate will join a dedicated QA team with responsibility for proving quality across the full range of ding’s top-up products and mobile operator interfaces. Working hand-in-hand with the development team you will have extensive experience in automating QA’s function in an online processing environment.


As a QA Automation Engineer, you will be responsible for:



  • Implementing and extending the existing web UI framework while defining and building the native mobile application framework.This new framework will cover platform API test automation, third party API test automation and custom test automation.

  • Implement a strategy to run automated test cycles on a nightly basis

  • Build and maintain a solution (or integrate a third party solution) to output test results on a daily basis that are reliable and user friendly

  • Work with the QA manager and developers to complement the level of unit / system testing being executed by developers using BDD methodologies

  • Work closely with scrum teams to build effective and useful tests by providing test scenarios as part of user story reviews.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Can you improve how we manage our very large web platform that keeps 11 million users playing globally every month? Would you like to embark on a career towards specializing in DevOps technologies in a company that still has the start-up spirit intact?


About The Job


Our Game Reliability Engineering team is searching for an uncommonly talented DevOps Engineer, responsible for building the systems and tools that enable our teams to develop a world class social gaming experience for our millions of monthly users. We hold the strong belief that standing up a healthy environment should be fast, automated, and intuitive. We empower our teams to use the tools and technologies that will provide our users the best social gaming experience on all our games. As a DevOps Engineer at MovieStarPlanet, the sky's the limit on the impact you can have on the business. All our teams at MovieStarPlanet engineer and participate in deploying their own code, and therefore they look to us for advice, guidance and stability. Because of this relationship our DevOps Engineers will have a stronger focus in development to provide that missing link between Development and Operations. We believe in having a deep understanding of our infrastructure and believe in picking the right tool for the job. Our application stacks run the games from .NET and Java, we embrace infrastructure as code and automation tools, and don’t shy from any AWS cloud technologies.


As our new DevOps Engineer your principal duties and responsibilities will be to:



  • Develop, build, and implement a continuous integration service in our multi-platform environment

  • Define and deploy logging, monitoring, and versioning metrics for the deployment process

  • Cultivate and tend to operational automation processes

  • Build tools for monitoring app performance and real user transaction testing

  • Contributing ideas on how to continuously improve systems and processes

  • Application development experience with emphasis on agile process

  • Automating all the things

jobs.title: Senior Engineer - DevOps
jobs.content:
SingleComm LLC is a venture funded startup based in Richmond Virginia and New York City. We develop and support an industry-leading contact center as a service platform used by businesses of all sizes to run their contact center operations. Our platform is deployed in AWS and allows contact centers of all sizes to replace their enterprise PBX and order management systems with a cloud based system. Your challenge, as our Senior Engineer - DevOps, will be to ensure our application exceeds our expectations of high availability, flexibility and cost effectiveness. You will work with our team of experienced engineers to build, maintain, automate and monitor our world class infrastructure in AWS.


Responsibilities



  • Interact with our software engineering and QA teams to deploy and operate our AWS hosted applications

  • Operate, build, and constantly improve our deployment, monitoring and operational systems

  • Troubleshoot performance and availability issues, and manage a team of support engineers

  • Continually create and implement strategies to scale, harden and optimize our application


Qualifications



  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Science or an engineering related field

  • 5+ years experience as a DevOps engineer Experience with Linux/Unix administration

  • Shell scripting

  • Automation and configuration management experience including experience with either Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or equivalents

  • Strong AWS experience

  • Effective written and verbal communication including the ability to write effective procedures and documentation for Tier 1 support staff

  • Ability to manage Tier 1 and other support staff

  • Bonus points for experience in telecom or real time communications environments

jobs.title: Senior Engineer
jobs.content: SingleComm LLC is a venture funded startup based in Richmond Virginia and New York City. We develop and support an industry-leading contact center as a service platform used by businesses of all sizes to run their contact center operations. Our platform is deployed in AWS and allows contact centers of all sizes to replace their enterprise PBX and order management systems with a cloud based system. The Senior Engineer - Data Architecture will be a key member of our engineering team and will focus on designing data topologies and pipelines for handling, storing and retrieving the data we generate each day. You will also be responsible for developing tools and pipelines that allow our users to access and extract their data to manage their contact center operations.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer to build a banking backend form the very beginning
jobs.content:
You will love working at Krypton, because



as one of the first team members, you will get the chance to shape our product and grow the company


––Your work directly contributes to redefine how people invest their money. We are a young team, ambitious to build the best designed mobile experience in the market


you will find an excellent working environment in the heart of Berlin. We are well funded with a seven digit number by some of the most renowned players in the industry. Krypton Investing offers you the unique opportunity to be part of one of the most exciting fintechs in Europe


we offer you a competitive compensation and the opportunity of an equity package, along with additional benefits


. 


As our Backend Engineer you will


– build our bank-facing backend infrastructure as well as mobile API


– access and integrate our banking partners' complex real-time systems


– design and implement various features, e.g. streaming real-time capital market data, ensuring banking-grade security


– seek own responsibilities and hold ownership of important parts of our systems


 .

jobs.title: Backend Developer
jobs.content:
MOBGEN delivers mobile platforms that strengthen the relationship between customers and brands or companies and employees. We aim to make mobile interaction easy, engaging and rewarding, so that users become loyal and life-long brand-ambassadors. We're looking for a seasoned Backend developer to help us do just that.


Why Backend Developers are important at MOBGEN?


Backend developers are responsible for the development, architectural design and implementation of server side applications, web services and API’s.


They translate requirements into a full working functional design, create (client friendly) documentation for all services and or API’s and assist the frontend team during implementation.


Senior developers assist juniors by answering technical questions and lead by example demonstrating best practice application design choices.


What do Backend developers do at MOBGEN?



  • Lead technical projects, ensuring the wishes of the client and end-user;

  • Create technical designs and manage a timely implementation of it. Keeping in control of project specifications, company’s design, coding and performance tuning standards;

  • Work closely with other development units in the company to share information regarding application subject matters and know-how.


The following experience is relevant to us:



  • Solid engineering fundamentals with expertise in web development technologies;

  • At least 5 years of experience as a developer;

  • Solid understanding of OOP;

  • Design and develop enterprise RESTful web services;

  • Strong experience with either PHP or Node.js;

  • Good experience with some frameworks (e.g. for PHP Yii, Symfony, Laravel, etc. For Node.js ExpressJS, Koa, etc);

  • Very good understanding of RDBMS and NoSQL database systems;

  • Understanding of different caching mechanisms;

  • Advanced knowledge of design and architectural patterns;

  • Source control system (GIT, Mercurial);

  • Experience with Continuous Integration (Jenkins, Bamboo);

  • Experience with Linux servers;

  • Capable of clarifying complex problems and structures to a broad audience;

  • Experience in large IT projects, preferably in the mobile area;

  • Communicative, accurate and pragmatic;

  • Strong analytical and creative problem solving skills;

  • Good knowledge of English spoken and written;


Nice to have



  • Previous experience in the mobile area;

  • Experience in TDD;

  • Experience with Continuous Delivery;

  • Cloud infrastructure (Docker, AWS, Google Cloud);

  • Experience as team leader.


Benefits



  • Market based salary;

  • Equipment of your choice;

  • Fruits and snacks;

  • Paid time off;

  • Lots of team building activities;

  • Internal hackathons;

  • Internal skill sharing;

  • And more...

jobs.title: CTO / CO-FOUNDER FOR A PROPTECH STARTUP
jobs.content:
CTO / CO-FOUNDER FOR A PROPTECH STARTUP


Do you want to move one of the largest industries worldwide with cutting edge digital products?


Do you want to create a product and company that really adds value and matters to professionals?


Then we have the right opportunity for you:


Ready to jump-start our business we are now hiring our technical mastermind to create a gamechanging


product! We have an outstanding setup with strong partners in the real estate industry.


{WHAT YOU WILL DO}



  • Be the technical mastermind behind our vision and make it happen

  • Hire, build and lead our engineering team

  • Start from the green-field and build the product, infrastructure and processes

  • Establish a scalable service architecture, build a deploy chain, define development processes,ensure code quality and automated testing and integrate cloud services (AWS)

  • Shape the company’s culture and strategy as top management team member


{ABOUT YOU}



  • At least three years of work experience in senior tech roles and/or C-Level tech positions

  • The know-how to lead an agile developer team and get things done

  • A solid knowledge of working with and building integrations (APIs)

  • Strong skillset in building analytics solutions

  • Extensive experience with dynamic languages, database modeling and ETL processes

  • Entrepreneurial spirit and a hands-on mentality

  • You have good communication skills and are able to quickly adapt to new challenges when needed

  • Ideally you previously worked in a startup and/or in a dynamic environment

  • Excellent analytical, logical and critical thinking skills

  • Fluency in English and/or German


{WHAT WE OFFER}



  • A challenging project that will significantly improve existing industry processes

  • Full freedom in setting up the product, setup and team

  • A competitive salary and an equity stake in the company

  • Secured seed-funding and high investors’ interest in business model

  • An enthusiastic, dynamic and professional team

  • Loft-style office in Berlin Kreuzberg and excellent network of successful entrepreneurs

  • Free breakfast, drinks and fruit to keep energy levels high


If you want to join us on our vision to change the real estate industry fundamentally send us


your application including your CV and Github profile (if available) here.


We are looking forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: NetOps
jobs.content:
Vous assurez l'évolution et la performance de notre infrastructure Réseau.

Vos missions :



  • Administrer les équipements réseaux, en veillant particulièrement à la disponibilité et à la sécurité de l'infrastructure et des services.

  • Diagnostiquer la véritable origine des problèmes : root cause analysis.  

  • Accompagner la croissance de l'infrastructure (liens et équipements) : capacity planning.

  • Automatiser la gestion de la production : devops.

  • Proposer des optimisations d'utilisation.

  • Piloter les changements et participer à la documentation interne.  

  • Répondre aux demandes des utilisateurs internes du service Network

jobs.title: Architecte logiciel
jobs.content:
En coordination avec nos différentes équipes, vous participez à la définition de l'architecture, la conception et l'intégration de projets bâtis sur la base des infrastructures et technologies OVH à destination de nos clients.

Vous êtes en charge de préconiser des solutions sur les aspects suivants : disponibilité, performances, capacité, configuration, conformité, sécurité, optimisation.

Vous êtes le garant du respect des bonnes pratiques sécurité et de l'Industrialisation des processus de production.

Vous pilotez les projets techniques et avez la responsabilité du fond documentaire technique tels que les documents d'Architecture et d'Exploitation.

Vos principales missions :



  •     Mise en place d'architectures logicielles, participer au développement de notre système d'information

  •     Conception et architectures des bases de données

  •     Mise en place de microservices, API, SDK

  •     Préconiser les optimisations des architectures logicielles et assurer une veille technologique

  •     Réaliser de spécifications détaillées et documents d'architecture technique.

  •     Mettre en place ces infrastructures en tenant compte des problématiques de criticité et performance (temps de réponse, nombre de connections simultanées, charge machine, éviter les single point of failure, éviter les bottleneck )

jobs.title: DevOps VOIP
jobs.content:
Au sein de l'équipe Telecom, vous intervenez sur les produits VOIP/SMS/Fax. Vous êtes en charge d'améliorer les produits et infrastructures existantes afin d'augmenter la satisfaction de nos clients sur ces produits.
OVH a développé il y a 10 ans son service VOIP/ SMS/ Fax afin de faciliter la vie de ses clients. Sur le même principe que les infrastructures hébergements et cloud, OVH a souhaité automatiser le maximum d'actions pour simplifier la configuration et l'utilisation du produit VOIP. Dans ce cadre, vous intégrez une équipe en charge d'améliorer la stabilité de nos plateformes (200 000 lignes SIP)


Missions :



  •     Concevoir et formaliser des solutions d'automatisation de déploiement

  •     Participer au développement et à l'optimisation du réseau Voip en vous appuyant sur des micro services

  •     Vous effectuez une veille active sur les nouveaux équipements et protocoles

  •     Vous êtes en contact régulier avec les équipes RUN afin de corriger les incidents remontés

  •     Vous assurez la qualité de service à travers des indicateurs de performance

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
• You extend our platform to deliver new processes, workflows and features

  • You work with web and interface designers to implement their creations, and provide input during the design process

  • You offer constant feedback to product management, QA, and development teams

  • You participate in agile processes

  • You develop your knowledge and skills continuously

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.content:
• You communicate with product owners about all the ecratum features

  • You write the User Stories and detail these together with the team

  • You manage the product roadmap, ensuring timely delivery

  • You co-ordinate and document the user feedback from all sources

  • You write non-technical documentation and communicate product progress to Marketing, Sales and Customer Success Departments

  • You manage the public Feature Request Board

  • You report directly to ecratum management

jobs.title: Senior Rails Programmer who likes simple
jobs.content:
This isn't some nifty iPhone app that people are going to download once and never use again. We're building the backbone to retail operations. That's over 17 million people in North America alone who could have a less crappy job because we exist. Our software solves a real problem, and the people we're selling to love us for it.

We also believe strongly in personal growth, challenges, and open communication. You will have a strong voice in the company and help influence its direction.. as well as your own. You get to help build a team of people that you love to work with, just as we would hire you if you're someone that we would love to work with.

--

Retailers use archaic, old systems that don't work (think fax machines and voicemails). We're replacing the core operational processes with a modern platform that our customers love. The simplest way to think about it is a task list for every store, managed by headquarters. Help us transform a $4.4 trillion industry and improve the way millions of people work. Major retailers are using Zipline every day, but there is so much more to do!

âI think I just shed a tear. This is great!â â One of our Fortune 100 customers

You will start out being responsible for the core infrastructure and servers. But, you aren't limited to one area of the product. There are a million other things that go into making a full-featured, modern SaaS app. The role will grow and change along with our customer's needs and your interests. Plenty of room to learn, grow, and make an impact.

Our tech stack is PostgreSQL, Ruby, and React.js. Deep understanding of Ruby / Rails is a must so that we can move quickly. However, we are always on the lookout for better ways to get the job done. You will be central to those conversations and influence the direction that we take.

You will help define our culture through hiring decisions, process design, and your personality. You don't need to have experience with management. But, a desire to help your co-workers grow makes a world of difference.

âTerrific founders with technical and domain expertise, totally focused on customer success. Their progress in the first year is amazing.â - One of our investors

Ideally, you are:

- able to distill complex problems into simple, elegant solutions 
- in a senior or leadership position on a large application 
- a developer who cares about the people who use your product 
- a good writer and can back up your opinions with data 
- an even better listener; always looking to expand your knowledge 
- driven to get things done and willing to put in the work 
- experienced with working remotely or managing a remote team 
- interested in the journey of growing a company

To apply: Send an email to careers@retailzipline.com. We have a predisposition for good writers, so a cover letter will go a long way. If you want a head start or if you'd rather talk in code, completing a hiring exercise works for us as well: https://github.com/jhubert/hiring-exercises/tree/master/grouping

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As part of the Service Engineering team for the Radiology Information Systems (RIS) you are responsible for ensuring on-time delivery of web server developments, service product features, technical publications, training and service process validation. The position provides exposure to the entire system and requires communication with all functions in the organization and will be involved in the full life cycle of the product from definition to verification/validation and installed base support.


Essential Responsibilities



  • Develop setup and deployment procedures for the RIS-i Application Server Environment

  • Define procedures and tools for install and update of the RIS-i Application Server Environment

  • Measure and define environment requirements for the RIS-i Web Server Environment, including network, system dimension and troubleshooting

  • Provide technical documentation according to the engineering guidelines (system requirements, test cases, product design documents, service instructions)

  • Develop and maintain automated Build and Deployment Scenarios

  • Own product and subsystem requirements related to serviceability

  • Train service personnel on technical procedures

jobs.title: JavaScript Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
Tripaneer.com is looking for a JavaScript Front-End Engineer to improve the user experience of our products.


Full time and long term | Join our international team in Amsterdam


This is your opportunity to join a fast growing startup and to make your mark. We believe that a great customer experience is key to the success of our business and in our small but growing team you will have the responsibility and freedom to ideate, implement, test and deliver improvements to our websites and other future products.


We’re looking for an experienced front end developer who is motivated by making measurable customer focused improvements to our products. The main responsibility is to implement features but also to own the front end infrastructure, and topics such as ease of implementation, performance & scalability. The Tripaneer.com team works in a highly collaborative environment of critique and iteration, involving experienced developers and the founders of Tripaneer.com


Since the launch of our first website in April 2013 our revenues have mostly funded our growth, and recently we received additional investment.

jobs.title: Senior Delivery Engineer
jobs.content:
Join Sievo, and you will join one of the fastest growing software companies in Europe. We are determined to change how companies – and specifically their sourcing teams – exploit big data and analytics for better decision making. Our self-financed, profitable growth proves that we have a solid business and a product that really adds value to our customers. We operate on global scale, serving customers such as Carlsberg, Schindler, GoDaddy and MTN. For you, this means demanding and rewarding career opportunities.


You would be part of our agile and experienced Technology team which is responsible for the development, operation and maintenance of our SaaS solution. At Sievo, working with our software solution means managing large data sets and enterprise wide solutions, developing a robust platform and maintaining the good quality.


As a Senior Delivery Engineer you will



  • Take an active role in developing our infrastructure further

  • Care for production and development environments

  • Act as a go-to person and guide to your peers and developers

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer: Scala
jobs.content:
BoozeBud.com is Australia’s leading online liquor marketplace, a true scalable business at the intersection of retail and technology.


Technology powers Boozebud, adding real value every day.


We believe:



  • There is great opportunity in multiple areas of retail: online, logistics, warehouse management, supply chain, data analytics

  • Custom solutions can out perform off the shelf industry standard solutions

  • Investment in technology is key to success


How we work:



  • We work hand in hand with the business to deliver change and add value

  • We deliver transformational changes quickly and safely

  • We use Scala for robustness, and to minimise complexity

  • We release to production multiple times per day

  • We have the minimum required process


We are some way along the technology journey and have major building blocks in place, including real time stock management, accounting and inventory management.


We are expanding the development team, to deliver quicker, to enable the business to grow faster.


The Role:


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will have extensive experience in delivering working solutions. You would be expected to have lots of server side development experience, if you are proficient full stack then even better.


Specific Scala experience is not required, but a willingness to learn and come up to speed quickly is. We are pragmatic and aim for simple readable code. Immutable and pure concepts and functional programming are useful and have their place, but we don't overweight this versus other considerations.


You'll be reporting directly to the CTO and founders and have the opportunity to have a major impact. We pay well to secure experienced, capable people who add value.


We’re creating a platform that’s truly unique and we need brains and passion to bring it to life. If you're a highly motivated top performer, this role offers exciting long-term prospects with one of Australia’s fastest growing and most innovative companies.

jobs.title: Security Analyst Â­ Forensics Remediation
jobs.content:
Wordfence is responsible for securing over 1 Million active WordPress websites. We are the most popular security product for WordPress publishers by a significant margin. We also help our customers recover from a hacked site.


We are looking for security analysts to join our forensics team. You will assist our customers to investigate how their site was hacked and to repair their site and remove all traces of the intrusion. In addition to this you will also collect evidence from intrusions that will help improve our product. You will need to determine how the intrusion occurred and then collect all IOC’s (indicators of compromise) and share this data with our product team in a structured way.


General requirements:


You must be highly technical and be comfortable with a wide range of open source tools.


Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


You must work well in a team.


You must be nimble, be able to come up with creative solutions to challenging problems and must have a mature approach to problem solving.


Attention to detail.


Note: Applicants who can work weekends will be given priority consideration.


We are a small, fast moving and fast growing company with a loyal customer base who love our products and services. We have the highest star rating for any WordPress plugin in history and we pride ourselves on providing an excellent product with great customer service that helps secure small and large production websites.


If you're passionate about information security and would like to help secure the web, this is your dream job. We have a friendly, highly capable team with a sense of humor who move fast. We take our team's family time seriously and don't ask you to work long hours if we can avoid it (we almost always can). Our entire team works remotely using Slack for casual interaction ­so you can live practically anywhere in the World as long as you have an Internet connection. Wordfence is high growth, but we are not a startup. The company is still controlled by the founders, we are profitable and have been for several years. So you will enjoy the rush of high growth but you won't have to risk working for a company that is controlled by venture capitalists or may not be here tomorrow.

jobs.title: ASML - the Dutch Silicon Valley is looking for Software Design Engineers!
jobs.content:
Introduction










Is solving complex software engineering problems your passion? Does working in a multi-cultural environment make you spin? Does contributing to world’s most advanced lithography machines make you feel proud? Then this might be the right opportunity for you.


Job Mission




As a part of ASML’s Metrology Software department, you will provide the software solutions that realize the metrology system functions, producing sub-nm measurement and control accuracy. Your solutions emerge from sound software engineering practice and take low effort to develop and maintain. You choose for system-wide experience and drive for successful customer deployment.


Job Description




ASML’s lithography systems deliver nanometer accuracy at high productivity. The required accuracy level cannot be achieved by hardware and mechatronics solutions only.  At system level, imperfections of the subsystems need to be measured and corrected. The Metrology Functional Group creates mathematical models describing the lithography machine and its imperfections. The parameters of these models are calibrated using several sensors present in the machine. The calibrations of the machine can be done offline in a dedicated calibration test, or inline while running production. Afterwards, the calibrated parameters are used to control the machine in such a manner that the inaccuracies are corrected.


Solutions of the Metrology Functional Group are implemented in software by the Metrology Software Department.  Your role is to design, realize and integrate high-quality software engineering solutions, allowing fast and efficient delivery of complex metrology functions. Within the Metrology Software Department, we are reshaping our software architecture to facilitate seamless implementation of the metrology functions in our software. By introducing engineering practices such as Model Driven Engineering, we increase our engineering efficiency.

jobs.title: Google AdWords (SEM) Account Manager
jobs.content:
We are The PPC Guys, a virtual agency specializing in pay per click marketing. We are a ~10 person remote team with a strong list of stable, long-term clients. 

Are you a driven, details-obsessed, digital marketing pro? Have you ever lost track of time because you were deep diving analytics data? Do you know how to read SEM sales data and use that knowledge to boost profits for a company? If so, we may have the position for you.

We are seeking a full-time Paid Search Manager who is ready to join a company with strong potential for advancement due to rapid growth. This role helps manage and optimize client accounts on Google AdWords, Bing Ads and Facebook Ads. This is a work from anywhere position, so you will be allowed to work wherever you work best!

Responsibilities:
  • Set-up PPC campaigns across Google Adwords (primary), Bing Ads and Facebook Ads
  • Maintain and optimize existing client PPC advertising accounts. A typical PPC manager will have 6-8 accounts total and will work alongside a project manager from our team
  • Make meaningful, well thought out recommendations to clients that will translate to increased sales for your assigned accounts
  • Proactively come up with ideas to improve accounts, improve client ROI and meet strict CPA goals
  • Work directly with clients by phone, Skype and email to build client relationships (must be able to speak knowledgeably and confidently about PPC strategies and technical PPC tactics)
  • Strong initiative and time management with the ability to manage multiple PPC accounts simultaneously
  • Take the lead on the Paid Ad topics of client calls to cover past results and to suggest improvements
  • A commitment to continued learning in the industry to stay on top of new PPC trends and releases to keep accounts on the cutting edge of PPC; training sessions are an important part of the company culture

Requirements:
  • Must have managed at least 3 Google AdWords client accounts simultaneously for 6+ months; preferably mature accounts with substantial ad spend
  • A keen knowledge of effective SEM media buying strategies which are contingent upon achieving a target CPA
  • Successful conversion-based media buying with Facebook and/or through Googleâs Search/Display network
  • Keyword research and the ability to quickly identify keyword themes (strong understanding of the English language to identify potential high converting keywords and keyword themes)
  • Strong understanding of mobile advertising, including call-only ads (click to call)
  • Google Remarketing/Retargeting with experience setting up and optimizing user audiences
  • Strong skill level in data analysis, strong ability to make educated decisions based on data
  • Intermediate-Advanced knowledge of AdWords Editor
  • Comfort using Microsoft Excel to analyze pay per click advertising data

Bonus for any of the following:
  • Experience in Google Shopping / Bing Shopping set-up and optimization (including product feed set-up and customization)
  • Google Analytics data analysis and customization experience
  • Experience training other account managers or interns
  • Landing Page development/editing experience (Unbounce.com)
  • Graphic design skills (for landing pages and banner ads)
  • Coding experience (enough to place code, make basic edits and check that existing code is placed correctly)
  • If you are Google AdWords certified in any area, send a link to your certification when you apply

Whatâs In It For You?
  • Competitive compensation (dependent on your experience and monthly time commitment)
  • Creative performance incentives
  • Work alongside a team of talented internet marketers, most of whom have been with us for 3+ years
  • Freedom to work when, where, and how you work best
  • You wonât be micro-managed here
  • Work (in your sweats, if you like) from anywhere
  • Gain experience across multiple industries and sectors through our varied client base

This is a 100% remote position; our team is located in 2 countries (USA and Canada) and 3 time zones. 

To apply: Please email careers@theppcguys.com with your cover letter and resume.Please also include a list of 2 Google AdWords features that you are most excited about for in the coming months.

  • Document designs, code and all project assets in an organized and up-to-date manner.

  • Provide initial analysis and produce accurate levels of effort.

  • Implement established Publishing Services processes in the course of his/her work.

  • Support development operations.

  • Maintain code bases.

  • Provide solutions to complex engineering tasks.

  • Troubleshoot problems and issues with code and data.

  • Research emerging technologies and make recommendations for processes improvements.

  • Participate in code review in a senior technical capacity.

jobs.title: Business Intelligence QlikView Developer
jobs.content:
Do you have proven track record of accomplishments in development, as well as thrive in a demanding, fast-paced, ever-evolving work environment?  Are you self-disciplined and methodical with coding practices, yet be comfortable and agile within iterative and incremental development practices?  How does being part of a dynamic and driven team who are creating and delivering custom BI solutions sound?


14 West, an Agora Company, has an opportunity for a BI QlikView Developer to join our growing Marketing Intelligence team.  The BI QlickView Developer is responsible for technical development, implementation and support of the company’s core reporting services.  In this role you will employ the BI tool, Qlikview, and MS SQL development processes like SSIS and stored procedures, to efficiently extract and convert data from multiple sources into cohesive, accurate data-marts to be accessed by marketing and other business-driven reporting. 





Responsibilities






  • QlikView Development


    • Work closely with the Business Analyst to design and code accurate, visualizing engaging and highly actionable reports and dashboards

    • Understand the business objectives and goals of every project and ensure that the business requirements are translated correctly in the code

    • Develop innovative Qlikview applications that enable business discovery and are technically sound in terms of performance and coding standards

    • Provide technical expertise, innovation and leadership in QlikView development to the internal team and external vendors

    • Support the internal team and the user community in all testing and QA processes

    • Grasp key concepts related to publishing, direct marketing and backend business operations to effectively apply in reporting development        

    • Support the maintenance and enhancement of existing reporting applications to support the changing business needs




  • Database Development and Maintenance


    • Collaborate with and support the data development team in the design, structure and implementation phases of key data-mart development initiatives

    • Design and develop SSIS packages, database objects, stored procedures and packages, views, tables, triggers and ETL code using coding standards and according to technical specifications

    • Design and develop MS SQL processes that extract data from multiple source systems including an EDW and an ERP 

    • Support all testing and QA processes to ensure correct application of logic from concept to production

    • Support the maintenance and enhancement of existing SSIS jobs

    • Analyze and collaborate with database administrators to improve database strategies to maximize performance, capacity and security

jobs.title: IT Director
jobs.content:
IT Director

InVision is the world's leading product design platform, powering the future of digital product design through our deep understanding of the dynamics of collaboration. We provide two million people with the power to prototype, review, refine, manage and user test web and mobile products. InVision drives the product design process at leading Fortune 100 companies, including at Disney, IBM, Walmart, Apple, Verizon and General Motors. Backed by Accel, ICONIQ Capital, FirstMark Capital, Tiger Global and others. InVision is a distributed team with over 200 employees around the world.

Mission: This position will play a critical role in establishing InVisionâs internal strategy and policies for the seamless provisioning of equipment and software to more than 200 remote employees worldwide so they can do their jobs effectively and securely. Day-to-day will include management of vendor relationships and logistics, as well hands-on support in a Mac environment. To start, this will be an individual position, but there are numerous opportunities to expand within our rapidly growing organization.

Additional Responsibilities:
  • Provision equipment, software, and services for new hires
  • Ensure that employees receive first-line support when issues arise with hardware/software
  • Pragmatic security prevention to mitigate loss of confidential information and equipment while being mindful of employee productivity
  • Manage vendor relationships, applications, and license renewals
  • Optimize budget and spend for equipment and software

Competencies:
  • Creative operational thinker with good judgment on policy creation
  • Pragmatic with a customer-service mindset
  • Ability to support 200+ remote employees in a fast-paced, startup environment
  • Ability to foster and manage strong vendor relationships
  • Not afraid to roll up sleeves and be hands-on

Background:
  • Experience with procurement of equipment, including managing vendor relationships
  • Experience managing internal helpdesk or third-party vendors for desktop support
  • Ideally experience providing remote support to managed desktops
  • Experience managing seats in corporate accounts (Atlassian, Google Apps, etc.)
  • Support of Mac environments strongly preferred

InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs more than 200 team members working remotely in 14 countries around the world. In the United States we have teams including hubs in New York, San Francisco, Austin, Portland, and Boston. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose. Among other benefits, we have a flexible vacation policy, unlimited Starbucks cards for each employee, and unlimited books related to your profession.

To apply: Please apply directly online at: https://invision.workable.com/jobs/338901

jobs.title: Senior Node.JS Azure Developer
jobs.content:
MAARK is seeking a freelance or contractor Senior Web Developer to build a REST web service. Web service will be built using Node.js, connecting to Azure SQL database, inside Azure cloud environment.


Benefits


ability to work remote


Maark was founded in 2001 with the vision of setting standards. We wanted to collaboratively create the work that would serve as a standard by which our clients judge their future work, and by which their customers judge their competition.

We believe that core to this vision is a passion for innovation, and a broad understanding of how the digital world moves, communicates, engages and interacts with its fully connected environment. We help our clients define and communicate their vision and their story, design new digital experiences, and develop applications at the intersection of where whats possible meets whats relevant.

jobs.title: WordPress Developer
jobs.content:
1FEE is looking for a WordPress Developer to join its rapidly growing WordPress division! A funded startup since August 2015 and backed by an agency(newmedia) with 20 years of experience, 1FEE.com is bringing the high-end agency experience to small and medium-sized businesses, organizations, and anyone else wanting to make a bigger impact on the web while not breaking the bank. 

WordPress Developers are responsible for ensuring each website is correctly built and delivered to the client. They are responsible for ensuring that all deliverables meet or exceed company baseline standards of performance and quality. WordPress Developers are expected to be problem solvers, with the ability to evaluate several options in order to pick the solution that provides a best fit between clients requirements and the project budget and timeline. WordPress Developers are able to debug and/or modify existing PHP and Javascript. They are highly consultative and help Project Managers and clients make sound decisions on the right path forward. Ultimately, they opt for configuration versus custom solutions, which allow the customer to get the largest ROI from open source software.

jobs.title: .NET Application Developer
jobs.content:
File Dynamics are looking for .NET developers to join their central Bristol team; if you have just graduated from an IT related degree or are looking to take the next step in your career as a .NET developer this is the job for you!


The Job:
As an application developer at File Dynamics you will be working on a diverse portfolio of projects, from website and desktop applications to line-of-business software services and MI reporting engines. Often using the latest tools and technologies, you will be expected to expand and showcase your technical skills from day-one in a friendly and successful development team. The role will be based in central Bristol although some of the team are based in Leeds and Fareham.


To help you keep your technical skills sharp and up to date you will be given an unlimited account on PluralSight.com to learn new skills both in and out of the work environment (with dedicated work time each month).


Role Duties and Responsibilities:
This role will involve writing clean, readable and reusable code using Object Oriented principles and working with the team to deliver high quality software.  The successful candidate will be highly organised with a track record of working in the context of a structured agile life-cycle.  They will be able to work to strict specifications whilst still ensuring they develop the best solution for the customer.  A key part of this role will be acting as a technical point-of-contact for other IT staff and business users.  It is essential whilst carrying out this role to keep abreast of latest methods and trends in programming and be aware of when they should or should not be used!


Our Tools  & Technologies



  • Microsoft Visual Studio 2015

  • Microsoft SQL Server 2012+

  • Microsoft Azure Platform

  • Trello for project management

  • Visual Studio Team Services

  • Source Vault

  • Slack Messenger

  • Agile Planning


Why Join us?
With Investors in People accreditation since 1998, we positively encourage our staff to progress and develop within the Company.  We recognise that our continued growth and success is the direct result of the contribution of our staff.


Our wide range of benefits, include a generous holiday entitlement, flexible benefits (including pension, childcare vouchers, bikes for work and health screening), bonus scheme and development opportunities.  We have an active social committee and support various charities/fundraising events across the UK.


We are an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from a wide range of candidates.


Please note that any offer of employment is subject to a satisfactory credit check and basic criminal record check. This information will only be used to assess suitability for employment insofar as it is relevant.


This position is based in central Bristol, UK. Interviews will be held in early January 2017.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Opportunity


We have an opportunity for a Senior Full Stack Developer with top-shelf skills to join our tight and talented team in Toronto (no remote—sorry). You’ll be collaborating closely with strategy, design, and contributing your skills with the Dev team. We are a fast-paced agency with a full pipeline.


You’ll be bringing your existing skill set and helping us evolve our stack on a wide range of projects. We’re currently a very heavy LAMP stack shop but have a number of projects that fall outside this wheelhouse. We want to move to a new Wheelhouse. 


You’ll be working with clients like Fitbit, eHealth Ontario, City of Toronto (GreenP), and Toshiba (to name a few) to push unexpectedly clever features and functionality to existing and new web properties and applications. We’d like you to be curious and courageous enough to bring new technologies into the fold. You have a chance to be part of a small team and make a huge impact on how things are done.



Your Personality


The kind of personality we’re looking for is someone who is both detail oriented but also sees the big picture. You’re interested in supporting your team and you enjoy growing your skills by rising to challenges. You’re flexible and open and understand that clients aren’t an impediment to doing great work, rather, they are an opportunity to do your best work. You’re a great communicator who strives to create context and visibility for everyone involved on a project. You use We more than I. You have contributed to the dev community and your passion for technology is clearly demonstrated through development related networks (Codepen, Git) and commentary/opinion channels (Medium, your own blog, Twitter, Instagram).

jobs.title: Web Design & Multimedia Specialist
jobs.content: Marymount Manhattan College is hiring a Web Design & Multimedia Specialist in New York

jobs.title: Full-stack engineer
jobs.content:
Zemanta is based on the idea that all content deserves an audience. We've been building Zemanta One, the most advanced content promotion platform in the world, and we are expanding our engineering team to take it to the next level. With millions in funding, years of experience in content marketing and offices in Europe and the US, we are a small, fast-moving team that is constantly breaking new ground in marketing technology.


We are looking for a versatile software engineer to help us build the next generation of features for our user-facing, data heavy dashboard. Whether it’s rebuilding our reporting backend to support real-time querying of huge amounts of data across two databases, designing a REST API to let our customers hook into our systems or pushing the limits of the browsers’ rendering engines to make our UI silky smooth, we never run out of interesting problems to solve.



  • You will join a small, independent team of talented engineers responsible for making our customers' workflow as smooth and efficient as possible.

  • You will own and implement features end to end. This means you will often need to design, implement, test, deploy and support code across multiple systems, including our Angular client, Django web server and a number of backend services written in Python or Go.

  • We don't do waterfall - our product managers don't write requirements and throw them over to engineering to implement. Instead, your team will be given enough context to understand what problems we are facing as a company, and collaborate with product managers to find optimal solutions.

  • You'll get a lot of freedom - our engineers are encouraged to work on any part of the codebase to get the job done, and they deploy all the code themselves. This will allow you to move fast and deliver value as fast as possible with nothing slowing you down.

  • However, this also brings responsibility - we expect you to maintain very high standards of code quality, ensure excellent unit-test coverage and take care of any issues in production.

  • We keep all our code in Github and we do a lot of code reviews to share knowledge, prevent defects and ensure our code is awesome.

  • Even though you are versatile, you are probably more familiar with one part of the stack than the others. That's great - your expert knowledge will enrich the team, and you can help each other improve in all areas.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer - React, Node
jobs.content:
WayBetter Senior Front End Developer


WayBetter has an exciting opportunity for a passionate, creative Senior Front End Developer to help us tear down our existing monolithic stack and completely rebuild it from the ground up with a modern, mobile-first, service-oriented architecture. This is your chance to build mobile and web apps with modern technology in a greenfield environment.


The WayBetter Way


At WayBetter, our mission is to make getting healthier fun.


Our life-changing games inspire people everywhere to live healthier every day. Our players support and motivate each other while financial incentives hold everyone accountable. Our formula has already helped more than 400,000 people reach their health goals and earn more than $25 Million – it’s based on science and it really works. We’ve created a proven motivational system and we’re excited to change the way people lose weight, stay active, exercise, sleep, quit smoking, and adopt healthier habits. We want your help!


What we're looking for


As our Senior Front End Developer, you’ll be working with a small, growing team of experienced engineers.  You will be responsible for developing the web client and web tier of our products, including the WebView components for mobile apps.  You will also have ample opportunity to aid in the design of our back-end services.  You’ll play a key role in identifying and investigating new technologies, prototyping and testing, and rapid iteration releases.  


Required Qualifications



  • Expertise with JavaScript, React and Node.js in production environments

  • Strong knowledge of HTML5 and web fundamentals (CSS, HTTP,  cookies, security, performance, etc.)

  • Strong relational database knowledge (MySQL, Postgres)

  • Experience with automated testing (writing unit tests)

  • Familiarity with AWS


Preferred Qualifications



  • Experience developing iOS and/or Android apps a major plus

  • Experience with React Native a major plus

  • Experience with micro-service architecture

  • Familiarity with NoSQL

  • Design/UX skills

  • Knowledge of code deployment best practices

  • Experience with Docker

  • Experience with websockets


Compensation and Benefits



  • Generous health care coverage.

  • 401(K)

  • Untracked, flexible vacation policy

  • Paid parental leave

  • Training opportunities

  • Meaningful equity participation

  • A healthy, collaborative, and fun work environment

  • A life outside work


WayBetter? Yes!


We care a lot about our company's culture and apply to our workplace the same principles that successfully power our games: fun, social support, and accountability. We also live by our belief that a healthy work-life balance is vital when it comes to sustainable, long-term success.


We know that when you join a startup you’re investing in that company. Unlike investors who risk other people’s money, you’re investing something more precious: your time. You can feel good about investing in WayBetter. We’ve been around for over five years and have raised over $5 million from successful entrepreneurs with deep pockets (including several billionaires). We were cashflow positive for the first five months of 2016 ... becoming self-funding means we control our own destiny. The bottom line is that we’re building the kind of company we want to work for, one with enduring value, inspiring co-workers, and happy customers.


Want to apply? Please send your portfolio (website, GitHub, app links), resume, and a note that tells us something about you that we can't pick up from your portfolio/resume.

jobs.title: SENIOR WEBDEVELOPER .NET
jobs.content:
About Emakina.NL
With offices in Amsterdam, Brussels, Geneva and Paris, Emakina Group is one of the leading full service digital agencies in Europe. We have an awesome portfolio that we are very proud of, with several (inter)national clients, including Unilever Global, Greenpeace, Coolcat, Rituals, HEMA, WE Fashion and Floris van Bommel. We build complex e-commerce platforms, innovative applications and exciting activation campaigns. In addition, we are a Certified Implementation Partner of Demandware. Although part of a large international group Emakina.NL is an informal and non-hierarchical organization with a friendly, openminded atmosphere and around 100 employees in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

What do we offer you:
We offer an interesting job at a highly innovative company, where everything is developed in-house. The working environment is informal yet professional. There is plenty of room for initiatives and personal development. Besides a good salary we offer you the opportunity to be part of an enthusiastic team in an international environment. Since there is more in life than hard work, we regularly organize activities such as barbecues, beach parties, pop quizzes, soccer tournaments and the annual ski trip.

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
The Oberlo team is looking for a QA engineer who displays high attention to detail, personal initiative and commitment to quality to join our growing company. We need someone who can quickly adapt to shifting approaches, situations and priorities. You will be free to work with the tools of your choice, in a quality-driven development environment (there will be no fights about what’s a bug and what’s a feature).


You will take full responsibility for bringing our top-quality product to thousands of our daily users by:



  • Being a designated tester for one of our development teams

  • Implementing and maintaining automated test scripts covering fundamental functions in the application

  • Discussing risk and risk mitigation in planning meetings

  • Assisting in shaping the overall QA process in the SLDC

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Qnnect Solutions AG is an early to mid stage company. At Qnnect we are on a mission to redefine the notion of a job. We have fun. We celebrate success. We wish to co-create, with you, an amazing place to work.


To achieve this goal, we are developing an employee engagement framework with heavy emphasis on connecting employees in a fun, refreshing and novel, but still secure and privacy sensitive way using their desktop computers and handheld devices.


We are looking for senior software engineers to work on our employee engagement solution. We are an equal opportunity employer and we will consider all applicants that we can employ lawfully.


The technologies that we use on the backend side:



  • Java 8, Spring, HTTP JSON API (and WebSockets)

  • PostgreSQL database server

  • JOOQ for data access


On the mobile side:



  • Android/iOS native development


On the web client side:



  • Javascript, HTML, CSS

  • AngularJS framework

  • various libraries with permissive licenses


To tie it all together:



  • Debian/Ubuntu GNU/Linux installations

  • Tomcat 8

  • Docker

  • Ansible

  • Syncthing

  • IPv6

  • bup

jobs.title: Full stack Engineer

You should be an all rounder, happy to tweak CSS in the front end, get dirty with dev ops, and hack on the backend if necessary. Preferably you are familiar with AWS or you are a very fast learner.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
WiX is looking for an experienced, passionate JavaScript Front-End Engineer to join our newly-established Editor team in Berlin.


You will work on the next generation of our website Editor, Wix's main product. Using cutting-edge technologies and methodologies you’ll improve the core of the software with an eye towards the front­end and graphics style. You’ll be a key member of this team, shaping its character and providing guidance to engineers later to come. This is a unique opportunity to work in a startup-like environment with the benefits of a stable, public company. 


What We Offer:



  • An interesting role with a lot of responsibility in a dynamic, innovative environment

  • An opportunity for professional, technical and personal development

  • A fun, young team with a passion for software development

  • A well established international company with a startup atmosphere based in Berlin

jobs.title: Software Engineer

At foodpanda we are working with PHP5/7, MySQL and Symfony 3.0 on AWS with Docker.

Sounds interesting to you? Well let´s talk then!

  • Help clean up and refactor our legacy code base and move it to a modern architecture centered around components, containers and microservices

  • Collaborate within cross-functional and international agile teams

  • Stay up-to-date with current industry trends and promote them within the company

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer for online Video-Editor and Streaming Platform
jobs.content:
As a Front-end Developer with a focus on JavaScript you will be responsible for our front-end user-experience. The primary focus will be the creation of user-interfaces for all screens, that is really making life easy for the users.


We are really proud about our own video editor based on WebGL. Our goal is to bring it to the next level, adding both functionality and tweaking performance and optimising the user experience.


There are always some templates and mockups you will have to create to bring the functionalities of our platform to the users screen. This is why we expect a high level of excitement for usability and robust development. Fast prototyping for user-testing and final integration with all the necessary validations and robustness should be right up your alley.


You will be working closely with our backend Developers using their REST APIs to access the platform's core functionalities and data-sets necessary for each area. We believe in a dynamic team where everybody gets to share their ideas, and hope to learn from your specific experience and skills.

jobs.title: Senior Mobile developer / engineer
jobs.content:
We are currently on the lookout for a masterful iOS developer, with MORE than a cursory understanding of building well-factored, testable and production worthy apps.


Do you live and breathe iOS mobile development? Do you love engineering fast and beautiful user experiences? Come and work with us if you want to be part of creating a best-of-breed product for the iOS ecosystem.


Pushpay is a hyper-growth New Zealand SaaS business. Our core competency is mobile payments with our current focus on the faith market. The Pushpay engineering team is spread between Auckland, New Zealand and Redmond, Washington. Developers, Quality Assistance and Analysts work closely together where we continuously deliver value with App deployments several times a month.

jobs.title: Ecommerce PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Love ecommerce? We do! We’re looking to build a web team to lead our online division.



What we’re looking for


We’re looking for someone who is as enthusiastic about ecommerce as we are. We’re looking for a backend PHP developer that understands the complete software lifecycle and knows how to produce rock-solid code.



Day to day you’ll be required to implement new features and support and expand upon existing functionality. The software stack is hand-rolled, that means we have a custom framework and a custom ecommerce platform. You’ll need to be comfortable proposing and making changes to the low-level framework, as well as making frontend changes to the customer facing site. You’ll also need to be confident about pushing code into production within a fast-paced environment

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Tell me about Ovo…


Love programming? Want to build great software, using leading edge technologies, with smart, passionate people?


The energy industry is changing, and technology is at the forefront of innovations that will transform it forever.


At OVO, technology and digital products are at the heart of our customer experience and they are key to our commercial success.


We were the first energy company to offer our Pay As You Go customers the opportunity to top up using their phone, the first company to offer real time electricity and gas usage data, and the first to release an apple watch App. We’ve been featured in Wired magazine for our ability to develop software to shatter the status quo.


But we’re just getting started.


We need to develop, test, and release software that scales, quickly and reliably. Over the last few years, we’ve built a highly skilled team of software engineers that is making a real impact to our business, and shaking up our industry.


We care about code quality, test automation and continuous delivery. Our developers drive our technology choices and own the software they create


from their laptop all the way through to production. We’re building a better energy company, and we’re doing it one Git commit at a time.


Right, I’m convinced… but where in the world of Ovo will I be working?


You will be working as part of our technology team, based in our Notting Hill office.


That sounds great! What will I be doing?



  • Take ownership of, architect, build and scale parts of our microservice platform.

  • Drive both product and technical improvements

  • Communicate your ideas, engage with different teams and encourage debate and collaboration.


hat sounds super exciting, but… Do I have what it takes?



  • Experience building scalable, distributed web applications in Java preferably

  • Interest in functional programming (examples of personal projects would be great)

  • Experience with REST and asynchronous event driven programming.

  • Experience with CI, and ideally CD

  • Experience driving automation across build, test and release processes.

jobs.title: Développeur Full-stack
jobs.content:
En étroite collaboration avec un des co-fondateurs et directeur technique de la société, vous intégrerez notre équipe technique, actuellement constituée de 5 développeurs séniors.


Côté back, nous utilisons l’écosystème Java et Groovy (Spring, Grails, Gradle, Spock...), le tout étant hébergé chez AWS.


Coté front, nous sommes en cours de migration vers Angular2 et Ionic2 (TypeScript, RxJS/Ngrx, Material, etc).

jobs.title: Trade Floor Support Engineer | Equity Derivatives | Hong Kong Based
jobs.content:
The successful candidate will become a member of an exciting team responsible for the operation of our trading systems, covering Asian markets.  If you have an analytical mind, believe in a proactive approach to system operations and enjoy troubleshooting mission critical systems in a fast paced trading floor environment, then this role is for you!


Responsibilities and Duties



  • Administration and maintenance of critical trading applications within a distributed multi-server environment

  • Provide trading floor support directly to traders

  • Develop scripts and other tools to support our trading systems operations as required

  • Work closely with the Desktop, Network and Development teams and assisting when necessary

  • Follow IT policies and procedures as set forth by the management

  • Be involved in some after-hours support as needed



  • Give and receive constructive feedback

  • Play an active role in your team’s growth and results

jobs.title: Senior Algorithm C++ Developer | Auto Trading | Trading Algorithm
jobs.content:
The Autotrading team is responsible for the firm's algorithmic trading. Our expertise in market structure combined with careful design and clever implementation is critical to the success of our trading. We are one of the top market makers in Asia.


Responsibilities and Duties



  • Design and development of our market making and trading algorithms, including quoting, hedging, arbitrage and delta one trading

  • Provide leadership in market structure and algorithm design across IT

  • Provide technical guidance throughout IT in design and code reviews

  • Work closely with traders and quants to define the behaviour of our automated trading

  • Provide Tier 3 support as needed

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer | Trading Systems Development
jobs.content:
Eclipse Trading is embarking on a significant transformation of our in-house Equity Derivatives Trading Systems to support its continuing expansion into new markets and trading strategies. The successful candidate will become a core member of the development team responsible for this transformation.


Role:



  • Transform the design and architecture of our suite of Java trading applications for our growing Delta 1 and Options Market Making desks

  • Contribute to the rearchitecture of our Reference Data, Parameter Management and Order Management systems to support our growing volumes and expansion into new product lines

  • Design and implement new solutions to manage inventory, tracking error and short selling

  • Work directly with traders to capture requirements and propose solutions

jobs.title: Senior Low Latency C++ Developer | Exchange Connectivity | Trading Systems
jobs.content:
The Gateway team is responsible for the firm's exchange market data and order execution. Our ability to process information completely and correctly with extremely low latency is critical to the success of our trading. We have one of the fastest software stacks in Asia.


The successful candidate will be a Senior member of the team responsible for developing market links for our in-house developed trading systems.


Responsibilities and Duties



  • Design and development of our exchange connectivity software on Linux using C++

  • Provide leadership in low-latency design and implementation across IT

  • Provide technical guidance throughout IT in design and code reviews

  • Engage with traders and quants on a regular basis to gather system requirements

  • Provide Tier 3 support as needed

jobs.title: Visual Designer
jobs.content: Shippo is hiring a Visual Designer in San Francisco, CA

jobs.title: SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about delivering high-quality software in a fast-paced, agile environment? Are you a believer in continuous integration, frequent releases to production and a rapid pace of development? Are you an advocate for the best practices and core principals of object-oriented design? Do you feel strongly about the art and craft of software development? If you are any or all of these, this might just be the team for you!


At Microsoft, our mission is to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more. This mission connects in fundamental ways with how we as a company operate, how we design and develop technology and how we work with others to serve people with disabilities. To make our products and services accessible, we need to know when we have issues and how to fix them. In other words, our tools need to help us more easily and quickly find and fix accessibility issues.


In Visual Studio Team System, we are on a fast-track to develop better ways to find bugs, better ways to write accessibility bugs and in general, create a workflow that builds accessibility into the process. And, this includes, making the process work for engineers and other Microsoft employees who have disabilities, because everyone wants tools that will help them do their best work.


We thrive in a fast paced agile environment, shipping high quality code to production every sprint. Our code base is C#, TypeScript, and SQL. We provide REST APIs via ASP.NET MVC, and we use jQuery, Knockout.js, and other modern frameworks to build our user interface. Our services run entirely in Azure and uses many of Azure’s services, particularly Service Bus, Storage, Document DB, AAD, and Azure Redis.

jobs.title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER II
jobs.content:
The VS Team Services group plays a fundamental role in our strategy to modernize engineering at Microsoft and beyond. We believe that collaboration sits at the core of this transformation, through a set of experiences that enable seamless source and binary sharing across large software teams.


As a member of the Packaging team you’ll help build these experiences – think GitHub meets NuGet.org / npmjs / bower.io / Maven Central for your organization! You’ll work in a fast-paced environment where we ship frequently using a variety of technologies and open-source libraries (C#, Azure, SQL, ASP MVC, jQuery, TypeScript, NuGet, …). You’ll also be part of the effort to transform our engineering system here at Microsoft, spearheading a shift in how agile development works at enterprise scale.


We’re looking for a talented and driven software engineer who seeks technical challenges as part of a strong team. If you enjoy building software with a broad range of technologies and being part of a smart, agile team that’s making software development better, come join us!


VS Team Services provides software development teams with version control, build automation, project and bug management, social engineering experiences and more. We have a growing user base with 3M users and counting.

jobs.title: Laravel PHP Engineer Do Good. Do Well. Have Fun Doing It
jobs.content:
LiteracyPro creates software to make the world a better place. We are leaders in the custom web application space for government agencies. Our data collection and reporting software helps agencies help millions of disadvantaged people improve their opportunities to get jobs with sustainable, living wages for themselves and their families. Enjoy being part of a fun group of bright, passionate folks, in a great working environment, with superb salary & benefits while helping those who help others.



We’re looking for an extraordinary PAAS, full-stack, Laravel/PHP engineer to help us grow our new, cloud-based application. This enterprise application – known as “CommunityPro Suite” – was released last Spring and is getting rave reviews. Our Company is poised for explosive growth in the coming months due to national demand, and we’re looking for a talented engineer with the smarts, passion and people skills to code and be part of moving the engineering team forward. You’d be an important player in the engineering effort as we continue expanding the product according to our roadmap.



CommunityPro Suite is a growing Laravel web application that enables huge state and local agencies to securely match, consolidate and share data between themselves in real time. The purpose of the software is to reduce organizational friction by helping local agencies help people achieve economic self-sufficiency. The end goal is to play an important role in creating healthy, vibrant communities.



Please no staffing agencies or contractors.

jobs.title: Front end Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a passionate and experienced front-end web developer. Having worked in an agile environment and capable of delivering enterprise applications you will be a self-starter, highly motivated and capable of showing initiative.


We are a distributed company and big believer in flexible working arrangements, however we are currently only looking for candidates already established in the United Kingdom.


Please make sure you answer this question in your cover letter:
- What are you learning right now and how?


You can expect to:


- Work on several multi-tenant enterprise web applications
- Deliver features to production every day
- Participate in problem solving and work with the team to make them a reality
- Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchical, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title
- Learn something new every day
- Develop your career by focusing on what you’re passionate about
- Evangelise agile, continuous delivery, test driven development and other coding best practices
- Share your passion for technology through coaching and mentoring
- Be an ambassador for technical excellence and company culture
- Enjoy working from home or the beach as well as pairing in the office

jobs.title: We are looking for an experienced Backend Developer // Mobile Intelligence Cloud
jobs.content:
We think Mobile Marketing differently and are reinventing the market for Location-based Marketing.


Bitplaces is a young company that reinvents the market for mobile marketing. We are a small, ambitious and creative team. We work with new technologies, develop in the cloud and with high demands on scalability. Our new Mobile Intelligence platform demonstrates how the future of mobile services will look like.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack .NET Web Developer
jobs.content:
Summary


Outreach, Inc has a mission to equip the Church to reach people with the Gospel of Jesus Christ. Over our 20 year history, we’ve equipped tens of thousands of churches to reach millions of people. Large and small organizations alike have partnered with us to change the world for the Church. But as the medium for reaching people changes, and the world becomes more digital, we need more people with technical skills and experience to join us in our mission.


Becoming a member of the Outreach software development team means that you’ll help shape the future of how we equip the Church. We’re a small team of software developers and designers, responsible for a wide variety of applications and services. Every day we’re presented with new ideas and new opportunities which our team approaches using an agile mindset. So if you’re a senior full stack web developer that can help us grow our team and appreciates working on a wide range of projects, we’d love to hear from you.


What we expect


As a senior full stack web developer, you’ve got at least 5 years of experience working on the web. Specifically, we’re looking for candidates that:



  • Have a solid understanding of how the web works, and are familiar with every layer of the web, from networking, to application, to database

  • Keep up to date, and love playing with the latest technologies and frameworks

  • Understand and have practiced data modeling, from concept to implementation

  • Have mastered object-oriented programming and can apply it to how they design data structures and systems

  • Have employed modern design and architecture patterns, like dependency injection, pub/sub, MVC, and microservices

  • Are not tied to any particular framework or system (though they might have preferences) and are always on the lookout for new ways of doing things


 As this is a senior position, we’re also expecting candidates that:



  • Have experience mentoring more junior developers

  • Consider themselves to be great communicators, to both developers and stakeholders

  • Have a proven track record of success working in an agile environment


How we build software


Our product design and software development processes are grounded in Agile principles and informed by LEAN Startup and SCRUM methodologies:



  • We put our customers at the center of every decision - life is way too short to build something nobody wants

  • We design and build to learn, then we build to scale - experimentation and learning are central to our approach

  • We measure our results and test our assumptions - data informs our decision making, not the loudest person in the room

  • We're constantly learning and growing as individuals and as a team - a growth mindset and strong drive for continuous improvement is a must


Our tech stack and tooling is pretty awesome, but we’re always looking for ways to improve:



  • We use SQL Server as our data store, accessed through Entity Framework.

  • On the back end, we’re using .NET Core.

  • On the front end, we’re using React.js.


We've been leveraging virtualized environments since the early 2000's, but in 2017 we'll be moving to the cloud by:



  • Embracing DevOps as a discipline

  • Defining our infrastructure as code

  • Migrating from monoliths to microservices

  • Running our apps in containers

  • Automating our entire process



To Apply


In addition to your resume, please submit a cover letter explaining why you are interested in the company, the position, and software development in general. In your cover letter, tell us which you use - tabs or spaces - and tell us why you are right. Most importantly, include an online portfolio (e.g. GitHub) that shows some of the projects that you’ve worked on. Without a portfolio, your application may not be considered.
